7865 
7866   # Publish this variable in the help.
7867 
7868 
7869   if test "x$MKDIR" = x; then
7870     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
7871     for ac_prog in mkdir
7872 do
7873   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
7874 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
7875 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
7876 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
7877 if ${ac_cv_path_MKDIR+:} false; then :
7878   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
7879 else
7880   case $MKDIR in
7881   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
7882   ac_cv_path_MKDIR="$MKDIR" # Let the user override the test with a path.
7883   ;;
7884   *)
7885   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
7886 for as_dir in $PATH
7887 do
7888   IFS=$as_save_IFS
7889   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
7890     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
7891   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
7892     ac_cv_path_MKDIR="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
7893     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
7894     break 2
7895   fi
7896 done
7897   done
7898 IFS=$as_save_IFS
7899 
7900   ;;
7901 esac
7902 fi
7903 MKDIR=$ac_cv_path_MKDIR
7904 if test -n "$MKDIR"; then
7905   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $MKDIR" >&5
7906 $as_echo "$MKDIR" >&6; }
7907 else
7908   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
7909 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
7910 fi
7911 
7912 
7913   test -n "$MKDIR" && break
7914 done
7915 
7916   else
7917     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
7918 
7919     # Try to remove the string !MKDIR! from our list.
7920     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!MKDIR!/}
7921     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
7922       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
7923       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
7924       if test "xMKDIR" != xBASH; then
7925         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of MKDIR from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
7926 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of MKDIR from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
7927       fi
7928       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
7929       for ac_prog in mkdir
7930 do
7931   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
7932 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
7933 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
7934 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
7935 if ${ac_cv_path_MKDIR+:} false; then :
7936   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
7937 else
7938   case $MKDIR in
7939   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
7940   ac_cv_path_MKDIR="$MKDIR" # Let the user override the test with a path.
7941   ;;
7942   *)
7943   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
7944 for as_dir in $PATH
7945 do
7946   IFS=$as_save_IFS
7947   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
7948     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
7949   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
7950     ac_cv_path_MKDIR="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
7951     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
7952     break 2
7953   fi
7954 done
7955   done
7956 IFS=$as_save_IFS
7957 
7958   ;;
7959 esac
7960 fi
7961 MKDIR=$ac_cv_path_MKDIR
7962 if test -n "$MKDIR"; then
7963   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $MKDIR" >&5
7964 $as_echo "$MKDIR" >&6; }
7965 else
7966   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
7967 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
7968 fi
7969 
7970 
7971   test -n "$MKDIR" && break
7972 done
7973 
7974     else
7975       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
7976       # for the tool.
7977 
7978       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
7979       # for unknown variables in the end.
7980       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
7981 
7982       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
7983       tool_specified="$MKDIR"
7984       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
7985       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
7986         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
7987         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool MKDIR=$tool_basename" >&5
7988 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool MKDIR=$tool_basename" >&6;}
7989         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
7990 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
7991 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
7992 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
7993 if ${ac_cv_path_MKDIR+:} false; then :
7994   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
7995 else
7996   case $MKDIR in
7997   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
7998   ac_cv_path_MKDIR="$MKDIR" # Let the user override the test with a path.
7999   ;;
8000   *)
8001   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
8002 for as_dir in $PATH
8003 do
8004   IFS=$as_save_IFS
8005   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
8006     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
8007   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
8008     ac_cv_path_MKDIR="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
8009     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
8010     break 2
8011   fi
8012 done
8013   done
8014 IFS=$as_save_IFS
8015 
8016   ;;
8017 esac
8018 fi
8019 MKDIR=$ac_cv_path_MKDIR
8020 if test -n "$MKDIR"; then
8021   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $MKDIR" >&5
8022 $as_echo "$MKDIR" >&6; }
8023 else
8024   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
8025 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
8026 fi
8027 
8028 
8029         if test "x$MKDIR" = x; then
8030           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
8031         fi
8032       else
8033         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
8034         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool MKDIR=$tool_specified" >&5
8035 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool MKDIR=$tool_specified" >&6;}
8036         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for MKDIR" >&5
8037 $as_echo_n "checking for MKDIR... " >&6; }
8038         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
8039           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
8040 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
8041           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool MKDIR=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
8042         fi
8043         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
8044 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
8045       fi
8046     fi
8047   fi
8048 
8049 
8050 
8051   if test "x$MKDIR" = x; then
8052     as_fn_error $? "Could not find required tool for MKDIR" "$LINENO" 5
8053   fi
8054 
8055 
8056 
8057 
8058 
8059   # Publish this variable in the help.
8060 
8061 
8062   if test "x$MKTEMP" = x; then
8063     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
8064     for ac_prog in mktemp
8065 do
8066   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
8067 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
8068 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
8069 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
8070 if ${ac_cv_path_MKTEMP+:} false; then :
8071   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
8072 else
8073   case $MKTEMP in
8074   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
8075   ac_cv_path_MKTEMP="$MKTEMP" # Let the user override the test with a path.
8076   ;;
8077   *)
8078   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
8079 for as_dir in $PATH
8080 do
8081   IFS=$as_save_IFS
8082   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
8083     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
8084   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
8085     ac_cv_path_MKTEMP="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
8086     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
8087     break 2
8088   fi
8089 done
8090   done
8091 IFS=$as_save_IFS
8092 
8093   ;;
8094 esac
8095 fi
8096 MKTEMP=$ac_cv_path_MKTEMP
8097 if test -n "$MKTEMP"; then
8098   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $MKTEMP" >&5
8099 $as_echo "$MKTEMP" >&6; }
8100 else
8101   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
8102 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
8103 fi
8104 
8105 
8106   test -n "$MKTEMP" && break
8107 done
8108 
8109   else
8110     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
8111 
8112     # Try to remove the string !MKTEMP! from our list.
8113     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!MKTEMP!/}
8114     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
8115       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
8116       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
8117       if test "xMKTEMP" != xBASH; then
8118         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of MKTEMP from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
8119 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of MKTEMP from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
8120       fi
8121       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
8122       for ac_prog in mktemp
8123 do
8124   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
8125 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
8126 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
8127 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
8128 if ${ac_cv_path_MKTEMP+:} false; then :
8129   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
8130 else
8131   case $MKTEMP in
8132   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
8133   ac_cv_path_MKTEMP="$MKTEMP" # Let the user override the test with a path.
8134   ;;
8135   *)
8136   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
8137 for as_dir in $PATH
8138 do
8139   IFS=$as_save_IFS
8140   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.

8144     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
8145     break 2
8146   fi
8147 done
8148   done
8149 IFS=$as_save_IFS
8150 
8151   ;;
8152 esac
8153 fi
8154 MKTEMP=$ac_cv_path_MKTEMP
8155 if test -n "$MKTEMP"; then
8156   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $MKTEMP" >&5
8157 $as_echo "$MKTEMP" >&6; }
8158 else
8159   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
8160 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
8161 fi
8162 
8163 
8164   test -n "$MKTEMP" && break
8165 done
8166 
8167     else
8168       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
8169       # for the tool.
8170

8172       # for unknown variables in the end.
8173       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"

8182         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
8183 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2

8253

8255   if test "x$MV" = x; then
8256     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
8257     for ac_prog in mv
8258 do
8259   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
8260 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
8261 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
8262 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
8263 if ${ac_cv_path_MV+:} false; then :
8264   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
8265 else
8266   case $MV in
8267   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
8268   ac_cv_path_MV="$MV" # Let the user override the test with a path.
8269   ;;
8270   *)

8279     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
8280     break 2
8281   fi
8282 done
8283   done
8284 IFS=$as_save_IFS
8285 
8286   ;;
8287 esac
8288 fi
8289 MV=$ac_cv_path_MV
8290 if test -n "$MV"; then
8291   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $MV" >&5
8292 $as_echo "$MV" >&6; }
8293 else
8294   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
8295 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
8296 fi
8297 
8298 
8299   test -n "$MV" && break
8300 done
8301 
8302   else
8303     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
8304 
8305     # Try to remove the string !MV! from our list.
8306     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!MV!/}
8307     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
8308       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
8309       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
8310       if test "xMV" != xBASH; then
8311         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of MV from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
8312 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of MV from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
8313       fi

8318 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2

8341   done

8343 
8344   ;;
8345 esac

8351 else

8353 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
8354 fi

8384   ac_cv_path_MV="$MV" # Let the user override the test with a path.
8385   ;;

8395     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
8396     break 2
8397   fi
8398 done
8399   done
8400 IFS=$as_save_IFS
8401 
8402   ;;
8403 esac
8404 fi

8406 if test -n "$MV"; then
8407   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $MV" >&5
8408 $as_echo "$MV" >&6; }
8409 else
8410   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
8411 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
8412 fi
8413 
8414 
8415         if test "x$MV" = x; then
8416           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
8417         fi
8418       else
8419         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
8420         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool MV=$tool_specified" >&5
8421 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool MV=$tool_specified" >&6;}
8422         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for MV" >&5
8423 $as_echo_n "checking for MV... " >&6; }
8424         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
8425           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
8426 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
8427           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool MV=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
8428         fi
8429         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
8430 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
8431       fi
8432     fi
8433   fi
8434 
8435 
8436 
8437   if test "x$MV" = x; then
8438     as_fn_error $? "Could not find required tool for MV" "$LINENO" 5
8439   fi

8445   # Publish this variable in the help.
8446 
8447 
8448   if test "x$NAWK" = x; then
8449     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
8450     for ac_prog in nawk gawk awk
8451 do
8452   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
8453 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
8454 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
8455 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
8456 if ${ac_cv_path_NAWK+:} false; then :
8457   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
8458 else
8459   case $NAWK in
8460   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
8461   ac_cv_path_NAWK="$NAWK" # Let the user override the test with a path.
8462   ;;
8463   *)
8464   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
8465 for as_dir in $PATH
8466 do
8467   IFS=$as_save_IFS
8468   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
8469     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
8470   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
8471     ac_cv_path_NAWK="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
8472     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
8473     break 2
8474   fi
8475 done
8476   done
8477 IFS=$as_save_IFS
8478 
8479   ;;
8480 esac
8481 fi
8482 NAWK=$ac_cv_path_NAWK
8483 if test -n "$NAWK"; then
8484   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $NAWK" >&5
8485 $as_echo "$NAWK" >&6; }
8486 else
8487   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
8488 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
8489 fi
8490 
8491 
8492   test -n "$NAWK" && break
8493 done
8494 
8495   else
8496     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
8497 
8498     # Try to remove the string !NAWK! from our list.
8499     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!NAWK!/}
8500     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
8501       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
8502       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
8503       if test "xNAWK" != xBASH; then
8504         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of NAWK from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
8505 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of NAWK from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
8506       fi
8507       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
8508       for ac_prog in nawk gawk awk
8509 do
8510   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
8511 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
8512 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
8513 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
8514 if ${ac_cv_path_NAWK+:} false; then :
8515   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
8516 else
8517   case $NAWK in
8518   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
8519   ac_cv_path_NAWK="$NAWK" # Let the user override the test with a path.
8520   ;;
8521   *)
8522   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
8523 for as_dir in $PATH
8524 do
8525   IFS=$as_save_IFS
8526   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
8527     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
8528   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
8529     ac_cv_path_NAWK="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
8530     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
8531     break 2
8532   fi
8533 done
8534   done
8535 IFS=$as_save_IFS
8536 
8537   ;;
8538 esac
8539 fi
8540 NAWK=$ac_cv_path_NAWK
8541 if test -n "$NAWK"; then
8542   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $NAWK" >&5
8543 $as_echo "$NAWK" >&6; }
8544 else
8545   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
8546 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
8547 fi
8548 
8549 
8550   test -n "$NAWK" && break
8551 done
8552 
8553     else
8554       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
8555       # for the tool.
8556 
8557       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
8558       # for unknown variables in the end.
8559       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
8560 
8561       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
8562       tool_specified="$NAWK"
8563       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
8564       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
8565         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
8566         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool NAWK=$tool_basename" >&5
8567 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool NAWK=$tool_basename" >&6;}
8568         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
8569 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
8570 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
8571 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
8572 if ${ac_cv_path_NAWK+:} false; then :
8573   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
8574 else
8575   case $NAWK in
8576   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
8577   ac_cv_path_NAWK="$NAWK" # Let the user override the test with a path.
8578   ;;
8579   *)
8580   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
8581 for as_dir in $PATH
8582 do
8583   IFS=$as_save_IFS
8584   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
8585     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
8586   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
8587     ac_cv_path_NAWK="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
8588     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
8589     break 2
8590   fi
8591 done
8592   done
8593 IFS=$as_save_IFS
8594 
8595   ;;
8596 esac
8597 fi
8598 NAWK=$ac_cv_path_NAWK
8599 if test -n "$NAWK"; then
8600   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $NAWK" >&5
8601 $as_echo "$NAWK" >&6; }
8602 else
8603   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
8604 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
8605 fi
8606 
8607 
8608         if test "x$NAWK" = x; then
8609           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
8610         fi
8611       else
8612         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
8613         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool NAWK=$tool_specified" >&5
8614 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool NAWK=$tool_specified" >&6;}
8615         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for NAWK" >&5
8616 $as_echo_n "checking for NAWK... " >&6; }
8617         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
8618           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
8619 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
8620           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool NAWK=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
8621         fi
8622         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
8623 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
8624       fi
8625     fi
8626   fi
8627 
8628 
8629 
8630   if test "x$NAWK" = x; then
8631     as_fn_error $? "Could not find required tool for NAWK" "$LINENO" 5
8632   fi
8633 
8634 
8635 
8636 
8637 
8638   # Publish this variable in the help.
8639 
8640 
8641   if test "x$PRINTF" = x; then
8642     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
8643     for ac_prog in printf
8644 do
8645   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
8646 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
8647 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
8648 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
8649 if ${ac_cv_path_PRINTF+:} false; then :
8650   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
8651 else
8652   case $PRINTF in
8653   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
8654   ac_cv_path_PRINTF="$PRINTF" # Let the user override the test with a path.
8655   ;;
8656   *)
8657   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
8658 for as_dir in $PATH
8659 do
8660   IFS=$as_save_IFS
8661   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
8662     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
8663   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
8664     ac_cv_path_PRINTF="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
8665     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
8666     break 2
8667   fi
8668 done
8669   done
8670 IFS=$as_save_IFS
8671 
8672   ;;
8673 esac
8674 fi
8675 PRINTF=$ac_cv_path_PRINTF
8676 if test -n "$PRINTF"; then
8677   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $PRINTF" >&5
8678 $as_echo "$PRINTF" >&6; }
8679 else
8680   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
8681 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
8682 fi
8683 
8684 
8685   test -n "$PRINTF" && break
8686 done
8687 
8688   else
8689     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
8690 
8691     # Try to remove the string !PRINTF! from our list.
8692     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!PRINTF!/}
8693     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
8694       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
8695       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
8696       if test "xPRINTF" != xBASH; then
8697         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of PRINTF from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
8698 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of PRINTF from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
8699       fi
8700       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
8701       for ac_prog in printf
8702 do
8703   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
8704 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
8705 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
8706 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
8707 if ${ac_cv_path_PRINTF+:} false; then :
8708   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
8709 else
8710   case $PRINTF in
8711   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
8712   ac_cv_path_PRINTF="$PRINTF" # Let the user override the test with a path.
8713   ;;
8714   *)
8715   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
8716 for as_dir in $PATH

8723     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
8724     break 2
8725   fi
8726 done
8727   done
8728 IFS=$as_save_IFS
8729 
8730   ;;
8731 esac
8732 fi
8733 PRINTF=$ac_cv_path_PRINTF
8734 if test -n "$PRINTF"; then
8735   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $PRINTF" >&5
8736 $as_echo "$PRINTF" >&6; }
8737 else
8738   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
8739 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
8740 fi
8741 
8742 
8743   test -n "$PRINTF" && break
8744 done
8745 
8746     else
8747       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
8748       # for the tool.
8749

8751       # for unknown variables in the end.
8752       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
8753

8755       tool_specified="$PRINTF"
8756       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
8757       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
8758         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
8759         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool PRINTF=$tool_basename" >&5
8760 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool PRINTF=$tool_basename" >&6;}
8761         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
8762 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
8763 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
8764 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
8765 if ${ac_cv_path_PRINTF+:} false; then :

8767 else

8781     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
8782     break 2
8783   fi
8784 done
8785   done
8786 IFS=$as_save_IFS
8787 
8788   ;;
8789 esac
8790 fi
8791 PRINTF=$ac_cv_path_PRINTF
8792 if test -n "$PRINTF"; then
8793   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $PRINTF" >&5
8794 $as_echo "$PRINTF" >&6; }
8795 else
8796   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
8797 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
8798 fi
8799

8801         if test "x$PRINTF" = x; then
8802           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
8803         fi
8804       else
8805         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
8806         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool PRINTF=$tool_specified" >&5
8807 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool PRINTF=$tool_specified" >&6;}
8808         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for PRINTF" >&5
8809 $as_echo_n "checking for PRINTF... " >&6; }
8810         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
8811           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
8812 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
8813           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool PRINTF=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
8814         fi
8815         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
8816 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
8817       fi
8818     fi
8819   fi
8820

8822 
8823   if test "x$PRINTF" = x; then
8824     as_fn_error $? "Could not find required tool for PRINTF" "$LINENO" 5
8825   fi
8826

8829 
8830 
8831   # Publish this variable in the help.
8832 
8833 
8834   if test "x$RM" = x; then
8835     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
8836     for ac_prog in rm
8837 do
8838   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
8839 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
8840 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
8841 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
8842 if ${ac_cv_path_RM+:} false; then :
8843   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
8844 else
8845   case $RM in
8846   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
8847   ac_cv_path_RM="$RM" # Let the user override the test with a path.
8848   ;;
8849   *)
8850   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
8851 for as_dir in $PATH
8852 do
8853   IFS=$as_save_IFS
8854   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
8855     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
8856   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
8857     ac_cv_path_RM="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
8858     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
8859     break 2
8860   fi
8861 done
8862   done
8863 IFS=$as_save_IFS
8864 
8865   ;;
8866 esac
8867 fi
8868 RM=$ac_cv_path_RM
8869 if test -n "$RM"; then
8870   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $RM" >&5
8871 $as_echo "$RM" >&6; }
8872 else
8873   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
8874 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
8875 fi
8876 
8877 
8878   test -n "$RM" && break
8879 done
8880 
8881   else
8882     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
8883 
8884     # Try to remove the string !RM! from our list.
8885     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!RM!/}
8886     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
8887       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
8888       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
8889       if test "xRM" != xBASH; then
8890         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of RM from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
8891 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of RM from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
8892       fi
8893       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
8894       for ac_prog in rm
8895 do
8896   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
8897 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
8898 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
8899 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
8900 if ${ac_cv_path_RM+:} false; then :
8901   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
8902 else
8903   case $RM in
8904   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
8905   ac_cv_path_RM="$RM" # Let the user override the test with a path.
8906   ;;
8907   *)
8908   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
8909 for as_dir in $PATH
8910 do
8911   IFS=$as_save_IFS
8912   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
8913     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
8914   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
8915     ac_cv_path_RM="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
8916     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
8917     break 2
8918   fi
8919 done
8920   done
8921 IFS=$as_save_IFS
8922 
8923   ;;
8924 esac
8925 fi
8926 RM=$ac_cv_path_RM
8927 if test -n "$RM"; then
8928   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $RM" >&5
8929 $as_echo "$RM" >&6; }
8930 else
8931   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
8932 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
8933 fi
8934 
8935 
8936   test -n "$RM" && break
8937 done
8938 
8939     else
8940       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
8941       # for the tool.
8942 
8943       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
8944       # for unknown variables in the end.
8945       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
8946 
8947       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
8948       tool_specified="$RM"
8949       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
8950       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
8951         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
8952         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool RM=$tool_basename" >&5
8953 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool RM=$tool_basename" >&6;}
8954         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
8955 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
8956 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
8957 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
8958 if ${ac_cv_path_RM+:} false; then :
8959   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
8960 else
8961   case $RM in
8962   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
8963   ac_cv_path_RM="$RM" # Let the user override the test with a path.
8964   ;;
8965   *)
8966   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
8967 for as_dir in $PATH
8968 do
8969   IFS=$as_save_IFS
8970   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
8971     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
8972   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
8973     ac_cv_path_RM="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
8974     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
8975     break 2
8976   fi
8977 done
8978   done
8979 IFS=$as_save_IFS
8980 
8981   ;;
8982 esac
8983 fi
8984 RM=$ac_cv_path_RM
8985 if test -n "$RM"; then
8986   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $RM" >&5
8987 $as_echo "$RM" >&6; }
8988 else
8989   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
8990 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
8991 fi
8992 
8993 
8994         if test "x$RM" = x; then
8995           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
8996         fi
8997       else
8998         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
8999         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool RM=$tool_specified" >&5
9000 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool RM=$tool_specified" >&6;}
9001         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for RM" >&5
9002 $as_echo_n "checking for RM... " >&6; }
9003         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
9004           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
9005 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
9006           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool RM=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
9007         fi
9008         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
9009 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
9010       fi
9011     fi
9012   fi
9013 
9014 
9015 
9016   if test "x$RM" = x; then
9017     as_fn_error $? "Could not find required tool for RM" "$LINENO" 5
9018   fi
9019 
9020 
9021 
9022 
9023 
9024   # Publish this variable in the help.
9025 
9026 
9027   if test "x$SH" = x; then
9028     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
9029     for ac_prog in sh
9030 do
9031   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
9032 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
9033 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
9034 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
9035 if ${ac_cv_path_SH+:} false; then :
9036   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
9037 else
9038   case $SH in
9039   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
9040   ac_cv_path_SH="$SH" # Let the user override the test with a path.
9041   ;;
9042   *)
9043   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
9044 for as_dir in $PATH
9045 do
9046   IFS=$as_save_IFS
9047   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
9048     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
9049   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
9050     ac_cv_path_SH="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
9051     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
9052     break 2
9053   fi
9054 done
9055   done
9056 IFS=$as_save_IFS
9057 
9058   ;;
9059 esac
9060 fi
9061 SH=$ac_cv_path_SH
9062 if test -n "$SH"; then
9063   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $SH" >&5
9064 $as_echo "$SH" >&6; }
9065 else
9066   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
9067 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
9068 fi
9069 
9070 
9071   test -n "$SH" && break
9072 done
9073 
9074   else
9075     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
9076 
9077     # Try to remove the string !SH! from our list.
9078     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!SH!/}
9079     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
9080       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
9081       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
9082       if test "xSH" != xBASH; then
9083         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of SH from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
9084 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of SH from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
9085       fi
9086       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
9087       for ac_prog in sh
9088 do
9089   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
9090 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
9091 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
9092 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
9093 if ${ac_cv_path_SH+:} false; then :
9094   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
9095 else
9096   case $SH in
9097   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
9098   ac_cv_path_SH="$SH" # Let the user override the test with a path.
9099   ;;
9100   *)
9101   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
9102 for as_dir in $PATH
9103 do
9104   IFS=$as_save_IFS
9105   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
9106     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
9107   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
9108     ac_cv_path_SH="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
9109     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
9110     break 2
9111   fi
9112 done
9113   done
9114 IFS=$as_save_IFS
9115 
9116   ;;
9117 esac
9118 fi
9119 SH=$ac_cv_path_SH
9120 if test -n "$SH"; then
9121   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $SH" >&5
9122 $as_echo "$SH" >&6; }
9123 else
9124   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
9125 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
9126 fi
9127 
9128 
9129   test -n "$SH" && break
9130 done
9131 
9132     else
9133       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
9134       # for the tool.
9135 
9136       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
9137       # for unknown variables in the end.
9138       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
9139 
9140       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
9141       tool_specified="$SH"
9142       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
9143       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
9144         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
9145         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool SH=$tool_basename" >&5
9146 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool SH=$tool_basename" >&6;}
9147         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
9148 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
9149 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
9150 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
9151 if ${ac_cv_path_SH+:} false; then :
9152   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
9153 else
9154   case $SH in
9155   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
9156   ac_cv_path_SH="$SH" # Let the user override the test with a path.
9157   ;;
9158   *)
9159   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
9160 for as_dir in $PATH
9161 do
9162   IFS=$as_save_IFS
9163   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
9164     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
9165   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
9166     ac_cv_path_SH="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
9167     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
9168     break 2
9169   fi
9170 done
9171   done
9172 IFS=$as_save_IFS
9173 
9174   ;;
9175 esac
9176 fi
9177 SH=$ac_cv_path_SH
9178 if test -n "$SH"; then
9179   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $SH" >&5
9180 $as_echo "$SH" >&6; }
9181 else
9182   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
9183 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
9184 fi
9185 
9186 
9187         if test "x$SH" = x; then
9188           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
9189         fi
9190       else
9191         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
9192         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool SH=$tool_specified" >&5
9193 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool SH=$tool_specified" >&6;}
9194         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for SH" >&5
9195 $as_echo_n "checking for SH... " >&6; }
9196         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
9197           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
9198 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
9199           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool SH=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
9200         fi
9201         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
9202 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
9203       fi
9204     fi
9205   fi
9206 
9207 
9208 
9209   if test "x$SH" = x; then
9210     as_fn_error $? "Could not find required tool for SH" "$LINENO" 5
9211   fi
9212

9214 
9215 
9216 
9217   # Publish this variable in the help.
9218 
9219 
9220   if test "x$SORT" = x; then
9221     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
9222     for ac_prog in sort
9223 do
9224   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
9225 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
9226 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
9227 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
9228 if ${ac_cv_path_SORT+:} false; then :
9229   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
9230 else
9231   case $SORT in
9232   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
9233   ac_cv_path_SORT="$SORT" # Let the user override the test with a path.
9234   ;;
9235   *)

9272     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
9273       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
9274       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
9275       if test "xSORT" != xBASH; then
9276         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of SORT from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
9277 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of SORT from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
9278       fi

9280       for ac_prog in sort

9283 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2

9404   fi

9412 
9413   if test "x$TAIL" = x; then
9414     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
9415     for ac_prog in tail
9416 do
9417   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
9418 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
9419 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
9420 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
9421 if ${ac_cv_path_TAIL+:} false; then :
9422   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
9423 else
9424   case $TAIL in
9425   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
9426   ac_cv_path_TAIL="$TAIL" # Let the user override the test with a path.
9427   ;;
9428   *)
9429   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
9430 for as_dir in $PATH
9431 do
9432   IFS=$as_save_IFS
9433   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
9434     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
9435   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
9436     ac_cv_path_TAIL="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
9437     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
9438     break 2
9439   fi
9440 done
9441   done
9442 IFS=$as_save_IFS
9443 
9444   ;;
9445 esac
9446 fi
9447 TAIL=$ac_cv_path_TAIL
9448 if test -n "$TAIL"; then
9449   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $TAIL" >&5
9450 $as_echo "$TAIL" >&6; }
9451 else
9452   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
9453 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
9454 fi
9455 
9456 
9457   test -n "$TAIL" && break
9458 done
9459 
9460   else
9461     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
9462 
9463     # Try to remove the string !TAIL! from our list.
9464     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!TAIL!/}
9465     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
9466       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
9467       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
9468       if test "xTAIL" != xBASH; then
9469         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of TAIL from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5

9471       fi

9476 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2

9485   ;;

9492     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
9493   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then

9495     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
9496     break 2
9497   fi
9498 done
9499   done
9500 IFS=$as_save_IFS
9501 
9502   ;;
9503 esac
9504 fi
9505 TAIL=$ac_cv_path_TAIL
9506 if test -n "$TAIL"; then
9507   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $TAIL" >&5
9508 $as_echo "$TAIL" >&6; }
9509 else
9510   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
9511 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
9512 fi
9513 
9514 
9515   test -n "$TAIL" && break
9516 done
9517 
9518     else
9519       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
9520       # for the tool.
9521 
9522       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
9523       # for unknown variables in the end.
9524       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
9525 
9526       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
9527       tool_specified="$TAIL"
9528       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
9529       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
9530         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
9531         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool TAIL=$tool_basename" >&5
9532 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool TAIL=$tool_basename" >&6;}
9533         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
9534 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
9535 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
9536 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
9537 if ${ac_cv_path_TAIL+:} false; then :
9538   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
9539 else
9540   case $TAIL in
9541   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
9542   ac_cv_path_TAIL="$TAIL" # Let the user override the test with a path.
9543   ;;
9544   *)
9545   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
9546 for as_dir in $PATH
9547 do
9548   IFS=$as_save_IFS
9549   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
9550     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
9551   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
9552     ac_cv_path_TAIL="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
9553     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
9554     break 2
9555   fi
9556 done
9557   done
9558 IFS=$as_save_IFS
9559 
9560   ;;
9561 esac
9562 fi
9563 TAIL=$ac_cv_path_TAIL
9564 if test -n "$TAIL"; then
9565   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $TAIL" >&5
9566 $as_echo "$TAIL" >&6; }
9567 else
9568   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
9569 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
9570 fi
9571 
9572 
9573         if test "x$TAIL" = x; then
9574           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
9575         fi
9576       else
9577         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
9578         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool TAIL=$tool_specified" >&5
9579 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool TAIL=$tool_specified" >&6;}
9580         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for TAIL" >&5
9581 $as_echo_n "checking for TAIL... " >&6; }
9582         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
9583           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
9584 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
9585           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool TAIL=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
9586         fi
9587         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
9588 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
9589       fi
9590     fi
9591   fi
9592 
9593 
9594 
9595   if test "x$TAIL" = x; then
9596     as_fn_error $? "Could not find required tool for TAIL" "$LINENO" 5
9597   fi
9598 
9599 
9600 
9601 
9602 
9603   # Publish this variable in the help.
9604 
9605 
9606   if test "x$TAR" = x; then
9607     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
9608     for ac_prog in tar
9609 do
9610   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
9611 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
9612 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
9613 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
9614 if ${ac_cv_path_TAR+:} false; then :
9615   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
9616 else
9617   case $TAR in
9618   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
9619   ac_cv_path_TAR="$TAR" # Let the user override the test with a path.
9620   ;;
9621   *)
9622   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
9623 for as_dir in $PATH
9624 do
9625   IFS=$as_save_IFS
9626   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
9627     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
9628   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
9629     ac_cv_path_TAR="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
9630     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
9631     break 2
9632   fi
9633 done
9634   done
9635 IFS=$as_save_IFS
9636 
9637   ;;
9638 esac
9639 fi
9640 TAR=$ac_cv_path_TAR
9641 if test -n "$TAR"; then
9642   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $TAR" >&5
9643 $as_echo "$TAR" >&6; }
9644 else
9645   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
9646 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
9647 fi
9648 
9649 
9650   test -n "$TAR" && break
9651 done
9652 
9653   else
9654     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
9655 
9656     # Try to remove the string !TAR! from our list.
9657     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!TAR!/}
9658     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
9659       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
9660       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
9661       if test "xTAR" != xBASH; then
9662         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of TAR from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
9663 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of TAR from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
9664       fi
9665       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
9666       for ac_prog in tar
9667 do
9668   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
9669 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
9670 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
9671 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
9672 if ${ac_cv_path_TAR+:} false; then :
9673   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
9674 else
9675   case $TAR in
9676   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
9677   ac_cv_path_TAR="$TAR" # Let the user override the test with a path.
9678   ;;
9679   *)
9680   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
9681 for as_dir in $PATH
9682 do
9683   IFS=$as_save_IFS
9684   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
9685     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
9686   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
9687     ac_cv_path_TAR="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
9688     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
9689     break 2
9690   fi
9691 done
9692   done
9693 IFS=$as_save_IFS
9694 
9695   ;;
9696 esac
9697 fi
9698 TAR=$ac_cv_path_TAR
9699 if test -n "$TAR"; then
9700   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $TAR" >&5
9701 $as_echo "$TAR" >&6; }
9702 else
9703   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
9704 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
9705 fi
9706 
9707 
9708   test -n "$TAR" && break
9709 done
9710 
9711     else
9712       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
9713       # for the tool.
9714 
9715       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
9716       # for unknown variables in the end.
9717       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
9718 
9719       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
9720       tool_specified="$TAR"
9721       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
9722       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
9723         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
9724         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool TAR=$tool_basename" >&5
9725 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool TAR=$tool_basename" >&6;}
9726         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
9727 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
9728 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
9729 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
9730 if ${ac_cv_path_TAR+:} false; then :
9731   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
9732 else
9733   case $TAR in
9734   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
9735   ac_cv_path_TAR="$TAR" # Let the user override the test with a path.
9736   ;;
9737   *)
9738   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
9739 for as_dir in $PATH

9746     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
9747     break 2
9748   fi
9749 done
9750   done
9751 IFS=$as_save_IFS
9752 
9753   ;;
9754 esac
9755 fi
9756 TAR=$ac_cv_path_TAR

9758   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $TAR" >&5

9760 else

9772 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool TAR=$tool_specified" >&6;}
9773         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for TAR" >&5

9776           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
9777 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }

9779         fi

9781 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
9782       fi
9783     fi
9784   fi

9789     as_fn_error $? "Could not find required tool for TAR" "$LINENO" 5
9790   fi

9852       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
9853       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
9854       if test "xTEE" != xBASH; then
9855         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of TEE from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5

9857       fi

9992   if test "x$TOUCH" = x; then
9993     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
9994     for ac_prog in touch
9995 do
9996   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
9997 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
9998 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
9999 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
10000 if ${ac_cv_path_TOUCH+:} false; then :
10001   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
10002 else
10003   case $TOUCH in
10004   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
10005   ac_cv_path_TOUCH="$TOUCH" # Let the user override the test with a path.
10006   ;;
10007   *)
10008   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
10009 for as_dir in $PATH
10010 do
10011   IFS=$as_save_IFS
10012   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
10013     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
10014   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
10015     ac_cv_path_TOUCH="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
10016     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
10017     break 2
10018   fi
10019 done
10020   done
10021 IFS=$as_save_IFS
10022 
10023   ;;
10024 esac
10025 fi
10026 TOUCH=$ac_cv_path_TOUCH
10027 if test -n "$TOUCH"; then
10028   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $TOUCH" >&5
10029 $as_echo "$TOUCH" >&6; }
10030 else
10031   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
10032 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
10033 fi
10034 
10035 
10036   test -n "$TOUCH" && break
10037 done
10038 
10039   else
10040     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
10041 
10042     # Try to remove the string !TOUCH! from our list.
10043     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!TOUCH!/}
10044     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
10045       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
10046       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
10047       if test "xTOUCH" != xBASH; then
10048         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of TOUCH from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
10049 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of TOUCH from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
10050       fi
10051       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
10052       for ac_prog in touch
10053 do
10054   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
10055 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
10056 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
10057 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
10058 if ${ac_cv_path_TOUCH+:} false; then :
10059   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
10060 else
10061   case $TOUCH in
10062   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
10063   ac_cv_path_TOUCH="$TOUCH" # Let the user override the test with a path.
10064   ;;
10065   *)
10066   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
10067 for as_dir in $PATH
10068 do
10069   IFS=$as_save_IFS
10070   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
10071     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
10072   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
10073     ac_cv_path_TOUCH="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
10074     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
10075     break 2
10076   fi
10077 done
10078   done
10079 IFS=$as_save_IFS
10080 
10081   ;;
10082 esac
10083 fi
10084 TOUCH=$ac_cv_path_TOUCH
10085 if test -n "$TOUCH"; then
10086   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $TOUCH" >&5
10087 $as_echo "$TOUCH" >&6; }
10088 else
10089   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
10090 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
10091 fi
10092 
10093 
10094   test -n "$TOUCH" && break
10095 done
10096 
10097     else
10098       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
10099       # for the tool.
10100 
10101       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
10102       # for unknown variables in the end.
10103       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
10104 
10105       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
10106       tool_specified="$TOUCH"
10107       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
10108       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
10109         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
10110         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool TOUCH=$tool_basename" >&5
10111 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool TOUCH=$tool_basename" >&6;}
10112         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
10113 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
10114 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
10115 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
10116 if ${ac_cv_path_TOUCH+:} false; then :
10117   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
10118 else
10119   case $TOUCH in
10120   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
10121   ac_cv_path_TOUCH="$TOUCH" # Let the user override the test with a path.
10122   ;;
10123   *)
10124   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
10125 for as_dir in $PATH
10126 do
10127   IFS=$as_save_IFS
10128   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
10129     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
10130   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
10131     ac_cv_path_TOUCH="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
10132     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
10133     break 2
10134   fi
10135 done
10136   done
10137 IFS=$as_save_IFS
10138 
10139   ;;
10140 esac
10141 fi
10142 TOUCH=$ac_cv_path_TOUCH
10143 if test -n "$TOUCH"; then
10144   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $TOUCH" >&5
10145 $as_echo "$TOUCH" >&6; }
10146 else
10147   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
10148 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
10149 fi
10150 
10151 
10152         if test "x$TOUCH" = x; then
10153           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
10154         fi
10155       else
10156         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
10157         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool TOUCH=$tool_specified" >&5
10158 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool TOUCH=$tool_specified" >&6;}
10159         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for TOUCH" >&5
10160 $as_echo_n "checking for TOUCH... " >&6; }
10161         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
10162           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
10163 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
10164           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool TOUCH=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
10165         fi
10166         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
10167 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
10168       fi
10169     fi
10170   fi
10171 
10172 
10173 
10174   if test "x$TOUCH" = x; then
10175     as_fn_error $? "Could not find required tool for TOUCH" "$LINENO" 5
10176   fi
10177 
10178 
10179 
10180 
10181 
10182   # Publish this variable in the help.
10183 
10184 
10185   if test "x$TR" = x; then
10186     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
10187     for ac_prog in tr
10188 do
10189   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
10190 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
10191 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
10192 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
10193 if ${ac_cv_path_TR+:} false; then :
10194   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
10195 else
10196   case $TR in
10197   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
10198   ac_cv_path_TR="$TR" # Let the user override the test with a path.
10199   ;;
10200   *)
10201   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
10202 for as_dir in $PATH
10203 do
10204   IFS=$as_save_IFS
10205   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
10206     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
10207   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
10208     ac_cv_path_TR="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
10209     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
10210     break 2
10211   fi
10212 done
10213   done
10214 IFS=$as_save_IFS
10215 
10216   ;;
10217 esac
10218 fi
10219 TR=$ac_cv_path_TR
10220 if test -n "$TR"; then
10221   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $TR" >&5
10222 $as_echo "$TR" >&6; }
10223 else
10224   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
10225 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
10226 fi
10227 
10228 
10229   test -n "$TR" && break
10230 done
10231 
10232   else
10233     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
10234 
10235     # Try to remove the string !TR! from our list.
10236     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!TR!/}
10237     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
10238       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
10239       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
10240       if test "xTR" != xBASH; then
10241         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of TR from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
10242 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of TR from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
10243       fi
10244       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
10245       for ac_prog in tr
10246 do
10247   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
10248 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
10249 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
10250 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
10251 if ${ac_cv_path_TR+:} false; then :
10252   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
10253 else
10254   case $TR in
10255   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
10256   ac_cv_path_TR="$TR" # Let the user override the test with a path.
10257   ;;
10258   *)
10259   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
10260 for as_dir in $PATH
10261 do
10262   IFS=$as_save_IFS
10263   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
10264     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
10265   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
10266     ac_cv_path_TR="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
10267     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
10268     break 2
10269   fi
10270 done
10271   done
10272 IFS=$as_save_IFS
10273 
10274   ;;
10275 esac
10276 fi
10277 TR=$ac_cv_path_TR
10278 if test -n "$TR"; then
10279   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $TR" >&5
10280 $as_echo "$TR" >&6; }
10281 else
10282   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
10283 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
10284 fi
10285 
10286 
10287   test -n "$TR" && break
10288 done
10289 
10290     else
10291       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
10292       # for the tool.
10293 
10294       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
10295       # for unknown variables in the end.
10296       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"

10369   fi

10375   # Publish this variable in the help.
10376

10378   if test "x$UNAME" = x; then
10379     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
10380     for ac_prog in uname
10381 do
10382   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
10383 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
10384 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
10385 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }

10403     break 2
10404   fi
10405 done
10406   done
10407 IFS=$as_save_IFS
10408 
10409   ;;
10410 esac
10411 fi

10413 if test -n "$UNAME"; then

10416 else

10418 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
10419 fi
10420 
10421

10423 done
10424 
10425   else
10426     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
10427 
10428     # Try to remove the string !UNAME! from our list.
10429     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!UNAME!/}
10430     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
10431       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
10432       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
10433       if test "xUNAME" != xBASH; then
10434         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of UNAME from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
10435 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of UNAME from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
10436       fi

10438       for ac_prog in uname
10439 do

10441 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2

10561     as_fn_error $? "Could not find required tool for UNAME" "$LINENO" 5
10562   fi

10571   if test "x$UNIQ" = x; then
10572     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
10573     for ac_prog in uniq
10574 do
10575   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
10576 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
10577 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
10578 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
10579 if ${ac_cv_path_UNIQ+:} false; then :
10580   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
10581 else
10582   case $UNIQ in
10583   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
10584   ac_cv_path_UNIQ="$UNIQ" # Let the user override the test with a path.
10585   ;;
10586   *)
10587   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
10588 for as_dir in $PATH
10589 do
10590   IFS=$as_save_IFS
10591   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
10592     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
10593   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
10594     ac_cv_path_UNIQ="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
10595     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
10596     break 2
10597   fi
10598 done
10599   done
10600 IFS=$as_save_IFS
10601 
10602   ;;
10603 esac
10604 fi
10605 UNIQ=$ac_cv_path_UNIQ
10606 if test -n "$UNIQ"; then
10607   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $UNIQ" >&5
10608 $as_echo "$UNIQ" >&6; }
10609 else
10610   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
10611 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
10612 fi
10613 
10614 
10615   test -n "$UNIQ" && break
10616 done
10617 
10618   else
10619     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
10620 
10621     # Try to remove the string !UNIQ! from our list.
10622     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!UNIQ!/}
10623     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
10624       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
10625       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
10626       if test "xUNIQ" != xBASH; then
10627         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of UNIQ from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
10628 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of UNIQ from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
10629       fi
10630       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
10631       for ac_prog in uniq
10632 do
10633   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
10634 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
10635 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
10636 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
10637 if ${ac_cv_path_UNIQ+:} false; then :
10638   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
10639 else
10640   case $UNIQ in
10641   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
10642   ac_cv_path_UNIQ="$UNIQ" # Let the user override the test with a path.
10643   ;;
10644   *)
10645   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
10646 for as_dir in $PATH
10647 do
10648   IFS=$as_save_IFS
10649   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
10650     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
10651   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
10652     ac_cv_path_UNIQ="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
10653     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
10654     break 2
10655   fi
10656 done
10657   done
10658 IFS=$as_save_IFS
10659 
10660   ;;
10661 esac
10662 fi
10663 UNIQ=$ac_cv_path_UNIQ
10664 if test -n "$UNIQ"; then
10665   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $UNIQ" >&5
10666 $as_echo "$UNIQ" >&6; }
10667 else
10668   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
10669 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
10670 fi
10671 
10672 
10673   test -n "$UNIQ" && break
10674 done
10675 
10676     else
10677       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
10678       # for the tool.
10679 
10680       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
10681       # for unknown variables in the end.
10682       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
10683 
10684       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
10685       tool_specified="$UNIQ"
10686       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
10687       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
10688         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
10689         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool UNIQ=$tool_basename" >&5
10690 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool UNIQ=$tool_basename" >&6;}
10691         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
10692 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
10693 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
10694 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
10695 if ${ac_cv_path_UNIQ+:} false; then :
10696   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
10697 else
10698   case $UNIQ in
10699   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
10700   ac_cv_path_UNIQ="$UNIQ" # Let the user override the test with a path.
10701   ;;
10702   *)
10703   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
10704 for as_dir in $PATH
10705 do
10706   IFS=$as_save_IFS
10707   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
10708     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
10709   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
10710     ac_cv_path_UNIQ="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
10711     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
10712     break 2
10713   fi
10714 done
10715   done
10716 IFS=$as_save_IFS
10717 
10718   ;;
10719 esac
10720 fi
10721 UNIQ=$ac_cv_path_UNIQ
10722 if test -n "$UNIQ"; then
10723   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $UNIQ" >&5
10724 $as_echo "$UNIQ" >&6; }
10725 else
10726   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
10727 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
10728 fi
10729 
10730 
10731         if test "x$UNIQ" = x; then
10732           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
10733         fi
10734       else
10735         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
10736         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool UNIQ=$tool_specified" >&5
10737 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool UNIQ=$tool_specified" >&6;}
10738         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for UNIQ" >&5
10739 $as_echo_n "checking for UNIQ... " >&6; }
10740         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
10741           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
10742 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
10743           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool UNIQ=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
10744         fi
10745         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
10746 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
10747       fi
10748     fi
10749   fi
10750 
10751 
10752 
10753   if test "x$UNIQ" = x; then
10754     as_fn_error $? "Could not find required tool for UNIQ" "$LINENO" 5
10755   fi
10756 
10757 
10758 
10759 
10760 
10761   # Publish this variable in the help.
10762 
10763 
10764   if test "x$WC" = x; then
10765     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
10766     for ac_prog in wc
10767 do
10768   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
10769 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
10770 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
10771 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
10772 if ${ac_cv_path_WC+:} false; then :
10773   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
10774 else
10775   case $WC in
10776   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
10777   ac_cv_path_WC="$WC" # Let the user override the test with a path.
10778   ;;
10779   *)
10780   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
10781 for as_dir in $PATH
10782 do
10783   IFS=$as_save_IFS
10784   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
10785     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
10786   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
10787     ac_cv_path_WC="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
10788     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
10789     break 2
10790   fi
10791 done
10792   done
10793 IFS=$as_save_IFS
10794 
10795   ;;
10796 esac
10797 fi
10798 WC=$ac_cv_path_WC
10799 if test -n "$WC"; then
10800   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $WC" >&5
10801 $as_echo "$WC" >&6; }
10802 else
10803   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
10804 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
10805 fi
10806 
10807 
10808   test -n "$WC" && break
10809 done
10810 
10811   else
10812     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
10813 
10814     # Try to remove the string !WC! from our list.
10815     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!WC!/}
10816     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
10817       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
10818       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
10819       if test "xWC" != xBASH; then
10820         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of WC from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
10821 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of WC from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
10822       fi
10823       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
10824       for ac_prog in wc
10825 do
10826   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
10827 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
10828 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
10829 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
10830 if ${ac_cv_path_WC+:} false; then :

10835   ac_cv_path_WC="$WC" # Let the user override the test with a path.

10848   fi
10849 done
10850   done
10851 IFS=$as_save_IFS
10852 
10853   ;;
10854 esac
10855 fi

10867 done

10904     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
10905     break 2
10906   fi
10907 done
10908   done
10909 IFS=$as_save_IFS
10910 
10911   ;;
10912 esac
10913 fi

10937         fi

10939 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
10940       fi
10941     fi
10942   fi

10947     as_fn_error $? "Could not find required tool for WC" "$LINENO" 5
10948   fi
10949

10951 
10952 
10953 
10954   # Publish this variable in the help.
10955 
10956 
10957   if test "x$WHICH" = x; then
10958     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
10959     for ac_prog in which
10960 do
10961   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
10962 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2

10964 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
10965 if ${ac_cv_path_WHICH+:} false; then :
10966   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
10967 else
10968   case $WHICH in
10969   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
10970   ac_cv_path_WHICH="$WHICH" # Let the user override the test with a path.
10971   ;;
10972   *)
10973   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR

10982     break 2
10983   fi
10984 done
10985   done
10986 IFS=$as_save_IFS
10987 
10988   ;;
10989 esac
10990 fi

10997 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
10998 fi
10999 
11000

11002 done

11009     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
11010       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,

11109   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $WHICH" >&5
