11112   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5

11120       else
11121         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
11122         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool WHICH=$tool_specified" >&5
11123 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool WHICH=$tool_specified" >&6;}
11124         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for WHICH" >&5
11125 $as_echo_n "checking for WHICH... " >&6; }
11126         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
11127           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
11128 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
11129           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool WHICH=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
11130         fi
11131         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
11132 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
11133       fi
11134     fi
11135   fi
11136 
11137 
11138 
11139   if test "x$WHICH" = x; then
11140     as_fn_error $? "Could not find required tool for WHICH" "$LINENO" 5
11141   fi
11142 
11143 
11144 
11145 
11146 
11147   # Publish this variable in the help.
11148 
11149 
11150   if test "x$XARGS" = x; then
11151     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
11152     for ac_prog in xargs
11153 do
11154   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
11155 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
11156 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
11157 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
11158 if ${ac_cv_path_XARGS+:} false; then :
11159   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
11160 else
11161   case $XARGS in
11162   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
11163   ac_cv_path_XARGS="$XARGS" # Let the user override the test with a path.
11164   ;;
11165   *)
11166   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
11167 for as_dir in $PATH
11168 do
11169   IFS=$as_save_IFS
11170   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
11171     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
11172   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
11173     ac_cv_path_XARGS="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
11174     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
11175     break 2
11176   fi
11177 done
11178   done
11179 IFS=$as_save_IFS
11180 
11181   ;;
11182 esac
11183 fi
11184 XARGS=$ac_cv_path_XARGS
11185 if test -n "$XARGS"; then
11186   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $XARGS" >&5
11187 $as_echo "$XARGS" >&6; }
11188 else
11189   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
11190 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
11191 fi
11192 
11193 
11194   test -n "$XARGS" && break
11195 done
11196 
11197   else
11198     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
11199 
11200     # Try to remove the string !XARGS! from our list.
11201     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!XARGS!/}
11202     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
11203       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
11204       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
11205       if test "xXARGS" != xBASH; then
11206         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of XARGS from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
11207 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of XARGS from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
11208       fi
11209       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
11210       for ac_prog in xargs
11211 do
11212   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
11213 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
11214 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
11215 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
11216 if ${ac_cv_path_XARGS+:} false; then :
11217   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
11218 else
11219   case $XARGS in
11220   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
11221   ac_cv_path_XARGS="$XARGS" # Let the user override the test with a path.
11222   ;;
11223   *)
11224   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
11225 for as_dir in $PATH
11226 do
11227   IFS=$as_save_IFS
11228   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
11229     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
11230   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
11231     ac_cv_path_XARGS="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
11232     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
11233     break 2
11234   fi
11235 done
11236   done
11237 IFS=$as_save_IFS
11238 
11239   ;;
11240 esac
11241 fi
11242 XARGS=$ac_cv_path_XARGS
11243 if test -n "$XARGS"; then
11244   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $XARGS" >&5
11245 $as_echo "$XARGS" >&6; }
11246 else
11247   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
11248 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
11249 fi
11250 
11251 
11252   test -n "$XARGS" && break
11253 done
11254 
11255     else
11256       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
11257       # for the tool.
11258 
11259       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
11260       # for unknown variables in the end.
11261       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
11262 
11263       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
11264       tool_specified="$XARGS"
11265       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
11266       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
11267         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
11268         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool XARGS=$tool_basename" >&5
11269 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool XARGS=$tool_basename" >&6;}
11270         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
11271 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
11272 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
11273 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
11274 if ${ac_cv_path_XARGS+:} false; then :
11275   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
11276 else
11277   case $XARGS in
11278   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
11279   ac_cv_path_XARGS="$XARGS" # Let the user override the test with a path.
11280   ;;
11281   *)
11282   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
11283 for as_dir in $PATH
11284 do
11285   IFS=$as_save_IFS
11286   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
11287     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
11288   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
11289     ac_cv_path_XARGS="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
11290     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
11291     break 2
11292   fi
11293 done
11294   done
11295 IFS=$as_save_IFS
11296 
11297   ;;
11298 esac
11299 fi
11300 XARGS=$ac_cv_path_XARGS
11301 if test -n "$XARGS"; then
11302   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $XARGS" >&5
11303 $as_echo "$XARGS" >&6; }
11304 else
11305   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
11306 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
11307 fi
11308 
11309 
11310         if test "x$XARGS" = x; then
11311           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
11312         fi
11313       else
11314         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
11315         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool XARGS=$tool_specified" >&5
11316 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool XARGS=$tool_specified" >&6;}
11317         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for XARGS" >&5
11318 $as_echo_n "checking for XARGS... " >&6; }
11319         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
11320           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
11321 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
11322           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool XARGS=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
11323         fi
11324         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
11325 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
11326       fi
11327     fi
11328   fi
11329 
11330 
11331 
11332   if test "x$XARGS" = x; then
11333     as_fn_error $? "Could not find required tool for XARGS" "$LINENO" 5
11334   fi
11335 
11336 
11337 
11338   # Then required tools that require some special treatment.
11339 
11340 
11341   # Publish this variable in the help.
11342 
11343 
11344   if test "x$AWK" = x; then
11345     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
11346     for ac_prog in gawk mawk nawk awk
11347 do
11348   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
11349 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
11350 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
11351 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
11352 if ${ac_cv_prog_AWK+:} false; then :
11353   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
11354 else
11355   if test -n "$AWK"; then
11356   ac_cv_prog_AWK="$AWK" # Let the user override the test.
11357 else
11358 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
11359 for as_dir in $PATH
11360 do
11361   IFS=$as_save_IFS
11362   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
11363     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
11364   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
11365     ac_cv_prog_AWK="$ac_prog"
11366     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
11367     break 2
11368   fi
11369 done
11370   done
11371 IFS=$as_save_IFS
11372 
11373 fi
11374 fi
11375 AWK=$ac_cv_prog_AWK
11376 if test -n "$AWK"; then
11377   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $AWK" >&5
11378 $as_echo "$AWK" >&6; }
11379 else
11380   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
11381 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
11382 fi
11383 
11384 
11385   test -n "$AWK" && break
11386 done
11387 
11388   else
11389     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
11390 
11391     # Try to remove the string !AWK! from our list.
11392     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!AWK!/}
11393     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
11394       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
11395       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
11396       if test "xAWK" != xBASH; then
11397         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of AWK from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
11398 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of AWK from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
11399       fi
11400       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
11401       for ac_prog in gawk mawk nawk awk
11402 do
11403   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
11404 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
11405 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
11406 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
11407 if ${ac_cv_prog_AWK+:} false; then :
11408   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
11409 else
11410   if test -n "$AWK"; then
11411   ac_cv_prog_AWK="$AWK" # Let the user override the test.
11412 else
11413 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
11414 for as_dir in $PATH
11415 do
11416   IFS=$as_save_IFS
11417   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
11418     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
11419   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
11420     ac_cv_prog_AWK="$ac_prog"
11421     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
11422     break 2
11423   fi
11424 done
11425   done
11426 IFS=$as_save_IFS
11427 
11428 fi
11429 fi
11430 AWK=$ac_cv_prog_AWK
11431 if test -n "$AWK"; then
11432   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $AWK" >&5
11433 $as_echo "$AWK" >&6; }
11434 else
11435   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
11436 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
11437 fi
11438 
11439 
11440   test -n "$AWK" && break
11441 done
11442 
11443     else
11444       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
11445       # for the tool.
11446 
11447       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
11448       # for unknown variables in the end.
11449       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
11450 
11451       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
11452       tool_specified="$AWK"
11453       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
11454       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
11455         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
11456         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool AWK=$tool_basename" >&5
11457 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool AWK=$tool_basename" >&6;}
11458         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
11459 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
11460 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
11461 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
11462 if ${ac_cv_path_AWK+:} false; then :
11463   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
11464 else
11465   case $AWK in
11466   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
11467   ac_cv_path_AWK="$AWK" # Let the user override the test with a path.
11468   ;;
11469   *)
11470   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
11471 for as_dir in $PATH
11472 do
11473   IFS=$as_save_IFS
11474   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
11475     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
11476   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
11477     ac_cv_path_AWK="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
11478     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
11479     break 2
11480   fi
11481 done
11482   done
11483 IFS=$as_save_IFS
11484 
11485   ;;
11486 esac
11487 fi
11488 AWK=$ac_cv_path_AWK
11489 if test -n "$AWK"; then
11490   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $AWK" >&5
11491 $as_echo "$AWK" >&6; }
11492 else
11493   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
11494 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
11495 fi
11496 
11497 
11498         if test "x$AWK" = x; then
11499           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
11500         fi
11501       else
11502         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
11503         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool AWK=$tool_specified" >&5
11504 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool AWK=$tool_specified" >&6;}
11505         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for AWK" >&5
11506 $as_echo_n "checking for AWK... " >&6; }
11507         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
11508           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
11509 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
11510           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool AWK=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
11511         fi
11512         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
11513 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
11514       fi
11515     fi
11516   fi
11517 
11518 
11519   if test "x$AWK" = x; then
11520     as_fn_error $? "Could not find required tool for AWK" "$LINENO" 5
11521   fi
11522 
11523 
11524 
11525 
11526   # Publish this variable in the help.
11527 
11528 
11529   if test "x$GREP" = x; then
11530     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
11531     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for grep that handles long lines and -e" >&5
11532 $as_echo_n "checking for grep that handles long lines and -e... " >&6; }
11533 if ${ac_cv_path_GREP+:} false; then :
11534   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
11535 else
11536   if test -z "$GREP"; then
11537   ac_path_GREP_found=false
11538   # Loop through the user's path and test for each of PROGNAME-LIST
11539   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
11540 for as_dir in $PATH$PATH_SEPARATOR/usr/xpg4/bin
11541 do
11542   IFS=$as_save_IFS
11543   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
11544     for ac_prog in grep ggrep; do
11545     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
11546       ac_path_GREP="$as_dir/$ac_prog$ac_exec_ext"
11547       as_fn_executable_p "$ac_path_GREP" || continue
11548 # Check for GNU ac_path_GREP and select it if it is found.
11549   # Check for GNU $ac_path_GREP
11550 case `"$ac_path_GREP" --version 2>&1` in
11551 *GNU*)
11552   ac_cv_path_GREP="$ac_path_GREP" ac_path_GREP_found=:;;
11553 *)
11554   ac_count=0
11555   $as_echo_n 0123456789 >"conftest.in"
11556   while :
11557   do
11558     cat "conftest.in" "conftest.in" >"conftest.tmp"
11559     mv "conftest.tmp" "conftest.in"
11560     cp "conftest.in" "conftest.nl"
11561     $as_echo 'GREP' >> "conftest.nl"
11562     "$ac_path_GREP" -e 'GREP$' -e '-(cannot match)-' < "conftest.nl" >"conftest.out" 2>/dev/null || break
11563     diff "conftest.out" "conftest.nl" >/dev/null 2>&1 || break
11564     as_fn_arith $ac_count + 1 && ac_count=$as_val
11565     if test $ac_count -gt ${ac_path_GREP_max-0}; then
11566       # Best one so far, save it but keep looking for a better one
11567       ac_cv_path_GREP="$ac_path_GREP"
11568       ac_path_GREP_max=$ac_count
11569     fi
11570     # 10*(2^10) chars as input seems more than enough
11571     test $ac_count -gt 10 && break
11572   done
11573   rm -f conftest.in conftest.tmp conftest.nl conftest.out;;
11574 esac
11575 
11576       $ac_path_GREP_found && break 3
11577     done
11578   done
11579   done
11580 IFS=$as_save_IFS
11581   if test -z "$ac_cv_path_GREP"; then
11582     as_fn_error $? "no acceptable grep could be found in $PATH$PATH_SEPARATOR/usr/xpg4/bin" "$LINENO" 5
11583   fi
11584 else
11585   ac_cv_path_GREP=$GREP
11586 fi
11587 
11588 fi
11589 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_path_GREP" >&5
11590 $as_echo "$ac_cv_path_GREP" >&6; }
11591  GREP="$ac_cv_path_GREP"
11592 
11593 
11594   else
11595     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
11596 
11597     # Try to remove the string !GREP! from our list.
11598     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!GREP!/}
11599     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
11600       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
11601       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
11602       if test "xGREP" != xBASH; then
11603         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of GREP from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
11604 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of GREP from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
11605       fi
11606       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
11607       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for grep that handles long lines and -e" >&5
11608 $as_echo_n "checking for grep that handles long lines and -e... " >&6; }
11609 if ${ac_cv_path_GREP+:} false; then :
11610   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
11611 else
11612   if test -z "$GREP"; then
11613   ac_path_GREP_found=false
11614   # Loop through the user's path and test for each of PROGNAME-LIST
11615   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
11616 for as_dir in $PATH$PATH_SEPARATOR/usr/xpg4/bin
11617 do
11618   IFS=$as_save_IFS
11619   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
11620     for ac_prog in grep ggrep; do
11621     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
11622       ac_path_GREP="$as_dir/$ac_prog$ac_exec_ext"
11623       as_fn_executable_p "$ac_path_GREP" || continue
11624 # Check for GNU ac_path_GREP and select it if it is found.
11625   # Check for GNU $ac_path_GREP
11626 case `"$ac_path_GREP" --version 2>&1` in
11627 *GNU*)
11628   ac_cv_path_GREP="$ac_path_GREP" ac_path_GREP_found=:;;
11629 *)
11630   ac_count=0
11631   $as_echo_n 0123456789 >"conftest.in"
11632   while :
11633   do
11634     cat "conftest.in" "conftest.in" >"conftest.tmp"
11635     mv "conftest.tmp" "conftest.in"
11636     cp "conftest.in" "conftest.nl"
11637     $as_echo 'GREP' >> "conftest.nl"
11638     "$ac_path_GREP" -e 'GREP$' -e '-(cannot match)-' < "conftest.nl" >"conftest.out" 2>/dev/null || break
11639     diff "conftest.out" "conftest.nl" >/dev/null 2>&1 || break
11640     as_fn_arith $ac_count + 1 && ac_count=$as_val
11641     if test $ac_count -gt ${ac_path_GREP_max-0}; then
11642       # Best one so far, save it but keep looking for a better one
11643       ac_cv_path_GREP="$ac_path_GREP"
11644       ac_path_GREP_max=$ac_count
11645     fi
11646     # 10*(2^10) chars as input seems more than enough
11647     test $ac_count -gt 10 && break
11648   done
11649   rm -f conftest.in conftest.tmp conftest.nl conftest.out;;
11650 esac
11651 
11652       $ac_path_GREP_found && break 3
11653     done
11654   done
11655   done
11656 IFS=$as_save_IFS
11657   if test -z "$ac_cv_path_GREP"; then
11658     as_fn_error $? "no acceptable grep could be found in $PATH$PATH_SEPARATOR/usr/xpg4/bin" "$LINENO" 5
11659   fi
11660 else
11661   ac_cv_path_GREP=$GREP
11662 fi
11663 
11664 fi
11665 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_path_GREP" >&5
11666 $as_echo "$ac_cv_path_GREP" >&6; }
11667  GREP="$ac_cv_path_GREP"
11668 
11669 
11670     else
11671       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
11672       # for the tool.
11673 
11674       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
11675       # for unknown variables in the end.
11676       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
11677 
11678       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
11679       tool_specified="$GREP"
11680       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
11681       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
11682         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
11683         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool GREP=$tool_basename" >&5
11684 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool GREP=$tool_basename" >&6;}
11685         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
11686 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
11687 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
11688 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
11689 if ${ac_cv_path_GREP+:} false; then :
11690   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
11691 else
11692   case $GREP in
11693   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
11694   ac_cv_path_GREP="$GREP" # Let the user override the test with a path.
11695   ;;
11696   *)
11697   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
11698 for as_dir in $PATH
11699 do
11700   IFS=$as_save_IFS
11701   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
11702     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
11703   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
11704     ac_cv_path_GREP="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
11705     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
11706     break 2
11707   fi
11708 done
11709   done
11710 IFS=$as_save_IFS
11711 
11712   ;;
11713 esac
11714 fi
11715 GREP=$ac_cv_path_GREP
11716 if test -n "$GREP"; then
11717   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $GREP" >&5
11718 $as_echo "$GREP" >&6; }
11719 else
11720   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
11721 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
11722 fi
11723 
11724 
11725         if test "x$GREP" = x; then
11726           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
11727         fi
11728       else
11729         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
11730         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool GREP=$tool_specified" >&5
11731 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool GREP=$tool_specified" >&6;}
11732         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for GREP" >&5
11733 $as_echo_n "checking for GREP... " >&6; }
11734         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
11735           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
11736 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
11737           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool GREP=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
11738         fi
11739         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
11740 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
11741       fi
11742     fi
11743   fi
11744 
11745 
11746   if test "x$GREP" = x; then
11747     as_fn_error $? "Could not find required tool for GREP" "$LINENO" 5
11748   fi
11749 
11750 
11751 
11752 
11753   # Publish this variable in the help.
11754 
11755 
11756   if test "x$EGREP" = x; then
11757     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
11758     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for egrep" >&5
11759 $as_echo_n "checking for egrep... " >&6; }
11760 if ${ac_cv_path_EGREP+:} false; then :
11761   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
11762 else
11763   if echo a | $GREP -E '(a|b)' >/dev/null 2>&1
11764    then ac_cv_path_EGREP="$GREP -E"
11765    else
11766      if test -z "$EGREP"; then
11767   ac_path_EGREP_found=false
11768   # Loop through the user's path and test for each of PROGNAME-LIST
11769   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
11770 for as_dir in $PATH$PATH_SEPARATOR/usr/xpg4/bin
11771 do
11772   IFS=$as_save_IFS
11773   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
11774     for ac_prog in egrep; do
11775     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
11776       ac_path_EGREP="$as_dir/$ac_prog$ac_exec_ext"
11777       as_fn_executable_p "$ac_path_EGREP" || continue
11778 # Check for GNU ac_path_EGREP and select it if it is found.
11779   # Check for GNU $ac_path_EGREP
11780 case `"$ac_path_EGREP" --version 2>&1` in
11781 *GNU*)
11782   ac_cv_path_EGREP="$ac_path_EGREP" ac_path_EGREP_found=:;;
11783 *)
11784   ac_count=0
11785   $as_echo_n 0123456789 >"conftest.in"
11786   while :
11787   do
11788     cat "conftest.in" "conftest.in" >"conftest.tmp"
11789     mv "conftest.tmp" "conftest.in"
11790     cp "conftest.in" "conftest.nl"
11791     $as_echo 'EGREP' >> "conftest.nl"
11792     "$ac_path_EGREP" 'EGREP$' < "conftest.nl" >"conftest.out" 2>/dev/null || break
11793     diff "conftest.out" "conftest.nl" >/dev/null 2>&1 || break
11794     as_fn_arith $ac_count + 1 && ac_count=$as_val
11795     if test $ac_count -gt ${ac_path_EGREP_max-0}; then
11796       # Best one so far, save it but keep looking for a better one
11797       ac_cv_path_EGREP="$ac_path_EGREP"
11798       ac_path_EGREP_max=$ac_count
11799     fi
11800     # 10*(2^10) chars as input seems more than enough
11801     test $ac_count -gt 10 && break
11802   done
11803   rm -f conftest.in conftest.tmp conftest.nl conftest.out;;
11804 esac
11805 
11806       $ac_path_EGREP_found && break 3
11807     done
11808   done
11809   done
11810 IFS=$as_save_IFS
11811   if test -z "$ac_cv_path_EGREP"; then
11812     as_fn_error $? "no acceptable egrep could be found in $PATH$PATH_SEPARATOR/usr/xpg4/bin" "$LINENO" 5
11813   fi
11814 else
11815   ac_cv_path_EGREP=$EGREP
11816 fi
11817 
11818    fi
11819 fi
11820 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_path_EGREP" >&5
11821 $as_echo "$ac_cv_path_EGREP" >&6; }
11822  EGREP="$ac_cv_path_EGREP"
11823 
11824 
11825   else
11826     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
11827 
11828     # Try to remove the string !EGREP! from our list.
11829     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!EGREP!/}
11830     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
11831       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
11832       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
11833       if test "xEGREP" != xBASH; then
11834         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of EGREP from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
11835 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of EGREP from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
11836       fi
11837       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
11838       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for egrep" >&5
11839 $as_echo_n "checking for egrep... " >&6; }
11840 if ${ac_cv_path_EGREP+:} false; then :
11841   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
11842 else
11843   if echo a | $GREP -E '(a|b)' >/dev/null 2>&1
11844    then ac_cv_path_EGREP="$GREP -E"
11845    else
11846      if test -z "$EGREP"; then
11847   ac_path_EGREP_found=false
11848   # Loop through the user's path and test for each of PROGNAME-LIST
11849   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
11850 for as_dir in $PATH$PATH_SEPARATOR/usr/xpg4/bin
11851 do
11852   IFS=$as_save_IFS
11853   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
11854     for ac_prog in egrep; do
11855     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
11856       ac_path_EGREP="$as_dir/$ac_prog$ac_exec_ext"
11857       as_fn_executable_p "$ac_path_EGREP" || continue
11858 # Check for GNU ac_path_EGREP and select it if it is found.
11859   # Check for GNU $ac_path_EGREP
11860 case `"$ac_path_EGREP" --version 2>&1` in
11861 *GNU*)
11862   ac_cv_path_EGREP="$ac_path_EGREP" ac_path_EGREP_found=:;;
11863 *)
11864   ac_count=0
11865   $as_echo_n 0123456789 >"conftest.in"
11866   while :
11867   do
11868     cat "conftest.in" "conftest.in" >"conftest.tmp"
11869     mv "conftest.tmp" "conftest.in"
11870     cp "conftest.in" "conftest.nl"
11871     $as_echo 'EGREP' >> "conftest.nl"
11872     "$ac_path_EGREP" 'EGREP$' < "conftest.nl" >"conftest.out" 2>/dev/null || break
11873     diff "conftest.out" "conftest.nl" >/dev/null 2>&1 || break
11874     as_fn_arith $ac_count + 1 && ac_count=$as_val
11875     if test $ac_count -gt ${ac_path_EGREP_max-0}; then
11876       # Best one so far, save it but keep looking for a better one
11877       ac_cv_path_EGREP="$ac_path_EGREP"
11878       ac_path_EGREP_max=$ac_count
11879     fi
11880     # 10*(2^10) chars as input seems more than enough
11881     test $ac_count -gt 10 && break
11882   done
11883   rm -f conftest.in conftest.tmp conftest.nl conftest.out;;
11884 esac
11885 
11886       $ac_path_EGREP_found && break 3
11887     done
11888   done
11889   done
11890 IFS=$as_save_IFS
11891   if test -z "$ac_cv_path_EGREP"; then
11892     as_fn_error $? "no acceptable egrep could be found in $PATH$PATH_SEPARATOR/usr/xpg4/bin" "$LINENO" 5
11893   fi
11894 else
11895   ac_cv_path_EGREP=$EGREP
11896 fi
11897 
11898    fi
11899 fi
11900 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_path_EGREP" >&5
11901 $as_echo "$ac_cv_path_EGREP" >&6; }
11902  EGREP="$ac_cv_path_EGREP"
11903 
11904 
11905     else
11906       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
11907       # for the tool.
11908 
11909       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
11910       # for unknown variables in the end.
11911       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
11912 
11913       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
11914       tool_specified="$EGREP"
11915       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
11916       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
11917         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
11918         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool EGREP=$tool_basename" >&5
11919 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool EGREP=$tool_basename" >&6;}
11920         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
11921 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
11922 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
11923 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
11924 if ${ac_cv_path_EGREP+:} false; then :
11925   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
11926 else
11927   case $EGREP in
11928   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
11929   ac_cv_path_EGREP="$EGREP" # Let the user override the test with a path.
11930   ;;
11931   *)
11932   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
11933 for as_dir in $PATH
11934 do
11935   IFS=$as_save_IFS
11936   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
11937     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
11938   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
11939     ac_cv_path_EGREP="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
11940     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
11941     break 2
11942   fi
11943 done
11944   done
11945 IFS=$as_save_IFS
11946 
11947   ;;
11948 esac
11949 fi
11950 EGREP=$ac_cv_path_EGREP
11951 if test -n "$EGREP"; then
11952   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $EGREP" >&5
11953 $as_echo "$EGREP" >&6; }
11954 else
11955   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
11956 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
11957 fi
11958 
11959 
11960         if test "x$EGREP" = x; then
11961           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
11962         fi
11963       else
11964         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
11965         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool EGREP=$tool_specified" >&5
11966 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool EGREP=$tool_specified" >&6;}
11967         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for EGREP" >&5
11968 $as_echo_n "checking for EGREP... " >&6; }
11969         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
11970           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
11971 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
11972           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool EGREP=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
11973         fi
11974         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
11975 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
11976       fi
11977     fi
11978   fi
11979 
11980 
11981   if test "x$EGREP" = x; then
11982     as_fn_error $? "Could not find required tool for EGREP" "$LINENO" 5
11983   fi
11984 
11985 
11986 
11987 
11988   # Publish this variable in the help.
11989 
11990 
11991   if test "x$FGREP" = x; then
11992     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
11993     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for fgrep" >&5
11994 $as_echo_n "checking for fgrep... " >&6; }
11995 if ${ac_cv_path_FGREP+:} false; then :
11996   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
11997 else
11998   if echo 'ab*c' | $GREP -F 'ab*c' >/dev/null 2>&1
11999    then ac_cv_path_FGREP="$GREP -F"
12000    else
12001      if test -z "$FGREP"; then
12002   ac_path_FGREP_found=false
12003   # Loop through the user's path and test for each of PROGNAME-LIST
12004   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
12005 for as_dir in $PATH$PATH_SEPARATOR/usr/xpg4/bin
12006 do
12007   IFS=$as_save_IFS
12008   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
12009     for ac_prog in fgrep; do
12010     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
12011       ac_path_FGREP="$as_dir/$ac_prog$ac_exec_ext"
12012       as_fn_executable_p "$ac_path_FGREP" || continue
12013 # Check for GNU ac_path_FGREP and select it if it is found.
12014   # Check for GNU $ac_path_FGREP
12015 case `"$ac_path_FGREP" --version 2>&1` in
12016 *GNU*)

12018 *)

12029     as_fn_arith $ac_count + 1 && ac_count=$as_val
12030     if test $ac_count -gt ${ac_path_FGREP_max-0}; then
12031       # Best one so far, save it but keep looking for a better one
12032       ac_cv_path_FGREP="$ac_path_FGREP"
12033       ac_path_FGREP_max=$ac_count
12034     fi
12035     # 10*(2^10) chars as input seems more than enough

12037   done

12039 esac
12040 
12041       $ac_path_FGREP_found && break 3
12042     done
12043   done
12044   done

12047     as_fn_error $? "no acceptable fgrep could be found in $PATH$PATH_SEPARATOR/usr/xpg4/bin" "$LINENO" 5
12048   fi
12049 else
12050   ac_cv_path_FGREP=$FGREP
12051 fi
12052 
12053    fi
12054 fi

12056 $as_echo "$ac_cv_path_FGREP" >&6; }
12057  FGREP="$ac_cv_path_FGREP"
12058 
12059 
12060   else
12061     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
12062 
12063     # Try to remove the string !FGREP! from our list.
12064     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!FGREP!/}
12065     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
12066       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
12067       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
12068       if test "xFGREP" != xBASH; then
12069         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of FGREP from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
12070 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of FGREP from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
12071       fi
12072       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
12073       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for fgrep" >&5
12074 $as_echo_n "checking for fgrep... " >&6; }
12075 if ${ac_cv_path_FGREP+:} false; then :
12076   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6

12080    else

12088   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
12089     for ac_prog in fgrep; do

12091       ac_path_FGREP="$as_dir/$ac_prog$ac_exec_ext"
12092       as_fn_executable_p "$ac_path_FGREP" || continue

12094   # Check for GNU $ac_path_FGREP
12095 case `"$ac_path_FGREP" --version 2>&1` in
12096 *GNU*)
12097   ac_cv_path_FGREP="$ac_path_FGREP" ac_path_FGREP_found=:;;
12098 *)

12100   $as_echo_n 0123456789 >"conftest.in"
12101   while :
12102   do
12103     cat "conftest.in" "conftest.in" >"conftest.tmp"

12105     cp "conftest.in" "conftest.nl"
12106     $as_echo 'FGREP' >> "conftest.nl"
12107     "$ac_path_FGREP" FGREP < "conftest.nl" >"conftest.out" 2>/dev/null || break
12108     diff "conftest.out" "conftest.nl" >/dev/null 2>&1 || break
12109     as_fn_arith $ac_count + 1 && ac_count=$as_val
12110     if test $ac_count -gt ${ac_path_FGREP_max-0}; then
12111       # Best one so far, save it but keep looking for a better one
12112       ac_cv_path_FGREP="$ac_path_FGREP"
12113       ac_path_FGREP_max=$ac_count
12114     fi
12115     # 10*(2^10) chars as input seems more than enough
12116     test $ac_count -gt 10 && break
12117   done
12118   rm -f conftest.in conftest.tmp conftest.nl conftest.out;;
12119 esac
12120 
12121       $ac_path_FGREP_found && break 3
12122     done
12123   done
12124   done
12125 IFS=$as_save_IFS
12126   if test -z "$ac_cv_path_FGREP"; then
12127     as_fn_error $? "no acceptable fgrep could be found in $PATH$PATH_SEPARATOR/usr/xpg4/bin" "$LINENO" 5
12128   fi
12129 else
12130   ac_cv_path_FGREP=$FGREP
12131 fi
12132 
12133    fi
12134 fi
12135 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_path_FGREP" >&5
12136 $as_echo "$ac_cv_path_FGREP" >&6; }
12137  FGREP="$ac_cv_path_FGREP"
12138 
12139 
12140     else
12141       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
12142       # for the tool.
12143 
12144       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
12145       # for unknown variables in the end.
12146       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
12147 
12148       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
12149       tool_specified="$FGREP"
12150       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
12151       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
12152         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
12153         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool FGREP=$tool_basename" >&5
12154 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool FGREP=$tool_basename" >&6;}
12155         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
12156 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
12157 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
12158 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
12159 if ${ac_cv_path_FGREP+:} false; then :
12160   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
12161 else
12162   case $FGREP in
12163   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
12164   ac_cv_path_FGREP="$FGREP" # Let the user override the test with a path.
12165   ;;
12166   *)
12167   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
12168 for as_dir in $PATH
12169 do
12170   IFS=$as_save_IFS
12171   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
12172     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
12173   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
12174     ac_cv_path_FGREP="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
12175     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
12176     break 2
12177   fi
12178 done
12179   done
12180 IFS=$as_save_IFS
12181 
12182   ;;
12183 esac
12184 fi
12185 FGREP=$ac_cv_path_FGREP
12186 if test -n "$FGREP"; then
12187   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $FGREP" >&5
12188 $as_echo "$FGREP" >&6; }
12189 else
12190   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
12191 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
12192 fi
12193 
12194 
12195         if test "x$FGREP" = x; then
12196           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
12197         fi
12198       else
12199         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
12200         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool FGREP=$tool_specified" >&5
12201 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool FGREP=$tool_specified" >&6;}
12202         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for FGREP" >&5
12203 $as_echo_n "checking for FGREP... " >&6; }
12204         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
12205           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
12206 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
12207           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool FGREP=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
12208         fi
12209         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
12210 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
12211       fi
12212     fi
12213   fi
12214 
12215 
12216   if test "x$FGREP" = x; then
12217     as_fn_error $? "Could not find required tool for FGREP" "$LINENO" 5
12218   fi
12219 
12220 
12221 
12222 
12223   # Publish this variable in the help.
12224 
12225 
12226   if test "x$SED" = x; then
12227     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
12228     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for a sed that does not truncate output" >&5
12229 $as_echo_n "checking for a sed that does not truncate output... " >&6; }
12230 if ${ac_cv_path_SED+:} false; then :
12231   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
12232 else
12233             ac_script=s/aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa/bbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbb/
12234      for ac_i in 1 2 3 4 5 6 7; do
12235        ac_script="$ac_script$as_nl$ac_script"
12236      done
12237      echo "$ac_script" 2>/dev/null | sed 99q >conftest.sed
12238      { ac_script=; unset ac_script;}
12239      if test -z "$SED"; then
12240   ac_path_SED_found=false
12241   # Loop through the user's path and test for each of PROGNAME-LIST
12242   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
12243 for as_dir in $PATH
12244 do
12245   IFS=$as_save_IFS
12246   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
12247     for ac_prog in sed gsed; do
12248     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
12249       ac_path_SED="$as_dir/$ac_prog$ac_exec_ext"
12250       as_fn_executable_p "$ac_path_SED" || continue
12251 # Check for GNU ac_path_SED and select it if it is found.
12252   # Check for GNU $ac_path_SED
12253 case `"$ac_path_SED" --version 2>&1` in
12254 *GNU*)
12255   ac_cv_path_SED="$ac_path_SED" ac_path_SED_found=:;;
12256 *)
12257   ac_count=0
12258   $as_echo_n 0123456789 >"conftest.in"
12259   while :
12260   do
12261     cat "conftest.in" "conftest.in" >"conftest.tmp"
12262     mv "conftest.tmp" "conftest.in"
12263     cp "conftest.in" "conftest.nl"
12264     $as_echo '' >> "conftest.nl"
12265     "$ac_path_SED" -f conftest.sed < "conftest.nl" >"conftest.out" 2>/dev/null || break
12266     diff "conftest.out" "conftest.nl" >/dev/null 2>&1 || break
12267     as_fn_arith $ac_count + 1 && ac_count=$as_val
12268     if test $ac_count -gt ${ac_path_SED_max-0}; then
12269       # Best one so far, save it but keep looking for a better one
12270       ac_cv_path_SED="$ac_path_SED"
12271       ac_path_SED_max=$ac_count
12272     fi
12273     # 10*(2^10) chars as input seems more than enough
12274     test $ac_count -gt 10 && break
12275   done
12276   rm -f conftest.in conftest.tmp conftest.nl conftest.out;;
12277 esac
12278 
12279       $ac_path_SED_found && break 3
12280     done
12281   done
12282   done
12283 IFS=$as_save_IFS
12284   if test -z "$ac_cv_path_SED"; then
12285     as_fn_error $? "no acceptable sed could be found in \$PATH" "$LINENO" 5
12286   fi
12287 else
12288   ac_cv_path_SED=$SED
12289 fi
12290 
12291 fi
12292 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_path_SED" >&5
12293 $as_echo "$ac_cv_path_SED" >&6; }
12294  SED="$ac_cv_path_SED"
12295   rm -f conftest.sed
12296 
12297   else
12298     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
12299 
12300     # Try to remove the string !SED! from our list.
12301     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!SED!/}
12302     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
12303       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
12304       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
12305       if test "xSED" != xBASH; then
12306         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of SED from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
12307 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of SED from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
12308       fi
12309       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
12310       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for a sed that does not truncate output" >&5
12311 $as_echo_n "checking for a sed that does not truncate output... " >&6; }
12312 if ${ac_cv_path_SED+:} false; then :
12313   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
12314 else
12315             ac_script=s/aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa/bbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbb/
12316      for ac_i in 1 2 3 4 5 6 7; do
12317        ac_script="$ac_script$as_nl$ac_script"
12318      done
12319      echo "$ac_script" 2>/dev/null | sed 99q >conftest.sed
12320      { ac_script=; unset ac_script;}
12321      if test -z "$SED"; then
12322   ac_path_SED_found=false
12323   # Loop through the user's path and test for each of PROGNAME-LIST
12324   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
12325 for as_dir in $PATH
12326 do
12327   IFS=$as_save_IFS
12328   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
12329     for ac_prog in sed gsed; do
12330     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
12331       ac_path_SED="$as_dir/$ac_prog$ac_exec_ext"
12332       as_fn_executable_p "$ac_path_SED" || continue
12333 # Check for GNU ac_path_SED and select it if it is found.
12334   # Check for GNU $ac_path_SED
12335 case `"$ac_path_SED" --version 2>&1` in
12336 *GNU*)
12337   ac_cv_path_SED="$ac_path_SED" ac_path_SED_found=:;;
12338 *)
12339   ac_count=0
12340   $as_echo_n 0123456789 >"conftest.in"
12341   while :
12342   do
12343     cat "conftest.in" "conftest.in" >"conftest.tmp"
12344     mv "conftest.tmp" "conftest.in"
12345     cp "conftest.in" "conftest.nl"
12346     $as_echo '' >> "conftest.nl"
12347     "$ac_path_SED" -f conftest.sed < "conftest.nl" >"conftest.out" 2>/dev/null || break
12348     diff "conftest.out" "conftest.nl" >/dev/null 2>&1 || break
12349     as_fn_arith $ac_count + 1 && ac_count=$as_val
12350     if test $ac_count -gt ${ac_path_SED_max-0}; then
12351       # Best one so far, save it but keep looking for a better one
12352       ac_cv_path_SED="$ac_path_SED"
12353       ac_path_SED_max=$ac_count
12354     fi
12355     # 10*(2^10) chars as input seems more than enough
12356     test $ac_count -gt 10 && break
12357   done
12358   rm -f conftest.in conftest.tmp conftest.nl conftest.out;;
12359 esac
12360 
12361       $ac_path_SED_found && break 3
12362     done
12363   done
12364   done
12365 IFS=$as_save_IFS
12366   if test -z "$ac_cv_path_SED"; then
12367     as_fn_error $? "no acceptable sed could be found in \$PATH" "$LINENO" 5
12368   fi
12369 else
12370   ac_cv_path_SED=$SED
12371 fi
12372 
12373 fi
12374 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_path_SED" >&5
12375 $as_echo "$ac_cv_path_SED" >&6; }
12376  SED="$ac_cv_path_SED"
12377   rm -f conftest.sed
12378 
12379     else
12380       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
12381       # for the tool.
12382 
12383       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
12384       # for unknown variables in the end.
12385       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
12386 
12387       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
12388       tool_specified="$SED"
12389       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
12390       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
12391         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
12392         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool SED=$tool_basename" >&5
12393 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool SED=$tool_basename" >&6;}
12394         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
12395 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
12396 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
12397 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
12398 if ${ac_cv_path_SED+:} false; then :
12399   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
12400 else
12401   case $SED in
12402   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
12403   ac_cv_path_SED="$SED" # Let the user override the test with a path.
12404   ;;
12405   *)
12406   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
12407 for as_dir in $PATH
12408 do
12409   IFS=$as_save_IFS
12410   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
12411     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
12412   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
12413     ac_cv_path_SED="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
12414     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
12415     break 2
12416   fi
12417 done
12418   done
12419 IFS=$as_save_IFS
12420 
12421   ;;
12422 esac
12423 fi
12424 SED=$ac_cv_path_SED
12425 if test -n "$SED"; then
12426   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $SED" >&5
12427 $as_echo "$SED" >&6; }
12428 else
12429   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
12430 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
12431 fi
12432 
12433 
12434         if test "x$SED" = x; then
12435           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
12436         fi
12437       else
12438         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
12439         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool SED=$tool_specified" >&5
12440 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool SED=$tool_specified" >&6;}
12441         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for SED" >&5
12442 $as_echo_n "checking for SED... " >&6; }
12443         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
12444           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
12445 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
12446           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool SED=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
12447         fi
12448         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
12449 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
12450       fi
12451     fi
12452   fi
12453 
12454 
12455   if test "x$SED" = x; then
12456     as_fn_error $? "Could not find required tool for SED" "$LINENO" 5
12457   fi
12458 
12459 
12460 
12461   # Always force rm.
12462   RM="$RM -f"
12463 
12464   # pwd behaves differently on various platforms and some don't support the -L flag.
12465   # Always use the bash builtin pwd to get uniform behavior.
12466   THEPWDCMD=pwd
12467 
12468   # These are not required on all platforms
12469 
12470 
12471   # Publish this variable in the help.
12472 
12473 
12474   if test "x$CYGPATH" = x; then
12475     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
12476     for ac_prog in cygpath
12477 do
12478   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
12479 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
12480 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
12481 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
12482 if ${ac_cv_path_CYGPATH+:} false; then :
12483   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
12484 else
12485   case $CYGPATH in
12486   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
12487   ac_cv_path_CYGPATH="$CYGPATH" # Let the user override the test with a path.
12488   ;;
12489   *)
12490   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
12491 for as_dir in $PATH
12492 do
12493   IFS=$as_save_IFS
12494   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
12495     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
12496   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
12497     ac_cv_path_CYGPATH="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
12498     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
12499     break 2
12500   fi
12501 done
12502   done
12503 IFS=$as_save_IFS
12504 
12505   ;;
12506 esac
12507 fi
12508 CYGPATH=$ac_cv_path_CYGPATH
12509 if test -n "$CYGPATH"; then
12510   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $CYGPATH" >&5
12511 $as_echo "$CYGPATH" >&6; }
12512 else
12513   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
12514 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
12515 fi
12516 
12517 
12518   test -n "$CYGPATH" && break
12519 done
12520 
12521   else
12522     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
12523 
12524     # Try to remove the string !CYGPATH! from our list.
12525     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!CYGPATH!/}
12526     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
12527       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
12528       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
12529       if test "xCYGPATH" != xBASH; then
12530         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of CYGPATH from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
12531 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of CYGPATH from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
12532       fi
12533       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
12534       for ac_prog in cygpath
12535 do
12536   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
12537 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
12538 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
12539 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
12540 if ${ac_cv_path_CYGPATH+:} false; then :
12541   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
12542 else
12543   case $CYGPATH in
12544   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
12545   ac_cv_path_CYGPATH="$CYGPATH" # Let the user override the test with a path.
12546   ;;
12547   *)
12548   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
12549 for as_dir in $PATH
12550 do
12551   IFS=$as_save_IFS
12552   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
12553     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
12554   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
12555     ac_cv_path_CYGPATH="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
12556     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
12557     break 2
12558   fi
12559 done
12560   done
12561 IFS=$as_save_IFS
12562 
12563   ;;
12564 esac
12565 fi
12566 CYGPATH=$ac_cv_path_CYGPATH
12567 if test -n "$CYGPATH"; then
12568   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $CYGPATH" >&5
12569 $as_echo "$CYGPATH" >&6; }
12570 else
12571   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
12572 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
12573 fi
12574 
12575 
12576   test -n "$CYGPATH" && break
12577 done
12578 
12579     else
12580       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
12581       # for the tool.
12582 
12583       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
12584       # for unknown variables in the end.
12585       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
12586 
12587       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
12588       tool_specified="$CYGPATH"
12589       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
12590       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
12591         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
12592         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool CYGPATH=$tool_basename" >&5
12593 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool CYGPATH=$tool_basename" >&6;}
12594         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
12595 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
12596 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
12597 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
12598 if ${ac_cv_path_CYGPATH+:} false; then :
12599   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
12600 else
12601   case $CYGPATH in
12602   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
12603   ac_cv_path_CYGPATH="$CYGPATH" # Let the user override the test with a path.
12604   ;;
12605   *)
12606   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
12607 for as_dir in $PATH
12608 do
12609   IFS=$as_save_IFS
12610   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
12611     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
12612   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
12613     ac_cv_path_CYGPATH="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
12614     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
12615     break 2
12616   fi
12617 done
12618   done
12619 IFS=$as_save_IFS
12620 
12621   ;;
12622 esac
12623 fi
12624 CYGPATH=$ac_cv_path_CYGPATH
12625 if test -n "$CYGPATH"; then
12626   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $CYGPATH" >&5
12627 $as_echo "$CYGPATH" >&6; }
12628 else
12629   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
12630 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
12631 fi
12632 
12633 
12634         if test "x$CYGPATH" = x; then
12635           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
12636         fi
12637       else
12638         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
12639         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool CYGPATH=$tool_specified" >&5
12640 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool CYGPATH=$tool_specified" >&6;}
12641         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for CYGPATH" >&5
12642 $as_echo_n "checking for CYGPATH... " >&6; }
12643         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
12644           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
12645 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
12646           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool CYGPATH=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
12647         fi
12648         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
12649 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
12650       fi
12651     fi
12652   fi
12653 
12654 
12655 
12656 
12657   # Publish this variable in the help.
12658 
12659 
12660   if test "x$READLINK" = x; then
12661     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
12662     for ac_prog in greadlink readlink
12663 do
12664   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
12665 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
12666 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
12667 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
12668 if ${ac_cv_path_READLINK+:} false; then :
12669   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
12670 else
12671   case $READLINK in
12672   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
12673   ac_cv_path_READLINK="$READLINK" # Let the user override the test with a path.
12674   ;;
12675   *)
12676   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
12677 for as_dir in $PATH
12678 do
12679   IFS=$as_save_IFS
12680   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
12681     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
12682   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
12683     ac_cv_path_READLINK="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
12684     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
12685     break 2
12686   fi
12687 done
12688   done
12689 IFS=$as_save_IFS
12690 
12691   ;;
12692 esac
12693 fi
12694 READLINK=$ac_cv_path_READLINK
12695 if test -n "$READLINK"; then
12696   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $READLINK" >&5
12697 $as_echo "$READLINK" >&6; }
12698 else
12699   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
12700 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
12701 fi
12702 
12703 
12704   test -n "$READLINK" && break
12705 done
12706 
12707   else
12708     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
12709 
12710     # Try to remove the string !READLINK! from our list.
12711     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!READLINK!/}
12712     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
12713       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
12714       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
12715       if test "xREADLINK" != xBASH; then
12716         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of READLINK from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
12717 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of READLINK from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
12718       fi
12719       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
12720       for ac_prog in greadlink readlink
12721 do
12722   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
12723 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
12724 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
12725 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
12726 if ${ac_cv_path_READLINK+:} false; then :
12727   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
12728 else
12729   case $READLINK in
12730   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
12731   ac_cv_path_READLINK="$READLINK" # Let the user override the test with a path.
12732   ;;
12733   *)
12734   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
12735 for as_dir in $PATH
12736 do
12737   IFS=$as_save_IFS
12738   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
12739     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
12740   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
12741     ac_cv_path_READLINK="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
12742     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
12743     break 2
12744   fi
12745 done
12746   done
12747 IFS=$as_save_IFS
12748 
12749   ;;
12750 esac
12751 fi
12752 READLINK=$ac_cv_path_READLINK
12753 if test -n "$READLINK"; then
12754   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $READLINK" >&5
12755 $as_echo "$READLINK" >&6; }
12756 else
12757   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
12758 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
12759 fi
12760 
12761 
12762   test -n "$READLINK" && break
12763 done
12764 
12765     else
12766       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
12767       # for the tool.
12768 
12769       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
12770       # for unknown variables in the end.
12771       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
12772 
12773       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
12774       tool_specified="$READLINK"
12775       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
12776       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
12777         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
12778         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool READLINK=$tool_basename" >&5
12779 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool READLINK=$tool_basename" >&6;}
12780         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
12781 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
12782 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
12783 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
12784 if ${ac_cv_path_READLINK+:} false; then :
12785   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
12786 else
12787   case $READLINK in
12788   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
12789   ac_cv_path_READLINK="$READLINK" # Let the user override the test with a path.
12790   ;;
12791   *)
12792   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
12793 for as_dir in $PATH
12794 do
12795   IFS=$as_save_IFS
12796   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
12797     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
12798   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
12799     ac_cv_path_READLINK="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
12800     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
12801     break 2
12802   fi
12803 done
12804   done
12805 IFS=$as_save_IFS
12806 
12807   ;;
12808 esac
12809 fi
12810 READLINK=$ac_cv_path_READLINK
12811 if test -n "$READLINK"; then
12812   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $READLINK" >&5
12813 $as_echo "$READLINK" >&6; }
12814 else
12815   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
12816 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
12817 fi
12818 
12819 
12820         if test "x$READLINK" = x; then
12821           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
12822         fi
12823       else
12824         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
12825         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool READLINK=$tool_specified" >&5
12826 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool READLINK=$tool_specified" >&6;}
12827         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for READLINK" >&5
12828 $as_echo_n "checking for READLINK... " >&6; }
12829         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
12830           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
12831 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
12832           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool READLINK=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
12833         fi
12834         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
12835 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
12836       fi
12837     fi
12838   fi
12839 
12840 
12841 
12842 
12843   # Publish this variable in the help.
12844 
12845 
12846   if test "x$DF" = x; then
12847     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
12848     for ac_prog in df
12849 do
12850   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
12851 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
12852 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
12853 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
12854 if ${ac_cv_path_DF+:} false; then :
12855   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
12856 else
12857   case $DF in
12858   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
12859   ac_cv_path_DF="$DF" # Let the user override the test with a path.
12860   ;;
12861   *)

12863 for as_dir in $PATH
12864 do

12867     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
12868   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
12869     ac_cv_path_DF="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
12870     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
12871     break 2
12872   fi
12873 done
12874   done
12875 IFS=$as_save_IFS
12876 
12877   ;;
12878 esac
12879 fi
12880 DF=$ac_cv_path_DF
12881 if test -n "$DF"; then
12882   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $DF" >&5
12883 $as_echo "$DF" >&6; }
12884 else
12885   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
12886 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
12887 fi
12888 
12889 
12890   test -n "$DF" && break
12891 done
12892 
12893   else
12894     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
12895 
12896     # Try to remove the string !DF! from our list.
12897     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!DF!/}
12898     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
12899       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
12900       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
12901       if test "xDF" != xBASH; then
12902         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of DF from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
12903 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of DF from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
12904       fi
12905       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
12906       for ac_prog in df
12907 do
12908   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
12909 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
12910 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
12911 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
12912 if ${ac_cv_path_DF+:} false; then :
12913   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
12914 else
12915   case $DF in
12916   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
12917   ac_cv_path_DF="$DF" # Let the user override the test with a path.
12918   ;;
12919   *)

12929     break 2
12930   fi
12931 done
12932   done
12933 IFS=$as_save_IFS
12934 
12935   ;;
12936 esac
12937 fi

12942 else

12944 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
12945 fi
12946

12949 done
12950

12953       # for the tool.

12956       # for unknown variables in the end.
12957       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
12958

12960       tool_specified="$DF"
12961       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
12962       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
12963         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
12964         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool DF=$tool_basename" >&5
12965 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool DF=$tool_basename" >&6;}
12966         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
12967 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
12968 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
12969 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
12970 if ${ac_cv_path_DF+:} false; then :
12971   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
12972 else
12973   case $DF in
12974   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
12975   ac_cv_path_DF="$DF" # Let the user override the test with a path.
12976   ;;
12977   *)
12978   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
12979 for as_dir in $PATH

12986     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
12987     break 2
12988   fi
12989 done
12990   done
12991 IFS=$as_save_IFS
12992 
12993   ;;
12994 esac
12995 fi
12996 DF=$ac_cv_path_DF
12997 if test -n "$DF"; then
12998   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $DF" >&5
12999 $as_echo "$DF" >&6; }
13000 else
13001   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
13002 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
13003 fi

13007           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5

13021 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
13022       fi
13023     fi

13032   if test "x$SETFILE" = x; then
13033     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
13034     for ac_prog in SetFile
13035 do
13036   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
13037 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
13038 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
13039 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
13040 if ${ac_cv_path_SETFILE+:} false; then :
13041   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
13042 else
13043   case $SETFILE in
13044   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
13045   ac_cv_path_SETFILE="$SETFILE" # Let the user override the test with a path.
13046   ;;
13047   *)
13048   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
13049 for as_dir in $PATH
13050 do
13051   IFS=$as_save_IFS
13052   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
13053     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
13054   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
13055     ac_cv_path_SETFILE="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
13056     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
13057     break 2
13058   fi
13059 done
13060   done
13061 IFS=$as_save_IFS
13062 
13063   ;;
13064 esac
13065 fi

13118   done

13120 
13121   ;;
13122 esac
13123 fi

13128 else

13131 fi
13132

13135 done

13139       # for the tool.
13140 
13141       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
13142       # for unknown variables in the end.
13143       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
13144 
13145       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
13146       tool_specified="$SETFILE"
13147       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
13148       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
13149         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
13150         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool SETFILE=$tool_basename" >&5
13151 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool SETFILE=$tool_basename" >&6;}
13152         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
13153 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
13154 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
13155 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
13156 if ${ac_cv_path_SETFILE+:} false; then :
13157   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
13158 else
13159   case $SETFILE in
13160   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
13161   ac_cv_path_SETFILE="$SETFILE" # Let the user override the test with a path.
13162   ;;
13163   *)
13164   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
13165 for as_dir in $PATH
13166 do
13167   IFS=$as_save_IFS
13168   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
13169     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
13170   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
13171     ac_cv_path_SETFILE="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
13172     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
13173     break 2
13174   fi
13175 done
13176   done
13177 IFS=$as_save_IFS
13178 
13179   ;;
13180 esac
13181 fi
13182 SETFILE=$ac_cv_path_SETFILE
13183 if test -n "$SETFILE"; then
13184   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $SETFILE" >&5
13185 $as_echo "$SETFILE" >&6; }
13186 else
13187   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
13188 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
13189 fi
13190 
13191 
13192         if test "x$SETFILE" = x; then
13193           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
13194         fi
13195       else
13196         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
13197         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool SETFILE=$tool_specified" >&5
13198 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool SETFILE=$tool_specified" >&6;}
13199         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for SETFILE" >&5
13200 $as_echo_n "checking for SETFILE... " >&6; }
13201         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
13202           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
13203 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
13204           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool SETFILE=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
13205         fi
13206         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
13207 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
13208       fi
13209     fi
13210   fi
13211 
13212 
13213 
13214 
13215   # Publish this variable in the help.
13216 
13217 
13218   if test "x$CPIO" = x; then
13219     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
13220     for ac_prog in cpio bsdcpio
13221 do
13222   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
13223 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
13224 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
13225 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
13226 if ${ac_cv_path_CPIO+:} false; then :
13227   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
13228 else
13229   case $CPIO in
13230   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
13231   ac_cv_path_CPIO="$CPIO" # Let the user override the test with a path.
13232   ;;
13233   *)
13234   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
13235 for as_dir in $PATH
13236 do
13237   IFS=$as_save_IFS
13238   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
13239     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
13240   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
13241     ac_cv_path_CPIO="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
13242     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
13243     break 2
13244   fi
13245 done
13246   done
13247 IFS=$as_save_IFS
13248 
13249   ;;
13250 esac
13251 fi
13252 CPIO=$ac_cv_path_CPIO
13253 if test -n "$CPIO"; then
13254   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $CPIO" >&5
13255 $as_echo "$CPIO" >&6; }
13256 else
13257   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
13258 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
13259 fi
13260 
13261 
13262   test -n "$CPIO" && break
13263 done
13264 
13265   else
13266     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
13267 
13268     # Try to remove the string !CPIO! from our list.
13269     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!CPIO!/}
13270     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
13271       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
13272       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
13273       if test "xCPIO" != xBASH; then
13274         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of CPIO from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
13275 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of CPIO from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
13276       fi
13277       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
13278       for ac_prog in cpio bsdcpio
13279 do
13280   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
13281 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
13282 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
13283 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
13284 if ${ac_cv_path_CPIO+:} false; then :
13285   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
13286 else
13287   case $CPIO in
13288   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
13289   ac_cv_path_CPIO="$CPIO" # Let the user override the test with a path.
13290   ;;
13291   *)
13292   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
13293 for as_dir in $PATH
13294 do
13295   IFS=$as_save_IFS
13296   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
13297     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
13298   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
13299     ac_cv_path_CPIO="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
13300     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
13301     break 2
13302   fi
13303 done
13304   done
13305 IFS=$as_save_IFS
13306 
13307   ;;
13308 esac
13309 fi
13310 CPIO=$ac_cv_path_CPIO
13311 if test -n "$CPIO"; then
13312   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $CPIO" >&5
