13313 $as_echo "$CPIO" >&6; }
13314 else
13315   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
13316 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
13317 fi
13318 
13319 
13320   test -n "$CPIO" && break
13321 done
13322 
13323     else
13324       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
13325       # for the tool.
13326 
13327       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
13328       # for unknown variables in the end.
13329       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
13330 
13331       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
13332       tool_specified="$CPIO"
13333       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
13334       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
13335         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
13336         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool CPIO=$tool_basename" >&5
13337 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool CPIO=$tool_basename" >&6;}
13338         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
13339 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
13340 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
13341 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
13342 if ${ac_cv_path_CPIO+:} false; then :
13343   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
13344 else
13345   case $CPIO in
13346   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
13347   ac_cv_path_CPIO="$CPIO" # Let the user override the test with a path.
13348   ;;
13349   *)
13350   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
13351 for as_dir in $PATH
13352 do
13353   IFS=$as_save_IFS
13354   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
13355     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
13356   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
13357     ac_cv_path_CPIO="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
13358     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
13359     break 2
13360   fi
13361 done
13362   done
13363 IFS=$as_save_IFS
13364 
13365   ;;
13366 esac
13367 fi
13368 CPIO=$ac_cv_path_CPIO
13369 if test -n "$CPIO"; then
13370   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $CPIO" >&5
13371 $as_echo "$CPIO" >&6; }
13372 else
13373   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
13374 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
13375 fi
13376 
13377 
13378         if test "x$CPIO" = x; then
13379           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
13380         fi
13381       else
13382         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
13383         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool CPIO=$tool_specified" >&5
13384 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool CPIO=$tool_specified" >&6;}
13385         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for CPIO" >&5
13386 $as_echo_n "checking for CPIO... " >&6; }
13387         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
13388           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
13389 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
13390           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool CPIO=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
13391         fi
13392         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
13393 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
13394       fi
13395     fi
13396   fi
13397 
13398 
13399 
13400 
13401 # Now we can determine OpenJDK build and target platforms. This is required to
13402 # have early on.
13403 # Make sure we can run config.sub.
13404 $SHELL "$ac_aux_dir/config.sub" sun4 >/dev/null 2>&1 ||
13405   as_fn_error $? "cannot run $SHELL $ac_aux_dir/config.sub" "$LINENO" 5
13406 
13407 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking build system type" >&5
13408 $as_echo_n "checking build system type... " >&6; }
13409 if ${ac_cv_build+:} false; then :
13410   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
13411 else
13412   ac_build_alias=$build_alias
13413 test "x$ac_build_alias" = x &&
13414   ac_build_alias=`$SHELL "$ac_aux_dir/config.guess"`
13415 test "x$ac_build_alias" = x &&
13416   as_fn_error $? "cannot guess build type; you must specify one" "$LINENO" 5
13417 ac_cv_build=`$SHELL "$ac_aux_dir/config.sub" $ac_build_alias` ||
13418   as_fn_error $? "$SHELL $ac_aux_dir/config.sub $ac_build_alias failed" "$LINENO" 5
13419 
13420 fi
13421 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_build" >&5
13422 $as_echo "$ac_cv_build" >&6; }
13423 case $ac_cv_build in
13424 *-*-*) ;;
13425 *) as_fn_error $? "invalid value of canonical build" "$LINENO" 5;;
13426 esac
13427 build=$ac_cv_build
13428 ac_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS='-'
13429 set x $ac_cv_build
13430 shift
13431 build_cpu=$1
13432 build_vendor=$2
13433 shift; shift
13434 # Remember, the first character of IFS is used to create $*,
13435 # except with old shells:
13436 build_os=$*
13437 IFS=$ac_save_IFS
13438 case $build_os in *\ *) build_os=`echo "$build_os" | sed 's/ /-/g'`;; esac
13439 
13440 
13441 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking host system type" >&5
13442 $as_echo_n "checking host system type... " >&6; }
13443 if ${ac_cv_host+:} false; then :
13444   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
13445 else
13446   if test "x$host_alias" = x; then
13447   ac_cv_host=$ac_cv_build
13448 else
13449   ac_cv_host=`$SHELL "$ac_aux_dir/config.sub" $host_alias` ||
13450     as_fn_error $? "$SHELL $ac_aux_dir/config.sub $host_alias failed" "$LINENO" 5
13451 fi
13452 
13453 fi
13454 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_host" >&5
13455 $as_echo "$ac_cv_host" >&6; }
13456 case $ac_cv_host in
13457 *-*-*) ;;
13458 *) as_fn_error $? "invalid value of canonical host" "$LINENO" 5;;
13459 esac
13460 host=$ac_cv_host
13461 ac_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS='-'
13462 set x $ac_cv_host
13463 shift
13464 host_cpu=$1
13465 host_vendor=$2
13466 shift; shift
13467 # Remember, the first character of IFS is used to create $*,
13468 # except with old shells:
13469 host_os=$*
13470 IFS=$ac_save_IFS
13471 case $host_os in *\ *) host_os=`echo "$host_os" | sed 's/ /-/g'`;; esac
13472 
13473 
13474 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking target system type" >&5
13475 $as_echo_n "checking target system type... " >&6; }
13476 if ${ac_cv_target+:} false; then :
13477   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
13478 else
13479   if test "x$target_alias" = x; then
13480   ac_cv_target=$ac_cv_host
13481 else
13482   ac_cv_target=`$SHELL "$ac_aux_dir/config.sub" $target_alias` ||
13483     as_fn_error $? "$SHELL $ac_aux_dir/config.sub $target_alias failed" "$LINENO" 5
13484 fi
13485 
13486 fi
13487 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_target" >&5
13488 $as_echo "$ac_cv_target" >&6; }
13489 case $ac_cv_target in
13490 *-*-*) ;;
13491 *) as_fn_error $? "invalid value of canonical target" "$LINENO" 5;;
13492 esac
13493 target=$ac_cv_target
13494 ac_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS='-'
13495 set x $ac_cv_target
13496 shift
13497 target_cpu=$1
13498 target_vendor=$2
13499 shift; shift
13500 # Remember, the first character of IFS is used to create $*,
13501 # except with old shells:
13502 target_os=$*
13503 IFS=$ac_save_IFS
13504 case $target_os in *\ *) target_os=`echo "$target_os" | sed 's/ /-/g'`;; esac
13505 
13506 
13507 # The aliases save the names the user supplied, while $host etc.
13508 # will get canonicalized.
13509 test -n "$target_alias" &&
13510   test "$program_prefix$program_suffix$program_transform_name" = \
13511     NONENONEs,x,x, &&
13512   program_prefix=${target_alias}-
13513 
13514   # Figure out the build and target systems. # Note that in autoconf terminology, "build" is obvious, but "target"
13515   # is confusing; it assumes you are cross-compiling a cross-compiler (!)  and "target" is thus the target of the
13516   # product you're building. The target of this build is called "host". Since this is confusing to most people, we
13517   # have not adopted that system, but use "target" as the platform we are building for. In some places though we need
13518   # to use the configure naming style.
13519 
13520 
13521 
13522 
13523 
13524   # Copy the autoconf trip/quadruplet verbatim to OPENJDK_TARGET_AUTOCONF_NAME
13525   # (from the autoconf "host") and OPENJDK_BUILD_AUTOCONF_NAME
13526   # Note that we might later on rewrite e.g. OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU due to reduced build,
13527   # but this will not change the value of OPENJDK_TARGET_AUTOCONF_NAME.
13528   OPENJDK_TARGET_AUTOCONF_NAME="$host"
13529   OPENJDK_BUILD_AUTOCONF_NAME="$build"
13530 
13531 
13532 
13533   # Convert the autoconf OS/CPU value to our own data, into the VAR_OS/CPU variables.
13534 
13535   case "$build_os" in
13536     *linux*)
13537       VAR_OS=linux
13538       VAR_OS_TYPE=unix
13539       ;;
13540     *solaris*)
13541       VAR_OS=solaris
13542       VAR_OS_TYPE=unix
13543       ;;
13544     *darwin*)
13545       VAR_OS=macosx
13546       VAR_OS_TYPE=unix
13547       ;;
13548     *bsd*)
13549       VAR_OS=bsd
13550       VAR_OS_TYPE=unix
13551       ;;
13552     *cygwin*)
13553       VAR_OS=windows
13554       VAR_OS_ENV=windows.cygwin
13555       ;;
13556     *mingw*)
13557       VAR_OS=windows
13558       VAR_OS_ENV=windows.msys
13559       ;;
13560     *aix*)
13561       VAR_OS=aix
13562       VAR_OS_TYPE=unix
13563       ;;
13564     *)
13565       as_fn_error $? "unsupported operating system $build_os" "$LINENO" 5
13566       ;;
13567   esac
13568 
13569 
13570   # First argument is the cpu name from the trip/quad
13571   case "$build_cpu" in
13572     x86_64)
13573       VAR_CPU=x86_64
13574       VAR_CPU_ARCH=x86
13575       VAR_CPU_BITS=64
13576       VAR_CPU_ENDIAN=little
13577       ;;
13578     i?86)
13579       VAR_CPU=x86
13580       VAR_CPU_ARCH=x86
13581       VAR_CPU_BITS=32
13582       VAR_CPU_ENDIAN=little
13583       ;;
13584     arm*)
13585       VAR_CPU=arm
13586       VAR_CPU_ARCH=arm
13587       VAR_CPU_BITS=32
13588       VAR_CPU_ENDIAN=little
13589       ;;
13590     powerpc)
13591       VAR_CPU=ppc
13592       VAR_CPU_ARCH=ppc
13593       VAR_CPU_BITS=32
13594       VAR_CPU_ENDIAN=big
13595       ;;
13596     powerpc64)
13597       VAR_CPU=ppc64
13598       VAR_CPU_ARCH=ppc
13599       VAR_CPU_BITS=64
13600       VAR_CPU_ENDIAN=big
13601       ;;
13602     powerpc64le)
13603       VAR_CPU=ppc64
13604       VAR_CPU_ARCH=ppc
13605       VAR_CPU_BITS=64
13606       VAR_CPU_ENDIAN=little
13607       ;;
13608     s390)
13609       VAR_CPU=s390
13610       VAR_CPU_ARCH=s390
13611       VAR_CPU_BITS=32
13612       VAR_CPU_ENDIAN=big
13613       ;;
13614     s390x)
13615       VAR_CPU=s390x
13616       VAR_CPU_ARCH=s390
13617       VAR_CPU_BITS=64
13618       VAR_CPU_ENDIAN=big
13619       ;;
13620     sparc)
13621       VAR_CPU=sparc
13622       VAR_CPU_ARCH=sparc
13623       VAR_CPU_BITS=32
13624       VAR_CPU_ENDIAN=big
13625       ;;
13626     sparcv9|sparc64)
13627       VAR_CPU=sparcv9
13628       VAR_CPU_ARCH=sparc
13629       VAR_CPU_BITS=64
13630       VAR_CPU_ENDIAN=big
13631       ;;
13632     *)
13633       as_fn_error $? "unsupported cpu $build_cpu" "$LINENO" 5
13634       ;;
13635   esac
13636 
13637   # ..and setup our own variables. (Do this explicitely to facilitate searching)
13638   OPENJDK_BUILD_OS="$VAR_OS"
13639   if test "x$VAR_OS_TYPE" != x; then
13640     OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_TYPE="$VAR_OS_TYPE"
13641   else
13642     OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_TYPE="$VAR_OS"
13643   fi
13644   if test "x$VAR_OS_ENV" != x; then
13645     OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV="$VAR_OS_ENV"
13646   else
13647     OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV="$VAR_OS"
13648   fi
13649   OPENJDK_BUILD_CPU="$VAR_CPU"
13650   OPENJDK_BUILD_CPU_ARCH="$VAR_CPU_ARCH"
13651   OPENJDK_BUILD_CPU_BITS="$VAR_CPU_BITS"
13652   OPENJDK_BUILD_CPU_ENDIAN="$VAR_CPU_ENDIAN"
13653 
13654 
13655 
13656 
13657 
13658 
13659 
13660 
13661   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking openjdk-build os-cpu" >&5
13662 $as_echo_n "checking openjdk-build os-cpu... " >&6; }
13663   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $OPENJDK_BUILD_OS-$OPENJDK_BUILD_CPU" >&5
13664 $as_echo "$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS-$OPENJDK_BUILD_CPU" >&6; }
13665 
13666   # Convert the autoconf OS/CPU value to our own data, into the VAR_OS/CPU variables.
13667 
13668   case "$host_os" in
13669     *linux*)
13670       VAR_OS=linux
13671       VAR_OS_TYPE=unix
13672       ;;
13673     *solaris*)
13674       VAR_OS=solaris
13675       VAR_OS_TYPE=unix
13676       ;;
13677     *darwin*)
13678       VAR_OS=macosx
13679       VAR_OS_TYPE=unix
13680       ;;
13681     *bsd*)
13682       VAR_OS=bsd
13683       VAR_OS_TYPE=unix
13684       ;;
13685     *cygwin*)
13686       VAR_OS=windows
13687       VAR_OS_ENV=windows.cygwin
13688       ;;
13689     *mingw*)
13690       VAR_OS=windows
13691       VAR_OS_ENV=windows.msys
13692       ;;
13693     *aix*)
13694       VAR_OS=aix
13695       VAR_OS_TYPE=unix
13696       ;;
13697     *)
13698       as_fn_error $? "unsupported operating system $host_os" "$LINENO" 5
13699       ;;
13700   esac
13701 
13702 
13703   # First argument is the cpu name from the trip/quad
13704   case "$host_cpu" in
13705     x86_64)
13706       VAR_CPU=x86_64
13707       VAR_CPU_ARCH=x86
13708       VAR_CPU_BITS=64
13709       VAR_CPU_ENDIAN=little
13710       ;;
13711     i?86)
13712       VAR_CPU=x86
13713       VAR_CPU_ARCH=x86
13714       VAR_CPU_BITS=32
13715       VAR_CPU_ENDIAN=little
13716       ;;
13717     arm*)
13718       VAR_CPU=arm
13719       VAR_CPU_ARCH=arm
13720       VAR_CPU_BITS=32
13721       VAR_CPU_ENDIAN=little
13722       ;;
13723     powerpc)
13724       VAR_CPU=ppc
13725       VAR_CPU_ARCH=ppc
13726       VAR_CPU_BITS=32
13727       VAR_CPU_ENDIAN=big
13728       ;;
13729     powerpc64)
13730       VAR_CPU=ppc64
13731       VAR_CPU_ARCH=ppc
13732       VAR_CPU_BITS=64
13733       VAR_CPU_ENDIAN=big
13734       ;;
13735     powerpc64le)
13736       VAR_CPU=ppc64
13737       VAR_CPU_ARCH=ppc
13738       VAR_CPU_BITS=64
13739       VAR_CPU_ENDIAN=little
13740       ;;
13741     s390)
13742       VAR_CPU=s390
13743       VAR_CPU_ARCH=s390
13744       VAR_CPU_BITS=32
13745       VAR_CPU_ENDIAN=big
13746       ;;
13747     s390x)
13748       VAR_CPU=s390x
13749       VAR_CPU_ARCH=s390
13750       VAR_CPU_BITS=64
13751       VAR_CPU_ENDIAN=big
13752       ;;
13753     sparc)
13754       VAR_CPU=sparc
13755       VAR_CPU_ARCH=sparc
13756       VAR_CPU_BITS=32
13757       VAR_CPU_ENDIAN=big
13758       ;;
13759     sparcv9|sparc64)
13760       VAR_CPU=sparcv9
13761       VAR_CPU_ARCH=sparc
13762       VAR_CPU_BITS=64
13763       VAR_CPU_ENDIAN=big
13764       ;;
13765     *)
13766       as_fn_error $? "unsupported cpu $host_cpu" "$LINENO" 5
13767       ;;
13768   esac
13769 
13770   # ... and setup our own variables. (Do this explicitely to facilitate searching)
13771   OPENJDK_TARGET_OS="$VAR_OS"
13772   if test "x$VAR_OS_TYPE" != x; then
13773     OPENJDK_TARGET_OS_TYPE="$VAR_OS_TYPE"
13774   else
13775     OPENJDK_TARGET_OS_TYPE="$VAR_OS"
13776   fi
13777   if test "x$VAR_OS_ENV" != x; then
13778     OPENJDK_TARGET_OS_ENV="$VAR_OS_ENV"
13779   else
13780     OPENJDK_TARGET_OS_ENV="$VAR_OS"
13781   fi
13782   OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU="$VAR_CPU"
13783   OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ARCH="$VAR_CPU_ARCH"
13784   OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS="$VAR_CPU_BITS"
13785   OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ENDIAN="$VAR_CPU_ENDIAN"
13786 
13787 
13788 
13789 
13790 
13791 
13792 
13793 
13794   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking openjdk-target os-cpu" >&5
13795 $as_echo_n "checking openjdk-target os-cpu... " >&6; }
13796   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $OPENJDK_TARGET_OS-$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU" >&5
13797 $as_echo "$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS-$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU" >&6; }
13798 
13799 
13800 
13801 # Check whether --with-target-bits was given.
13802 if test "${with_target_bits+set}" = set; then :
13803   withval=$with_target_bits;
13804 fi
13805 
13806 
13807   # We have three types of compiles:
13808   # native  == normal compilation, target system == build system
13809   # cross   == traditional cross compilation, target system != build system; special toolchain needed
13810   # reduced == using native compilers, but with special flags (e.g. -m32) to produce 32-bit builds on 64-bit machines
13811   #
13812   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_AUTOCONF_NAME" != "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_AUTOCONF_NAME"; then
13813     # We're doing a proper cross-compilation
13814     COMPILE_TYPE="cross"
13815   else
13816     COMPILE_TYPE="native"
13817   fi
13818 
13819   if test "x$with_target_bits" != x; then
13820     if test "x$COMPILE_TYPE" = "xcross"; then
13821       as_fn_error $? "It is not possible to combine --with-target-bits=X and proper cross-compilation. Choose either." "$LINENO" 5
13822     fi
13823 
13824     if test "x$with_target_bits" = x32 && test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = x64; then
13825       # A reduced build is requested
13826       COMPILE_TYPE="reduced"
13827       OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS=32
13828       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ARCH" = "xx86"; then
13829         OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU=x86
13830       elif test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ARCH" = "xsparc"; then
13831         OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU=sparc
13832       else
13833         as_fn_error $? "Reduced build (--with-target-bits=32) is only supported on x86_64 and sparcv9" "$LINENO" 5
13834       fi
13835     elif test "x$with_target_bits" = x64 && test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = x32; then
13836       as_fn_error $? "It is not possible to use --with-target-bits=64 on a 32 bit system. Use proper cross-compilation instead." "$LINENO" 5
13837     elif test "x$with_target_bits" = "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS"; then
13838       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: --with-target-bits are set to build platform address size; argument has no meaning" >&5
13839 $as_echo "$as_me: --with-target-bits are set to build platform address size; argument has no meaning" >&6;}
13840     else
13841       as_fn_error $? "--with-target-bits can only be 32 or 64, you specified $with_target_bits!" "$LINENO" 5
13842     fi
13843   fi
13844 
13845 
13846   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking compilation type" >&5
13847 $as_echo_n "checking compilation type... " >&6; }
13848   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $COMPILE_TYPE" >&5
13849 $as_echo "$COMPILE_TYPE" >&6; }
13850 
13851 
13852   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = "xsolaris"; then
13853     REQUIRED_OS_NAME=SunOS
13854     REQUIRED_OS_VERSION=5.10
13855   fi
13856   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = "xlinux"; then
13857     REQUIRED_OS_NAME=Linux
13858     REQUIRED_OS_VERSION=2.6
13859   fi
13860   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = "xwindows"; then
13861     REQUIRED_OS_NAME=Windows
13862     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = "x64"; then
13863       REQUIRED_OS_VERSION=5.2
13864     else
13865       REQUIRED_OS_VERSION=5.1
13866     fi
13867   fi
13868   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = "xmacosx"; then
13869     REQUIRED_OS_NAME=Darwin
13870     REQUIRED_OS_VERSION=11.2
13871   fi
13872 
13873 
13874 
13875 
13876 
13877   # Also store the legacy naming of the cpu.
13878   # Ie i586 and amd64 instead of x86 and x86_64
13879   OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_LEGACY="$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU"
13880   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU" = xx86; then
13881     OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_LEGACY="i586"
13882   elif test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" != xmacosx && test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU" = xx86_64; then
13883     # On all platforms except MacOSX replace x86_64 with amd64.
13884     OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_LEGACY="amd64"
13885   fi
13886 
13887 
13888   # And the second legacy naming of the cpu.
13889   # Ie i386 and amd64 instead of x86 and x86_64.
13890   OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_LEGACY_LIB="$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU"
13891   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU" = xx86; then
13892     OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_LEGACY_LIB="i386"
13893   elif test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU" = xx86_64; then
13894     OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_LEGACY_LIB="amd64"
13895   fi
13896 
13897 
13898   # This is the name of the cpu (but using i386 and amd64 instead of
13899   # x86 and x86_64, respectively), preceeded by a /, to be used when
13900   # locating libraries. On macosx, it's empty, though.
13901   OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_LIBDIR="/$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_LEGACY_LIB"
13902   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xmacosx; then
13903     OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_LIBDIR=""
13904   fi
13905 
13906 
13907   # OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ISADIR is normally empty. On 64-bit Solaris systems, it is set to
13908   # /amd64 or /sparcv9. This string is appended to some library paths, like this:
13909   # /usr/lib${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ISADIR}/libexample.so
13910   OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ISADIR=""
13911   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xsolaris; then
13912     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU" = xx86_64; then
13913       OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ISADIR="/amd64"
13914     elif test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU" = xsparcv9; then
13915       OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ISADIR="/sparcv9"
13916     fi
13917   fi
13918 
13919 
13920   # Setup OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_OSARCH, which is used to set the os.arch Java system property
13921   OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_OSARCH="$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU"
13922   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xlinux && test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU" = xx86; then
13923     # On linux only, we replace x86 with i386.
13924     OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_OSARCH="i386"
13925   elif test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" != xmacosx && test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU" = xx86_64; then
13926     # On all platforms except macosx, we replace x86_64 with amd64.
13927     OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_OSARCH="amd64"
13928   fi
13929 
13930 
13931   OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_JLI="$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU"
13932   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU" = xx86; then
13933     OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_JLI="i386"
13934   elif test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" != xmacosx && test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU" = xx86_64; then
13935     # On all platforms except macosx, we replace x86_64 with amd64.
13936     OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_JLI="amd64"
13937   fi
13938   # Now setup the -D flags for building libjli.
13939   OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_JLI_CFLAGS="-DLIBARCHNAME='\"$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_JLI\"'"
13940   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xsolaris; then
13941     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ARCH" = xsparc; then
13942       OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_JLI_CFLAGS="$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_JLI_CFLAGS -DLIBARCH32NAME='\"sparc\"' -DLIBARCH64NAME='\"sparcv9\"'"
13943     elif test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ARCH" = xx86; then
13944       OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_JLI_CFLAGS="$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_JLI_CFLAGS -DLIBARCH32NAME='\"i386\"' -DLIBARCH64NAME='\"amd64\"'"
13945     fi
13946   fi
13947 
13948 
13949   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xmacosx; then
13950       OPENJDK_TARGET_OS_EXPORT_DIR=macosx
13951   else
13952       OPENJDK_TARGET_OS_EXPORT_DIR=${OPENJDK_TARGET_OS_TYPE}
13953   fi
13954 
13955 
13956   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = x64; then
13957     A_LP64="LP64:="
13958     # -D_LP64=1 is only set on linux and mac. Setting on windows causes diff in
13959     # unpack200.exe
13960     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xlinux || test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xmacosx; then
13961       ADD_LP64="-D_LP64=1"
13962     fi
13963   fi
13964   LP64=$A_LP64
13965 
13966 
13967   if test "x$COMPILE_TYPE" = "xcross"; then
13968     # FIXME: ... or should this include reduced builds..?
13969     DEFINE_CROSS_COMPILE_ARCH="CROSS_COMPILE_ARCH:=$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_LEGACY"
13970   else
13971     DEFINE_CROSS_COMPILE_ARCH=""
13972   fi
13973 
13974 
13975   # ZERO_ARCHDEF is used to enable architecture-specific code
13976   case "${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU}" in
13977     ppc)     ZERO_ARCHDEF=PPC32 ;;
13978     ppc64)   ZERO_ARCHDEF=PPC64 ;;
13979     s390*)   ZERO_ARCHDEF=S390  ;;
13980     sparc*)  ZERO_ARCHDEF=SPARC ;;
13981     x86_64*) ZERO_ARCHDEF=AMD64 ;;
13982     x86)     ZERO_ARCHDEF=IA32  ;;
13983     *)      ZERO_ARCHDEF=$(echo "${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_LEGACY_LIB}" | tr a-z A-Z)
13984   esac
13985 
13986 
13987 
13988 
13989 # Continue setting up basic stuff. Most remaining code require fundamental tools.
13990 
13991   # Save the current directory this script was started from
13992   CURDIR="$PWD"
13993 
13994   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = "xwindows"; then
13995     PATH_SEP=";"
13996 
13997   SRC_ROOT_LENGTH=`$THEPWDCMD -L|$WC -m`
13998   if test $SRC_ROOT_LENGTH -gt 100; then
13999     as_fn_error $? "Your base path is too long. It is $SRC_ROOT_LENGTH characters long, but only 100 is supported" "$LINENO" 5
14000   fi
14001 
14002   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
14003     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking cygwin release" >&5
14004 $as_echo_n "checking cygwin release... " >&6; }
14005     CYGWIN_VERSION=`$UNAME -r`
14006     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $CYGWIN_VERSION" >&5
14007 $as_echo "$CYGWIN_VERSION" >&6; }
14008     WINDOWS_ENV_VENDOR='cygwin'
14009     WINDOWS_ENV_VERSION="$CYGWIN_VERSION"
14010 
14011     CYGWIN_VERSION_OK=`$ECHO $CYGWIN_VERSION | $GREP ^1.7.`
14012     if test "x$CYGWIN_VERSION_OK" = x; then
14013       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Your cygwin is too old. You are running $CYGWIN_VERSION, but at least cygwin 1.7 is required. Please upgrade." >&5
14014 $as_echo "$as_me: Your cygwin is too old. You are running $CYGWIN_VERSION, but at least cygwin 1.7 is required. Please upgrade." >&6;}
14015       as_fn_error $? "Cannot continue" "$LINENO" 5
14016     fi
14017     if test "x$CYGPATH" = x; then
14018       as_fn_error $? "Something is wrong with your cygwin installation since I cannot find cygpath.exe in your path" "$LINENO" 5
14019     fi
14020     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking cygwin root directory as unix-style path" >&5
14021 $as_echo_n "checking cygwin root directory as unix-style path... " >&6; }
14022     # The cmd output ends with Windows line endings (CR/LF), the grep command will strip that away
14023     cygwin_winpath_root=`cd / ; cmd /c cd | grep ".*"`
14024     # Force cygpath to report the proper root by including a trailing space, and then stripping it off again.
14025     CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH=`$CYGPATH -u "$cygwin_winpath_root " | $CUT -f 1 -d " "`
14026     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH" >&5
14027 $as_echo "$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH" >&6; }
14028     WINDOWS_ENV_ROOT_PATH="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH"
14029     test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
14030     if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
14031       as_fn_error $? "Your cygdrive prefix is not /cygdrive. This is currently not supported. Change with mount -c." "$LINENO" 5
14032     fi
14033   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
14034     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking msys release" >&5
14035 $as_echo_n "checking msys release... " >&6; }
14036     MSYS_VERSION=`$UNAME -r`
14037     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $MSYS_VERSION" >&5
14038 $as_echo "$MSYS_VERSION" >&6; }
14039 
14040     WINDOWS_ENV_VENDOR='msys'
14041     WINDOWS_ENV_VERSION="$MSYS_VERSION"
14042 
14043     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking msys root directory as unix-style path" >&5
14044 $as_echo_n "checking msys root directory as unix-style path... " >&6; }
14045     # The cmd output ends with Windows line endings (CR/LF), the grep command will strip that away
14046     MSYS_ROOT_PATH=`cd / ; cmd /c cd | grep ".*"`
14047 
14048   windows_path="$MSYS_ROOT_PATH"
14049   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
14050     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
14051     MSYS_ROOT_PATH="$unix_path"
14052   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
14053     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
14054     MSYS_ROOT_PATH="$unix_path"
14055   fi
14056 
14057     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $MSYS_ROOT_PATH" >&5
14058 $as_echo "$MSYS_ROOT_PATH" >&6; }
14059     WINDOWS_ENV_ROOT_PATH="$MSYS_ROOT_PATH"
14060   else
14061     as_fn_error $? "Unknown Windows environment. Neither cygwin nor msys was detected." "$LINENO" 5
14062   fi
14063 
14064   # Test if windows or unix (cygwin/msys) find is first in path.
14065   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking what kind of 'find' is first on the PATH" >&5
14066 $as_echo_n "checking what kind of 'find' is first on the PATH... " >&6; }
14067   FIND_BINARY_OUTPUT=`find --version 2>&1`
14068   if test "x`echo $FIND_BINARY_OUTPUT | $GREP GNU`" != x; then
14069     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: unix style" >&5
14070 $as_echo "unix style" >&6; }
14071   elif test "x`echo $FIND_BINARY_OUTPUT | $GREP FIND`" != x; then
14072     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: Windows" >&5
14073 $as_echo "Windows" >&6; }
14074     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Your path contains Windows tools (C:\Windows\system32) before your unix (cygwin or msys) tools." >&5
14075 $as_echo "$as_me: Your path contains Windows tools (C:\Windows\system32) before your unix (cygwin or msys) tools." >&6;}
14076     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This will not work. Please correct and make sure /usr/bin (or similar) is first in path." >&5
14077 $as_echo "$as_me: This will not work. Please correct and make sure /usr/bin (or similar) is first in path." >&6;}
14078     as_fn_error $? "Cannot continue" "$LINENO" 5
14079   else
14080     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: unknown" >&5
14081 $as_echo "unknown" >&6; }
14082     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: It seems that your find utility is non-standard." >&5
14083 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: It seems that your find utility is non-standard." >&2;}
14084   fi
14085 
14086   else
14087     PATH_SEP=":"
14088   fi
14089 
14090 
14091   # We get the top-level directory from the supporting wrappers.
14092   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for top-level directory" >&5
14093 $as_echo_n "checking for top-level directory... " >&6; }
14094   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $TOPDIR" >&5
14095 $as_echo "$TOPDIR" >&6; }
14096 
14097 
14098   # We can only call BASIC_FIXUP_PATH after BASIC_CHECK_PATHS_WINDOWS.
14099 
14100   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
14101 
14102   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
14103   # unix format.
14104   path="$CURDIR"
14105   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
14106 
14107   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
14108   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
14109   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
14110   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
14111   #
14112   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file precense.
14113   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
14114   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
14115   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
14116     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of CURDIR, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
14117 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of CURDIR, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
14118     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of CURDIR" "$LINENO" 5
14119   fi
14120 
14121   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
14122   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
14123 
14124   input_path="$new_path"
14125   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
14126   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
14127   # take no chances and rewrite it.
14128   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
14129   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
14130   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
14131     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
14132     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
14133     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
14134     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
14135       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
14136       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
14137       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
14138       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
14139       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
14140       new_path="$input_path"
14141     fi
14142   fi
14143 
14144   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
14145   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
14146     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
14147     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
14148       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
14149       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
14150       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
14151     fi
14152   fi
14153 
14154 
14155   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
14156     CURDIR="$new_path"
14157     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting CURDIR to \"$new_path\"" >&5
14158 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting CURDIR to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
14159   fi
14160 
14161   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
14162 
14163   path="$CURDIR"
14164   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
14165   new_path="$path"
14166   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
14167     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
14168     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
14169   fi
14170 
14171 
14172   input_path="$new_path"
14173   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
14174   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
14175   # take no chances and rewrite it.
14176   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
14177   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
14178   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
14179     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
14180     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
14181   fi
14182 
14183 
14184   windows_path="$new_path"
14185   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
14186     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
14187     new_path="$unix_path"
14188   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
14189     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
14190     new_path="$unix_path"
14191   fi
14192 
14193   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
14194     CURDIR="$new_path"
14195     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting CURDIR to \"$new_path\"" >&5
14196 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting CURDIR to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
14197   fi
14198 
14199   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
14200   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
14201 
14202   else
14203     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
14204     path="$CURDIR"
14205     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
14206     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
14207       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of CURDIR, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
14208 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of CURDIR, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
14209       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
14210     fi
14211 
14212     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
14213     eval path="$path"
14214     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
14215       as_fn_error $? "The path of CURDIR, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
14216     fi
14217 
14218     CURDIR="`cd "$path"; $THEPWDCMD -L`"
14219   fi
14220 
14221 
14222   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
14223 
14224   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
14225   # unix format.
14226   path="$TOPDIR"
14227   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
14228 
14229   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
14230   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
14231   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
14232   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
14233   #
14234   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file precense.
14235   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
14236   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
14237   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
14238     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of TOPDIR, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
14239 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of TOPDIR, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
14240     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of TOPDIR" "$LINENO" 5
14241   fi
14242 
14243   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
14244   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
14245 
14246   input_path="$new_path"
14247   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
14248   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
14249   # take no chances and rewrite it.
14250   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
14251   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
14252   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
14253     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
14254     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
14255     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
14256     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
14257       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
14258       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
14259       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
14260       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
14261       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
14262       new_path="$input_path"
14263     fi
14264   fi
14265 
14266   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
14267   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
14268     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
14269     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
14270       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
14271       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
14272       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
14273     fi
14274   fi
14275 
14276 
14277   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
14278     TOPDIR="$new_path"
14279     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting TOPDIR to \"$new_path\"" >&5
14280 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting TOPDIR to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
14281   fi
14282 
14283   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
14284 
14285   path="$TOPDIR"
14286   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
14287   new_path="$path"
14288   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
14289     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
14290     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
14291   fi
14292 
14293 
14294   input_path="$new_path"
14295   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
14296   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
14297   # take no chances and rewrite it.
14298   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
14299   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
14300   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
14301     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
14302     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
14303   fi
14304 
14305 
14306   windows_path="$new_path"
14307   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
14308     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
14309     new_path="$unix_path"
14310   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
14311     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
14312     new_path="$unix_path"
14313   fi
14314 
14315   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
14316     TOPDIR="$new_path"
14317     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting TOPDIR to \"$new_path\"" >&5
14318 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting TOPDIR to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
14319   fi
14320 
14321   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
14322   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
14323 
14324   else
14325     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
14326     path="$TOPDIR"
14327     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
14328     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
14329       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of TOPDIR, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
14330 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of TOPDIR, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
14331       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
14332     fi
14333 
14334     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
14335     eval path="$path"
14336     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
14337       as_fn_error $? "The path of TOPDIR, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
14338     fi
14339 
14340     TOPDIR="`cd "$path"; $THEPWDCMD -L`"
14341   fi
14342 
14343   # SRC_ROOT is a traditional alias for TOPDIR.
14344   SRC_ROOT=$TOPDIR
14345 
14346   # Locate the directory of this script.
14347   AUTOCONF_DIR=$TOPDIR/common/autoconf
14348 
14349 
14350   # Setup default logging of stdout and stderr to build.log in the output root.
14351   BUILD_LOG='$(OUTPUT_ROOT)/build.log'
14352   BUILD_LOG_PREVIOUS='$(OUTPUT_ROOT)/build.log.old'
14353   BUILD_LOG_WRAPPER='$(BASH) $(SRC_ROOT)/common/bin/logger.sh $(BUILD_LOG)'
14354 
14355 
14356 
14357 
14358 
14359 # Check if it's a pure open build or if custom sources are to be used.
14360 
14361   # Check whether --enable-openjdk-only was given.
14362 if test "${enable_openjdk_only+set}" = set; then :
14363   enableval=$enable_openjdk_only;
14364 else
14365   enable_openjdk_only="no"
14366 fi
14367 
14368 
14369   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for presence of closed sources" >&5
14370 $as_echo_n "checking for presence of closed sources... " >&6; }
14371   if test -d "$SRC_ROOT/jdk/src/closed"; then
14372     CLOSED_SOURCE_PRESENT=yes
14373   else
14374     CLOSED_SOURCE_PRESENT=no
14375   fi
14376   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $CLOSED_SOURCE_PRESENT" >&5
14377 $as_echo "$CLOSED_SOURCE_PRESENT" >&6; }
14378 
14379   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if closed source is suppressed (openjdk-only)" >&5
14380 $as_echo_n "checking if closed source is suppressed (openjdk-only)... " >&6; }
14381   SUPPRESS_CLOSED_SOURCE="$enable_openjdk_only"
14382   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $SUPPRESS_CLOSED_SOURCE" >&5
14383 $as_echo "$SUPPRESS_CLOSED_SOURCE" >&6; }
14384 
14385   if test "x$CLOSED_SOURCE_PRESENT" = xno; then
14386     OPENJDK=true
14387     if test "x$SUPPRESS_CLOSED_SOURCE" = "xyes"; then
14388       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: No closed source present, --enable-openjdk-only makes no sense" >&5
14389 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: No closed source present, --enable-openjdk-only makes no sense" >&2;}
14390     fi
14391   else
14392     if test "x$SUPPRESS_CLOSED_SOURCE" = "xyes"; then
14393       OPENJDK=true
14394     else
14395       OPENJDK=false
14396     fi
14397   fi
14398 
14399   if test "x$OPENJDK" = "xtrue"; then
14400     SET_OPENJDK="OPENJDK=true"
14401   fi
14402 
14403 
14404 
14405   # custom-make-dir is deprecated. Please use your custom-hook.m4 to override
14406   # the IncludeCustomExtension macro.
14407 
14408 
14409 # Check whether --with-custom-make-dir was given.
14410 if test "${with_custom_make_dir+set}" = set; then :
14411   withval=$with_custom_make_dir; { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Option --with-custom-make-dir is deprecated and will be ignored." >&5
14412 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Option --with-custom-make-dir is deprecated and will be ignored." >&2;}
14413 fi
14414 
14415 
14416 
14417 
14418 # These are needed to be able to create a configuration name (and thus the output directory)
14419 
14420   ###############################################################################
14421   #
14422   # Check which variant of the JDK that we want to build.
14423   # Currently we have:
14424   #    normal:   standard edition
14425   # but the custom make system may add other variants
14426   #
14427   # Effectively the JDK variant gives a name to a specific set of
14428   # modules to compile into the JDK. In the future, these modules
14429   # might even be Jigsaw modules.
14430   #
14431   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking which variant of the JDK to build" >&5
14432 $as_echo_n "checking which variant of the JDK to build... " >&6; }
14433 
14434 # Check whether --with-jdk-variant was given.
14435 if test "${with_jdk_variant+set}" = set; then :
14436   withval=$with_jdk_variant;
14437 fi
14438 
14439 
14440   if test "x$with_jdk_variant" = xnormal || test "x$with_jdk_variant" = x; then
14441     JDK_VARIANT="normal"
14442   else
14443     as_fn_error $? "The available JDK variants are: normal" "$LINENO" 5
14444   fi
14445 
14446 
14447 
14448   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $JDK_VARIANT" >&5
14449 $as_echo "$JDK_VARIANT" >&6; }
14450 
14451 
14452 ###############################################################################
14453 #
14454 # Check which interpreter of the JVM we want to build.
14455 # Currently we have:
14456 #    template: Template interpreter (the default)
14457 #    cpp     : C++ interpreter
14458 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking which interpreter of the JVM to build" >&5
14459 $as_echo_n "checking which interpreter of the JVM to build... " >&6; }
14460 
14461 # Check whether --with-jvm-interpreter was given.
14462 if test "${with_jvm_interpreter+set}" = set; then :
14463   withval=$with_jvm_interpreter;
14464 fi
14465 
14466 
14467 if test "x$with_jvm_interpreter" = x; then
14468      with_jvm_interpreter="template"
14469 fi
14470 
14471 JVM_INTERPRETER="$with_jvm_interpreter"
14472 
14473 if test "x$JVM_INTERPRETER" != xtemplate && test "x$JVM_INTERPRETER" != xcpp; then
14474    as_fn_error $? "The available JVM interpreters are: template, cpp" "$LINENO" 5
14475 fi
14476 
14477 
14478 
14479 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $with_jvm_interpreter" >&5
14480 $as_echo "$with_jvm_interpreter" >&6; }
14481 
14482 
14483 
14484   ###############################################################################
14485   #
14486   # Check which variants of the JVM that we want to build.
14487   # Currently we have:
14488   #    server: normal interpreter and a tiered C1/C2 compiler
14489   #    client: normal interpreter and C1 (no C2 compiler) (only 32-bit platforms)
14490   #    minimal1: reduced form of client with optional VM services and features stripped out
14491   #    kernel: kernel footprint JVM that passes the TCK without major performance problems,
14492   #             ie normal interpreter and C1, only the serial GC, kernel jvmti etc
14493   #    zero: no machine code interpreter, no compiler
14494   #    zeroshark: zero interpreter and shark/llvm compiler backend
14495 #    core: interpreter only, no compiler (only works on some platforms)
14496   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking which variants of the JVM to build" >&5
14497 $as_echo_n "checking which variants of the JVM to build... " >&6; }
14498 
14499 # Check whether --with-jvm-variants was given.
14500 if test "${with_jvm_variants+set}" = set; then :
14501   withval=$with_jvm_variants;
14502 fi
14503 
14504 
14505   if test "x$with_jvm_variants" = x; then
14506     with_jvm_variants="server"
14507   fi
14508 
14509   JVM_VARIANTS=",$with_jvm_variants,"
14510   TEST_VARIANTS=`$ECHO "$JVM_VARIANTS" | $SED -e 's/server,//' -e 's/client,//'  -e 's/minimal1,//' -e 's/kernel,//' -e 's/zero,//' -e 's/zeroshark,//' -e 's/core,//'`
14511 
14512   if test "x$TEST_VARIANTS" != "x,"; then
14513      as_fn_error $? "The available JVM variants are: server, client, minimal1, kernel, zero, zeroshark, core" "$LINENO" 5
14514   fi
14515   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $with_jvm_variants" >&5
14516 $as_echo "$with_jvm_variants" >&6; }
14517 
14518   JVM_VARIANT_SERVER=`$ECHO "$JVM_VARIANTS" | $SED -e '/,server,/!s/.*/false/g' -e '/,server,/s/.*/true/g'`
14519   JVM_VARIANT_CLIENT=`$ECHO "$JVM_VARIANTS" | $SED -e '/,client,/!s/.*/false/g' -e '/,client,/s/.*/true/g'`
14520   JVM_VARIANT_MINIMAL1=`$ECHO "$JVM_VARIANTS" | $SED -e '/,minimal1,/!s/.*/false/g' -e '/,minimal1,/s/.*/true/g'`
14521   JVM_VARIANT_KERNEL=`$ECHO "$JVM_VARIANTS" | $SED -e '/,kernel,/!s/.*/false/g' -e '/,kernel,/s/.*/true/g'`
14522   JVM_VARIANT_ZERO=`$ECHO "$JVM_VARIANTS" | $SED -e '/,zero,/!s/.*/false/g' -e '/,zero,/s/.*/true/g'`
14523   JVM_VARIANT_ZEROSHARK=`$ECHO "$JVM_VARIANTS" | $SED -e '/,zeroshark,/!s/.*/false/g' -e '/,zeroshark,/s/.*/true/g'`
14524   JVM_VARIANT_CORE=`$ECHO "$JVM_VARIANTS" | $SED -e '/,core,/!s/.*/false/g' -e '/,core,/s/.*/true/g'`
14525 
14526   if test "x$JVM_VARIANT_CLIENT" = xtrue; then
14527     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = x64; then
14528       as_fn_error $? "You cannot build a client JVM for a 64-bit machine." "$LINENO" 5
14529     fi
14530   fi
14531   if test "x$JVM_VARIANT_KERNEL" = xtrue; then
14532     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = x64; then
14533       as_fn_error $? "You cannot build a kernel JVM for a 64-bit machine." "$LINENO" 5
14534     fi
14535   fi
14536   if test "x$JVM_VARIANT_MINIMAL1" = xtrue; then
14537     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = x64; then
14538       as_fn_error $? "You cannot build a minimal JVM for a 64-bit machine." "$LINENO" 5
14539     fi
14540   fi
14541 
14542   # Replace the commas with AND for use in the build directory name.
14543   ANDED_JVM_VARIANTS=`$ECHO "$JVM_VARIANTS" | $SED -e 's/^,//' -e 's/,$//' -e 's/,/AND/g'`
14544   COUNT_VARIANTS=`$ECHO "$JVM_VARIANTS" | $SED -e 's/server,/1/' -e 's/client,/1/' -e 's/minimal1,/1/' -e 's/kernel,/1/' -e 's/zero,/1/' -e 's/zeroshark,/1/' -e 's/core,/1/'`
14545   if test "x$COUNT_VARIANTS" != "x,1"; then
14546     BUILDING_MULTIPLE_JVM_VARIANTS=yes
14547   else
14548     BUILDING_MULTIPLE_JVM_VARIANTS=no
14549   fi
14550 
14551 
14552 
14553 
14554 
14555 
14556 
14557 
14558 
14559 
14560   INCLUDE_SA=true
14561   if test "x$JVM_VARIANT_ZERO" = xtrue ; then
14562     INCLUDE_SA=false
14563   fi
14564   if test "x$JVM_VARIANT_ZEROSHARK" = xtrue ; then
14565     INCLUDE_SA=false
14566   fi
14567   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xaix ; then
14568     INCLUDE_SA=false
14569   fi
14570 
14571 
14572   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = "xmacosx"; then
14573     MACOSX_UNIVERSAL="true"
14574   fi
14575 
14576 
14577 
14578 
14579   ###############################################################################
14580   #
14581   # Set the debug level
14582   #    release: no debug information, all optimizations, no asserts.
14583   #    optimized: no debug information, all optimizations, no asserts, HotSpot target is 'optimized'.
14584   #    fastdebug: debug information (-g), all optimizations, all asserts
14585   #    slowdebug: debug information (-g), no optimizations, all asserts
14586   #
14587   DEBUG_LEVEL="release"
14588   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking which debug level to use" >&5
14589 $as_echo_n "checking which debug level to use... " >&6; }
14590   # Check whether --enable-debug was given.
14591 if test "${enable_debug+set}" = set; then :
14592   enableval=$enable_debug;
14593         ENABLE_DEBUG="${enableval}"
14594         DEBUG_LEVEL="fastdebug"
14595 
14596 else
14597   ENABLE_DEBUG="no"
14598 fi
14599 
14600 
14601 
14602 # Check whether --with-debug-level was given.
14603 if test "${with_debug_level+set}" = set; then :
14604   withval=$with_debug_level;
14605         DEBUG_LEVEL="${withval}"
14606         if test "x$ENABLE_DEBUG" = xyes; then
14607           as_fn_error $? "You cannot use both --enable-debug and --with-debug-level at the same time." "$LINENO" 5
14608         fi
14609 
14610 fi
14611 
14612   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $DEBUG_LEVEL" >&5
14613 $as_echo "$DEBUG_LEVEL" >&6; }
14614 
14615   if test "x$DEBUG_LEVEL" != xrelease && \
14616       test "x$DEBUG_LEVEL" != xoptimized && \
14617       test "x$DEBUG_LEVEL" != xfastdebug && \
14618       test "x$DEBUG_LEVEL" != xslowdebug; then
14619     as_fn_error $? "Allowed debug levels are: release, fastdebug and slowdebug" "$LINENO" 5
14620   fi
14621 
14622 
14623   ###############################################################################
14624   #
14625   # Setup legacy vars/targets and new vars to deal with different debug levels.
14626   #
14627 
14628   case $DEBUG_LEVEL in
14629     release )
14630       VARIANT="OPT"
14631       FASTDEBUG="false"
14632       DEBUG_CLASSFILES="false"
14633       BUILD_VARIANT_RELEASE=""
14634       HOTSPOT_DEBUG_LEVEL="product"
14635       HOTSPOT_EXPORT="product"
14636       ;;
14637     fastdebug )
14638       VARIANT="DBG"
14639       FASTDEBUG="true"
14640       DEBUG_CLASSFILES="true"
14641       BUILD_VARIANT_RELEASE="-fastdebug"
14642       HOTSPOT_DEBUG_LEVEL="fastdebug"
14643       HOTSPOT_EXPORT="fastdebug"
14644       ;;
14645     slowdebug )
14646       VARIANT="DBG"
14647       FASTDEBUG="false"
14648       DEBUG_CLASSFILES="true"
14649       BUILD_VARIANT_RELEASE="-debug"
14650       HOTSPOT_DEBUG_LEVEL="debug"
14651       HOTSPOT_EXPORT="debug"
14652       ;;
14653     optimized )
14654       VARIANT="OPT"
14655       FASTDEBUG="false"
14656       DEBUG_CLASSFILES="false"
14657       BUILD_VARIANT_RELEASE="-optimized"
14658       HOTSPOT_DEBUG_LEVEL="optimized"
14659       HOTSPOT_EXPORT="optimized"
14660       ;;
14661   esac
14662 
14663   # The debug level 'optimized' is a little special because it is currently only
14664   # applicable to the HotSpot build where it means to build a completely
14665   # optimized version of the VM without any debugging code (like for the
14666   # 'release' debug level which is called 'product' in the HotSpot build) but
14667   # with the exception that it can contain additional code which is otherwise
14668   # protected by '#ifndef PRODUCT' macros. These 'optimized' builds are used to
14669   # test new and/or experimental features which are not intended for customer
14670   # shipment. Because these new features need to be tested and benchmarked in
14671   # real world scenarios, we want to build the containing JDK at the 'release'
14672   # debug level.
14673   if test "x$DEBUG_LEVEL" = xoptimized; then
14674     DEBUG_LEVEL="release"
14675   fi
14676 
14677   #####
14678   # Generate the legacy makefile targets for hotspot.
14679   # The hotspot api for selecting the build artifacts, really, needs to be improved.
14680   # JDK-7195896 will fix this on the hotspot side by using the JVM_VARIANT_* variables to
14681   # determine what needs to be built. All we will need to set here is all_product, all_fastdebug etc
14682   # But until then ...
14683   HOTSPOT_TARGET=""
14684 
14685   if test "x$JVM_VARIANT_SERVER" = xtrue; then
14686     HOTSPOT_TARGET="$HOTSPOT_TARGET${HOTSPOT_DEBUG_LEVEL} "
14687   fi
14688 
14689   if test "x$JVM_VARIANT_CLIENT" = xtrue; then
14690     HOTSPOT_TARGET="$HOTSPOT_TARGET${HOTSPOT_DEBUG_LEVEL}1 "
14691   fi
14692 
14693   if test "x$JVM_VARIANT_MINIMAL1" = xtrue; then
14694     HOTSPOT_TARGET="$HOTSPOT_TARGET${HOTSPOT_DEBUG_LEVEL}minimal1 "
14695   fi
14696 
14697   if test "x$JVM_VARIANT_KERNEL" = xtrue; then
14698     HOTSPOT_TARGET="$HOTSPOT_TARGET${HOTSPOT_DEBUG_LEVEL}kernel "
14699   fi
14700 
14701   if test "x$JVM_VARIANT_ZERO" = xtrue; then
14702     HOTSPOT_TARGET="$HOTSPOT_TARGET${HOTSPOT_DEBUG_LEVEL}zero "
14703   fi
14704 
14705   if test "x$JVM_VARIANT_ZEROSHARK" = xtrue; then
14706     HOTSPOT_TARGET="$HOTSPOT_TARGET${HOTSPOT_DEBUG_LEVEL}shark "
14707   fi
14708 
14709   if test "x$JVM_VARIANT_CORE" = xtrue; then
14710     HOTSPOT_TARGET="$HOTSPOT_TARGET${HOTSPOT_DEBUG_LEVEL}core "
14711   fi
14712 
14713   HOTSPOT_TARGET="$HOTSPOT_TARGET docs export_$HOTSPOT_EXPORT"
14714 
14715   # On Macosx universal binaries are produced, but they only contain
14716   # 64 bit intel. This invalidates control of which jvms are built
14717   # from configure, but only server is valid anyway. Fix this
14718   # when hotspot makefiles are rewritten.
14719   if test "x$MACOSX_UNIVERSAL" = xtrue; then
14720     HOTSPOT_TARGET=universal_${HOTSPOT_EXPORT}
14721   fi
14722 
14723   #####
14724 
14725 
14726 
14727 
14728 
14729 
14730 
14731 
14732 # With basic setup done, call the custom early hook.
14733 
14734 
14735 # Check if we have devkits, extra paths or sysroot set.
14736 
14737 
14738 # Check whether --with-devkit was given.
14739 if test "${with_devkit+set}" = set; then :
14740   withval=$with_devkit;
14741 
14742   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
14743 
14744   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
14745   # unix format.
14746   path="$with_devkit"
14747   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
14748 
14749   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
14750   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
14751   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
14752   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
14753   #
14754   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file precense.
14755   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
14756   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
14757   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
14758     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of with_devkit, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
14759 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of with_devkit, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
14760     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of with_devkit" "$LINENO" 5
14761   fi
14762 
14763   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
14764   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
14765 
14766   input_path="$new_path"
14767   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
14768   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
14769   # take no chances and rewrite it.
14770   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
14771   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
14772   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
14773     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
14774     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
14775     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
14776     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
14777       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
14778       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
14779       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
14780       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
14781       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
14782       new_path="$input_path"
14783     fi
14784   fi
14785 
14786   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
14787   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
14788     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
14789     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
14790       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
14791       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
14792       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
14793     fi
14794   fi
14795 
14796 
14797   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
14798     with_devkit="$new_path"
14799     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting with_devkit to \"$new_path\"" >&5
14800 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting with_devkit to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
14801   fi
14802 
14803   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
14804 
14805   path="$with_devkit"
14806   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
14807   new_path="$path"
14808   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
14809     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
14810     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
14811   fi
14812 
14813 
14814   input_path="$new_path"
14815   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
14816   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
14817   # take no chances and rewrite it.
14818   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
14819   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
14820   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
14821     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
14822     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
14823   fi
14824 
14825 
14826   windows_path="$new_path"
14827   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
14828     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
14829     new_path="$unix_path"
14830   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
14831     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
14832     new_path="$unix_path"
14833   fi
14834 
14835   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
14836     with_devkit="$new_path"
14837     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting with_devkit to \"$new_path\"" >&5
14838 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting with_devkit to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
14839   fi
14840 
14841   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
14842   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
14843 
14844   else
14845     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
14846     path="$with_devkit"
14847     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
14848     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
14849       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of with_devkit, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
14850 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of with_devkit, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
14851       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
14852     fi
14853 
14854     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
14855     eval path="$path"
14856     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
14857       as_fn_error $? "The path of with_devkit, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
14858     fi
14859 
14860     with_devkit="`cd "$path"; $THEPWDCMD -L`"
14861   fi
14862 
14863         DEVKIT_ROOT="$with_devkit"
14864         # Check for a meta data info file in the root of the devkit
14865         if test -f "$DEVKIT_ROOT/devkit.info"; then
14866           # This potentially sets the following:
14867           # DEVKIT_NAME: A descriptive name of the devkit
14868           # DEVKIT_TOOLCHAIN_PATH: Corresponds to --with-toolchain-path
14869           # DEVKIT_EXTRA_PATH: Corresponds to --with-extra-path
14870           # DEVKIT_SYSROOT: Corresponds to --with-sysroot
14871           . $DEVKIT_ROOT/devkit.info
14872         fi
14873 
14874         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for devkit" >&5
14875 $as_echo_n "checking for devkit... " >&6; }
14876         if test "x$DEVKIT_NAME" != x; then
14877           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $DEVKIT_NAME in $DEVKIT_ROOT" >&5
14878 $as_echo "$DEVKIT_NAME in $DEVKIT_ROOT" >&6; }
14879         else
14880           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $DEVKIT_ROOT" >&5
14881 $as_echo "$DEVKIT_ROOT" >&6; }
14882         fi
14883 
14884         if test "x$DEVKIT_EXTRA_PATH" != x; then
14885 
14886   if test "x$DEVKIT_EXTRA_PATH" != x; then
14887     if test "x$EXTRA_PATH" = x; then
14888       EXTRA_PATH="$DEVKIT_EXTRA_PATH"
14889     else
14890       EXTRA_PATH="$DEVKIT_EXTRA_PATH:$EXTRA_PATH"
14891     fi
14892   fi
14893 
14894         fi
14895 
14896         # Fallback default of just /bin if DEVKIT_PATH is not defined
14897         if test "x$DEVKIT_TOOLCHAIN_PATH" = x; then
14898           DEVKIT_TOOLCHAIN_PATH="$DEVKIT_ROOT/bin"
14899         fi
14900 
14901   if test "x$DEVKIT_TOOLCHAIN_PATH" != x; then
14902     if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_PATH" = x; then
14903       TOOLCHAIN_PATH="$DEVKIT_TOOLCHAIN_PATH"
14904     else
14905       TOOLCHAIN_PATH="$DEVKIT_TOOLCHAIN_PATH:$TOOLCHAIN_PATH"
14906     fi
14907   fi
14908 
14909 
14910         # If DEVKIT_SYSROOT is set, use that, otherwise try a couple of known
14911         # places for backwards compatiblity.
14912         if test "x$DEVKIT_SYSROOT" != x; then
14913           SYSROOT="$DEVKIT_SYSROOT"
14914         elif test -d "$DEVKIT_ROOT/$host_alias/libc"; then
14915           SYSROOT="$DEVKIT_ROOT/$host_alias/libc"
14916         elif test -d "$DEVKIT_ROOT/$host/sys-root"; then
14917           SYSROOT="$DEVKIT_ROOT/$host/sys-root"
14918         fi
14919 
14920 
14921 fi
14922 
14923 
14924   # You can force the sysroot if the sysroot encoded into the compiler tools
14925   # is not correct.
14926 
14927 # Check whether --with-sys-root was given.
14928 if test "${with_sys_root+set}" = set; then :
14929   withval=$with_sys_root; SYSROOT=$with_sys_root
14930 
14931 fi
14932 
14933 
14934 
14935 # Check whether --with-sysroot was given.
14936 if test "${with_sysroot+set}" = set; then :
14937   withval=$with_sysroot; SYSROOT=$with_sysroot
14938 
14939 fi
14940 
14941 
14942 
14943 # Check whether --with-tools-dir was given.
14944 if test "${with_tools_dir+set}" = set; then :
14945   withval=$with_tools_dir;
14946   if test "x$with_tools_dir" != x; then
14947     if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_PATH" = x; then
14948       TOOLCHAIN_PATH="$with_tools_dir"
14949     else
14950       TOOLCHAIN_PATH="$with_tools_dir:$TOOLCHAIN_PATH"
14951     fi
14952   fi
14953 
14954 
14955 fi
14956 
14957 
14958 
14959 # Check whether --with-toolchain-path was given.
14960 if test "${with_toolchain_path+set}" = set; then :
14961   withval=$with_toolchain_path;
14962   if test "x$with_toolchain_path" != x; then
14963     if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_PATH" = x; then
14964       TOOLCHAIN_PATH="$with_toolchain_path"
14965     else
14966       TOOLCHAIN_PATH="$with_toolchain_path:$TOOLCHAIN_PATH"
14967     fi
14968   fi
14969 
14970 
14971 fi
14972 
14973 
14974 
14975 # Check whether --with-extra-path was given.
14976 if test "${with_extra_path+set}" = set; then :
14977   withval=$with_extra_path;
14978   if test "x$with_extra_path" != x; then
14979     if test "x$EXTRA_PATH" = x; then
14980       EXTRA_PATH="$with_extra_path"
14981     else
14982       EXTRA_PATH="$with_extra_path:$EXTRA_PATH"
14983     fi
14984   fi
14985 
14986 
14987 fi
14988 
14989 
14990   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS" = "xmacosx"; then
14991     # detect if Xcode is installed by running xcodebuild -version
14992     # if no Xcode installed, xcodebuild exits with 1
14993     # if Xcode is installed, even if xcode-select is misconfigured, then it exits with 0
14994     if /usr/bin/xcodebuild -version >/dev/null 2>&1; then
14995       # We need to use xcodebuild in the toolchain dir provided by the user, this will
14996       # fall back on the stub binary in /usr/bin/xcodebuild
14997       # Extract the first word of "xcodebuild", so it can be a program name with args.
14998 set dummy xcodebuild; ac_word=$2
14999 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
15000 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
15001 if ${ac_cv_path_XCODEBUILD+:} false; then :
15002   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
15003 else
15004   case $XCODEBUILD in
15005   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
15006   ac_cv_path_XCODEBUILD="$XCODEBUILD" # Let the user override the test with a path.
15007   ;;
15008   *)
15009   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
15010 for as_dir in $TOOLCHAIN_PATH
15011 do
15012   IFS=$as_save_IFS
15013   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
15014     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
15015   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
15016     ac_cv_path_XCODEBUILD="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
15017     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
15018     break 2
15019   fi
15020 done
15021   done
15022 IFS=$as_save_IFS
15023 
15024   test -z "$ac_cv_path_XCODEBUILD" && ac_cv_path_XCODEBUILD="/usr/bin/xcodebuild"
15025   ;;
15026 esac
15027 fi
15028 XCODEBUILD=$ac_cv_path_XCODEBUILD
15029 if test -n "$XCODEBUILD"; then
15030   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $XCODEBUILD" >&5
15031 $as_echo "$XCODEBUILD" >&6; }
15032 else
15033   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
15034 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
15035 fi
15036 
15037 
15038     else
15039       # this should result in SYSROOT being empty, unless --with-sysroot is provided
15040       # when only the command line tools are installed there are no SDKs, so headers
15041       # are copied into the system frameworks
15042       XCODEBUILD=
15043 
15044     fi
15045 
15046     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for sdk name" >&5
15047 $as_echo_n "checking for sdk name... " >&6; }
15048 
15049 # Check whether --with-sdk-name was given.
15050 if test "${with_sdk_name+set}" = set; then :
15051   withval=$with_sdk_name; SDKNAME=$with_sdk_name
15052 
15053 fi
15054 
15055     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $SDKNAME" >&5
15056 $as_echo "$SDKNAME" >&6; }
15057 
15058     # if toolchain path is specified then don't rely on system headers, they may not compile
15059     HAVE_SYSTEM_FRAMEWORK_HEADERS=0
15060     test -z "$TOOLCHAIN_PATH" && \
15061       HAVE_SYSTEM_FRAMEWORK_HEADERS=`test ! -f /System/Library/Frameworks/Foundation.framework/Headers/Foundation.h; echo $?`
15062 
15063     if test -z "$SYSROOT"; then
15064       if test -n "$XCODEBUILD"; then
15065         # if we don't have system headers, use default SDK name (last resort)
15066         if test -z "$SDKNAME" -a $HAVE_SYSTEM_FRAMEWORK_HEADERS -eq 0; then
15067           SDKNAME=${SDKNAME:-macosx}
15068         fi
15069 
15070         if test -n "$SDKNAME"; then
15071           # Call xcodebuild to determine SYSROOT
15072           SYSROOT=`"$XCODEBUILD" -sdk $SDKNAME -version | grep '^Path: ' | sed 's/Path: //'`
15073         fi
15074       else
15075         if test $HAVE_SYSTEM_FRAMEWORK_HEADERS -eq 0; then
15076           as_fn_error $? "No xcodebuild tool and no system framework headers found, use --with-sysroot or --with-sdk-name to provide a path to a valid SDK" "$LINENO" 5
15077         fi
15078       fi
15079     else
15080       # warn user if --with-sdk-name was also set
15081       if test -n "$with_sdk_name"; then
15082         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Both SYSROOT and --with-sdk-name are set, only SYSROOT will be used" >&5
15083 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Both SYSROOT and --with-sdk-name are set, only SYSROOT will be used" >&2;}
15084       fi
15085     fi
15086 
15087     if test $HAVE_SYSTEM_FRAMEWORK_HEADERS -eq 0 -a -z "$SYSROOT"; then
15088       # If no system framework headers, then SYSROOT must be set, or we won't build
15089       as_fn_error $? "Unable to determine SYSROOT and no headers found in /System/Library/Frameworks. Check Xcode configuration, --with-sysroot or --with-sdk-name arguments." "$LINENO" 5
15090     fi
15091 
15092     # Perform a basic sanity test
15093     if test ! -f "$SYSROOT/System/Library/Frameworks/Foundation.framework/Headers/Foundation.h"; then
15094       if test -z "$SYSROOT"; then
15095         as_fn_error $? "Unable to find required framework headers, provide a path to an SDK via --with-sysroot or --with-sdk-name and be sure Xcode is installed properly" "$LINENO" 5
15096       else
15097         as_fn_error $? "Invalid SDK or SYSROOT path, dependent framework headers not found" "$LINENO" 5
15098       fi
15099     fi
15100 
15101     # set SDKROOT too, Xcode tools will pick it up
15102     SDKROOT=$SYSROOT
15103 
15104   fi
15105 
15106   # Prepend the extra path to the global path
15107 
15108   if test "x$EXTRA_PATH" != x; then
15109     if test "x$PATH" = x; then
15110       PATH="$EXTRA_PATH"
15111     else
15112       PATH="$EXTRA_PATH:$PATH"
15113     fi
15114   fi
15115 
15116 
15117   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS" = "xsolaris"; then
15118     # Add extra search paths on solaris for utilities like ar and as etc...
15119     PATH="$PATH:/usr/ccs/bin:/usr/sfw/bin:/opt/csw/bin"
15120   fi
15121 
15122   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for sysroot" >&5
15123 $as_echo_n "checking for sysroot... " >&6; }
15124   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $SYSROOT" >&5
15125 $as_echo "$SYSROOT" >&6; }
15126   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for toolchain path" >&5
15127 $as_echo_n "checking for toolchain path... " >&6; }
15128   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $TOOLCHAIN_PATH" >&5
15129 $as_echo "$TOOLCHAIN_PATH" >&6; }
15130   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for extra path" >&5
15131 $as_echo_n "checking for extra path... " >&6; }
15132   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $EXTRA_PATH" >&5
15133 $as_echo "$EXTRA_PATH" >&6; }
15134 
15135 
15136 # To properly create a configuration name, we need to have the OpenJDK target
15137 # and options (variants and debug level) parsed.
15138 
15139 
15140 
15141 # Check whether --with-conf-name was given.
15142 if test "${with_conf_name+set}" = set; then :
15143   withval=$with_conf_name;  CONF_NAME=${with_conf_name}
15144 fi
15145 
15146 
15147   # Test from where we are running configure, in or outside of src root.
15148   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking where to store configuration" >&5
15149 $as_echo_n "checking where to store configuration... " >&6; }
15150   if test "x$CURDIR" = "x$SRC_ROOT" || test "x$CURDIR" = "x$SRC_ROOT/common" \
15151       || test "x$CURDIR" = "x$SRC_ROOT/common/autoconf" \
15152       || test "x$CURDIR" = "x$SRC_ROOT/make" ; then
15153     # We are running configure from the src root.
15154     # Create a default ./build/target-variant-debuglevel output root.
15155     if test "x${CONF_NAME}" = x; then
15156       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: in default location" >&5
15157 $as_echo "in default location" >&6; }
15158       CONF_NAME="${OPENJDK_TARGET_OS}-${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU}-${JDK_VARIANT}-${ANDED_JVM_VARIANTS}-${DEBUG_LEVEL}"
15159     else
15160       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: in build directory with custom name" >&5
15161 $as_echo "in build directory with custom name" >&6; }
15162     fi
15163     OUTPUT_ROOT="$SRC_ROOT/build/${CONF_NAME}"
15164     $MKDIR -p "$OUTPUT_ROOT"
15165     if test ! -d "$OUTPUT_ROOT"; then
15166       as_fn_error $? "Could not create build directory $OUTPUT_ROOT" "$LINENO" 5
15167     fi
15168   else
15169     # We are running configure from outside of the src dir.
15170     # Then use the current directory as output dir!
15171     # If configuration is situated in normal build directory, just use the build
15172     # directory name as configuration name, otherwise use the complete path.
15173     if test "x${CONF_NAME}" = x; then
15174       CONF_NAME=`$ECHO $CURDIR | $SED -e "s!^${SRC_ROOT}/build/!!"`
15175     fi
15176     OUTPUT_ROOT="$CURDIR"
15177     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: in current directory" >&5
15178 $as_echo "in current directory" >&6; }
15179 
15180     # WARNING: This might be a bad thing to do. You need to be sure you want to
15181     # have a configuration in this directory. Do some sanity checks!
15182 
15183     if test ! -e "$OUTPUT_ROOT/spec.gmk"; then
15184       # If we have a spec.gmk, we have run here before and we are OK. Otherwise, check for
15185       # other files
15186       files_present=`$LS $OUTPUT_ROOT`
15187       # Configure has already touched config.log and confdefs.h in the current dir when this check
15188       # is performed.
15189       filtered_files=`$ECHO "$files_present" | $SED -e 's/config.log//g' -e 's/confdefs.h//g' -e 's/ //g' \
15190       | $TR -d '\n'`
15191       if test "x$filtered_files" != x; then
15192         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Current directory is $CURDIR." >&5
15193 $as_echo "$as_me: Current directory is $CURDIR." >&6;}
15194         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Since this is not the source root, configure will output the configuration here" >&5
15195 $as_echo "$as_me: Since this is not the source root, configure will output the configuration here" >&6;}
15196         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: (as opposed to creating a configuration in <src_root>/build/<conf-name>)." >&5
15197 $as_echo "$as_me: (as opposed to creating a configuration in <src_root>/build/<conf-name>)." >&6;}
15198         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: However, this directory is not empty. This is not allowed, since it could" >&5
15199 $as_echo "$as_me: However, this directory is not empty. This is not allowed, since it could" >&6;}
15200         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: seriously mess up just about everything." >&5
15201 $as_echo "$as_me: seriously mess up just about everything." >&6;}
15202         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Try 'cd $SRC_ROOT' and restart configure" >&5
15203 $as_echo "$as_me: Try 'cd $SRC_ROOT' and restart configure" >&6;}
15204         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: (or create a new empty directory and cd to it)." >&5
15205 $as_echo "$as_me: (or create a new empty directory and cd to it)." >&6;}
15206         as_fn_error $? "Will not continue creating configuration in $CURDIR" "$LINENO" 5
15207       fi
15208     fi
15209   fi
15210   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking what configuration name to use" >&5
15211 $as_echo_n "checking what configuration name to use... " >&6; }
15212   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $CONF_NAME" >&5
15213 $as_echo "$CONF_NAME" >&6; }
15214 
15215 
15216   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
15217 
15218   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
15219   # unix format.
15220   path="$OUTPUT_ROOT"
15221   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
15222 
15223   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
15224   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
15225   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
15226   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
15227   #
15228   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file precense.
