15229   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
15230   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
15231   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
15232     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of OUTPUT_ROOT, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
15233 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of OUTPUT_ROOT, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
15234     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of OUTPUT_ROOT" "$LINENO" 5
15235   fi
15236 
15237   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
15238   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
15239 
15240   input_path="$new_path"
15241   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
15242   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
15243   # take no chances and rewrite it.
15244   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
15245   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
15246   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
15247     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
15248     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
15249     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
15250     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
15251       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
15252       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
15253       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
15254       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
15255       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
15256       new_path="$input_path"
15257     fi
15258   fi
15259 
15260   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
15261   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
15262     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
15263     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
15264       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
15265       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
15266       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
15267     fi
15268   fi
15269 
15270 
15271   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
15272     OUTPUT_ROOT="$new_path"
15273     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting OUTPUT_ROOT to \"$new_path\"" >&5
15274 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting OUTPUT_ROOT to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
15275   fi
15276 
15277   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
15278 
15279   path="$OUTPUT_ROOT"
15280   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
15281   new_path="$path"
15282   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
15283     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
15284     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
15285   fi
15286 
15287 
15288   input_path="$new_path"
15289   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
15290   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
15291   # take no chances and rewrite it.
15292   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
15293   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
15294   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
15295     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
15296     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
15297   fi
15298 
15299 
15300   windows_path="$new_path"
15301   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
15302     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
15303     new_path="$unix_path"
15304   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
15305     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
15306     new_path="$unix_path"
15307   fi
15308 
15309   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
15310     OUTPUT_ROOT="$new_path"
15311     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting OUTPUT_ROOT to \"$new_path\"" >&5
15312 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting OUTPUT_ROOT to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
15313   fi
15314 
15315   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
15316   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
15317 
15318   else
15319     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
15320     path="$OUTPUT_ROOT"
15321     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
15322     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
15323       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of OUTPUT_ROOT, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
15324 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of OUTPUT_ROOT, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
15325       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
15326     fi
15327 
15328     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
15329     eval path="$path"
15330     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
15331       as_fn_error $? "The path of OUTPUT_ROOT, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
15332     fi
15333 
15334     OUTPUT_ROOT="`cd "$path"; $THEPWDCMD -L`"
15335   fi
15336 
15337 
15338   SPEC=$OUTPUT_ROOT/spec.gmk
15339 
15340   CONF_NAME=$CONF_NAME
15341 
15342   OUTPUT_ROOT=$OUTPUT_ROOT
15343 
15344 
15345   # The spec.gmk file contains all variables for the make system.
15346   ac_config_files="$ac_config_files $OUTPUT_ROOT/spec.gmk:$AUTOCONF_DIR/spec.gmk.in"
15347 
15348   # The hotspot-spec.gmk file contains legacy variables for the hotspot make system.
15349   ac_config_files="$ac_config_files $OUTPUT_ROOT/hotspot-spec.gmk:$AUTOCONF_DIR/hotspot-spec.gmk.in"
15350 
15351   # The bootcycle-spec.gmk file contains support for boot cycle builds.
15352   ac_config_files="$ac_config_files $OUTPUT_ROOT/bootcycle-spec.gmk:$AUTOCONF_DIR/bootcycle-spec.gmk.in"
15353 
15354   # The compare.sh is used to compare the build output to other builds.
15355   ac_config_files="$ac_config_files $OUTPUT_ROOT/compare.sh:$AUTOCONF_DIR/compare.sh.in"
15356 
15357   # The generated Makefile knows where the spec.gmk is and where the source is.
15358   # You can run make from the OUTPUT_ROOT, or from the top-level Makefile
15359   # which will look for generated configurations
15360   ac_config_files="$ac_config_files $OUTPUT_ROOT/Makefile:$AUTOCONF_DIR/Makefile.in"
15361 
15362 
15363 
15364 # Must be done before we can call HELP_MSG_MISSING_DEPENDENCY.
15365 
15366   for ac_prog in apt-get yum port pkgutil pkgadd
15367 do
15368   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
15369 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
15370 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
15371 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
15372 if ${ac_cv_prog_PKGHANDLER+:} false; then :
15373   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
15374 else
15375   if test -n "$PKGHANDLER"; then
15376   ac_cv_prog_PKGHANDLER="$PKGHANDLER" # Let the user override the test.
15377 else
15378 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
15379 for as_dir in $PATH
15380 do
15381   IFS=$as_save_IFS
15382   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
15383     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
15384   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
15385     ac_cv_prog_PKGHANDLER="$ac_prog"
15386     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
15387     break 2
15388   fi
15389 done
15390   done
15391 IFS=$as_save_IFS
15392 
15393 fi
15394 fi
15395 PKGHANDLER=$ac_cv_prog_PKGHANDLER
15396 if test -n "$PKGHANDLER"; then
15397   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $PKGHANDLER" >&5
15398 $as_echo "$PKGHANDLER" >&6; }
15399 else
15400   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
15401 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
15402 fi
15403 
15404 
15405   test -n "$PKGHANDLER" && break
15406 done
15407 
15408 
15409 
15410 # Setup tools that requires more complex handling, or that is not needed by the configure script.
15411 
15412 
15413   # We need to find a recent version of GNU make. Especially on Solaris, this can be tricky.
15414   if test "x$MAKE" != x; then
15415     # User has supplied a make, test it.
15416     if test ! -f "$MAKE"; then
15417       as_fn_error $? "The specified make (by MAKE=$MAKE) is not found." "$LINENO" 5
15418     fi
15419 
15420   MAKE_CANDIDATE=""$MAKE""
15421   DESCRIPTION="user supplied MAKE=$MAKE"
15422   if test "x$MAKE_CANDIDATE" != x; then
15423     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Testing potential make at $MAKE_CANDIDATE, found using $DESCRIPTION" >&5
15424 $as_echo "$as_me: Testing potential make at $MAKE_CANDIDATE, found using $DESCRIPTION" >&6;}
15425     MAKE_VERSION_STRING=`$MAKE_CANDIDATE --version | $HEAD -n 1`
15426     IS_GNU_MAKE=`$ECHO $MAKE_VERSION_STRING | $GREP 'GNU Make'`
15427     if test "x$IS_GNU_MAKE" = x; then
15428       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found potential make at $MAKE_CANDIDATE, however, this is not GNU Make. Ignoring." >&5
15429 $as_echo "$as_me: Found potential make at $MAKE_CANDIDATE, however, this is not GNU Make. Ignoring." >&6;}
15430     else
15431       IS_MODERN_MAKE=`$ECHO $MAKE_VERSION_STRING | $GREP -e '3\.8[12]' -e '4\.'`
15432       if test "x$IS_MODERN_MAKE" = x; then
15433         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found GNU make at $MAKE_CANDIDATE, however this is not version 3.81 or later. (it is: $MAKE_VERSION_STRING). Ignoring." >&5
15434 $as_echo "$as_me: Found GNU make at $MAKE_CANDIDATE, however this is not version 3.81 or later. (it is: $MAKE_VERSION_STRING). Ignoring." >&6;}
15435       else
15436         if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS" = "xwindows"; then
15437           if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
15438             MAKE_EXPECTED_ENV='cygwin'
15439           elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
15440             MAKE_EXPECTED_ENV='msys'
15441           else
15442             as_fn_error $? "Unknown Windows environment" "$LINENO" 5
15443           fi
15444           MAKE_BUILT_FOR=`$MAKE_CANDIDATE --version | $GREP -i 'built for'`
15445           IS_MAKE_CORRECT_ENV=`$ECHO $MAKE_BUILT_FOR | $GREP $MAKE_EXPECTED_ENV`
15446         else
15447           # Not relevant for non-Windows
15448           IS_MAKE_CORRECT_ENV=true
15449         fi
15450         if test "x$IS_MAKE_CORRECT_ENV" = x; then
15451           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found GNU make version $MAKE_VERSION_STRING at $MAKE_CANDIDATE, but it is not for $MAKE_EXPECTED_ENV (it says: $MAKE_BUILT_FOR). Ignoring." >&5
15452 $as_echo "$as_me: Found GNU make version $MAKE_VERSION_STRING at $MAKE_CANDIDATE, but it is not for $MAKE_EXPECTED_ENV (it says: $MAKE_BUILT_FOR). Ignoring." >&6;}
15453         else
15454           FOUND_MAKE=$MAKE_CANDIDATE
15455 
15456   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
15457 
15458   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
15459   # space.
15460   complete="$FOUND_MAKE"
15461   path="${complete%% *}"
15462   tmp="$complete EOL"
15463   arguments="${tmp#* }"
15464 
15465   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
15466   # unix format.
15467   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
15468 
15469   # Now try to locate executable using which
15470   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
15471   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
15472   # to not find them
15473   if test "x$new_path" = x \
15474       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
15475       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
15476     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
15477   fi
15478   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
15479     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
15480     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
15481     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
15482     # argument.
15483     path="$complete"
15484     arguments="EOL"
15485     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
15486     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
15487     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
15488     # to not find them
15489     if test "x$new_path" = x \
15490         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
15491         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
15492       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
15493     fi
15494     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
15495       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
15496       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of FOUND_MAKE, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
15497 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of FOUND_MAKE, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
15498       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
15499       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
15500         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
15501 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
15502       fi
15503       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of FOUND_MAKE" "$LINENO" 5
15504     fi
15505   fi
15506 
15507   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
15508   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
15509   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
15510   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
15511   #
15512   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
15513   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
15514   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
15515   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
15516     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
15517     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
15518     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
15519       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
15520     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
15521       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
15522     else
15523       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of FOUND_MAKE, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
15524 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of FOUND_MAKE, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
15525       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
15526 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
15527       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of FOUND_MAKE" "$LINENO" 5
15528     fi
15529   else
15530     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
15531   fi
15532 
15533   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
15534   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
15535   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
15536 
15537   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
15538   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
15539   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
15540   # take no chances and rewrite it.
15541   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
15542   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
15543   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
15544     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
15545     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
15546     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
15547     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
15548       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
15549       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
15550       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
15551       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
15552       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
15553       new_path="$input_path"
15554     fi
15555   fi
15556 
15557   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
15558   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
15559     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
15560     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
15561       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
15562       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
15563       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
15564     fi
15565   fi
15566 
15567   # remove trailing .exe if any
15568   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
15569 
15570   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
15571 
15572   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
15573   # space.
15574   complete="$FOUND_MAKE"
15575   path="${complete%% *}"
15576   tmp="$complete EOL"
15577   arguments="${tmp#* }"
15578 
15579   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
15580   # unix format.
15581   new_path="$path"
15582 
15583   windows_path="$new_path"
15584   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
15585     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
15586     new_path="$unix_path"
15587   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
15588     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
15589     new_path="$unix_path"
15590   fi
15591 
15592 
15593   # Now try to locate executable using which
15594   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
15595 
15596   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
15597     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
15598     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
15599     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
15600     # argument.
15601     path="$complete"
15602     arguments="EOL"
15603     new_path="$path"
15604 
15605   windows_path="$new_path"
15606   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
15607     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
15608     new_path="$unix_path"
15609   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
15610     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
15611     new_path="$unix_path"
15612   fi
15613 
15614 
15615     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
15616     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
15617     # to not find them
15618     if test "x$new_path" = x \
15619         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
15620         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
15621       new_path="$path"
15622 
15623   windows_path="$new_path"
15624   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
15625     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
15626     new_path="$unix_path"
15627   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
15628     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
15629     new_path="$unix_path"
15630   fi
15631 
15632     fi
15633 
15634     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
15635       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
15636       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of FOUND_MAKE, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
15637 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of FOUND_MAKE, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
15638       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
15639       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
15640         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
15641 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
15642       fi
15643       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of FOUND_MAKE" "$LINENO" 5
15644     fi
15645   fi
15646 
15647   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
15648   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
15649     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
15650     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
15651     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
15652   else
15653     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
15654     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
15655 
15656   input_path="$new_path"
15657   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
15658   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
15659   # take no chances and rewrite it.
15660   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
15661   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
15662   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
15663     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
15664     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
15665   fi
15666 
15667     # Output is in $new_path
15668 
15669   windows_path="$new_path"
15670   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
15671     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
15672     new_path="$unix_path"
15673   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
15674     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
15675     new_path="$unix_path"
15676   fi
15677 
15678     # remove trailing .exe if any
15679     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
15680 
15681     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
15682     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
15683   fi
15684 
15685   else
15686     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
15687     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
15688     # space.
15689     complete="$FOUND_MAKE"
15690     path="${complete%% *}"
15691     tmp="$complete EOL"
15692     arguments="${tmp#* }"
15693 
15694     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
15695     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
15696     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
15697       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
15698       IFS_save="$IFS"
15699       IFS=:
15700       for p in $PATH; do
15701         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
15702           new_path="$p/$path"
15703           break
15704         fi
15705       done
15706       IFS="$IFS_save"
15707     else
15708       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
15709       new_path="$path"
15710     fi
15711 
15712     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
15713       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of FOUND_MAKE, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
15714 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of FOUND_MAKE, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
15715       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
15716       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
15717         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
15718 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
15719       fi
15720       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of FOUND_MAKE" "$LINENO" 5
15721     fi
15722   fi
15723 
15724   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
15725   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
15726     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
15727   else
15728     new_complete="$new_path"
15729   fi
15730 
15731   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
15732     FOUND_MAKE="$new_complete"
15733     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting FOUND_MAKE to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
15734 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting FOUND_MAKE to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
15735   fi
15736 
15737         fi
15738       fi
15739     fi
15740   fi
15741 
15742     if test "x$FOUND_MAKE" = x; then
15743       as_fn_error $? "The specified make (by MAKE=$MAKE) is not GNU make 3.81 or newer." "$LINENO" 5
15744     fi
15745   else
15746     # Try our hardest to locate a correct version of GNU make
15747     for ac_prog in gmake
15748 do
15749   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
15750 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
15751 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
15752 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
15753 if ${ac_cv_path_CHECK_GMAKE+:} false; then :
15754   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
15755 else
15756   case $CHECK_GMAKE in
15757   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
15758   ac_cv_path_CHECK_GMAKE="$CHECK_GMAKE" # Let the user override the test with a path.
15759   ;;
15760   *)
15761   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
15762 for as_dir in $PATH
15763 do
15764   IFS=$as_save_IFS
15765   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
15766     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
15767   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
15768     ac_cv_path_CHECK_GMAKE="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
15769     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
15770     break 2
15771   fi
15772 done
15773   done
15774 IFS=$as_save_IFS
15775 
15776   ;;
15777 esac
15778 fi
15779 CHECK_GMAKE=$ac_cv_path_CHECK_GMAKE
15780 if test -n "$CHECK_GMAKE"; then
15781   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $CHECK_GMAKE" >&5
15782 $as_echo "$CHECK_GMAKE" >&6; }
15783 else
15784   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
15785 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
15786 fi
15787 
15788 
15789   test -n "$CHECK_GMAKE" && break
15790 done
15791 
15792 
15793   MAKE_CANDIDATE=""$CHECK_GMAKE""
15794   DESCRIPTION="gmake in PATH"
15795   if test "x$MAKE_CANDIDATE" != x; then
15796     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Testing potential make at $MAKE_CANDIDATE, found using $DESCRIPTION" >&5
15797 $as_echo "$as_me: Testing potential make at $MAKE_CANDIDATE, found using $DESCRIPTION" >&6;}
15798     MAKE_VERSION_STRING=`$MAKE_CANDIDATE --version | $HEAD -n 1`
15799     IS_GNU_MAKE=`$ECHO $MAKE_VERSION_STRING | $GREP 'GNU Make'`
15800     if test "x$IS_GNU_MAKE" = x; then
15801       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found potential make at $MAKE_CANDIDATE, however, this is not GNU Make. Ignoring." >&5
15802 $as_echo "$as_me: Found potential make at $MAKE_CANDIDATE, however, this is not GNU Make. Ignoring." >&6;}
15803     else
15804       IS_MODERN_MAKE=`$ECHO $MAKE_VERSION_STRING | $GREP -e '3\.8[12]' -e '4\.'`
15805       if test "x$IS_MODERN_MAKE" = x; then
15806         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found GNU make at $MAKE_CANDIDATE, however this is not version 3.81 or later. (it is: $MAKE_VERSION_STRING). Ignoring." >&5
15807 $as_echo "$as_me: Found GNU make at $MAKE_CANDIDATE, however this is not version 3.81 or later. (it is: $MAKE_VERSION_STRING). Ignoring." >&6;}
15808       else
15809         if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS" = "xwindows"; then
15810           if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
15811             MAKE_EXPECTED_ENV='cygwin'
15812           elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
15813             MAKE_EXPECTED_ENV='msys'
15814           else
15815             as_fn_error $? "Unknown Windows environment" "$LINENO" 5
15816           fi
15817           MAKE_BUILT_FOR=`$MAKE_CANDIDATE --version | $GREP -i 'built for'`
15818           IS_MAKE_CORRECT_ENV=`$ECHO $MAKE_BUILT_FOR | $GREP $MAKE_EXPECTED_ENV`
15819         else
15820           # Not relevant for non-Windows
15821           IS_MAKE_CORRECT_ENV=true
15822         fi
15823         if test "x$IS_MAKE_CORRECT_ENV" = x; then
15824           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found GNU make version $MAKE_VERSION_STRING at $MAKE_CANDIDATE, but it is not for $MAKE_EXPECTED_ENV (it says: $MAKE_BUILT_FOR). Ignoring." >&5
15825 $as_echo "$as_me: Found GNU make version $MAKE_VERSION_STRING at $MAKE_CANDIDATE, but it is not for $MAKE_EXPECTED_ENV (it says: $MAKE_BUILT_FOR). Ignoring." >&6;}
15826         else
15827           FOUND_MAKE=$MAKE_CANDIDATE
15828 
15829   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
15830 
15831   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
15832   # space.
15833   complete="$FOUND_MAKE"
15834   path="${complete%% *}"
15835   tmp="$complete EOL"
15836   arguments="${tmp#* }"
15837 
15838   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
15839   # unix format.
15840   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
15841 
15842   # Now try to locate executable using which
15843   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
15844   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
15845   # to not find them
15846   if test "x$new_path" = x \
15847       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
15848       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
15849     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
15850   fi
15851   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
15852     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
15853     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
15854     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
15855     # argument.
15856     path="$complete"
15857     arguments="EOL"
15858     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
15859     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
15860     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
15861     # to not find them
15862     if test "x$new_path" = x \
15863         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
15864         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
15865       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
15866     fi
15867     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
15868       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
15869       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of FOUND_MAKE, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
15870 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of FOUND_MAKE, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
15871       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
15872       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
15873         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
15874 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
15875       fi
15876       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of FOUND_MAKE" "$LINENO" 5
15877     fi
15878   fi
15879 
15880   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
15881   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
15882   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
15883   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
15884   #
15885   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
15886   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
15887   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
15888   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
15889     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
15890     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
15891     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
15892       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
15893     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
15894       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
15895     else
15896       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of FOUND_MAKE, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
15897 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of FOUND_MAKE, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
15898       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
15899 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
15900       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of FOUND_MAKE" "$LINENO" 5
15901     fi
15902   else
15903     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
15904   fi
15905 
15906   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
15907   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
15908   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
15909 
15910   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
15911   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
15912   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
15913   # take no chances and rewrite it.
15914   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
15915   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
15916   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
15917     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
15918     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
15919     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
15920     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
15921       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
15922       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
15923       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
15924       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
15925       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
15926       new_path="$input_path"
15927     fi
15928   fi
15929 
15930   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
15931   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
15932     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
15933     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
15934       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
15935       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
15936       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
15937     fi
15938   fi
15939 
15940   # remove trailing .exe if any
15941   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
15942 
15943   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
15944 
15945   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
15946   # space.
15947   complete="$FOUND_MAKE"
15948   path="${complete%% *}"
15949   tmp="$complete EOL"
15950   arguments="${tmp#* }"
15951 
15952   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
15953   # unix format.
15954   new_path="$path"
15955 
15956   windows_path="$new_path"
15957   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
15958     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
15959     new_path="$unix_path"
15960   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
15961     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
15962     new_path="$unix_path"
15963   fi
15964 
15965 
15966   # Now try to locate executable using which
15967   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
15968 
15969   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
15970     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
15971     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
15972     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
15973     # argument.
15974     path="$complete"
15975     arguments="EOL"
15976     new_path="$path"
15977 
15978   windows_path="$new_path"
15979   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
15980     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
15981     new_path="$unix_path"
15982   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
15983     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
15984     new_path="$unix_path"
15985   fi
15986 
15987 
15988     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
15989     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
15990     # to not find them
15991     if test "x$new_path" = x \
15992         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
15993         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
15994       new_path="$path"
15995 
15996   windows_path="$new_path"
15997   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
15998     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
15999     new_path="$unix_path"
16000   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
16001     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
16002     new_path="$unix_path"
16003   fi
16004 
16005     fi
16006 
16007     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
16008       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
16009       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of FOUND_MAKE, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
16010 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of FOUND_MAKE, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
16011       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
16012       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
16013         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
16014 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
16015       fi
16016       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of FOUND_MAKE" "$LINENO" 5
16017     fi
16018   fi
16019 
16020   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
16021   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
16022     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
16023     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
16024     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
16025   else
16026     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
16027     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
16028 
16029   input_path="$new_path"
16030   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
16031   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
16032   # take no chances and rewrite it.
16033   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
16034   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
16035   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
16036     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
16037     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
16038   fi
16039 
16040     # Output is in $new_path
16041 
16042   windows_path="$new_path"
16043   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
16044     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
16045     new_path="$unix_path"
16046   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
16047     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
16048     new_path="$unix_path"
16049   fi
16050 
16051     # remove trailing .exe if any
16052     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
16053 
16054     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
16055     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
16056   fi
16057 
16058   else
16059     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
16060     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
16061     # space.
16062     complete="$FOUND_MAKE"
16063     path="${complete%% *}"
16064     tmp="$complete EOL"
16065     arguments="${tmp#* }"
16066 
16067     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
16068     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
16069     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
16070       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
16071       IFS_save="$IFS"
16072       IFS=:
16073       for p in $PATH; do
16074         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
16075           new_path="$p/$path"
16076           break
16077         fi
16078       done
16079       IFS="$IFS_save"
16080     else
16081       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
16082       new_path="$path"
16083     fi
16084 
16085     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
16086       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of FOUND_MAKE, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
16087 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of FOUND_MAKE, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
16088       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
16089       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
16090         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
16091 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
16092       fi
16093       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of FOUND_MAKE" "$LINENO" 5
16094     fi
16095   fi
16096 
16097   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
16098   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
16099     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
16100   else
16101     new_complete="$new_path"
16102   fi
16103 
16104   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
16105     FOUND_MAKE="$new_complete"
16106     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting FOUND_MAKE to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
16107 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting FOUND_MAKE to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
16108   fi
16109 
16110         fi
16111       fi
16112     fi
16113   fi
16114 
16115 
16116     if test "x$FOUND_MAKE" = x; then
16117       for ac_prog in make
16118 do
16119   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
16120 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
16121 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
16122 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
16123 if ${ac_cv_path_CHECK_MAKE+:} false; then :
16124   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
16125 else
16126   case $CHECK_MAKE in
16127   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
16128   ac_cv_path_CHECK_MAKE="$CHECK_MAKE" # Let the user override the test with a path.
16129   ;;
16130   *)
16131   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
16132 for as_dir in $PATH
16133 do
16134   IFS=$as_save_IFS
16135   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
16136     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
16137   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
16138     ac_cv_path_CHECK_MAKE="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
16139     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
16140     break 2
16141   fi
16142 done
16143   done
16144 IFS=$as_save_IFS
16145 
16146   ;;
16147 esac
16148 fi
16149 CHECK_MAKE=$ac_cv_path_CHECK_MAKE
16150 if test -n "$CHECK_MAKE"; then
16151   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $CHECK_MAKE" >&5
16152 $as_echo "$CHECK_MAKE" >&6; }
16153 else
16154   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
16155 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
16156 fi
16157 
16158 
16159   test -n "$CHECK_MAKE" && break
16160 done
16161 
16162 
16163   MAKE_CANDIDATE=""$CHECK_MAKE""
16164   DESCRIPTION="make in PATH"
16165   if test "x$MAKE_CANDIDATE" != x; then
16166     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Testing potential make at $MAKE_CANDIDATE, found using $DESCRIPTION" >&5
16167 $as_echo "$as_me: Testing potential make at $MAKE_CANDIDATE, found using $DESCRIPTION" >&6;}
16168     MAKE_VERSION_STRING=`$MAKE_CANDIDATE --version | $HEAD -n 1`
16169     IS_GNU_MAKE=`$ECHO $MAKE_VERSION_STRING | $GREP 'GNU Make'`
16170     if test "x$IS_GNU_MAKE" = x; then
16171       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found potential make at $MAKE_CANDIDATE, however, this is not GNU Make. Ignoring." >&5
16172 $as_echo "$as_me: Found potential make at $MAKE_CANDIDATE, however, this is not GNU Make. Ignoring." >&6;}
16173     else
16174       IS_MODERN_MAKE=`$ECHO $MAKE_VERSION_STRING | $GREP -e '3\.8[12]' -e '4\.'`
16175       if test "x$IS_MODERN_MAKE" = x; then
16176         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found GNU make at $MAKE_CANDIDATE, however this is not version 3.81 or later. (it is: $MAKE_VERSION_STRING). Ignoring." >&5
16177 $as_echo "$as_me: Found GNU make at $MAKE_CANDIDATE, however this is not version 3.81 or later. (it is: $MAKE_VERSION_STRING). Ignoring." >&6;}
16178       else
16179         if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS" = "xwindows"; then
16180           if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
16181             MAKE_EXPECTED_ENV='cygwin'
16182           elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
16183             MAKE_EXPECTED_ENV='msys'
16184           else
16185             as_fn_error $? "Unknown Windows environment" "$LINENO" 5
16186           fi
16187           MAKE_BUILT_FOR=`$MAKE_CANDIDATE --version | $GREP -i 'built for'`
16188           IS_MAKE_CORRECT_ENV=`$ECHO $MAKE_BUILT_FOR | $GREP $MAKE_EXPECTED_ENV`
16189         else
16190           # Not relevant for non-Windows
16191           IS_MAKE_CORRECT_ENV=true
16192         fi
16193         if test "x$IS_MAKE_CORRECT_ENV" = x; then
16194           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found GNU make version $MAKE_VERSION_STRING at $MAKE_CANDIDATE, but it is not for $MAKE_EXPECTED_ENV (it says: $MAKE_BUILT_FOR). Ignoring." >&5
16195 $as_echo "$as_me: Found GNU make version $MAKE_VERSION_STRING at $MAKE_CANDIDATE, but it is not for $MAKE_EXPECTED_ENV (it says: $MAKE_BUILT_FOR). Ignoring." >&6;}
16196         else
16197           FOUND_MAKE=$MAKE_CANDIDATE
16198 
16199   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
16200 
16201   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
16202   # space.
16203   complete="$FOUND_MAKE"
16204   path="${complete%% *}"
16205   tmp="$complete EOL"
16206   arguments="${tmp#* }"
16207 
16208   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
16209   # unix format.
16210   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
16211 
16212   # Now try to locate executable using which
16213   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
16214   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
16215   # to not find them
16216   if test "x$new_path" = x \
16217       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
16218       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
16219     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
16220   fi
16221   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
16222     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
16223     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
16224     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
16225     # argument.
16226     path="$complete"
16227     arguments="EOL"
16228     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
16229     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
16230     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
16231     # to not find them
16232     if test "x$new_path" = x \
16233         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
16234         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
16235       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
16236     fi
16237     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
16238       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
16239       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of FOUND_MAKE, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
16240 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of FOUND_MAKE, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
16241       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
16242       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
16243         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
16244 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
16245       fi
16246       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of FOUND_MAKE" "$LINENO" 5
16247     fi
16248   fi
16249 
16250   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
16251   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
16252   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
16253   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
16254   #
16255   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
16256   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
16257   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
16258   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
16259     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
16260     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
16261     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
16262       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
16263     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
16264       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
16265     else
16266       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of FOUND_MAKE, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
16267 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of FOUND_MAKE, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
16268       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
16269 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
16270       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of FOUND_MAKE" "$LINENO" 5
16271     fi
16272   else
16273     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
16274   fi
16275 
16276   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
16277   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
16278   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
16279 
16280   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
16281   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
16282   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
16283   # take no chances and rewrite it.
16284   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
16285   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
16286   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
16287     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
16288     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
16289     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
16290     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
16291       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
16292       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
16293       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
16294       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
16295       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
16296       new_path="$input_path"
16297     fi
16298   fi
16299 
16300   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
16301   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
16302     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
16303     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
16304       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
16305       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
16306       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
16307     fi
16308   fi
16309 
16310   # remove trailing .exe if any
16311   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
16312 
16313   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
16314 
16315   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
16316   # space.
16317   complete="$FOUND_MAKE"
16318   path="${complete%% *}"
16319   tmp="$complete EOL"
16320   arguments="${tmp#* }"
16321 
16322   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
16323   # unix format.
16324   new_path="$path"
16325 
16326   windows_path="$new_path"
16327   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
16328     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
16329     new_path="$unix_path"
16330   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
16331     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
16332     new_path="$unix_path"
16333   fi
16334 
16335 
16336   # Now try to locate executable using which
16337   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
16338 
16339   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
16340     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
16341     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
16342     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
16343     # argument.
16344     path="$complete"
16345     arguments="EOL"
16346     new_path="$path"
16347 
16348   windows_path="$new_path"
16349   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
16350     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
16351     new_path="$unix_path"
16352   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
16353     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
16354     new_path="$unix_path"
16355   fi
16356 
16357 
16358     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
16359     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
16360     # to not find them
16361     if test "x$new_path" = x \
16362         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
16363         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
16364       new_path="$path"
16365 
16366   windows_path="$new_path"
16367   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
16368     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
16369     new_path="$unix_path"
16370   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
16371     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
16372     new_path="$unix_path"
16373   fi
16374 
16375     fi
16376 
16377     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
16378       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
16379       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of FOUND_MAKE, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
16380 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of FOUND_MAKE, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
16381       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
16382       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
16383         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
16384 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
16385       fi
16386       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of FOUND_MAKE" "$LINENO" 5
16387     fi
16388   fi
16389 
16390   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
16391   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
16392     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
16393     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
16394     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
16395   else
16396     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
16397     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
16398 
16399   input_path="$new_path"
16400   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
16401   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
16402   # take no chances and rewrite it.
16403   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
16404   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
16405   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
16406     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
16407     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
16408   fi
16409 
16410     # Output is in $new_path
16411 
16412   windows_path="$new_path"
16413   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
16414     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
16415     new_path="$unix_path"
16416   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
16417     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
16418     new_path="$unix_path"
16419   fi
16420 
16421     # remove trailing .exe if any
16422     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
16423 
16424     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
16425     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
16426   fi
16427 
16428   else
16429     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
16430     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
16431     # space.
16432     complete="$FOUND_MAKE"
16433     path="${complete%% *}"
16434     tmp="$complete EOL"
16435     arguments="${tmp#* }"
16436 
16437     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
16438     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
16439     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
16440       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
16441       IFS_save="$IFS"
16442       IFS=:
16443       for p in $PATH; do
16444         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
16445           new_path="$p/$path"
16446           break
16447         fi
16448       done
16449       IFS="$IFS_save"
16450     else
16451       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
16452       new_path="$path"
16453     fi
16454 
16455     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
16456       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of FOUND_MAKE, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
16457 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of FOUND_MAKE, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
16458       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
16459       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
16460         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
16461 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
16462       fi
16463       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of FOUND_MAKE" "$LINENO" 5
16464     fi
16465   fi
16466 
16467   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
16468   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
16469     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
16470   else
16471     new_complete="$new_path"
16472   fi
16473 
16474   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
16475     FOUND_MAKE="$new_complete"
16476     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting FOUND_MAKE to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
16477 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting FOUND_MAKE to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
16478   fi
16479 
16480         fi
16481       fi
16482     fi
16483   fi
16484 
16485     fi
16486 
16487     if test "x$FOUND_MAKE" = x; then
16488       if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_PATH" != x; then
16489         # We have a toolchain path, check that as well before giving up.
16490         OLD_PATH=$PATH
16491         PATH=$TOOLCHAIN_PATH:$PATH
16492         for ac_prog in gmake
16493 do
16494   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
16495 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
16496 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
16497 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
16498 if ${ac_cv_path_CHECK_TOOLSDIR_GMAKE+:} false; then :
16499   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
16500 else
16501   case $CHECK_TOOLSDIR_GMAKE in
16502   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
16503   ac_cv_path_CHECK_TOOLSDIR_GMAKE="$CHECK_TOOLSDIR_GMAKE" # Let the user override the test with a path.
16504   ;;
16505   *)
16506   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
16507 for as_dir in $PATH
16508 do
16509   IFS=$as_save_IFS
16510   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
16511     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
16512   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
16513     ac_cv_path_CHECK_TOOLSDIR_GMAKE="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
16514     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
16515     break 2
16516   fi
16517 done
16518   done
16519 IFS=$as_save_IFS
16520 
16521   ;;
16522 esac
16523 fi
16524 CHECK_TOOLSDIR_GMAKE=$ac_cv_path_CHECK_TOOLSDIR_GMAKE
16525 if test -n "$CHECK_TOOLSDIR_GMAKE"; then
16526   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $CHECK_TOOLSDIR_GMAKE" >&5
16527 $as_echo "$CHECK_TOOLSDIR_GMAKE" >&6; }
16528 else
16529   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
16530 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
16531 fi
16532 
16533 
16534   test -n "$CHECK_TOOLSDIR_GMAKE" && break
16535 done
16536 
16537 
16538   MAKE_CANDIDATE=""$CHECK_TOOLSDIR_GMAKE""
16539   DESCRIPTION="gmake in tools-dir"
16540   if test "x$MAKE_CANDIDATE" != x; then
16541     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Testing potential make at $MAKE_CANDIDATE, found using $DESCRIPTION" >&5
16542 $as_echo "$as_me: Testing potential make at $MAKE_CANDIDATE, found using $DESCRIPTION" >&6;}
16543     MAKE_VERSION_STRING=`$MAKE_CANDIDATE --version | $HEAD -n 1`
16544     IS_GNU_MAKE=`$ECHO $MAKE_VERSION_STRING | $GREP 'GNU Make'`
16545     if test "x$IS_GNU_MAKE" = x; then
16546       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found potential make at $MAKE_CANDIDATE, however, this is not GNU Make. Ignoring." >&5
16547 $as_echo "$as_me: Found potential make at $MAKE_CANDIDATE, however, this is not GNU Make. Ignoring." >&6;}
16548     else
16549       IS_MODERN_MAKE=`$ECHO $MAKE_VERSION_STRING | $GREP -e '3\.8[12]' -e '4\.'`
16550       if test "x$IS_MODERN_MAKE" = x; then
16551         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found GNU make at $MAKE_CANDIDATE, however this is not version 3.81 or later. (it is: $MAKE_VERSION_STRING). Ignoring." >&5
16552 $as_echo "$as_me: Found GNU make at $MAKE_CANDIDATE, however this is not version 3.81 or later. (it is: $MAKE_VERSION_STRING). Ignoring." >&6;}
16553       else
16554         if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS" = "xwindows"; then
16555           if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
16556             MAKE_EXPECTED_ENV='cygwin'
16557           elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
16558             MAKE_EXPECTED_ENV='msys'
16559           else
16560             as_fn_error $? "Unknown Windows environment" "$LINENO" 5
16561           fi
16562           MAKE_BUILT_FOR=`$MAKE_CANDIDATE --version | $GREP -i 'built for'`
16563           IS_MAKE_CORRECT_ENV=`$ECHO $MAKE_BUILT_FOR | $GREP $MAKE_EXPECTED_ENV`
16564         else
16565           # Not relevant for non-Windows
16566           IS_MAKE_CORRECT_ENV=true
16567         fi
16568         if test "x$IS_MAKE_CORRECT_ENV" = x; then
16569           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found GNU make version $MAKE_VERSION_STRING at $MAKE_CANDIDATE, but it is not for $MAKE_EXPECTED_ENV (it says: $MAKE_BUILT_FOR). Ignoring." >&5
16570 $as_echo "$as_me: Found GNU make version $MAKE_VERSION_STRING at $MAKE_CANDIDATE, but it is not for $MAKE_EXPECTED_ENV (it says: $MAKE_BUILT_FOR). Ignoring." >&6;}
16571         else
16572           FOUND_MAKE=$MAKE_CANDIDATE
16573 
16574   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
16575 
16576   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
16577   # space.
16578   complete="$FOUND_MAKE"
16579   path="${complete%% *}"
16580   tmp="$complete EOL"
16581   arguments="${tmp#* }"
16582 
16583   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
16584   # unix format.
16585   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
16586 
16587   # Now try to locate executable using which
16588   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
16589   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
16590   # to not find them
16591   if test "x$new_path" = x \
16592       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
16593       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
16594     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
16595   fi
16596   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
16597     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
16598     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
16599     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
16600     # argument.
16601     path="$complete"
16602     arguments="EOL"
16603     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
16604     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
16605     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
16606     # to not find them
16607     if test "x$new_path" = x \
16608         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
16609         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
16610       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
16611     fi
16612     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
16613       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
16614       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of FOUND_MAKE, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
16615 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of FOUND_MAKE, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
16616       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
16617       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
16618         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
16619 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
16620       fi
16621       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of FOUND_MAKE" "$LINENO" 5
16622     fi
16623   fi
16624 
16625   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
16626   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
16627   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
16628   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
16629   #
16630   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
16631   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
16632   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
16633   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
16634     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
16635     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
16636     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
16637       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
16638     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
16639       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
16640     else
16641       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of FOUND_MAKE, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
16642 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of FOUND_MAKE, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
16643       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
16644 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
16645       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of FOUND_MAKE" "$LINENO" 5
16646     fi
16647   else
16648     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
16649   fi
16650 
16651   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
16652   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
16653   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
16654 
16655   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
16656   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
16657   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
16658   # take no chances and rewrite it.
16659   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
16660   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
16661   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
16662     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
16663     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
16664     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
16665     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
16666       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
16667       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
16668       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
16669       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
16670       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
16671       new_path="$input_path"
16672     fi
16673   fi
16674 
16675   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
16676   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
16677     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
16678     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
16679       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
16680       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
16681       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
16682     fi
16683   fi
16684 
16685   # remove trailing .exe if any
16686   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
16687 
16688   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
16689 
16690   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
16691   # space.
16692   complete="$FOUND_MAKE"
16693   path="${complete%% *}"
16694   tmp="$complete EOL"
16695   arguments="${tmp#* }"
16696 
16697   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
16698   # unix format.
16699   new_path="$path"
16700 
16701   windows_path="$new_path"
16702   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
16703     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
16704     new_path="$unix_path"
16705   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
16706     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
16707     new_path="$unix_path"
16708   fi
16709 
16710 
16711   # Now try to locate executable using which
16712   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
16713 
16714   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
16715     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
16716     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
16717     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
16718     # argument.
16719     path="$complete"
16720     arguments="EOL"
16721     new_path="$path"
16722 
16723   windows_path="$new_path"
16724   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
16725     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
16726     new_path="$unix_path"
16727   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
16728     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
16729     new_path="$unix_path"
16730   fi
16731 
16732 
16733     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
16734     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
16735     # to not find them
16736     if test "x$new_path" = x \
16737         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
16738         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
16739       new_path="$path"
16740 
16741   windows_path="$new_path"
16742   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
16743     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
16744     new_path="$unix_path"
16745   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
16746     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
16747     new_path="$unix_path"
16748   fi
16749 
16750     fi
16751 
16752     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
16753       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
16754       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of FOUND_MAKE, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
16755 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of FOUND_MAKE, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
16756       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
16757       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
16758         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
16759 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
16760       fi
16761       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of FOUND_MAKE" "$LINENO" 5
16762     fi
16763   fi
16764 
16765   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
16766   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
16767     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
16768     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
16769     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
16770   else
16771     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
16772     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
16773 
16774   input_path="$new_path"
16775   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
16776   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
16777   # take no chances and rewrite it.
16778   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
16779   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
16780   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
16781     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
16782     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
16783   fi
16784 
16785     # Output is in $new_path
16786 
16787   windows_path="$new_path"
16788   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
16789     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
16790     new_path="$unix_path"
16791   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
16792     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
16793     new_path="$unix_path"
16794   fi
16795 
16796     # remove trailing .exe if any
16797     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
16798 
16799     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
16800     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
16801   fi
16802 
16803   else
16804     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
16805     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
16806     # space.
16807     complete="$FOUND_MAKE"
16808     path="${complete%% *}"
16809     tmp="$complete EOL"
16810     arguments="${tmp#* }"
16811 
16812     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
16813     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
16814     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
16815       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
16816       IFS_save="$IFS"
16817       IFS=:
16818       for p in $PATH; do
16819         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
16820           new_path="$p/$path"
16821           break
16822         fi
16823       done
16824       IFS="$IFS_save"
16825     else
16826       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
16827       new_path="$path"
16828     fi
16829 
16830     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
16831       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of FOUND_MAKE, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
16832 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of FOUND_MAKE, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
16833       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
16834       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
16835         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
16836 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
16837       fi
16838       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of FOUND_MAKE" "$LINENO" 5
16839     fi
16840   fi
16841 
16842   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
16843   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
16844     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
16845   else
16846     new_complete="$new_path"
16847   fi
16848 
16849   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
16850     FOUND_MAKE="$new_complete"
16851     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting FOUND_MAKE to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
16852 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting FOUND_MAKE to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
16853   fi
16854 
16855         fi
16856       fi
16857     fi
16858   fi
16859 
16860         if test "x$FOUND_MAKE" = x; then
16861           for ac_prog in make
16862 do
16863   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
16864 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
16865 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
16866 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
16867 if ${ac_cv_path_CHECK_TOOLSDIR_MAKE+:} false; then :
16868   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
16869 else
16870   case $CHECK_TOOLSDIR_MAKE in
16871   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
16872   ac_cv_path_CHECK_TOOLSDIR_MAKE="$CHECK_TOOLSDIR_MAKE" # Let the user override the test with a path.
16873   ;;
16874   *)
16875   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
16876 for as_dir in $PATH
16877 do
16878   IFS=$as_save_IFS
16879   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
16880     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
16881   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
16882     ac_cv_path_CHECK_TOOLSDIR_MAKE="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
16883     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
16884     break 2
16885   fi
16886 done
16887   done
16888 IFS=$as_save_IFS
16889 
16890   ;;
16891 esac
16892 fi
16893 CHECK_TOOLSDIR_MAKE=$ac_cv_path_CHECK_TOOLSDIR_MAKE
16894 if test -n "$CHECK_TOOLSDIR_MAKE"; then
16895   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $CHECK_TOOLSDIR_MAKE" >&5
16896 $as_echo "$CHECK_TOOLSDIR_MAKE" >&6; }
16897 else
16898   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
16899 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
16900 fi
16901 
16902 
16903   test -n "$CHECK_TOOLSDIR_MAKE" && break
16904 done
16905 
16906 
16907   MAKE_CANDIDATE=""$CHECK_TOOLSDIR_MAKE""
16908   DESCRIPTION="make in tools-dir"
16909   if test "x$MAKE_CANDIDATE" != x; then
16910     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Testing potential make at $MAKE_CANDIDATE, found using $DESCRIPTION" >&5
16911 $as_echo "$as_me: Testing potential make at $MAKE_CANDIDATE, found using $DESCRIPTION" >&6;}
16912     MAKE_VERSION_STRING=`$MAKE_CANDIDATE --version | $HEAD -n 1`
16913     IS_GNU_MAKE=`$ECHO $MAKE_VERSION_STRING | $GREP 'GNU Make'`
16914     if test "x$IS_GNU_MAKE" = x; then
16915       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found potential make at $MAKE_CANDIDATE, however, this is not GNU Make. Ignoring." >&5
