19559   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
19560     ac_cv_path_CODESIGN="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
19561     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
19562     break 2
19563   fi
19564 done
19565   done
19566 IFS=$as_save_IFS
19567 
19568   ;;
19569 esac
19570 fi
19571 CODESIGN=$ac_cv_path_CODESIGN
19572 if test -n "$CODESIGN"; then
19573   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $CODESIGN" >&5
19574 $as_echo "$CODESIGN" >&6; }
19575 else
19576   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
19577 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
19578 fi
19579 
19580 
19581         if test "x$CODESIGN" = x; then
19582           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
19583         fi
19584       else
19585         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
19586         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool CODESIGN=$tool_specified" >&5
19587 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool CODESIGN=$tool_specified" >&6;}
19588         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for CODESIGN" >&5
19589 $as_echo_n "checking for CODESIGN... " >&6; }
19590         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
19591           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
19592 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
19593           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool CODESIGN=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
19594         fi
19595         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
19596 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
19597       fi
19598     fi
19599   fi
19600 
19601 
19602     if test "x$CODESIGN" != "x"; then
19603       # Verify that the openjdk_codesign certificate is present
19604       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if openjdk_codesign certificate is present" >&5
19605 $as_echo_n "checking if openjdk_codesign certificate is present... " >&6; }
19606       rm -f codesign-testfile
19607       touch codesign-testfile
19608       codesign -s openjdk_codesign codesign-testfile 2>&5 >&5 || CODESIGN=
19609       rm -f codesign-testfile
19610       if test "x$CODESIGN" = x; then
19611         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
19612 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
19613       else
19614         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes" >&5
19615 $as_echo "yes" >&6; }
19616       fi
19617     fi
19618   fi
19619 
19620 
19621   # Test if bash supports pipefail.
19622   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if bash supports pipefail" >&5
19623 $as_echo_n "checking if bash supports pipefail... " >&6; }
19624   if ${BASH} -c 'set -o pipefail'; then
19625     BASH_ARGS="$BASH_ARGS -o pipefail"
19626     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes" >&5
19627 $as_echo "yes" >&6; }
19628   else
19629     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
19630 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
19631   fi
19632 
19633   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if bash supports errexit (-e)" >&5
19634 $as_echo_n "checking if bash supports errexit (-e)... " >&6; }
19635   if ${BASH} -e -c 'true'; then
19636     BASH_ARGS="$BASH_ARGS -e"
19637     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes" >&5
19638 $as_echo "yes" >&6; }
19639   else
19640     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
19641 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
19642   fi
19643 
19644 
19645 
19646 
19647 # Check if pkg-config is available.
19648 
19649 
19650 if test "x$ac_cv_env_PKG_CONFIG_set" != "xset"; then
19651         if test -n "$ac_tool_prefix"; then
19652   # Extract the first word of "${ac_tool_prefix}pkg-config", so it can be a program name with args.
19653 set dummy ${ac_tool_prefix}pkg-config; ac_word=$2
19654 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
19655 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
19656 if ${ac_cv_path_PKG_CONFIG+:} false; then :
19657   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
19658 else
19659   case $PKG_CONFIG in
19660   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
19661   ac_cv_path_PKG_CONFIG="$PKG_CONFIG" # Let the user override the test with a path.
19662   ;;
19663   *)
19664   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
19665 for as_dir in $PATH
19666 do
19667   IFS=$as_save_IFS
19668   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
19669     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
19670   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
19671     ac_cv_path_PKG_CONFIG="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
19672     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
19673     break 2
19674   fi
19675 done
19676   done
19677 IFS=$as_save_IFS
19678 
19679   ;;
19680 esac
19681 fi
19682 PKG_CONFIG=$ac_cv_path_PKG_CONFIG
19683 if test -n "$PKG_CONFIG"; then
19684   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $PKG_CONFIG" >&5
19685 $as_echo "$PKG_CONFIG" >&6; }
19686 else
19687   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
19688 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
19689 fi
19690 
19691 
19692 fi
19693 if test -z "$ac_cv_path_PKG_CONFIG"; then
19694   ac_pt_PKG_CONFIG=$PKG_CONFIG
19695   # Extract the first word of "pkg-config", so it can be a program name with args.
19696 set dummy pkg-config; ac_word=$2
19697 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
19698 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
19699 if ${ac_cv_path_ac_pt_PKG_CONFIG+:} false; then :
19700   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
19701 else
19702   case $ac_pt_PKG_CONFIG in
19703   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
19704   ac_cv_path_ac_pt_PKG_CONFIG="$ac_pt_PKG_CONFIG" # Let the user override the test with a path.
19705   ;;
19706   *)
19707   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
19708 for as_dir in $PATH
19709 do
19710   IFS=$as_save_IFS
19711   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
19712     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
19713   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
19714     ac_cv_path_ac_pt_PKG_CONFIG="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
19715     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
19716     break 2
19717   fi
19718 done
19719   done
19720 IFS=$as_save_IFS
19721 
19722   ;;
19723 esac
19724 fi
19725 ac_pt_PKG_CONFIG=$ac_cv_path_ac_pt_PKG_CONFIG
19726 if test -n "$ac_pt_PKG_CONFIG"; then
19727   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_pt_PKG_CONFIG" >&5
19728 $as_echo "$ac_pt_PKG_CONFIG" >&6; }
19729 else
19730   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
19731 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
19732 fi
19733 
19734   if test "x$ac_pt_PKG_CONFIG" = x; then
19735     PKG_CONFIG=""
19736   else
19737     case $cross_compiling:$ac_tool_warned in
19738 yes:)
19739 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&5
19740 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&2;}
19741 ac_tool_warned=yes ;;
19742 esac
19743     PKG_CONFIG=$ac_pt_PKG_CONFIG
19744   fi
19745 else
19746   PKG_CONFIG="$ac_cv_path_PKG_CONFIG"
19747 fi
19748 
19749 fi
19750 if test -n "$PKG_CONFIG"; then
19751         _pkg_min_version=0.9.0
19752         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking pkg-config is at least version $_pkg_min_version" >&5
19753 $as_echo_n "checking pkg-config is at least version $_pkg_min_version... " >&6; }
19754         if $PKG_CONFIG --atleast-pkgconfig-version $_pkg_min_version; then
19755                 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes" >&5
19756 $as_echo "yes" >&6; }
19757         else
19758                 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
19759 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
19760                 PKG_CONFIG=""
19761         fi
19762 
19763 fi
19764 
19765 # After basic tools have been setup, we can check build os specific details.
19766 
19767   ###############################################################################
19768 
19769   # Note that this is the build platform OS version!
19770 
19771   OS_VERSION="`uname -r | ${SED} 's!\.! !g' | ${SED} 's!-! !g'`"
19772   OS_VERSION_MAJOR="`${ECHO} ${OS_VERSION} | ${CUT} -f 1 -d ' '`"
19773   OS_VERSION_MINOR="`${ECHO} ${OS_VERSION} | ${CUT} -f 2 -d ' '`"
19774   OS_VERSION_MICRO="`${ECHO} ${OS_VERSION} | ${CUT} -f 3 -d ' '`"
19775 
19776 
19777 
19778 
19779 
19780 # Setup builddeps, for automatic downloading of tools we need.
19781 # This is needed before we can call BDEPS_CHECK_MODULE, which is done in
19782 # boot-jdk setup, but we need to have basic tools setup first.
19783 
19784 
19785 # Check whether --with-builddeps-conf was given.
19786 if test "${with_builddeps_conf+set}" = set; then :
19787   withval=$with_builddeps_conf;
19788 fi
19789 
19790 
19791 
19792 # Check whether --with-builddeps-server was given.
19793 if test "${with_builddeps_server+set}" = set; then :
19794   withval=$with_builddeps_server;
19795 fi
19796 
19797 
19798 
19799 # Check whether --with-builddeps-dir was given.
19800 if test "${with_builddeps_dir+set}" = set; then :
19801   withval=$with_builddeps_dir;
19802 else
19803   with_builddeps_dir=/localhome/builddeps
19804 fi
19805 
19806 
19807 
19808 # Check whether --with-builddeps-group was given.
19809 if test "${with_builddeps_group+set}" = set; then :
19810   withval=$with_builddeps_group;
19811 fi
19812 
19813 
19814 
19815 
19816   if test "x$with_builddeps_server" != x || test "x$with_builddeps_conf" != x; then
19817     if test "x$with_builddeps_conf" != x; then
19818       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for supplied builddeps configuration file" >&5
19819 $as_echo_n "checking for supplied builddeps configuration file... " >&6; }
19820       builddepsfile=$with_builddeps_conf
19821       if test -s $builddepsfile; then
19822         . $builddepsfile
19823         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: loaded!" >&5
19824 $as_echo "loaded!" >&6; }
19825       else
19826         as_fn_error $? "The given builddeps conf file $with_builddeps_conf could not be loaded!" "$LINENO" 5
19827       fi
19828     else
19829       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for builddeps.conf files in sources..." >&5
19830 $as_echo_n "checking for builddeps.conf files in sources...... " >&6; }
19831       builddepsfile=`mktemp`
19832       touch $builddepsfile
19833       # Put all found confs into a single file.
19834       find ${SRC_ROOT} -name builddeps.conf -exec cat \{\} \; >> $builddepsfile
19835       # Source the file to acquire the variables
19836       if test -s $builddepsfile; then
19837         . $builddepsfile
19838         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: found at least one!" >&5
19839 $as_echo "found at least one!" >&6; }
19840       else
19841         as_fn_error $? "Could not find any builddeps.conf at all!" "$LINENO" 5
19842       fi
19843     fi
19844     # Create build and target names that use _ instead of "-" and ".".
19845     # This is necessary to use them in variable names.
19846     build_var=`echo ${OPENJDK_BUILD_AUTOCONF_NAME} | tr '-' '_' | tr '.' '_'`
19847     target_var=`echo ${OPENJDK_TARGET_AUTOCONF_NAME} | tr '-' '_' | tr '.' '_'`
19848     # Extract rewrite information for build and target
19849     eval rewritten_build=\${REWRITE_${build_var}}
19850     if test "x$rewritten_build" = x; then
19851       rewritten_build=${OPENJDK_BUILD_AUTOCONF_NAME}
19852       echo Build stays the same $rewritten_build
19853     else
19854       echo Rewriting build for builddeps into $rewritten_build
19855     fi
19856     eval rewritten_target=\${REWRITE_${target_var}}
19857     if test "x$rewritten_target" = x; then
19858       rewritten_target=${OPENJDK_TARGET_AUTOCONF_NAME}
19859       echo Target stays the same $rewritten_target
19860     else
19861       echo Rewriting target for builddeps into $rewritten_target
19862     fi
19863     rewritten_build_var=`echo ${rewritten_build} | tr '-' '_' | tr '.' '_'`
19864     rewritten_target_var=`echo ${rewritten_target} | tr '-' '_' | tr '.' '_'`
19865   fi
19866   for ac_prog in 7z unzip
19867 do
19868   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
19869 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
19870 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
19871 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
19872 if ${ac_cv_prog_BDEPS_UNZIP+:} false; then :
19873   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
19874 else
19875   if test -n "$BDEPS_UNZIP"; then
19876   ac_cv_prog_BDEPS_UNZIP="$BDEPS_UNZIP" # Let the user override the test.
19877 else
19878 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
19879 for as_dir in $PATH
19880 do
19881   IFS=$as_save_IFS
19882   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
19883     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
19884   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
19885     ac_cv_prog_BDEPS_UNZIP="$ac_prog"
19886     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
19887     break 2
19888   fi
19889 done
19890   done
19891 IFS=$as_save_IFS
19892 
19893 fi
19894 fi
19895 BDEPS_UNZIP=$ac_cv_prog_BDEPS_UNZIP
19896 if test -n "$BDEPS_UNZIP"; then
19897   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BDEPS_UNZIP" >&5
19898 $as_echo "$BDEPS_UNZIP" >&6; }
19899 else
19900   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
19901 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
19902 fi
19903 
19904 
19905   test -n "$BDEPS_UNZIP" && break
19906 done
19907 
19908   if test "x$BDEPS_UNZIP" = x7z; then
19909     BDEPS_UNZIP="7z x"
19910   fi
19911 
19912   for ac_prog in wget lftp ftp
19913 do
19914   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
19915 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
19916 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
19917 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
19918 if ${ac_cv_prog_BDEPS_FTP+:} false; then :
19919   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
19920 else
19921   if test -n "$BDEPS_FTP"; then
19922   ac_cv_prog_BDEPS_FTP="$BDEPS_FTP" # Let the user override the test.
19923 else
19924 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
19925 for as_dir in $PATH
19926 do
19927   IFS=$as_save_IFS
19928   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
19929     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
19930   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
19931     ac_cv_prog_BDEPS_FTP="$ac_prog"
19932     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
19933     break 2
19934   fi
19935 done
19936   done
19937 IFS=$as_save_IFS
19938 
19939 fi
19940 fi
19941 BDEPS_FTP=$ac_cv_prog_BDEPS_FTP
19942 if test -n "$BDEPS_FTP"; then
19943   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BDEPS_FTP" >&5
19944 $as_echo "$BDEPS_FTP" >&6; }
19945 else
19946   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
19947 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
19948 fi
19949 
19950 
19951   test -n "$BDEPS_FTP" && break
19952 done
19953 
19954 
19955 
19956 ###############################################################################
19957 #
19958 # Determine OpenJDK variants, options and version numbers.
19959 #
19960 ###############################################################################
19961 
19962 # We need build & target for this.
19963 
19964 
19965   ###############################################################################
19966   #
19967   # Should we build a JDK/JVM with headful support (ie a graphical ui)?
19968   # We always build headless support.
19969   #
19970   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking headful support" >&5
19971 $as_echo_n "checking headful support... " >&6; }
19972   # Check whether --enable-headful was given.
19973 if test "${enable_headful+set}" = set; then :
19974   enableval=$enable_headful; SUPPORT_HEADFUL=${enable_headful}
19975 else
19976   SUPPORT_HEADFUL=yes
19977 fi
19978 
19979 
19980   SUPPORT_HEADLESS=yes
19981   BUILD_HEADLESS="BUILD_HEADLESS:=true"
19982 
19983   if test "x$SUPPORT_HEADFUL" = xyes; then
19984     # We are building both headful and headless.
19985     headful_msg="include support for both headful and headless"
19986   fi
19987 
19988   if test "x$SUPPORT_HEADFUL" = xno; then
19989     # Thus we are building headless only.
19990     BUILD_HEADLESS="BUILD_HEADLESS:=true"
19991     headful_msg="headless only"
19992   fi
19993 
19994   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $headful_msg" >&5
19995 $as_echo "$headful_msg" >&6; }
19996 
19997 
19998 
19999 
20000 
20001   # Control wether Hotspot runs Queens test after build.
20002   # Check whether --enable-hotspot-test-in-build was given.
20003 if test "${enable_hotspot_test_in_build+set}" = set; then :
20004   enableval=$enable_hotspot_test_in_build;
20005 else
20006   enable_hotspot_test_in_build=no
20007 fi
20008 
20009   if test "x$enable_hotspot_test_in_build" = "xyes"; then
20010     TEST_IN_BUILD=true
20011   else
20012     TEST_IN_BUILD=false
20013   fi
20014 
20015 
20016   ###############################################################################
20017   #
20018   # Choose cacerts source file
20019   #
20020 
20021 # Check whether --with-cacerts-file was given.
20022 if test "${with_cacerts_file+set}" = set; then :
20023   withval=$with_cacerts_file;
20024 fi
20025 
20026   if test "x$with_cacerts_file" != x; then
20027     CACERTS_FILE=$with_cacerts_file
20028   fi
20029 
20030 
20031   ###############################################################################
20032   #
20033   # Enable or disable unlimited crypto
20034   #
20035   # Check whether --enable-unlimited-crypto was given.
20036 if test "${enable_unlimited_crypto+set}" = set; then :
20037   enableval=$enable_unlimited_crypto;
20038 else
20039   enable_unlimited_crypto=no
20040 fi
20041 
20042   if test "x$enable_unlimited_crypto" = "xyes"; then
20043     UNLIMITED_CRYPTO=true
20044   else
20045     UNLIMITED_CRYPTO=false
20046   fi
20047 
20048 
20049   ###############################################################################
20050   #
20051   # Enable or disable the elliptic curve crypto implementation
20052   #
20053 
20054 
20055   ###############################################################################
20056   #
20057   # --enable-rmiconnector-iiop
20058   #
20059   # Check whether --enable-rmiconnector-iiop was given.
20060 if test "${enable_rmiconnector_iiop+set}" = set; then :
20061   enableval=$enable_rmiconnector_iiop;
20062 fi
20063 
20064   if test "x$enable_rmiconnector_iiop" = "xyes"; then
20065     RMICONNECTOR_IIOP=true
20066   else
20067     RMICONNECTOR_IIOP=false
20068   fi
20069 
20070 
20071   ###############################################################################
20072   #
20073   # Compress jars
20074   #
20075   COMPRESS_JARS=false
20076 
20077 
20078 
20079 
20080   # Source the version numbers
20081   . $AUTOCONF_DIR/version-numbers
20082 
20083   # Get the settings from parameters
20084 
20085 # Check whether --with-milestone was given.
20086 if test "${with_milestone+set}" = set; then :
20087   withval=$with_milestone;
20088 fi
20089 
20090   if test "x$with_milestone" = xyes; then
20091     as_fn_error $? "Milestone must have a value" "$LINENO" 5
20092   elif test "x$with_milestone" != x; then
20093     MILESTONE="$with_milestone"
20094   fi
20095   if test "x$MILESTONE" = x; then
20096     MILESTONE=internal
20097   fi
20098 
20099 
20100 # Check whether --with-update-version was given.
20101 if test "${with_update_version+set}" = set; then :
20102   withval=$with_update_version;
20103 fi
20104 
20105   if test "x$with_update_version" = xyes; then
20106     as_fn_error $? "Update version must have a value" "$LINENO" 5
20107   elif test "x$with_update_version" != x; then
20108     JDK_UPDATE_VERSION="$with_update_version"
20109     # On macosx 10.7, it's not possible to set --with-update-version=0X due
20110     # to a bug in expr (which reduces it to just X). To work around this, we
20111     # always add a 0 to one digit update versions.
20112     if test "${#JDK_UPDATE_VERSION}" = "1"; then
20113       JDK_UPDATE_VERSION="0${JDK_UPDATE_VERSION}"
20114     fi
20115   fi
20116 
20117 
20118 # Check whether --with-user-release-suffix was given.
20119 if test "${with_user_release_suffix+set}" = set; then :
20120   withval=$with_user_release_suffix;
20121 fi
20122 
20123   if test "x$with_user_release_suffix" = xyes; then
20124     as_fn_error $? "Release suffix must have a value" "$LINENO" 5
20125   elif test "x$with_user_release_suffix" != x; then
20126     USER_RELEASE_SUFFIX="$with_user_release_suffix"
20127   fi
20128 
20129 
20130 # Check whether --with-build-number was given.
20131 if test "${with_build_number+set}" = set; then :
20132   withval=$with_build_number;
20133 fi
20134 
20135   if test "x$with_build_number" = xyes; then
20136     as_fn_error $? "Build number must have a value" "$LINENO" 5
20137   elif test "x$with_build_number" != x; then
20138     JDK_BUILD_NUMBER="$with_build_number"
20139   fi
20140   # Define default USER_RELEASE_SUFFIX if BUILD_NUMBER and USER_RELEASE_SUFFIX are not set
20141   if test "x$JDK_BUILD_NUMBER" = x; then
20142     JDK_BUILD_NUMBER=b00
20143     if test "x$USER_RELEASE_SUFFIX" = x; then
20144       BUILD_DATE=`date '+%Y_%m_%d_%H_%M'`
20145       # Avoid [:alnum:] since it depends on the locale.
20146       CLEAN_USERNAME=`echo "$USER" | $TR -d -c 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ0123456789'`
20147       USER_RELEASE_SUFFIX=`echo "${CLEAN_USERNAME}_${BUILD_DATE}" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
20148     fi
20149   fi
20150 
20151   # Now set the JDK version, milestone, build number etc.
20152 
20153 
20154 
20155 
20156 
20157 
20158 
20159 
20160 
20161 
20162 
20163 
20164 
20165 
20166 
20167 
20168 # Check whether --with-copyright-year was given.
20169 if test "${with_copyright_year+set}" = set; then :
20170   withval=$with_copyright_year;
20171 fi
20172 
20173   if test "x$with_copyright_year" = xyes; then
20174     as_fn_error $? "Copyright year must have a value" "$LINENO" 5
20175   elif test "x$with_copyright_year" != x; then
20176     COPYRIGHT_YEAR="$with_copyright_year"
20177   else
20178     COPYRIGHT_YEAR=`date +'%Y'`
20179   fi
20180 
20181 
20182   if test "x$JDK_UPDATE_VERSION" != x; then
20183     JDK_VERSION="${JDK_MAJOR_VERSION}.${JDK_MINOR_VERSION}.${JDK_MICRO_VERSION}_${JDK_UPDATE_VERSION}"
20184   else
20185     JDK_VERSION="${JDK_MAJOR_VERSION}.${JDK_MINOR_VERSION}.${JDK_MICRO_VERSION}"
20186   fi
20187 
20188 
20189   COOKED_BUILD_NUMBER=`$ECHO $JDK_BUILD_NUMBER | $SED -e 's/^b//' -e 's/^0//'`
20190 
20191 
20192 
20193 ###############################################################################
20194 #
20195 # Setup BootJDK, used to bootstrap the build.
20196 #
20197 ###############################################################################
20198 
20199 
20200   BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
20201 
20202 # Check whether --with-boot-jdk was given.
20203 if test "${with_boot_jdk+set}" = set; then :
20204   withval=$with_boot_jdk;
20205 fi
20206 
20207 
20208   # We look for the Boot JDK through various means, going from more certain to
20209   # more of a guess-work. After each test, BOOT_JDK_FOUND is set to "yes" if
20210   # we detected something (if so, the path to the jdk is in BOOT_JDK). But we
20211   # must check if this is indeed valid; otherwise we'll continue looking.
20212 
20213   # Test: Is bootjdk explicitely set by command line arguments?
20214 
20215   if test "x$BOOT_JDK_FOUND" = xno; then
20216     # Now execute the test
20217 
20218   if test "x$with_boot_jdk" != x; then
20219     BOOT_JDK=$with_boot_jdk
20220     BOOT_JDK_FOUND=maybe
20221     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found potential Boot JDK using configure arguments" >&5
20222 $as_echo "$as_me: Found potential Boot JDK using configure arguments" >&6;}
20223   fi
20224 
20225 
20226     # If previous step claimed to have found a JDK, check it to see if it seems to be valid.
20227     if test "x$BOOT_JDK_FOUND" = xmaybe; then
20228       # Do we have a bin/java?
20229       if test ! -x "$BOOT_JDK/bin/java"; then
20230         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/java; ignoring" >&5
20231 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/java; ignoring" >&6;}
20232         BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
20233       else
20234         # Do we have a bin/javac?
20235         if test ! -x "$BOOT_JDK/bin/javac"; then
20236           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/javac; ignoring" >&5
20237 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/javac; ignoring" >&6;}
20238           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: (This might be an JRE instead of an JDK)" >&5
20239 $as_echo "$as_me: (This might be an JRE instead of an JDK)" >&6;}
20240           BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
20241         else
20242           # Oh, this is looking good! We probably have found a proper JDK. Is it the correct version?
20243           BOOT_JDK_VERSION=`"$BOOT_JDK/bin/java" -version 2>&1 | head -n 1`
20244 
20245           # Extra M4 quote needed to protect [] in grep expression.
20246           FOUND_CORRECT_VERSION=`echo $BOOT_JDK_VERSION | grep  '\"1\.[89]\.'`
20247           if test "x$FOUND_CORRECT_VERSION" = x; then
20248             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK is incorrect JDK version ($BOOT_JDK_VERSION); ignoring" >&5
20249 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK is incorrect JDK version ($BOOT_JDK_VERSION); ignoring" >&6;}
20250             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: (Your Boot JDK must be version 8 or 9)" >&5
20251 $as_echo "$as_me: (Your Boot JDK must be version 8 or 9)" >&6;}
20252             BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
20253           else
20254             # We're done! :-)
20255             BOOT_JDK_FOUND=yes
20256 
20257   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
20258 
20259   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
20260   # unix format.
20261   path="$BOOT_JDK"
20262   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
20263 
20264   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
20265   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
20266   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
20267   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
20268   #
20269   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file precense.
20270   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
20271   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
20272   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
20273     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
20274 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
20275     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of BOOT_JDK" "$LINENO" 5
20276   fi
20277 
20278   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
20279   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
20280 
20281   input_path="$new_path"
20282   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
20283   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
20284   # take no chances and rewrite it.
20285   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
20286   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
20287   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
20288     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
20289     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
20290     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
20291     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
20292       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
20293       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
20294       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
20295       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
20296       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
20297       new_path="$input_path"
20298     fi
20299   fi
20300 
20301   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
20302   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
20303     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
20304     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
20305       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
20306       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
20307       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
20308     fi
20309   fi
20310 
20311 
20312   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
20313     BOOT_JDK="$new_path"
20314     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&5
20315 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
20316   fi
20317 
20318   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
20319 
20320   path="$BOOT_JDK"
20321   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
20322   new_path="$path"
20323   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
20324     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
20325     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
20326   fi
20327 
20328 
20329   input_path="$new_path"
20330   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
20331   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
20332   # take no chances and rewrite it.
20333   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
20334   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
20335   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
20336     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
20337     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
20338   fi
20339 
20340 
20341   windows_path="$new_path"
20342   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
20343     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
20344     new_path="$unix_path"
20345   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
20346     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
20347     new_path="$unix_path"
20348   fi
20349 
20350   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
20351     BOOT_JDK="$new_path"
20352     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&5
20353 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
20354   fi
20355 
20356   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
20357   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
20358 
20359   else
20360     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
20361     path="$BOOT_JDK"
20362     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
20363     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
20364       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
20365 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
20366       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
20367     fi
20368 
20369     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
20370     eval path="$path"
20371     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
20372       as_fn_error $? "The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
20373     fi
20374 
20375     BOOT_JDK="`cd "$path"; $THEPWDCMD -L`"
20376   fi
20377 
20378             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for Boot JDK" >&5
20379 $as_echo_n "checking for Boot JDK... " >&6; }
20380             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BOOT_JDK" >&5
20381 $as_echo "$BOOT_JDK" >&6; }
20382             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking Boot JDK version" >&5
20383 $as_echo_n "checking Boot JDK version... " >&6; }
20384             BOOT_JDK_VERSION=`"$BOOT_JDK/bin/java" -version 2>&1 | $TR '\n\r' '  '`
20385             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BOOT_JDK_VERSION" >&5
20386 $as_echo "$BOOT_JDK_VERSION" >&6; }
20387           fi # end check jdk version
20388         fi # end check javac
20389       fi # end check java
20390     fi # end check boot jdk found
20391   fi
20392 
20393   if test "x$with_boot_jdk" != x && test "x$BOOT_JDK_FOUND" = xno; then
20394     # Having specified an argument which is incorrect will produce an instant failure;
20395     # we should not go on looking
20396     as_fn_error $? "The path given by --with-boot-jdk does not contain a valid Boot JDK" "$LINENO" 5
20397   fi
20398 
20399   # Test: Is bootjdk available from builddeps?
20400 
20401   if test "x$BOOT_JDK_FOUND" = xno; then
20402     # Now execute the test
20403 
20404 
20405 
20406   if test "x$with_builddeps_server" != x || test "x$with_builddeps_conf" != x; then
20407     # Source the builddeps file again, to make sure it uses the latest variables!
20408     . $builddepsfile
20409     # Look for a target and build machine specific resource!
20410     eval resource=\${builddep_bootjdk_BUILD_${rewritten_build_var}_TARGET_${rewritten_target_var}}
20411     if test "x$resource" = x; then
20412       # Ok, lets instead look for a target specific resource
20413       eval resource=\${builddep_bootjdk_TARGET_${rewritten_target_var}}
20414     fi
20415     if test "x$resource" = x; then
20416       # Ok, lets instead look for a build specific resource
20417       eval resource=\${builddep_bootjdk_BUILD_${rewritten_build_var}}
20418     fi
20419     if test "x$resource" = x; then
20420       # Ok, lets instead look for a generic resource
20421       # (The bootjdk comes from M4 and not the shell, thus no need for eval here.)
20422       resource=${builddep_bootjdk}
20423     fi
20424     if test "x$resource" != x; then
20425       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Using builddeps $resource for bootjdk" >&5
20426 $as_echo "$as_me: Using builddeps $resource for bootjdk" >&6;}
20427       # If the resource in the builddeps.conf file is an existing directory,
20428       # for example /java/linux/cups
20429       if test -d ${resource}; then
20430         depdir=${resource}
20431       else
20432 
20433   # bootjdk is for example mymodule
20434   # $resource is for example libs/general/libmymod_1_2_3.zip
20435   # $with_builddeps_server is for example ftp://mybuilddeps.myserver.com/builddeps
20436   # $with_builddeps_dir is for example /localhome/builddeps
20437   # depdir is the name of the variable into which we store the depdir, eg MYMOD
20438   # Will download ftp://mybuilddeps.myserver.com/builddeps/libs/general/libmymod_1_2_3.zip and
20439   # unzip into the directory: /localhome/builddeps/libmymod_1_2_3
20440   filename=`basename $resource`
20441   filebase=`echo $filename | sed 's/\.[^\.]*$//'`
20442   filebase=${filename%%.*}
20443   extension=${filename#*.}
20444   installdir=$with_builddeps_dir/$filebase
20445   if test ! -f $installdir/$filename.unpacked; then
20446     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Downloading build dependency bootjdk from $with_builddeps_server/$resource and installing into $installdir" >&5
20447 $as_echo "$as_me: Downloading build dependency bootjdk from $with_builddeps_server/$resource and installing into $installdir" >&6;}
20448     if test ! -d $installdir; then
20449       mkdir -p $installdir
20450     fi
20451     if test ! -d $installdir; then
20452       as_fn_error $? "Could not create directory $installdir" "$LINENO" 5
20453     fi
20454     tmpfile=`mktemp $installdir/bootjdk.XXXXXXXXX`
20455     touch $tmpfile
20456     if test ! -f $tmpfile; then
20457       as_fn_error $? "Could not create files in directory $installdir" "$LINENO" 5
20458     fi
20459 
20460   # $with_builddeps_server/$resource  is the ftp://abuilddeps.server.com/libs/cups.zip
20461   # $tmpfile is the local file name for the downloaded file.
20462   VALID_TOOL=no
20463   if test "x$BDEPS_FTP" = xwget; then
20464     VALID_TOOL=yes
20465     wget -O $tmpfile $with_builddeps_server/$resource
20466   fi
20467   if test "x$BDEPS_FTP" = xlftp; then
20468     VALID_TOOL=yes
20469     lftp -c "get $with_builddeps_server/$resource  -o $tmpfile"
20470   fi
20471   if test "x$BDEPS_FTP" = xftp; then
20472     VALID_TOOL=yes
20473     FTPSERVER=`echo $with_builddeps_server/$resource  | cut -f 3 -d '/'`
20474     FTPPATH=`echo $with_builddeps_server/$resource  | cut -f 4- -d '/'`
20475     FTPUSERPWD=${FTPSERVER%%@*}
20476     if test "x$FTPSERVER" != "x$FTPUSERPWD"; then
20477       FTPUSER=${userpwd%%:*}
20478       FTPPWD=${userpwd#*@}
20479       FTPSERVER=${FTPSERVER#*@}
20480     else
20481       FTPUSER=ftp
20482       FTPPWD=ftp
20483     fi
20484     # the "pass" command does not work on some
20485     # ftp clients (read ftp.exe) but if it works,
20486     # passive mode is better!
20487     ( \
20488         echo "user $FTPUSER $FTPPWD"        ; \
20489         echo "pass"                         ; \
20490         echo "bin"                          ; \
20491         echo "get $FTPPATH $tmpfile"              ; \
20492     ) | ftp -in $FTPSERVER
20493   fi
20494   if test "x$VALID_TOOL" != xyes; then
20495     as_fn_error $? "I do not know how to use the tool: $BDEPS_FTP" "$LINENO" 5
20496   fi
20497 
20498     mv $tmpfile $installdir/$filename
20499     if test ! -s $installdir/$filename; then
20500       as_fn_error $? "Could not download $with_builddeps_server/$resource" "$LINENO" 5
20501     fi
20502     case "$extension" in
20503       zip)  echo "Unzipping $installdir/$filename..."
20504         (cd $installdir ; rm -f $installdir/$filename.unpacked ; $BDEPS_UNZIP $installdir/$filename > /dev/null && touch $installdir/$filename.unpacked)
20505         ;;
20506       tar.gz) echo "Untaring $installdir/$filename..."
20507         (cd $installdir ; rm -f $installdir/$filename.unpacked ; tar xzf $installdir/$filename && touch $installdir/$filename.unpacked)
20508         ;;
20509       tgz) echo "Untaring $installdir/$filename..."
20510         (cd $installdir ; rm -f $installdir/$filename.unpacked ; tar xzf $installdir/$filename && touch $installdir/$filename.unpacked)
20511         ;;
20512       *) as_fn_error $? "Cannot handle build depency archive with extension $extension" "$LINENO" 5
20513         ;;
20514     esac
20515   fi
20516   if test -f $installdir/$filename.unpacked; then
20517     depdir=$installdir
20518   fi
20519 
20520       fi
20521       # Source the builddeps file again, because in the previous command, the depdir
20522       # was updated to point at the current build dependency install directory.
20523       . $builddepsfile
20524       # Now extract variables from the builddeps.conf files.
20525       theroot=${builddep_bootjdk_ROOT}
20526       thecflags=${builddep_bootjdk_CFLAGS}
20527       thelibs=${builddep_bootjdk_LIBS}
20528       if test "x$depdir" = x; then
20529         as_fn_error $? "Could not download build dependency bootjdk" "$LINENO" 5
20530       fi
20531       BOOT_JDK=$depdir
20532       if test "x$theroot" != x; then
20533         BOOT_JDK="$theroot"
20534       fi
20535       if test "x$thecflags" != x; then
20536         BOOT_JDK_CFLAGS="$thecflags"
20537       fi
20538       if test "x$thelibs" != x; then
20539         BOOT_JDK_LIBS="$thelibs"
20540       fi
20541       BOOT_JDK_FOUND=maybe
20542       else BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
20543 
20544     fi
20545     else BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
20546 
20547   fi
20548 
20549 
20550 
20551     # If previous step claimed to have found a JDK, check it to see if it seems to be valid.
20552     if test "x$BOOT_JDK_FOUND" = xmaybe; then
20553       # Do we have a bin/java?
20554       if test ! -x "$BOOT_JDK/bin/java"; then
20555         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/java; ignoring" >&5
20556 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/java; ignoring" >&6;}
20557         BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
20558       else
20559         # Do we have a bin/javac?
20560         if test ! -x "$BOOT_JDK/bin/javac"; then
20561           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/javac; ignoring" >&5
20562 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/javac; ignoring" >&6;}
20563           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: (This might be an JRE instead of an JDK)" >&5
20564 $as_echo "$as_me: (This might be an JRE instead of an JDK)" >&6;}
20565           BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
20566         else
20567           # Oh, this is looking good! We probably have found a proper JDK. Is it the correct version?
20568           BOOT_JDK_VERSION=`"$BOOT_JDK/bin/java" -version 2>&1 | head -n 1`
20569 
20570           # Extra M4 quote needed to protect [] in grep expression.
20571           FOUND_CORRECT_VERSION=`echo $BOOT_JDK_VERSION | grep  '\"1\.[89]\.'`
20572           if test "x$FOUND_CORRECT_VERSION" = x; then
20573             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK is incorrect JDK version ($BOOT_JDK_VERSION); ignoring" >&5
20574 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK is incorrect JDK version ($BOOT_JDK_VERSION); ignoring" >&6;}
20575             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: (Your Boot JDK must be version 8 or 9)" >&5
20576 $as_echo "$as_me: (Your Boot JDK must be version 8 or 9)" >&6;}
20577             BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
20578           else
20579             # We're done! :-)
20580             BOOT_JDK_FOUND=yes
20581 
20582   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
20583 
20584   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
20585   # unix format.
20586   path="$BOOT_JDK"
20587   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
20588 
20589   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
20590   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
20591   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
20592   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
20593   #
20594   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file precense.
20595   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
20596   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
20597   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
20598     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
20599 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
20600     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of BOOT_JDK" "$LINENO" 5
20601   fi
20602 
20603   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
20604   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
20605 
20606   input_path="$new_path"
20607   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
20608   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
20609   # take no chances and rewrite it.
20610   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
20611   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
20612   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
20613     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
20614     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
20615     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
20616     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
20617       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
20618       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
20619       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
20620       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
20621       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
20622       new_path="$input_path"
20623     fi
20624   fi
20625 
20626   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
20627   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
20628     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
20629     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
20630       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
20631       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
20632       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
20633     fi
20634   fi
20635 
20636 
20637   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
20638     BOOT_JDK="$new_path"
20639     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&5
20640 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
20641   fi
20642 
20643   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
20644 
20645   path="$BOOT_JDK"
20646   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
20647   new_path="$path"
20648   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
20649     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
20650     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
20651   fi
20652 
20653 
20654   input_path="$new_path"
20655   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
20656   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
20657   # take no chances and rewrite it.
20658   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
20659   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
20660   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
20661     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
20662     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
20663   fi
20664 
20665 
20666   windows_path="$new_path"
20667   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
20668     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
20669     new_path="$unix_path"
20670   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
20671     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
20672     new_path="$unix_path"
20673   fi
20674 
20675   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
20676     BOOT_JDK="$new_path"
20677     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&5
20678 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
20679   fi
20680 
20681   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
20682   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
20683 
20684   else
20685     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
20686     path="$BOOT_JDK"
20687     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
20688     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
20689       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
20690 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
20691       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
20692     fi
20693 
20694     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
20695     eval path="$path"
20696     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
20697       as_fn_error $? "The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
20698     fi
20699 
20700     BOOT_JDK="`cd "$path"; $THEPWDCMD -L`"
20701   fi
20702 
20703             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for Boot JDK" >&5
20704 $as_echo_n "checking for Boot JDK... " >&6; }
20705             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BOOT_JDK" >&5
20706 $as_echo "$BOOT_JDK" >&6; }
20707             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking Boot JDK version" >&5
20708 $as_echo_n "checking Boot JDK version... " >&6; }
20709             BOOT_JDK_VERSION=`"$BOOT_JDK/bin/java" -version 2>&1 | $TR '\n\r' '  '`
20710             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BOOT_JDK_VERSION" >&5
20711 $as_echo "$BOOT_JDK_VERSION" >&6; }
20712           fi # end check jdk version
20713         fi # end check javac
20714       fi # end check java
20715     fi # end check boot jdk found
20716   fi
20717 
20718 
20719   # Test: On MacOS X, can we find a boot jdk using /usr/libexec/java_home?
20720 
20721   if test "x$BOOT_JDK_FOUND" = xno; then
20722     # Now execute the test
20723 
20724   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xmacosx; then
20725     # First check at user selected default
20726 
20727   if test "x$BOOT_JDK_FOUND" = xno; then
20728     # Now execute the test
20729 
20730   if test -x /usr/libexec/java_home; then
20731     BOOT_JDK=`/usr/libexec/java_home `
20732     BOOT_JDK_FOUND=maybe
20733     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found potential Boot JDK using /usr/libexec/java_home " >&5
20734 $as_echo "$as_me: Found potential Boot JDK using /usr/libexec/java_home " >&6;}
20735   fi
20736 
20737 
20738     # If previous step claimed to have found a JDK, check it to see if it seems to be valid.
20739     if test "x$BOOT_JDK_FOUND" = xmaybe; then
20740       # Do we have a bin/java?
20741       if test ! -x "$BOOT_JDK/bin/java"; then
20742         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/java; ignoring" >&5
20743 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/java; ignoring" >&6;}
20744         BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
20745       else
20746         # Do we have a bin/javac?
20747         if test ! -x "$BOOT_JDK/bin/javac"; then
20748           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/javac; ignoring" >&5
20749 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/javac; ignoring" >&6;}
20750           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: (This might be an JRE instead of an JDK)" >&5
20751 $as_echo "$as_me: (This might be an JRE instead of an JDK)" >&6;}
20752           BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
20753         else
20754           # Oh, this is looking good! We probably have found a proper JDK. Is it the correct version?
20755           BOOT_JDK_VERSION=`"$BOOT_JDK/bin/java" -version 2>&1 | head -n 1`
20756 
20757           # Extra M4 quote needed to protect [] in grep expression.
20758           FOUND_CORRECT_VERSION=`echo $BOOT_JDK_VERSION | grep  '\"1\.[89]\.'`
20759           if test "x$FOUND_CORRECT_VERSION" = x; then
20760             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK is incorrect JDK version ($BOOT_JDK_VERSION); ignoring" >&5
20761 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK is incorrect JDK version ($BOOT_JDK_VERSION); ignoring" >&6;}
20762             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: (Your Boot JDK must be version 8 or 9)" >&5
20763 $as_echo "$as_me: (Your Boot JDK must be version 8 or 9)" >&6;}
20764             BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
20765           else
20766             # We're done! :-)
20767             BOOT_JDK_FOUND=yes
20768 
20769   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
20770 
20771   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
20772   # unix format.
20773   path="$BOOT_JDK"
20774   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
20775 
20776   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
20777   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
20778   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
20779   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
20780   #
20781   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file precense.
20782   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
20783   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
20784   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
20785     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
20786 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
20787     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of BOOT_JDK" "$LINENO" 5
20788   fi
20789 
20790   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
20791   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
20792 
20793   input_path="$new_path"
20794   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
20795   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
20796   # take no chances and rewrite it.
20797   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
20798   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
20799   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
20800     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
20801     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
20802     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
20803     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
20804       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
20805       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
20806       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
20807       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
20808       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
20809       new_path="$input_path"
20810     fi
20811   fi
20812 
20813   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
20814   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
20815     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
20816     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
20817       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
20818       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
20819       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
20820     fi
20821   fi
20822 
20823 
20824   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
20825     BOOT_JDK="$new_path"
20826     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&5
20827 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
20828   fi
20829 
20830   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
20831 
20832   path="$BOOT_JDK"
20833   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
20834   new_path="$path"
20835   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
20836     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
20837     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
20838   fi
20839 
20840 
20841   input_path="$new_path"
20842   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
20843   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
20844   # take no chances and rewrite it.
20845   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
20846   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
20847   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
20848     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
20849     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
20850   fi
20851 
20852 
20853   windows_path="$new_path"
20854   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
20855     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
20856     new_path="$unix_path"
20857   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
20858     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
20859     new_path="$unix_path"
20860   fi
20861 
20862   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
20863     BOOT_JDK="$new_path"
20864     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&5
20865 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
20866   fi
20867 
20868   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
20869   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
20870 
20871   else
20872     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
20873     path="$BOOT_JDK"
20874     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
20875     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
20876       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
20877 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
20878       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
20879     fi
20880 
20881     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
20882     eval path="$path"
20883     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
20884       as_fn_error $? "The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
20885     fi
20886 
20887     BOOT_JDK="`cd "$path"; $THEPWDCMD -L`"
20888   fi
20889 
20890             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for Boot JDK" >&5
20891 $as_echo_n "checking for Boot JDK... " >&6; }
20892             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BOOT_JDK" >&5
20893 $as_echo "$BOOT_JDK" >&6; }
20894             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking Boot JDK version" >&5
20895 $as_echo_n "checking Boot JDK version... " >&6; }
20896             BOOT_JDK_VERSION=`"$BOOT_JDK/bin/java" -version 2>&1 | $TR '\n\r' '  '`
20897             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BOOT_JDK_VERSION" >&5
20898 $as_echo "$BOOT_JDK_VERSION" >&6; }
20899           fi # end check jdk version
20900         fi # end check javac
20901       fi # end check java
20902     fi # end check boot jdk found
20903   fi
20904 
20905     # If that did not work out (e.g. too old), try explicit versions instead
20906 
20907   if test "x$BOOT_JDK_FOUND" = xno; then
20908     # Now execute the test
20909 
20910   if test -x /usr/libexec/java_home; then
20911     BOOT_JDK=`/usr/libexec/java_home -v 1.9`
20912     BOOT_JDK_FOUND=maybe
20913     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found potential Boot JDK using /usr/libexec/java_home -v 1.9" >&5
20914 $as_echo "$as_me: Found potential Boot JDK using /usr/libexec/java_home -v 1.9" >&6;}
20915   fi
20916 
20917 
20918     # If previous step claimed to have found a JDK, check it to see if it seems to be valid.
20919     if test "x$BOOT_JDK_FOUND" = xmaybe; then
20920       # Do we have a bin/java?
20921       if test ! -x "$BOOT_JDK/bin/java"; then
20922         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/java; ignoring" >&5
20923 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/java; ignoring" >&6;}
20924         BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
20925       else
20926         # Do we have a bin/javac?
20927         if test ! -x "$BOOT_JDK/bin/javac"; then
20928           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/javac; ignoring" >&5
20929 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/javac; ignoring" >&6;}
20930           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: (This might be an JRE instead of an JDK)" >&5
20931 $as_echo "$as_me: (This might be an JRE instead of an JDK)" >&6;}
20932           BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
20933         else
20934           # Oh, this is looking good! We probably have found a proper JDK. Is it the correct version?
20935           BOOT_JDK_VERSION=`"$BOOT_JDK/bin/java" -version 2>&1 | head -n 1`
20936 
20937           # Extra M4 quote needed to protect [] in grep expression.
20938           FOUND_CORRECT_VERSION=`echo $BOOT_JDK_VERSION | grep  '\"1\.[89]\.'`
20939           if test "x$FOUND_CORRECT_VERSION" = x; then
20940             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK is incorrect JDK version ($BOOT_JDK_VERSION); ignoring" >&5
20941 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK is incorrect JDK version ($BOOT_JDK_VERSION); ignoring" >&6;}
20942             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: (Your Boot JDK must be version 8 or 9)" >&5
20943 $as_echo "$as_me: (Your Boot JDK must be version 8 or 9)" >&6;}
20944             BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
20945           else
20946             # We're done! :-)
20947             BOOT_JDK_FOUND=yes
20948 
20949   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
20950 
20951   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
20952   # unix format.
20953   path="$BOOT_JDK"
20954   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
20955 
20956   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
20957   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
20958   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
20959   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
20960   #
20961   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file precense.
20962   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
20963   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
20964   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
20965     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
20966 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
20967     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of BOOT_JDK" "$LINENO" 5
20968   fi
20969 
20970   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
20971   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
20972 
20973   input_path="$new_path"
20974   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
20975   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
20976   # take no chances and rewrite it.
20977   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
20978   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
20979   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
20980     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
20981     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
20982     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
20983     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
20984       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
20985       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
20986       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
20987       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
20988       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
20989       new_path="$input_path"
20990     fi
20991   fi
20992 
20993   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
20994   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
20995     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
20996     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
20997       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
20998       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
20999       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
21000     fi
21001   fi
21002 
21003 
21004   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
21005     BOOT_JDK="$new_path"
21006     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&5
21007 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
21008   fi
21009 
21010   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
21011 
21012   path="$BOOT_JDK"
21013   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
21014   new_path="$path"
21015   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
21016     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
21017     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
21018   fi
21019 
21020 
21021   input_path="$new_path"
21022   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
21023   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
21024   # take no chances and rewrite it.
21025   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
21026   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
21027   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
21028     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
21029     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
21030   fi
21031 
21032 
21033   windows_path="$new_path"
21034   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
21035     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
21036     new_path="$unix_path"
21037   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
21038     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
21039     new_path="$unix_path"
21040   fi
21041 
21042   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
21043     BOOT_JDK="$new_path"
21044     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&5
21045 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
21046   fi
21047 
21048   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
21049   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
21050 
21051   else
21052     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
21053     path="$BOOT_JDK"
21054     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
21055     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
21056       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
21057 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
21058       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
21059     fi
21060 
21061     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
21062     eval path="$path"
21063     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
21064       as_fn_error $? "The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
21065     fi
21066 
21067     BOOT_JDK="`cd "$path"; $THEPWDCMD -L`"
21068   fi
21069 
21070             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for Boot JDK" >&5
21071 $as_echo_n "checking for Boot JDK... " >&6; }
21072             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BOOT_JDK" >&5
21073 $as_echo "$BOOT_JDK" >&6; }
21074             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking Boot JDK version" >&5
21075 $as_echo_n "checking Boot JDK version... " >&6; }
21076             BOOT_JDK_VERSION=`"$BOOT_JDK/bin/java" -version 2>&1 | $TR '\n\r' '  '`
21077             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BOOT_JDK_VERSION" >&5
21078 $as_echo "$BOOT_JDK_VERSION" >&6; }
21079           fi # end check jdk version
21080         fi # end check javac
21081       fi # end check java
21082     fi # end check boot jdk found
21083   fi
21084 
21085 
21086   if test "x$BOOT_JDK_FOUND" = xno; then
21087     # Now execute the test
21088 
21089   if test -x /usr/libexec/java_home; then
21090     BOOT_JDK=`/usr/libexec/java_home -v 1.8`
21091     BOOT_JDK_FOUND=maybe
21092     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found potential Boot JDK using /usr/libexec/java_home -v 1.8" >&5
21093 $as_echo "$as_me: Found potential Boot JDK using /usr/libexec/java_home -v 1.8" >&6;}
21094   fi
21095 
21096 
21097     # If previous step claimed to have found a JDK, check it to see if it seems to be valid.
21098     if test "x$BOOT_JDK_FOUND" = xmaybe; then
21099       # Do we have a bin/java?
21100       if test ! -x "$BOOT_JDK/bin/java"; then
21101         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/java; ignoring" >&5
21102 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/java; ignoring" >&6;}
21103         BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
21104       else
21105         # Do we have a bin/javac?
21106         if test ! -x "$BOOT_JDK/bin/javac"; then
21107           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/javac; ignoring" >&5
21108 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/javac; ignoring" >&6;}
21109           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: (This might be an JRE instead of an JDK)" >&5
21110 $as_echo "$as_me: (This might be an JRE instead of an JDK)" >&6;}
21111           BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
21112         else
21113           # Oh, this is looking good! We probably have found a proper JDK. Is it the correct version?
21114           BOOT_JDK_VERSION=`"$BOOT_JDK/bin/java" -version 2>&1 | head -n 1`
21115 
21116           # Extra M4 quote needed to protect [] in grep expression.
21117           FOUND_CORRECT_VERSION=`echo $BOOT_JDK_VERSION | grep  '\"1\.[89]\.'`
21118           if test "x$FOUND_CORRECT_VERSION" = x; then
21119             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK is incorrect JDK version ($BOOT_JDK_VERSION); ignoring" >&5
21120 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK is incorrect JDK version ($BOOT_JDK_VERSION); ignoring" >&6;}
21121             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: (Your Boot JDK must be version 8 or 9)" >&5
21122 $as_echo "$as_me: (Your Boot JDK must be version 8 or 9)" >&6;}
21123             BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
21124           else
21125             # We're done! :-)
21126             BOOT_JDK_FOUND=yes
21127 
21128   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
21129 
21130   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
21131   # unix format.
21132   path="$BOOT_JDK"
21133   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
21134 
21135   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
21136   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
21137   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
21138   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
21139   #
21140   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file precense.
21141   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
21142   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
21143   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
21144     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
21145 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
21146     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of BOOT_JDK" "$LINENO" 5
21147   fi
21148 
21149   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
21150   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
21151 
21152   input_path="$new_path"
21153   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
21154   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
21155   # take no chances and rewrite it.
21156   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
21157   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
21158   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
21159     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
21160     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
21161     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
21162     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
21163       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
21164       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
21165       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
21166       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
21167       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
21168       new_path="$input_path"
21169     fi
21170   fi
21171 
21172   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
21173   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
21174     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
21175     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
21176       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
21177       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
21178       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
21179     fi
21180   fi
21181 
21182 
21183   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
21184     BOOT_JDK="$new_path"
21185     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&5
21186 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
21187   fi
21188 
21189   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
21190 
21191   path="$BOOT_JDK"
21192   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
21193   new_path="$path"
21194   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
21195     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
21196     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
21197   fi
21198 
21199 
21200   input_path="$new_path"
21201   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
21202   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
21203   # take no chances and rewrite it.
21204   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
21205   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
21206   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
21207     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
21208     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
21209   fi
21210 
21211 
21212   windows_path="$new_path"
21213   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
21214     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
21215     new_path="$unix_path"
21216   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
21217     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
21218     new_path="$unix_path"
21219   fi
21220 
21221   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
21222     BOOT_JDK="$new_path"
21223     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&5
21224 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
21225   fi
21226 
21227   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
21228   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
21229 
21230   else
21231     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
21232     path="$BOOT_JDK"
21233     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
21234     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
21235       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
21236 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
21237       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
21238     fi
21239 
21240     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
21241     eval path="$path"
21242     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
21243       as_fn_error $? "The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
21244     fi
21245 
21246     BOOT_JDK="`cd "$path"; $THEPWDCMD -L`"
21247   fi
21248 
21249             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for Boot JDK" >&5
21250 $as_echo_n "checking for Boot JDK... " >&6; }
21251             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BOOT_JDK" >&5
21252 $as_echo "$BOOT_JDK" >&6; }
21253             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking Boot JDK version" >&5
21254 $as_echo_n "checking Boot JDK version... " >&6; }
21255             BOOT_JDK_VERSION=`"$BOOT_JDK/bin/java" -version 2>&1 | $TR '\n\r' '  '`
21256             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BOOT_JDK_VERSION" >&5
21257 $as_echo "$BOOT_JDK_VERSION" >&6; }
21258           fi # end check jdk version
21259         fi # end check javac
21260       fi # end check java
21261     fi # end check boot jdk found
21262   fi
21263 
21264 
21265   if test "x$BOOT_JDK_FOUND" = xno; then
21266     # Now execute the test
21267 
21268   if test -x /usr/libexec/java_home; then
21269     BOOT_JDK=`/usr/libexec/java_home -v 1.7`
21270     BOOT_JDK_FOUND=maybe
21271     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found potential Boot JDK using /usr/libexec/java_home -v 1.7" >&5
21272 $as_echo "$as_me: Found potential Boot JDK using /usr/libexec/java_home -v 1.7" >&6;}
21273   fi
21274 
21275 
21276     # If previous step claimed to have found a JDK, check it to see if it seems to be valid.
21277     if test "x$BOOT_JDK_FOUND" = xmaybe; then
21278       # Do we have a bin/java?
21279       if test ! -x "$BOOT_JDK/bin/java"; then
21280         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/java; ignoring" >&5
21281 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/java; ignoring" >&6;}
21282         BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
21283       else
21284         # Do we have a bin/javac?
21285         if test ! -x "$BOOT_JDK/bin/javac"; then
21286           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/javac; ignoring" >&5
21287 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/javac; ignoring" >&6;}
21288           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: (This might be an JRE instead of an JDK)" >&5
21289 $as_echo "$as_me: (This might be an JRE instead of an JDK)" >&6;}
21290           BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
21291         else
21292           # Oh, this is looking good! We probably have found a proper JDK. Is it the correct version?
21293           BOOT_JDK_VERSION=`"$BOOT_JDK/bin/java" -version 2>&1 | head -n 1`
21294 
21295           # Extra M4 quote needed to protect [] in grep expression.
21296           FOUND_CORRECT_VERSION=`echo $BOOT_JDK_VERSION | grep  '\"1\.[89]\.'`
21297           if test "x$FOUND_CORRECT_VERSION" = x; then
21298             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK is incorrect JDK version ($BOOT_JDK_VERSION); ignoring" >&5
21299 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK is incorrect JDK version ($BOOT_JDK_VERSION); ignoring" >&6;}
21300             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: (Your Boot JDK must be version 8 or 9)" >&5
21301 $as_echo "$as_me: (Your Boot JDK must be version 8 or 9)" >&6;}
21302             BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
21303           else
21304             # We're done! :-)
21305             BOOT_JDK_FOUND=yes
21306 
21307   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
21308 
21309   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
21310   # unix format.
21311   path="$BOOT_JDK"
