24458             BOOT_JDK_VERSION=`"$BOOT_JDK/bin/java" -version 2>&1 | $TR '\n\r' '  '`
24459             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BOOT_JDK_VERSION" >&5
24460 $as_echo "$BOOT_JDK_VERSION" >&6; }
24461           fi # end check jdk version
24462         fi # end check javac
24463       fi # end check java
24464     fi # end check boot jdk found
24465   fi
24466 
24467 
24468   if test "x$BOOT_JDK_FOUND" = xno; then
24469     # Now execute the test
24470 
24471   BOOT_JDK_PREFIX="/System/Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines"
24472   BOOT_JDK_SUFFIX="/Contents/Home"
24473   ALL_JDKS_FOUND=`$LS "$BOOT_JDK_PREFIX" 2> /dev/null | $SORT -r`
24474   if test "x$ALL_JDKS_FOUND" != x; then
24475     for JDK_TO_TRY in $ALL_JDKS_FOUND ; do
24476 
24477   if test "x$BOOT_JDK_FOUND" = xno; then
24478     # Now execute the test
24479 
24480         BOOT_JDK="${BOOT_JDK_PREFIX}/${JDK_TO_TRY}${BOOT_JDK_SUFFIX}"
24481         if test -d "$BOOT_JDK"; then
24482           BOOT_JDK_FOUND=maybe
24483           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found potential Boot JDK using well-known locations (in $BOOT_JDK_PREFIX/$JDK_TO_TRY)" >&5
24484 $as_echo "$as_me: Found potential Boot JDK using well-known locations (in $BOOT_JDK_PREFIX/$JDK_TO_TRY)" >&6;}
24485         fi
24486 
24487 
24488     # If previous step claimed to have found a JDK, check it to see if it seems to be valid.
24489     if test "x$BOOT_JDK_FOUND" = xmaybe; then
24490       # Do we have a bin/java?
24491       if test ! -x "$BOOT_JDK/bin/java"; then
24492         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/java; ignoring" >&5
24493 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/java; ignoring" >&6;}
24494         BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
24495       else
24496         # Do we have a bin/javac?
24497         if test ! -x "$BOOT_JDK/bin/javac"; then
24498           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/javac; ignoring" >&5
24499 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/javac; ignoring" >&6;}
24500           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: (This might be an JRE instead of an JDK)" >&5
24501 $as_echo "$as_me: (This might be an JRE instead of an JDK)" >&6;}
24502           BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
24503         else
24504           # Oh, this is looking good! We probably have found a proper JDK. Is it the correct version?
24505           BOOT_JDK_VERSION=`"$BOOT_JDK/bin/java" -version 2>&1 | head -n 1`
24506 
24507           # Extra M4 quote needed to protect [] in grep expression.
24508           FOUND_CORRECT_VERSION=`echo $BOOT_JDK_VERSION | grep  '\"1\.[89]\.'`
24509           if test "x$FOUND_CORRECT_VERSION" = x; then
24510             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK is incorrect JDK version ($BOOT_JDK_VERSION); ignoring" >&5
24511 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK is incorrect JDK version ($BOOT_JDK_VERSION); ignoring" >&6;}
24512             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: (Your Boot JDK must be version 8 or 9)" >&5
24513 $as_echo "$as_me: (Your Boot JDK must be version 8 or 9)" >&6;}
24514             BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
24515           else
24516             # We're done! :-)
24517             BOOT_JDK_FOUND=yes
24518 
24519   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
24520 
24521   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
24522   # unix format.
24523   path="$BOOT_JDK"
24524   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
24525 
24526   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
24527   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
24528   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
24529   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
24530   #
24531   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file precense.
24532   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
24533   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
24534   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
24535     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
24536 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
24537     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of BOOT_JDK" "$LINENO" 5
24538   fi
24539 
24540   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
24541   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
24542 
24543   input_path="$new_path"
24544   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
24545   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
24546   # take no chances and rewrite it.
24547   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
24548   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
24549   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
24550     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
24551     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
24552     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
24553     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
24554       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
24555       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
24556       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
24557       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
24558       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
24559       new_path="$input_path"
24560     fi
24561   fi
24562 
24563   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
24564   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
24565     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
24566     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
24567       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
24568       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
24569       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
24570     fi
24571   fi
24572 
24573 
24574   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
24575     BOOT_JDK="$new_path"
24576     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&5
24577 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
24578   fi
24579 
24580   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
24581 
24582   path="$BOOT_JDK"
24583   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
24584   new_path="$path"
24585   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
24586     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
24587     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
24588   fi
24589 
24590 
24591   input_path="$new_path"
24592   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
24593   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
24594   # take no chances and rewrite it.
24595   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
24596   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
24597   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
24598     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
24599     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
24600   fi
24601 
24602 
24603   windows_path="$new_path"
24604   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
24605     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
24606     new_path="$unix_path"
24607   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
24608     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
24609     new_path="$unix_path"
24610   fi
24611 
24612   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
24613     BOOT_JDK="$new_path"
24614     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&5
24615 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
24616   fi
24617 
24618   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
24619   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
24620 
24621   else
24622     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
24623     path="$BOOT_JDK"
24624     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
24625     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
24626       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
24627 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
24628       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
24629     fi
24630 
24631     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
24632     eval path="$path"
24633     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
24634       as_fn_error $? "The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
24635     fi
24636 
24637     BOOT_JDK="`cd "$path"; $THEPWDCMD -L`"
24638   fi
24639 
24640             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for Boot JDK" >&5
24641 $as_echo_n "checking for Boot JDK... " >&6; }
24642             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BOOT_JDK" >&5
24643 $as_echo "$BOOT_JDK" >&6; }
24644             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking Boot JDK version" >&5
24645 $as_echo_n "checking Boot JDK version... " >&6; }
24646             BOOT_JDK_VERSION=`"$BOOT_JDK/bin/java" -version 2>&1 | $TR '\n\r' '  '`
24647             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BOOT_JDK_VERSION" >&5
24648 $as_echo "$BOOT_JDK_VERSION" >&6; }
24649           fi # end check jdk version
24650         fi # end check javac
24651       fi # end check java
24652     fi # end check boot jdk found
24653   fi
24654 
24655     done
24656   fi
24657 
24658 
24659     # If previous step claimed to have found a JDK, check it to see if it seems to be valid.
24660     if test "x$BOOT_JDK_FOUND" = xmaybe; then
24661       # Do we have a bin/java?
24662       if test ! -x "$BOOT_JDK/bin/java"; then
24663         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/java; ignoring" >&5
24664 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/java; ignoring" >&6;}
24665         BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
24666       else
24667         # Do we have a bin/javac?
24668         if test ! -x "$BOOT_JDK/bin/javac"; then
24669           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/javac; ignoring" >&5
24670 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/javac; ignoring" >&6;}
24671           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: (This might be an JRE instead of an JDK)" >&5
24672 $as_echo "$as_me: (This might be an JRE instead of an JDK)" >&6;}
24673           BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
24674         else
24675           # Oh, this is looking good! We probably have found a proper JDK. Is it the correct version?
24676           BOOT_JDK_VERSION=`"$BOOT_JDK/bin/java" -version 2>&1 | head -n 1`
24677 
24678           # Extra M4 quote needed to protect [] in grep expression.
24679           FOUND_CORRECT_VERSION=`echo $BOOT_JDK_VERSION | grep  '\"1\.[89]\.'`
24680           if test "x$FOUND_CORRECT_VERSION" = x; then
24681             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK is incorrect JDK version ($BOOT_JDK_VERSION); ignoring" >&5
24682 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK is incorrect JDK version ($BOOT_JDK_VERSION); ignoring" >&6;}
24683             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: (Your Boot JDK must be version 8 or 9)" >&5
24684 $as_echo "$as_me: (Your Boot JDK must be version 8 or 9)" >&6;}
24685             BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
24686           else
24687             # We're done! :-)
24688             BOOT_JDK_FOUND=yes
24689 
24690   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
24691 
24692   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
24693   # unix format.
24694   path="$BOOT_JDK"
24695   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
24696 
24697   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
24698   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
24699   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
24700   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
24701   #
24702   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file precense.
24703   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
24704   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
24705   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
24706     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
24707 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
24708     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of BOOT_JDK" "$LINENO" 5
24709   fi
24710 
24711   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
24712   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
24713 
24714   input_path="$new_path"
24715   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
24716   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
24717   # take no chances and rewrite it.
24718   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
24719   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
24720   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
24721     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
24722     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
24723     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
24724     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
24725       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
24726       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
24727       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
24728       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
24729       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
24730       new_path="$input_path"
24731     fi
24732   fi
24733 
24734   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
24735   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
24736     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
24737     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
24738       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
24739       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
24740       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
24741     fi
24742   fi
24743 
24744 
24745   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
24746     BOOT_JDK="$new_path"
24747     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&5
24748 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
24749   fi
24750 
24751   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
24752 
24753   path="$BOOT_JDK"
24754   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
24755   new_path="$path"
24756   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
24757     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
24758     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
24759   fi
24760 
24761 
24762   input_path="$new_path"
24763   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
24764   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
24765   # take no chances and rewrite it.
24766   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
24767   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
24768   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
24769     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
24770     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
24771   fi
24772 
24773 
24774   windows_path="$new_path"
24775   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
24776     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
24777     new_path="$unix_path"
24778   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
24779     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
24780     new_path="$unix_path"
24781   fi
24782 
24783   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
24784     BOOT_JDK="$new_path"
24785     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&5
24786 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
24787   fi
24788 
24789   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
24790   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
24791 
24792   else
24793     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
24794     path="$BOOT_JDK"
24795     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
24796     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
24797       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
24798 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
24799       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
24800     fi
24801 
24802     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
24803     eval path="$path"
24804     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
24805       as_fn_error $? "The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
24806     fi
24807 
24808     BOOT_JDK="`cd "$path"; $THEPWDCMD -L`"
24809   fi
24810 
24811             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for Boot JDK" >&5
24812 $as_echo_n "checking for Boot JDK... " >&6; }
24813             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BOOT_JDK" >&5
24814 $as_echo "$BOOT_JDK" >&6; }
24815             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking Boot JDK version" >&5
24816 $as_echo_n "checking Boot JDK version... " >&6; }
24817             BOOT_JDK_VERSION=`"$BOOT_JDK/bin/java" -version 2>&1 | $TR '\n\r' '  '`
24818             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BOOT_JDK_VERSION" >&5
24819 $as_echo "$BOOT_JDK_VERSION" >&6; }
24820           fi # end check jdk version
24821         fi # end check javac
24822       fi # end check java
24823     fi # end check boot jdk found
24824   fi
24825 
24826   elif test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xlinux; then
24827 
24828   if test "x$BOOT_JDK_FOUND" = xno; then
24829     # Now execute the test
24830 
24831   BOOT_JDK_PREFIX="/usr/lib/jvm"
24832   BOOT_JDK_SUFFIX=""
24833   ALL_JDKS_FOUND=`$LS "$BOOT_JDK_PREFIX" 2> /dev/null | $SORT -r`
24834   if test "x$ALL_JDKS_FOUND" != x; then
24835     for JDK_TO_TRY in $ALL_JDKS_FOUND ; do
24836 
24837   if test "x$BOOT_JDK_FOUND" = xno; then
24838     # Now execute the test
24839 
24840         BOOT_JDK="${BOOT_JDK_PREFIX}/${JDK_TO_TRY}${BOOT_JDK_SUFFIX}"
24841         if test -d "$BOOT_JDK"; then
24842           BOOT_JDK_FOUND=maybe
24843           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found potential Boot JDK using well-known locations (in $BOOT_JDK_PREFIX/$JDK_TO_TRY)" >&5
24844 $as_echo "$as_me: Found potential Boot JDK using well-known locations (in $BOOT_JDK_PREFIX/$JDK_TO_TRY)" >&6;}
24845         fi
24846 
24847 
24848     # If previous step claimed to have found a JDK, check it to see if it seems to be valid.
24849     if test "x$BOOT_JDK_FOUND" = xmaybe; then
24850       # Do we have a bin/java?
24851       if test ! -x "$BOOT_JDK/bin/java"; then
24852         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/java; ignoring" >&5
24853 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/java; ignoring" >&6;}
24854         BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
24855       else
24856         # Do we have a bin/javac?
24857         if test ! -x "$BOOT_JDK/bin/javac"; then
24858           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/javac; ignoring" >&5
24859 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/javac; ignoring" >&6;}
24860           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: (This might be an JRE instead of an JDK)" >&5
24861 $as_echo "$as_me: (This might be an JRE instead of an JDK)" >&6;}
24862           BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
24863         else
24864           # Oh, this is looking good! We probably have found a proper JDK. Is it the correct version?
24865           BOOT_JDK_VERSION=`"$BOOT_JDK/bin/java" -version 2>&1 | head -n 1`
24866 
24867           # Extra M4 quote needed to protect [] in grep expression.
24868           FOUND_CORRECT_VERSION=`echo $BOOT_JDK_VERSION | grep  '\"1\.[89]\.'`
24869           if test "x$FOUND_CORRECT_VERSION" = x; then
24870             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK is incorrect JDK version ($BOOT_JDK_VERSION); ignoring" >&5
24871 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK is incorrect JDK version ($BOOT_JDK_VERSION); ignoring" >&6;}
24872             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: (Your Boot JDK must be version 8 or 9)" >&5
24873 $as_echo "$as_me: (Your Boot JDK must be version 8 or 9)" >&6;}
24874             BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
24875           else
24876             # We're done! :-)
24877             BOOT_JDK_FOUND=yes
24878 
24879   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
24880 
24881   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
24882   # unix format.
24883   path="$BOOT_JDK"
24884   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
24885 
24886   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
24887   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
24888   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
24889   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
24890   #
24891   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file precense.
24892   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
24893   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
24894   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
24895     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
24896 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
24897     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of BOOT_JDK" "$LINENO" 5
24898   fi
24899 
24900   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
24901   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
24902 
24903   input_path="$new_path"
24904   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
24905   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
24906   # take no chances and rewrite it.
24907   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
24908   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
24909   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
24910     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
24911     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
24912     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
24913     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
24914       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
24915       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
24916       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
24917       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
24918       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
24919       new_path="$input_path"
24920     fi
24921   fi
24922 
24923   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
24924   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
24925     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
24926     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
24927       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
24928       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
24929       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
24930     fi
24931   fi
24932 
24933 
24934   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
24935     BOOT_JDK="$new_path"
24936     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&5
24937 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
24938   fi
24939 
24940   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
24941 
24942   path="$BOOT_JDK"
24943   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
24944   new_path="$path"
24945   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
24946     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
24947     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
24948   fi
24949 
24950 
24951   input_path="$new_path"
24952   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
24953   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
24954   # take no chances and rewrite it.
24955   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
24956   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
24957   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
24958     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
24959     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
24960   fi
24961 
24962 
24963   windows_path="$new_path"
24964   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
24965     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
24966     new_path="$unix_path"
24967   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
24968     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
24969     new_path="$unix_path"
24970   fi
24971 
24972   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
24973     BOOT_JDK="$new_path"
24974     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&5
24975 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
24976   fi
24977 
24978   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
24979   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
24980 
24981   else
24982     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
24983     path="$BOOT_JDK"
24984     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
24985     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
24986       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
24987 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
24988       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
24989     fi
24990 
24991     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
24992     eval path="$path"
24993     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
24994       as_fn_error $? "The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
24995     fi
24996 
24997     BOOT_JDK="`cd "$path"; $THEPWDCMD -L`"
24998   fi
24999 
25000             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for Boot JDK" >&5
25001 $as_echo_n "checking for Boot JDK... " >&6; }
25002             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BOOT_JDK" >&5
25003 $as_echo "$BOOT_JDK" >&6; }
25004             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking Boot JDK version" >&5
25005 $as_echo_n "checking Boot JDK version... " >&6; }
25006             BOOT_JDK_VERSION=`"$BOOT_JDK/bin/java" -version 2>&1 | $TR '\n\r' '  '`
25007             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BOOT_JDK_VERSION" >&5
25008 $as_echo "$BOOT_JDK_VERSION" >&6; }
25009           fi # end check jdk version
25010         fi # end check javac
25011       fi # end check java
25012     fi # end check boot jdk found
25013   fi
25014 
25015     done
25016   fi
25017 
25018 
25019     # If previous step claimed to have found a JDK, check it to see if it seems to be valid.
25020     if test "x$BOOT_JDK_FOUND" = xmaybe; then
25021       # Do we have a bin/java?
25022       if test ! -x "$BOOT_JDK/bin/java"; then
25023         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/java; ignoring" >&5
25024 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/java; ignoring" >&6;}
25025         BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
25026       else
25027         # Do we have a bin/javac?
25028         if test ! -x "$BOOT_JDK/bin/javac"; then
25029           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/javac; ignoring" >&5
25030 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/javac; ignoring" >&6;}
25031           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: (This might be an JRE instead of an JDK)" >&5
25032 $as_echo "$as_me: (This might be an JRE instead of an JDK)" >&6;}
25033           BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
25034         else
25035           # Oh, this is looking good! We probably have found a proper JDK. Is it the correct version?
25036           BOOT_JDK_VERSION=`"$BOOT_JDK/bin/java" -version 2>&1 | head -n 1`
25037 
25038           # Extra M4 quote needed to protect [] in grep expression.
25039           FOUND_CORRECT_VERSION=`echo $BOOT_JDK_VERSION | grep  '\"1\.[89]\.'`
25040           if test "x$FOUND_CORRECT_VERSION" = x; then
25041             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK is incorrect JDK version ($BOOT_JDK_VERSION); ignoring" >&5
25042 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK is incorrect JDK version ($BOOT_JDK_VERSION); ignoring" >&6;}
25043             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: (Your Boot JDK must be version 8 or 9)" >&5
25044 $as_echo "$as_me: (Your Boot JDK must be version 8 or 9)" >&6;}
25045             BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
25046           else
25047             # We're done! :-)
25048             BOOT_JDK_FOUND=yes
25049 
25050   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
25051 
25052   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
25053   # unix format.
25054   path="$BOOT_JDK"
25055   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
25056 
25057   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
25058   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
25059   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
25060   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
25061   #
25062   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file precense.
25063   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
25064   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
25065   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
25066     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
25067 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
25068     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of BOOT_JDK" "$LINENO" 5
25069   fi
25070 
25071   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
25072   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
25073 
25074   input_path="$new_path"
25075   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
25076   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
25077   # take no chances and rewrite it.
25078   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
25079   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
25080   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
25081     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
25082     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
25083     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
25084     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
25085       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
25086       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
25087       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
25088       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
25089       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
25090       new_path="$input_path"
25091     fi
25092   fi
25093 
25094   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
25095   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
25096     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
25097     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
25098       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
25099       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
25100       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
25101     fi
25102   fi
25103 
25104 
25105   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
25106     BOOT_JDK="$new_path"
25107     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&5
25108 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
25109   fi
25110 
25111   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
25112 
25113   path="$BOOT_JDK"
25114   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
25115   new_path="$path"
25116   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
25117     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
25118     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
25119   fi
25120 
25121 
25122   input_path="$new_path"
25123   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
25124   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
25125   # take no chances and rewrite it.
25126   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
25127   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
25128   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
25129     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
25130     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
25131   fi
25132 
25133 
25134   windows_path="$new_path"
25135   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
25136     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
25137     new_path="$unix_path"
25138   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
25139     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
25140     new_path="$unix_path"
25141   fi
25142 
25143   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
25144     BOOT_JDK="$new_path"
25145     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&5
25146 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
25147   fi
25148 
25149   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
25150   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
25151 
25152   else
25153     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
25154     path="$BOOT_JDK"
25155     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
25156     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
25157       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
25158 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
25159       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
25160     fi
25161 
25162     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
25163     eval path="$path"
25164     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
25165       as_fn_error $? "The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
25166     fi
25167 
25168     BOOT_JDK="`cd "$path"; $THEPWDCMD -L`"
25169   fi
25170 
25171             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for Boot JDK" >&5
25172 $as_echo_n "checking for Boot JDK... " >&6; }
25173             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BOOT_JDK" >&5
25174 $as_echo "$BOOT_JDK" >&6; }
25175             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking Boot JDK version" >&5
25176 $as_echo_n "checking Boot JDK version... " >&6; }
25177             BOOT_JDK_VERSION=`"$BOOT_JDK/bin/java" -version 2>&1 | $TR '\n\r' '  '`
25178             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BOOT_JDK_VERSION" >&5
25179 $as_echo "$BOOT_JDK_VERSION" >&6; }
25180           fi # end check jdk version
25181         fi # end check javac
25182       fi # end check java
25183     fi # end check boot jdk found
25184   fi
25185 
25186   fi
25187 
25188 
25189     # If previous step claimed to have found a JDK, check it to see if it seems to be valid.
25190     if test "x$BOOT_JDK_FOUND" = xmaybe; then
25191       # Do we have a bin/java?
25192       if test ! -x "$BOOT_JDK/bin/java"; then
25193         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/java; ignoring" >&5
25194 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/java; ignoring" >&6;}
25195         BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
25196       else
25197         # Do we have a bin/javac?
25198         if test ! -x "$BOOT_JDK/bin/javac"; then
25199           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/javac; ignoring" >&5
25200 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK did not contain bin/javac; ignoring" >&6;}
25201           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: (This might be an JRE instead of an JDK)" >&5
25202 $as_echo "$as_me: (This might be an JRE instead of an JDK)" >&6;}
25203           BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
25204         else
25205           # Oh, this is looking good! We probably have found a proper JDK. Is it the correct version?
25206           BOOT_JDK_VERSION=`"$BOOT_JDK/bin/java" -version 2>&1 | head -n 1`
25207 
25208           # Extra M4 quote needed to protect [] in grep expression.
25209           FOUND_CORRECT_VERSION=`echo $BOOT_JDK_VERSION | grep  '\"1\.[89]\.'`
25210           if test "x$FOUND_CORRECT_VERSION" = x; then
25211             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK is incorrect JDK version ($BOOT_JDK_VERSION); ignoring" >&5
25212 $as_echo "$as_me: Potential Boot JDK found at $BOOT_JDK is incorrect JDK version ($BOOT_JDK_VERSION); ignoring" >&6;}
25213             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: (Your Boot JDK must be version 8 or 9)" >&5
25214 $as_echo "$as_me: (Your Boot JDK must be version 8 or 9)" >&6;}
25215             BOOT_JDK_FOUND=no
25216           else
25217             # We're done! :-)
25218             BOOT_JDK_FOUND=yes
25219 
25220   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
25221 
25222   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
25223   # unix format.
25224   path="$BOOT_JDK"
25225   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
25226 
25227   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
25228   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
25229   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
25230   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
25231   #
25232   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file precense.
25233   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
25234   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
25235   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
25236     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
25237 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
25238     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of BOOT_JDK" "$LINENO" 5
25239   fi
25240 
25241   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
25242   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
25243 
25244   input_path="$new_path"
25245   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
25246   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
25247   # take no chances and rewrite it.
25248   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
25249   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
25250   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
25251     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
25252     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
25253     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
25254     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
25255       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
25256       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
25257       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
25258       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
25259       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
25260       new_path="$input_path"
25261     fi
25262   fi
25263 
25264   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
25265   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
25266     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
25267     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
25268       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
25269       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
25270       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
25271     fi
25272   fi
25273 
25274 
25275   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
25276     BOOT_JDK="$new_path"
25277     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&5
25278 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
25279   fi
25280 
25281   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
25282 
25283   path="$BOOT_JDK"
25284   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
25285   new_path="$path"
25286   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
25287     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
25288     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
25289   fi
25290 
25291 
25292   input_path="$new_path"
25293   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
25294   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
25295   # take no chances and rewrite it.
25296   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
25297   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
25298   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
25299     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
25300     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
25301   fi
25302 
25303 
25304   windows_path="$new_path"
25305   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
25306     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
25307     new_path="$unix_path"
25308   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
25309     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
25310     new_path="$unix_path"
25311   fi
25312 
25313   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
25314     BOOT_JDK="$new_path"
25315     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&5
25316 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting BOOT_JDK to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
25317   fi
25318 
25319   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
25320   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
25321 
25322   else
25323     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
25324     path="$BOOT_JDK"
25325     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
25326     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
25327       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
25328 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
25329       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
25330     fi
25331 
25332     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
25333     eval path="$path"
25334     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
25335       as_fn_error $? "The path of BOOT_JDK, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
25336     fi
25337 
25338     BOOT_JDK="`cd "$path"; $THEPWDCMD -L`"
25339   fi
25340 
25341             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for Boot JDK" >&5
25342 $as_echo_n "checking for Boot JDK... " >&6; }
25343             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BOOT_JDK" >&5
25344 $as_echo "$BOOT_JDK" >&6; }
25345             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking Boot JDK version" >&5
25346 $as_echo_n "checking Boot JDK version... " >&6; }
25347             BOOT_JDK_VERSION=`"$BOOT_JDK/bin/java" -version 2>&1 | $TR '\n\r' '  '`
25348             { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BOOT_JDK_VERSION" >&5
25349 $as_echo "$BOOT_JDK_VERSION" >&6; }
25350           fi # end check jdk version
25351         fi # end check javac
25352       fi # end check java
25353     fi # end check boot jdk found
25354   fi
25355 
25356 
25357   # If we haven't found anything yet, we've truly lost. Give up.
25358   if test "x$BOOT_JDK_FOUND" = xno; then
25359 
25360   # Print a helpful message on how to acquire the necessary build dependency.
25361   # openjdk is the help tag: freetype, cups, pulse, alsa etc
25362   MISSING_DEPENDENCY=openjdk
25363 
25364   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
25365     cygwin_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY
25366   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
25367     msys_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY
25368   else
25369     PKGHANDLER_COMMAND=
25370 
25371     case $PKGHANDLER in
25372       apt-get)
25373         apt_help     $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
25374       yum)
25375         yum_help     $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
25376       port)
25377         port_help    $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
25378       pkgutil)
25379         pkgutil_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
25380       pkgadd)
25381         pkgadd_help  $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
25382     esac
25383 
25384     if test "x$PKGHANDLER_COMMAND" != x; then
25385       HELP_MSG="You might be able to fix this by running '$PKGHANDLER_COMMAND'."
25386     fi
25387   fi
25388 
25389     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Could not find a valid Boot JDK. $HELP_MSG" >&5
25390 $as_echo "$as_me: Could not find a valid Boot JDK. $HELP_MSG" >&6;}
25391     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be fixed by explicitely setting --with-boot-jdk" >&5
25392 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be fixed by explicitely setting --with-boot-jdk" >&6;}
25393     as_fn_error $? "Cannot continue" "$LINENO" 5
25394   fi
25395 
25396 
25397 
25398   # Setup tools from the Boot JDK.
25399 
25400   # Use user overridden value if available, otherwise locate tool in the Boot JDK.
25401 
25402   # Publish this variable in the help.
25403 
25404 
25405   if test "x$JAVA" = x; then
25406     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
25407 
25408       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for java in Boot JDK" >&5
25409 $as_echo_n "checking for java in Boot JDK... " >&6; }
25410       JAVA=$BOOT_JDK/bin/java
25411       if test ! -x $JAVA; then
25412         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
25413 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
25414         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Your Boot JDK seems broken. This might be fixed by explicitely setting --with-boot-jdk" >&5
25415 $as_echo "$as_me: Your Boot JDK seems broken. This might be fixed by explicitely setting --with-boot-jdk" >&6;}
25416         as_fn_error $? "Could not find java in the Boot JDK" "$LINENO" 5
25417       fi
25418       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: ok" >&5
25419 $as_echo "ok" >&6; }
25420 
25421 
25422   else
25423     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
25424 
25425     # Try to remove the string !JAVA! from our list.
25426     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!JAVA!/}
25427     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
25428       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
25429       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
25430       if test "xJAVA" != xBASH; then
25431         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of JAVA from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
25432 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of JAVA from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
25433       fi
25434       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
25435 
25436       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for java in Boot JDK" >&5
25437 $as_echo_n "checking for java in Boot JDK... " >&6; }
25438       JAVA=$BOOT_JDK/bin/java
25439       if test ! -x $JAVA; then
25440         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
25441 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
25442         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Your Boot JDK seems broken. This might be fixed by explicitely setting --with-boot-jdk" >&5
25443 $as_echo "$as_me: Your Boot JDK seems broken. This might be fixed by explicitely setting --with-boot-jdk" >&6;}
25444         as_fn_error $? "Could not find java in the Boot JDK" "$LINENO" 5
25445       fi
25446       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: ok" >&5
25447 $as_echo "ok" >&6; }
25448 
25449 
25450     else
25451       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
25452       # for the tool.
25453 
25454       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
25455       # for unknown variables in the end.
25456       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
25457 
25458       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
25459       tool_specified="$JAVA"
25460       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
25461       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
25462         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
25463         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool JAVA=$tool_basename" >&5
25464 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool JAVA=$tool_basename" >&6;}
25465         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
25466 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
25467 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
25468 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
25469 if ${ac_cv_path_JAVA+:} false; then :
25470   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
25471 else
25472   case $JAVA in
25473   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
25474   ac_cv_path_JAVA="$JAVA" # Let the user override the test with a path.
25475   ;;
25476   *)
25477   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
25478 for as_dir in $PATH
25479 do
25480   IFS=$as_save_IFS
25481   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
25482     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
25483   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
25484     ac_cv_path_JAVA="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
25485     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
25486     break 2
25487   fi
25488 done
25489   done
25490 IFS=$as_save_IFS
25491 
25492   ;;
25493 esac
25494 fi
25495 JAVA=$ac_cv_path_JAVA
25496 if test -n "$JAVA"; then
25497   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $JAVA" >&5
25498 $as_echo "$JAVA" >&6; }
25499 else
25500   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
25501 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
25502 fi
25503 
25504 
25505         if test "x$JAVA" = x; then
25506           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
25507         fi
25508       else
25509         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
25510         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool JAVA=$tool_specified" >&5
25511 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool JAVA=$tool_specified" >&6;}
25512         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for JAVA" >&5
25513 $as_echo_n "checking for JAVA... " >&6; }
25514         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
25515           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
25516 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
25517           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool JAVA=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
25518         fi
25519         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
25520 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
25521       fi
25522     fi
25523   fi
25524 
25525 
25526 
25527   # Use user overridden value if available, otherwise locate tool in the Boot JDK.
25528 
25529   # Publish this variable in the help.
25530 
25531 
25532   if test "x$JAVAC" = x; then
25533     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
25534 
25535       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for javac in Boot JDK" >&5
25536 $as_echo_n "checking for javac in Boot JDK... " >&6; }
25537       JAVAC=$BOOT_JDK/bin/javac
25538       if test ! -x $JAVAC; then
25539         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
25540 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
25541         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Your Boot JDK seems broken. This might be fixed by explicitely setting --with-boot-jdk" >&5
25542 $as_echo "$as_me: Your Boot JDK seems broken. This might be fixed by explicitely setting --with-boot-jdk" >&6;}
25543         as_fn_error $? "Could not find javac in the Boot JDK" "$LINENO" 5
25544       fi
25545       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: ok" >&5
25546 $as_echo "ok" >&6; }
25547 
25548 
25549   else
25550     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
25551 
25552     # Try to remove the string !JAVAC! from our list.
25553     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!JAVAC!/}
25554     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
25555       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
25556       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
25557       if test "xJAVAC" != xBASH; then
25558         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of JAVAC from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
25559 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of JAVAC from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
25560       fi
25561       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
25562 
25563       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for javac in Boot JDK" >&5
25564 $as_echo_n "checking for javac in Boot JDK... " >&6; }
25565       JAVAC=$BOOT_JDK/bin/javac
25566       if test ! -x $JAVAC; then
25567         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
25568 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
25569         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Your Boot JDK seems broken. This might be fixed by explicitely setting --with-boot-jdk" >&5
25570 $as_echo "$as_me: Your Boot JDK seems broken. This might be fixed by explicitely setting --with-boot-jdk" >&6;}
25571         as_fn_error $? "Could not find javac in the Boot JDK" "$LINENO" 5
25572       fi
25573       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: ok" >&5
25574 $as_echo "ok" >&6; }
25575 
25576 
25577     else
25578       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
25579       # for the tool.
25580 
25581       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
25582       # for unknown variables in the end.
25583       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
25584 
25585       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
25586       tool_specified="$JAVAC"
25587       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
25588       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
25589         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
25590         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool JAVAC=$tool_basename" >&5
25591 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool JAVAC=$tool_basename" >&6;}
25592         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
25593 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
25594 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5

25596 if ${ac_cv_path_JAVAC+:} false; then :
25597   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
25598 else
25599   case $JAVAC in

25602   ;;
25603   *)

25614   fi
25615 done
25616   done

25618 
25619   ;;
25620 esac

25627   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
25628 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
25629 fi

25633           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
25634         fi

25892 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool JAR=$tool_specified" >&6;}
25893         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for JAR" >&5
25894 $as_echo_n "checking for JAR... " >&6; }
25895         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
25896           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
25897 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
25898           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool JAR=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
25899         fi
25900         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
25901 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
25902       fi
25903     fi
25904   fi
25905 
25906 
25907 
25908   # Use user overridden value if available, otherwise locate tool in the Boot JDK.
25909 
25910   # Publish this variable in the help.
25911 
25912 
25913   if test "x$NATIVE2ASCII" = x; then
25914     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
25915 
25916       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for native2ascii in Boot JDK" >&5
25917 $as_echo_n "checking for native2ascii in Boot JDK... " >&6; }
25918       NATIVE2ASCII=$BOOT_JDK/bin/native2ascii
25919       if test ! -x $NATIVE2ASCII; then
25920         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
25921 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
25922         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Your Boot JDK seems broken. This might be fixed by explicitely setting --with-boot-jdk" >&5
25923 $as_echo "$as_me: Your Boot JDK seems broken. This might be fixed by explicitely setting --with-boot-jdk" >&6;}
25924         as_fn_error $? "Could not find native2ascii in the Boot JDK" "$LINENO" 5
25925       fi
25926       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: ok" >&5
25927 $as_echo "ok" >&6; }
25928 
25929 
25930   else
25931     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
25932 
25933     # Try to remove the string !NATIVE2ASCII! from our list.
25934     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!NATIVE2ASCII!/}
25935     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
25936       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
25937       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
25938       if test "xNATIVE2ASCII" != xBASH; then
25939         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of NATIVE2ASCII from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
25940 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of NATIVE2ASCII from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
25941       fi
25942       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
25943 
25944       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for native2ascii in Boot JDK" >&5
25945 $as_echo_n "checking for native2ascii in Boot JDK... " >&6; }
25946       NATIVE2ASCII=$BOOT_JDK/bin/native2ascii
25947       if test ! -x $NATIVE2ASCII; then
25948         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
25949 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
25950         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Your Boot JDK seems broken. This might be fixed by explicitely setting --with-boot-jdk" >&5
25951 $as_echo "$as_me: Your Boot JDK seems broken. This might be fixed by explicitely setting --with-boot-jdk" >&6;}
25952         as_fn_error $? "Could not find native2ascii in the Boot JDK" "$LINENO" 5
25953       fi
25954       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: ok" >&5
25955 $as_echo "ok" >&6; }
25956 
25957 
25958     else
25959       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
25960       # for the tool.
25961 
25962       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
25963       # for unknown variables in the end.
25964       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
25965 
25966       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
25967       tool_specified="$NATIVE2ASCII"
25968       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
25969       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
25970         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
25971         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool NATIVE2ASCII=$tool_basename" >&5
25972 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool NATIVE2ASCII=$tool_basename" >&6;}
25973         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
25974 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
25975 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
25976 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
25977 if ${ac_cv_path_NATIVE2ASCII+:} false; then :
25978   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
25979 else
25980   case $NATIVE2ASCII in
25981   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
25982   ac_cv_path_NATIVE2ASCII="$NATIVE2ASCII" # Let the user override the test with a path.
25983   ;;
25984   *)
25985   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
25986 for as_dir in $PATH
25987 do
25988   IFS=$as_save_IFS
25989   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
25990     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
25991   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
25992     ac_cv_path_NATIVE2ASCII="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
25993     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
25994     break 2
25995   fi
25996 done
25997   done
25998 IFS=$as_save_IFS
25999 
26000   ;;
26001 esac
26002 fi
26003 NATIVE2ASCII=$ac_cv_path_NATIVE2ASCII
26004 if test -n "$NATIVE2ASCII"; then
26005   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $NATIVE2ASCII" >&5
26006 $as_echo "$NATIVE2ASCII" >&6; }
26007 else
26008   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
26009 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
26010 fi
26011 
26012 
26013         if test "x$NATIVE2ASCII" = x; then
26014           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
26015         fi
26016       else
26017         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
26018         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool NATIVE2ASCII=$tool_specified" >&5
26019 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool NATIVE2ASCII=$tool_specified" >&6;}
26020         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for NATIVE2ASCII" >&5
26021 $as_echo_n "checking for NATIVE2ASCII... " >&6; }
26022         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
26023           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
26024 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
26025           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool NATIVE2ASCII=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
26026         fi
26027         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
26028 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
26029       fi
26030     fi
26031   fi
26032 
26033 
26034 
26035   # Use user overridden value if available, otherwise locate tool in the Boot JDK.
26036 
26037   # Publish this variable in the help.
26038 
26039 
26040   if test "x$JARSIGNER" = x; then
26041     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
26042 
26043       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for jarsigner in Boot JDK" >&5
26044 $as_echo_n "checking for jarsigner in Boot JDK... " >&6; }
26045       JARSIGNER=$BOOT_JDK/bin/jarsigner
26046       if test ! -x $JARSIGNER; then
26047         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
26048 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
26049         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Your Boot JDK seems broken. This might be fixed by explicitely setting --with-boot-jdk" >&5
26050 $as_echo "$as_me: Your Boot JDK seems broken. This might be fixed by explicitely setting --with-boot-jdk" >&6;}
26051         as_fn_error $? "Could not find jarsigner in the Boot JDK" "$LINENO" 5
26052       fi
26053       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: ok" >&5
26054 $as_echo "ok" >&6; }
26055 
26056 
26057   else
26058     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
26059 
26060     # Try to remove the string !JARSIGNER! from our list.
26061     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!JARSIGNER!/}
26062     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
26063       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
26064       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
26065       if test "xJARSIGNER" != xBASH; then
26066         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of JARSIGNER from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
26067 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of JARSIGNER from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
26068       fi
26069       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
26070 
26071       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for jarsigner in Boot JDK" >&5
26072 $as_echo_n "checking for jarsigner in Boot JDK... " >&6; }
26073       JARSIGNER=$BOOT_JDK/bin/jarsigner
26074       if test ! -x $JARSIGNER; then
26075         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
26076 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
26077         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Your Boot JDK seems broken. This might be fixed by explicitely setting --with-boot-jdk" >&5
26078 $as_echo "$as_me: Your Boot JDK seems broken. This might be fixed by explicitely setting --with-boot-jdk" >&6;}
26079         as_fn_error $? "Could not find jarsigner in the Boot JDK" "$LINENO" 5
26080       fi
26081       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: ok" >&5
26082 $as_echo "ok" >&6; }
26083 
26084 
26085     else
26086       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
26087       # for the tool.
26088 
26089       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
26090       # for unknown variables in the end.
26091       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
26092 
26093       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
26094       tool_specified="$JARSIGNER"
26095       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
26096       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
26097         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
26098         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool JARSIGNER=$tool_basename" >&5
26099 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool JARSIGNER=$tool_basename" >&6;}
26100         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
26101 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
26102 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
26103 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
26104 if ${ac_cv_path_JARSIGNER+:} false; then :
26105   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
26106 else
26107   case $JARSIGNER in
26108   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
26109   ac_cv_path_JARSIGNER="$JARSIGNER" # Let the user override the test with a path.
26110   ;;
26111   *)
26112   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
26113 for as_dir in $PATH
26114 do
26115   IFS=$as_save_IFS
26116   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
26117     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
26118   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
26119     ac_cv_path_JARSIGNER="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
26120     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
26121     break 2
26122   fi
26123 done
26124   done
26125 IFS=$as_save_IFS
26126 
26127   ;;
26128 esac
26129 fi
26130 JARSIGNER=$ac_cv_path_JARSIGNER
26131 if test -n "$JARSIGNER"; then
26132   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $JARSIGNER" >&5
26133 $as_echo "$JARSIGNER" >&6; }
26134 else
26135   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
26136 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
26137 fi
26138 
26139 
26140         if test "x$JARSIGNER" = x; then
26141           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
26142         fi
26143       else
26144         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
26145         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool JARSIGNER=$tool_specified" >&5
26146 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool JARSIGNER=$tool_specified" >&6;}
26147         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for JARSIGNER" >&5
26148 $as_echo_n "checking for JARSIGNER... " >&6; }
26149         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
26150           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
26151 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
26152           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool JARSIGNER=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
26153         fi
26154         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
26155 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
26156       fi
26157     fi
26158   fi
26159 
26160 
26161 
26162   # Finally, set some other options...
26163 
26164   # When compiling code to be executed by the Boot JDK, force jdk8 compatibility.
26165   BOOT_JDK_SOURCETARGET="-source 8 -target 8"
26166 
26167 
26168 
26169 
26170 ###############################################################################
26171 #
26172 # Configure the sources to use. We can add or override individual directories.
26173 #
26174 ###############################################################################
26175 
26176 
26177   # Where are the sources. Any of these can be overridden
26178   # using --with-override-corba and the likes.
26179   LANGTOOLS_TOPDIR="$SRC_ROOT/langtools"
26180   CORBA_TOPDIR="$SRC_ROOT/corba"
26181   JAXP_TOPDIR="$SRC_ROOT/jaxp"
26182   JAXWS_TOPDIR="$SRC_ROOT/jaxws"
26183   HOTSPOT_TOPDIR="$SRC_ROOT/hotspot"
26184   NASHORN_TOPDIR="$SRC_ROOT/nashorn"
26185   JDK_TOPDIR="$SRC_ROOT/jdk"
26186 
26187 
26188 
26189 
26190 
26191 
26192 
26193 
26194 
26195 
26196   ###############################################################################
26197   #
26198   # Pickup additional source for a component from outside of the source root
26199   # or override source for a component.
26200   #
26201 
26202 # Check whether --with-add-source-root was given.
26203 if test "${with_add_source_root+set}" = set; then :
26204   withval=$with_add_source_root;
26205 fi
26206 
26207 
26208 
26209 # Check whether --with-override-source-root was given.
26210 if test "${with_override_source_root+set}" = set; then :
26211   withval=$with_override_source_root;
26212 fi
26213 
26214 
26215 
26216 # Check whether --with-adds-and-overrides was given.
26217 if test "${with_adds_and_overrides+set}" = set; then :
26218   withval=$with_adds_and_overrides;
26219 fi
26220 
26221 
26222   if test "x$with_adds_and_overrides" != x; then
26223     with_add_source_root="$with_adds_and_overrides/adds"
26224     with_override_source_root="$with_adds_and_overrides/overrides"
26225   fi
26226 
26227   if test "x$with_add_source_root" != x; then
26228     if ! test -d $with_add_source_root; then
26229       as_fn_error $? "Trying to use a non-existant add-source-root $with_add_source_root" "$LINENO" 5
26230     fi
26231     CURDIR="$PWD"
26232     cd "$with_add_source_root"
26233     ADD_SRC_ROOT="`pwd`"
26234     cd "$CURDIR"
26235     # Verify that the addon source root does not have any root makefiles.
26236     # If it does, then it is usually an error, prevent this.
26237     if test -f $with_add_source_root/langtools/make/Makefile; then
26238       as_fn_error $? "Your add source root seems to contain a full langtools repo! An add source root should only contain additional sources." "$LINENO" 5
26239     fi
26240     if test -f $with_add_source_root/corba/make/Makefile; then
26241       as_fn_error $? "Your add source root seems to contain a full corba repo! An add source root should only contain additional sources." "$LINENO" 5
26242     fi
26243     if test -f $with_add_source_root/jaxp/make/Makefile; then
26244       as_fn_error $? "Your add source root seems to contain a full jaxp repo! An add source root should only contain additional sources." "$LINENO" 5
26245     fi
26246     if test -f $with_add_source_root/jaxws/make/Makefile; then
26247       as_fn_error $? "Your add source root seems to contain a full jaxws repo! An add source root should only contain additional sources." "$LINENO" 5
26248     fi
26249     if test -f $with_add_source_root/hotspot/make/Makefile; then
26250       as_fn_error $? "Your add source root seems to contain a full hotspot repo! An add source root should only contain additional sources." "$LINENO" 5
26251     fi
26252     if test -f $with_add_source_root/nashorn/make/Makefile; then
26253       as_fn_error $? "Your add source root seems to contain a full nashorn repo! An add source root should only contain additional sources." "$LINENO" 5
26254     fi
26255     if test -f $with_add_source_root/jdk/make/Makefile; then
26256       as_fn_error $? "Your add source root seems to contain a full JDK repo! An add source root should only contain additional sources." "$LINENO" 5
26257     fi
26258   fi
26259 
26260 
26261   if test "x$with_override_source_root" != x; then
26262     if ! test -d $with_override_source_root; then
26263       as_fn_error $? "Trying to use a non-existant override-source-root $with_override_source_root" "$LINENO" 5
26264     fi
26265     CURDIR="$PWD"
26266     cd "$with_override_source_root"
26267     OVERRIDE_SRC_ROOT="`pwd`"
26268     cd "$CURDIR"
26269     if test -f $with_override_source_root/langtools/make/Makefile; then
26270       as_fn_error $? "Your override source root seems to contain a full langtools repo! An override source root should only contain sources that override." "$LINENO" 5
26271     fi
26272     if test -f $with_override_source_root/corba/make/Makefile; then
26273       as_fn_error $? "Your override source root seems to contain a full corba repo! An override source root should only contain sources that override." "$LINENO" 5
26274     fi
26275     if test -f $with_override_source_root/jaxp/make/Makefile; then
26276       as_fn_error $? "Your override source root seems to contain a full jaxp repo! An override source root should only contain sources that override." "$LINENO" 5
26277     fi
26278     if test -f $with_override_source_root/jaxws/make/Makefile; then
26279       as_fn_error $? "Your override source root seems to contain a full jaxws repo! An override source root should only contain sources that override." "$LINENO" 5
26280     fi
26281     if test -f $with_override_source_root/hotspot/make/Makefile; then
26282       as_fn_error $? "Your override source root seems to contain a full hotspot repo! An override source root should only contain sources that override." "$LINENO" 5
26283     fi
26284     if test -f $with_override_source_root/nashorn/make/Makefile; then
26285       as_fn_error $? "Your override source root seems to contain a full nashorn repo! An override source root should only contain sources that override." "$LINENO" 5
26286     fi
26287     if test -f $with_override_source_root/jdk/make/Makefile; then
26288       as_fn_error $? "Your override source root seems to contain a full JDK repo! An override source root should only contain sources that override." "$LINENO" 5
26289     fi
26290   fi
26291 
26292 
26293   ###############################################################################
26294   #
26295   # Override a repo completely, this is used for example when you have 3 small
26296   # development sandboxes of the langtools sources and want to avoid having 3 full
26297   # OpenJDK sources checked out on disk.
26298   #
26299   # Assuming that the 3 langtools sandboxes are located here:
26300   # /home/fredrik/sandbox1/langtools
26301   # /home/fredrik/sandbox2/langtools
26302   # /home/fredrik/sandbox3/langtools
26303   #
26304   # From the source root you create build subdirs manually:
26305   #     mkdir -p build1 build2 build3
26306   # in each build directory run:
26307   #     (cd build1 && ../configure --with-override-langtools=/home/fredrik/sandbox1 && make)
26308   #     (cd build2 && ../configure --with-override-langtools=/home/fredrik/sandbox2 && make)
26309   #     (cd build3 && ../configure --with-override-langtools=/home/fredrik/sandbox3 && make)
26310   #
26311 
26312 
26313 # Check whether --with-override-langtools was given.
26314 if test "${with_override_langtools+set}" = set; then :
26315   withval=$with_override_langtools;
26316 fi
26317 
26318 
26319 
26320 # Check whether --with-override-corba was given.
26321 if test "${with_override_corba+set}" = set; then :
26322   withval=$with_override_corba;
26323 fi
26324 
26325 
26326 
26327 # Check whether --with-override-jaxp was given.
26328 if test "${with_override_jaxp+set}" = set; then :
26329   withval=$with_override_jaxp;
26330 fi
26331 
26332 
26333 
26334 # Check whether --with-override-jaxws was given.
26335 if test "${with_override_jaxws+set}" = set; then :
26336   withval=$with_override_jaxws;
26337 fi
26338 
26339 
26340 
26341 # Check whether --with-override-hotspot was given.
26342 if test "${with_override_hotspot+set}" = set; then :
26343   withval=$with_override_hotspot;
26344 fi
26345 
26346 
26347
