26348 # Check whether --with-override-nashorn was given.
26349 if test "${with_override_nashorn+set}" = set; then :
26350   withval=$with_override_nashorn;
26351 fi
26352 
26353 
26354 
26355 # Check whether --with-override-jdk was given.
26356 if test "${with_override_jdk+set}" = set; then :
26357   withval=$with_override_jdk;
26358 fi
26359 
26360 
26361   if test "x$with_override_langtools" != x; then
26362     CURDIR="$PWD"
26363     cd "$with_override_langtools"
26364     LANGTOOLS_TOPDIR="`pwd`"
26365     cd "$CURDIR"
26366     if ! test -f $LANGTOOLS_TOPDIR/make/Makefile; then
26367       as_fn_error $? "You have to override langtools with a full langtools repo!" "$LINENO" 5
26368     fi
26369     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if langtools should be overridden" >&5
26370 $as_echo_n "checking if langtools should be overridden... " >&6; }
26371     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes with $LANGTOOLS_TOPDIR" >&5
26372 $as_echo "yes with $LANGTOOLS_TOPDIR" >&6; }
26373   fi
26374   if test "x$with_override_corba" != x; then
26375     CURDIR="$PWD"
26376     cd "$with_override_corba"
26377     CORBA_TOPDIR="`pwd`"
26378     cd "$CURDIR"
26379     if ! test -f $CORBA_TOPDIR/make/Makefile; then
26380       as_fn_error $? "You have to override corba with a full corba repo!" "$LINENO" 5
26381     fi
26382     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if corba should be overridden" >&5
26383 $as_echo_n "checking if corba should be overridden... " >&6; }
26384     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes with $CORBA_TOPDIR" >&5
26385 $as_echo "yes with $CORBA_TOPDIR" >&6; }
26386   fi
26387   if test "x$with_override_jaxp" != x; then
26388     CURDIR="$PWD"
26389     cd "$with_override_jaxp"
26390     JAXP_TOPDIR="`pwd`"
26391     cd "$CURDIR"
26392     if ! test -f $JAXP_TOPDIR/make/Makefile; then
26393       as_fn_error $? "You have to override jaxp with a full jaxp repo!" "$LINENO" 5
26394     fi
26395     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if jaxp should be overridden" >&5
26396 $as_echo_n "checking if jaxp should be overridden... " >&6; }
26397     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes with $JAXP_TOPDIR" >&5
26398 $as_echo "yes with $JAXP_TOPDIR" >&6; }
26399   fi
26400   if test "x$with_override_jaxws" != x; then
26401     CURDIR="$PWD"
26402     cd "$with_override_jaxws"
26403     JAXWS_TOPDIR="`pwd`"
26404     cd "$CURDIR"
26405     if ! test -f $JAXWS_TOPDIR/make/Makefile; then
26406       as_fn_error $? "You have to override jaxws with a full jaxws repo!" "$LINENO" 5
26407     fi
26408     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if jaxws should be overridden" >&5
26409 $as_echo_n "checking if jaxws should be overridden... " >&6; }
26410     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes with $JAXWS_TOPDIR" >&5
26411 $as_echo "yes with $JAXWS_TOPDIR" >&6; }
26412   fi
26413   if test "x$with_override_hotspot" != x; then
26414     CURDIR="$PWD"
26415     cd "$with_override_hotspot"
26416     HOTSPOT_TOPDIR="`pwd`"
26417     cd "$CURDIR"
26418     if ! test -f $HOTSPOT_TOPDIR/make/Makefile; then
26419       as_fn_error $? "You have to override hotspot with a full hotspot repo!" "$LINENO" 5
26420     fi
26421     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if hotspot should be overridden" >&5
26422 $as_echo_n "checking if hotspot should be overridden... " >&6; }
26423     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes with $HOTSPOT_TOPDIR" >&5
26424 $as_echo "yes with $HOTSPOT_TOPDIR" >&6; }
26425   fi
26426   if test "x$with_override_nashorn" != x; then
26427     CURDIR="$PWD"
26428     cd "$with_override_nashorn"
26429     NASHORN_TOPDIR="`pwd`"
26430     cd "$CURDIR"
26431     if ! test -f $NASHORN_TOPDIR/make/Makefile; then
26432       as_fn_error $? "You have to override nashorn with a full nashorn repo!" "$LINENO" 5
26433     fi
26434     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if nashorn should be overridden" >&5
26435 $as_echo_n "checking if nashorn should be overridden... " >&6; }
26436     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes with $NASHORN_TOPDIR" >&5
26437 $as_echo "yes with $NASHORN_TOPDIR" >&6; }
26438   fi
26439   if test "x$with_override_jdk" != x; then
26440     CURDIR="$PWD"
26441     cd "$with_override_jdk"
26442     JDK_TOPDIR="`pwd`"
26443     cd "$CURDIR"
26444     if ! test -f $JDK_TOPDIR/make/Makefile; then
26445       as_fn_error $? "You have to override JDK with a full JDK repo!" "$LINENO" 5
26446     fi
26447     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if JDK should be overridden" >&5
26448 $as_echo_n "checking if JDK should be overridden... " >&6; }
26449     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes with $JDK_TOPDIR" >&5
26450 $as_echo "yes with $JDK_TOPDIR" >&6; }
26451   fi
26452 
26453 
26454   BUILD_OUTPUT="$OUTPUT_ROOT"
26455 
26456 
26457   HOTSPOT_DIST="$OUTPUT_ROOT/hotspot/dist"
26458   BUILD_HOTSPOT=true
26459 
26460 
26461 
26462 # Check whether --with-import-hotspot was given.
26463 if test "${with_import_hotspot+set}" = set; then :
26464   withval=$with_import_hotspot;
26465 fi
26466 
26467   if test "x$with_import_hotspot" != x; then
26468     CURDIR="$PWD"
26469     cd "$with_import_hotspot"
26470     HOTSPOT_DIST="`pwd`"
26471     cd "$CURDIR"
26472     if ! (test -d $HOTSPOT_DIST/lib && test -d $HOTSPOT_DIST/jre/lib); then
26473       as_fn_error $? "You have to import hotspot from a full jdk image or hotspot build dist dir!" "$LINENO" 5
26474     fi
26475     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if hotspot should be imported" >&5
26476 $as_echo_n "checking if hotspot should be imported... " >&6; }
26477     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes from $HOTSPOT_DIST" >&5
26478 $as_echo "yes from $HOTSPOT_DIST" >&6; }
26479     BUILD_HOTSPOT=false
26480   fi
26481 
26482   JDK_OUTPUTDIR="$OUTPUT_ROOT/jdk"
26483 
26484 
26485 ###############################################################################
26486 #
26487 # Setup the toolchain (compilers etc), i.e. tools used to compile and process
26488 # native code.
26489 #
26490 ###############################################################################
26491 
26492 # First determine the toolchain type (compiler family)
26493 
26494 
26495 # Check whether --with-toolchain-type was given.
26496 if test "${with_toolchain_type+set}" = set; then :
26497   withval=$with_toolchain_type;
26498 fi
26499 
26500 
26501   # Use indirect variable referencing
26502   toolchain_var_name=VALID_TOOLCHAINS_$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS
26503   VALID_TOOLCHAINS=${!toolchain_var_name}
26504 
26505   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xmacosx; then
26506     if test -n "$XCODEBUILD"; then
26507       # On Mac OS X, default toolchain to clang after Xcode 5
26508       XCODE_VERSION_OUTPUT=`"$XCODEBUILD" -version 2>&1 | $HEAD -n 1`
26509       $ECHO "$XCODE_VERSION_OUTPUT" | $GREP "Xcode " > /dev/null
26510       if test $? -ne 0; then
26511         as_fn_error $? "Failed to determine Xcode version." "$LINENO" 5
26512       fi
26513       XCODE_MAJOR_VERSION=`$ECHO $XCODE_VERSION_OUTPUT | \
26514           $SED -e 's/^Xcode \([1-9][0-9.]*\)/\1/' | \
26515           $CUT -f 1 -d .`
26516       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Xcode major version: $XCODE_MAJOR_VERSION" >&5
26517 $as_echo "$as_me: Xcode major version: $XCODE_MAJOR_VERSION" >&6;}
26518       if test $XCODE_MAJOR_VERSION -ge 5; then
26519           DEFAULT_TOOLCHAIN="clang"
26520       else
26521           DEFAULT_TOOLCHAIN="gcc"
26522       fi
26523     else
26524       # If Xcode is not installed, but the command line tools are
26525       # then we can't run xcodebuild. On these systems we should
26526       # default to clang
26527       DEFAULT_TOOLCHAIN="clang"
26528     fi
26529   else
26530     # First toolchain type in the list is the default
26531     DEFAULT_TOOLCHAIN=${VALID_TOOLCHAINS%% *}
26532   fi
26533 
26534   if test "x$with_toolchain_type" = xlist; then
26535     # List all toolchains
26536     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The following toolchains are valid on this platform:" >&5
26537 $as_echo "$as_me: The following toolchains are valid on this platform:" >&6;}
26538     for toolchain in $VALID_TOOLCHAINS; do
26539       toolchain_var_name=TOOLCHAIN_DESCRIPTION_$toolchain
26540       TOOLCHAIN_DESCRIPTION=${!toolchain_var_name}
26541       $PRINTF "  %-10s  %s\n" $toolchain "$TOOLCHAIN_DESCRIPTION"
26542     done
26543 
26544     exit 0
26545   elif test "x$with_toolchain_type" != x; then
26546     # User override; check that it is valid
26547     if test "x${VALID_TOOLCHAINS/$with_toolchain_type/}" = "x${VALID_TOOLCHAINS}"; then
26548       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Toolchain type $with_toolchain_type is not valid on this platform." >&5
26549 $as_echo "$as_me: Toolchain type $with_toolchain_type is not valid on this platform." >&6;}
26550       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Valid toolchains: $VALID_TOOLCHAINS." >&5
26551 $as_echo "$as_me: Valid toolchains: $VALID_TOOLCHAINS." >&6;}
26552       as_fn_error $? "Cannot continue." "$LINENO" 5
26553     fi
26554     TOOLCHAIN_TYPE=$with_toolchain_type
26555   else
26556     # No flag given, use default
26557     TOOLCHAIN_TYPE=$DEFAULT_TOOLCHAIN
26558   fi
26559 
26560 
26561   TOOLCHAIN_CC_BINARY_clang="clang"
26562   TOOLCHAIN_CC_BINARY_gcc="gcc"
26563   TOOLCHAIN_CC_BINARY_microsoft="cl"
26564   TOOLCHAIN_CC_BINARY_solstudio="cc"
26565   TOOLCHAIN_CC_BINARY_xlc="xlc_r"
26566 
26567   TOOLCHAIN_CXX_BINARY_clang="clang++"
26568   TOOLCHAIN_CXX_BINARY_gcc="g++"
26569   TOOLCHAIN_CXX_BINARY_microsoft="cl"
26570   TOOLCHAIN_CXX_BINARY_solstudio="CC"
26571   TOOLCHAIN_CXX_BINARY_xlc="xlC_r"
26572 
26573   # Use indirect variable referencing
26574   toolchain_var_name=TOOLCHAIN_DESCRIPTION_$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE
26575   TOOLCHAIN_DESCRIPTION=${!toolchain_var_name}
26576   toolchain_var_name=TOOLCHAIN_CC_BINARY_$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE
26577   TOOLCHAIN_CC_BINARY=${!toolchain_var_name}
26578   toolchain_var_name=TOOLCHAIN_CXX_BINARY_$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE
26579   TOOLCHAIN_CXX_BINARY=${!toolchain_var_name}
26580 
26581 
26582   # Define filename patterns
26583   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xwindows; then
26584     LIBRARY_PREFIX=
26585     SHARED_LIBRARY_SUFFIX='.dll'
26586     STATIC_LIBRARY_SUFFIX='.lib'
26587     SHARED_LIBRARY='$1.dll'
26588     STATIC_LIBRARY='$1.lib'
26589     OBJ_SUFFIX='.obj'
26590     EXE_SUFFIX='.exe'
26591   else
26592     LIBRARY_PREFIX=lib
26593     SHARED_LIBRARY_SUFFIX='.so'
26594     STATIC_LIBRARY_SUFFIX='.a'
26595     SHARED_LIBRARY='lib$1.so'
26596     STATIC_LIBRARY='lib$1.a'
26597     OBJ_SUFFIX='.o'
26598     EXE_SUFFIX=''
26599     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xmacosx; then
26600       SHARED_LIBRARY='lib$1.dylib'
26601       SHARED_LIBRARY_SUFFIX='.dylib'
26602     fi
26603   fi
26604 
26605 
26606 
26607 
26608 
26609 
26610 
26611 
26612 
26613 
26614   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = "x$DEFAULT_TOOLCHAIN"; then
26615     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Using default toolchain $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE ($TOOLCHAIN_DESCRIPTION)" >&5
26616 $as_echo "$as_me: Using default toolchain $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE ($TOOLCHAIN_DESCRIPTION)" >&6;}
26617   else
26618     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Using user selected toolchain $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE ($TOOLCHAIN_DESCRIPTION). Default toolchain is $DEFAULT_TOOLCHAIN." >&5
26619 $as_echo "$as_me: Using user selected toolchain $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE ($TOOLCHAIN_DESCRIPTION). Default toolchain is $DEFAULT_TOOLCHAIN." >&6;}
26620   fi
26621 
26622 
26623 # Then detect the actual binaries needed
26624 
26625   # FIXME: Is this needed?
26626   ac_ext=cpp
26627 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
26628 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
26629 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
26630 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
26631 
26632 
26633   # Store the CFLAGS etc passed to the configure script.
26634   ORG_CFLAGS="$CFLAGS"
26635   ORG_CXXFLAGS="$CXXFLAGS"
26636   ORG_OBJCFLAGS="$OBJCFLAGS"
26637 
26638   # On Windows, we need to detect the visual studio installation first.
26639   # This will change the PATH, but we need to keep that new PATH even
26640   # after toolchain detection is done, since the compiler (on x86) uses
26641   # it for DLL resolution in runtime.
26642   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS" = "xwindows" && test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = "xmicrosoft"; then
26643 
26644   # Store path to cygwin link.exe to help excluding it when searching for
26645   # VS linker. This must be done before changing the PATH when looking for VS.
26646   # Extract the first word of "link", so it can be a program name with args.
26647 set dummy link; ac_word=$2
26648 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
26649 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
26650 if ${ac_cv_path_CYGWIN_LINK+:} false; then :
26651   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
26652 else
26653   case $CYGWIN_LINK in
26654   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
26655   ac_cv_path_CYGWIN_LINK="$CYGWIN_LINK" # Let the user override the test with a path.
26656   ;;
26657   *)
26658   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
26659 for as_dir in $PATH
26660 do
26661   IFS=$as_save_IFS
26662   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
26663     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
26664   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
26665     ac_cv_path_CYGWIN_LINK="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
26666     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
26667     break 2
26668   fi
26669 done
26670   done
26671 IFS=$as_save_IFS
26672 
26673   ;;
26674 esac
26675 fi
26676 CYGWIN_LINK=$ac_cv_path_CYGWIN_LINK
26677 if test -n "$CYGWIN_LINK"; then
26678   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $CYGWIN_LINK" >&5
26679 $as_echo "$CYGWIN_LINK" >&6; }
26680 else
26681   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
26682 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
26683 fi
26684 
26685 
26686   if test "x$CYGWIN_LINK" != x; then
26687     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if the first found link.exe is actually the Cygwin link tool" >&5
26688 $as_echo_n "checking if the first found link.exe is actually the Cygwin link tool... " >&6; }
26689     "$CYGWIN_LINK" --version > /dev/null
26690     if test $? -eq 0 ; then
26691       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes" >&5
26692 $as_echo "yes" >&6; }
26693     else
26694       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
26695 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
26696       # This might be the VS linker. Don't exclude it later on.
26697       CYGWIN_LINK=""
26698     fi
26699   fi
26700 
26701   # First-hand choice is to locate and run the vsvars bat file.
26702 
26703   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = x32; then
26704     VCVARSFILE="vc/bin/vcvars32.bat"
26705   else
26706     VCVARSFILE="vc/bin/amd64/vcvars64.bat"
26707   fi
26708 
26709   VS_ENV_CMD=""
26710   VS_ENV_ARGS=""
26711   if test "x$with_toolsdir" != x; then
26712 
26713   if test "x$VS_ENV_CMD" = x; then
26714     VS100BASE="$with_toolsdir/../.."
26715     METHOD="--with-tools-dir"
26716 
26717   windows_path="$VS100BASE"
26718   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
26719     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
26720     VS100BASE="$unix_path"
26721   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
26722     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
26723     VS100BASE="$unix_path"
26724   fi
26725 
26726     if test -d "$VS100BASE"; then
26727       if test -f "$VS100BASE/$VCVARSFILE"; then
26728         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found Visual Studio installation at $VS100BASE using $METHOD" >&5
26729 $as_echo "$as_me: Found Visual Studio installation at $VS100BASE using $METHOD" >&6;}
26730         VS_ENV_CMD="$VS100BASE/$VCVARSFILE"
26731         # PLATFORM_TOOLSET is used during the compilation of the freetype sources (see
26732         # 'LIB_BUILD_FREETYPE' in libraries.m4) and must be one of 'v100', 'v110' or 'v120' for VS 2010, 2012 or VS2013
26733         # TODO: improve detection for other versions of VS
26734         PLATFORM_TOOLSET="v100"
26735       else
26736         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found Visual Studio installation at $VS100BASE using $METHOD" >&5
26737 $as_echo "$as_me: Found Visual Studio installation at $VS100BASE using $METHOD" >&6;}
26738         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Warning: $VCVARSFILE is missing, this is probably Visual Studio Express. Ignoring" >&5
26739 $as_echo "$as_me: Warning: $VCVARSFILE is missing, this is probably Visual Studio Express. Ignoring" >&6;}
26740       fi
26741     fi
26742   fi
26743 
26744   fi
26745 
26746   if test "x$with_toolsdir" != x && test "x$VS_ENV_CMD" = x; then
26747     # Having specified an argument which is incorrect will produce an instant failure;
26748     # we should not go on looking
26749     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path given by --with-tools-dir does not contain a valid Visual Studio installation" >&5
26750 $as_echo "$as_me: The path given by --with-tools-dir does not contain a valid Visual Studio installation" >&6;}
26751     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Please point to the VC/bin directory within the Visual Studio installation" >&5
26752 $as_echo "$as_me: Please point to the VC/bin directory within the Visual Studio installation" >&6;}
26753     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate a valid Visual Studio installation" "$LINENO" 5
26754   fi
26755 
26756   if test "x$VS100COMNTOOLS" != x; then
26757 
26758   if test "x$VS_ENV_CMD" = x; then
26759     VS100BASE="$VS100COMNTOOLS/../.."
26760     METHOD="VS100COMNTOOLS variable"
26761 
26762   windows_path="$VS100BASE"
26763   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
26764     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
26765     VS100BASE="$unix_path"
26766   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
26767     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
26768     VS100BASE="$unix_path"
26769   fi
26770 
26771     if test -d "$VS100BASE"; then
26772       if test -f "$VS100BASE/$VCVARSFILE"; then
26773         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found Visual Studio installation at $VS100BASE using $METHOD" >&5
26774 $as_echo "$as_me: Found Visual Studio installation at $VS100BASE using $METHOD" >&6;}
26775         VS_ENV_CMD="$VS100BASE/$VCVARSFILE"
26776         # PLATFORM_TOOLSET is used during the compilation of the freetype sources (see
26777         # 'LIB_BUILD_FREETYPE' in libraries.m4) and must be one of 'v100', 'v110' or 'v120' for VS 2010, 2012 or VS2013
26778         # TODO: improve detection for other versions of VS
26779         PLATFORM_TOOLSET="v100"
26780       else
26781         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found Visual Studio installation at $VS100BASE using $METHOD" >&5
26782 $as_echo "$as_me: Found Visual Studio installation at $VS100BASE using $METHOD" >&6;}
26783         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Warning: $VCVARSFILE is missing, this is probably Visual Studio Express. Ignoring" >&5
26784 $as_echo "$as_me: Warning: $VCVARSFILE is missing, this is probably Visual Studio Express. Ignoring" >&6;}
26785       fi
26786     fi
26787   fi
26788 
26789   fi
26790   if test "x$PROGRAMFILES" != x; then
26791 
26792   if test "x$VS_ENV_CMD" = x; then
26793     VS100BASE="$PROGRAMFILES/Microsoft Visual Studio 10.0"
26794     METHOD="well-known name"
26795 
26796   windows_path="$VS100BASE"
26797   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
26798     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
26799     VS100BASE="$unix_path"
26800   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
26801     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
26802     VS100BASE="$unix_path"
26803   fi
26804 
26805     if test -d "$VS100BASE"; then
26806       if test -f "$VS100BASE/$VCVARSFILE"; then
26807         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found Visual Studio installation at $VS100BASE using $METHOD" >&5
26808 $as_echo "$as_me: Found Visual Studio installation at $VS100BASE using $METHOD" >&6;}
26809         VS_ENV_CMD="$VS100BASE/$VCVARSFILE"
26810         # PLATFORM_TOOLSET is used during the compilation of the freetype sources (see
26811         # 'LIB_BUILD_FREETYPE' in libraries.m4) and must be one of 'v100', 'v110' or 'v120' for VS 2010, 2012 or VS2013
26812         # TODO: improve detection for other versions of VS
26813         PLATFORM_TOOLSET="v100"
26814       else
26815         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found Visual Studio installation at $VS100BASE using $METHOD" >&5
26816 $as_echo "$as_me: Found Visual Studio installation at $VS100BASE using $METHOD" >&6;}
26817         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Warning: $VCVARSFILE is missing, this is probably Visual Studio Express. Ignoring" >&5
26818 $as_echo "$as_me: Warning: $VCVARSFILE is missing, this is probably Visual Studio Express. Ignoring" >&6;}
26819       fi
26820     fi
26821   fi
26822 
26823   fi
26824 
26825   if test "x$VS_ENV_CMD" = x; then
26826     VS100BASE="C:/Program Files/Microsoft Visual Studio 10.0"
26827     METHOD="well-known name"
26828 
26829   windows_path="$VS100BASE"
26830   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
26831     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
26832     VS100BASE="$unix_path"
26833   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
26834     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
26835     VS100BASE="$unix_path"
26836   fi
26837 
26838     if test -d "$VS100BASE"; then
26839       if test -f "$VS100BASE/$VCVARSFILE"; then
26840         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found Visual Studio installation at $VS100BASE using $METHOD" >&5
26841 $as_echo "$as_me: Found Visual Studio installation at $VS100BASE using $METHOD" >&6;}
26842         VS_ENV_CMD="$VS100BASE/$VCVARSFILE"
26843         # PLATFORM_TOOLSET is used during the compilation of the freetype sources (see
26844         # 'LIB_BUILD_FREETYPE' in libraries.m4) and must be one of 'v100', 'v110' or 'v120' for VS 2010, 2012 or VS2013
26845         # TODO: improve detection for other versions of VS
26846         PLATFORM_TOOLSET="v100"
26847       else
26848         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found Visual Studio installation at $VS100BASE using $METHOD" >&5
26849 $as_echo "$as_me: Found Visual Studio installation at $VS100BASE using $METHOD" >&6;}
26850         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Warning: $VCVARSFILE is missing, this is probably Visual Studio Express. Ignoring" >&5
26851 $as_echo "$as_me: Warning: $VCVARSFILE is missing, this is probably Visual Studio Express. Ignoring" >&6;}
26852       fi
26853     fi
26854   fi
26855 
26856 
26857   if test "x$VS_ENV_CMD" = x; then
26858     VS100BASE="C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft Visual Studio 10.0"
26859     METHOD="well-known name"
26860 
26861   windows_path="$VS100BASE"
26862   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
26863     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
26864     VS100BASE="$unix_path"
26865   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
26866     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
26867     VS100BASE="$unix_path"
26868   fi
26869 
26870     if test -d "$VS100BASE"; then
26871       if test -f "$VS100BASE/$VCVARSFILE"; then
26872         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found Visual Studio installation at $VS100BASE using $METHOD" >&5
26873 $as_echo "$as_me: Found Visual Studio installation at $VS100BASE using $METHOD" >&6;}
26874         VS_ENV_CMD="$VS100BASE/$VCVARSFILE"
26875         # PLATFORM_TOOLSET is used during the compilation of the freetype sources (see
26876         # 'LIB_BUILD_FREETYPE' in libraries.m4) and must be one of 'v100', 'v110' or 'v120' for VS 2010, 2012 or VS2013
26877         # TODO: improve detection for other versions of VS
26878         PLATFORM_TOOLSET="v100"
26879       else
26880         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found Visual Studio installation at $VS100BASE using $METHOD" >&5
26881 $as_echo "$as_me: Found Visual Studio installation at $VS100BASE using $METHOD" >&6;}
26882         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Warning: $VCVARSFILE is missing, this is probably Visual Studio Express. Ignoring" >&5
26883 $as_echo "$as_me: Warning: $VCVARSFILE is missing, this is probably Visual Studio Express. Ignoring" >&6;}
26884       fi
26885     fi
26886   fi
26887 
26888 
26889   if test "x$ProgramW6432" != x; then
26890 
26891   if test "x$VS_ENV_CMD" = x; then
26892     WIN_SDK_BASE="$ProgramW6432/Microsoft SDKs/Windows/v7.1/Bin"
26893     METHOD="well-known name"
26894 
26895   windows_path="$WIN_SDK_BASE"
26896   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
26897     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
26898     WIN_SDK_BASE="$unix_path"
26899   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
26900     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
26901     WIN_SDK_BASE="$unix_path"
26902   fi
26903 
26904     if test -d "$WIN_SDK_BASE"; then
26905       # There have been cases of partial or broken SDK installations. A missing
26906       # lib dir is not going to work.
26907       if test ! -d "$WIN_SDK_BASE/../lib"; then
26908         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found Windows SDK installation at $WIN_SDK_BASE using $METHOD" >&5
26909 $as_echo "$as_me: Found Windows SDK installation at $WIN_SDK_BASE using $METHOD" >&6;}
26910         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Warning: Installation is broken, lib dir is missing. Ignoring" >&5
26911 $as_echo "$as_me: Warning: Installation is broken, lib dir is missing. Ignoring" >&6;}
26912       elif test -f "$WIN_SDK_BASE/SetEnv.Cmd"; then
26913         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found Windows SDK installation at $WIN_SDK_BASE using $METHOD" >&5
26914 $as_echo "$as_me: Found Windows SDK installation at $WIN_SDK_BASE using $METHOD" >&6;}
26915         VS_ENV_CMD="$WIN_SDK_BASE/SetEnv.Cmd"
26916         if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = x32; then
26917           VS_ENV_ARGS="/x86"
26918         else
26919           VS_ENV_ARGS="/x64"
26920         fi
26921         # PLATFORM_TOOLSET is used during the compilation of the freetype sources (see
26922         # 'LIB_BUILD_FREETYPE' in libraries.m4) and must be 'Windows7.1SDK' for Windows7.1SDK
26923         # TODO: improve detection for other versions of SDK
26924         PLATFORM_TOOLSET="Windows7.1SDK"
26925       else
26926         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found Windows SDK installation at $WIN_SDK_BASE using $METHOD" >&5
26927 $as_echo "$as_me: Found Windows SDK installation at $WIN_SDK_BASE using $METHOD" >&6;}
26928         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Warning: Installation is broken, SetEnv.Cmd is missing. Ignoring" >&5
26929 $as_echo "$as_me: Warning: Installation is broken, SetEnv.Cmd is missing. Ignoring" >&6;}
26930       fi
26931     fi
26932   fi
26933 
26934   fi
26935   if test "x$PROGRAMW6432" != x; then
26936 
26937   if test "x$VS_ENV_CMD" = x; then
26938     WIN_SDK_BASE="$PROGRAMW6432/Microsoft SDKs/Windows/v7.1/Bin"
26939     METHOD="well-known name"
26940 
26941   windows_path="$WIN_SDK_BASE"
26942   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
26943     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
26944     WIN_SDK_BASE="$unix_path"
26945   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
26946     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
26947     WIN_SDK_BASE="$unix_path"
26948   fi
26949 
26950     if test -d "$WIN_SDK_BASE"; then
26951       # There have been cases of partial or broken SDK installations. A missing
26952       # lib dir is not going to work.
26953       if test ! -d "$WIN_SDK_BASE/../lib"; then
26954         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found Windows SDK installation at $WIN_SDK_BASE using $METHOD" >&5
26955 $as_echo "$as_me: Found Windows SDK installation at $WIN_SDK_BASE using $METHOD" >&6;}
26956         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Warning: Installation is broken, lib dir is missing. Ignoring" >&5
26957 $as_echo "$as_me: Warning: Installation is broken, lib dir is missing. Ignoring" >&6;}
26958       elif test -f "$WIN_SDK_BASE/SetEnv.Cmd"; then
26959         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found Windows SDK installation at $WIN_SDK_BASE using $METHOD" >&5
26960 $as_echo "$as_me: Found Windows SDK installation at $WIN_SDK_BASE using $METHOD" >&6;}
26961         VS_ENV_CMD="$WIN_SDK_BASE/SetEnv.Cmd"
26962         if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = x32; then
26963           VS_ENV_ARGS="/x86"
26964         else
26965           VS_ENV_ARGS="/x64"
26966         fi
26967         # PLATFORM_TOOLSET is used during the compilation of the freetype sources (see
26968         # 'LIB_BUILD_FREETYPE' in libraries.m4) and must be 'Windows7.1SDK' for Windows7.1SDK
26969         # TODO: improve detection for other versions of SDK
26970         PLATFORM_TOOLSET="Windows7.1SDK"
26971       else
26972         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found Windows SDK installation at $WIN_SDK_BASE using $METHOD" >&5
26973 $as_echo "$as_me: Found Windows SDK installation at $WIN_SDK_BASE using $METHOD" >&6;}
26974         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Warning: Installation is broken, SetEnv.Cmd is missing. Ignoring" >&5
26975 $as_echo "$as_me: Warning: Installation is broken, SetEnv.Cmd is missing. Ignoring" >&6;}
26976       fi
26977     fi
26978   fi
26979 
26980   fi
26981   if test "x$PROGRAMFILES" != x; then
26982 
26983   if test "x$VS_ENV_CMD" = x; then
26984     WIN_SDK_BASE="$PROGRAMFILES/Microsoft SDKs/Windows/v7.1/Bin"
26985     METHOD="well-known name"
26986 
26987   windows_path="$WIN_SDK_BASE"
26988   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
26989     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
26990     WIN_SDK_BASE="$unix_path"
26991   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
26992     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
26993     WIN_SDK_BASE="$unix_path"
26994   fi
26995 
26996     if test -d "$WIN_SDK_BASE"; then
26997       # There have been cases of partial or broken SDK installations. A missing
26998       # lib dir is not going to work.
26999       if test ! -d "$WIN_SDK_BASE/../lib"; then
27000         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found Windows SDK installation at $WIN_SDK_BASE using $METHOD" >&5
27001 $as_echo "$as_me: Found Windows SDK installation at $WIN_SDK_BASE using $METHOD" >&6;}
27002         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Warning: Installation is broken, lib dir is missing. Ignoring" >&5
27003 $as_echo "$as_me: Warning: Installation is broken, lib dir is missing. Ignoring" >&6;}
27004       elif test -f "$WIN_SDK_BASE/SetEnv.Cmd"; then
27005         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found Windows SDK installation at $WIN_SDK_BASE using $METHOD" >&5
27006 $as_echo "$as_me: Found Windows SDK installation at $WIN_SDK_BASE using $METHOD" >&6;}
27007         VS_ENV_CMD="$WIN_SDK_BASE/SetEnv.Cmd"
27008         if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = x32; then
27009           VS_ENV_ARGS="/x86"
27010         else
27011           VS_ENV_ARGS="/x64"
27012         fi
27013         # PLATFORM_TOOLSET is used during the compilation of the freetype sources (see
27014         # 'LIB_BUILD_FREETYPE' in libraries.m4) and must be 'Windows7.1SDK' for Windows7.1SDK
27015         # TODO: improve detection for other versions of SDK
27016         PLATFORM_TOOLSET="Windows7.1SDK"
27017       else
27018         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found Windows SDK installation at $WIN_SDK_BASE using $METHOD" >&5
27019 $as_echo "$as_me: Found Windows SDK installation at $WIN_SDK_BASE using $METHOD" >&6;}
27020         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Warning: Installation is broken, SetEnv.Cmd is missing. Ignoring" >&5
27021 $as_echo "$as_me: Warning: Installation is broken, SetEnv.Cmd is missing. Ignoring" >&6;}
27022       fi
27023     fi
27024   fi
27025 
27026   fi
27027 
27028   if test "x$VS_ENV_CMD" = x; then
27029     WIN_SDK_BASE="C:/Program Files/Microsoft SDKs/Windows/v7.1/Bin"
27030     METHOD="well-known name"
27031 
27032   windows_path="$WIN_SDK_BASE"
27033   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
27034     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
27035     WIN_SDK_BASE="$unix_path"
27036   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
27037     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
27038     WIN_SDK_BASE="$unix_path"
27039   fi
27040 
27041     if test -d "$WIN_SDK_BASE"; then
27042       # There have been cases of partial or broken SDK installations. A missing
27043       # lib dir is not going to work.
27044       if test ! -d "$WIN_SDK_BASE/../lib"; then
27045         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found Windows SDK installation at $WIN_SDK_BASE using $METHOD" >&5
27046 $as_echo "$as_me: Found Windows SDK installation at $WIN_SDK_BASE using $METHOD" >&6;}
27047         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Warning: Installation is broken, lib dir is missing. Ignoring" >&5
27048 $as_echo "$as_me: Warning: Installation is broken, lib dir is missing. Ignoring" >&6;}
27049       elif test -f "$WIN_SDK_BASE/SetEnv.Cmd"; then
27050         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found Windows SDK installation at $WIN_SDK_BASE using $METHOD" >&5
27051 $as_echo "$as_me: Found Windows SDK installation at $WIN_SDK_BASE using $METHOD" >&6;}
27052         VS_ENV_CMD="$WIN_SDK_BASE/SetEnv.Cmd"
27053         if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = x32; then
27054           VS_ENV_ARGS="/x86"
27055         else
27056           VS_ENV_ARGS="/x64"
27057         fi
27058         # PLATFORM_TOOLSET is used during the compilation of the freetype sources (see
27059         # 'LIB_BUILD_FREETYPE' in libraries.m4) and must be 'Windows7.1SDK' for Windows7.1SDK
27060         # TODO: improve detection for other versions of SDK
27061         PLATFORM_TOOLSET="Windows7.1SDK"
27062       else
27063         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found Windows SDK installation at $WIN_SDK_BASE using $METHOD" >&5
27064 $as_echo "$as_me: Found Windows SDK installation at $WIN_SDK_BASE using $METHOD" >&6;}
27065         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Warning: Installation is broken, SetEnv.Cmd is missing. Ignoring" >&5
27066 $as_echo "$as_me: Warning: Installation is broken, SetEnv.Cmd is missing. Ignoring" >&6;}
27067       fi
27068     fi
27069   fi
27070 
27071 
27072   if test "x$VS_ENV_CMD" = x; then
27073     WIN_SDK_BASE="C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft SDKs/Windows/v7.1/Bin"
27074     METHOD="well-known name"
27075 
27076   windows_path="$WIN_SDK_BASE"
27077   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
27078     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
27079     WIN_SDK_BASE="$unix_path"
27080   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
27081     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
27082     WIN_SDK_BASE="$unix_path"
27083   fi
27084 
27085     if test -d "$WIN_SDK_BASE"; then
27086       # There have been cases of partial or broken SDK installations. A missing
27087       # lib dir is not going to work.
27088       if test ! -d "$WIN_SDK_BASE/../lib"; then
27089         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found Windows SDK installation at $WIN_SDK_BASE using $METHOD" >&5
27090 $as_echo "$as_me: Found Windows SDK installation at $WIN_SDK_BASE using $METHOD" >&6;}
27091         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Warning: Installation is broken, lib dir is missing. Ignoring" >&5
27092 $as_echo "$as_me: Warning: Installation is broken, lib dir is missing. Ignoring" >&6;}
27093       elif test -f "$WIN_SDK_BASE/SetEnv.Cmd"; then
27094         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found Windows SDK installation at $WIN_SDK_BASE using $METHOD" >&5
27095 $as_echo "$as_me: Found Windows SDK installation at $WIN_SDK_BASE using $METHOD" >&6;}
27096         VS_ENV_CMD="$WIN_SDK_BASE/SetEnv.Cmd"
27097         if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = x32; then
27098           VS_ENV_ARGS="/x86"
27099         else
27100           VS_ENV_ARGS="/x64"
27101         fi
27102         # PLATFORM_TOOLSET is used during the compilation of the freetype sources (see
27103         # 'LIB_BUILD_FREETYPE' in libraries.m4) and must be 'Windows7.1SDK' for Windows7.1SDK
27104         # TODO: improve detection for other versions of SDK
27105         PLATFORM_TOOLSET="Windows7.1SDK"
27106       else
27107         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found Windows SDK installation at $WIN_SDK_BASE using $METHOD" >&5
27108 $as_echo "$as_me: Found Windows SDK installation at $WIN_SDK_BASE using $METHOD" >&6;}
27109         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Warning: Installation is broken, SetEnv.Cmd is missing. Ignoring" >&5
27110 $as_echo "$as_me: Warning: Installation is broken, SetEnv.Cmd is missing. Ignoring" >&6;}
27111       fi
27112     fi
27113   fi
27114 
27115 
27116   if test "x$VS_ENV_CMD" != x; then
27117     # We have found a Visual Studio environment on disk, let's extract variables from the vsvars bat file.
27118 
27119   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
27120 
27121   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
27122   # space.
27123   complete="$VS_ENV_CMD"
27124   path="${complete%% *}"
27125   tmp="$complete EOL"
27126   arguments="${tmp#* }"
27127 
27128   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
27129   # unix format.
27130   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
27131 
27132   # Now try to locate executable using which
27133   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
27134   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
27135   # to not find them
27136   if test "x$new_path" = x \
27137       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
27138       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
27139     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
27140   fi
27141   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
27142     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
27143     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
27144     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
27145     # argument.
27146     path="$complete"
27147     arguments="EOL"
27148     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
27149     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
27150     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
27151     # to not find them
27152     if test "x$new_path" = x \
27153         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
27154         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
27155       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
27156     fi
27157     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
27158       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
27159       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of VS_ENV_CMD, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
27160 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of VS_ENV_CMD, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
27161       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
27162       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
27163         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
27164 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
27165       fi
27166       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of VS_ENV_CMD" "$LINENO" 5
27167     fi
27168   fi
27169 
27170   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
27171   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
27172   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
27173   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
27174   #
27175   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
27176   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
27177   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
27178   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
27179     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
27180     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
27181     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
27182       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
27183     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
27184       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
27185     else
27186       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of VS_ENV_CMD, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
27187 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of VS_ENV_CMD, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
27188       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
27189 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
27190       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of VS_ENV_CMD" "$LINENO" 5
27191     fi
27192   else
27193     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
27194   fi
27195 
27196   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
27197   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
27198   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
27199 
27200   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
27201   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
27202   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
27203   # take no chances and rewrite it.
27204   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
27205   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
27206   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
27207     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
27208     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
27209     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
27210     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
27211       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
27212       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
27213       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
27214       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
27215       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
27216       new_path="$input_path"
27217     fi
27218   fi
27219 
27220   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
27221   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
27222     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
27223     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
27224       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
27225       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
27226       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
27227     fi
27228   fi
27229 
27230   # remove trailing .exe if any
27231   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
27232 
27233   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
27234 
27235   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
27236   # space.
27237   complete="$VS_ENV_CMD"
27238   path="${complete%% *}"
27239   tmp="$complete EOL"
27240   arguments="${tmp#* }"
27241 
27242   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
27243   # unix format.
27244   new_path="$path"
27245 
27246   windows_path="$new_path"
27247   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
27248     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
27249     new_path="$unix_path"
27250   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
27251     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
27252     new_path="$unix_path"
27253   fi
27254 
27255 
27256   # Now try to locate executable using which
27257   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
27258 
27259   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
27260     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
27261     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
27262     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
27263     # argument.
27264     path="$complete"
27265     arguments="EOL"
27266     new_path="$path"
27267 
27268   windows_path="$new_path"
27269   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
27270     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
27271     new_path="$unix_path"
27272   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
27273     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
27274     new_path="$unix_path"
27275   fi
27276 
27277 
27278     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
27279     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
27280     # to not find them
27281     if test "x$new_path" = x \
27282         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
27283         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
27284       new_path="$path"
27285 
27286   windows_path="$new_path"
27287   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
27288     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
27289     new_path="$unix_path"
27290   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
27291     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
27292     new_path="$unix_path"
27293   fi
27294 
27295     fi
27296 
27297     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
27298       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
27299       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of VS_ENV_CMD, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
27300 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of VS_ENV_CMD, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
27301       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
27302       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
27303         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
27304 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
27305       fi
27306       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of VS_ENV_CMD" "$LINENO" 5
27307     fi
27308   fi
27309 
27310   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
27311   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
27312     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
27313     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
27314     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
27315   else
27316     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
27317     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
27318 
27319   input_path="$new_path"
27320   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
27321   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
27322   # take no chances and rewrite it.
27323   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
27324   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
27325   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
27326     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
27327     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
27328   fi
27329 
27330     # Output is in $new_path
27331 
27332   windows_path="$new_path"
27333   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
27334     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
27335     new_path="$unix_path"
27336   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
27337     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
27338     new_path="$unix_path"
27339   fi
27340 
27341     # remove trailing .exe if any
27342     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
27343 
27344     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
27345     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
27346   fi
27347 
27348   else
27349     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
27350     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
27351     # space.
27352     complete="$VS_ENV_CMD"
27353     path="${complete%% *}"
27354     tmp="$complete EOL"
27355     arguments="${tmp#* }"
27356 
27357     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
27358     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
27359     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
27360       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
27361       IFS_save="$IFS"
27362       IFS=:
27363       for p in $PATH; do
27364         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
27365           new_path="$p/$path"
27366           break
27367         fi
27368       done
27369       IFS="$IFS_save"
27370     else
27371       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
27372       new_path="$path"
27373     fi
27374 
27375     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
27376       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of VS_ENV_CMD, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
27377 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of VS_ENV_CMD, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
27378       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
27379       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
27380         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
27381 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
27382       fi
27383       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of VS_ENV_CMD" "$LINENO" 5
27384     fi
27385   fi
27386 
27387   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
27388   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
27389     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
27390   else
27391     new_complete="$new_path"
27392   fi
27393 
27394   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
27395     VS_ENV_CMD="$new_complete"
27396     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting VS_ENV_CMD to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
27397 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting VS_ENV_CMD to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
27398   fi
27399 
27400 
27401     # Lets extract the variables that are set by vcvarsall.bat/vsvars32.bat/vsvars64.bat
27402     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Trying to extract Visual Studio environment variables" >&5
27403 $as_echo "$as_me: Trying to extract Visual Studio environment variables" >&6;}
27404 
27405     # We need to create a couple of temporary files.
27406     VS_ENV_TMP_DIR="$OUTPUT_ROOT/vs-env"
27407     $MKDIR -p $VS_ENV_TMP_DIR
27408 
27409     # Cannot use the VS10 setup script directly (since it only updates the DOS subshell environment).
27410     # Instead create a shell script which will set the relevant variables when run.
27411     WINPATH_VS_ENV_CMD="$VS_ENV_CMD"
27412 
27413   unix_path="$WINPATH_VS_ENV_CMD"
27414   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
27415     windows_path=`$CYGPATH -m "$unix_path"`
27416     WINPATH_VS_ENV_CMD="$windows_path"
27417   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
27418     windows_path=`cmd //c echo $unix_path`
27419     WINPATH_VS_ENV_CMD="$windows_path"
27420   fi
27421 
27422     WINPATH_BASH="$BASH"
27423 
27424   unix_path="$WINPATH_BASH"
27425   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
27426     windows_path=`$CYGPATH -m "$unix_path"`
27427     WINPATH_BASH="$windows_path"
27428   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
27429     windows_path=`cmd //c echo $unix_path`
27430     WINPATH_BASH="$windows_path"
27431   fi
27432 
27433 
27434     # Generate a DOS batch file which runs $VS_ENV_CMD, and then creates a shell
27435     # script (executable by bash) that will setup the important variables.
27436     EXTRACT_VC_ENV_BAT_FILE="$VS_ENV_TMP_DIR/extract-vs-env.bat"
27437     $ECHO "@echo off" >  $EXTRACT_VC_ENV_BAT_FILE
27438     # This will end up something like:
27439     # call C:/progra~2/micros~2.0/vc/bin/amd64/vcvars64.bat
27440     $ECHO "call $WINPATH_VS_ENV_CMD $VS_ENV_ARGS" >> $EXTRACT_VC_ENV_BAT_FILE
27441     # These will end up something like:
27442     # C:/CygWin/bin/bash -c 'echo VS_PATH=\"$PATH\" > localdevenv.sh
27443     # The trailing space for everyone except PATH is no typo, but is needed due
27444     # to trailing \ in the Windows paths. These will be stripped later.
27445     $ECHO "$WINPATH_BASH -c 'echo VS_PATH="'\"$PATH\" > set-vs-env.sh' >> $EXTRACT_VC_ENV_BAT_FILE
27446     $ECHO "$WINPATH_BASH -c 'echo VS_INCLUDE="'\"$INCLUDE\;$include \" >> set-vs-env.sh' >> $EXTRACT_VC_ENV_BAT_FILE
27447     $ECHO "$WINPATH_BASH -c 'echo VS_LIB="'\"$LIB\;$lib \" >> set-vs-env.sh' >> $EXTRACT_VC_ENV_BAT_FILE
27448     $ECHO "$WINPATH_BASH -c 'echo VCINSTALLDIR="'\"$VCINSTALLDIR \" >> set-vs-env.sh' >> $EXTRACT_VC_ENV_BAT_FILE
27449     $ECHO "$WINPATH_BASH -c 'echo WindowsSdkDir="'\"$WindowsSdkDir \" >> set-vs-env.sh' >> $EXTRACT_VC_ENV_BAT_FILE
27450     $ECHO "$WINPATH_BASH -c 'echo WINDOWSSDKDIR="'\"$WINDOWSSDKDIR \" >> set-vs-env.sh' >> $EXTRACT_VC_ENV_BAT_FILE
27451 
27452     # Now execute the newly created bat file.
27453     # The | cat is to stop SetEnv.Cmd to mess with system colors on msys.
27454     # Change directory so we don't need to mess with Windows paths in redirects.
27455     cd $VS_ENV_TMP_DIR
27456     cmd /c extract-vs-env.bat | $CAT
27457     cd $CURDIR
27458 
27459     if test ! -s $VS_ENV_TMP_DIR/set-vs-env.sh; then
27460       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Could not succesfully extract the envionment variables needed for the VS setup." >&5
27461 $as_echo "$as_me: Could not succesfully extract the envionment variables needed for the VS setup." >&6;}
27462       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Try setting --with-tools-dir to the VC/bin directory within the VS installation" >&5
27463 $as_echo "$as_me: Try setting --with-tools-dir to the VC/bin directory within the VS installation" >&6;}
27464       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: or run \"bash.exe -l\" from a VS command prompt and then run configure from there." >&5
27465 $as_echo "$as_me: or run \"bash.exe -l\" from a VS command prompt and then run configure from there." >&6;}
27466       as_fn_error $? "Cannot continue" "$LINENO" 5
27467     fi
27468 
27469     # Now set all paths and other env variables. This will allow the rest of
27470     # the configure script to find and run the compiler in the proper way.
27471     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Setting extracted environment variables" >&5
27472 $as_echo "$as_me: Setting extracted environment variables" >&6;}
27473     . $VS_ENV_TMP_DIR/set-vs-env.sh
27474     # Now we have VS_PATH, VS_INCLUDE, VS_LIB. For further checking, we
27475     # also define VCINSTALLDIR, WindowsSdkDir and WINDOWSSDKDIR.
27476   else
27477     # We did not find a vsvars bat file, let's hope we are run from a VS command prompt.
27478     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Cannot locate a valid Visual Studio installation, checking current environment" >&5
27479 $as_echo "$as_me: Cannot locate a valid Visual Studio installation, checking current environment" >&6;}
27480   fi
27481 
27482   # At this point, we should have correct variables in the environment, or we can't continue.
27483   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for Visual Studio variables" >&5
27484 $as_echo_n "checking for Visual Studio variables... " >&6; }
27485 
27486   if test "x$VCINSTALLDIR" != x || test "x$WindowsSDKDir" != x || test "x$WINDOWSSDKDIR" != x; then
27487     if test "x$VS_INCLUDE" = x || test "x$VS_LIB" = x; then
27488       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: present but broken" >&5
27489 $as_echo "present but broken" >&6; }
27490       as_fn_error $? "Your VC command prompt seems broken, INCLUDE and/or LIB is missing." "$LINENO" 5
27491     else
27492       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: ok" >&5
27493 $as_echo "ok" >&6; }
27494       # Remove any trailing "\" ";" and " " from the variables.
27495       VS_INCLUDE=`$ECHO "$VS_INCLUDE" | $SED -e 's/\\\\*;* *$//'`
27496       VS_LIB=`$ECHO "$VS_LIB" | $SED 's/\\\\*;* *$//'`
27497       VCINSTALLDIR=`$ECHO "$VCINSTALLDIR" | $SED 's/\\\\* *$//'`
27498       WindowsSDKDir=`$ECHO "$WindowsSDKDir" | $SED 's/\\\\* *$//'`
27499       WINDOWSSDKDIR=`$ECHO "$WINDOWSSDKDIR" | $SED 's/\\\\* *$//'`
27500       # Remove any paths containing # (typically F#) as that messes up make. This
27501       # is needed if visual studio was installed with F# support.
27502       VS_PATH=`$ECHO "$VS_PATH" | $SED 's/[^:#]*#[^:]*://g'`
27503 
27504 
27505 
27506 
27507 
27508       # Convert VS_INCLUDE into SYSROOT_CFLAGS
27509       OLDIFS="$IFS"
27510       IFS=";"
27511       for i in $VS_INCLUDE; do
27512         ipath=$i
27513         IFS="$OLDIFS"
27514 
27515   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
27516 
27517   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
27518   # unix format.
27519   path="$ipath"
27520   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
27521 
27522   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
27523   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
27524   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
27525   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
27526   #
27527   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file precense.
27528   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
27529   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
27530   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
27531     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of ipath, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
27532 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of ipath, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
27533     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of ipath" "$LINENO" 5
27534   fi
27535 
27536   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
27537   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
27538 
27539   input_path="$new_path"
27540   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
27541   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
27542   # take no chances and rewrite it.
27543   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
27544   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
27545   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
27546     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
27547     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
27548     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
27549     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
27550       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
27551       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
27552       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
27553       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
27554       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
27555       new_path="$input_path"
27556     fi
27557   fi
27558 
27559   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
27560   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
27561     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
27562     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
27563       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
27564       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
27565       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
27566     fi
27567   fi
27568 
27569 
27570   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
27571     ipath="$new_path"
27572     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting ipath to \"$new_path\"" >&5
27573 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting ipath to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
27574   fi
27575 
27576   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
27577 
27578   path="$ipath"
27579   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
27580   new_path="$path"
27581   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
27582     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
27583     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
27584   fi
27585 
27586 
27587   input_path="$new_path"
27588   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
27589   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
27590   # take no chances and rewrite it.
27591   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
27592   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
27593   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
27594     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
27595     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
27596   fi
27597 
27598 
27599   windows_path="$new_path"
27600   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
27601     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
27602     new_path="$unix_path"
27603   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
27604     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
27605     new_path="$unix_path"
27606   fi
27607 
27608   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
27609     ipath="$new_path"
27610     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting ipath to \"$new_path\"" >&5
27611 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting ipath to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
27612   fi
27613 
27614   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
27615   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
27616 
27617   else
27618     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
27619     path="$ipath"
27620     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
27621     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
27622       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of ipath, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
27623 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of ipath, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
27624       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
27625     fi
27626 
27627     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
27628     eval path="$path"
27629     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
27630       as_fn_error $? "The path of ipath, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
27631     fi
27632 
27633     ipath="`cd "$path"; $THEPWDCMD -L`"
27634   fi
27635 
27636         IFS=";"
27637         SYSROOT_CFLAGS="$SYSROOT_CFLAGS -I$ipath"
27638       done
27639       # Convert VS_LIB into SYSROOT_LDFLAGS
27640       for i in $VS_LIB; do
27641         libpath=$i
27642         IFS="$OLDIFS"
27643 
27644   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
27645 
27646   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
27647   # unix format.
27648   path="$libpath"
27649   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
27650 
27651   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
27652   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
27653   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
27654   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
27655   #
27656   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file precense.
27657   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
27658   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
27659   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
27660     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of libpath, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
27661 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of libpath, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
27662     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of libpath" "$LINENO" 5
27663   fi
27664 
27665   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
27666   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
27667 
27668   input_path="$new_path"
27669   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
27670   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
27671   # take no chances and rewrite it.
27672   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
27673   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
27674   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
27675     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
27676     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
27677     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
27678     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
27679       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
27680       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
27681       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
27682       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
27683       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
27684       new_path="$input_path"
27685     fi
27686   fi
27687 
27688   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
27689   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
27690     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
27691     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
27692       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
27693       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
27694       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
27695     fi
27696   fi
27697 
27698 
27699   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
27700     libpath="$new_path"
27701     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting libpath to \"$new_path\"" >&5
27702 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting libpath to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
27703   fi
27704 
27705   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
27706 
27707   path="$libpath"
27708   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
27709   new_path="$path"
27710   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
27711     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
27712     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
27713   fi
27714 
27715 
27716   input_path="$new_path"
27717   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
27718   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
27719   # take no chances and rewrite it.
27720   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
27721   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
27722   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
27723     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
27724     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
27725   fi
27726 
27727 
27728   windows_path="$new_path"
27729   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
27730     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
27731     new_path="$unix_path"
27732   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
27733     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
27734     new_path="$unix_path"
27735   fi
27736 
27737   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
27738     libpath="$new_path"
27739     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting libpath to \"$new_path\"" >&5
27740 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting libpath to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
27741   fi
27742 
27743   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
27744   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
27745 
27746   else
27747     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
27748     path="$libpath"
27749     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
27750     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
27751       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of libpath, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
27752 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of libpath, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
27753       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
27754     fi
27755 
27756     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
27757     eval path="$path"
27758     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
27759       as_fn_error $? "The path of libpath, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
27760     fi
27761 
27762     libpath="`cd "$path"; $THEPWDCMD -L`"
27763   fi
27764 
27765         IFS=";"
27766         SYSROOT_LDFLAGS="$SYSROOT_LDFLAGS -libpath:$libpath"
27767       done
27768       IFS="$OLDIFS"
27769     fi
27770   else
27771     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
27772 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
27773 
27774     if test "x$VS_ENV_CMD" = x; then
27775       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Cannot locate a valid Visual Studio or Windows SDK installation on disk," >&5
27776 $as_echo "$as_me: Cannot locate a valid Visual Studio or Windows SDK installation on disk," >&6;}
27777       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: nor is this script run from a Visual Studio command prompt." >&5
27778 $as_echo "$as_me: nor is this script run from a Visual Studio command prompt." >&6;}
27779     else
27780       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Running the extraction script failed." >&5
27781 $as_echo "$as_me: Running the extraction script failed." >&6;}
27782     fi
27783     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Try setting --with-tools-dir to the VC/bin directory within the VS installation" >&5
27784 $as_echo "$as_me: Try setting --with-tools-dir to the VC/bin directory within the VS installation" >&6;}
27785     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: or run \"bash.exe -l\" from a VS command prompt and then run configure from there." >&5
27786 $as_echo "$as_me: or run \"bash.exe -l\" from a VS command prompt and then run configure from there." >&6;}
27787     as_fn_error $? "Cannot continue" "$LINENO" 5
27788   fi
27789 
27790     # Reset path to VS_PATH. It will include everything that was on PATH at the time we
27791     # ran TOOLCHAIN_SETUP_VISUAL_STUDIO_ENV.
27792     PATH="$VS_PATH"
27793     # The microsoft toolchain also requires INCLUDE and LIB to be set.
27794     export INCLUDE="$VS_INCLUDE"
27795     export LIB="$VS_LIB"
27796   fi
27797 
27798   # autoconf magic only relies on PATH, so update it if tools dir is specified
27799   OLD_PATH="$PATH"
27800 
27801   # For solaris we really need solaris tools, and not the GNU equivalent.
27802   # The build tools on Solaris reside in /usr/ccs (C Compilation System),
27803   # so add that to path before starting to probe.
27804   # FIXME: This was originally only done for AS,NM,GNM,STRIP,MCS,OBJCOPY,OBJDUMP.
27805   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS" = xsolaris; then
27806     PATH="/usr/ccs/bin:$PATH"
27807   fi
27808 
27809   # Finally add TOOLCHAIN_PATH at the beginning, to allow --with-tools-dir to
27810   # override all other locations.
27811   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_PATH" != x; then
27812     PATH=$TOOLCHAIN_PATH:$PATH
27813   fi
27814 
27815 
27816   #
27817   # Setup the compilers (CC and CXX)
27818   #
27819 
27820   COMPILER_NAME=C
27821   SEARCH_LIST="$TOOLCHAIN_CC_BINARY"
27822 
27823   if test "x$CC" != x; then
27824     # User has supplied compiler name already, always let that override.
27825     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied compiler CC=$CC" >&5
27826 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied compiler CC=$CC" >&6;}
27827     if test "x`basename $CC`" = "x$CC"; then
27828       # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
27829 
27830       for ac_prog in $CC
27831 do
27832   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
27833 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
27834 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
27835 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
27836 if ${ac_cv_path_POTENTIAL_CC+:} false; then :
27837   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
27838 else
27839   case $POTENTIAL_CC in
27840   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
27841   ac_cv_path_POTENTIAL_CC="$POTENTIAL_CC" # Let the user override the test with a path.
27842   ;;
27843   *)
27844   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
27845 for as_dir in $PATH
27846 do
27847   IFS=$as_save_IFS
27848   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
27849     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
27850   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
27851     ac_cv_path_POTENTIAL_CC="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
27852     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
27853     break 2
27854   fi
27855 done
27856   done
27857 IFS=$as_save_IFS
27858 
27859   ;;
27860 esac
27861 fi
27862 POTENTIAL_CC=$ac_cv_path_POTENTIAL_CC
27863 if test -n "$POTENTIAL_CC"; then
27864   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $POTENTIAL_CC" >&5
27865 $as_echo "$POTENTIAL_CC" >&6; }
27866 else
27867   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
27868 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
27869 fi
27870 
27871 
27872   test -n "$POTENTIAL_CC" && break
27873 done
27874 
27875       if test "x$POTENTIAL_CC" != x; then
27876         CC=$POTENTIAL_CC
27877       else
27878         as_fn_error $? "User supplied compiler CC=$CC could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
27879       fi
27880     else
27881       # Otherwise it might already be a complete path
27882       if test ! -x "$CC"; then
27883         as_fn_error $? "User supplied compiler CC=$CC does not exist" "$LINENO" 5
27884       fi
27885     fi
27886   else
27887     # No user supplied value. Locate compiler ourselves.
27888 
27889     # If we are cross compiling, assume cross compilation tools follows the
27890     # cross compilation standard where they are prefixed with the autoconf
27891     # standard name for the target. For example the binary
27892     # i686-sun-solaris2.10-gcc will cross compile for i686-sun-solaris2.10.
27893     # If we are not cross compiling, then the default compiler name will be
27894     # used.
27895 
27896     CC=
27897     # If TOOLCHAIN_PATH is set, check for all compiler names in there first
27898     # before checking the rest of the PATH.
27899     # FIXME: Now that we prefix the TOOLS_DIR to the PATH in the PRE_DETECTION
27900     # step, this should not be necessary.
27901     if test -n "$TOOLCHAIN_PATH"; then
27902       PATH_save="$PATH"
27903       PATH="$TOOLCHAIN_PATH"
27904       for ac_prog in $SEARCH_LIST
27905 do
27906   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
27907 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
27908 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
27909 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
27910 if ${ac_cv_path_TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CC+:} false; then :
27911   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
27912 else
27913   case $TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CC in
27914   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
27915   ac_cv_path_TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CC="$TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CC" # Let the user override the test with a path.
27916   ;;
27917   *)
27918   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
27919 for as_dir in $PATH
27920 do
27921   IFS=$as_save_IFS
27922   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
27923     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
27924   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
27925     ac_cv_path_TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CC="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
27926     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
27927     break 2
27928   fi
27929 done
27930   done
27931 IFS=$as_save_IFS
27932 
27933   ;;
27934 esac
27935 fi
27936 TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CC=$ac_cv_path_TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CC
27937 if test -n "$TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CC"; then
27938   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CC" >&5
27939 $as_echo "$TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CC" >&6; }
27940 else
27941   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
27942 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
27943 fi
27944 
27945 
27946   test -n "$TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CC" && break
27947 done
27948 
27949       CC=$TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CC
27950       PATH="$PATH_save"
27951     fi
27952 
27953     # AC_PATH_PROGS can't be run multiple times with the same variable,
27954     # so create a new name for this run.
27955     if test "x$CC" = x; then
27956       for ac_prog in $SEARCH_LIST
27957 do
27958   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
27959 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
27960 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
27961 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
27962 if ${ac_cv_path_POTENTIAL_CC+:} false; then :
27963   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
27964 else
27965   case $POTENTIAL_CC in
27966   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
27967   ac_cv_path_POTENTIAL_CC="$POTENTIAL_CC" # Let the user override the test with a path.
27968   ;;
27969   *)
27970   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
27971 for as_dir in $PATH
27972 do
27973   IFS=$as_save_IFS
27974   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
27975     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
27976   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
27977     ac_cv_path_POTENTIAL_CC="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
27978     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
27979     break 2
27980   fi
27981 done
27982   done
27983 IFS=$as_save_IFS
27984 
27985   ;;
27986 esac
27987 fi
27988 POTENTIAL_CC=$ac_cv_path_POTENTIAL_CC
27989 if test -n "$POTENTIAL_CC"; then
27990   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $POTENTIAL_CC" >&5
27991 $as_echo "$POTENTIAL_CC" >&6; }
27992 else
27993   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
27994 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
27995 fi
27996 
27997 
27998   test -n "$POTENTIAL_CC" && break
27999 done
28000 
28001       CC=$POTENTIAL_CC
28002     fi
28003 
28004     if test "x$CC" = x; then
28005 
28006   # Print a helpful message on how to acquire the necessary build dependency.
28007   # devkit is the help tag: freetype, cups, pulse, alsa etc
28008   MISSING_DEPENDENCY=devkit
28009 
28010   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
28011     cygwin_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY
28012   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
28013     msys_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY
28014   else
28015     PKGHANDLER_COMMAND=
28016 
28017     case $PKGHANDLER in
28018       apt-get)
