28019         apt_help     $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
28020       yum)
28021         yum_help     $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
28022       port)
28023         port_help    $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
28024       pkgutil)
28025         pkgutil_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
28026       pkgadd)
28027         pkgadd_help  $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
28028     esac
28029 
28030     if test "x$PKGHANDLER_COMMAND" != x; then
28031       HELP_MSG="You might be able to fix this by running '$PKGHANDLER_COMMAND'."
28032     fi
28033   fi
28034 
28035       as_fn_error $? "Could not find a $COMPILER_NAME compiler. $HELP_MSG" "$LINENO" 5
28036     fi
28037   fi
28038 
28039   # Now we have a compiler binary in CC. Make sure it's okay.
28040 
28041   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
28042 
28043   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
28044   # space.
28045   complete="$CC"
28046   path="${complete%% *}"
28047   tmp="$complete EOL"
28048   arguments="${tmp#* }"
28049 
28050   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
28051   # unix format.
28052   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
28053 
28054   # Now try to locate executable using which
28055   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
28056   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
28057   # to not find them
28058   if test "x$new_path" = x \
28059       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
28060       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
28061     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
28062   fi
28063   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
28064     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
28065     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
28066     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
28067     # argument.
28068     path="$complete"
28069     arguments="EOL"
28070     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
28071     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
28072     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
28073     # to not find them
28074     if test "x$new_path" = x \
28075         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
28076         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
28077       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
28078     fi
28079     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
28080       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
28081       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of CC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
28082 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of CC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
28083       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
28084       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
28085         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
28086 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
28087       fi
28088       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of CC" "$LINENO" 5
28089     fi
28090   fi
28091 
28092   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
28093   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
28094   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
28095   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
28096   #
28097   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
28098   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
28099   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
28100   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
28101     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
28102     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
28103     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
28104       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
28105     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
28106       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
28107     else
28108       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of CC, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
28109 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of CC, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
28110       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
28111 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
28112       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of CC" "$LINENO" 5
28113     fi
28114   else
28115     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
28116   fi
28117 
28118   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
28119   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
28120   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
28121 
28122   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
28123   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
28124   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
28125   # take no chances and rewrite it.
28126   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
28127   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
28128   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
28129     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
28130     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
28131     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
28132     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
28133       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
28134       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
28135       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
28136       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
28137       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
28138       new_path="$input_path"
28139     fi
28140   fi
28141 
28142   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
28143   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
28144     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
28145     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
28146       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
28147       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
28148       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
28149     fi
28150   fi
28151 
28152   # remove trailing .exe if any
28153   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
28154 
28155   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
28156 
28157   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
28158   # space.
28159   complete="$CC"
28160   path="${complete%% *}"
28161   tmp="$complete EOL"
28162   arguments="${tmp#* }"
28163 
28164   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
28165   # unix format.
28166   new_path="$path"
28167 
28168   windows_path="$new_path"
28169   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
28170     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
28171     new_path="$unix_path"
28172   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
28173     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
28174     new_path="$unix_path"
28175   fi
28176 
28177 
28178   # Now try to locate executable using which
28179   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
28180 
28181   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
28182     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
28183     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
28184     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
28185     # argument.
28186     path="$complete"
28187     arguments="EOL"
28188     new_path="$path"
28189 
28190   windows_path="$new_path"
28191   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
28192     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
28193     new_path="$unix_path"
28194   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
28195     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
28196     new_path="$unix_path"
28197   fi
28198 
28199 
28200     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
28201     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
28202     # to not find them
28203     if test "x$new_path" = x \
28204         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
28205         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
28206       new_path="$path"
28207 
28208   windows_path="$new_path"
28209   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
28210     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
28211     new_path="$unix_path"
28212   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
28213     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
28214     new_path="$unix_path"
28215   fi
28216 
28217     fi
28218 
28219     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
28220       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
28221       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of CC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
28222 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of CC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
28223       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
28224       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
28225         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
28226 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
28227       fi
28228       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of CC" "$LINENO" 5
28229     fi
28230   fi
28231 
28232   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
28233   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
28234     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
28235     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
28236     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
28237   else
28238     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
28239     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
28240 
28241   input_path="$new_path"
28242   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
28243   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
28244   # take no chances and rewrite it.
28245   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
28246   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
28247   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
28248     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
28249     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
28250   fi
28251 
28252     # Output is in $new_path
28253 
28254   windows_path="$new_path"
28255   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
28256     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
28257     new_path="$unix_path"
28258   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
28259     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
28260     new_path="$unix_path"
28261   fi
28262 
28263     # remove trailing .exe if any
28264     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
28265 
28266     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
28267     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
28268   fi
28269 
28270   else
28271     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
28272     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
28273     # space.
28274     complete="$CC"
28275     path="${complete%% *}"
28276     tmp="$complete EOL"
28277     arguments="${tmp#* }"
28278 
28279     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
28280     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
28281     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
28282       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
28283       IFS_save="$IFS"
28284       IFS=:
28285       for p in $PATH; do
28286         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
28287           new_path="$p/$path"
28288           break
28289         fi
28290       done
28291       IFS="$IFS_save"
28292     else
28293       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
28294       new_path="$path"
28295     fi
28296 
28297     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
28298       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of CC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
28299 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of CC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
28300       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
28301       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
28302         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
28303 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
28304       fi
28305       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of CC" "$LINENO" 5
28306     fi
28307   fi
28308 
28309   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
28310   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
28311     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
28312   else
28313     new_complete="$new_path"
28314   fi
28315 
28316   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
28317     CC="$new_complete"
28318     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting CC to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
28319 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting CC to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
28320   fi
28321 
28322   TEST_COMPILER="$CC"
28323   # Don't remove symbolic links on AIX because 'xlc_r' and 'xlC_r' may all be links
28324   # to 'xlc' but it is crucial that we invoke the compiler with the right name!
28325   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS" != xaix; then
28326     # FIXME: This test should not be needed anymore; we don't do that for any platform.
28327     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking resolved symbolic links for CC" >&5
28328 $as_echo_n "checking resolved symbolic links for CC... " >&6; }
28329 
28330   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS" != xwindows; then
28331     # Follow a chain of symbolic links. Use readlink
28332     # where it exists, else fall back to horribly
28333     # complicated shell code.
28334     if test "x$READLINK_TESTED" != yes; then
28335       # On MacOSX there is a readlink tool with a different
28336       # purpose than the GNU readlink tool. Check the found readlink.
28337       ISGNU=`$READLINK --version 2>&1 | $GREP GNU`
28338       if test "x$ISGNU" = x; then
28339         # A readlink that we do not know how to use.
28340         # Are there other non-GNU readlinks out there?
28341         READLINK_TESTED=yes
28342         READLINK=
28343       fi
28344     fi
28345 
28346     if test "x$READLINK" != x; then
28347       TEST_COMPILER=`$READLINK -f $TEST_COMPILER`
28348     else
28349       # Save the current directory for restoring afterwards
28350       STARTDIR=$PWD
28351       COUNTER=0
28352       sym_link_dir=`$DIRNAME $TEST_COMPILER`
28353       sym_link_file=`$BASENAME $TEST_COMPILER`
28354       cd $sym_link_dir
28355       # Use -P flag to resolve symlinks in directories.
28356       cd `$THEPWDCMD -P`
28357       sym_link_dir=`$THEPWDCMD -P`
28358       # Resolve file symlinks
28359       while test $COUNTER -lt 20; do
28360         ISLINK=`$LS -l $sym_link_dir/$sym_link_file | $GREP '\->' | $SED -e 's/.*-> \(.*\)/\1/'`
28361         if test "x$ISLINK" == x; then
28362           # This is not a symbolic link! We are done!
28363           break
28364         fi
28365         # Again resolve directory symlinks since the target of the just found
28366         # link could be in a different directory
28367         cd `$DIRNAME $ISLINK`
28368         sym_link_dir=`$THEPWDCMD -P`
28369         sym_link_file=`$BASENAME $ISLINK`
28370         let COUNTER=COUNTER+1
28371       done
28372       cd $STARTDIR
28373       TEST_COMPILER=$sym_link_dir/$sym_link_file
28374     fi
28375   fi
28376 
28377     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $TEST_COMPILER" >&5
28378 $as_echo "$TEST_COMPILER" >&6; }
28379   fi
28380   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if CC is disguised ccache" >&5
28381 $as_echo_n "checking if CC is disguised ccache... " >&6; }
28382 
28383   COMPILER_BASENAME=`$BASENAME "$TEST_COMPILER"`
28384   if test "x$COMPILER_BASENAME" = "xccache"; then
28385     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes, trying to find proper $COMPILER_NAME compiler" >&5
28386 $as_echo "yes, trying to find proper $COMPILER_NAME compiler" >&6; }
28387     # We /usr/lib/ccache in the path, so cc is a symlink to /usr/bin/ccache.
28388     # We want to control ccache invocation ourselves, so ignore this cc and try
28389     # searching again.
28390 
28391     # Remove the path to the fake ccache cc from the PATH
28392     RETRY_COMPILER_SAVED_PATH="$PATH"
28393     COMPILER_DIRNAME=`$DIRNAME $CC`
28394     PATH="`$ECHO $PATH | $SED -e "s,$COMPILER_DIRNAME,,g" -e "s,::,:,g" -e "s,^:,,g"`"
28395 
28396     # Try again looking for our compiler
28397     if test -n "$ac_tool_prefix"; then
28398   for ac_prog in $TOOLCHAIN_CC_BINARY
28399   do
28400     # Extract the first word of "$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
28401 set dummy $ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog; ac_word=$2
28402 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
28403 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
28404 if ${ac_cv_prog_PROPER_COMPILER_CC+:} false; then :
28405   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
28406 else
28407   if test -n "$PROPER_COMPILER_CC"; then
28408   ac_cv_prog_PROPER_COMPILER_CC="$PROPER_COMPILER_CC" # Let the user override the test.
28409 else
28410 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
28411 for as_dir in $PATH
28412 do
28413   IFS=$as_save_IFS
28414   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
28415     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
28416   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
28417     ac_cv_prog_PROPER_COMPILER_CC="$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog"
28418     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
28419     break 2
28420   fi
28421 done
28422   done
28423 IFS=$as_save_IFS
28424 
28425 fi
28426 fi
28427 PROPER_COMPILER_CC=$ac_cv_prog_PROPER_COMPILER_CC
28428 if test -n "$PROPER_COMPILER_CC"; then
28429   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $PROPER_COMPILER_CC" >&5
28430 $as_echo "$PROPER_COMPILER_CC" >&6; }
28431 else
28432   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
28433 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
28434 fi
28435 
28436 
28437     test -n "$PROPER_COMPILER_CC" && break
28438   done
28439 fi
28440 if test -z "$PROPER_COMPILER_CC"; then
28441   ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CC=$PROPER_COMPILER_CC
28442   for ac_prog in $TOOLCHAIN_CC_BINARY
28443 do
28444   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
28445 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
28446 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
28447 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
28448 if ${ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CC+:} false; then :
28449   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
28450 else
28451   if test -n "$ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CC"; then
28452   ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CC="$ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CC" # Let the user override the test.
28453 else
28454 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
28455 for as_dir in $PATH
28456 do
28457   IFS=$as_save_IFS
28458   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
28459     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
28460   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
28461     ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CC="$ac_prog"
28462     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
28463     break 2
28464   fi
28465 done
28466   done
28467 IFS=$as_save_IFS
28468 
28469 fi
28470 fi
28471 ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CC=$ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CC
28472 if test -n "$ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CC"; then
28473   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CC" >&5
28474 $as_echo "$ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CC" >&6; }
28475 else
28476   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
28477 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
28478 fi
28479 
28480 
28481   test -n "$ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CC" && break
28482 done
28483 
28484   if test "x$ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CC" = x; then
28485     PROPER_COMPILER_CC=""
28486   else
28487     case $cross_compiling:$ac_tool_warned in
28488 yes:)
28489 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&5
28490 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&2;}
28491 ac_tool_warned=yes ;;
28492 esac
28493     PROPER_COMPILER_CC=$ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CC
28494   fi
28495 fi
28496 
28497 
28498   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
28499 
28500   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
28501   # space.
28502   complete="$PROPER_COMPILER_CC"
28503   path="${complete%% *}"
28504   tmp="$complete EOL"
28505   arguments="${tmp#* }"
28506 
28507   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
28508   # unix format.
28509   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
28510 
28511   # Now try to locate executable using which
28512   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
28513   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
28514   # to not find them
28515   if test "x$new_path" = x \
28516       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
28517       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
28518     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
28519   fi
28520   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
28521     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
28522     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
28523     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
28524     # argument.
28525     path="$complete"
28526     arguments="EOL"
28527     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
28528     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
28529     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
28530     # to not find them
28531     if test "x$new_path" = x \
28532         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
28533         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
28534       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
28535     fi
28536     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
28537       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
28538       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of PROPER_COMPILER_CC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
28539 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of PROPER_COMPILER_CC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
28540       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
28541       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
28542         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
28543 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
28544       fi
28545       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of PROPER_COMPILER_CC" "$LINENO" 5
28546     fi
28547   fi
28548 
28549   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
28550   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
28551   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
28552   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
28553   #
28554   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
28555   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
28556   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
28557   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
28558     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
28559     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
28560     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
28561       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
28562     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
28563       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
28564     else
28565       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of PROPER_COMPILER_CC, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
28566 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of PROPER_COMPILER_CC, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
28567       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
28568 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
28569       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of PROPER_COMPILER_CC" "$LINENO" 5
28570     fi
28571   else
28572     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
28573   fi
28574 
28575   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
28576   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
28577   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
28578 
28579   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
28580   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
28581   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
28582   # take no chances and rewrite it.
28583   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
28584   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
28585   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
28586     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
28587     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
28588     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
28589     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
28590       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
28591       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
28592       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
28593       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
28594       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
28595       new_path="$input_path"
28596     fi
28597   fi
28598 
28599   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
28600   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
28601     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
28602     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
28603       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
28604       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
28605       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
28606     fi
28607   fi
28608 
28609   # remove trailing .exe if any
28610   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
28611 
28612   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
28613 
28614   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
28615   # space.
28616   complete="$PROPER_COMPILER_CC"
28617   path="${complete%% *}"
28618   tmp="$complete EOL"
28619   arguments="${tmp#* }"
28620 
28621   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
28622   # unix format.
28623   new_path="$path"
28624 
28625   windows_path="$new_path"
28626   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
28627     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
28628     new_path="$unix_path"
28629   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
28630     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
28631     new_path="$unix_path"
28632   fi
28633 
28634 
28635   # Now try to locate executable using which
28636   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
28637 
28638   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
28639     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
28640     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
28641     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
28642     # argument.
28643     path="$complete"
28644     arguments="EOL"
28645     new_path="$path"
28646 
28647   windows_path="$new_path"
28648   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
28649     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
28650     new_path="$unix_path"
28651   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
28652     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
28653     new_path="$unix_path"
28654   fi
28655 
28656 
28657     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
28658     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
28659     # to not find them
28660     if test "x$new_path" = x \
28661         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
28662         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
28663       new_path="$path"
28664 
28665   windows_path="$new_path"
28666   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
28667     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
28668     new_path="$unix_path"
28669   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
28670     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
28671     new_path="$unix_path"
28672   fi
28673 
28674     fi
28675 
28676     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
28677       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
28678       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of PROPER_COMPILER_CC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
28679 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of PROPER_COMPILER_CC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
28680       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
28681       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
28682         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
28683 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
28684       fi
28685       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of PROPER_COMPILER_CC" "$LINENO" 5
28686     fi
28687   fi
28688 
28689   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
28690   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
28691     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
28692     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
28693     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
28694   else
28695     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
28696     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
28697 
28698   input_path="$new_path"
28699   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
28700   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
28701   # take no chances and rewrite it.
28702   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
28703   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
28704   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
28705     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
28706     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
28707   fi
28708 
28709     # Output is in $new_path
28710 
28711   windows_path="$new_path"
28712   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
28713     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
28714     new_path="$unix_path"
28715   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
28716     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
28717     new_path="$unix_path"
28718   fi
28719 
28720     # remove trailing .exe if any
28721     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
28722 
28723     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
28724     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
28725   fi
28726 
28727   else
28728     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
28729     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
28730     # space.
28731     complete="$PROPER_COMPILER_CC"
28732     path="${complete%% *}"
28733     tmp="$complete EOL"
28734     arguments="${tmp#* }"
28735 
28736     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
28737     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
28738     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
28739       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
28740       IFS_save="$IFS"
28741       IFS=:
28742       for p in $PATH; do
28743         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
28744           new_path="$p/$path"
28745           break
28746         fi
28747       done
28748       IFS="$IFS_save"
28749     else
28750       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
28751       new_path="$path"
28752     fi
28753 
28754     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
28755       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of PROPER_COMPILER_CC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
28756 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of PROPER_COMPILER_CC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
28757       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
28758       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
28759         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
28760 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
28761       fi
28762       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of PROPER_COMPILER_CC" "$LINENO" 5
28763     fi
28764   fi
28765 
28766   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
28767   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
28768     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
28769   else
28770     new_complete="$new_path"
28771   fi
28772 
28773   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
28774     PROPER_COMPILER_CC="$new_complete"
28775     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting PROPER_COMPILER_CC to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
28776 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting PROPER_COMPILER_CC to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
28777   fi
28778 
28779     PATH="$RETRY_COMPILER_SAVED_PATH"
28780 
28781     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for resolved symbolic links for CC" >&5
28782 $as_echo_n "checking for resolved symbolic links for CC... " >&6; }
28783 
28784   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS" != xwindows; then
28785     # Follow a chain of symbolic links. Use readlink
28786     # where it exists, else fall back to horribly
28787     # complicated shell code.
28788     if test "x$READLINK_TESTED" != yes; then
28789       # On MacOSX there is a readlink tool with a different
28790       # purpose than the GNU readlink tool. Check the found readlink.
28791       ISGNU=`$READLINK --version 2>&1 | $GREP GNU`
28792       if test "x$ISGNU" = x; then
28793         # A readlink that we do not know how to use.
28794         # Are there other non-GNU readlinks out there?
28795         READLINK_TESTED=yes
28796         READLINK=
28797       fi
28798     fi
28799 
28800     if test "x$READLINK" != x; then
28801       PROPER_COMPILER_CC=`$READLINK -f $PROPER_COMPILER_CC`
28802     else
28803       # Save the current directory for restoring afterwards
28804       STARTDIR=$PWD
28805       COUNTER=0
28806       sym_link_dir=`$DIRNAME $PROPER_COMPILER_CC`
28807       sym_link_file=`$BASENAME $PROPER_COMPILER_CC`
28808       cd $sym_link_dir
28809       # Use -P flag to resolve symlinks in directories.
28810       cd `$THEPWDCMD -P`
28811       sym_link_dir=`$THEPWDCMD -P`
28812       # Resolve file symlinks
28813       while test $COUNTER -lt 20; do
28814         ISLINK=`$LS -l $sym_link_dir/$sym_link_file | $GREP '\->' | $SED -e 's/.*-> \(.*\)/\1/'`
28815         if test "x$ISLINK" == x; then
28816           # This is not a symbolic link! We are done!
28817           break
28818         fi
28819         # Again resolve directory symlinks since the target of the just found
28820         # link could be in a different directory
28821         cd `$DIRNAME $ISLINK`
28822         sym_link_dir=`$THEPWDCMD -P`
28823         sym_link_file=`$BASENAME $ISLINK`
28824         let COUNTER=COUNTER+1
28825       done
28826       cd $STARTDIR
28827       PROPER_COMPILER_CC=$sym_link_dir/$sym_link_file
28828     fi
28829   fi
28830 
28831     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $PROPER_COMPILER_CC" >&5
28832 $as_echo "$PROPER_COMPILER_CC" >&6; }
28833     CC="$PROPER_COMPILER_CC"
28834   else
28835     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no, keeping CC" >&5
28836 $as_echo "no, keeping CC" >&6; }
28837   fi
28838 
28839 
28840   COMPILER=$CC
28841   COMPILER_NAME=$COMPILER_NAME
28842 
28843   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xsolstudio; then
28844     # cc -V output typically looks like
28845     #     cc: Sun C 5.12 Linux_i386 2011/11/16
28846     COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT=`$COMPILER -V 2>&1`
28847     # Check that this is likely to be the Solaris Studio cc.
28848     $ECHO "$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT" | $GREP "^.*: Sun $COMPILER_NAME" > /dev/null
28849     if test $? -ne 0; then
28850       ALT_VERSION_OUTPUT=`$COMPILER --version 2>&1`
28851       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The $COMPILER_NAME compiler (located as $COMPILER) does not seem to be the required $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler." >&5
28852 $as_echo "$as_me: The $COMPILER_NAME compiler (located as $COMPILER) does not seem to be the required $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler." >&6;}
28853       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The result from running with -V was: \"$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&5
28854 $as_echo "$as_me: The result from running with -V was: \"$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&6;}
28855       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The result from running with --version was: \"$ALT_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&5
28856 $as_echo "$as_me: The result from running with --version was: \"$ALT_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&6;}
28857       as_fn_error $? "A $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler is required. Try setting --with-tools-dir." "$LINENO" 5
28858     fi
28859     # Remove usage instructions (if present), and
28860     # collapse compiler output into a single line
28861     COMPILER_VERSION_STRING=`$ECHO $COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT | \
28862         $SED -e 's/ *[Uu]sage:.*//'`
28863     COMPILER_VERSION_NUMBER=`$ECHO $COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT | \
28864         $SED -e "s/^.*[ ,\t]$COMPILER_NAME[ ,\t]\([1-9]\.[0-9][0-9]*\).*/\1/"`
28865   elif test  "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xxlc; then
28866     # xlc -qversion output typically looks like
28867     #     IBM XL C/C++ for AIX, V11.1 (5724-X13)
28868     #     Version: 11.01.0000.0015
28869     COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT=`$COMPILER -qversion 2>&1`
28870     # Check that this is likely to be the IBM XL C compiler.
28871     $ECHO "$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT" | $GREP "IBM XL C" > /dev/null
28872     if test $? -ne 0; then
28873       ALT_VERSION_OUTPUT=`$COMPILER --version 2>&1`
28874       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The $COMPILER_NAME compiler (located as $COMPILER) does not seem to be the required $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler." >&5
28875 $as_echo "$as_me: The $COMPILER_NAME compiler (located as $COMPILER) does not seem to be the required $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler." >&6;}
28876       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The result from running with -qversion was: \"$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&5
28877 $as_echo "$as_me: The result from running with -qversion was: \"$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&6;}
28878       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The result from running with --version was: \"$ALT_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&5
28879 $as_echo "$as_me: The result from running with --version was: \"$ALT_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&6;}
28880       as_fn_error $? "A $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler is required. Try setting --with-tools-dir." "$LINENO" 5
28881     fi
28882     # Collapse compiler output into a single line
28883     COMPILER_VERSION_STRING=`$ECHO $COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT`
28884     COMPILER_VERSION_NUMBER=`$ECHO $COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT | \
28885         $SED -e 's/^.*, V\([1-9][0-9.]*\).*$/\1/'`
28886   elif test  "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xmicrosoft; then
28887     # There is no specific version flag, but all output starts with a version string.
28888     # First line typically looks something like:
28889     # Microsoft (R) 32-bit C/C++ Optimizing Compiler Version 16.00.40219.01 for 80x86
28890     COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT=`$COMPILER 2>&1 | $HEAD -n 1 | $TR -d '\r'`
28891     # Check that this is likely to be Microsoft CL.EXE.
28892     $ECHO "$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT" | $GREP "Microsoft.*Compiler" > /dev/null
28893     if test $? -ne 0; then
28894       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The $COMPILER_NAME compiler (located as $COMPILER) does not seem to be the required $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler." >&5
28895 $as_echo "$as_me: The $COMPILER_NAME compiler (located as $COMPILER) does not seem to be the required $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler." >&6;}
28896       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The result from running it was: \"$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&5
28897 $as_echo "$as_me: The result from running it was: \"$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&6;}
28898       as_fn_error $? "A $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler is required. Try setting --with-tools-dir." "$LINENO" 5
28899     fi
28900     # Collapse compiler output into a single line
28901     COMPILER_VERSION_STRING=`$ECHO $COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT`
28902     COMPILER_VERSION_NUMBER=`$ECHO $COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT | \
28903         $SED -e 's/^.*ersion.\([1-9][0-9.]*\) .*$/\1/'`
28904   elif test  "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xgcc; then
28905     # gcc --version output typically looks like
28906     #     gcc (Ubuntu/Linaro 4.8.1-10ubuntu9) 4.8.1
28907     #     Copyright (C) 2013 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
28908     #     This is free software; see the source for copying conditions.  There is NO
28909     #     warranty; not even for MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.
28910     COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT=`$COMPILER --version 2>&1`
28911     # Check that this is likely to be GCC.
28912     $ECHO "$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT" | $GREP "Free Software Foundation" > /dev/null
28913     if test $? -ne 0; then
28914       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The $COMPILER_NAME compiler (located as $COMPILER) does not seem to be the required $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler." >&5
28915 $as_echo "$as_me: The $COMPILER_NAME compiler (located as $COMPILER) does not seem to be the required $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler." >&6;}
28916       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The result from running with --version was: \"$COMPILER_VERSION\"" >&5
28917 $as_echo "$as_me: The result from running with --version was: \"$COMPILER_VERSION\"" >&6;}
28918       as_fn_error $? "A $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler is required. Try setting --with-tools-dir." "$LINENO" 5
28919     fi
28920     # Remove Copyright and legalese from version string, and
28921     # collapse into a single line
28922     COMPILER_VERSION_STRING=`$ECHO $COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT | \
28923         $SED -e 's/ *Copyright .*//'`
28924     COMPILER_VERSION_NUMBER=`$ECHO $COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT | \
28925         $SED -e 's/^.* \([1-9]\.[0-9.]*\) .*$/\1/'`
28926   elif test  "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xclang; then
28927     # clang --version output typically looks like
28928     #    Apple LLVM version 5.0 (clang-500.2.79) (based on LLVM 3.3svn)
28929     #    clang version 3.3 (tags/RELEASE_33/final)
28930     # or
28931     #    Debian clang version 3.2-7ubuntu1 (tags/RELEASE_32/final) (based on LLVM 3.2)
28932     #    Target: x86_64-pc-linux-gnu
28933     #    Thread model: posix
28934     COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT=`$COMPILER --version 2>&1`
28935     # Check that this is likely to be clang
28936     $ECHO "$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT" | $GREP "clang" > /dev/null
28937     if test $? -ne 0; then
28938       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The $COMPILER_NAME compiler (located as $COMPILER) does not seem to be the required $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler." >&5
28939 $as_echo "$as_me: The $COMPILER_NAME compiler (located as $COMPILER) does not seem to be the required $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler." >&6;}
28940       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The result from running with --version was: \"$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&5
28941 $as_echo "$as_me: The result from running with --version was: \"$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&6;}
28942       as_fn_error $? "A $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler is required. Try setting --with-tools-dir." "$LINENO" 5
28943     fi
28944     # Collapse compiler output into a single line
28945     COMPILER_VERSION_STRING=`$ECHO $COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT`
28946     COMPILER_VERSION_NUMBER=`$ECHO $COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT | \
28947         $SED -e 's/^.*clang version \([1-9][0-9.]*\).*$/\1/'`
28948   else
28949       as_fn_error $? "Unknown toolchain type $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE." "$LINENO" 5
28950   fi
28951   # This sets CC_VERSION_NUMBER or CXX_VERSION_NUMBER. (This comment is a grep marker)
28952   CC_VERSION_NUMBER="$COMPILER_VERSION_NUMBER"
28953   # This sets CC_VERSION_STRING or CXX_VERSION_STRING. (This comment is a grep marker)
28954   CC_VERSION_STRING="$COMPILER_VERSION_STRING"
28955 
28956   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Using $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE $COMPILER_NAME compiler version $COMPILER_VERSION_NUMBER [$COMPILER_VERSION_STRING]" >&5
28957 $as_echo "$as_me: Using $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE $COMPILER_NAME compiler version $COMPILER_VERSION_NUMBER [$COMPILER_VERSION_STRING]" >&6;}
28958 
28959 
28960   # Now that we have resolved CC ourself, let autoconf have its go at it
28961   ac_ext=c
28962 ac_cpp='$CPP $CPPFLAGS'
28963 ac_compile='$CC -c $CFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
28964 ac_link='$CC -o conftest$ac_exeext $CFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
28965 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_c_compiler_gnu
28966 if test -n "$ac_tool_prefix"; then
28967   for ac_prog in $CC
28968   do
28969     # Extract the first word of "$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
28970 set dummy $ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog; ac_word=$2
28971 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
28972 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
28973 if ${ac_cv_prog_CC+:} false; then :
28974   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
28975 else
28976   if test -n "$CC"; then
28977   ac_cv_prog_CC="$CC" # Let the user override the test.
28978 else
28979 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
28980 for as_dir in $PATH
28981 do
28982   IFS=$as_save_IFS
28983   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
28984     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
28985   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
28986     ac_cv_prog_CC="$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog"
28987     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
28988     break 2
28989   fi
28990 done
28991   done
28992 IFS=$as_save_IFS
28993 
28994 fi
28995 fi
28996 CC=$ac_cv_prog_CC
28997 if test -n "$CC"; then
28998   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $CC" >&5
28999 $as_echo "$CC" >&6; }
29000 else
29001   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
29002 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
29003 fi
29004 
29005 
29006     test -n "$CC" && break
29007   done
29008 fi
29009 if test -z "$CC"; then
29010   ac_ct_CC=$CC
29011   for ac_prog in $CC
29012 do
29013   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
29014 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
29015 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
29016 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
29017 if ${ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_CC+:} false; then :
29018   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
29019 else
29020   if test -n "$ac_ct_CC"; then
29021   ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_CC="$ac_ct_CC" # Let the user override the test.
29022 else
29023 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
29024 for as_dir in $PATH
29025 do
29026   IFS=$as_save_IFS
29027   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
29028     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
29029   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
29030     ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_CC="$ac_prog"
29031     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
29032     break 2
29033   fi
29034 done
29035   done
29036 IFS=$as_save_IFS
29037 
29038 fi
29039 fi
29040 ac_ct_CC=$ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_CC
29041 if test -n "$ac_ct_CC"; then
29042   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_ct_CC" >&5
29043 $as_echo "$ac_ct_CC" >&6; }
29044 else
29045   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
29046 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
29047 fi
29048 
29049 
29050   test -n "$ac_ct_CC" && break
29051 done
29052 
29053   if test "x$ac_ct_CC" = x; then
29054     CC=""
29055   else
29056     case $cross_compiling:$ac_tool_warned in
29057 yes:)
29058 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&5
29059 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&2;}
29060 ac_tool_warned=yes ;;
29061 esac
29062     CC=$ac_ct_CC
29063   fi
29064 fi
29065 
29066 
29067 test -z "$CC" && { { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: error: in \`$ac_pwd':" >&5
29068 $as_echo "$as_me: error: in \`$ac_pwd':" >&2;}
29069 as_fn_error $? "no acceptable C compiler found in \$PATH
29070 See \`config.log' for more details" "$LINENO" 5; }
29071 
29072 # Provide some information about the compiler.
29073 $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for C compiler version" >&5
29074 set X $ac_compile
29075 ac_compiler=$2
29076 for ac_option in --version -v -V -qversion; do
29077   { { ac_try="$ac_compiler $ac_option >&5"
29078 case "(($ac_try" in
29079   *\"* | *\`* | *\\*) ac_try_echo=\$ac_try;;
29080   *) ac_try_echo=$ac_try;;
29081 esac
29082 eval ac_try_echo="\"\$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: $ac_try_echo\""
29083 $as_echo "$ac_try_echo"; } >&5
29084   (eval "$ac_compiler $ac_option >&5") 2>conftest.err
29085   ac_status=$?
29086   if test -s conftest.err; then
29087     sed '10a\
29088 ... rest of stderr output deleted ...
29089          10q' conftest.err >conftest.er1
29090     cat conftest.er1 >&5
29091   fi
29092   rm -f conftest.er1 conftest.err
29093   $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$? = $ac_status" >&5
29094   test $ac_status = 0; }
29095 done
29096 
29097 cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
29098 /* end confdefs.h.  */
29099 
29100 int
29101 main ()
29102 {
29103 
29104   ;
29105   return 0;
29106 }
29107 _ACEOF
29108 ac_clean_files_save=$ac_clean_files
29109 ac_clean_files="$ac_clean_files a.out a.out.dSYM a.exe b.out"
29110 # Try to create an executable without -o first, disregard a.out.
29111 # It will help us diagnose broken compilers, and finding out an intuition
29112 # of exeext.
29113 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking whether the C compiler works" >&5
29114 $as_echo_n "checking whether the C compiler works... " >&6; }
29115 ac_link_default=`$as_echo "$ac_link" | sed 's/ -o *conftest[^ ]*//'`
29116 
29117 # The possible output files:
29118 ac_files="a.out conftest.exe conftest a.exe a_out.exe b.out conftest.*"
29119 
29120 ac_rmfiles=
29121 for ac_file in $ac_files
29122 do
29123   case $ac_file in
29124     *.$ac_ext | *.xcoff | *.tds | *.d | *.pdb | *.xSYM | *.bb | *.bbg | *.map | *.inf | *.dSYM | *.o | *.obj ) ;;
29125     * ) ac_rmfiles="$ac_rmfiles $ac_file";;
29126   esac
29127 done
29128 rm -f $ac_rmfiles
29129 
29130 if { { ac_try="$ac_link_default"
29131 case "(($ac_try" in
29132   *\"* | *\`* | *\\*) ac_try_echo=\$ac_try;;
29133   *) ac_try_echo=$ac_try;;
29134 esac
29135 eval ac_try_echo="\"\$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: $ac_try_echo\""
29136 $as_echo "$ac_try_echo"; } >&5
29137   (eval "$ac_link_default") 2>&5
29138   ac_status=$?
29139   $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$? = $ac_status" >&5
29140   test $ac_status = 0; }; then :
29141   # Autoconf-2.13 could set the ac_cv_exeext variable to `no'.
29142 # So ignore a value of `no', otherwise this would lead to `EXEEXT = no'
29143 # in a Makefile.  We should not override ac_cv_exeext if it was cached,
29144 # so that the user can short-circuit this test for compilers unknown to
29145 # Autoconf.
29146 for ac_file in $ac_files ''
29147 do
29148   test -f "$ac_file" || continue
29149   case $ac_file in
29150     *.$ac_ext | *.xcoff | *.tds | *.d | *.pdb | *.xSYM | *.bb | *.bbg | *.map | *.inf | *.dSYM | *.o | *.obj )
29151         ;;
29152     [ab].out )
29153         # We found the default executable, but exeext='' is most
29154         # certainly right.
29155         break;;
29156     *.* )
29157         if test "${ac_cv_exeext+set}" = set && test "$ac_cv_exeext" != no;
29158         then :; else
29159            ac_cv_exeext=`expr "$ac_file" : '[^.]*\(\..*\)'`
29160         fi
29161         # We set ac_cv_exeext here because the later test for it is not
29162         # safe: cross compilers may not add the suffix if given an `-o'
29163         # argument, so we may need to know it at that point already.
29164         # Even if this section looks crufty: it has the advantage of
29165         # actually working.
29166         break;;
29167     * )
29168         break;;
29169   esac
29170 done
29171 test "$ac_cv_exeext" = no && ac_cv_exeext=
29172 
29173 else
29174   ac_file=''
29175 fi
29176 if test -z "$ac_file"; then :
29177   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
29178 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
29179 $as_echo "$as_me: failed program was:" >&5
29180 sed 's/^/| /' conftest.$ac_ext >&5
29181 
29182 { { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: error: in \`$ac_pwd':" >&5
29183 $as_echo "$as_me: error: in \`$ac_pwd':" >&2;}
29184 as_fn_error 77 "C compiler cannot create executables
29185 See \`config.log' for more details" "$LINENO" 5; }
29186 else
29187   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes" >&5
29188 $as_echo "yes" >&6; }
29189 fi
29190 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for C compiler default output file name" >&5
29191 $as_echo_n "checking for C compiler default output file name... " >&6; }
29192 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_file" >&5
29193 $as_echo "$ac_file" >&6; }
29194 ac_exeext=$ac_cv_exeext
29195 
29196 rm -f -r a.out a.out.dSYM a.exe conftest$ac_cv_exeext b.out
29197 ac_clean_files=$ac_clean_files_save
29198 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for suffix of executables" >&5
29199 $as_echo_n "checking for suffix of executables... " >&6; }
29200 if { { ac_try="$ac_link"
29201 case "(($ac_try" in
29202   *\"* | *\`* | *\\*) ac_try_echo=\$ac_try;;
29203   *) ac_try_echo=$ac_try;;
29204 esac
29205 eval ac_try_echo="\"\$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: $ac_try_echo\""
29206 $as_echo "$ac_try_echo"; } >&5
29207   (eval "$ac_link") 2>&5
29208   ac_status=$?
29209   $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$? = $ac_status" >&5
29210   test $ac_status = 0; }; then :
29211   # If both `conftest.exe' and `conftest' are `present' (well, observable)
29212 # catch `conftest.exe'.  For instance with Cygwin, `ls conftest' will
29213 # work properly (i.e., refer to `conftest.exe'), while it won't with
29214 # `rm'.
29215 for ac_file in conftest.exe conftest conftest.*; do
29216   test -f "$ac_file" || continue
29217   case $ac_file in
29218     *.$ac_ext | *.xcoff | *.tds | *.d | *.pdb | *.xSYM | *.bb | *.bbg | *.map | *.inf | *.dSYM | *.o | *.obj ) ;;
29219     *.* ) ac_cv_exeext=`expr "$ac_file" : '[^.]*\(\..*\)'`
29220           break;;
29221     * ) break;;
29222   esac
29223 done
29224 else
29225   { { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: error: in \`$ac_pwd':" >&5
29226 $as_echo "$as_me: error: in \`$ac_pwd':" >&2;}
29227 as_fn_error $? "cannot compute suffix of executables: cannot compile and link
29228 See \`config.log' for more details" "$LINENO" 5; }
29229 fi
29230 rm -f conftest conftest$ac_cv_exeext
29231 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_exeext" >&5
29232 $as_echo "$ac_cv_exeext" >&6; }
29233 
29234 rm -f conftest.$ac_ext
29235 EXEEXT=$ac_cv_exeext
29236 ac_exeext=$EXEEXT
29237 cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
29238 /* end confdefs.h.  */
29239 #include <stdio.h>
29240 int
29241 main ()
29242 {
29243 FILE *f = fopen ("conftest.out", "w");
29244  return ferror (f) || fclose (f) != 0;
29245 
29246   ;
29247   return 0;
29248 }
29249 _ACEOF
29250 ac_clean_files="$ac_clean_files conftest.out"
29251 # Check that the compiler produces executables we can run.  If not, either
29252 # the compiler is broken, or we cross compile.
29253 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking whether we are cross compiling" >&5
29254 $as_echo_n "checking whether we are cross compiling... " >&6; }
29255 if test "$cross_compiling" != yes; then
29256   { { ac_try="$ac_link"
29257 case "(($ac_try" in
29258   *\"* | *\`* | *\\*) ac_try_echo=\$ac_try;;
29259   *) ac_try_echo=$ac_try;;
29260 esac
29261 eval ac_try_echo="\"\$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: $ac_try_echo\""
29262 $as_echo "$ac_try_echo"; } >&5
29263   (eval "$ac_link") 2>&5
29264   ac_status=$?
29265   $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$? = $ac_status" >&5
29266   test $ac_status = 0; }
29267   if { ac_try='./conftest$ac_cv_exeext'
29268   { { case "(($ac_try" in
29269   *\"* | *\`* | *\\*) ac_try_echo=\$ac_try;;
29270   *) ac_try_echo=$ac_try;;
29271 esac
29272 eval ac_try_echo="\"\$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: $ac_try_echo\""
29273 $as_echo "$ac_try_echo"; } >&5
29274   (eval "$ac_try") 2>&5
29275   ac_status=$?
29276   $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$? = $ac_status" >&5
29277   test $ac_status = 0; }; }; then
29278     cross_compiling=no
29279   else
29280     if test "$cross_compiling" = maybe; then
29281         cross_compiling=yes
29282     else
29283         { { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: error: in \`$ac_pwd':" >&5
29284 $as_echo "$as_me: error: in \`$ac_pwd':" >&2;}
29285 as_fn_error $? "cannot run C compiled programs.
29286 If you meant to cross compile, use \`--host'.
29287 See \`config.log' for more details" "$LINENO" 5; }
29288     fi
29289   fi
29290 fi
29291 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $cross_compiling" >&5
29292 $as_echo "$cross_compiling" >&6; }
29293 
29294 rm -f conftest.$ac_ext conftest$ac_cv_exeext conftest.out
29295 ac_clean_files=$ac_clean_files_save
29296 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for suffix of object files" >&5
29297 $as_echo_n "checking for suffix of object files... " >&6; }
29298 if ${ac_cv_objext+:} false; then :
29299   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
29300 else
29301   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
29302 /* end confdefs.h.  */
29303 
29304 int
29305 main ()
29306 {
29307 
29308   ;
29309   return 0;
29310 }
29311 _ACEOF
29312 rm -f conftest.o conftest.obj
29313 if { { ac_try="$ac_compile"
29314 case "(($ac_try" in
29315   *\"* | *\`* | *\\*) ac_try_echo=\$ac_try;;
29316   *) ac_try_echo=$ac_try;;
29317 esac
29318 eval ac_try_echo="\"\$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: $ac_try_echo\""
29319 $as_echo "$ac_try_echo"; } >&5
29320   (eval "$ac_compile") 2>&5
29321   ac_status=$?
29322   $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$? = $ac_status" >&5
29323   test $ac_status = 0; }; then :
29324   for ac_file in conftest.o conftest.obj conftest.*; do
29325   test -f "$ac_file" || continue;
29326   case $ac_file in
29327     *.$ac_ext | *.xcoff | *.tds | *.d | *.pdb | *.xSYM | *.bb | *.bbg | *.map | *.inf | *.dSYM ) ;;
29328     *) ac_cv_objext=`expr "$ac_file" : '.*\.\(.*\)'`
29329        break;;
29330   esac
29331 done
29332 else
29333   $as_echo "$as_me: failed program was:" >&5
29334 sed 's/^/| /' conftest.$ac_ext >&5
29335 
29336 { { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: error: in \`$ac_pwd':" >&5
29337 $as_echo "$as_me: error: in \`$ac_pwd':" >&2;}
29338 as_fn_error $? "cannot compute suffix of object files: cannot compile
29339 See \`config.log' for more details" "$LINENO" 5; }
29340 fi
29341 rm -f conftest.$ac_cv_objext conftest.$ac_ext
29342 fi
29343 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_objext" >&5
29344 $as_echo "$ac_cv_objext" >&6; }
29345 OBJEXT=$ac_cv_objext
29346 ac_objext=$OBJEXT
29347 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking whether we are using the GNU C compiler" >&5
29348 $as_echo_n "checking whether we are using the GNU C compiler... " >&6; }
29349 if ${ac_cv_c_compiler_gnu+:} false; then :
29350   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
29351 else
29352   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
29353 /* end confdefs.h.  */
29354 
29355 int
29356 main ()
29357 {
29358 #ifndef __GNUC__
29359        choke me
29360 #endif
29361 
29362   ;
29363   return 0;
29364 }
29365 _ACEOF
29366 if ac_fn_c_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
29367   ac_compiler_gnu=yes
29368 else
29369   ac_compiler_gnu=no
29370 fi
29371 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
29372 ac_cv_c_compiler_gnu=$ac_compiler_gnu
29373 
29374 fi
29375 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_c_compiler_gnu" >&5
29376 $as_echo "$ac_cv_c_compiler_gnu" >&6; }
29377 if test $ac_compiler_gnu = yes; then
29378   GCC=yes
29379 else
29380   GCC=
29381 fi
29382 ac_test_CFLAGS=${CFLAGS+set}
29383 ac_save_CFLAGS=$CFLAGS
29384 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking whether $CC accepts -g" >&5
29385 $as_echo_n "checking whether $CC accepts -g... " >&6; }
29386 if ${ac_cv_prog_cc_g+:} false; then :
29387   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
29388 else
29389   ac_save_c_werror_flag=$ac_c_werror_flag
29390    ac_c_werror_flag=yes
29391    ac_cv_prog_cc_g=no
29392    CFLAGS="-g"
29393    cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
29394 /* end confdefs.h.  */
29395 
29396 int
29397 main ()
29398 {
29399 
29400   ;
29401   return 0;
29402 }
29403 _ACEOF
29404 if ac_fn_c_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
29405   ac_cv_prog_cc_g=yes
29406 else
29407   CFLAGS=""
29408       cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
29409 /* end confdefs.h.  */
29410 
29411 int
29412 main ()
29413 {
29414 
29415   ;
29416   return 0;
29417 }
29418 _ACEOF
29419 if ac_fn_c_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
29420 
29421 else
29422   ac_c_werror_flag=$ac_save_c_werror_flag
29423          CFLAGS="-g"
29424          cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
29425 /* end confdefs.h.  */
29426 
29427 int
29428 main ()
29429 {
29430 
29431   ;
29432   return 0;
29433 }
29434 _ACEOF
29435 if ac_fn_c_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
29436   ac_cv_prog_cc_g=yes
29437 fi
29438 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
29439 fi
29440 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
29441 fi
29442 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
29443    ac_c_werror_flag=$ac_save_c_werror_flag
29444 fi
29445 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_prog_cc_g" >&5
29446 $as_echo "$ac_cv_prog_cc_g" >&6; }
29447 if test "$ac_test_CFLAGS" = set; then
29448   CFLAGS=$ac_save_CFLAGS
29449 elif test $ac_cv_prog_cc_g = yes; then
29450   if test "$GCC" = yes; then
29451     CFLAGS="-g -O2"
29452   else
29453     CFLAGS="-g"
29454   fi
29455 else
29456   if test "$GCC" = yes; then
29457     CFLAGS="-O2"
29458   else
29459     CFLAGS=
29460   fi
29461 fi
29462 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $CC option to accept ISO C89" >&5
29463 $as_echo_n "checking for $CC option to accept ISO C89... " >&6; }
29464 if ${ac_cv_prog_cc_c89+:} false; then :
29465   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
29466 else
29467   ac_cv_prog_cc_c89=no
29468 ac_save_CC=$CC
29469 cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
29470 /* end confdefs.h.  */
29471 #include <stdarg.h>
29472 #include <stdio.h>
29473 struct stat;
29474 /* Most of the following tests are stolen from RCS 5.7's src/conf.sh.  */
29475 struct buf { int x; };
29476 FILE * (*rcsopen) (struct buf *, struct stat *, int);
29477 static char *e (p, i)
29478      char **p;
29479      int i;
29480 {
29481   return p[i];
29482 }
29483 static char *f (char * (*g) (char **, int), char **p, ...)
29484 {
29485   char *s;
29486   va_list v;
29487   va_start (v,p);
29488   s = g (p, va_arg (v,int));
29489   va_end (v);
29490   return s;
29491 }
29492 
29493 /* OSF 4.0 Compaq cc is some sort of almost-ANSI by default.  It has
29494    function prototypes and stuff, but not '\xHH' hex character constants.
29495    These don't provoke an error unfortunately, instead are silently treated
29496    as 'x'.  The following induces an error, until -std is added to get
29497    proper ANSI mode.  Curiously '\x00'!='x' always comes out true, for an
29498    array size at least.  It's necessary to write '\x00'==0 to get something
29499    that's true only with -std.  */
29500 int osf4_cc_array ['\x00' == 0 ? 1 : -1];
29501 
29502 /* IBM C 6 for AIX is almost-ANSI by default, but it replaces macro parameters
29503    inside strings and character constants.  */
29504 #define FOO(x) 'x'
29505 int xlc6_cc_array[FOO(a) == 'x' ? 1 : -1];
29506 
29507 int test (int i, double x);
29508 struct s1 {int (*f) (int a);};
29509 struct s2 {int (*f) (double a);};
29510 int pairnames (int, char **, FILE *(*)(struct buf *, struct stat *, int), int, int);
29511 int argc;
29512 char **argv;
29513 int
29514 main ()
29515 {
29516 return f (e, argv, 0) != argv[0]  ||  f (e, argv, 1) != argv[1];
29517   ;
29518   return 0;
29519 }
29520 _ACEOF
29521 for ac_arg in '' -qlanglvl=extc89 -qlanglvl=ansi -std \
29522         -Ae "-Aa -D_HPUX_SOURCE" "-Xc -D__EXTENSIONS__"
29523 do
29524   CC="$ac_save_CC $ac_arg"
29525   if ac_fn_c_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
29526   ac_cv_prog_cc_c89=$ac_arg
29527 fi
29528 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext
29529   test "x$ac_cv_prog_cc_c89" != "xno" && break
29530 done
29531 rm -f conftest.$ac_ext
29532 CC=$ac_save_CC
29533 
29534 fi
29535 # AC_CACHE_VAL
29536 case "x$ac_cv_prog_cc_c89" in
29537   x)
29538     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: none needed" >&5
29539 $as_echo "none needed" >&6; } ;;
29540   xno)
29541     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: unsupported" >&5
29542 $as_echo "unsupported" >&6; } ;;
29543   *)
29544     CC="$CC $ac_cv_prog_cc_c89"
29545     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_prog_cc_c89" >&5
29546 $as_echo "$ac_cv_prog_cc_c89" >&6; } ;;
29547 esac
29548 if test "x$ac_cv_prog_cc_c89" != xno; then :
29549 
29550 fi
29551 
29552 ac_ext=cpp
29553 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
29554 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
29555 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
29556 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
29557 
29558 
29559 
29560   COMPILER_NAME=C++
29561   SEARCH_LIST="$TOOLCHAIN_CXX_BINARY"
29562 
29563   if test "x$CXX" != x; then
29564     # User has supplied compiler name already, always let that override.
29565     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied compiler CXX=$CXX" >&5
29566 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied compiler CXX=$CXX" >&6;}
29567     if test "x`basename $CXX`" = "x$CXX"; then
29568       # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
29569 
29570       for ac_prog in $CXX
29571 do
29572   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
29573 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
29574 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
29575 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
29576 if ${ac_cv_path_POTENTIAL_CXX+:} false; then :
29577   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
29578 else
29579   case $POTENTIAL_CXX in
29580   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
29581   ac_cv_path_POTENTIAL_CXX="$POTENTIAL_CXX" # Let the user override the test with a path.
29582   ;;
29583   *)
29584   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
29585 for as_dir in $PATH
29586 do
29587   IFS=$as_save_IFS
29588   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
29589     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
29590   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
29591     ac_cv_path_POTENTIAL_CXX="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
29592     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
29593     break 2
29594   fi
29595 done
29596   done
29597 IFS=$as_save_IFS
29598 
29599   ;;
29600 esac
29601 fi
29602 POTENTIAL_CXX=$ac_cv_path_POTENTIAL_CXX
29603 if test -n "$POTENTIAL_CXX"; then
29604   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $POTENTIAL_CXX" >&5
29605 $as_echo "$POTENTIAL_CXX" >&6; }
29606 else
29607   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
29608 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
29609 fi
29610 
29611 
29612   test -n "$POTENTIAL_CXX" && break
29613 done
29614 
29615       if test "x$POTENTIAL_CXX" != x; then
29616         CXX=$POTENTIAL_CXX
29617       else
29618         as_fn_error $? "User supplied compiler CXX=$CXX could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
29619       fi
29620     else
29621       # Otherwise it might already be a complete path
29622       if test ! -x "$CXX"; then
29623         as_fn_error $? "User supplied compiler CXX=$CXX does not exist" "$LINENO" 5
29624       fi
29625     fi
29626   else
29627     # No user supplied value. Locate compiler ourselves.
29628 
29629     # If we are cross compiling, assume cross compilation tools follows the
29630     # cross compilation standard where they are prefixed with the autoconf
29631     # standard name for the target. For example the binary
29632     # i686-sun-solaris2.10-gcc will cross compile for i686-sun-solaris2.10.
29633     # If we are not cross compiling, then the default compiler name will be
29634     # used.
29635 
29636     CXX=
29637     # If TOOLCHAIN_PATH is set, check for all compiler names in there first
29638     # before checking the rest of the PATH.
29639     # FIXME: Now that we prefix the TOOLS_DIR to the PATH in the PRE_DETECTION
29640     # step, this should not be necessary.
29641     if test -n "$TOOLCHAIN_PATH"; then
29642       PATH_save="$PATH"
29643       PATH="$TOOLCHAIN_PATH"
29644       for ac_prog in $SEARCH_LIST
29645 do
29646   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
29647 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
29648 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
29649 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
29650 if ${ac_cv_path_TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CXX+:} false; then :
29651   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
29652 else
29653   case $TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CXX in
29654   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
29655   ac_cv_path_TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CXX="$TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CXX" # Let the user override the test with a path.
29656   ;;
29657   *)
29658   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
29659 for as_dir in $PATH
29660 do
29661   IFS=$as_save_IFS
29662   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
29663     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
29664   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
29665     ac_cv_path_TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CXX="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
29666     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
29667     break 2
29668   fi
29669 done
29670   done
29671 IFS=$as_save_IFS
29672 
29673   ;;
29674 esac
29675 fi
29676 TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CXX=$ac_cv_path_TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CXX
29677 if test -n "$TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CXX"; then
29678   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CXX" >&5
29679 $as_echo "$TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CXX" >&6; }
29680 else
29681   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
29682 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
29683 fi
29684 
29685 
29686   test -n "$TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CXX" && break
29687 done
29688 
29689       CXX=$TOOLCHAIN_PATH_CXX
29690       PATH="$PATH_save"
29691     fi
29692 
29693     # AC_PATH_PROGS can't be run multiple times with the same variable,
29694     # so create a new name for this run.
29695     if test "x$CXX" = x; then
29696       for ac_prog in $SEARCH_LIST
29697 do
29698   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
29699 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
29700 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
29701 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
29702 if ${ac_cv_path_POTENTIAL_CXX+:} false; then :
29703   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
29704 else
29705   case $POTENTIAL_CXX in
29706   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
29707   ac_cv_path_POTENTIAL_CXX="$POTENTIAL_CXX" # Let the user override the test with a path.
29708   ;;
29709   *)
29710   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
29711 for as_dir in $PATH
29712 do
29713   IFS=$as_save_IFS
29714   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
29715     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
29716   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
29717     ac_cv_path_POTENTIAL_CXX="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
29718     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
29719     break 2
29720   fi
29721 done
29722   done
29723 IFS=$as_save_IFS
29724 
29725   ;;
29726 esac
29727 fi
29728 POTENTIAL_CXX=$ac_cv_path_POTENTIAL_CXX
29729 if test -n "$POTENTIAL_CXX"; then
29730   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $POTENTIAL_CXX" >&5
29731 $as_echo "$POTENTIAL_CXX" >&6; }
29732 else
29733   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
29734 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
29735 fi
29736 
29737 
29738   test -n "$POTENTIAL_CXX" && break
29739 done
29740 
29741       CXX=$POTENTIAL_CXX
29742     fi
29743 
29744     if test "x$CXX" = x; then
29745 
29746   # Print a helpful message on how to acquire the necessary build dependency.
29747   # devkit is the help tag: freetype, cups, pulse, alsa etc
29748   MISSING_DEPENDENCY=devkit
29749 
29750   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
29751     cygwin_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY
29752   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
29753     msys_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY
29754   else
29755     PKGHANDLER_COMMAND=
29756 
29757     case $PKGHANDLER in
29758       apt-get)
29759         apt_help     $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
29760       yum)
29761         yum_help     $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
29762       port)
29763         port_help    $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
29764       pkgutil)
29765         pkgutil_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
29766       pkgadd)
29767         pkgadd_help  $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
29768     esac
29769 
29770     if test "x$PKGHANDLER_COMMAND" != x; then
29771       HELP_MSG="You might be able to fix this by running '$PKGHANDLER_COMMAND'."
29772     fi
29773   fi
29774 
29775       as_fn_error $? "Could not find a $COMPILER_NAME compiler. $HELP_MSG" "$LINENO" 5
29776     fi
29777   fi
29778 
29779   # Now we have a compiler binary in CXX. Make sure it's okay.
29780 
29781   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
29782 
29783   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
29784   # space.
29785   complete="$CXX"
29786   path="${complete%% *}"
29787   tmp="$complete EOL"
29788   arguments="${tmp#* }"
29789 
29790   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
29791   # unix format.
29792   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
29793 
29794   # Now try to locate executable using which
29795   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
29796   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
29797   # to not find them
29798   if test "x$new_path" = x \
29799       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
29800       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
29801     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
29802   fi
29803   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
29804     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
29805     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
29806     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
29807     # argument.
29808     path="$complete"
29809     arguments="EOL"
29810     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
29811     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
29812     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
29813     # to not find them
29814     if test "x$new_path" = x \
29815         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
29816         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
29817       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
29818     fi
29819     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
29820       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
29821       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of CXX, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
29822 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of CXX, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
29823       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
29824       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
29825         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
29826 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
29827       fi
29828       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of CXX" "$LINENO" 5
29829     fi
29830   fi
29831 
29832   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
29833   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
29834   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
29835   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
29836   #
29837   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
29838   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
29839   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
29840   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
29841     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
29842     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
29843     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
29844       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
29845     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
29846       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
29847     else
29848       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of CXX, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
29849 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of CXX, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
29850       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
29851 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
29852       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of CXX" "$LINENO" 5
29853     fi
29854   else
29855     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
29856   fi
29857 
29858   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
29859   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
29860   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
29861 
29862   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
29863   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
29864   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
29865   # take no chances and rewrite it.
29866   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
29867   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
29868   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
