29869     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
29870     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
29871     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
29872     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
29873       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
29874       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
29875       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
29876       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
29877       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
29878       new_path="$input_path"
29879     fi
29880   fi
29881 
29882   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
29883   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
29884     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
29885     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
29886       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
29887       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
29888       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
29889     fi
29890   fi
29891 
29892   # remove trailing .exe if any
29893   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
29894 
29895   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
29896 
29897   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
29898   # space.
29899   complete="$CXX"
29900   path="${complete%% *}"
29901   tmp="$complete EOL"
29902   arguments="${tmp#* }"
29903 
29904   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
29905   # unix format.
29906   new_path="$path"
29907 
29908   windows_path="$new_path"
29909   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
29910     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
29911     new_path="$unix_path"
29912   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
29913     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
29914     new_path="$unix_path"
29915   fi
29916 
29917 
29918   # Now try to locate executable using which
29919   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
29920 
29921   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
29922     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
29923     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
29924     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
29925     # argument.
29926     path="$complete"
29927     arguments="EOL"
29928     new_path="$path"
29929 
29930   windows_path="$new_path"
29931   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
29932     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
29933     new_path="$unix_path"
29934   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
29935     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
29936     new_path="$unix_path"
29937   fi
29938 
29939 
29940     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
29941     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
29942     # to not find them
29943     if test "x$new_path" = x \
29944         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
29945         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
29946       new_path="$path"
29947 
29948   windows_path="$new_path"
29949   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
29950     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
29951     new_path="$unix_path"
29952   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
29953     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
29954     new_path="$unix_path"
29955   fi
29956 
29957     fi
29958 
29959     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
29960       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
29961       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of CXX, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
29962 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of CXX, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
29963       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
29964       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
29965         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
29966 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
29967       fi
29968       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of CXX" "$LINENO" 5
29969     fi
29970   fi
29971 
29972   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
29973   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
29974     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
29975     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
29976     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
29977   else
29978     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
29979     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
29980 
29981   input_path="$new_path"
29982   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
29983   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
29984   # take no chances and rewrite it.
29985   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
29986   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
29987   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
29988     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
29989     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
29990   fi
29991 
29992     # Output is in $new_path
29993 
29994   windows_path="$new_path"
29995   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
29996     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
29997     new_path="$unix_path"
29998   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
29999     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
30000     new_path="$unix_path"
30001   fi
30002 
30003     # remove trailing .exe if any
30004     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
30005 
30006     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
30007     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
30008   fi
30009 
30010   else
30011     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
30012     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
30013     # space.
30014     complete="$CXX"
30015     path="${complete%% *}"
30016     tmp="$complete EOL"
30017     arguments="${tmp#* }"
30018 
30019     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
30020     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
30021     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
30022       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
30023       IFS_save="$IFS"
30024       IFS=:
30025       for p in $PATH; do
30026         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
30027           new_path="$p/$path"
30028           break
30029         fi
30030       done
30031       IFS="$IFS_save"
30032     else
30033       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
30034       new_path="$path"
30035     fi
30036 
30037     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
30038       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of CXX, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
30039 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of CXX, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
30040       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
30041       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
30042         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
30043 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
30044       fi
30045       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of CXX" "$LINENO" 5
30046     fi
30047   fi
30048 
30049   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
30050   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
30051     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
30052   else
30053     new_complete="$new_path"
30054   fi
30055 
30056   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
30057     CXX="$new_complete"
30058     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting CXX to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
30059 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting CXX to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
30060   fi
30061 
30062   TEST_COMPILER="$CXX"
30063   # Don't remove symbolic links on AIX because 'xlc_r' and 'xlC_r' may all be links
30064   # to 'xlc' but it is crucial that we invoke the compiler with the right name!
30065   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS" != xaix; then
30066     # FIXME: This test should not be needed anymore; we don't do that for any platform.
30067     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking resolved symbolic links for CXX" >&5
30068 $as_echo_n "checking resolved symbolic links for CXX... " >&6; }
30069 
30070   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS" != xwindows; then
30071     # Follow a chain of symbolic links. Use readlink
30072     # where it exists, else fall back to horribly
30073     # complicated shell code.
30074     if test "x$READLINK_TESTED" != yes; then
30075       # On MacOSX there is a readlink tool with a different
30076       # purpose than the GNU readlink tool. Check the found readlink.
30077       ISGNU=`$READLINK --version 2>&1 | $GREP GNU`
30078       if test "x$ISGNU" = x; then
30079         # A readlink that we do not know how to use.
30080         # Are there other non-GNU readlinks out there?
30081         READLINK_TESTED=yes
30082         READLINK=
30083       fi
30084     fi
30085 
30086     if test "x$READLINK" != x; then
30087       TEST_COMPILER=`$READLINK -f $TEST_COMPILER`
30088     else
30089       # Save the current directory for restoring afterwards
30090       STARTDIR=$PWD
30091       COUNTER=0
30092       sym_link_dir=`$DIRNAME $TEST_COMPILER`
30093       sym_link_file=`$BASENAME $TEST_COMPILER`
30094       cd $sym_link_dir
30095       # Use -P flag to resolve symlinks in directories.
30096       cd `$THEPWDCMD -P`
30097       sym_link_dir=`$THEPWDCMD -P`
30098       # Resolve file symlinks
30099       while test $COUNTER -lt 20; do
30100         ISLINK=`$LS -l $sym_link_dir/$sym_link_file | $GREP '\->' | $SED -e 's/.*-> \(.*\)/\1/'`
30101         if test "x$ISLINK" == x; then
30102           # This is not a symbolic link! We are done!
30103           break
30104         fi
30105         # Again resolve directory symlinks since the target of the just found
30106         # link could be in a different directory
30107         cd `$DIRNAME $ISLINK`
30108         sym_link_dir=`$THEPWDCMD -P`
30109         sym_link_file=`$BASENAME $ISLINK`
30110         let COUNTER=COUNTER+1
30111       done
30112       cd $STARTDIR
30113       TEST_COMPILER=$sym_link_dir/$sym_link_file
30114     fi
30115   fi
30116 
30117     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $TEST_COMPILER" >&5
30118 $as_echo "$TEST_COMPILER" >&6; }
30119   fi
30120   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if CXX is disguised ccache" >&5
30121 $as_echo_n "checking if CXX is disguised ccache... " >&6; }
30122 
30123   COMPILER_BASENAME=`$BASENAME "$TEST_COMPILER"`
30124   if test "x$COMPILER_BASENAME" = "xccache"; then
30125     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes, trying to find proper $COMPILER_NAME compiler" >&5
30126 $as_echo "yes, trying to find proper $COMPILER_NAME compiler" >&6; }
30127     # We /usr/lib/ccache in the path, so cc is a symlink to /usr/bin/ccache.
30128     # We want to control ccache invocation ourselves, so ignore this cc and try
30129     # searching again.
30130 
30131     # Remove the path to the fake ccache cc from the PATH
30132     RETRY_COMPILER_SAVED_PATH="$PATH"
30133     COMPILER_DIRNAME=`$DIRNAME $CXX`
30134     PATH="`$ECHO $PATH | $SED -e "s,$COMPILER_DIRNAME,,g" -e "s,::,:,g" -e "s,^:,,g"`"
30135 
30136     # Try again looking for our compiler
30137     if test -n "$ac_tool_prefix"; then
30138   for ac_prog in $TOOLCHAIN_CXX_BINARY
30139   do
30140     # Extract the first word of "$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
30141 set dummy $ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog; ac_word=$2
30142 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
30143 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
30144 if ${ac_cv_prog_PROPER_COMPILER_CXX+:} false; then :
30145   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
30146 else
30147   if test -n "$PROPER_COMPILER_CXX"; then
30148   ac_cv_prog_PROPER_COMPILER_CXX="$PROPER_COMPILER_CXX" # Let the user override the test.
30149 else
30150 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
30151 for as_dir in $PATH
30152 do
30153   IFS=$as_save_IFS
30154   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
30155     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
30156   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
30157     ac_cv_prog_PROPER_COMPILER_CXX="$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog"
30158     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
30159     break 2
30160   fi
30161 done
30162   done
30163 IFS=$as_save_IFS
30164 
30165 fi
30166 fi
30167 PROPER_COMPILER_CXX=$ac_cv_prog_PROPER_COMPILER_CXX
30168 if test -n "$PROPER_COMPILER_CXX"; then
30169   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $PROPER_COMPILER_CXX" >&5
30170 $as_echo "$PROPER_COMPILER_CXX" >&6; }
30171 else
30172   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
30173 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
30174 fi
30175 
30176 
30177     test -n "$PROPER_COMPILER_CXX" && break
30178   done
30179 fi
30180 if test -z "$PROPER_COMPILER_CXX"; then
30181   ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CXX=$PROPER_COMPILER_CXX
30182   for ac_prog in $TOOLCHAIN_CXX_BINARY
30183 do
30184   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
30185 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
30186 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
30187 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
30188 if ${ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CXX+:} false; then :
30189   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
30190 else
30191   if test -n "$ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CXX"; then
30192   ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CXX="$ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CXX" # Let the user override the test.
30193 else
30194 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
30195 for as_dir in $PATH
30196 do
30197   IFS=$as_save_IFS
30198   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
30199     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
30200   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
30201     ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CXX="$ac_prog"
30202     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
30203     break 2
30204   fi
30205 done
30206   done
30207 IFS=$as_save_IFS
30208 
30209 fi
30210 fi
30211 ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CXX=$ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CXX
30212 if test -n "$ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CXX"; then
30213   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CXX" >&5
30214 $as_echo "$ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CXX" >&6; }
30215 else
30216   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
30217 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
30218 fi
30219 
30220 
30221   test -n "$ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CXX" && break
30222 done
30223 
30224   if test "x$ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CXX" = x; then
30225     PROPER_COMPILER_CXX=""
30226   else
30227     case $cross_compiling:$ac_tool_warned in
30228 yes:)
30229 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&5
30230 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&2;}
30231 ac_tool_warned=yes ;;
30232 esac
30233     PROPER_COMPILER_CXX=$ac_ct_PROPER_COMPILER_CXX
30234   fi
30235 fi
30236 
30237 
30238   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
30239 
30240   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
30241   # space.
30242   complete="$PROPER_COMPILER_CXX"
30243   path="${complete%% *}"
30244   tmp="$complete EOL"
30245   arguments="${tmp#* }"
30246 
30247   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
30248   # unix format.
30249   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
30250 
30251   # Now try to locate executable using which
30252   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
30253   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
30254   # to not find them
30255   if test "x$new_path" = x \
30256       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
30257       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
30258     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
30259   fi
30260   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
30261     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
30262     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
30263     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
30264     # argument.
30265     path="$complete"
30266     arguments="EOL"
30267     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
30268     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
30269     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
30270     # to not find them
30271     if test "x$new_path" = x \
30272         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
30273         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
30274       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
30275     fi
30276     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
30277       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
30278       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of PROPER_COMPILER_CXX, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
30279 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of PROPER_COMPILER_CXX, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
30280       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
30281       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
30282         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
30283 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
30284       fi
30285       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of PROPER_COMPILER_CXX" "$LINENO" 5
30286     fi
30287   fi
30288 
30289   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
30290   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
30291   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
30292   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
30293   #
30294   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
30295   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
30296   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
30297   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
30298     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
30299     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
30300     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
30301       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
30302     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
30303       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
30304     else
30305       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of PROPER_COMPILER_CXX, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
30306 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of PROPER_COMPILER_CXX, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
30307       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
30308 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
30309       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of PROPER_COMPILER_CXX" "$LINENO" 5
30310     fi
30311   else
30312     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
30313   fi
30314 
30315   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
30316   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
30317   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
30318 
30319   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
30320   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
30321   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
30322   # take no chances and rewrite it.
30323   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
30324   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
30325   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
30326     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
30327     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
30328     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
30329     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
30330       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
30331       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
30332       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
30333       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
30334       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
30335       new_path="$input_path"
30336     fi
30337   fi
30338 
30339   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
30340   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
30341     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
30342     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
30343       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
30344       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
30345       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
30346     fi
30347   fi
30348 
30349   # remove trailing .exe if any
30350   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
30351 
30352   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
30353 
30354   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
30355   # space.
30356   complete="$PROPER_COMPILER_CXX"
30357   path="${complete%% *}"
30358   tmp="$complete EOL"
30359   arguments="${tmp#* }"
30360 
30361   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
30362   # unix format.
30363   new_path="$path"
30364 
30365   windows_path="$new_path"
30366   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
30367     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
30368     new_path="$unix_path"
30369   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
30370     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
30371     new_path="$unix_path"
30372   fi
30373 
30374 
30375   # Now try to locate executable using which
30376   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
30377 
30378   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
30379     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
30380     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
30381     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
30382     # argument.
30383     path="$complete"
30384     arguments="EOL"
30385     new_path="$path"
30386 
30387   windows_path="$new_path"
30388   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
30389     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
30390     new_path="$unix_path"
30391   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
30392     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
30393     new_path="$unix_path"
30394   fi
30395 
30396 
30397     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
30398     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
30399     # to not find them
30400     if test "x$new_path" = x \
30401         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
30402         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
30403       new_path="$path"
30404 
30405   windows_path="$new_path"
30406   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
30407     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
30408     new_path="$unix_path"
30409   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
30410     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
30411     new_path="$unix_path"
30412   fi
30413 
30414     fi
30415 
30416     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
30417       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
30418       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of PROPER_COMPILER_CXX, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
30419 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of PROPER_COMPILER_CXX, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
30420       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
30421       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
30422         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
30423 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
30424       fi
30425       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of PROPER_COMPILER_CXX" "$LINENO" 5
30426     fi
30427   fi
30428 
30429   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
30430   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
30431     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
30432     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
30433     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
30434   else
30435     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
30436     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
30437 
30438   input_path="$new_path"
30439   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
30440   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
30441   # take no chances and rewrite it.
30442   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
30443   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
30444   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
30445     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
30446     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
30447   fi
30448 
30449     # Output is in $new_path
30450 
30451   windows_path="$new_path"
30452   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
30453     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
30454     new_path="$unix_path"
30455   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
30456     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
30457     new_path="$unix_path"
30458   fi
30459 
30460     # remove trailing .exe if any
30461     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
30462 
30463     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
30464     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
30465   fi
30466 
30467   else
30468     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
30469     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
30470     # space.
30471     complete="$PROPER_COMPILER_CXX"
30472     path="${complete%% *}"
30473     tmp="$complete EOL"
30474     arguments="${tmp#* }"
30475 
30476     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
30477     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
30478     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
30479       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
30480       IFS_save="$IFS"
30481       IFS=:
30482       for p in $PATH; do
30483         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
30484           new_path="$p/$path"
30485           break
30486         fi
30487       done
30488       IFS="$IFS_save"
30489     else
30490       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
30491       new_path="$path"
30492     fi
30493 
30494     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
30495       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of PROPER_COMPILER_CXX, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
30496 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of PROPER_COMPILER_CXX, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
30497       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
30498       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
30499         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
30500 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
30501       fi
30502       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of PROPER_COMPILER_CXX" "$LINENO" 5
30503     fi
30504   fi
30505 
30506   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
30507   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
30508     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
30509   else
30510     new_complete="$new_path"
30511   fi
30512 
30513   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
30514     PROPER_COMPILER_CXX="$new_complete"
30515     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting PROPER_COMPILER_CXX to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
30516 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting PROPER_COMPILER_CXX to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
30517   fi
30518 
30519     PATH="$RETRY_COMPILER_SAVED_PATH"
30520 
30521     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for resolved symbolic links for CXX" >&5
30522 $as_echo_n "checking for resolved symbolic links for CXX... " >&6; }
30523 
30524   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS" != xwindows; then
30525     # Follow a chain of symbolic links. Use readlink
30526     # where it exists, else fall back to horribly
30527     # complicated shell code.
30528     if test "x$READLINK_TESTED" != yes; then
30529       # On MacOSX there is a readlink tool with a different
30530       # purpose than the GNU readlink tool. Check the found readlink.
30531       ISGNU=`$READLINK --version 2>&1 | $GREP GNU`
30532       if test "x$ISGNU" = x; then
30533         # A readlink that we do not know how to use.
30534         # Are there other non-GNU readlinks out there?
30535         READLINK_TESTED=yes
30536         READLINK=
30537       fi
30538     fi
30539 
30540     if test "x$READLINK" != x; then
30541       PROPER_COMPILER_CXX=`$READLINK -f $PROPER_COMPILER_CXX`
30542     else
30543       # Save the current directory for restoring afterwards
30544       STARTDIR=$PWD
30545       COUNTER=0
30546       sym_link_dir=`$DIRNAME $PROPER_COMPILER_CXX`
30547       sym_link_file=`$BASENAME $PROPER_COMPILER_CXX`
30548       cd $sym_link_dir
30549       # Use -P flag to resolve symlinks in directories.
30550       cd `$THEPWDCMD -P`
30551       sym_link_dir=`$THEPWDCMD -P`
30552       # Resolve file symlinks
30553       while test $COUNTER -lt 20; do
30554         ISLINK=`$LS -l $sym_link_dir/$sym_link_file | $GREP '\->' | $SED -e 's/.*-> \(.*\)/\1/'`
30555         if test "x$ISLINK" == x; then
30556           # This is not a symbolic link! We are done!
30557           break
30558         fi
30559         # Again resolve directory symlinks since the target of the just found
30560         # link could be in a different directory
30561         cd `$DIRNAME $ISLINK`
30562         sym_link_dir=`$THEPWDCMD -P`
30563         sym_link_file=`$BASENAME $ISLINK`
30564         let COUNTER=COUNTER+1
30565       done
30566       cd $STARTDIR
30567       PROPER_COMPILER_CXX=$sym_link_dir/$sym_link_file
30568     fi
30569   fi
30570 
30571     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $PROPER_COMPILER_CXX" >&5
30572 $as_echo "$PROPER_COMPILER_CXX" >&6; }
30573     CXX="$PROPER_COMPILER_CXX"
30574   else
30575     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no, keeping CXX" >&5
30576 $as_echo "no, keeping CXX" >&6; }
30577   fi
30578 
30579 
30580   COMPILER=$CXX
30581   COMPILER_NAME=$COMPILER_NAME
30582 
30583   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xsolstudio; then
30584     # cc -V output typically looks like
30585     #     cc: Sun C 5.12 Linux_i386 2011/11/16
30586     COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT=`$COMPILER -V 2>&1`
30587     # Check that this is likely to be the Solaris Studio cc.
30588     $ECHO "$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT" | $GREP "^.*: Sun $COMPILER_NAME" > /dev/null
30589     if test $? -ne 0; then
30590       ALT_VERSION_OUTPUT=`$COMPILER --version 2>&1`
30591       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The $COMPILER_NAME compiler (located as $COMPILER) does not seem to be the required $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler." >&5
30592 $as_echo "$as_me: The $COMPILER_NAME compiler (located as $COMPILER) does not seem to be the required $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler." >&6;}
30593       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The result from running with -V was: \"$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&5
30594 $as_echo "$as_me: The result from running with -V was: \"$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&6;}
30595       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The result from running with --version was: \"$ALT_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&5
30596 $as_echo "$as_me: The result from running with --version was: \"$ALT_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&6;}
30597       as_fn_error $? "A $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler is required. Try setting --with-tools-dir." "$LINENO" 5
30598     fi
30599     # Remove usage instructions (if present), and
30600     # collapse compiler output into a single line
30601     COMPILER_VERSION_STRING=`$ECHO $COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT | \
30602         $SED -e 's/ *[Uu]sage:.*//'`
30603     COMPILER_VERSION_NUMBER=`$ECHO $COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT | \
30604         $SED -e "s/^.*[ ,\t]$COMPILER_NAME[ ,\t]\([1-9]\.[0-9][0-9]*\).*/\1/"`
30605   elif test  "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xxlc; then
30606     # xlc -qversion output typically looks like
30607     #     IBM XL C/C++ for AIX, V11.1 (5724-X13)
30608     #     Version: 11.01.0000.0015
30609     COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT=`$COMPILER -qversion 2>&1`
30610     # Check that this is likely to be the IBM XL C compiler.
30611     $ECHO "$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT" | $GREP "IBM XL C" > /dev/null
30612     if test $? -ne 0; then
30613       ALT_VERSION_OUTPUT=`$COMPILER --version 2>&1`
30614       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The $COMPILER_NAME compiler (located as $COMPILER) does not seem to be the required $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler." >&5
30615 $as_echo "$as_me: The $COMPILER_NAME compiler (located as $COMPILER) does not seem to be the required $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler." >&6;}
30616       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The result from running with -qversion was: \"$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&5
30617 $as_echo "$as_me: The result from running with -qversion was: \"$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&6;}
30618       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The result from running with --version was: \"$ALT_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&5
30619 $as_echo "$as_me: The result from running with --version was: \"$ALT_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&6;}
30620       as_fn_error $? "A $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler is required. Try setting --with-tools-dir." "$LINENO" 5
30621     fi
30622     # Collapse compiler output into a single line
30623     COMPILER_VERSION_STRING=`$ECHO $COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT`
30624     COMPILER_VERSION_NUMBER=`$ECHO $COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT | \
30625         $SED -e 's/^.*, V\([1-9][0-9.]*\).*$/\1/'`
30626   elif test  "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xmicrosoft; then
30627     # There is no specific version flag, but all output starts with a version string.
30628     # First line typically looks something like:
30629     # Microsoft (R) 32-bit C/C++ Optimizing Compiler Version 16.00.40219.01 for 80x86
30630     COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT=`$COMPILER 2>&1 | $HEAD -n 1 | $TR -d '\r'`
30631     # Check that this is likely to be Microsoft CL.EXE.
30632     $ECHO "$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT" | $GREP "Microsoft.*Compiler" > /dev/null
30633     if test $? -ne 0; then
30634       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The $COMPILER_NAME compiler (located as $COMPILER) does not seem to be the required $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler." >&5
30635 $as_echo "$as_me: The $COMPILER_NAME compiler (located as $COMPILER) does not seem to be the required $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler." >&6;}
30636       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The result from running it was: \"$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&5
30637 $as_echo "$as_me: The result from running it was: \"$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&6;}
30638       as_fn_error $? "A $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler is required. Try setting --with-tools-dir." "$LINENO" 5
30639     fi
30640     # Collapse compiler output into a single line
30641     COMPILER_VERSION_STRING=`$ECHO $COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT`
30642     COMPILER_VERSION_NUMBER=`$ECHO $COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT | \
30643         $SED -e 's/^.*ersion.\([1-9][0-9.]*\) .*$/\1/'`
30644   elif test  "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xgcc; then
30645     # gcc --version output typically looks like
30646     #     gcc (Ubuntu/Linaro 4.8.1-10ubuntu9) 4.8.1
30647     #     Copyright (C) 2013 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
30648     #     This is free software; see the source for copying conditions.  There is NO
30649     #     warranty; not even for MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.
30650     COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT=`$COMPILER --version 2>&1`
30651     # Check that this is likely to be GCC.
30652     $ECHO "$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT" | $GREP "Free Software Foundation" > /dev/null
30653     if test $? -ne 0; then
30654       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The $COMPILER_NAME compiler (located as $COMPILER) does not seem to be the required $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler." >&5
30655 $as_echo "$as_me: The $COMPILER_NAME compiler (located as $COMPILER) does not seem to be the required $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler." >&6;}
30656       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The result from running with --version was: \"$COMPILER_VERSION\"" >&5
30657 $as_echo "$as_me: The result from running with --version was: \"$COMPILER_VERSION\"" >&6;}
30658       as_fn_error $? "A $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler is required. Try setting --with-tools-dir." "$LINENO" 5
30659     fi
30660     # Remove Copyright and legalese from version string, and
30661     # collapse into a single line
30662     COMPILER_VERSION_STRING=`$ECHO $COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT | \
30663         $SED -e 's/ *Copyright .*//'`
30664     COMPILER_VERSION_NUMBER=`$ECHO $COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT | \
30665         $SED -e 's/^.* \([1-9]\.[0-9.]*\) .*$/\1/'`
30666   elif test  "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xclang; then
30667     # clang --version output typically looks like
30668     #    Apple LLVM version 5.0 (clang-500.2.79) (based on LLVM 3.3svn)
30669     #    clang version 3.3 (tags/RELEASE_33/final)
30670     # or
30671     #    Debian clang version 3.2-7ubuntu1 (tags/RELEASE_32/final) (based on LLVM 3.2)
30672     #    Target: x86_64-pc-linux-gnu
30673     #    Thread model: posix
30674     COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT=`$COMPILER --version 2>&1`
30675     # Check that this is likely to be clang
30676     $ECHO "$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT" | $GREP "clang" > /dev/null
30677     if test $? -ne 0; then
30678       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The $COMPILER_NAME compiler (located as $COMPILER) does not seem to be the required $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler." >&5
30679 $as_echo "$as_me: The $COMPILER_NAME compiler (located as $COMPILER) does not seem to be the required $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler." >&6;}
30680       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The result from running with --version was: \"$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&5
30681 $as_echo "$as_me: The result from running with --version was: \"$COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT\"" >&6;}
30682       as_fn_error $? "A $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE compiler is required. Try setting --with-tools-dir." "$LINENO" 5
30683     fi
30684     # Collapse compiler output into a single line
30685     COMPILER_VERSION_STRING=`$ECHO $COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT`
30686     COMPILER_VERSION_NUMBER=`$ECHO $COMPILER_VERSION_OUTPUT | \
30687         $SED -e 's/^.*clang version \([1-9][0-9.]*\).*$/\1/'`
30688   else
30689       as_fn_error $? "Unknown toolchain type $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE." "$LINENO" 5
30690   fi
30691   # This sets CC_VERSION_NUMBER or CXX_VERSION_NUMBER. (This comment is a grep marker)
30692   CXX_VERSION_NUMBER="$COMPILER_VERSION_NUMBER"
30693   # This sets CC_VERSION_STRING or CXX_VERSION_STRING. (This comment is a grep marker)
30694   CXX_VERSION_STRING="$COMPILER_VERSION_STRING"
30695 
30696   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Using $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE $COMPILER_NAME compiler version $COMPILER_VERSION_NUMBER [$COMPILER_VERSION_STRING]" >&5
30697 $as_echo "$as_me: Using $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE $COMPILER_NAME compiler version $COMPILER_VERSION_NUMBER [$COMPILER_VERSION_STRING]" >&6;}
30698 
30699 
30700   # Now that we have resolved CXX ourself, let autoconf have its go at it
30701   ac_ext=cpp
30702 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
30703 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
30704 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
30705 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
30706 if test -z "$CXX"; then
30707   if test -n "$CCC"; then
30708     CXX=$CCC
30709   else
30710     if test -n "$ac_tool_prefix"; then
30711   for ac_prog in $CXX
30712   do
30713     # Extract the first word of "$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
30714 set dummy $ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog; ac_word=$2
30715 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
30716 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
30717 if ${ac_cv_prog_CXX+:} false; then :
30718   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
30719 else
30720   if test -n "$CXX"; then
30721   ac_cv_prog_CXX="$CXX" # Let the user override the test.
30722 else
30723 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
30724 for as_dir in $PATH
30725 do
30726   IFS=$as_save_IFS
30727   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
30728     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
30729   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
30730     ac_cv_prog_CXX="$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog"
30731     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
30732     break 2
30733   fi
30734 done
30735   done
30736 IFS=$as_save_IFS
30737 
30738 fi
30739 fi
30740 CXX=$ac_cv_prog_CXX
30741 if test -n "$CXX"; then
30742   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $CXX" >&5
30743 $as_echo "$CXX" >&6; }
30744 else
30745   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
30746 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
30747 fi
30748 
30749 
30750     test -n "$CXX" && break
30751   done
30752 fi
30753 if test -z "$CXX"; then
30754   ac_ct_CXX=$CXX
30755   for ac_prog in $CXX
30756 do
30757   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
30758 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
30759 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
30760 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
30761 if ${ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_CXX+:} false; then :
30762   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
30763 else
30764   if test -n "$ac_ct_CXX"; then
30765   ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_CXX="$ac_ct_CXX" # Let the user override the test.
30766 else
30767 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
30768 for as_dir in $PATH
30769 do
30770   IFS=$as_save_IFS
30771   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
30772     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
30773   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
30774     ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_CXX="$ac_prog"
30775     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
30776     break 2
30777   fi
30778 done
30779   done
30780 IFS=$as_save_IFS
30781 
30782 fi
30783 fi
30784 ac_ct_CXX=$ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_CXX
30785 if test -n "$ac_ct_CXX"; then
30786   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_ct_CXX" >&5
30787 $as_echo "$ac_ct_CXX" >&6; }
30788 else
30789   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
30790 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
30791 fi
30792 
30793 
30794   test -n "$ac_ct_CXX" && break
30795 done
30796 
30797   if test "x$ac_ct_CXX" = x; then
30798     CXX="g++"
30799   else
30800     case $cross_compiling:$ac_tool_warned in
30801 yes:)
30802 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&5
30803 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&2;}
30804 ac_tool_warned=yes ;;
30805 esac
30806     CXX=$ac_ct_CXX
30807   fi
30808 fi
30809 
30810   fi
30811 fi
30812 # Provide some information about the compiler.
30813 $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for C++ compiler version" >&5
30814 set X $ac_compile
30815 ac_compiler=$2
30816 for ac_option in --version -v -V -qversion; do
30817   { { ac_try="$ac_compiler $ac_option >&5"
30818 case "(($ac_try" in
30819   *\"* | *\`* | *\\*) ac_try_echo=\$ac_try;;
30820   *) ac_try_echo=$ac_try;;
30821 esac
30822 eval ac_try_echo="\"\$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: $ac_try_echo\""
30823 $as_echo "$ac_try_echo"; } >&5
30824   (eval "$ac_compiler $ac_option >&5") 2>conftest.err
30825   ac_status=$?
30826   if test -s conftest.err; then
30827     sed '10a\
30828 ... rest of stderr output deleted ...
30829          10q' conftest.err >conftest.er1
30830     cat conftest.er1 >&5
30831   fi
30832   rm -f conftest.er1 conftest.err
30833   $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$? = $ac_status" >&5
30834   test $ac_status = 0; }
30835 done
30836 
30837 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking whether we are using the GNU C++ compiler" >&5
30838 $as_echo_n "checking whether we are using the GNU C++ compiler... " >&6; }
30839 if ${ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu+:} false; then :
30840   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
30841 else
30842   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
30843 /* end confdefs.h.  */
30844 
30845 int
30846 main ()
30847 {
30848 #ifndef __GNUC__
30849        choke me
30850 #endif
30851 
30852   ;
30853   return 0;
30854 }
30855 _ACEOF
30856 if ac_fn_cxx_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
30857   ac_compiler_gnu=yes
30858 else
30859   ac_compiler_gnu=no
30860 fi
30861 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
30862 ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu=$ac_compiler_gnu
30863 
30864 fi
30865 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu" >&5
30866 $as_echo "$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu" >&6; }
30867 if test $ac_compiler_gnu = yes; then
30868   GXX=yes
30869 else
30870   GXX=
30871 fi
30872 ac_test_CXXFLAGS=${CXXFLAGS+set}
30873 ac_save_CXXFLAGS=$CXXFLAGS
30874 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking whether $CXX accepts -g" >&5
30875 $as_echo_n "checking whether $CXX accepts -g... " >&6; }
30876 if ${ac_cv_prog_cxx_g+:} false; then :
30877   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
30878 else
30879   ac_save_cxx_werror_flag=$ac_cxx_werror_flag
30880    ac_cxx_werror_flag=yes
30881    ac_cv_prog_cxx_g=no
30882    CXXFLAGS="-g"
30883    cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
30884 /* end confdefs.h.  */
30885 
30886 int
30887 main ()
30888 {
30889 
30890   ;
30891   return 0;
30892 }
30893 _ACEOF
30894 if ac_fn_cxx_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
30895   ac_cv_prog_cxx_g=yes
30896 else
30897   CXXFLAGS=""
30898       cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
30899 /* end confdefs.h.  */
30900 
30901 int
30902 main ()
30903 {
30904 
30905   ;
30906   return 0;
30907 }
30908 _ACEOF
30909 if ac_fn_cxx_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
30910 
30911 else
30912   ac_cxx_werror_flag=$ac_save_cxx_werror_flag
30913          CXXFLAGS="-g"
30914          cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
30915 /* end confdefs.h.  */
30916 
30917 int
30918 main ()
30919 {
30920 
30921   ;
30922   return 0;
30923 }
30924 _ACEOF
30925 if ac_fn_cxx_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
30926   ac_cv_prog_cxx_g=yes
30927 fi
30928 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
30929 fi
30930 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
30931 fi
30932 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
30933    ac_cxx_werror_flag=$ac_save_cxx_werror_flag
30934 fi
30935 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_prog_cxx_g" >&5
30936 $as_echo "$ac_cv_prog_cxx_g" >&6; }
30937 if test "$ac_test_CXXFLAGS" = set; then
30938   CXXFLAGS=$ac_save_CXXFLAGS
30939 elif test $ac_cv_prog_cxx_g = yes; then
30940   if test "$GXX" = yes; then
30941     CXXFLAGS="-g -O2"
30942   else
30943     CXXFLAGS="-g"
30944   fi
30945 else
30946   if test "$GXX" = yes; then
30947     CXXFLAGS="-O2"
30948   else
30949     CXXFLAGS=
30950   fi
30951 fi
30952 ac_ext=cpp
30953 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
30954 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
30955 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
30956 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
30957 
30958 
30959   #
30960   # Setup the preprocessor (CPP and CXXCPP)
30961   #
30962   ac_ext=c
30963 ac_cpp='$CPP $CPPFLAGS'
30964 ac_compile='$CC -c $CFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
30965 ac_link='$CC -o conftest$ac_exeext $CFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
30966 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_c_compiler_gnu
30967 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking how to run the C preprocessor" >&5
30968 $as_echo_n "checking how to run the C preprocessor... " >&6; }
30969 # On Suns, sometimes $CPP names a directory.
30970 if test -n "$CPP" && test -d "$CPP"; then
30971   CPP=
30972 fi
30973 if test -z "$CPP"; then
30974   if ${ac_cv_prog_CPP+:} false; then :
30975   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
30976 else
30977       # Double quotes because CPP needs to be expanded
30978     for CPP in "$CC -E" "$CC -E -traditional-cpp" "/lib/cpp"
30979     do
30980       ac_preproc_ok=false
30981 for ac_c_preproc_warn_flag in '' yes
30982 do
30983   # Use a header file that comes with gcc, so configuring glibc
30984   # with a fresh cross-compiler works.
30985   # Prefer <limits.h> to <assert.h> if __STDC__ is defined, since
30986   # <limits.h> exists even on freestanding compilers.
30987   # On the NeXT, cc -E runs the code through the compiler's parser,
30988   # not just through cpp. "Syntax error" is here to catch this case.
30989   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
30990 /* end confdefs.h.  */
30991 #ifdef __STDC__
30992 # include <limits.h>
30993 #else
30994 # include <assert.h>
30995 #endif
30996                      Syntax error
30997 _ACEOF
30998 if ac_fn_c_try_cpp "$LINENO"; then :
30999 
31000 else
31001   # Broken: fails on valid input.
31002 continue
31003 fi
31004 rm -f conftest.err conftest.i conftest.$ac_ext
31005 
31006   # OK, works on sane cases.  Now check whether nonexistent headers
31007   # can be detected and how.
31008   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
31009 /* end confdefs.h.  */
31010 #include <ac_nonexistent.h>
31011 _ACEOF
31012 if ac_fn_c_try_cpp "$LINENO"; then :
31013   # Broken: success on invalid input.
31014 continue
31015 else
31016   # Passes both tests.
31017 ac_preproc_ok=:
31018 break
31019 fi
31020 rm -f conftest.err conftest.i conftest.$ac_ext
31021 
31022 done
31023 # Because of `break', _AC_PREPROC_IFELSE's cleaning code was skipped.
31024 rm -f conftest.i conftest.err conftest.$ac_ext
31025 if $ac_preproc_ok; then :
31026   break
31027 fi
31028 
31029     done
31030     ac_cv_prog_CPP=$CPP
31031 
31032 fi
31033   CPP=$ac_cv_prog_CPP
31034 else
31035   ac_cv_prog_CPP=$CPP
31036 fi
31037 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $CPP" >&5
31038 $as_echo "$CPP" >&6; }
31039 ac_preproc_ok=false
31040 for ac_c_preproc_warn_flag in '' yes
31041 do
31042   # Use a header file that comes with gcc, so configuring glibc
31043   # with a fresh cross-compiler works.
31044   # Prefer <limits.h> to <assert.h> if __STDC__ is defined, since
31045   # <limits.h> exists even on freestanding compilers.
31046   # On the NeXT, cc -E runs the code through the compiler's parser,
31047   # not just through cpp. "Syntax error" is here to catch this case.
31048   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
31049 /* end confdefs.h.  */
31050 #ifdef __STDC__
31051 # include <limits.h>
31052 #else
31053 # include <assert.h>
31054 #endif
31055                      Syntax error
31056 _ACEOF
31057 if ac_fn_c_try_cpp "$LINENO"; then :
31058 
31059 else
31060   # Broken: fails on valid input.
31061 continue
31062 fi
31063 rm -f conftest.err conftest.i conftest.$ac_ext
31064 
31065   # OK, works on sane cases.  Now check whether nonexistent headers
31066   # can be detected and how.
31067   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
31068 /* end confdefs.h.  */
31069 #include <ac_nonexistent.h>
31070 _ACEOF
31071 if ac_fn_c_try_cpp "$LINENO"; then :
31072   # Broken: success on invalid input.
31073 continue
31074 else
31075   # Passes both tests.
31076 ac_preproc_ok=:
31077 break
31078 fi
31079 rm -f conftest.err conftest.i conftest.$ac_ext
31080 
31081 done
31082 # Because of `break', _AC_PREPROC_IFELSE's cleaning code was skipped.
31083 rm -f conftest.i conftest.err conftest.$ac_ext
31084 if $ac_preproc_ok; then :
31085 
31086 else
31087   { { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: error: in \`$ac_pwd':" >&5
31088 $as_echo "$as_me: error: in \`$ac_pwd':" >&2;}
31089 as_fn_error $? "C preprocessor \"$CPP\" fails sanity check
31090 See \`config.log' for more details" "$LINENO" 5; }
31091 fi
31092 
31093 ac_ext=cpp
31094 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
31095 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
31096 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
31097 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
31098 
31099 
31100   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
31101 
31102   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
31103   # space.
31104   complete="$CPP"
31105   path="${complete%% *}"
31106   tmp="$complete EOL"
31107   arguments="${tmp#* }"
31108 
31109   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
31110   # unix format.
31111   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
31112 
31113   # Now try to locate executable using which
31114   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
31115   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
31116   # to not find them
31117   if test "x$new_path" = x \
31118       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
31119       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
31120     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
31121   fi
31122   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
31123     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
31124     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
31125     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
31126     # argument.
31127     path="$complete"
31128     arguments="EOL"
31129     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
31130     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
31131     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
31132     # to not find them
31133     if test "x$new_path" = x \
31134         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
31135         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
31136       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
31137     fi
31138     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
31139       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
31140       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of CPP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
31141 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of CPP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
31142       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
31143       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
31144         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
31145 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
31146       fi
31147       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of CPP" "$LINENO" 5
31148     fi
31149   fi
31150 
31151   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
31152   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
31153   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
31154   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
31155   #
31156   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
31157   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
31158   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
31159   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
31160     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
31161     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
31162     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
31163       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
31164     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
31165       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
31166     else
31167       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of CPP, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
31168 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of CPP, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
31169       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
31170 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
31171       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of CPP" "$LINENO" 5
31172     fi
31173   else
31174     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
31175   fi
31176 
31177   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
31178   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
31179   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
31180 
31181   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
31182   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
31183   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
31184   # take no chances and rewrite it.
31185   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
31186   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
31187   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
31188     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
31189     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
31190     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
31191     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
31192       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
31193       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
31194       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
31195       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
31196       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
31197       new_path="$input_path"
31198     fi
31199   fi
31200 
31201   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
31202   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
31203     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
31204     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
31205       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
31206       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
31207       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
31208     fi
31209   fi
31210 
31211   # remove trailing .exe if any
31212   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
31213 
31214   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
31215 
31216   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
31217   # space.
31218   complete="$CPP"
31219   path="${complete%% *}"
31220   tmp="$complete EOL"
31221   arguments="${tmp#* }"
31222 
31223   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
31224   # unix format.
31225   new_path="$path"
31226 
31227   windows_path="$new_path"
31228   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
31229     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
31230     new_path="$unix_path"
31231   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
31232     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
31233     new_path="$unix_path"
31234   fi
31235 
31236 
31237   # Now try to locate executable using which
31238   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
31239 
31240   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
31241     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
31242     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
31243     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
31244     # argument.
31245     path="$complete"
31246     arguments="EOL"
31247     new_path="$path"
31248 
31249   windows_path="$new_path"
31250   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
31251     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
31252     new_path="$unix_path"
31253   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
31254     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
31255     new_path="$unix_path"
31256   fi
31257 
31258 
31259     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
31260     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
31261     # to not find them
31262     if test "x$new_path" = x \
31263         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
31264         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
31265       new_path="$path"
31266 
31267   windows_path="$new_path"
31268   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
31269     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
31270     new_path="$unix_path"
31271   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
31272     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
31273     new_path="$unix_path"
31274   fi
31275 
31276     fi
31277 
31278     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
31279       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
31280       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of CPP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
31281 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of CPP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
31282       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
31283       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
31284         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
31285 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
31286       fi
31287       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of CPP" "$LINENO" 5
31288     fi
31289   fi
31290 
31291   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
31292   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
31293     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
31294     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
31295     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
31296   else
31297     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
31298     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
31299 
31300   input_path="$new_path"
31301   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
31302   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
31303   # take no chances and rewrite it.
31304   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
31305   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
31306   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
31307     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
31308     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
31309   fi
31310 
31311     # Output is in $new_path
31312 
31313   windows_path="$new_path"
31314   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
31315     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
31316     new_path="$unix_path"
31317   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
31318     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
31319     new_path="$unix_path"
31320   fi
31321 
31322     # remove trailing .exe if any
31323     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
31324 
31325     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
31326     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
31327   fi
31328 
31329   else
31330     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
31331     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
31332     # space.
31333     complete="$CPP"
31334     path="${complete%% *}"
31335     tmp="$complete EOL"
31336     arguments="${tmp#* }"
31337 
31338     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
31339     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
31340     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
31341       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
31342       IFS_save="$IFS"
31343       IFS=:
31344       for p in $PATH; do
31345         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
31346           new_path="$p/$path"
31347           break
31348         fi
31349       done
31350       IFS="$IFS_save"
31351     else
31352       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
31353       new_path="$path"
31354     fi
31355 
31356     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
31357       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of CPP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
31358 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of CPP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
31359       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
31360       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
31361         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
31362 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
31363       fi
31364       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of CPP" "$LINENO" 5
31365     fi
31366   fi
31367 
31368   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
31369   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
31370     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
31371   else
31372     new_complete="$new_path"
31373   fi
31374 
31375   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
31376     CPP="$new_complete"
31377     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting CPP to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
31378 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting CPP to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
31379   fi
31380 
31381   ac_ext=cpp
31382 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
31383 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
31384 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
31385 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
31386 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking how to run the C++ preprocessor" >&5
31387 $as_echo_n "checking how to run the C++ preprocessor... " >&6; }
31388 if test -z "$CXXCPP"; then
31389   if ${ac_cv_prog_CXXCPP+:} false; then :
31390   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
31391 else
31392       # Double quotes because CXXCPP needs to be expanded
31393     for CXXCPP in "$CXX -E" "/lib/cpp"
31394     do
31395       ac_preproc_ok=false
31396 for ac_cxx_preproc_warn_flag in '' yes
31397 do
31398   # Use a header file that comes with gcc, so configuring glibc
31399   # with a fresh cross-compiler works.
31400   # Prefer <limits.h> to <assert.h> if __STDC__ is defined, since
31401   # <limits.h> exists even on freestanding compilers.
31402   # On the NeXT, cc -E runs the code through the compiler's parser,
31403   # not just through cpp. "Syntax error" is here to catch this case.
31404   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
31405 /* end confdefs.h.  */
31406 #ifdef __STDC__
31407 # include <limits.h>
31408 #else
31409 # include <assert.h>
31410 #endif
31411                      Syntax error
31412 _ACEOF
31413 if ac_fn_cxx_try_cpp "$LINENO"; then :
31414 
31415 else
31416   # Broken: fails on valid input.
31417 continue
31418 fi
31419 rm -f conftest.err conftest.i conftest.$ac_ext
31420 
31421   # OK, works on sane cases.  Now check whether nonexistent headers
31422   # can be detected and how.
31423   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
31424 /* end confdefs.h.  */
31425 #include <ac_nonexistent.h>
31426 _ACEOF
31427 if ac_fn_cxx_try_cpp "$LINENO"; then :
31428   # Broken: success on invalid input.
31429 continue
31430 else
31431   # Passes both tests.
31432 ac_preproc_ok=:
31433 break
31434 fi
31435 rm -f conftest.err conftest.i conftest.$ac_ext
31436 
31437 done
31438 # Because of `break', _AC_PREPROC_IFELSE's cleaning code was skipped.
31439 rm -f conftest.i conftest.err conftest.$ac_ext
31440 if $ac_preproc_ok; then :
31441   break
31442 fi
31443 
31444     done
31445     ac_cv_prog_CXXCPP=$CXXCPP
31446 
31447 fi
31448   CXXCPP=$ac_cv_prog_CXXCPP
31449 else
31450   ac_cv_prog_CXXCPP=$CXXCPP
31451 fi
31452 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $CXXCPP" >&5
31453 $as_echo "$CXXCPP" >&6; }
31454 ac_preproc_ok=false
31455 for ac_cxx_preproc_warn_flag in '' yes
31456 do
31457   # Use a header file that comes with gcc, so configuring glibc
31458   # with a fresh cross-compiler works.
31459   # Prefer <limits.h> to <assert.h> if __STDC__ is defined, since
31460   # <limits.h> exists even on freestanding compilers.
31461   # On the NeXT, cc -E runs the code through the compiler's parser,
31462   # not just through cpp. "Syntax error" is here to catch this case.
31463   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
31464 /* end confdefs.h.  */
31465 #ifdef __STDC__
31466 # include <limits.h>
31467 #else
31468 # include <assert.h>
31469 #endif
31470                      Syntax error
31471 _ACEOF
31472 if ac_fn_cxx_try_cpp "$LINENO"; then :
31473 
31474 else
31475   # Broken: fails on valid input.
31476 continue
31477 fi
31478 rm -f conftest.err conftest.i conftest.$ac_ext
31479 
31480   # OK, works on sane cases.  Now check whether nonexistent headers
31481   # can be detected and how.
31482   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
31483 /* end confdefs.h.  */
31484 #include <ac_nonexistent.h>
31485 _ACEOF
31486 if ac_fn_cxx_try_cpp "$LINENO"; then :
31487   # Broken: success on invalid input.
31488 continue
31489 else
31490   # Passes both tests.
31491 ac_preproc_ok=:
31492 break
31493 fi
31494 rm -f conftest.err conftest.i conftest.$ac_ext
31495 
31496 done
31497 # Because of `break', _AC_PREPROC_IFELSE's cleaning code was skipped.
31498 rm -f conftest.i conftest.err conftest.$ac_ext
31499 if $ac_preproc_ok; then :
31500 
31501 else
31502   { { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: error: in \`$ac_pwd':" >&5
31503 $as_echo "$as_me: error: in \`$ac_pwd':" >&2;}
31504 as_fn_error $? "C++ preprocessor \"$CXXCPP\" fails sanity check
31505 See \`config.log' for more details" "$LINENO" 5; }
31506 fi
31507 
31508 ac_ext=cpp
31509 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
31510 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
31511 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
31512 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
31513 
31514 
31515   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
31516 
31517   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
31518   # space.
31519   complete="$CXXCPP"
31520   path="${complete%% *}"
31521   tmp="$complete EOL"
31522   arguments="${tmp#* }"
31523 
31524   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
31525   # unix format.
31526   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
31527 
31528   # Now try to locate executable using which
31529   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
31530   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
31531   # to not find them
31532   if test "x$new_path" = x \
31533       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
31534       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
31535     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
31536   fi
31537   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
31538     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
31539     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
31540     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
31541     # argument.
31542     path="$complete"
31543     arguments="EOL"
31544     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
31545     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
31546     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
31547     # to not find them
31548     if test "x$new_path" = x \
31549         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
31550         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
31551       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
31552     fi
31553     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
31554       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
31555       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of CXXCPP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
31556 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of CXXCPP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
31557       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
31558       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
31559         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
31560 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
31561       fi
31562       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of CXXCPP" "$LINENO" 5
31563     fi
31564   fi
31565 
31566   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
31567   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
31568   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
31569   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
31570   #
31571   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
31572   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
31573   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
31574   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
31575     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
31576     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
31577     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
31578       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
31579     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
31580       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
31581     else
31582       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of CXXCPP, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
31583 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of CXXCPP, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
31584       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
31585 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
31586       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of CXXCPP" "$LINENO" 5
31587     fi
31588   else
31589     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
31590   fi
31591 
31592   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
31593   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
31594   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
31595 
31596   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
31597   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
31598   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
31599   # take no chances and rewrite it.
31600   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
31601   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
31602   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
31603     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
31604     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
31605     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
31606     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
31607       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
31608       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
31609       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
31610       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
31611       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
31612       new_path="$input_path"
31613     fi
31614   fi
31615 
31616   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
31617   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
31618     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
31619     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
31620       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
31621       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
31622       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
31623     fi
31624   fi
31625 
31626   # remove trailing .exe if any
31627   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
31628 
31629   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
31630 
31631   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
31632   # space.
31633   complete="$CXXCPP"
31634   path="${complete%% *}"
31635   tmp="$complete EOL"
31636   arguments="${tmp#* }"
31637 
31638   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
31639   # unix format.
31640   new_path="$path"
31641 
31642   windows_path="$new_path"
31643   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
31644     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
31645     new_path="$unix_path"
31646   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
31647     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
31648     new_path="$unix_path"
31649   fi
31650 
31651 
31652   # Now try to locate executable using which
31653   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
31654 
31655   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
31656     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
31657     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
31658     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
31659     # argument.
31660     path="$complete"
31661     arguments="EOL"
31662     new_path="$path"
31663 
31664   windows_path="$new_path"
31665   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
31666     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
31667     new_path="$unix_path"
31668   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
31669     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
31670     new_path="$unix_path"
31671   fi
31672 
31673 
31674     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
31675     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
31676     # to not find them
31677     if test "x$new_path" = x \
31678         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
31679         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
31680       new_path="$path"
31681
