31682   windows_path="$new_path"
31683   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
31684     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
31685     new_path="$unix_path"
31686   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
31687     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
31688     new_path="$unix_path"
31689   fi
31690 
31691     fi
31692 
31693     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
31694       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
31695       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of CXXCPP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
31696 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of CXXCPP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
31697       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
31698       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
31699         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
31700 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
31701       fi
31702       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of CXXCPP" "$LINENO" 5
31703     fi
31704   fi
31705 
31706   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
31707   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
31708     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
31709     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
31710     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
31711   else
31712     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
31713     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
31714 
31715   input_path="$new_path"
31716   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
31717   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
31718   # take no chances and rewrite it.
31719   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
31720   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
31721   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
31722     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
31723     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
31724   fi
31725 
31726     # Output is in $new_path
31727 
31728   windows_path="$new_path"
31729   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
31730     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
31731     new_path="$unix_path"
31732   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
31733     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
31734     new_path="$unix_path"
31735   fi
31736 
31737     # remove trailing .exe if any
31738     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
31739 
31740     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
31741     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
31742   fi
31743 
31744   else
31745     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
31746     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
31747     # space.
31748     complete="$CXXCPP"
31749     path="${complete%% *}"
31750     tmp="$complete EOL"
31751     arguments="${tmp#* }"
31752 
31753     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
31754     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
31755     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
31756       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
31757       IFS_save="$IFS"
31758       IFS=:
31759       for p in $PATH; do
31760         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
31761           new_path="$p/$path"
31762           break
31763         fi
31764       done
31765       IFS="$IFS_save"
31766     else
31767       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
31768       new_path="$path"
31769     fi
31770 
31771     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
31772       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of CXXCPP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
31773 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of CXXCPP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
31774       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
31775       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
31776         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
31777 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
31778       fi
31779       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of CXXCPP" "$LINENO" 5
31780     fi
31781   fi
31782 
31783   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
31784   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
31785     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
31786   else
31787     new_complete="$new_path"
31788   fi
31789 
31790   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
31791     CXXCPP="$new_complete"
31792     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting CXXCPP to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
31793 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting CXXCPP to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
31794   fi
31795 
31796 
31797   #
31798   # Setup the linker (LD)
31799   #
31800   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xmicrosoft; then
31801     # In the Microsoft toolchain we have a separate LD command "link".
31802     # Make sure we reject /usr/bin/link (as determined in CYGWIN_LINK), which is
31803     # a cygwin program for something completely different.
31804     # Extract the first word of "link", so it can be a program name with args.
31805 set dummy link; ac_word=$2
31806 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
31807 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
31808 if ${ac_cv_prog_LD+:} false; then :
31809   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
31810 else
31811   if test -n "$LD"; then
31812   ac_cv_prog_LD="$LD" # Let the user override the test.
31813 else
31814   ac_prog_rejected=no
31815 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
31816 for as_dir in $PATH
31817 do
31818   IFS=$as_save_IFS
31819   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
31820     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
31821   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
31822     if test "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" = "$CYGWIN_LINK"; then
31823        ac_prog_rejected=yes
31824        continue
31825      fi
31826     ac_cv_prog_LD="link"
31827     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
31828     break 2
31829   fi
31830 done
31831   done
31832 IFS=$as_save_IFS
31833 
31834 if test $ac_prog_rejected = yes; then
31835   # We found a bogon in the path, so make sure we never use it.
31836   set dummy $ac_cv_prog_LD
31837   shift
31838   if test $# != 0; then
31839     # We chose a different compiler from the bogus one.
31840     # However, it has the same basename, so the bogon will be chosen
31841     # first if we set LD to just the basename; use the full file name.
31842     shift
31843     ac_cv_prog_LD="$as_dir/$ac_word${1+' '}$@"
31844   fi
31845 fi
31846 fi
31847 fi
31848 LD=$ac_cv_prog_LD
31849 if test -n "$LD"; then
31850   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $LD" >&5
31851 $as_echo "$LD" >&6; }
31852 else
31853   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
31854 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
31855 fi
31856 
31857 
31858 
31859   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
31860 
31861   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
31862   # space.
31863   complete="$LD"
31864   path="${complete%% *}"
31865   tmp="$complete EOL"
31866   arguments="${tmp#* }"
31867 
31868   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
31869   # unix format.
31870   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
31871 
31872   # Now try to locate executable using which
31873   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
31874   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
31875   # to not find them
31876   if test "x$new_path" = x \
31877       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
31878       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
31879     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
31880   fi
31881   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
31882     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
31883     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
31884     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
31885     # argument.
31886     path="$complete"
31887     arguments="EOL"
31888     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
31889     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
31890     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
31891     # to not find them
31892     if test "x$new_path" = x \
31893         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
31894         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
31895       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
31896     fi
31897     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
31898       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
31899       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of LD, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
31900 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of LD, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
31901       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
31902       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
31903         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
31904 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
31905       fi
31906       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of LD" "$LINENO" 5
31907     fi
31908   fi
31909 
31910   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
31911   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
31912   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
31913   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
31914   #
31915   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
31916   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
31917   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
31918   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
31919     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
31920     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
31921     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
31922       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
31923     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
31924       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
31925     else
31926       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of LD, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
31927 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of LD, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
31928       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
31929 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
31930       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of LD" "$LINENO" 5
31931     fi
31932   else
31933     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
31934   fi
31935 
31936   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
31937   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
31938   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
31939 
31940   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
31941   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
31942   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
31943   # take no chances and rewrite it.
31944   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
31945   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
31946   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
31947     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
31948     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
31949     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
31950     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
31951       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
31952       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
31953       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
31954       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
31955       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
31956       new_path="$input_path"
31957     fi
31958   fi
31959 
31960   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
31961   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
31962     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
31963     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
31964       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
31965       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
31966       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
31967     fi
31968   fi
31969 
31970   # remove trailing .exe if any
31971   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
31972 
31973   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
31974 
31975   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
31976   # space.
31977   complete="$LD"
31978   path="${complete%% *}"
31979   tmp="$complete EOL"
31980   arguments="${tmp#* }"
31981 
31982   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
31983   # unix format.
31984   new_path="$path"
31985 
31986   windows_path="$new_path"
31987   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
31988     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
31989     new_path="$unix_path"
31990   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
31991     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
31992     new_path="$unix_path"
31993   fi
31994 
31995 
31996   # Now try to locate executable using which
31997   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
31998 
31999   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
32000     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
32001     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
32002     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
32003     # argument.
32004     path="$complete"
32005     arguments="EOL"
32006     new_path="$path"
32007 
32008   windows_path="$new_path"
32009   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
32010     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
32011     new_path="$unix_path"
32012   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
32013     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
32014     new_path="$unix_path"
32015   fi
32016 
32017 
32018     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
32019     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
32020     # to not find them
32021     if test "x$new_path" = x \
32022         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
32023         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
32024       new_path="$path"
32025 
32026   windows_path="$new_path"
32027   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
32028     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
32029     new_path="$unix_path"
32030   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
32031     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
32032     new_path="$unix_path"
32033   fi
32034 
32035     fi
32036 
32037     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
32038       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
32039       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of LD, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
32040 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of LD, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
32041       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
32042       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
32043         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
32044 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
32045       fi
32046       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of LD" "$LINENO" 5
32047     fi
32048   fi
32049 
32050   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
32051   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
32052     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
32053     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
32054     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
32055   else
32056     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
32057     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
32058 
32059   input_path="$new_path"
32060   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
32061   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
32062   # take no chances and rewrite it.
32063   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
32064   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
32065   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
32066     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
32067     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
32068   fi
32069 
32070     # Output is in $new_path
32071 
32072   windows_path="$new_path"
32073   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
32074     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
32075     new_path="$unix_path"
32076   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
32077     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
32078     new_path="$unix_path"
32079   fi
32080 
32081     # remove trailing .exe if any
32082     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
32083 
32084     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
32085     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
32086   fi
32087 
32088   else
32089     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
32090     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
32091     # space.
32092     complete="$LD"
32093     path="${complete%% *}"
32094     tmp="$complete EOL"
32095     arguments="${tmp#* }"
32096 
32097     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
32098     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
32099     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
32100       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
32101       IFS_save="$IFS"
32102       IFS=:
32103       for p in $PATH; do
32104         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
32105           new_path="$p/$path"
32106           break
32107         fi
32108       done
32109       IFS="$IFS_save"
32110     else
32111       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
32112       new_path="$path"
32113     fi
32114 
32115     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
32116       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of LD, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
32117 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of LD, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
32118       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
32119       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
32120         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
32121 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
32122       fi
32123       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of LD" "$LINENO" 5
32124     fi
32125   fi
32126 
32127   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
32128   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
32129     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
32130   else
32131     new_complete="$new_path"
32132   fi
32133 
32134   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
32135     LD="$new_complete"
32136     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting LD to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
32137 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting LD to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
32138   fi
32139 
32140     # Verify that we indeed succeeded with this trick.
32141     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if the found link.exe is actually the Visual Studio linker" >&5
32142 $as_echo_n "checking if the found link.exe is actually the Visual Studio linker... " >&6; }
32143     "$LD" --version > /dev/null
32144     if test $? -eq 0 ; then
32145       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
32146 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
32147       as_fn_error $? "This is the Cygwin link tool. Please check your PATH and rerun configure." "$LINENO" 5
32148     else
32149       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes" >&5
32150 $as_echo "yes" >&6; }
32151     fi
32152     LDCXX="$LD"
32153   else
32154     # All other toolchains use the compiler to link.
32155     LD="$CC"
32156     LDCXX="$CXX"
32157   fi
32158 
32159   # FIXME: it should be CXXLD, according to standard (cf CXXCPP)
32160 
32161 
32162   #
32163   # Setup the assembler (AS)
32164   #
32165   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xsolaris; then
32166     # FIXME: should this really be solaris, or solstudio?
32167 
32168 
32169   # Publish this variable in the help.
32170 
32171 
32172   if test "x$AS" = x; then
32173     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
32174     for ac_prog in as
32175 do
32176   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
32177 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
32178 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
32179 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
32180 if ${ac_cv_path_AS+:} false; then :
32181   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
32182 else
32183   case $AS in
32184   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
32185   ac_cv_path_AS="$AS" # Let the user override the test with a path.
32186   ;;
32187   *)
32188   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
32189 for as_dir in $PATH
32190 do
32191   IFS=$as_save_IFS
32192   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
32193     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
32194   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
32195     ac_cv_path_AS="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
32196     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
32197     break 2
32198   fi
32199 done
32200   done
32201 IFS=$as_save_IFS
32202 
32203   ;;
32204 esac
32205 fi
32206 AS=$ac_cv_path_AS
32207 if test -n "$AS"; then
32208   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $AS" >&5
32209 $as_echo "$AS" >&6; }
32210 else
32211   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
32212 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
32213 fi
32214 
32215 
32216   test -n "$AS" && break
32217 done
32218 
32219   else
32220     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
32221 
32222     # Try to remove the string !AS! from our list.
32223     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!AS!/}
32224     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
32225       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
32226       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
32227       if test "xAS" != xBASH; then
32228         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of AS from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
32229 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of AS from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
32230       fi
32231       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
32232       for ac_prog in as
32233 do
32234   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
32235 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
32236 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
32237 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
32238 if ${ac_cv_path_AS+:} false; then :
32239   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
32240 else
32241   case $AS in
32242   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
32243   ac_cv_path_AS="$AS" # Let the user override the test with a path.
32244   ;;
32245   *)
32246   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
32247 for as_dir in $PATH
32248 do
32249   IFS=$as_save_IFS
32250   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
32251     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
32252   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
32253     ac_cv_path_AS="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
32254     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
32255     break 2
32256   fi
32257 done
32258   done
32259 IFS=$as_save_IFS
32260 
32261   ;;
32262 esac
32263 fi
32264 AS=$ac_cv_path_AS
32265 if test -n "$AS"; then
32266   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $AS" >&5
32267 $as_echo "$AS" >&6; }
32268 else
32269   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
32270 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
32271 fi
32272 
32273 
32274   test -n "$AS" && break
32275 done
32276 
32277     else
32278       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
32279       # for the tool.
32280 
32281       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
32282       # for unknown variables in the end.
32283       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
32284 
32285       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
32286       tool_specified="$AS"
32287       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
32288       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
32289         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
32290         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool AS=$tool_basename" >&5
32291 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool AS=$tool_basename" >&6;}
32292         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
32293 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
32294 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
32295 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
32296 if ${ac_cv_path_AS+:} false; then :
32297   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
32298 else
32299   case $AS in
32300   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
32301   ac_cv_path_AS="$AS" # Let the user override the test with a path.
32302   ;;
32303   *)
32304   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
32305 for as_dir in $PATH
32306 do
32307   IFS=$as_save_IFS
32308   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
32309     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
32310   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
32311     ac_cv_path_AS="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
32312     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
32313     break 2
32314   fi
32315 done
32316   done
32317 IFS=$as_save_IFS
32318 
32319   ;;
32320 esac
32321 fi
32322 AS=$ac_cv_path_AS
32323 if test -n "$AS"; then
32324   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $AS" >&5
32325 $as_echo "$AS" >&6; }
32326 else
32327   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
32328 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
32329 fi
32330 
32331 
32332         if test "x$AS" = x; then
32333           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
32334         fi
32335       else
32336         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
32337         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool AS=$tool_specified" >&5
32338 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool AS=$tool_specified" >&6;}
32339         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for AS" >&5
32340 $as_echo_n "checking for AS... " >&6; }
32341         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
32342           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
32343 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
32344           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool AS=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
32345         fi
32346         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
32347 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
32348       fi
32349     fi
32350   fi
32351 
32352 
32353 
32354   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
32355 
32356   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
32357   # space.
32358   complete="$AS"
32359   path="${complete%% *}"
32360   tmp="$complete EOL"
32361   arguments="${tmp#* }"
32362 
32363   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
32364   # unix format.
32365   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
32366 
32367   # Now try to locate executable using which
32368   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
32369   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
32370   # to not find them
32371   if test "x$new_path" = x \
32372       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
32373       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
32374     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
32375   fi
32376   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
32377     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
32378     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
32379     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
32380     # argument.
32381     path="$complete"
32382     arguments="EOL"
32383     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
32384     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
32385     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
32386     # to not find them
32387     if test "x$new_path" = x \
32388         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
32389         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
32390       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
32391     fi
32392     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
32393       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
32394       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of AS, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
32395 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of AS, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
32396       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
32397       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
32398         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
32399 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
32400       fi
32401       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of AS" "$LINENO" 5
32402     fi
32403   fi
32404 
32405   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
32406   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
32407   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
32408   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
32409   #
32410   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
32411   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
32412   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
32413   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
32414     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
32415     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
32416     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
32417       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
32418     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
32419       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
32420     else
32421       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of AS, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
32422 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of AS, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
32423       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
32424 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
32425       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of AS" "$LINENO" 5
32426     fi
32427   else
32428     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
32429   fi
32430 
32431   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
32432   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
32433   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
32434 
32435   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
32436   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
32437   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
32438   # take no chances and rewrite it.
32439   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
32440   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
32441   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
32442     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
32443     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
32444     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
32445     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
32446       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
32447       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
32448       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
32449       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
32450       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
32451       new_path="$input_path"
32452     fi
32453   fi
32454 
32455   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
32456   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
32457     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
32458     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
32459       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
32460       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
32461       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
32462     fi
32463   fi
32464 
32465   # remove trailing .exe if any
32466   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
32467 
32468   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
32469 
32470   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
32471   # space.
32472   complete="$AS"
32473   path="${complete%% *}"
32474   tmp="$complete EOL"
32475   arguments="${tmp#* }"
32476 
32477   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
32478   # unix format.
32479   new_path="$path"
32480 
32481   windows_path="$new_path"
32482   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
32483     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
32484     new_path="$unix_path"
32485   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
32486     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
32487     new_path="$unix_path"
32488   fi
32489 
32490 
32491   # Now try to locate executable using which
32492   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
32493 
32494   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
32495     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
32496     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
32497     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
32498     # argument.
32499     path="$complete"
32500     arguments="EOL"
32501     new_path="$path"
32502 
32503   windows_path="$new_path"
32504   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
32505     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
32506     new_path="$unix_path"
32507   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
32508     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
32509     new_path="$unix_path"
32510   fi
32511 
32512 
32513     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
32514     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
32515     # to not find them
32516     if test "x$new_path" = x \
32517         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
32518         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
32519       new_path="$path"
32520 
32521   windows_path="$new_path"
32522   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
32523     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
32524     new_path="$unix_path"
32525   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
32526     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
32527     new_path="$unix_path"
32528   fi
32529 
32530     fi
32531 
32532     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
32533       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
32534       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of AS, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
32535 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of AS, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
32536       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
32537       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
32538         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
32539 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
32540       fi
32541       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of AS" "$LINENO" 5
32542     fi
32543   fi
32544 
32545   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
32546   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
32547     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
32548     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
32549     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
32550   else
32551     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
32552     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
32553 
32554   input_path="$new_path"
32555   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
32556   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
32557   # take no chances and rewrite it.
32558   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
32559   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
32560   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
32561     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
32562     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
32563   fi
32564 
32565     # Output is in $new_path
32566 
32567   windows_path="$new_path"
32568   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
32569     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
32570     new_path="$unix_path"
32571   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
32572     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
32573     new_path="$unix_path"
32574   fi
32575 
32576     # remove trailing .exe if any
32577     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
32578 
32579     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
32580     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
32581   fi
32582 
32583   else
32584     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
32585     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
32586     # space.
32587     complete="$AS"
32588     path="${complete%% *}"
32589     tmp="$complete EOL"
32590     arguments="${tmp#* }"
32591 
32592     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
32593     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
32594     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
32595       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
32596       IFS_save="$IFS"
32597       IFS=:
32598       for p in $PATH; do
32599         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
32600           new_path="$p/$path"
32601           break
32602         fi
32603       done
32604       IFS="$IFS_save"
32605     else
32606       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
32607       new_path="$path"
32608     fi
32609 
32610     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
32611       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of AS, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
32612 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of AS, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
32613       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
32614       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
32615         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
32616 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
32617       fi
32618       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of AS" "$LINENO" 5
32619     fi
32620   fi
32621 
32622   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
32623   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
32624     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
32625   else
32626     new_complete="$new_path"
32627   fi
32628 
32629   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
32630     AS="$new_complete"
32631     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting AS to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
32632 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting AS to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
32633   fi
32634 
32635   else
32636     # FIXME: is this correct for microsoft?
32637     AS="$CC -c"
32638   fi
32639 
32640 
32641   #
32642   # Setup the archiver (AR)
32643   #
32644   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xmicrosoft; then
32645     # The corresponding ar tool is lib.exe (used to create static libraries)
32646     # Extract the first word of "lib", so it can be a program name with args.
32647 set dummy lib; ac_word=$2
32648 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
32649 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
32650 if ${ac_cv_prog_AR+:} false; then :
32651   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
32652 else
32653   if test -n "$AR"; then
32654   ac_cv_prog_AR="$AR" # Let the user override the test.
32655 else
32656 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
32657 for as_dir in $PATH
32658 do
32659   IFS=$as_save_IFS
32660   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
32661     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
32662   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
32663     ac_cv_prog_AR="lib"
32664     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
32665     break 2
32666   fi
32667 done
32668   done
32669 IFS=$as_save_IFS
32670 
32671 fi
32672 fi
32673 AR=$ac_cv_prog_AR
32674 if test -n "$AR"; then
32675   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $AR" >&5
32676 $as_echo "$AR" >&6; }
32677 else
32678   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
32679 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
32680 fi
32681 
32682 
32683   else
32684 
32685 
32686   # Publish this variable in the help.
32687 
32688 
32689   if test "x$AR" = x; then
32690     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
32691     if test -n "$ac_tool_prefix"; then
32692   for ac_prog in ar
32693   do
32694     # Extract the first word of "$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
32695 set dummy $ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog; ac_word=$2
32696 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
32697 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
32698 if ${ac_cv_prog_AR+:} false; then :
32699   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
32700 else
32701   if test -n "$AR"; then
32702   ac_cv_prog_AR="$AR" # Let the user override the test.
32703 else
32704 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
32705 for as_dir in $PATH
32706 do
32707   IFS=$as_save_IFS
32708   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
32709     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
32710   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
32711     ac_cv_prog_AR="$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog"
32712     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
32713     break 2
32714   fi
32715 done
32716   done
32717 IFS=$as_save_IFS
32718 
32719 fi
32720 fi
32721 AR=$ac_cv_prog_AR
32722 if test -n "$AR"; then
32723   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $AR" >&5
32724 $as_echo "$AR" >&6; }
32725 else
32726   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
32727 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
32728 fi
32729 
32730 
32731     test -n "$AR" && break
32732   done
32733 fi
32734 if test -z "$AR"; then
32735   ac_ct_AR=$AR
32736   for ac_prog in ar
32737 do
32738   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
32739 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
32740 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
32741 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
32742 if ${ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_AR+:} false; then :
32743   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
32744 else
32745   if test -n "$ac_ct_AR"; then
32746   ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_AR="$ac_ct_AR" # Let the user override the test.
32747 else
32748 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
32749 for as_dir in $PATH
32750 do
32751   IFS=$as_save_IFS
32752   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
32753     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
32754   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
32755     ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_AR="$ac_prog"
32756     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
32757     break 2
32758   fi
32759 done
32760   done
32761 IFS=$as_save_IFS
32762 
32763 fi
32764 fi
32765 ac_ct_AR=$ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_AR
32766 if test -n "$ac_ct_AR"; then
32767   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_ct_AR" >&5
32768 $as_echo "$ac_ct_AR" >&6; }
32769 else
32770   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
32771 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
32772 fi
32773 
32774 
32775   test -n "$ac_ct_AR" && break
32776 done
32777 
32778   if test "x$ac_ct_AR" = x; then
32779     AR=""
32780   else
32781     case $cross_compiling:$ac_tool_warned in
32782 yes:)
32783 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&5
32784 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&2;}
32785 ac_tool_warned=yes ;;
32786 esac
32787     AR=$ac_ct_AR
32788   fi
32789 fi
32790 
32791   else
32792     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
32793 
32794     # Try to remove the string !AR! from our list.
32795     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!AR!/}
32796     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
32797       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
32798       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
32799       if test "xAR" != xBASH; then
32800         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of AR from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
32801 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of AR from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
32802       fi
32803       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
32804       if test -n "$ac_tool_prefix"; then
32805   for ac_prog in ar
32806   do
32807     # Extract the first word of "$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
32808 set dummy $ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog; ac_word=$2
32809 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
32810 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
32811 if ${ac_cv_prog_AR+:} false; then :
32812   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
32813 else
32814   if test -n "$AR"; then
32815   ac_cv_prog_AR="$AR" # Let the user override the test.
32816 else
32817 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
32818 for as_dir in $PATH
32819 do
32820   IFS=$as_save_IFS
32821   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
32822     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
32823   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
32824     ac_cv_prog_AR="$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog"
32825     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
32826     break 2
32827   fi
32828 done
32829   done
32830 IFS=$as_save_IFS
32831 
32832 fi
32833 fi
32834 AR=$ac_cv_prog_AR
32835 if test -n "$AR"; then
32836   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $AR" >&5
32837 $as_echo "$AR" >&6; }
32838 else
32839   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
32840 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
32841 fi
32842 
32843 
32844     test -n "$AR" && break
32845   done
32846 fi
32847 if test -z "$AR"; then
32848   ac_ct_AR=$AR
32849   for ac_prog in ar
32850 do
32851   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
32852 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
32853 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
32854 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
32855 if ${ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_AR+:} false; then :
32856   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
32857 else
32858   if test -n "$ac_ct_AR"; then
32859   ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_AR="$ac_ct_AR" # Let the user override the test.
32860 else
32861 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
32862 for as_dir in $PATH
32863 do
32864   IFS=$as_save_IFS
32865   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
32866     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
32867   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
32868     ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_AR="$ac_prog"
32869     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
32870     break 2
32871   fi
32872 done
32873   done
32874 IFS=$as_save_IFS
32875 
32876 fi
32877 fi
32878 ac_ct_AR=$ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_AR
32879 if test -n "$ac_ct_AR"; then
32880   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_ct_AR" >&5
32881 $as_echo "$ac_ct_AR" >&6; }
32882 else
32883   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
32884 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
32885 fi
32886 
32887 
32888   test -n "$ac_ct_AR" && break
32889 done
32890 
32891   if test "x$ac_ct_AR" = x; then
32892     AR=""
32893   else
32894     case $cross_compiling:$ac_tool_warned in
32895 yes:)
32896 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&5
32897 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&2;}
32898 ac_tool_warned=yes ;;
32899 esac
32900     AR=$ac_ct_AR
32901   fi
32902 fi
32903 
32904     else
32905       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
32906       # for the tool.
32907 
32908       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
32909       # for unknown variables in the end.
32910       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
32911 
32912       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
32913       tool_specified="$AR"
32914       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
32915       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
32916         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
32917         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool AR=$tool_basename" >&5
32918 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool AR=$tool_basename" >&6;}
32919         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
32920 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
32921 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
32922 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
32923 if ${ac_cv_path_AR+:} false; then :
32924   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
32925 else
32926   case $AR in
32927   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
32928   ac_cv_path_AR="$AR" # Let the user override the test with a path.
32929   ;;
32930   *)
32931   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
32932 for as_dir in $PATH
32933 do
32934   IFS=$as_save_IFS
32935   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
32936     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
32937   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
32938     ac_cv_path_AR="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
32939     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
32940     break 2
32941   fi
32942 done
32943   done
32944 IFS=$as_save_IFS
32945 
32946   ;;
32947 esac
32948 fi
32949 AR=$ac_cv_path_AR
32950 if test -n "$AR"; then
32951   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $AR" >&5
32952 $as_echo "$AR" >&6; }
32953 else
32954   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
32955 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
32956 fi
32957 
32958 
32959         if test "x$AR" = x; then
32960           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
32961         fi
32962       else
32963         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
32964         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool AR=$tool_specified" >&5
32965 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool AR=$tool_specified" >&6;}
32966         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for AR" >&5
32967 $as_echo_n "checking for AR... " >&6; }
32968         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
32969           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
32970 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
32971           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool AR=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
32972         fi
32973         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
32974 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
32975       fi
32976     fi
32977   fi
32978 
32979 
32980   fi
32981 
32982   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
32983 
32984   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
32985   # space.
32986   complete="$AR"
32987   path="${complete%% *}"
32988   tmp="$complete EOL"
32989   arguments="${tmp#* }"
32990 
32991   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
32992   # unix format.
32993   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
32994 
32995   # Now try to locate executable using which
32996   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
32997   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
32998   # to not find them
32999   if test "x$new_path" = x \
33000       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
33001       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
33002     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
33003   fi
33004   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
33005     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
33006     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
33007     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
33008     # argument.
33009     path="$complete"
33010     arguments="EOL"
33011     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
33012     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
33013     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
33014     # to not find them
33015     if test "x$new_path" = x \
33016         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
33017         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
33018       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
33019     fi
33020     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
33021       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
33022       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of AR, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
33023 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of AR, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
33024       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
33025       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
33026         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
33027 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
33028       fi
33029       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of AR" "$LINENO" 5
33030     fi
33031   fi
33032 
33033   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
33034   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
33035   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
33036   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
33037   #
33038   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
33039   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
33040   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
33041   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
33042     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
33043     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
33044     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
33045       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
33046     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
33047       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
33048     else
33049       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of AR, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
33050 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of AR, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
33051       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
33052 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
33053       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of AR" "$LINENO" 5
33054     fi
33055   else
33056     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
33057   fi
33058 
33059   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
33060   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
33061   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
33062 
33063   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
33064   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
33065   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
33066   # take no chances and rewrite it.
33067   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
33068   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
33069   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
33070     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
33071     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
33072     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
33073     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
33074       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
33075       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
33076       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
33077       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
33078       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
33079       new_path="$input_path"
33080     fi
33081   fi
33082 
33083   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
33084   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
33085     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
33086     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
33087       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
33088       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
33089       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
33090     fi
33091   fi
33092 
33093   # remove trailing .exe if any
33094   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
33095 
33096   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
33097 
33098   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
33099   # space.
33100   complete="$AR"
33101   path="${complete%% *}"
33102   tmp="$complete EOL"
33103   arguments="${tmp#* }"
33104 
33105   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
33106   # unix format.
33107   new_path="$path"
33108 
33109   windows_path="$new_path"
33110   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
33111     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
33112     new_path="$unix_path"
33113   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
33114     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
33115     new_path="$unix_path"
33116   fi
33117 
33118 
33119   # Now try to locate executable using which
33120   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
33121 
33122   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
33123     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
33124     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
33125     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
33126     # argument.
33127     path="$complete"
33128     arguments="EOL"
33129     new_path="$path"
33130 
33131   windows_path="$new_path"
33132   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
33133     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
33134     new_path="$unix_path"
33135   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
33136     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
33137     new_path="$unix_path"
33138   fi
33139 
33140 
33141     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
33142     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
33143     # to not find them
33144     if test "x$new_path" = x \
33145         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
33146         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
33147       new_path="$path"
33148 
33149   windows_path="$new_path"
33150   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
33151     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
33152     new_path="$unix_path"
33153   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
33154     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
33155     new_path="$unix_path"
33156   fi
33157 
33158     fi
33159 
33160     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
33161       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
33162       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of AR, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
33163 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of AR, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
33164       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
33165       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
33166         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
33167 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
33168       fi
33169       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of AR" "$LINENO" 5
33170     fi
33171   fi
33172 
33173   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
33174   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
33175     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
33176     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
33177     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
33178   else
33179     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
33180     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
33181 
33182   input_path="$new_path"
33183   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
33184   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
33185   # take no chances and rewrite it.
33186   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
33187   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
33188   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
33189     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
33190     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
33191   fi
33192 
33193     # Output is in $new_path
33194 
33195   windows_path="$new_path"
33196   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
33197     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
33198     new_path="$unix_path"
33199   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
33200     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
33201     new_path="$unix_path"
33202   fi
33203 
33204     # remove trailing .exe if any
33205     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
33206 
33207     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
33208     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
33209   fi
33210 
33211   else
33212     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
33213     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
33214     # space.
33215     complete="$AR"
33216     path="${complete%% *}"
33217     tmp="$complete EOL"
33218     arguments="${tmp#* }"
33219 
33220     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
33221     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
33222     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
33223       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
33224       IFS_save="$IFS"
33225       IFS=:
33226       for p in $PATH; do
33227         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
33228           new_path="$p/$path"
33229           break
33230         fi
33231       done
33232       IFS="$IFS_save"
33233     else
33234       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
33235       new_path="$path"
33236     fi
33237 
33238     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
33239       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of AR, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
33240 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of AR, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
33241       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
33242       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
33243         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
33244 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
33245       fi
33246       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of AR" "$LINENO" 5
33247     fi
33248   fi
33249 
33250   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
33251   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
33252     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
33253   else
33254     new_complete="$new_path"
33255   fi
33256 
33257   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
33258     AR="$new_complete"
33259     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting AR to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
33260 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting AR to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
33261   fi
33262 
33263 
33264 
33265   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = "xmacosx"; then
33266     ac_ext=m
33267 ac_cpp='$OBJCPP $CPPFLAGS'
33268 ac_compile='$OBJC -c $OBJCFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
33269 ac_link='$OBJC -o conftest$ac_exeext $OBJCFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
33270 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_objc_compiler_gnu
33271 if test -n "$ac_tool_prefix"; then
33272   for ac_prog in gcc objcc objc cc CC
33273   do
33274     # Extract the first word of "$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
33275 set dummy $ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog; ac_word=$2
33276 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
33277 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
33278 if ${ac_cv_prog_OBJC+:} false; then :
33279   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
33280 else
33281   if test -n "$OBJC"; then
33282   ac_cv_prog_OBJC="$OBJC" # Let the user override the test.
33283 else
33284 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
33285 for as_dir in $PATH
33286 do
33287   IFS=$as_save_IFS
33288   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
33289     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
33290   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
33291     ac_cv_prog_OBJC="$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog"
33292     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
33293     break 2
33294   fi
33295 done
33296   done
33297 IFS=$as_save_IFS
33298 
33299 fi
33300 fi
33301 OBJC=$ac_cv_prog_OBJC
33302 if test -n "$OBJC"; then
33303   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $OBJC" >&5
33304 $as_echo "$OBJC" >&6; }
33305 else
33306   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
33307 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
33308 fi
33309 
33310 
33311     test -n "$OBJC" && break
33312   done
33313 fi
33314 if test -z "$OBJC"; then
33315   ac_ct_OBJC=$OBJC
33316   for ac_prog in gcc objcc objc cc CC
33317 do
33318   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
33319 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
33320 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
33321 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
33322 if ${ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_OBJC+:} false; then :
33323   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
33324 else
33325   if test -n "$ac_ct_OBJC"; then
33326   ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_OBJC="$ac_ct_OBJC" # Let the user override the test.
33327 else
33328 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
33329 for as_dir in $PATH
33330 do
33331   IFS=$as_save_IFS
33332   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
33333     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
33334   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
33335     ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_OBJC="$ac_prog"
33336     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
33337     break 2
33338   fi
33339 done
33340   done
33341 IFS=$as_save_IFS
33342 
33343 fi
33344 fi
33345 ac_ct_OBJC=$ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_OBJC
33346 if test -n "$ac_ct_OBJC"; then
33347   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_ct_OBJC" >&5
33348 $as_echo "$ac_ct_OBJC" >&6; }
33349 else
33350   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
33351 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
33352 fi
33353 
33354 
33355   test -n "$ac_ct_OBJC" && break
33356 done
33357 
33358   if test "x$ac_ct_OBJC" = x; then
33359     OBJC="gcc"
33360   else
33361     case $cross_compiling:$ac_tool_warned in
33362 yes:)
33363 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&5
33364 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&2;}
33365 ac_tool_warned=yes ;;
33366 esac
33367     OBJC=$ac_ct_OBJC
33368   fi
33369 fi
33370 
33371 # Provide some information about the compiler.
33372 $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for Objective C compiler version" >&5
33373 set X $ac_compile
33374 ac_compiler=$2
33375 for ac_option in --version -v -V -qversion; do
33376   { { ac_try="$ac_compiler $ac_option >&5"
33377 case "(($ac_try" in
33378   *\"* | *\`* | *\\*) ac_try_echo=\$ac_try;;
33379   *) ac_try_echo=$ac_try;;
33380 esac
33381 eval ac_try_echo="\"\$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: $ac_try_echo\""
33382 $as_echo "$ac_try_echo"; } >&5
33383   (eval "$ac_compiler $ac_option >&5") 2>conftest.err
33384   ac_status=$?
33385   if test -s conftest.err; then
33386     sed '10a\
33387 ... rest of stderr output deleted ...
33388          10q' conftest.err >conftest.er1
33389     cat conftest.er1 >&5
33390   fi
33391   rm -f conftest.er1 conftest.err
33392   $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$? = $ac_status" >&5
33393   test $ac_status = 0; }
33394 done
33395 
33396 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking whether we are using the GNU Objective C compiler" >&5
33397 $as_echo_n "checking whether we are using the GNU Objective C compiler... " >&6; }
33398 if ${ac_cv_objc_compiler_gnu+:} false; then :
33399   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
33400 else
33401   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
33402 /* end confdefs.h.  */
33403 
33404 int
33405 main ()
33406 {
33407 #ifndef __GNUC__
33408        choke me
33409 #endif
33410 
33411   ;
33412   return 0;
33413 }
33414 _ACEOF
33415 if ac_fn_objc_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
33416   ac_compiler_gnu=yes
33417 else
33418   ac_compiler_gnu=no
33419 fi
33420 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
33421 ac_cv_objc_compiler_gnu=$ac_compiler_gnu
33422 
33423 fi
33424 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_objc_compiler_gnu" >&5
33425 $as_echo "$ac_cv_objc_compiler_gnu" >&6; }
33426 if test $ac_compiler_gnu = yes; then
33427   GOBJC=yes
33428 else
33429   GOBJC=
33430 fi
33431 ac_test_OBJCFLAGS=${OBJCFLAGS+set}
33432 ac_save_OBJCFLAGS=$OBJCFLAGS
33433 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking whether $OBJC accepts -g" >&5
33434 $as_echo_n "checking whether $OBJC accepts -g... " >&6; }
33435 if ${ac_cv_prog_objc_g+:} false; then :
33436   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
33437 else
33438   ac_save_objc_werror_flag=$ac_objc_werror_flag
33439    ac_objc_werror_flag=yes
33440    ac_cv_prog_objc_g=no
33441    OBJCFLAGS="-g"
33442    cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
33443 /* end confdefs.h.  */
33444 
33445 int
33446 main ()
33447 {
33448 
33449   ;
33450   return 0;
33451 }
33452 _ACEOF
33453 if ac_fn_objc_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
33454   ac_cv_prog_objc_g=yes
33455 else
33456   OBJCFLAGS=""
33457       cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
33458 /* end confdefs.h.  */
33459 
33460 int
33461 main ()
33462 {
33463 
33464   ;
33465   return 0;
33466 }
33467 _ACEOF
33468 if ac_fn_objc_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
33469 
33470 else
33471   ac_objc_werror_flag=$ac_save_objc_werror_flag
33472          OBJCFLAGS="-g"
33473          cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
33474 /* end confdefs.h.  */
33475 
33476 int
33477 main ()
33478 {
33479 
33480   ;
33481   return 0;
33482 }
33483 _ACEOF
33484 if ac_fn_objc_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
33485   ac_cv_prog_objc_g=yes
33486 fi
33487 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
33488 fi
33489 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
33490 fi
33491 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
33492    ac_objc_werror_flag=$ac_save_objc_werror_flag
33493 fi
33494 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_prog_objc_g" >&5
33495 $as_echo "$ac_cv_prog_objc_g" >&6; }
33496 if test "$ac_test_OBJCFLAGS" = set; then
33497   OBJCFLAGS=$ac_save_OBJCFLAGS
33498 elif test $ac_cv_prog_objc_g = yes; then
33499   if test "$GOBJC" = yes; then
33500     OBJCFLAGS="-g -O2"
33501   else
33502     OBJCFLAGS="-g"
33503   fi
33504 else
33505   if test "$GOBJC" = yes; then
33506     OBJCFLAGS="-O2"
33507   else
33508     OBJCFLAGS=
33509   fi
33510 fi
33511 ac_ext=cpp
33512 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
33513 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
33514 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
33515 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
33516 
33517 
33518   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
33519 
33520   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
33521   # space.
33522   complete="$OBJC"
33523   path="${complete%% *}"
33524   tmp="$complete EOL"
33525   arguments="${tmp#* }"
33526 
33527   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
33528   # unix format.
33529   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
33530 
33531   # Now try to locate executable using which
33532   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
33533   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
33534   # to not find them
33535   if test "x$new_path" = x \
33536       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
33537       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
33538     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
33539   fi
33540   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
33541     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
33542     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
33543     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
33544     # argument.
33545     path="$complete"
33546     arguments="EOL"
33547     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
33548     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
33549     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
33550     # to not find them
33551     if test "x$new_path" = x \
33552         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
33553         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
33554       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
33555     fi
33556     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
33557       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
33558       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of OBJC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
33559 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of OBJC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
33560       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
33561       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
33562         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
33563 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
33564       fi
33565       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of OBJC" "$LINENO" 5
33566     fi
33567   fi
33568 
33569   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
33570   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
33571   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
33572   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
33573   #
33574   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
33575   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
33576   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
33577   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
33578     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
33579     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
33580     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
33581       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
33582     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
33583       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
33584     else
33585       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of OBJC, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
33586 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of OBJC, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
33587       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
33588 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
33589       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of OBJC" "$LINENO" 5
33590     fi
33591   else
33592     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
33593   fi
33594 
33595   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
33596   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
33597   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
33598 
33599   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
