33600   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
33601   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
33602   # take no chances and rewrite it.
33603   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
33604   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
33605   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
33606     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
33607     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
33608     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
33609     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
33610       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
33611       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
33612       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
33613       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
33614       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
33615       new_path="$input_path"
33616     fi
33617   fi
33618 
33619   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
33620   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
33621     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
33622     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
33623       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
33624       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
33625       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
33626     fi
33627   fi
33628 
33629   # remove trailing .exe if any
33630   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
33631 
33632   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
33633 
33634   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
33635   # space.
33636   complete="$OBJC"
33637   path="${complete%% *}"
33638   tmp="$complete EOL"
33639   arguments="${tmp#* }"
33640 
33641   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
33642   # unix format.
33643   new_path="$path"
33644 
33645   windows_path="$new_path"
33646   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
33647     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
33648     new_path="$unix_path"
33649   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
33650     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
33651     new_path="$unix_path"
33652   fi
33653 
33654 
33655   # Now try to locate executable using which
33656   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
33657 
33658   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
33659     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
33660     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
33661     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
33662     # argument.
33663     path="$complete"
33664     arguments="EOL"
33665     new_path="$path"
33666 
33667   windows_path="$new_path"
33668   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
33669     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
33670     new_path="$unix_path"
33671   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
33672     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
33673     new_path="$unix_path"
33674   fi
33675 
33676 
33677     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
33678     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
33679     # to not find them
33680     if test "x$new_path" = x \
33681         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
33682         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
33683       new_path="$path"
33684 
33685   windows_path="$new_path"
33686   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
33687     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
33688     new_path="$unix_path"
33689   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
33690     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
33691     new_path="$unix_path"
33692   fi
33693 
33694     fi
33695 
33696     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
33697       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
33698       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of OBJC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
33699 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of OBJC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
33700       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
33701       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
33702         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
33703 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
33704       fi
33705       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of OBJC" "$LINENO" 5
33706     fi
33707   fi
33708 
33709   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
33710   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
33711     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
33712     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
33713     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
33714   else
33715     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
33716     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
33717 
33718   input_path="$new_path"
33719   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
33720   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
33721   # take no chances and rewrite it.
33722   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
33723   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
33724   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
33725     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
33726     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
33727   fi
33728 
33729     # Output is in $new_path
33730 
33731   windows_path="$new_path"
33732   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
33733     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
33734     new_path="$unix_path"
33735   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
33736     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
33737     new_path="$unix_path"
33738   fi
33739 
33740     # remove trailing .exe if any
33741     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
33742 
33743     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
33744     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
33745   fi
33746 
33747   else
33748     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
33749     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
33750     # space.
33751     complete="$OBJC"
33752     path="${complete%% *}"
33753     tmp="$complete EOL"
33754     arguments="${tmp#* }"
33755 
33756     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
33757     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
33758     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
33759       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
33760       IFS_save="$IFS"
33761       IFS=:
33762       for p in $PATH; do
33763         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
33764           new_path="$p/$path"
33765           break
33766         fi
33767       done
33768       IFS="$IFS_save"
33769     else
33770       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
33771       new_path="$path"
33772     fi
33773 
33774     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
33775       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of OBJC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
33776 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of OBJC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
33777       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
33778       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
33779         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
33780 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
33781       fi
33782       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of OBJC" "$LINENO" 5
33783     fi
33784   fi
33785 
33786   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
33787   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
33788     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
33789   else
33790     new_complete="$new_path"
33791   fi
33792 
33793   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
33794     OBJC="$new_complete"
33795     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting OBJC to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
33796 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting OBJC to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
33797   fi
33798 
33799 
33800 
33801   # Publish this variable in the help.
33802 
33803 
33804   if test "x$LIPO" = x; then
33805     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
33806     for ac_prog in lipo
33807 do
33808   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
33809 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
33810 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
33811 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
33812 if ${ac_cv_path_LIPO+:} false; then :
33813   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
33814 else
33815   case $LIPO in
33816   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
33817   ac_cv_path_LIPO="$LIPO" # Let the user override the test with a path.
33818   ;;
33819   *)
33820   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
33821 for as_dir in $PATH
33822 do
33823   IFS=$as_save_IFS
33824   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
33825     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
33826   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
33827     ac_cv_path_LIPO="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
33828     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
33829     break 2
33830   fi
33831 done
33832   done
33833 IFS=$as_save_IFS
33834 
33835   ;;
33836 esac
33837 fi
33838 LIPO=$ac_cv_path_LIPO
33839 if test -n "$LIPO"; then
33840   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $LIPO" >&5
33841 $as_echo "$LIPO" >&6; }
33842 else
33843   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
33844 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
33845 fi
33846 
33847 
33848   test -n "$LIPO" && break
33849 done
33850 
33851   else
33852     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
33853 
33854     # Try to remove the string !LIPO! from our list.
33855     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!LIPO!/}
33856     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
33857       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
33858       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
33859       if test "xLIPO" != xBASH; then
33860         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of LIPO from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
33861 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of LIPO from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
33862       fi
33863       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
33864       for ac_prog in lipo
33865 do
33866   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
33867 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
33868 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
33869 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
33870 if ${ac_cv_path_LIPO+:} false; then :
33871   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
33872 else
33873   case $LIPO in
33874   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
33875   ac_cv_path_LIPO="$LIPO" # Let the user override the test with a path.
33876   ;;
33877   *)
33878   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
33879 for as_dir in $PATH
33880 do
33881   IFS=$as_save_IFS
33882   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
33883     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
33884   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
33885     ac_cv_path_LIPO="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
33886     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
33887     break 2
33888   fi
33889 done
33890   done
33891 IFS=$as_save_IFS
33892 
33893   ;;
33894 esac
33895 fi
33896 LIPO=$ac_cv_path_LIPO
33897 if test -n "$LIPO"; then
33898   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $LIPO" >&5
33899 $as_echo "$LIPO" >&6; }
33900 else
33901   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
33902 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
33903 fi
33904 
33905 
33906   test -n "$LIPO" && break
33907 done
33908 
33909     else
33910       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
33911       # for the tool.
33912 
33913       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
33914       # for unknown variables in the end.
33915       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
33916 
33917       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
33918       tool_specified="$LIPO"
33919       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
33920       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
33921         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
33922         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool LIPO=$tool_basename" >&5
33923 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool LIPO=$tool_basename" >&6;}
33924         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
33925 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
33926 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
33927 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
33928 if ${ac_cv_path_LIPO+:} false; then :
33929   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
33930 else
33931   case $LIPO in
33932   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
33933   ac_cv_path_LIPO="$LIPO" # Let the user override the test with a path.
33934   ;;
33935   *)
33936   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
33937 for as_dir in $PATH
33938 do
33939   IFS=$as_save_IFS
33940   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
33941     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
33942   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
33943     ac_cv_path_LIPO="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
33944     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
33945     break 2
33946   fi
33947 done
33948   done
33949 IFS=$as_save_IFS
33950 
33951   ;;
33952 esac
33953 fi
33954 LIPO=$ac_cv_path_LIPO
33955 if test -n "$LIPO"; then
33956   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $LIPO" >&5
33957 $as_echo "$LIPO" >&6; }
33958 else
33959   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
33960 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
33961 fi
33962 
33963 
33964         if test "x$LIPO" = x; then
33965           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
33966         fi
33967       else
33968         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
33969         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool LIPO=$tool_specified" >&5
33970 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool LIPO=$tool_specified" >&6;}
33971         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for LIPO" >&5
33972 $as_echo_n "checking for LIPO... " >&6; }
33973         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
33974           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
33975 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
33976           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool LIPO=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
33977         fi
33978         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
33979 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
33980       fi
33981     fi
33982   fi
33983 
33984 
33985 
33986   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
33987 
33988   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
33989   # space.
33990   complete="$LIPO"
33991   path="${complete%% *}"
33992   tmp="$complete EOL"
33993   arguments="${tmp#* }"
33994 
33995   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
33996   # unix format.
33997   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
33998 
33999   # Now try to locate executable using which
34000   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
34001   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
34002   # to not find them
34003   if test "x$new_path" = x \
34004       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
34005       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
34006     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
34007   fi
34008   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
34009     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
34010     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
34011     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
34012     # argument.
34013     path="$complete"
34014     arguments="EOL"
34015     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
34016     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
34017     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
34018     # to not find them
34019     if test "x$new_path" = x \
34020         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
34021         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
34022       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
34023     fi
34024     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
34025       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
34026       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of LIPO, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
34027 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of LIPO, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
34028       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
34029       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
34030         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
34031 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
34032       fi
34033       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of LIPO" "$LINENO" 5
34034     fi
34035   fi
34036 
34037   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
34038   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
34039   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
34040   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
34041   #
34042   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
34043   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
34044   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
34045   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
34046     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
34047     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
34048     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
34049       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
34050     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
34051       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
34052     else
34053       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of LIPO, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
34054 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of LIPO, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
34055       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
34056 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
34057       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of LIPO" "$LINENO" 5
34058     fi
34059   else
34060     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
34061   fi
34062 
34063   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
34064   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
34065   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
34066 
34067   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
34068   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
34069   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
34070   # take no chances and rewrite it.
34071   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
34072   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
34073   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
34074     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
34075     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
34076     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
34077     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
34078       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
34079       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
34080       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
34081       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
34082       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
34083       new_path="$input_path"
34084     fi
34085   fi
34086 
34087   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
34088   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
34089     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
34090     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
34091       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
34092       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
34093       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
34094     fi
34095   fi
34096 
34097   # remove trailing .exe if any
34098   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
34099 
34100   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
34101 
34102   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
34103   # space.
34104   complete="$LIPO"
34105   path="${complete%% *}"
34106   tmp="$complete EOL"
34107   arguments="${tmp#* }"
34108 
34109   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
34110   # unix format.
34111   new_path="$path"
34112 
34113   windows_path="$new_path"
34114   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
34115     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
34116     new_path="$unix_path"
34117   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
34118     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
34119     new_path="$unix_path"
34120   fi
34121 
34122 
34123   # Now try to locate executable using which
34124   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
34125 
34126   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
34127     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
34128     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
34129     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
34130     # argument.
34131     path="$complete"
34132     arguments="EOL"
34133     new_path="$path"
34134 
34135   windows_path="$new_path"
34136   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
34137     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
34138     new_path="$unix_path"
34139   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
34140     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
34141     new_path="$unix_path"
34142   fi
34143 
34144 
34145     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
34146     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
34147     # to not find them
34148     if test "x$new_path" = x \
34149         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
34150         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
34151       new_path="$path"
34152 
34153   windows_path="$new_path"
34154   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
34155     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
34156     new_path="$unix_path"
34157   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
34158     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
34159     new_path="$unix_path"
34160   fi
34161 
34162     fi
34163 
34164     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
34165       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
34166       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of LIPO, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
34167 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of LIPO, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
34168       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
34169       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
34170         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
34171 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
34172       fi
34173       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of LIPO" "$LINENO" 5
34174     fi
34175   fi
34176 
34177   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
34178   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
34179     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
34180     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
34181     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
34182   else
34183     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
34184     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
34185 
34186   input_path="$new_path"
34187   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
34188   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
34189   # take no chances and rewrite it.
34190   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
34191   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
34192   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
34193     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
34194     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
34195   fi
34196 
34197     # Output is in $new_path
34198 
34199   windows_path="$new_path"
34200   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
34201     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
34202     new_path="$unix_path"
34203   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
34204     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
34205     new_path="$unix_path"
34206   fi
34207 
34208     # remove trailing .exe if any
34209     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
34210 
34211     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
34212     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
34213   fi
34214 
34215   else
34216     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
34217     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
34218     # space.
34219     complete="$LIPO"
34220     path="${complete%% *}"
34221     tmp="$complete EOL"
34222     arguments="${tmp#* }"
34223 
34224     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
34225     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
34226     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
34227       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
34228       IFS_save="$IFS"
34229       IFS=:
34230       for p in $PATH; do
34231         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
34232           new_path="$p/$path"
34233           break
34234         fi
34235       done
34236       IFS="$IFS_save"
34237     else
34238       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
34239       new_path="$path"
34240     fi
34241 
34242     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
34243       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of LIPO, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
34244 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of LIPO, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
34245       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
34246       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
34247         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
34248 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
34249       fi
34250       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of LIPO" "$LINENO" 5
34251     fi
34252   fi
34253 
34254   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
34255   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
34256     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
34257   else
34258     new_complete="$new_path"
34259   fi
34260 
34261   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
34262     LIPO="$new_complete"
34263     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting LIPO to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
34264 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting LIPO to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
34265   fi
34266 
34267   else
34268     OBJC=
34269   fi
34270 
34271   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xmicrosoft; then
34272     # Extract the first word of "mt", so it can be a program name with args.
34273 set dummy mt; ac_word=$2
34274 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
34275 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
34276 if ${ac_cv_prog_MT+:} false; then :
34277   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
34278 else
34279   if test -n "$MT"; then
34280   ac_cv_prog_MT="$MT" # Let the user override the test.
34281 else
34282   ac_prog_rejected=no
34283 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
34284 for as_dir in $PATH
34285 do
34286   IFS=$as_save_IFS
34287   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
34288     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
34289   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
34290     if test "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" = "/usr/bin/mt"; then
34291        ac_prog_rejected=yes
34292        continue
34293      fi
34294     ac_cv_prog_MT="mt"
34295     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
34296     break 2
34297   fi
34298 done
34299   done
34300 IFS=$as_save_IFS
34301 
34302 if test $ac_prog_rejected = yes; then
34303   # We found a bogon in the path, so make sure we never use it.
34304   set dummy $ac_cv_prog_MT
34305   shift
34306   if test $# != 0; then
34307     # We chose a different compiler from the bogus one.
34308     # However, it has the same basename, so the bogon will be chosen
34309     # first if we set MT to just the basename; use the full file name.
34310     shift
34311     ac_cv_prog_MT="$as_dir/$ac_word${1+' '}$@"
34312   fi
34313 fi
34314 fi
34315 fi
34316 MT=$ac_cv_prog_MT
34317 if test -n "$MT"; then
34318   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $MT" >&5
34319 $as_echo "$MT" >&6; }
34320 else
34321   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
34322 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
34323 fi
34324 
34325 
34326 
34327   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
34328 
34329   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
34330   # space.
34331   complete="$MT"
34332   path="${complete%% *}"
34333   tmp="$complete EOL"
34334   arguments="${tmp#* }"
34335 
34336   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
34337   # unix format.
34338   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
34339 
34340   # Now try to locate executable using which
34341   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
34342   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
34343   # to not find them
34344   if test "x$new_path" = x \
34345       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
34346       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
34347     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
34348   fi
34349   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
34350     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
34351     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
34352     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
34353     # argument.
34354     path="$complete"
34355     arguments="EOL"
34356     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
34357     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
34358     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
34359     # to not find them
34360     if test "x$new_path" = x \
34361         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
34362         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
34363       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
34364     fi
34365     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
34366       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
34367       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of MT, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
34368 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of MT, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
34369       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
34370       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
34371         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
34372 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
34373       fi
34374       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of MT" "$LINENO" 5
34375     fi
34376   fi
34377 
34378   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
34379   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
34380   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
34381   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
34382   #
34383   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
34384   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
34385   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
34386   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
34387     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
34388     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
34389     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
34390       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
34391     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
34392       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
34393     else
34394       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of MT, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
34395 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of MT, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
34396       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
34397 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
34398       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of MT" "$LINENO" 5
34399     fi
34400   else
34401     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
34402   fi
34403 
34404   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
34405   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
34406   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
34407 
34408   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
34409   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
34410   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
34411   # take no chances and rewrite it.
34412   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
34413   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
34414   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
34415     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
34416     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
34417     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
34418     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
34419       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
34420       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
34421       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
34422       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
34423       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
34424       new_path="$input_path"
34425     fi
34426   fi
34427 
34428   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
34429   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
34430     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
34431     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
34432       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
34433       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
34434       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
34435     fi
34436   fi
34437 
34438   # remove trailing .exe if any
34439   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
34440 
34441   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
34442 
34443   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
34444   # space.
34445   complete="$MT"
34446   path="${complete%% *}"
34447   tmp="$complete EOL"
34448   arguments="${tmp#* }"
34449 
34450   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
34451   # unix format.
34452   new_path="$path"
34453 
34454   windows_path="$new_path"
34455   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
34456     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
34457     new_path="$unix_path"
34458   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
34459     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
34460     new_path="$unix_path"
34461   fi
34462 
34463 
34464   # Now try to locate executable using which
34465   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
34466 
34467   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
34468     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
34469     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
34470     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
34471     # argument.
34472     path="$complete"
34473     arguments="EOL"
34474     new_path="$path"
34475 
34476   windows_path="$new_path"
34477   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
34478     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
34479     new_path="$unix_path"
34480   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
34481     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
34482     new_path="$unix_path"
34483   fi
34484 
34485 
34486     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
34487     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
34488     # to not find them
34489     if test "x$new_path" = x \
34490         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
34491         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
34492       new_path="$path"
34493 
34494   windows_path="$new_path"
34495   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
34496     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
34497     new_path="$unix_path"
34498   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
34499     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
34500     new_path="$unix_path"
34501   fi
34502 
34503     fi
34504 
34505     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
34506       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
34507       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of MT, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
34508 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of MT, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
34509       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
34510       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
34511         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
34512 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
34513       fi
34514       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of MT" "$LINENO" 5
34515     fi
34516   fi
34517 
34518   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
34519   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
34520     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
34521     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
34522     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
34523   else
34524     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
34525     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
34526 
34527   input_path="$new_path"
34528   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
34529   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
34530   # take no chances and rewrite it.
34531   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
34532   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
34533   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
34534     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
34535     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
34536   fi
34537 
34538     # Output is in $new_path
34539 
34540   windows_path="$new_path"
34541   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
34542     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
34543     new_path="$unix_path"
34544   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
34545     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
34546     new_path="$unix_path"
34547   fi
34548 
34549     # remove trailing .exe if any
34550     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
34551 
34552     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
34553     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
34554   fi
34555 
34556   else
34557     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
34558     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
34559     # space.
34560     complete="$MT"
34561     path="${complete%% *}"
34562     tmp="$complete EOL"
34563     arguments="${tmp#* }"
34564 
34565     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
34566     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
34567     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
34568       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
34569       IFS_save="$IFS"
34570       IFS=:
34571       for p in $PATH; do
34572         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
34573           new_path="$p/$path"
34574           break
34575         fi
34576       done
34577       IFS="$IFS_save"
34578     else
34579       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
34580       new_path="$path"
34581     fi
34582 
34583     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
34584       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of MT, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
34585 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of MT, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
34586       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
34587       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
34588         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
34589 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
34590       fi
34591       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of MT" "$LINENO" 5
34592     fi
34593   fi
34594 
34595   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
34596   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
34597     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
34598   else
34599     new_complete="$new_path"
34600   fi
34601 
34602   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
34603     MT="$new_complete"
34604     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting MT to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
34605 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting MT to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
34606   fi
34607 
34608     # Setup the resource compiler (RC)
34609     # Extract the first word of "rc", so it can be a program name with args.
34610 set dummy rc; ac_word=$2
34611 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
34612 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
34613 if ${ac_cv_prog_RC+:} false; then :
34614   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
34615 else
34616   if test -n "$RC"; then
34617   ac_cv_prog_RC="$RC" # Let the user override the test.
34618 else
34619   ac_prog_rejected=no
34620 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
34621 for as_dir in $PATH
34622 do
34623   IFS=$as_save_IFS
34624   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
34625     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
34626   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
34627     if test "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" = "/usr/bin/rc"; then
34628        ac_prog_rejected=yes
34629        continue
34630      fi
34631     ac_cv_prog_RC="rc"
34632     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
34633     break 2
34634   fi
34635 done
34636   done
34637 IFS=$as_save_IFS
34638 
34639 if test $ac_prog_rejected = yes; then
34640   # We found a bogon in the path, so make sure we never use it.
34641   set dummy $ac_cv_prog_RC
34642   shift
34643   if test $# != 0; then
34644     # We chose a different compiler from the bogus one.
34645     # However, it has the same basename, so the bogon will be chosen
34646     # first if we set RC to just the basename; use the full file name.
34647     shift
34648     ac_cv_prog_RC="$as_dir/$ac_word${1+' '}$@"
34649   fi
34650 fi
34651 fi
34652 fi
34653 RC=$ac_cv_prog_RC
34654 if test -n "$RC"; then
34655   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $RC" >&5
34656 $as_echo "$RC" >&6; }
34657 else
34658   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
34659 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
34660 fi
34661 
34662 
34663 
34664   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
34665 
34666   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
34667   # space.
34668   complete="$RC"
34669   path="${complete%% *}"
34670   tmp="$complete EOL"
34671   arguments="${tmp#* }"
34672 
34673   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
34674   # unix format.
34675   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
34676 
34677   # Now try to locate executable using which
34678   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
34679   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
34680   # to not find them
34681   if test "x$new_path" = x \
34682       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
34683       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
34684     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
34685   fi
34686   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
34687     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
34688     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
34689     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
34690     # argument.
34691     path="$complete"
34692     arguments="EOL"
34693     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
34694     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
34695     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
34696     # to not find them
34697     if test "x$new_path" = x \
34698         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
34699         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
34700       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
34701     fi
34702     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
34703       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
34704       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of RC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
34705 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of RC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
34706       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
34707       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
34708         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
34709 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
34710       fi
34711       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of RC" "$LINENO" 5
34712     fi
34713   fi
34714 
34715   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
34716   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
34717   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
34718   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
34719   #
34720   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
34721   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
34722   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
34723   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
34724     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
34725     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
34726     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
34727       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
34728     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
34729       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
34730     else
34731       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of RC, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
34732 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of RC, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
34733       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
34734 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
34735       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of RC" "$LINENO" 5
34736     fi
34737   else
34738     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
34739   fi
34740 
34741   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
34742   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
34743   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
34744 
34745   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
34746   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
34747   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
34748   # take no chances and rewrite it.
34749   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
34750   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
34751   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
34752     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
34753     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
34754     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
34755     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
34756       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
34757       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
34758       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
34759       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
34760       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
34761       new_path="$input_path"
34762     fi
34763   fi
34764 
34765   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
34766   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
34767     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
34768     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
34769       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
34770       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
34771       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
34772     fi
34773   fi
34774 
34775   # remove trailing .exe if any
34776   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
34777 
34778   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
34779 
34780   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
34781   # space.
34782   complete="$RC"
34783   path="${complete%% *}"
34784   tmp="$complete EOL"
34785   arguments="${tmp#* }"
34786 
34787   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
34788   # unix format.
34789   new_path="$path"
34790 
34791   windows_path="$new_path"
34792   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
34793     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
34794     new_path="$unix_path"
34795   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
34796     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
34797     new_path="$unix_path"
34798   fi
34799 
34800 
34801   # Now try to locate executable using which
34802   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
34803 
34804   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
34805     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
34806     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
34807     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
34808     # argument.
34809     path="$complete"
34810     arguments="EOL"
34811     new_path="$path"
34812 
34813   windows_path="$new_path"
34814   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
34815     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
34816     new_path="$unix_path"
34817   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
34818     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
34819     new_path="$unix_path"
34820   fi
34821 
34822 
34823     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
34824     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
34825     # to not find them
34826     if test "x$new_path" = x \
34827         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
34828         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
34829       new_path="$path"
34830 
34831   windows_path="$new_path"
34832   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
34833     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
34834     new_path="$unix_path"
34835   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
34836     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
34837     new_path="$unix_path"
34838   fi
34839 
34840     fi
34841 
34842     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
34843       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
34844       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of RC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
34845 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of RC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
34846       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
34847       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
34848         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
34849 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
34850       fi
34851       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of RC" "$LINENO" 5
34852     fi
34853   fi
34854 
34855   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
34856   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
34857     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
34858     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
34859     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
34860   else
34861     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
34862     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
34863 
34864   input_path="$new_path"
34865   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
34866   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
34867   # take no chances and rewrite it.
34868   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
34869   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
34870   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
34871     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
34872     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
34873   fi
34874 
34875     # Output is in $new_path
34876 
34877   windows_path="$new_path"
34878   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
34879     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
34880     new_path="$unix_path"
34881   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
34882     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
34883     new_path="$unix_path"
34884   fi
34885 
34886     # remove trailing .exe if any
34887     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
34888 
34889     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
34890     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
34891   fi
34892 
34893   else
34894     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
34895     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
34896     # space.
34897     complete="$RC"
34898     path="${complete%% *}"
34899     tmp="$complete EOL"
34900     arguments="${tmp#* }"
34901 
34902     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
34903     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
34904     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
34905       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
34906       IFS_save="$IFS"
34907       IFS=:
34908       for p in $PATH; do
34909         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
34910           new_path="$p/$path"
34911           break
34912         fi
34913       done
34914       IFS="$IFS_save"
34915     else
34916       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
34917       new_path="$path"
34918     fi
34919 
34920     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
34921       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of RC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
34922 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of RC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
34923       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
34924       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
34925         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
34926 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
34927       fi
34928       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of RC" "$LINENO" 5
34929     fi
34930   fi
34931 
34932   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
34933   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
34934     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
34935   else
34936     new_complete="$new_path"
34937   fi
34938 
34939   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
34940     RC="$new_complete"
34941     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting RC to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
34942 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting RC to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
34943   fi
34944 
34945     # Extract the first word of "dumpbin", so it can be a program name with args.
34946 set dummy dumpbin; ac_word=$2
34947 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
34948 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
34949 if ${ac_cv_prog_DUMPBIN+:} false; then :
34950   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
34951 else
34952   if test -n "$DUMPBIN"; then
34953   ac_cv_prog_DUMPBIN="$DUMPBIN" # Let the user override the test.
34954 else
34955 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
34956 for as_dir in $PATH
34957 do
34958   IFS=$as_save_IFS
34959   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
34960     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
34961   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
34962     ac_cv_prog_DUMPBIN="dumpbin"
34963     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
34964     break 2
34965   fi
34966 done
34967   done
34968 IFS=$as_save_IFS
34969 
34970 fi
34971 fi
34972 DUMPBIN=$ac_cv_prog_DUMPBIN
34973 if test -n "$DUMPBIN"; then
34974   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $DUMPBIN" >&5
34975 $as_echo "$DUMPBIN" >&6; }
34976 else
34977   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
34978 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
34979 fi
34980 
34981 
34982 
34983   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
34984 
34985   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
34986   # space.
34987   complete="$DUMPBIN"
34988   path="${complete%% *}"
34989   tmp="$complete EOL"
34990   arguments="${tmp#* }"
34991 
34992   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
34993   # unix format.
34994   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
34995 
34996   # Now try to locate executable using which
34997   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
34998   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
34999   # to not find them
35000   if test "x$new_path" = x \
35001       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
35002       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
35003     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
35004   fi
35005   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
35006     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
35007     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
35008     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
35009     # argument.
35010     path="$complete"
35011     arguments="EOL"
35012     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
35013     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
35014     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
35015     # to not find them
35016     if test "x$new_path" = x \
35017         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
35018         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
35019       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
35020     fi
35021     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
35022       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
35023       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of DUMPBIN, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
35024 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of DUMPBIN, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
35025       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
35026       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
35027         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
35028 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
35029       fi
35030       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of DUMPBIN" "$LINENO" 5
35031     fi
35032   fi
35033 
35034   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
35035   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
35036   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
35037   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
35038   #
35039   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
35040   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
35041   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
35042   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
35043     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
35044     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
35045     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
35046       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
35047     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
35048       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
35049     else
35050       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of DUMPBIN, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
35051 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of DUMPBIN, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
35052       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
35053 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
35054       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of DUMPBIN" "$LINENO" 5
35055     fi
35056   else
35057     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
35058   fi
35059 
35060   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
35061   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
35062   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
35063 
35064   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
35065   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
35066   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
35067   # take no chances and rewrite it.
35068   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
35069   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
35070   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
35071     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
35072     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
35073     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
35074     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
35075       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
35076       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
35077       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
35078       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
35079       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
35080       new_path="$input_path"
35081     fi
35082   fi
35083 
35084   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
35085   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
35086     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
35087     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
35088       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
35089       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
35090       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
35091     fi
35092   fi
35093 
35094   # remove trailing .exe if any
35095   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
35096 
35097   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
35098 
35099   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
35100   # space.
35101   complete="$DUMPBIN"
35102   path="${complete%% *}"
35103   tmp="$complete EOL"
35104   arguments="${tmp#* }"
35105 
35106   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
35107   # unix format.
35108   new_path="$path"
35109 
35110   windows_path="$new_path"
35111   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
35112     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
35113     new_path="$unix_path"
35114   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
35115     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
35116     new_path="$unix_path"
35117   fi
35118 
35119 
35120   # Now try to locate executable using which
35121   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
35122 
35123   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
35124     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
35125     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
35126     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
35127     # argument.
35128     path="$complete"
35129     arguments="EOL"
35130     new_path="$path"
35131 
35132   windows_path="$new_path"
35133   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
35134     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
35135     new_path="$unix_path"
35136   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
35137     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
35138     new_path="$unix_path"
35139   fi
35140 
35141 
35142     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
35143     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
35144     # to not find them
35145     if test "x$new_path" = x \
35146         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
35147         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
35148       new_path="$path"
35149 
35150   windows_path="$new_path"
35151   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
35152     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
35153     new_path="$unix_path"
35154   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
35155     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
35156     new_path="$unix_path"
35157   fi
35158 
35159     fi
35160 
35161     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
35162       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
35163       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of DUMPBIN, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
35164 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of DUMPBIN, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
35165       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
35166       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
35167         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
35168 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
35169       fi
35170       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of DUMPBIN" "$LINENO" 5
35171     fi
35172   fi
35173 
35174   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
35175   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
35176     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
35177     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
35178     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
35179   else
35180     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
35181     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
35182 
35183   input_path="$new_path"
35184   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
35185   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
35186   # take no chances and rewrite it.
35187   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
35188   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
35189   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
35190     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
35191     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
35192   fi
35193 
35194     # Output is in $new_path
35195 
35196   windows_path="$new_path"
35197   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
35198     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
35199     new_path="$unix_path"
35200   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
35201     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
35202     new_path="$unix_path"
35203   fi
35204 
35205     # remove trailing .exe if any
35206     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
35207 
35208     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
35209     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
35210   fi
35211 
35212   else
35213     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
35214     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
35215     # space.
35216     complete="$DUMPBIN"
35217     path="${complete%% *}"
35218     tmp="$complete EOL"
35219     arguments="${tmp#* }"
35220 
35221     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
35222     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
35223     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
35224       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
35225       IFS_save="$IFS"
35226       IFS=:
35227       for p in $PATH; do
35228         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
35229           new_path="$p/$path"
35230           break
35231         fi
35232       done
35233       IFS="$IFS_save"
35234     else
35235       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
35236       new_path="$path"
35237     fi
35238 
35239     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
35240       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of DUMPBIN, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
35241 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of DUMPBIN, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
35242       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
35243       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
35244         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
35245 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
35246       fi
35247       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of DUMPBIN" "$LINENO" 5
35248     fi
35249   fi
35250 
35251   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
35252   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
35253     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
35254   else
35255     new_complete="$new_path"
35256   fi
35257 
35258   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
35259     DUMPBIN="$new_complete"
35260     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting DUMPBIN to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
35261 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting DUMPBIN to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
35262   fi
35263 
35264     # We need to check for 'msbuild.exe' because at the place where we expect to
35265     # find 'msbuild.exe' there's also a directory called 'msbuild' and configure
35266     # won't find the 'msbuild.exe' executable in that case (and the
35267     # 'ac_executable_extensions' is unusable due to performance reasons).
35268     # Notice that we intentionally don't fix up the path to MSBUILD because we
35269     # will call it in a DOS shell during freetype detection on Windows (see
35270     # 'LIB_SETUP_FREETYPE' in "libraries.m4"
35271     # Extract the first word of "msbuild.exe", so it can be a program name with args.
35272 set dummy msbuild.exe; ac_word=$2
35273 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
35274 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
35275 if ${ac_cv_prog_MSBUILD+:} false; then :
35276   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
35277 else
35278   if test -n "$MSBUILD"; then
35279   ac_cv_prog_MSBUILD="$MSBUILD" # Let the user override the test.
35280 else
35281 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
35282 for as_dir in $PATH
35283 do
35284   IFS=$as_save_IFS
35285   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
35286     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
35287   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
35288     ac_cv_prog_MSBUILD="msbuild.exe"
35289     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
35290     break 2
35291   fi
35292 done
35293   done
35294 IFS=$as_save_IFS
35295 
35296 fi
35297 fi
35298 MSBUILD=$ac_cv_prog_MSBUILD
35299 if test -n "$MSBUILD"; then
35300   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $MSBUILD" >&5
35301 $as_echo "$MSBUILD" >&6; }
35302 else
35303   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
35304 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
35305 fi
35306 
35307 
35308   fi
35309 
35310   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xsolaris; then
35311 
35312 
35313   # Publish this variable in the help.
35314 
35315 
35316   if test "x$STRIP" = x; then
35317     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
35318     for ac_prog in strip
35319 do
35320   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
35321 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
35322 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
35323 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
35324 if ${ac_cv_path_STRIP+:} false; then :
35325   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
35326 else
35327   case $STRIP in
35328   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
35329   ac_cv_path_STRIP="$STRIP" # Let the user override the test with a path.
35330   ;;
35331   *)
35332   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
35333 for as_dir in $PATH
35334 do
35335   IFS=$as_save_IFS
35336   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
35337     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
35338   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
35339     ac_cv_path_STRIP="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
35340     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
35341     break 2
35342   fi
35343 done
35344   done
35345 IFS=$as_save_IFS
35346 
35347   ;;
35348 esac
35349 fi
35350 STRIP=$ac_cv_path_STRIP
35351 if test -n "$STRIP"; then
35352   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $STRIP" >&5
35353 $as_echo "$STRIP" >&6; }
35354 else
35355   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
35356 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
35357 fi
35358 
35359 
35360   test -n "$STRIP" && break
35361 done
35362 
35363   else
35364     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
35365 
35366     # Try to remove the string !STRIP! from our list.
35367     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!STRIP!/}
35368     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
35369       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
35370       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
35371       if test "xSTRIP" != xBASH; then
35372         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of STRIP from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
35373 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of STRIP from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
35374       fi
35375       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
35376       for ac_prog in strip
35377 do
35378   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
35379 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
35380 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
35381 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
35382 if ${ac_cv_path_STRIP+:} false; then :
35383   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
35384 else
35385   case $STRIP in
35386   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
35387   ac_cv_path_STRIP="$STRIP" # Let the user override the test with a path.
35388   ;;
35389   *)
35390   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
35391 for as_dir in $PATH
35392 do
35393   IFS=$as_save_IFS
35394   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
35395     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
35396   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
35397     ac_cv_path_STRIP="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
