37240   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
37241 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
37242 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
37243 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
37244 if ${ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_STRIP+:} false; then :
37245   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
37246 else
37247   if test -n "$ac_ct_STRIP"; then
37248   ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_STRIP="$ac_ct_STRIP" # Let the user override the test.
37249 else
37250 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
37251 for as_dir in $PATH
37252 do
37253   IFS=$as_save_IFS
37254   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
37255     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
37256   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
37257     ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_STRIP="$ac_prog"
37258     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
37259     break 2
37260   fi
37261 done
37262   done
37263 IFS=$as_save_IFS
37264 
37265 fi
37266 fi
37267 ac_ct_STRIP=$ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_STRIP
37268 if test -n "$ac_ct_STRIP"; then
37269   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_ct_STRIP" >&5
37270 $as_echo "$ac_ct_STRIP" >&6; }
37271 else
37272   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
37273 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
37274 fi
37275 
37276 
37277   test -n "$ac_ct_STRIP" && break
37278 done
37279 
37280   if test "x$ac_ct_STRIP" = x; then
37281     STRIP=""
37282   else
37283     case $cross_compiling:$ac_tool_warned in
37284 yes:)
37285 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&5
37286 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&2;}
37287 ac_tool_warned=yes ;;
37288 esac
37289     STRIP=$ac_ct_STRIP
37290   fi
37291 fi
37292 
37293   else
37294     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
37295 
37296     # Try to remove the string !STRIP! from our list.
37297     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!STRIP!/}
37298     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
37299       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
37300       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
37301       if test "xSTRIP" != xBASH; then
37302         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of STRIP from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
37303 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of STRIP from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
37304       fi
37305       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
37306       if test -n "$ac_tool_prefix"; then
37307   for ac_prog in strip
37308   do
37309     # Extract the first word of "$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
37310 set dummy $ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog; ac_word=$2
37311 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
37312 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
37313 if ${ac_cv_prog_STRIP+:} false; then :
37314   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
37315 else
37316   if test -n "$STRIP"; then
37317   ac_cv_prog_STRIP="$STRIP" # Let the user override the test.
37318 else
37319 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
37320 for as_dir in $PATH
37321 do
37322   IFS=$as_save_IFS
37323   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
37324     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
37325   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
37326     ac_cv_prog_STRIP="$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog"
37327     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
37328     break 2
37329   fi
37330 done
37331   done
37332 IFS=$as_save_IFS
37333 
37334 fi
37335 fi
37336 STRIP=$ac_cv_prog_STRIP
37337 if test -n "$STRIP"; then
37338   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $STRIP" >&5
37339 $as_echo "$STRIP" >&6; }
37340 else
37341   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
37342 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
37343 fi
37344 
37345 
37346     test -n "$STRIP" && break
37347   done
37348 fi
37349 if test -z "$STRIP"; then
37350   ac_ct_STRIP=$STRIP
37351   for ac_prog in strip
37352 do
37353   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
37354 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
37355 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
37356 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
37357 if ${ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_STRIP+:} false; then :
37358   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
37359 else
37360   if test -n "$ac_ct_STRIP"; then
37361   ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_STRIP="$ac_ct_STRIP" # Let the user override the test.
37362 else
37363 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
37364 for as_dir in $PATH
37365 do
37366   IFS=$as_save_IFS
37367   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
37368     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
37369   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
37370     ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_STRIP="$ac_prog"
37371     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
37372     break 2
37373   fi
37374 done
37375   done
37376 IFS=$as_save_IFS
37377 
37378 fi
37379 fi
37380 ac_ct_STRIP=$ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_STRIP
37381 if test -n "$ac_ct_STRIP"; then
37382   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_ct_STRIP" >&5
37383 $as_echo "$ac_ct_STRIP" >&6; }
37384 else
37385   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
37386 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
37387 fi
37388 
37389 
37390   test -n "$ac_ct_STRIP" && break
37391 done
37392 
37393   if test "x$ac_ct_STRIP" = x; then
37394     STRIP=""
37395   else
37396     case $cross_compiling:$ac_tool_warned in
37397 yes:)
37398 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&5
37399 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&2;}
37400 ac_tool_warned=yes ;;
37401 esac
37402     STRIP=$ac_ct_STRIP
37403   fi
37404 fi
37405 
37406     else
37407       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
37408       # for the tool.
37409 
37410       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
37411       # for unknown variables in the end.
37412       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
37413 
37414       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
37415       tool_specified="$STRIP"
37416       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
37417       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
37418         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
37419         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool STRIP=$tool_basename" >&5
37420 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool STRIP=$tool_basename" >&6;}
37421         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
37422 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
37423 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
37424 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
37425 if ${ac_cv_path_STRIP+:} false; then :
37426   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
37427 else
37428   case $STRIP in
37429   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
37430   ac_cv_path_STRIP="$STRIP" # Let the user override the test with a path.
37431   ;;
37432   *)
37433   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
37434 for as_dir in $PATH
37435 do
37436   IFS=$as_save_IFS
37437   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
37438     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
37439   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
37440     ac_cv_path_STRIP="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
37441     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
37442     break 2
37443   fi
37444 done
37445   done
37446 IFS=$as_save_IFS
37447 
37448   ;;
37449 esac
37450 fi
37451 STRIP=$ac_cv_path_STRIP
37452 if test -n "$STRIP"; then
37453   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $STRIP" >&5
37454 $as_echo "$STRIP" >&6; }
37455 else
37456   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
37457 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
37458 fi
37459 
37460 
37461         if test "x$STRIP" = x; then
37462           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
37463         fi
37464       else
37465         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
37466         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool STRIP=$tool_specified" >&5
37467 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool STRIP=$tool_specified" >&6;}
37468         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for STRIP" >&5
37469 $as_echo_n "checking for STRIP... " >&6; }
37470         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
37471           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
37472 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
37473           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool STRIP=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
37474         fi
37475         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
37476 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
37477       fi
37478     fi
37479   fi
37480 
37481 
37482 
37483   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
37484 
37485   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
37486   # space.
37487   complete="$STRIP"
37488   path="${complete%% *}"
37489   tmp="$complete EOL"
37490   arguments="${tmp#* }"
37491 
37492   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
37493   # unix format.
37494   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
37495 
37496   # Now try to locate executable using which
37497   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
37498   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
37499   # to not find them
37500   if test "x$new_path" = x \
37501       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
37502       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
37503     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
37504   fi
37505   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
37506     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
37507     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
37508     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
37509     # argument.
37510     path="$complete"
37511     arguments="EOL"
37512     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
37513     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
37514     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
37515     # to not find them
37516     if test "x$new_path" = x \
37517         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
37518         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
37519       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
37520     fi
37521     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
37522       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
37523       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of STRIP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
37524 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of STRIP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
37525       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
37526       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
37527         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
37528 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
37529       fi
37530       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of STRIP" "$LINENO" 5
37531     fi
37532   fi
37533 
37534   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
37535   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
37536   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
37537   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
37538   #
37539   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
37540   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
37541   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
37542   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
37543     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
37544     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
37545     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
37546       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
37547     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
37548       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
37549     else
37550       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of STRIP, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
37551 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of STRIP, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
37552       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
37553 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
37554       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of STRIP" "$LINENO" 5
37555     fi
37556   else
37557     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
37558   fi
37559 
37560   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
37561   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
37562   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
37563 
37564   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
37565   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
37566   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
37567   # take no chances and rewrite it.
37568   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
37569   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
37570   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
37571     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
37572     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
37573     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
37574     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
37575       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
37576       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
37577       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
37578       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
37579       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
37580       new_path="$input_path"
37581     fi
37582   fi
37583 
37584   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
37585   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
37586     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
37587     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
37588       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
37589       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
37590       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
37591     fi
37592   fi
37593 
37594   # remove trailing .exe if any
37595   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
37596 
37597   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
37598 
37599   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
37600   # space.
37601   complete="$STRIP"
37602   path="${complete%% *}"
37603   tmp="$complete EOL"
37604   arguments="${tmp#* }"
37605 
37606   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
37607   # unix format.
37608   new_path="$path"
37609 
37610   windows_path="$new_path"
37611   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
37612     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
37613     new_path="$unix_path"
37614   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
37615     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
37616     new_path="$unix_path"
37617   fi
37618 
37619 
37620   # Now try to locate executable using which
37621   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
37622 
37623   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
37624     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
37625     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
37626     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
37627     # argument.
37628     path="$complete"
37629     arguments="EOL"
37630     new_path="$path"
37631 
37632   windows_path="$new_path"
37633   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
37634     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
37635     new_path="$unix_path"
37636   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
37637     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
37638     new_path="$unix_path"
37639   fi
37640 
37641 
37642     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
37643     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
37644     # to not find them
37645     if test "x$new_path" = x \
37646         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
37647         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
37648       new_path="$path"
37649 
37650   windows_path="$new_path"
37651   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
37652     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
37653     new_path="$unix_path"
37654   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
37655     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
37656     new_path="$unix_path"
37657   fi
37658 
37659     fi
37660 
37661     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
37662       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
37663       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of STRIP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
37664 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of STRIP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
37665       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
37666       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
37667         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
37668 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
37669       fi
37670       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of STRIP" "$LINENO" 5
37671     fi
37672   fi
37673 
37674   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
37675   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
37676     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
37677     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
37678     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
37679   else
37680     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
37681     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
37682 
37683   input_path="$new_path"
37684   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
37685   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
37686   # take no chances and rewrite it.
37687   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
37688   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
37689   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
37690     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
37691     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
37692   fi
37693 
37694     # Output is in $new_path
37695 
37696   windows_path="$new_path"
37697   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
37698     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
37699     new_path="$unix_path"
37700   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
37701     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
37702     new_path="$unix_path"
37703   fi
37704 
37705     # remove trailing .exe if any
37706     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
37707 
37708     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
37709     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
37710   fi
37711 
37712   else
37713     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
37714     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
37715     # space.
37716     complete="$STRIP"
37717     path="${complete%% *}"
37718     tmp="$complete EOL"
37719     arguments="${tmp#* }"
37720 
37721     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
37722     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
37723     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
37724       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
37725       IFS_save="$IFS"
37726       IFS=:
37727       for p in $PATH; do
37728         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
37729           new_path="$p/$path"
37730           break
37731         fi
37732       done
37733       IFS="$IFS_save"
37734     else
37735       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
37736       new_path="$path"
37737     fi
37738 
37739     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
37740       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of STRIP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
37741 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of STRIP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
37742       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
37743       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
37744         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
37745 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
37746       fi
37747       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of STRIP" "$LINENO" 5
37748     fi
37749   fi
37750 
37751   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
37752   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
37753     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
37754   else
37755     new_complete="$new_path"
37756   fi
37757 
37758   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
37759     STRIP="$new_complete"
37760     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting STRIP to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
37761 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting STRIP to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
37762   fi
37763 
37764 
37765 
37766   # Publish this variable in the help.
37767 
37768 
37769   if test "x$NM" = x; then
37770     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
37771     if test -n "$ac_tool_prefix"; then
37772   for ac_prog in nm
37773   do
37774     # Extract the first word of "$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
37775 set dummy $ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog; ac_word=$2
37776 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
37777 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
37778 if ${ac_cv_prog_NM+:} false; then :
37779   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
37780 else
37781   if test -n "$NM"; then
37782   ac_cv_prog_NM="$NM" # Let the user override the test.
37783 else
37784 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
37785 for as_dir in $PATH
37786 do
37787   IFS=$as_save_IFS
37788   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
37789     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
37790   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
37791     ac_cv_prog_NM="$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog"
37792     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
37793     break 2
37794   fi
37795 done
37796   done
37797 IFS=$as_save_IFS
37798 
37799 fi
37800 fi
37801 NM=$ac_cv_prog_NM
37802 if test -n "$NM"; then
37803   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $NM" >&5
37804 $as_echo "$NM" >&6; }
37805 else
37806   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
37807 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
37808 fi
37809 
37810 
37811     test -n "$NM" && break
37812   done
37813 fi
37814 if test -z "$NM"; then
37815   ac_ct_NM=$NM
37816   for ac_prog in nm
37817 do
37818   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
37819 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
37820 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
37821 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
37822 if ${ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_NM+:} false; then :
37823   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
37824 else
37825   if test -n "$ac_ct_NM"; then
37826   ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_NM="$ac_ct_NM" # Let the user override the test.
37827 else
37828 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
37829 for as_dir in $PATH
37830 do
37831   IFS=$as_save_IFS
37832   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
37833     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
37834   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
37835     ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_NM="$ac_prog"
37836     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
37837     break 2
37838   fi
37839 done
37840   done
37841 IFS=$as_save_IFS
37842 
37843 fi
37844 fi
37845 ac_ct_NM=$ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_NM
37846 if test -n "$ac_ct_NM"; then
37847   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_ct_NM" >&5
37848 $as_echo "$ac_ct_NM" >&6; }
37849 else
37850   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
37851 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
37852 fi
37853 
37854 
37855   test -n "$ac_ct_NM" && break
37856 done
37857 
37858   if test "x$ac_ct_NM" = x; then
37859     NM=""
37860   else
37861     case $cross_compiling:$ac_tool_warned in
37862 yes:)
37863 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&5
37864 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&2;}
37865 ac_tool_warned=yes ;;
37866 esac
37867     NM=$ac_ct_NM
37868   fi
37869 fi
37870 
37871   else
37872     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
37873 
37874     # Try to remove the string !NM! from our list.
37875     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!NM!/}
37876     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
37877       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
37878       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
37879       if test "xNM" != xBASH; then
37880         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of NM from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
37881 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of NM from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
37882       fi
37883       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
37884       if test -n "$ac_tool_prefix"; then
37885   for ac_prog in nm
37886   do
37887     # Extract the first word of "$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
37888 set dummy $ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog; ac_word=$2
37889 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
37890 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
37891 if ${ac_cv_prog_NM+:} false; then :
37892   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
37893 else
37894   if test -n "$NM"; then
37895   ac_cv_prog_NM="$NM" # Let the user override the test.
37896 else
37897 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
37898 for as_dir in $PATH
37899 do
37900   IFS=$as_save_IFS
37901   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
37902     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
37903   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
37904     ac_cv_prog_NM="$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog"
37905     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
37906     break 2
37907   fi
37908 done
37909   done
37910 IFS=$as_save_IFS
37911 
37912 fi
37913 fi
37914 NM=$ac_cv_prog_NM
37915 if test -n "$NM"; then
37916   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $NM" >&5
37917 $as_echo "$NM" >&6; }
37918 else
37919   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
37920 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
37921 fi
37922 
37923 
37924     test -n "$NM" && break
37925   done
37926 fi
37927 if test -z "$NM"; then
37928   ac_ct_NM=$NM
37929   for ac_prog in nm
37930 do
37931   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
37932 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
37933 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
37934 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
37935 if ${ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_NM+:} false; then :
37936   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
37937 else
37938   if test -n "$ac_ct_NM"; then
37939   ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_NM="$ac_ct_NM" # Let the user override the test.
37940 else
37941 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
37942 for as_dir in $PATH
37943 do
37944   IFS=$as_save_IFS
37945   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
37946     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
37947   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
37948     ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_NM="$ac_prog"
37949     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
37950     break 2
37951   fi
37952 done
37953   done
37954 IFS=$as_save_IFS
37955 
37956 fi
37957 fi
37958 ac_ct_NM=$ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_NM
37959 if test -n "$ac_ct_NM"; then
37960   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_ct_NM" >&5
37961 $as_echo "$ac_ct_NM" >&6; }
37962 else
37963   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
37964 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
37965 fi
37966 
37967 
37968   test -n "$ac_ct_NM" && break
37969 done
37970 
37971   if test "x$ac_ct_NM" = x; then
37972     NM=""
37973   else
37974     case $cross_compiling:$ac_tool_warned in
37975 yes:)
37976 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&5
37977 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&2;}
37978 ac_tool_warned=yes ;;
37979 esac
37980     NM=$ac_ct_NM
37981   fi
37982 fi
37983 
37984     else
37985       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
37986       # for the tool.
37987 
37988       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
37989       # for unknown variables in the end.
37990       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
37991 
37992       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
37993       tool_specified="$NM"
37994       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
37995       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
37996         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
37997         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool NM=$tool_basename" >&5
37998 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool NM=$tool_basename" >&6;}
37999         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
38000 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
38001 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
38002 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
38003 if ${ac_cv_path_NM+:} false; then :
38004   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
38005 else
38006   case $NM in
38007   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
38008   ac_cv_path_NM="$NM" # Let the user override the test with a path.
38009   ;;
38010   *)
38011   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
38012 for as_dir in $PATH
38013 do
38014   IFS=$as_save_IFS
38015   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
38016     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
38017   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
38018     ac_cv_path_NM="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
38019     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
38020     break 2
38021   fi
38022 done
38023   done
38024 IFS=$as_save_IFS
38025 
38026   ;;
38027 esac
38028 fi
38029 NM=$ac_cv_path_NM
38030 if test -n "$NM"; then
38031   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $NM" >&5
38032 $as_echo "$NM" >&6; }
38033 else
38034   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
38035 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
38036 fi
38037 
38038 
38039         if test "x$NM" = x; then
38040           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
38041         fi
38042       else
38043         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
38044         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool NM=$tool_specified" >&5
38045 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool NM=$tool_specified" >&6;}
38046         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for NM" >&5
38047 $as_echo_n "checking for NM... " >&6; }
38048         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
38049           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
38050 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
38051           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool NM=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
38052         fi
38053         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
38054 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
38055       fi
38056     fi
38057   fi
38058 
38059 
38060 
38061   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
38062 
38063   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
38064   # space.
38065   complete="$NM"
38066   path="${complete%% *}"
38067   tmp="$complete EOL"
38068   arguments="${tmp#* }"
38069 
38070   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
38071   # unix format.
38072   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
38073 
38074   # Now try to locate executable using which
38075   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
38076   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
38077   # to not find them
38078   if test "x$new_path" = x \
38079       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
38080       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
38081     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
38082   fi
38083   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
38084     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
38085     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
38086     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
38087     # argument.
38088     path="$complete"
38089     arguments="EOL"
38090     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
38091     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
38092     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
38093     # to not find them
38094     if test "x$new_path" = x \
38095         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
38096         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
38097       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
38098     fi
38099     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
38100       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
38101       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of NM, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
38102 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of NM, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
38103       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
38104       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
38105         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
38106 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
38107       fi
38108       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of NM" "$LINENO" 5
38109     fi
38110   fi
38111 
38112   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
38113   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
38114   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
38115   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
38116   #
38117   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
38118   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
38119   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
38120   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
38121     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
38122     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
38123     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
38124       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
38125     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
38126       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
38127     else
38128       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of NM, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
38129 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of NM, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
38130       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
38131 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
38132       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of NM" "$LINENO" 5
38133     fi
38134   else
38135     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
38136   fi
38137 
38138   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
38139   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
38140   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
38141 
38142   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
38143   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
38144   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
38145   # take no chances and rewrite it.
38146   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
38147   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
38148   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
38149     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
38150     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
38151     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
38152     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
38153       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
38154       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
38155       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
38156       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
38157       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
38158       new_path="$input_path"
38159     fi
38160   fi
38161 
38162   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
38163   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
38164     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
38165     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
38166       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
38167       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
38168       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
38169     fi
38170   fi
38171 
38172   # remove trailing .exe if any
38173   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
38174 
38175   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
38176 
38177   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
38178   # space.
38179   complete="$NM"
38180   path="${complete%% *}"
38181   tmp="$complete EOL"
38182   arguments="${tmp#* }"
38183 
38184   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
38185   # unix format.
38186   new_path="$path"
38187 
38188   windows_path="$new_path"
38189   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
38190     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
38191     new_path="$unix_path"
38192   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
38193     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
38194     new_path="$unix_path"
38195   fi
38196 
38197 
38198   # Now try to locate executable using which
38199   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
38200 
38201   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
38202     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
38203     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
38204     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
38205     # argument.
38206     path="$complete"
38207     arguments="EOL"
38208     new_path="$path"
38209 
38210   windows_path="$new_path"
38211   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
38212     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
38213     new_path="$unix_path"
38214   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
38215     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
38216     new_path="$unix_path"
38217   fi
38218 
38219 
38220     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
38221     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
38222     # to not find them
38223     if test "x$new_path" = x \
38224         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
38225         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
38226       new_path="$path"
38227 
38228   windows_path="$new_path"
38229   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
38230     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
38231     new_path="$unix_path"
38232   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
38233     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
38234     new_path="$unix_path"
38235   fi
38236 
38237     fi
38238 
38239     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
38240       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
38241       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of NM, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
38242 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of NM, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
38243       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
38244       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
38245         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
38246 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
38247       fi
38248       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of NM" "$LINENO" 5
38249     fi
38250   fi
38251 
38252   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
38253   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
38254     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
38255     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
38256     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
38257   else
38258     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
38259     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
38260 
38261   input_path="$new_path"
38262   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
38263   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
38264   # take no chances and rewrite it.
38265   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
38266   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
38267   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
38268     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
38269     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
38270   fi
38271 
38272     # Output is in $new_path
38273 
38274   windows_path="$new_path"
38275   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
38276     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
38277     new_path="$unix_path"
38278   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
38279     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
38280     new_path="$unix_path"
38281   fi
38282 
38283     # remove trailing .exe if any
38284     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
38285 
38286     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
38287     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
38288   fi
38289 
38290   else
38291     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
38292     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
38293     # space.
38294     complete="$NM"
38295     path="${complete%% *}"
38296     tmp="$complete EOL"
38297     arguments="${tmp#* }"
38298 
38299     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
38300     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
38301     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
38302       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
38303       IFS_save="$IFS"
38304       IFS=:
38305       for p in $PATH; do
38306         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
38307           new_path="$p/$path"
38308           break
38309         fi
38310       done
38311       IFS="$IFS_save"
38312     else
38313       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
38314       new_path="$path"
38315     fi
38316 
38317     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
38318       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of NM, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
38319 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of NM, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
38320       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
38321       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
38322         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
38323 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
38324       fi
38325       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of NM" "$LINENO" 5
38326     fi
38327   fi
38328 
38329   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
38330   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
38331     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
38332   else
38333     new_complete="$new_path"
38334   fi
38335 
38336   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
38337     NM="$new_complete"
38338     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting NM to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
38339 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting NM to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
38340   fi
38341 
38342     GNM="$NM"
38343 
38344   fi
38345 
38346   # objcopy is used for moving debug symbols to separate files when
38347   # full debug symbols are enabled.
38348   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xsolaris || test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xlinux; then
38349 
38350 
38351   # Publish this variable in the help.
38352 
38353 
38354   if test "x$OBJCOPY" = x; then
38355     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
38356     if test -n "$ac_tool_prefix"; then
38357   for ac_prog in gobjcopy objcopy
38358   do
38359     # Extract the first word of "$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
38360 set dummy $ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog; ac_word=$2
38361 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
38362 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
38363 if ${ac_cv_prog_OBJCOPY+:} false; then :
38364   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
38365 else
38366   if test -n "$OBJCOPY"; then
38367   ac_cv_prog_OBJCOPY="$OBJCOPY" # Let the user override the test.
38368 else
38369 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
38370 for as_dir in $PATH
38371 do
38372   IFS=$as_save_IFS
38373   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
38374     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
38375   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
38376     ac_cv_prog_OBJCOPY="$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog"
38377     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
38378     break 2
38379   fi
38380 done
38381   done
38382 IFS=$as_save_IFS
38383 
38384 fi
38385 fi
38386 OBJCOPY=$ac_cv_prog_OBJCOPY
38387 if test -n "$OBJCOPY"; then
38388   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $OBJCOPY" >&5
38389 $as_echo "$OBJCOPY" >&6; }
38390 else
38391   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
38392 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
38393 fi
38394 
38395 
38396     test -n "$OBJCOPY" && break
38397   done
38398 fi
38399 if test -z "$OBJCOPY"; then
38400   ac_ct_OBJCOPY=$OBJCOPY
38401   for ac_prog in gobjcopy objcopy
38402 do
38403   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
38404 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
38405 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
38406 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
38407 if ${ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_OBJCOPY+:} false; then :
38408   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
38409 else
38410   if test -n "$ac_ct_OBJCOPY"; then
38411   ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_OBJCOPY="$ac_ct_OBJCOPY" # Let the user override the test.
38412 else
38413 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
38414 for as_dir in $PATH
38415 do
38416   IFS=$as_save_IFS
38417   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
38418     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
38419   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
38420     ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_OBJCOPY="$ac_prog"
38421     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
38422     break 2
38423   fi
38424 done
38425   done
38426 IFS=$as_save_IFS
38427 
38428 fi
38429 fi
38430 ac_ct_OBJCOPY=$ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_OBJCOPY
38431 if test -n "$ac_ct_OBJCOPY"; then
38432   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_ct_OBJCOPY" >&5
38433 $as_echo "$ac_ct_OBJCOPY" >&6; }
38434 else
38435   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
38436 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
38437 fi
38438 
38439 
38440   test -n "$ac_ct_OBJCOPY" && break
38441 done
38442 
38443   if test "x$ac_ct_OBJCOPY" = x; then
38444     OBJCOPY=""
38445   else
38446     case $cross_compiling:$ac_tool_warned in
38447 yes:)
38448 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&5
38449 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&2;}
38450 ac_tool_warned=yes ;;
38451 esac
38452     OBJCOPY=$ac_ct_OBJCOPY
38453   fi
38454 fi
38455 
38456   else
38457     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
38458 
38459     # Try to remove the string !OBJCOPY! from our list.
38460     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!OBJCOPY!/}
38461     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
38462       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
38463       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
38464       if test "xOBJCOPY" != xBASH; then
38465         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of OBJCOPY from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
38466 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of OBJCOPY from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
38467       fi
38468       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
38469       if test -n "$ac_tool_prefix"; then
38470   for ac_prog in gobjcopy objcopy
38471   do
38472     # Extract the first word of "$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
38473 set dummy $ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog; ac_word=$2
38474 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
38475 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
38476 if ${ac_cv_prog_OBJCOPY+:} false; then :
38477   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
38478 else
38479   if test -n "$OBJCOPY"; then
38480   ac_cv_prog_OBJCOPY="$OBJCOPY" # Let the user override the test.
38481 else
38482 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
38483 for as_dir in $PATH
38484 do
38485   IFS=$as_save_IFS
38486   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
38487     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
38488   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
38489     ac_cv_prog_OBJCOPY="$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog"
38490     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
38491     break 2
38492   fi
38493 done
38494   done
38495 IFS=$as_save_IFS
38496 
38497 fi
38498 fi
38499 OBJCOPY=$ac_cv_prog_OBJCOPY
38500 if test -n "$OBJCOPY"; then
38501   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $OBJCOPY" >&5
38502 $as_echo "$OBJCOPY" >&6; }
38503 else
38504   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
38505 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
38506 fi
38507 
38508 
38509     test -n "$OBJCOPY" && break
38510   done
38511 fi
38512 if test -z "$OBJCOPY"; then
38513   ac_ct_OBJCOPY=$OBJCOPY
38514   for ac_prog in gobjcopy objcopy
38515 do
38516   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
38517 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
38518 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
38519 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
38520 if ${ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_OBJCOPY+:} false; then :
38521   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
38522 else
38523   if test -n "$ac_ct_OBJCOPY"; then
38524   ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_OBJCOPY="$ac_ct_OBJCOPY" # Let the user override the test.
38525 else
38526 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
38527 for as_dir in $PATH
38528 do
38529   IFS=$as_save_IFS
38530   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
38531     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
38532   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
38533     ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_OBJCOPY="$ac_prog"
38534     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
38535     break 2
38536   fi
38537 done
38538   done
38539 IFS=$as_save_IFS
38540 
38541 fi
38542 fi
38543 ac_ct_OBJCOPY=$ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_OBJCOPY
38544 if test -n "$ac_ct_OBJCOPY"; then
38545   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_ct_OBJCOPY" >&5
38546 $as_echo "$ac_ct_OBJCOPY" >&6; }
38547 else
38548   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
38549 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
38550 fi
38551 
38552 
38553   test -n "$ac_ct_OBJCOPY" && break
38554 done
38555 
38556   if test "x$ac_ct_OBJCOPY" = x; then
38557     OBJCOPY=""
38558   else
38559     case $cross_compiling:$ac_tool_warned in
38560 yes:)
38561 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&5
38562 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&2;}
38563 ac_tool_warned=yes ;;
38564 esac
38565     OBJCOPY=$ac_ct_OBJCOPY
38566   fi
38567 fi
38568 
38569     else
38570       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
38571       # for the tool.
38572 
38573       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
38574       # for unknown variables in the end.
38575       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
38576 
38577       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
38578       tool_specified="$OBJCOPY"
38579       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
38580       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
38581         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
38582         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool OBJCOPY=$tool_basename" >&5
38583 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool OBJCOPY=$tool_basename" >&6;}
38584         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
38585 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
38586 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
38587 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
38588 if ${ac_cv_path_OBJCOPY+:} false; then :
38589   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
38590 else
38591   case $OBJCOPY in
38592   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
38593   ac_cv_path_OBJCOPY="$OBJCOPY" # Let the user override the test with a path.
38594   ;;
38595   *)
38596   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
38597 for as_dir in $PATH
38598 do
38599   IFS=$as_save_IFS
38600   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
38601     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
38602   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
38603     ac_cv_path_OBJCOPY="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
38604     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
38605     break 2
38606   fi
38607 done
38608   done
38609 IFS=$as_save_IFS
38610 
38611   ;;
38612 esac
38613 fi
38614 OBJCOPY=$ac_cv_path_OBJCOPY
38615 if test -n "$OBJCOPY"; then
38616   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $OBJCOPY" >&5
38617 $as_echo "$OBJCOPY" >&6; }
38618 else
38619   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
38620 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
38621 fi
38622 
38623 
38624         if test "x$OBJCOPY" = x; then
38625           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
38626         fi
38627       else
38628         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
38629         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool OBJCOPY=$tool_specified" >&5
38630 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool OBJCOPY=$tool_specified" >&6;}
38631         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for OBJCOPY" >&5
38632 $as_echo_n "checking for OBJCOPY... " >&6; }
38633         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
38634           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
38635 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
38636           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool OBJCOPY=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
38637         fi
38638         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
38639 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
38640       fi
38641     fi
38642   fi
38643 
38644 
38645     # Only call fixup if objcopy was found.
38646     if test -n "$OBJCOPY"; then
38647 
38648   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
38649 
38650   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
38651   # space.
38652   complete="$OBJCOPY"
38653   path="${complete%% *}"
38654   tmp="$complete EOL"
38655   arguments="${tmp#* }"
38656 
38657   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
38658   # unix format.
38659   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
38660 
38661   # Now try to locate executable using which
38662   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
38663   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
38664   # to not find them
38665   if test "x$new_path" = x \
38666       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
38667       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
38668     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
38669   fi
38670   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
38671     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
38672     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
38673     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
38674     # argument.
38675     path="$complete"
38676     arguments="EOL"
38677     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
38678     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
38679     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
38680     # to not find them
38681     if test "x$new_path" = x \
38682         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
38683         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
38684       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
38685     fi
38686     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
38687       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
38688       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of OBJCOPY, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
38689 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of OBJCOPY, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
38690       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
38691       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
38692         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
38693 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
38694       fi
38695       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of OBJCOPY" "$LINENO" 5
38696     fi
38697   fi
38698 
38699   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
38700   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
38701   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
38702   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
38703   #
38704   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
38705   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
38706   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
38707   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
38708     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
38709     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
38710     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
38711       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
38712     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
38713       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
38714     else
38715       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of OBJCOPY, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
38716 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of OBJCOPY, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
38717       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
38718 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
38719       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of OBJCOPY" "$LINENO" 5
38720     fi
38721   else
38722     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
38723   fi
38724 
38725   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
38726   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
38727   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
38728 
38729   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
38730   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
38731   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
38732   # take no chances and rewrite it.
38733   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
38734   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
38735   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
38736     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
38737     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
38738     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
38739     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
38740       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
38741       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
38742       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
38743       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
38744       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
38745       new_path="$input_path"
38746     fi
38747   fi
38748 
38749   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
38750   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
38751     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
38752     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
38753       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
38754       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
38755       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
38756     fi
38757   fi
38758 
38759   # remove trailing .exe if any
38760   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
38761 
38762   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
38763 
38764   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
38765   # space.
38766   complete="$OBJCOPY"
38767   path="${complete%% *}"
38768   tmp="$complete EOL"
38769   arguments="${tmp#* }"
38770 
38771   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
38772   # unix format.
38773   new_path="$path"
38774 
38775   windows_path="$new_path"
38776   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
38777     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
38778     new_path="$unix_path"
38779   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
38780     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
38781     new_path="$unix_path"
38782   fi
38783 
38784 
38785   # Now try to locate executable using which
38786   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
38787 
38788   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
38789     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
38790     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
38791     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
38792     # argument.
38793     path="$complete"
38794     arguments="EOL"
38795     new_path="$path"
38796 
38797   windows_path="$new_path"
38798   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
38799     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
38800     new_path="$unix_path"
38801   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
38802     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
38803     new_path="$unix_path"
38804   fi
38805 
38806 
38807     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
38808     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
38809     # to not find them
38810     if test "x$new_path" = x \
38811         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
38812         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
38813       new_path="$path"
38814 
38815   windows_path="$new_path"
38816   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
38817     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
38818     new_path="$unix_path"
38819   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
38820     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
38821     new_path="$unix_path"
38822   fi
38823 
38824     fi
38825 
38826     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
38827       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
38828       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of OBJCOPY, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
38829 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of OBJCOPY, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
38830       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
38831       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
38832         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
38833 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
38834       fi
38835       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of OBJCOPY" "$LINENO" 5
38836     fi
38837   fi
38838 
38839   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
38840   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
38841     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
38842     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
38843     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
38844   else
38845     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
38846     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
38847 
38848   input_path="$new_path"
38849   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
38850   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
38851   # take no chances and rewrite it.
38852   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
38853   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
38854   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
38855     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
38856     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
38857   fi
38858 
38859     # Output is in $new_path
38860 
38861   windows_path="$new_path"
38862   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
38863     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
38864     new_path="$unix_path"
38865   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
38866     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
38867     new_path="$unix_path"
38868   fi
38869 
38870     # remove trailing .exe if any
38871     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
38872 
38873     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
38874     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
38875   fi
38876 
38877   else
38878     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
38879     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
38880     # space.
38881     complete="$OBJCOPY"
38882     path="${complete%% *}"
38883     tmp="$complete EOL"
38884     arguments="${tmp#* }"
38885 
38886     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
38887     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
38888     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
38889       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
38890       IFS_save="$IFS"
38891       IFS=:
38892       for p in $PATH; do
38893         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
38894           new_path="$p/$path"
38895           break
38896         fi
38897       done
38898       IFS="$IFS_save"
38899     else
38900       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
38901       new_path="$path"
38902     fi
38903 
38904     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
38905       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of OBJCOPY, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
38906 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of OBJCOPY, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
38907       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
38908       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
38909         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
38910 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
38911       fi
38912       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of OBJCOPY" "$LINENO" 5
38913     fi
38914   fi
38915 
38916   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
38917   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
38918     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
38919   else
38920     new_complete="$new_path"
38921   fi
38922 
38923   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
38924     OBJCOPY="$new_complete"
38925     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting OBJCOPY to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
38926 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting OBJCOPY to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
38927   fi
38928 
38929     fi
38930   fi
38931 
38932 
38933 
38934   # Publish this variable in the help.
38935 
38936 
38937   if test "x$OBJDUMP" = x; then
38938     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
38939     if test -n "$ac_tool_prefix"; then
38940   for ac_prog in gobjdump objdump
38941   do
38942     # Extract the first word of "$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
38943 set dummy $ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog; ac_word=$2
38944 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
38945 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
38946 if ${ac_cv_prog_OBJDUMP+:} false; then :
38947   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
38948 else
38949   if test -n "$OBJDUMP"; then
38950   ac_cv_prog_OBJDUMP="$OBJDUMP" # Let the user override the test.
38951 else
38952 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
38953 for as_dir in $PATH
38954 do
38955   IFS=$as_save_IFS
38956   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
38957     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
38958   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
38959     ac_cv_prog_OBJDUMP="$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog"
38960     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
38961     break 2
38962   fi
38963 done
38964   done
38965 IFS=$as_save_IFS
38966 
38967 fi
38968 fi
38969 OBJDUMP=$ac_cv_prog_OBJDUMP
38970 if test -n "$OBJDUMP"; then
38971   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $OBJDUMP" >&5
38972 $as_echo "$OBJDUMP" >&6; }
38973 else
38974   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
38975 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
38976 fi
38977 
38978 
38979     test -n "$OBJDUMP" && break
38980   done
38981 fi
38982 if test -z "$OBJDUMP"; then
38983   ac_ct_OBJDUMP=$OBJDUMP
38984   for ac_prog in gobjdump objdump
38985 do
38986   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
38987 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
38988 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
38989 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
38990 if ${ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_OBJDUMP+:} false; then :
38991   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
38992 else
38993   if test -n "$ac_ct_OBJDUMP"; then
38994   ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_OBJDUMP="$ac_ct_OBJDUMP" # Let the user override the test.
38995 else
38996 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
38997 for as_dir in $PATH
38998 do
38999   IFS=$as_save_IFS
39000   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
39001     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
39002   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
39003     ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_OBJDUMP="$ac_prog"
39004     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
39005     break 2
39006   fi
39007 done
39008   done
39009 IFS=$as_save_IFS
39010 
39011 fi
39012 fi
39013 ac_ct_OBJDUMP=$ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_OBJDUMP
39014 if test -n "$ac_ct_OBJDUMP"; then
39015   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_ct_OBJDUMP" >&5
39016 $as_echo "$ac_ct_OBJDUMP" >&6; }
39017 else
39018   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
39019 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
39020 fi
39021 
39022 
39023   test -n "$ac_ct_OBJDUMP" && break
39024 done
39025 
39026   if test "x$ac_ct_OBJDUMP" = x; then
39027     OBJDUMP=""
39028   else
39029     case $cross_compiling:$ac_tool_warned in
39030 yes:)
39031 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&5
39032 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&2;}
39033 ac_tool_warned=yes ;;
39034 esac
39035     OBJDUMP=$ac_ct_OBJDUMP
39036   fi
39037 fi
39038 
39039   else
39040     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
39041 
39042     # Try to remove the string !OBJDUMP! from our list.
39043     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!OBJDUMP!/}
39044     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
39045       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
39046       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
39047       if test "xOBJDUMP" != xBASH; then
39048         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of OBJDUMP from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
39049 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of OBJDUMP from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
39050       fi
39051       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
39052       if test -n "$ac_tool_prefix"; then
39053   for ac_prog in gobjdump objdump
39054   do
39055     # Extract the first word of "$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
39056 set dummy $ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog; ac_word=$2
39057 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
39058 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
39059 if ${ac_cv_prog_OBJDUMP+:} false; then :
39060   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
39061 else
39062   if test -n "$OBJDUMP"; then
39063   ac_cv_prog_OBJDUMP="$OBJDUMP" # Let the user override the test.
39064 else
39065 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
39066 for as_dir in $PATH
39067 do
39068   IFS=$as_save_IFS
39069   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
39070     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
39071   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
39072     ac_cv_prog_OBJDUMP="$ac_tool_prefix$ac_prog"
39073     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
39074     break 2
39075   fi
39076 done
39077   done
39078 IFS=$as_save_IFS
39079 
39080 fi
39081 fi
39082 OBJDUMP=$ac_cv_prog_OBJDUMP
39083 if test -n "$OBJDUMP"; then
39084   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $OBJDUMP" >&5
39085 $as_echo "$OBJDUMP" >&6; }
39086 else
39087   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
39088 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
39089 fi
39090 
39091 
39092     test -n "$OBJDUMP" && break
39093   done
39094 fi
39095 if test -z "$OBJDUMP"; then
39096   ac_ct_OBJDUMP=$OBJDUMP
39097   for ac_prog in gobjdump objdump
39098 do
39099   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
39100 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
39101 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
39102 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
39103 if ${ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_OBJDUMP+:} false; then :
39104   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
39105 else
39106   if test -n "$ac_ct_OBJDUMP"; then
39107   ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_OBJDUMP="$ac_ct_OBJDUMP" # Let the user override the test.
39108 else
39109 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
39110 for as_dir in $PATH
39111 do
39112   IFS=$as_save_IFS
39113   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
39114     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
39115   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
39116     ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_OBJDUMP="$ac_prog"
39117     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
39118     break 2
39119   fi
39120 done
39121   done
39122 IFS=$as_save_IFS
39123 
39124 fi
39125 fi
39126 ac_ct_OBJDUMP=$ac_cv_prog_ac_ct_OBJDUMP
39127 if test -n "$ac_ct_OBJDUMP"; then
39128   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_ct_OBJDUMP" >&5
39129 $as_echo "$ac_ct_OBJDUMP" >&6; }
39130 else
39131   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
39132 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
39133 fi
39134 
39135 
39136   test -n "$ac_ct_OBJDUMP" && break
39137 done
39138 
39139   if test "x$ac_ct_OBJDUMP" = x; then
39140     OBJDUMP=""
39141   else
39142     case $cross_compiling:$ac_tool_warned in
39143 yes:)
39144 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&5
39145 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: using cross tools not prefixed with host triplet" >&2;}
39146 ac_tool_warned=yes ;;
39147 esac
39148     OBJDUMP=$ac_ct_OBJDUMP
39149   fi
39150 fi
39151 
39152     else
39153       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
39154       # for the tool.
39155 
39156       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
39157       # for unknown variables in the end.
39158       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
39159 
39160       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
39161       tool_specified="$OBJDUMP"
39162       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
39163       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
