39164         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
39165         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool OBJDUMP=$tool_basename" >&5
39166 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool OBJDUMP=$tool_basename" >&6;}
39167         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
39168 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
39169 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
39170 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
39171 if ${ac_cv_path_OBJDUMP+:} false; then :
39172   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
39173 else
39174   case $OBJDUMP in
39175   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
39176   ac_cv_path_OBJDUMP="$OBJDUMP" # Let the user override the test with a path.
39177   ;;
39178   *)
39179   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
39180 for as_dir in $PATH
39181 do
39182   IFS=$as_save_IFS
39183   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
39184     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
39185   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
39186     ac_cv_path_OBJDUMP="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
39187     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
39188     break 2
39189   fi
39190 done
39191   done
39192 IFS=$as_save_IFS
39193 
39194   ;;
39195 esac
39196 fi
39197 OBJDUMP=$ac_cv_path_OBJDUMP
39198 if test -n "$OBJDUMP"; then
39199   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $OBJDUMP" >&5
39200 $as_echo "$OBJDUMP" >&6; }
39201 else
39202   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
39203 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
39204 fi
39205 
39206 
39207         if test "x$OBJDUMP" = x; then
39208           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
39209         fi
39210       else
39211         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
39212         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool OBJDUMP=$tool_specified" >&5
39213 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool OBJDUMP=$tool_specified" >&6;}
39214         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for OBJDUMP" >&5
39215 $as_echo_n "checking for OBJDUMP... " >&6; }
39216         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
39217           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
39218 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
39219           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool OBJDUMP=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
39220         fi
39221         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
39222 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
39223       fi
39224     fi
39225   fi
39226 
39227 
39228   if test "x$OBJDUMP" != x; then
39229     # Only used for compare.sh; we can live without it. BASIC_FIXUP_EXECUTABLE
39230     # bails if argument is missing.
39231 
39232   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
39233 
39234   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
39235   # space.
39236   complete="$OBJDUMP"
39237   path="${complete%% *}"
39238   tmp="$complete EOL"
39239   arguments="${tmp#* }"
39240 
39241   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
39242   # unix format.
39243   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
39244 
39245   # Now try to locate executable using which
39246   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
39247   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
39248   # to not find them
39249   if test "x$new_path" = x \
39250       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
39251       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
39252     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
39253   fi
39254   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
39255     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
39256     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
39257     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
39258     # argument.
39259     path="$complete"
39260     arguments="EOL"
39261     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
39262     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
39263     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
39264     # to not find them
39265     if test "x$new_path" = x \
39266         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
39267         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
39268       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
39269     fi
39270     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
39271       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
39272       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of OBJDUMP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
39273 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of OBJDUMP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
39274       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
39275       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
39276         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
39277 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
39278       fi
39279       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of OBJDUMP" "$LINENO" 5
39280     fi
39281   fi
39282 
39283   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
39284   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
39285   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
39286   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
39287   #
39288   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
39289   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
39290   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
39291   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
39292     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
39293     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
39294     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
39295       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
39296     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
39297       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
39298     else
39299       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of OBJDUMP, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
39300 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of OBJDUMP, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
39301       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
39302 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
39303       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of OBJDUMP" "$LINENO" 5
39304     fi
39305   else
39306     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
39307   fi
39308 
39309   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
39310   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
39311   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
39312 
39313   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
39314   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
39315   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
39316   # take no chances and rewrite it.
39317   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
39318   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
39319   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
39320     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
39321     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
39322     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
39323     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
39324       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
39325       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
39326       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
39327       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
39328       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
39329       new_path="$input_path"
39330     fi
39331   fi
39332 
39333   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
39334   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
39335     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
39336     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
39337       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
39338       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
39339       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
39340     fi
39341   fi
39342 
39343   # remove trailing .exe if any
39344   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
39345 
39346   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
39347 
39348   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
39349   # space.
39350   complete="$OBJDUMP"
39351   path="${complete%% *}"
39352   tmp="$complete EOL"
39353   arguments="${tmp#* }"
39354 
39355   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
39356   # unix format.
39357   new_path="$path"
39358 
39359   windows_path="$new_path"
39360   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
39361     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
39362     new_path="$unix_path"
39363   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
39364     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
39365     new_path="$unix_path"
39366   fi
39367 
39368 
39369   # Now try to locate executable using which
39370   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
39371 
39372   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
39373     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
39374     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
39375     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
39376     # argument.
39377     path="$complete"
39378     arguments="EOL"
39379     new_path="$path"
39380 
39381   windows_path="$new_path"
39382   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
39383     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
39384     new_path="$unix_path"
39385   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
39386     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
39387     new_path="$unix_path"
39388   fi
39389 
39390 
39391     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
39392     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
39393     # to not find them
39394     if test "x$new_path" = x \
39395         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
39396         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
39397       new_path="$path"
39398 
39399   windows_path="$new_path"
39400   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
39401     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
39402     new_path="$unix_path"
39403   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
39404     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
39405     new_path="$unix_path"
39406   fi
39407 
39408     fi
39409 
39410     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
39411       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
39412       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of OBJDUMP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
39413 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of OBJDUMP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
39414       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
39415       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
39416         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
39417 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
39418       fi
39419       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of OBJDUMP" "$LINENO" 5
39420     fi
39421   fi
39422 
39423   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
39424   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
39425     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
39426     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
39427     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
39428   else
39429     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
39430     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
39431 
39432   input_path="$new_path"
39433   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
39434   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
39435   # take no chances and rewrite it.
39436   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
39437   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
39438   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
39439     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
39440     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
39441   fi
39442 
39443     # Output is in $new_path
39444 
39445   windows_path="$new_path"
39446   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
39447     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
39448     new_path="$unix_path"
39449   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
39450     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
39451     new_path="$unix_path"
39452   fi
39453 
39454     # remove trailing .exe if any
39455     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
39456 
39457     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
39458     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
39459   fi
39460 
39461   else
39462     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
39463     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
39464     # space.
39465     complete="$OBJDUMP"
39466     path="${complete%% *}"
39467     tmp="$complete EOL"
39468     arguments="${tmp#* }"
39469 
39470     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
39471     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
39472     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
39473       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
39474       IFS_save="$IFS"
39475       IFS=:
39476       for p in $PATH; do
39477         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
39478           new_path="$p/$path"
39479           break
39480         fi
39481       done
39482       IFS="$IFS_save"
39483     else
39484       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
39485       new_path="$path"
39486     fi
39487 
39488     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
39489       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of OBJDUMP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
39490 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of OBJDUMP, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
39491       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
39492       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
39493         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
39494 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
39495       fi
39496       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of OBJDUMP" "$LINENO" 5
39497     fi
39498   fi
39499 
39500   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
39501   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
39502     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
39503   else
39504     new_complete="$new_path"
39505   fi
39506 
39507   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
39508     OBJDUMP="$new_complete"
39509     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting OBJDUMP to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
39510 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting OBJDUMP to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
39511   fi
39512 
39513   fi
39514 
39515 
39516   # Restore old path.
39517   PATH="$OLD_PATH"
39518 
39519   # Restore the flags to the user specified values.
39520   # This is necessary since AC_PROG_CC defaults CFLAGS to "-g -O2"
39521   CFLAGS="$ORG_CFLAGS"
39522   CXXFLAGS="$ORG_CXXFLAGS"
39523   OBJCFLAGS="$ORG_OBJCFLAGS"
39524 
39525 
39526 # Finally do some processing after the detection phase
39527 
39528   if test "x$COMPILE_TYPE" = "xcross"; then
39529     # Now we need to find a C/C++ compiler that can build executables for the
39530     # build platform. We can't use the AC_PROG_CC macro, since it can only be
39531     # used once. Also, we need to do this without adding a tools dir to the
39532     # path, otherwise we might pick up cross-compilers which don't use standard
39533     # naming.
39534 
39535     # FIXME: we should list the discovered compilers as an exclude pattern!
39536     # If we do that, we can do this detection before POST_DETECTION, and still
39537     # find the build compilers in the tools dir, if needed.
39538 
39539 
39540   # Publish this variable in the help.
39541 
39542 
39543   if test "x$BUILD_CC" = x; then
39544     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
39545     for ac_prog in cl cc gcc
39546 do
39547   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
39548 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
39549 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
39550 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
39551 if ${ac_cv_path_BUILD_CC+:} false; then :
39552   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
39553 else
39554   case $BUILD_CC in
39555   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
39556   ac_cv_path_BUILD_CC="$BUILD_CC" # Let the user override the test with a path.
39557   ;;
39558   *)
39559   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
39560 for as_dir in $PATH
39561 do
39562   IFS=$as_save_IFS
39563   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
39564     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
39565   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
39566     ac_cv_path_BUILD_CC="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
39567     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
39568     break 2
39569   fi
39570 done
39571   done
39572 IFS=$as_save_IFS
39573 
39574   ;;
39575 esac
39576 fi
39577 BUILD_CC=$ac_cv_path_BUILD_CC
39578 if test -n "$BUILD_CC"; then
39579   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BUILD_CC" >&5
39580 $as_echo "$BUILD_CC" >&6; }
39581 else
39582   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
39583 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
39584 fi
39585 
39586 
39587   test -n "$BUILD_CC" && break
39588 done
39589 
39590   else
39591     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
39592 
39593     # Try to remove the string !BUILD_CC! from our list.
39594     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!BUILD_CC!/}
39595     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
39596       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
39597       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
39598       if test "xBUILD_CC" != xBASH; then
39599         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of BUILD_CC from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
39600 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of BUILD_CC from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
39601       fi
39602       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
39603       for ac_prog in cl cc gcc
39604 do
39605   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
39606 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
39607 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
39608 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
39609 if ${ac_cv_path_BUILD_CC+:} false; then :
39610   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
39611 else
39612   case $BUILD_CC in
39613   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
39614   ac_cv_path_BUILD_CC="$BUILD_CC" # Let the user override the test with a path.
39615   ;;
39616   *)
39617   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
39618 for as_dir in $PATH
39619 do
39620   IFS=$as_save_IFS
39621   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
39622     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
39623   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
39624     ac_cv_path_BUILD_CC="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
39625     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
39626     break 2
39627   fi
39628 done
39629   done
39630 IFS=$as_save_IFS
39631 
39632   ;;
39633 esac
39634 fi
39635 BUILD_CC=$ac_cv_path_BUILD_CC
39636 if test -n "$BUILD_CC"; then
39637   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BUILD_CC" >&5
39638 $as_echo "$BUILD_CC" >&6; }
39639 else
39640   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
39641 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
39642 fi
39643 
39644 
39645   test -n "$BUILD_CC" && break
39646 done
39647 
39648     else
39649       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
39650       # for the tool.
39651 
39652       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
39653       # for unknown variables in the end.
39654       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
39655 
39656       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
39657       tool_specified="$BUILD_CC"
39658       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
39659       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
39660         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
39661         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool BUILD_CC=$tool_basename" >&5
39662 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool BUILD_CC=$tool_basename" >&6;}
39663         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
39664 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
39665 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
39666 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
39667 if ${ac_cv_path_BUILD_CC+:} false; then :
39668   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
39669 else
39670   case $BUILD_CC in
39671   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
39672   ac_cv_path_BUILD_CC="$BUILD_CC" # Let the user override the test with a path.
39673   ;;
39674   *)
39675   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
39676 for as_dir in $PATH
39677 do
39678   IFS=$as_save_IFS
39679   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
39680     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
39681   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
39682     ac_cv_path_BUILD_CC="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
39683     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
39684     break 2
39685   fi
39686 done
39687   done
39688 IFS=$as_save_IFS
39689 
39690   ;;
39691 esac
39692 fi
39693 BUILD_CC=$ac_cv_path_BUILD_CC
39694 if test -n "$BUILD_CC"; then
39695   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BUILD_CC" >&5
39696 $as_echo "$BUILD_CC" >&6; }
39697 else
39698   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
39699 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
39700 fi
39701 
39702 
39703         if test "x$BUILD_CC" = x; then
39704           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
39705         fi
39706       else
39707         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
39708         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool BUILD_CC=$tool_specified" >&5
39709 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool BUILD_CC=$tool_specified" >&6;}
39710         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for BUILD_CC" >&5
39711 $as_echo_n "checking for BUILD_CC... " >&6; }
39712         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
39713           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
39714 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
39715           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool BUILD_CC=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
39716         fi
39717         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
39718 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
39719       fi
39720     fi
39721   fi
39722 
39723 
39724 
39725   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
39726 
39727   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
39728   # space.
39729   complete="$BUILD_CC"
39730   path="${complete%% *}"
39731   tmp="$complete EOL"
39732   arguments="${tmp#* }"
39733 
39734   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
39735   # unix format.
39736   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
39737 
39738   # Now try to locate executable using which
39739   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
39740   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
39741   # to not find them
39742   if test "x$new_path" = x \
39743       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
39744       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
39745     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
39746   fi
39747   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
39748     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
39749     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
39750     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
39751     # argument.
39752     path="$complete"
39753     arguments="EOL"
39754     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
39755     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
39756     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
39757     # to not find them
39758     if test "x$new_path" = x \
39759         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
39760         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
39761       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
39762     fi
39763     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
39764       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
39765       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BUILD_CC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
39766 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BUILD_CC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
39767       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
39768       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
39769         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
39770 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
39771       fi
39772       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of BUILD_CC" "$LINENO" 5
39773     fi
39774   fi
39775 
39776   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
39777   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
39778   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
39779   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
39780   #
39781   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
39782   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
39783   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
39784   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
39785     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
39786     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
39787     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
39788       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
39789     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
39790       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
39791     else
39792       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BUILD_CC, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
39793 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BUILD_CC, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
39794       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
39795 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
39796       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of BUILD_CC" "$LINENO" 5
39797     fi
39798   else
39799     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
39800   fi
39801 
39802   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
39803   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
39804   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
39805 
39806   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
39807   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
39808   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
39809   # take no chances and rewrite it.
39810   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
39811   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
39812   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
39813     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
39814     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
39815     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
39816     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
39817       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
39818       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
39819       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
39820       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
39821       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
39822       new_path="$input_path"
39823     fi
39824   fi
39825 
39826   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
39827   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
39828     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
39829     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
39830       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
39831       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
39832       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
39833     fi
39834   fi
39835 
39836   # remove trailing .exe if any
39837   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
39838 
39839   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
39840 
39841   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
39842   # space.
39843   complete="$BUILD_CC"
39844   path="${complete%% *}"
39845   tmp="$complete EOL"
39846   arguments="${tmp#* }"
39847 
39848   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
39849   # unix format.
39850   new_path="$path"
39851 
39852   windows_path="$new_path"
39853   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
39854     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
39855     new_path="$unix_path"
39856   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
39857     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
39858     new_path="$unix_path"
39859   fi
39860 
39861 
39862   # Now try to locate executable using which
39863   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
39864 
39865   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
39866     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
39867     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
39868     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
39869     # argument.
39870     path="$complete"
39871     arguments="EOL"
39872     new_path="$path"
39873 
39874   windows_path="$new_path"
39875   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
39876     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
39877     new_path="$unix_path"
39878   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
39879     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
39880     new_path="$unix_path"
39881   fi
39882 
39883 
39884     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
39885     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
39886     # to not find them
39887     if test "x$new_path" = x \
39888         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
39889         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
39890       new_path="$path"
39891 
39892   windows_path="$new_path"
39893   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
39894     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
39895     new_path="$unix_path"
39896   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
39897     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
39898     new_path="$unix_path"
39899   fi
39900 
39901     fi
39902 
39903     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
39904       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
39905       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BUILD_CC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
39906 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BUILD_CC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
39907       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
39908       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
39909         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
39910 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
39911       fi
39912       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of BUILD_CC" "$LINENO" 5
39913     fi
39914   fi
39915 
39916   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
39917   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
39918     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
39919     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
39920     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
39921   else
39922     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
39923     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
39924 
39925   input_path="$new_path"
39926   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
39927   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
39928   # take no chances and rewrite it.
39929   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
39930   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
39931   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
39932     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
39933     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
39934   fi
39935 
39936     # Output is in $new_path
39937 
39938   windows_path="$new_path"
39939   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
39940     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
39941     new_path="$unix_path"
39942   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
39943     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
39944     new_path="$unix_path"
39945   fi
39946 
39947     # remove trailing .exe if any
39948     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
39949 
39950     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
39951     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
39952   fi
39953 
39954   else
39955     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
39956     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
39957     # space.
39958     complete="$BUILD_CC"
39959     path="${complete%% *}"
39960     tmp="$complete EOL"
39961     arguments="${tmp#* }"
39962 
39963     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
39964     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
39965     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
39966       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
39967       IFS_save="$IFS"
39968       IFS=:
39969       for p in $PATH; do
39970         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
39971           new_path="$p/$path"
39972           break
39973         fi
39974       done
39975       IFS="$IFS_save"
39976     else
39977       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
39978       new_path="$path"
39979     fi
39980 
39981     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
39982       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BUILD_CC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
39983 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BUILD_CC, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
39984       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
39985       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
39986         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
39987 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
39988       fi
39989       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of BUILD_CC" "$LINENO" 5
39990     fi
39991   fi
39992 
39993   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
39994   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
39995     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
39996   else
39997     new_complete="$new_path"
39998   fi
39999 
40000   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
40001     BUILD_CC="$new_complete"
40002     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting BUILD_CC to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
40003 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting BUILD_CC to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
40004   fi
40005 
40006 
40007 
40008   # Publish this variable in the help.
40009 
40010 
40011   if test "x$BUILD_CXX" = x; then
40012     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
40013     for ac_prog in cl CC g++
40014 do
40015   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
40016 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
40017 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
40018 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
40019 if ${ac_cv_path_BUILD_CXX+:} false; then :
40020   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
40021 else
40022   case $BUILD_CXX in
40023   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
40024   ac_cv_path_BUILD_CXX="$BUILD_CXX" # Let the user override the test with a path.
40025   ;;
40026   *)
40027   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
40028 for as_dir in $PATH
40029 do
40030   IFS=$as_save_IFS
40031   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
40032     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
40033   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
40034     ac_cv_path_BUILD_CXX="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
40035     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
40036     break 2
40037   fi
40038 done
40039   done
40040 IFS=$as_save_IFS
40041 
40042   ;;
40043 esac
40044 fi
40045 BUILD_CXX=$ac_cv_path_BUILD_CXX
40046 if test -n "$BUILD_CXX"; then
40047   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BUILD_CXX" >&5
40048 $as_echo "$BUILD_CXX" >&6; }
40049 else
40050   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
40051 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
40052 fi
40053 
40054 
40055   test -n "$BUILD_CXX" && break
40056 done
40057 
40058   else
40059     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
40060 
40061     # Try to remove the string !BUILD_CXX! from our list.
40062     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!BUILD_CXX!/}
40063     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
40064       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
40065       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
40066       if test "xBUILD_CXX" != xBASH; then
40067         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of BUILD_CXX from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
40068 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of BUILD_CXX from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
40069       fi
40070       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
40071       for ac_prog in cl CC g++
40072 do
40073   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
40074 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
40075 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
40076 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
40077 if ${ac_cv_path_BUILD_CXX+:} false; then :
40078   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
40079 else
40080   case $BUILD_CXX in
40081   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
40082   ac_cv_path_BUILD_CXX="$BUILD_CXX" # Let the user override the test with a path.
40083   ;;
40084   *)
40085   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
40086 for as_dir in $PATH
40087 do
40088   IFS=$as_save_IFS
40089   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
40090     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
40091   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
40092     ac_cv_path_BUILD_CXX="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
40093     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
40094     break 2
40095   fi
40096 done
40097   done
40098 IFS=$as_save_IFS
40099 
40100   ;;
40101 esac
40102 fi
40103 BUILD_CXX=$ac_cv_path_BUILD_CXX
40104 if test -n "$BUILD_CXX"; then
40105   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BUILD_CXX" >&5
40106 $as_echo "$BUILD_CXX" >&6; }
40107 else
40108   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
40109 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
40110 fi
40111 
40112 
40113   test -n "$BUILD_CXX" && break
40114 done
40115 
40116     else
40117       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
40118       # for the tool.
40119 
40120       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
40121       # for unknown variables in the end.
40122       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
40123 
40124       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
40125       tool_specified="$BUILD_CXX"
40126       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
40127       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
40128         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
40129         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool BUILD_CXX=$tool_basename" >&5
40130 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool BUILD_CXX=$tool_basename" >&6;}
40131         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
40132 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
40133 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
40134 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
40135 if ${ac_cv_path_BUILD_CXX+:} false; then :
40136   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
40137 else
40138   case $BUILD_CXX in
40139   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
40140   ac_cv_path_BUILD_CXX="$BUILD_CXX" # Let the user override the test with a path.
40141   ;;
40142   *)
40143   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
40144 for as_dir in $PATH
40145 do
40146   IFS=$as_save_IFS
40147   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
40148     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
40149   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
40150     ac_cv_path_BUILD_CXX="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
40151     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
40152     break 2
40153   fi
40154 done
40155   done
40156 IFS=$as_save_IFS
40157 
40158   ;;
40159 esac
40160 fi
40161 BUILD_CXX=$ac_cv_path_BUILD_CXX
40162 if test -n "$BUILD_CXX"; then
40163   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BUILD_CXX" >&5
40164 $as_echo "$BUILD_CXX" >&6; }
40165 else
40166   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
40167 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
40168 fi
40169 
40170 
40171         if test "x$BUILD_CXX" = x; then
40172           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
40173         fi
40174       else
40175         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
40176         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool BUILD_CXX=$tool_specified" >&5
40177 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool BUILD_CXX=$tool_specified" >&6;}
40178         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for BUILD_CXX" >&5
40179 $as_echo_n "checking for BUILD_CXX... " >&6; }
40180         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
40181           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
40182 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
40183           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool BUILD_CXX=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
40184         fi
40185         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
40186 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
40187       fi
40188     fi
40189   fi
40190 
40191 
40192 
40193   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
40194 
40195   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
40196   # space.
40197   complete="$BUILD_CXX"
40198   path="${complete%% *}"
40199   tmp="$complete EOL"
40200   arguments="${tmp#* }"
40201 
40202   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
40203   # unix format.
40204   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
40205 
40206   # Now try to locate executable using which
40207   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
40208   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
40209   # to not find them
40210   if test "x$new_path" = x \
40211       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
40212       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
40213     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
40214   fi
40215   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
40216     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
40217     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
40218     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
40219     # argument.
40220     path="$complete"
40221     arguments="EOL"
40222     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
40223     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
40224     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
40225     # to not find them
40226     if test "x$new_path" = x \
40227         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
40228         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
40229       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
40230     fi
40231     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
40232       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
40233       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BUILD_CXX, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
40234 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BUILD_CXX, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
40235       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
40236       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
40237         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
40238 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
40239       fi
40240       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of BUILD_CXX" "$LINENO" 5
40241     fi
40242   fi
40243 
40244   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
40245   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
40246   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
40247   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
40248   #
40249   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
40250   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
40251   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
40252   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
40253     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
40254     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
40255     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
40256       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
40257     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
40258       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
40259     else
40260       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BUILD_CXX, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
40261 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BUILD_CXX, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
40262       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
40263 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
40264       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of BUILD_CXX" "$LINENO" 5
40265     fi
40266   else
40267     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
40268   fi
40269 
40270   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
40271   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
40272   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
40273 
40274   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
40275   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
40276   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
40277   # take no chances and rewrite it.
40278   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
40279   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
40280   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
40281     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
40282     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
40283     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
40284     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
40285       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
40286       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
40287       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
40288       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
40289       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
40290       new_path="$input_path"
40291     fi
40292   fi
40293 
40294   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
40295   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
40296     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
40297     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
40298       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
40299       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
40300       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
40301     fi
40302   fi
40303 
40304   # remove trailing .exe if any
40305   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
40306 
40307   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
40308 
40309   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
40310   # space.
40311   complete="$BUILD_CXX"
40312   path="${complete%% *}"
40313   tmp="$complete EOL"
40314   arguments="${tmp#* }"
40315 
40316   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
40317   # unix format.
40318   new_path="$path"
40319 
40320   windows_path="$new_path"
40321   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
40322     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
40323     new_path="$unix_path"
40324   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
40325     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
40326     new_path="$unix_path"
40327   fi
40328 
40329 
40330   # Now try to locate executable using which
40331   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
40332 
40333   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
40334     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
40335     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
40336     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
40337     # argument.
40338     path="$complete"
40339     arguments="EOL"
40340     new_path="$path"
40341 
40342   windows_path="$new_path"
40343   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
40344     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
40345     new_path="$unix_path"
40346   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
40347     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
40348     new_path="$unix_path"
40349   fi
40350 
40351 
40352     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
40353     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
40354     # to not find them
40355     if test "x$new_path" = x \
40356         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
40357         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
40358       new_path="$path"
40359 
40360   windows_path="$new_path"
40361   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
40362     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
40363     new_path="$unix_path"
40364   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
40365     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
40366     new_path="$unix_path"
40367   fi
40368 
40369     fi
40370 
40371     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
40372       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
40373       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BUILD_CXX, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
40374 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BUILD_CXX, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
40375       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
40376       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
40377         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
40378 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
40379       fi
40380       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of BUILD_CXX" "$LINENO" 5
40381     fi
40382   fi
40383 
40384   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
40385   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
40386     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
40387     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
40388     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
40389   else
40390     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
40391     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
40392 
40393   input_path="$new_path"
40394   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
40395   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
40396   # take no chances and rewrite it.
40397   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
40398   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
40399   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
40400     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
40401     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
40402   fi
40403 
40404     # Output is in $new_path
40405 
40406   windows_path="$new_path"
40407   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
40408     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
40409     new_path="$unix_path"
40410   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
40411     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
40412     new_path="$unix_path"
40413   fi
40414 
40415     # remove trailing .exe if any
40416     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
40417 
40418     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
40419     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
40420   fi
40421 
40422   else
40423     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
40424     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
40425     # space.
40426     complete="$BUILD_CXX"
40427     path="${complete%% *}"
40428     tmp="$complete EOL"
40429     arguments="${tmp#* }"
40430 
40431     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
40432     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
40433     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
40434       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
40435       IFS_save="$IFS"
40436       IFS=:
40437       for p in $PATH; do
40438         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
40439           new_path="$p/$path"
40440           break
40441         fi
40442       done
40443       IFS="$IFS_save"
40444     else
40445       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
40446       new_path="$path"
40447     fi
40448 
40449     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
40450       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BUILD_CXX, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
40451 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BUILD_CXX, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
40452       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
40453       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
40454         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
40455 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
40456       fi
40457       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of BUILD_CXX" "$LINENO" 5
40458     fi
40459   fi
40460 
40461   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
40462   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
40463     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
40464   else
40465     new_complete="$new_path"
40466   fi
40467 
40468   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
40469     BUILD_CXX="$new_complete"
40470     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting BUILD_CXX to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
40471 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting BUILD_CXX to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
40472   fi
40473 
40474 
40475 
40476   # Publish this variable in the help.
40477 
40478 
40479   if test "x$BUILD_LD" = x; then
40480     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
40481     for ac_prog in ld
40482 do
40483   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
40484 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
40485 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
40486 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
40487 if ${ac_cv_path_BUILD_LD+:} false; then :
40488   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
40489 else
40490   case $BUILD_LD in
40491   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
40492   ac_cv_path_BUILD_LD="$BUILD_LD" # Let the user override the test with a path.
40493   ;;
40494   *)
40495   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
40496 for as_dir in $PATH
40497 do
40498   IFS=$as_save_IFS
40499   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
40500     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
40501   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
40502     ac_cv_path_BUILD_LD="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
40503     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
40504     break 2
40505   fi
40506 done
40507   done
40508 IFS=$as_save_IFS
40509 
40510   ;;
40511 esac
40512 fi
40513 BUILD_LD=$ac_cv_path_BUILD_LD
40514 if test -n "$BUILD_LD"; then
40515   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BUILD_LD" >&5
40516 $as_echo "$BUILD_LD" >&6; }
40517 else
40518   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
40519 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
40520 fi
40521 
40522 
40523   test -n "$BUILD_LD" && break
40524 done
40525 
40526   else
40527     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
40528 
40529     # Try to remove the string !BUILD_LD! from our list.
40530     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!BUILD_LD!/}
40531     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
40532       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
40533       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
40534       if test "xBUILD_LD" != xBASH; then
40535         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of BUILD_LD from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
40536 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of BUILD_LD from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
40537       fi
40538       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
40539       for ac_prog in ld
40540 do
40541   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
40542 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
40543 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
40544 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
40545 if ${ac_cv_path_BUILD_LD+:} false; then :
40546   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
40547 else
40548   case $BUILD_LD in
40549   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
40550   ac_cv_path_BUILD_LD="$BUILD_LD" # Let the user override the test with a path.
40551   ;;
40552   *)
40553   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
40554 for as_dir in $PATH
40555 do
40556   IFS=$as_save_IFS
40557   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
40558     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
40559   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
40560     ac_cv_path_BUILD_LD="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
40561     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
40562     break 2
40563   fi
40564 done
40565   done
40566 IFS=$as_save_IFS
40567 
40568   ;;
40569 esac
40570 fi
40571 BUILD_LD=$ac_cv_path_BUILD_LD
40572 if test -n "$BUILD_LD"; then
40573   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BUILD_LD" >&5
40574 $as_echo "$BUILD_LD" >&6; }
40575 else
40576   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
40577 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
40578 fi
40579 
40580 
40581   test -n "$BUILD_LD" && break
40582 done
40583 
40584     else
40585       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
40586       # for the tool.
40587 
40588       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
40589       # for unknown variables in the end.
40590       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
40591 
40592       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
40593       tool_specified="$BUILD_LD"
40594       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
40595       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
40596         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
40597         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool BUILD_LD=$tool_basename" >&5
40598 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool BUILD_LD=$tool_basename" >&6;}
40599         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
40600 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
40601 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
40602 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
40603 if ${ac_cv_path_BUILD_LD+:} false; then :
40604   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
40605 else
40606   case $BUILD_LD in
40607   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
40608   ac_cv_path_BUILD_LD="$BUILD_LD" # Let the user override the test with a path.
40609   ;;
40610   *)
40611   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
40612 for as_dir in $PATH
40613 do
40614   IFS=$as_save_IFS
40615   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
40616     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
40617   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
40618     ac_cv_path_BUILD_LD="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
40619     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
40620     break 2
40621   fi
40622 done
40623   done
40624 IFS=$as_save_IFS
40625 
40626   ;;
40627 esac
40628 fi
40629 BUILD_LD=$ac_cv_path_BUILD_LD
40630 if test -n "$BUILD_LD"; then
40631   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BUILD_LD" >&5
40632 $as_echo "$BUILD_LD" >&6; }
40633 else
40634   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
40635 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
40636 fi
40637 
40638 
40639         if test "x$BUILD_LD" = x; then
40640           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
40641         fi
40642       else
40643         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
40644         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool BUILD_LD=$tool_specified" >&5
40645 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool BUILD_LD=$tool_specified" >&6;}
40646         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for BUILD_LD" >&5
40647 $as_echo_n "checking for BUILD_LD... " >&6; }
40648         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
40649           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
40650 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
40651           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool BUILD_LD=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
40652         fi
40653         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
40654 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
40655       fi
40656     fi
40657   fi
40658 
40659 
40660 
40661   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
40662 
40663   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
40664   # space.
40665   complete="$BUILD_LD"
40666   path="${complete%% *}"
40667   tmp="$complete EOL"
40668   arguments="${tmp#* }"
40669 
40670   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
40671   # unix format.
40672   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
40673 
40674   # Now try to locate executable using which
40675   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
40676   # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
40677   # to not find them
40678   if test "x$new_path" = x \
40679       && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
40680       && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
40681     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
40682   fi
40683   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
40684     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
40685     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
40686     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
40687     # argument.
40688     path="$complete"
40689     arguments="EOL"
40690     new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
40691     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
40692     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in cygwin causing which
40693     # to not find them
40694     if test "x$new_path" = x \
40695         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
40696         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
40697       new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
40698     fi
40699     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
40700       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
40701       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BUILD_LD, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
40702 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BUILD_LD, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
40703       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
40704       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
40705         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
40706 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
40707       fi
40708       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of BUILD_LD" "$LINENO" 5
40709     fi
40710   fi
40711 
40712   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
40713   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
40714   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
40715   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
40716   #
40717   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file presence.
40718   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
40719   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
40720   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
40721     # Short path failed, file does not exist as specified.
40722     # Try adding .exe or .cmd
40723     if test -f "${new_path}.exe"; then
40724       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.exe"
40725     elif test -f "${new_path}.cmd"; then
40726       input_to_shortpath="${new_path}.cmd"
40727     else
40728       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BUILD_LD, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&5
40729 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BUILD_LD, which resolves as \"$new_path\", is invalid." >&6;}
40730       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&5
40731 $as_echo "$as_me: Neither \"$new_path\" nor \"$new_path.exe/cmd\" can be found" >&6;}
40732       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of BUILD_LD" "$LINENO" 5
40733     fi
40734   else
40735     input_to_shortpath="$new_path"
40736   fi
40737 
40738   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
40739   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
40740   new_path="$input_to_shortpath"
40741 
40742   input_path="$input_to_shortpath"
40743   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
40744   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
40745   # take no chances and rewrite it.
40746   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
40747   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
40748   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
40749     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
40750     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
40751     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
40752     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
40753       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
40754       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
40755       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
40756       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
40757       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
40758       new_path="$input_path"
40759     fi
40760   fi
40761 
40762   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
40763   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
40764     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
40765     if test "x`$ECHO $input_to_shortpath | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
40766       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
40767       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
40768       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
40769     fi
40770   fi
40771 
40772   # remove trailing .exe if any
40773   new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
40774 
40775   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
40776 
40777   # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
40778   # space.
40779   complete="$BUILD_LD"
40780   path="${complete%% *}"
40781   tmp="$complete EOL"
40782   arguments="${tmp#* }"
40783 
40784   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
40785   # unix format.
40786   new_path="$path"
40787 
40788   windows_path="$new_path"
40789   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
40790     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
40791     new_path="$unix_path"
40792   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
40793     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
40794     new_path="$unix_path"
40795   fi
40796 
40797 
40798   # Now try to locate executable using which
40799   new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
40800 
40801   if test "x$new_path" = x; then
40802     # Oops. Which didn't find the executable.
40803     # The splitting of arguments from the executable at a space might have been incorrect,
40804     # since paths with space are more likely in Windows. Give it another try with the whole
40805     # argument.
40806     path="$complete"
40807     arguments="EOL"
40808     new_path="$path"
40809 
40810   windows_path="$new_path"
40811   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
40812     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
40813     new_path="$unix_path"
40814   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
40815     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
40816     new_path="$unix_path"
40817   fi
40818 
40819 
40820     new_path=`$WHICH "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
40821     # bat and cmd files are not always considered executable in MSYS causing which
40822     # to not find them
40823     if test "x$new_path" = x \
40824         && test "x`$ECHO \"$path\" | $GREP -i -e \"\\.bat$\" -e \"\\.cmd$\"`" != x \
40825         && test "x`$LS \"$path\" 2>/dev/null`" != x; then
40826       new_path="$path"
40827 
40828   windows_path="$new_path"
40829   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
40830     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
40831     new_path="$unix_path"
40832   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
40833     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
40834     new_path="$unix_path"
40835   fi
40836 
40837     fi
40838 
40839     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
40840       # It's still not found. Now this is an unrecoverable error.
40841       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BUILD_LD, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
40842 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BUILD_LD, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
40843       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
40844       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
40845         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&5
40846 $as_echo "$as_me: You might be mixing spaces in the path and extra arguments, which is not allowed." >&6;}
40847       fi
40848       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of BUILD_LD" "$LINENO" 5
40849     fi
40850   fi
40851 
40852   # Now new_path has a complete unix path to the binary
40853   if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/bin/`" != x; then
40854     # Keep paths in /bin as-is, but remove trailing .exe if any
40855     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
40856     # Do not save /bin paths to all_fixpath_prefixes!
40857   else
40858     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
40859     new_path=`cmd //c echo $new_path`
40860 
40861   input_path="$new_path"
40862   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
40863   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
40864   # take no chances and rewrite it.
40865   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
40866   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
40867   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
40868     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
40869     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
40870   fi
40871 
40872     # Output is in $new_path
40873 
40874   windows_path="$new_path"
40875   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
40876     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
40877     new_path="$unix_path"
40878   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
40879     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
40880     new_path="$unix_path"
40881   fi
40882 
40883     # remove trailing .exe if any
40884     new_path="${new_path/%.exe/}"
40885 
40886     # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
40887     all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
40888   fi
40889 
40890   else
40891     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
40892     # First separate the path from the arguments. This will split at the first
40893     # space.
40894     complete="$BUILD_LD"
40895     path="${complete%% *}"
40896     tmp="$complete EOL"
40897     arguments="${tmp#* }"
40898 
40899     # Cannot rely on the command "which" here since it doesn't always work.
40900     is_absolute_path=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP ^/`
40901     if test -z "$is_absolute_path"; then
40902       # Path to executable is not absolute. Find it.
40903       IFS_save="$IFS"
40904       IFS=:
40905       for p in $PATH; do
40906         if test -f "$p/$path" && test -x "$p/$path"; then
40907           new_path="$p/$path"
40908           break
40909         fi
40910       done
40911       IFS="$IFS_save"
40912     else
40913       # This is an absolute path, we can use it without further modifications.
40914       new_path="$path"
40915     fi
40916 
40917     if test "x$new_path" = x; then
40918       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of BUILD_LD, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&5
40919 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of BUILD_LD, which resolves as \"$complete\", is not found." >&6;}
40920       has_space=`$ECHO "$complete" | $GREP " "`
40921       if test "x$has_space" != x; then
40922         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&5
40923 $as_echo "$as_me: This might be caused by spaces in the path, which is not allowed." >&6;}
40924       fi
40925       as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of BUILD_LD" "$LINENO" 5
40926     fi
40927   fi
40928 
40929   # Now join together the path and the arguments once again
40930   if test "x$arguments" != xEOL; then
40931     new_complete="$new_path ${arguments% *}"
40932   else
40933     new_complete="$new_path"
40934   fi
40935 
40936   if test "x$complete" != "x$new_complete"; then
40937     BUILD_LD="$new_complete"
40938     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting BUILD_LD to \"$new_complete\"" >&5
40939 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting BUILD_LD to \"$new_complete\"" >&6;}
40940   fi
40941 
40942   else
40943     # If we are not cross compiling, use the normal target compilers for
40944     # building the build platform executables.
40945     BUILD_CC="$CC"
40946     BUILD_CXX="$CXX"
40947     BUILD_LD="$LD"
40948   fi
40949 
40950 
40951 
40952 
40953 
40954 
40955   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xmicrosoft; then
40956     # For hotspot, we need these in Windows mixed path,
40957     # so rewrite them all. Need added .exe suffix.
40958     HOTSPOT_CXX="$CXX.exe"
40959     HOTSPOT_LD="$LD.exe"
40960     HOTSPOT_MT="$MT.exe"
