40961     HOTSPOT_RC="$RC.exe"
40962 
40963   unix_path="$HOTSPOT_CXX"
40964   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
40965     windows_path=`$CYGPATH -m "$unix_path"`
40966     HOTSPOT_CXX="$windows_path"
40967   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
40968     windows_path=`cmd //c echo $unix_path`
40969     HOTSPOT_CXX="$windows_path"
40970   fi
40971 
40972 
40973   unix_path="$HOTSPOT_LD"
40974   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
40975     windows_path=`$CYGPATH -m "$unix_path"`
40976     HOTSPOT_LD="$windows_path"
40977   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
40978     windows_path=`cmd //c echo $unix_path`
40979     HOTSPOT_LD="$windows_path"
40980   fi
40981 
40982 
40983   unix_path="$HOTSPOT_MT"
40984   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
40985     windows_path=`$CYGPATH -m "$unix_path"`
40986     HOTSPOT_MT="$windows_path"
40987   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
40988     windows_path=`cmd //c echo $unix_path`
40989     HOTSPOT_MT="$windows_path"
40990   fi
40991 
40992 
40993   unix_path="$HOTSPOT_RC"
40994   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
40995     windows_path=`$CYGPATH -m "$unix_path"`
40996     HOTSPOT_RC="$windows_path"
40997   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
40998     windows_path=`cmd //c echo $unix_path`
40999     HOTSPOT_RC="$windows_path"
41000   fi
41001 
41002 
41003 
41004   else
41005     HOTSPOT_CXX="$CXX"
41006     HOTSPOT_LD="$LD"
41007   fi
41008 
41009 
41010 
41011   if test  "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xclang; then
41012     USE_CLANG=true
41013   fi
41014 
41015 
41016   # LDEXE is the linker to use, when creating executables. Not really used.
41017   # FIXME: These should just be removed!
41018   LDEXE="$LD"
41019   LDEXECXX="$LDCXX"
41020 
41021 
41022 
41023 
41024 
41025 
41026   # The package path is used only on macosx?
41027   # FIXME: clean this up, and/or move it elsewhere.
41028   PACKAGE_PATH=/opt/local
41029 
41030 
41031   # Check for extra potential brokenness.
41032   if test  "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xmicrosoft; then
41033     # On Windows, double-check that we got the right compiler.
41034     CC_VERSION_OUTPUT=`$CC 2>&1 | $HEAD -n 1 | $TR -d '\r'`
41035     COMPILER_CPU_TEST=`$ECHO $CC_VERSION_OUTPUT | $SED -n "s/^.* \(.*\)$/\1/p"`
41036     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU" = "xx86"; then
41037       if test "x$COMPILER_CPU_TEST" != "x80x86"; then
41038         as_fn_error $? "Target CPU mismatch. We are building for $OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU but CL is for \"$COMPILER_CPU_TEST\"; expected \"80x86\"." "$LINENO" 5
41039       fi
41040     elif test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU" = "xx86_64"; then
41041       if test "x$COMPILER_CPU_TEST" != "xx64"; then
41042         as_fn_error $? "Target CPU mismatch. We are building for $OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU but CL is for \"$COMPILER_CPU_TEST\"; expected \"x64\"." "$LINENO" 5
41043       fi
41044     fi
41045   fi
41046 
41047   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xgcc; then
41048     # If this is a --hash-style=gnu system, use --hash-style=both, why?
41049     HAS_GNU_HASH=`$CC -dumpspecs 2>/dev/null | $GREP 'hash-style=gnu'`
41050     # This is later checked when setting flags.
41051 
41052     # "-Og" suppported for GCC 4.8 and later
41053     CFLAG_OPTIMIZE_DEBUG_FLAG="-Og"
41054 
41055   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if compiler supports \"$CFLAG_OPTIMIZE_DEBUG_FLAG\"" >&5
41056 $as_echo_n "checking if compiler supports \"$CFLAG_OPTIMIZE_DEBUG_FLAG\"... " >&6; }
41057   supports=yes
41058 
41059   saved_cflags="$CFLAGS"
41060   CFLAGS="$CFLAGS $CFLAG_OPTIMIZE_DEBUG_FLAG"
41061   ac_ext=c
41062 ac_cpp='$CPP $CPPFLAGS'
41063 ac_compile='$CC -c $CFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
41064 ac_link='$CC -o conftest$ac_exeext $CFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
41065 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_c_compiler_gnu
41066 
41067   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
41068 /* end confdefs.h.  */
41069 int i;
41070 _ACEOF
41071 if ac_fn_c_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
41072 
41073 else
41074   supports=no
41075 fi
41076 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
41077   ac_ext=cpp
41078 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
41079 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
41080 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
41081 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
41082 
41083   CFLAGS="$saved_cflags"
41084 
41085   saved_cxxflags="$CXXFLAGS"
41086   CXXFLAGS="$CXXFLAG $CFLAG_OPTIMIZE_DEBUG_FLAG"
41087   ac_ext=cpp
41088 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
41089 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
41090 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
41091 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
41092 
41093   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
41094 /* end confdefs.h.  */
41095 int i;
41096 _ACEOF
41097 if ac_fn_cxx_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
41098 
41099 else
41100   supports=no
41101 fi
41102 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
41103   ac_ext=cpp
41104 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
41105 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
41106 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
41107 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
41108 
41109   CXXFLAGS="$saved_cxxflags"
41110 
41111   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $supports" >&5
41112 $as_echo "$supports" >&6; }
41113   if test "x$supports" = "xyes" ; then
41114     HAS_CFLAG_OPTIMIZE_DEBUG=true
41115   else
41116     HAS_CFLAG_OPTIMIZE_DEBUG=false
41117   fi
41118 
41119 
41120     # "-z relro" supported in GNU binutils 2.17 and later
41121     LINKER_RELRO_FLAG="-Xlinker -z -Xlinker relro"
41122 
41123   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if linker supports \"$LINKER_RELRO_FLAG\"" >&5
41124 $as_echo_n "checking if linker supports \"$LINKER_RELRO_FLAG\"... " >&6; }
41125   supports=yes
41126 
41127   saved_ldflags="$LDFLAGS"
41128   LDFLAGS="$LDFLAGS $LINKER_RELRO_FLAG"
41129   ac_ext=c
41130 ac_cpp='$CPP $CPPFLAGS'
41131 ac_compile='$CC -c $CFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
41132 ac_link='$CC -o conftest$ac_exeext $CFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
41133 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_c_compiler_gnu
41134 
41135   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
41136 /* end confdefs.h.  */
41137 
41138 int
41139 main ()
41140 {
41141 
41142   ;
41143   return 0;
41144 }
41145 _ACEOF
41146 if ac_fn_c_try_link "$LINENO"; then :
41147 
41148 else
41149   supports=no
41150 fi
41151 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext \
41152     conftest$ac_exeext conftest.$ac_ext
41153   ac_ext=cpp
41154 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
41155 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
41156 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
41157 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
41158 
41159   LDFLAGS="$saved_ldflags"
41160 
41161   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $supports" >&5
41162 $as_echo "$supports" >&6; }
41163   if test "x$supports" = "xyes" ; then
41164     HAS_LINKER_RELRO=true
41165   else
41166     HAS_LINKER_RELRO=false
41167   fi
41168 
41169 
41170     # "-z now" supported in GNU binutils 2.11 and later
41171     LINKER_NOW_FLAG="-Xlinker -z -Xlinker now"
41172 
41173   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if linker supports \"$LINKER_NOW_FLAG\"" >&5
41174 $as_echo_n "checking if linker supports \"$LINKER_NOW_FLAG\"... " >&6; }
41175   supports=yes
41176 
41177   saved_ldflags="$LDFLAGS"
41178   LDFLAGS="$LDFLAGS $LINKER_NOW_FLAG"
41179   ac_ext=c
41180 ac_cpp='$CPP $CPPFLAGS'
41181 ac_compile='$CC -c $CFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
41182 ac_link='$CC -o conftest$ac_exeext $CFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
41183 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_c_compiler_gnu
41184 
41185   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
41186 /* end confdefs.h.  */
41187 
41188 int
41189 main ()
41190 {
41191 
41192   ;
41193   return 0;
41194 }
41195 _ACEOF
41196 if ac_fn_c_try_link "$LINENO"; then :
41197 
41198 else
41199   supports=no
41200 fi
41201 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext \
41202     conftest$ac_exeext conftest.$ac_ext
41203   ac_ext=cpp
41204 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
41205 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
41206 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
41207 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
41208 
41209   LDFLAGS="$saved_ldflags"
41210 
41211   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $supports" >&5
41212 $as_echo "$supports" >&6; }
41213   if test "x$supports" = "xyes" ; then
41214     HAS_LINKER_NOW=true
41215   else
41216     HAS_LINKER_NOW=false
41217   fi
41218 
41219   fi
41220 
41221   # Check for broken SuSE 'ld' for which 'Only anonymous version tag is allowed
41222   # in executable.'
41223   USING_BROKEN_SUSE_LD=no
41224   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xlinux && test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xgcc; then
41225     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for broken SuSE 'ld' which only understands anonymous version tags in executables" >&5
41226 $as_echo_n "checking for broken SuSE 'ld' which only understands anonymous version tags in executables... " >&6; }
41227     $ECHO "SUNWprivate_1.1 { local: *; };" > version-script.map
41228     $ECHO "int main() { }" > main.c
41229     if $CXX -Xlinker -version-script=version-script.map main.c 2>&5 >&5; then
41230       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
41231 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
41232       USING_BROKEN_SUSE_LD=no
41233     else
41234       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes" >&5
41235 $as_echo "yes" >&6; }
41236       USING_BROKEN_SUSE_LD=yes
41237     fi
41238     rm -rf version-script.map main.c a.out
41239   fi
41240 
41241 
41242 
41243 # Setup the JTReg Regression Test Harness.
41244 
41245 
41246 # Check whether --with-jtreg was given.
41247 if test "${with_jtreg+set}" = set; then :
41248   withval=$with_jtreg;
41249 else
41250   with_jtreg=no
41251 fi
41252 
41253 
41254   if test "x$with_jtreg" = xno; then
41255     # jtreg disabled
41256     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for jtreg" >&5
41257 $as_echo_n "checking for jtreg... " >&6; }
41258     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
41259 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
41260   else
41261     if test "x$with_jtreg" != xyes; then
41262       # with path specified.
41263       JT_HOME="$with_jtreg"
41264     fi
41265 
41266     if test "x$JT_HOME" != x; then
41267       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for jtreg" >&5
41268 $as_echo_n "checking for jtreg... " >&6; }
41269 
41270       # use JT_HOME enviroment var.
41271 
41272   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
41273 
41274   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
41275   # unix format.
41276   path="$JT_HOME"
41277   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
41278 
41279   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
41280   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
41281   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
41282   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
41283   #
41284   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file precense.
41285   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
41286   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
41287   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
41288     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of JT_HOME, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
41289 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of JT_HOME, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
41290     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of JT_HOME" "$LINENO" 5
41291   fi
41292 
41293   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
41294   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
41295 
41296   input_path="$new_path"
41297   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
41298   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
41299   # take no chances and rewrite it.
41300   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
41301   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
41302   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
41303     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
41304     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
41305     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
41306     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
41307       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
41308       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
41309       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
41310       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
41311       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
41312       new_path="$input_path"
41313     fi
41314   fi
41315 
41316   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
41317   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
41318     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
41319     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
41320       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
41321       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
41322       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
41323     fi
41324   fi
41325 
41326 
41327   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
41328     JT_HOME="$new_path"
41329     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting JT_HOME to \"$new_path\"" >&5
41330 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting JT_HOME to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
41331   fi
41332 
41333   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
41334 
41335   path="$JT_HOME"
41336   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
41337   new_path="$path"
41338   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
41339     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
41340     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
41341   fi
41342 
41343 
41344   input_path="$new_path"
41345   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
41346   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
41347   # take no chances and rewrite it.
41348   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
41349   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
41350   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
41351     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
41352     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
41353   fi
41354 
41355 
41356   windows_path="$new_path"
41357   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
41358     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
41359     new_path="$unix_path"
41360   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
41361     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
41362     new_path="$unix_path"
41363   fi
41364 
41365   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
41366     JT_HOME="$new_path"
41367     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting JT_HOME to \"$new_path\"" >&5
41368 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting JT_HOME to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
41369   fi
41370 
41371   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
41372   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
41373 
41374   else
41375     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
41376     path="$JT_HOME"
41377     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
41378     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
41379       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of JT_HOME, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
41380 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of JT_HOME, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
41381       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
41382     fi
41383 
41384     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
41385     eval path="$path"
41386     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
41387       as_fn_error $? "The path of JT_HOME, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
41388     fi
41389 
41390     JT_HOME="`cd "$path"; $THEPWDCMD -L`"
41391   fi
41392 
41393 
41394       # jtreg win32 script works for everybody
41395       JTREGEXE="$JT_HOME/win32/bin/jtreg"
41396 
41397       if test ! -f "$JTREGEXE"; then
41398         as_fn_error $? "JTReg executable does not exist: $JTREGEXE" "$LINENO" 5
41399       fi
41400 
41401       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $JTREGEXE" >&5
41402 $as_echo "$JTREGEXE" >&6; }
41403     else
41404       # try to find jtreg on path
41405 
41406 
41407 
41408   # Publish this variable in the help.
41409 
41410 
41411   if test "x$JTREGEXE" = x; then
41412     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
41413     for ac_prog in jtreg
41414 do
41415   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
41416 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
41417 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
41418 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
41419 if ${ac_cv_path_JTREGEXE+:} false; then :
41420   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
41421 else
41422   case $JTREGEXE in
41423   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
41424   ac_cv_path_JTREGEXE="$JTREGEXE" # Let the user override the test with a path.
41425   ;;
41426   *)
41427   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
41428 for as_dir in $PATH
41429 do
41430   IFS=$as_save_IFS
41431   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
41432     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
41433   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
41434     ac_cv_path_JTREGEXE="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
41435     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
41436     break 2
41437   fi
41438 done
41439   done
41440 IFS=$as_save_IFS
41441 
41442   ;;
41443 esac
41444 fi
41445 JTREGEXE=$ac_cv_path_JTREGEXE
41446 if test -n "$JTREGEXE"; then
41447   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $JTREGEXE" >&5
41448 $as_echo "$JTREGEXE" >&6; }
41449 else
41450   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
41451 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
41452 fi
41453 
41454 
41455   test -n "$JTREGEXE" && break
41456 done
41457 
41458   else
41459     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
41460 
41461     # Try to remove the string !JTREGEXE! from our list.
41462     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!JTREGEXE!/}
41463     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
41464       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
41465       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
41466       if test "xJTREGEXE" != xBASH; then
41467         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of JTREGEXE from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
41468 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of JTREGEXE from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
41469       fi
41470       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
41471       for ac_prog in jtreg
41472 do
41473   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
41474 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
41475 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
41476 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
41477 if ${ac_cv_path_JTREGEXE+:} false; then :
41478   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
41479 else
41480   case $JTREGEXE in
41481   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
41482   ac_cv_path_JTREGEXE="$JTREGEXE" # Let the user override the test with a path.
41483   ;;
41484   *)
41485   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
41486 for as_dir in $PATH
41487 do
41488   IFS=$as_save_IFS
41489   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
41490     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
41491   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
41492     ac_cv_path_JTREGEXE="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
41493     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
41494     break 2
41495   fi
41496 done
41497   done
41498 IFS=$as_save_IFS
41499 
41500   ;;
41501 esac
41502 fi
41503 JTREGEXE=$ac_cv_path_JTREGEXE
41504 if test -n "$JTREGEXE"; then
41505   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $JTREGEXE" >&5
41506 $as_echo "$JTREGEXE" >&6; }
41507 else
41508   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
41509 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
41510 fi
41511 
41512 
41513   test -n "$JTREGEXE" && break
41514 done
41515 
41516     else
41517       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
41518       # for the tool.
41519 
41520       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
41521       # for unknown variables in the end.
41522       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
41523 
41524       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
41525       tool_specified="$JTREGEXE"
41526       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
41527       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
41528         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
41529         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool JTREGEXE=$tool_basename" >&5
41530 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool JTREGEXE=$tool_basename" >&6;}
41531         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
41532 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
41533 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
41534 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
41535 if ${ac_cv_path_JTREGEXE+:} false; then :
41536   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
41537 else
41538   case $JTREGEXE in
41539   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
41540   ac_cv_path_JTREGEXE="$JTREGEXE" # Let the user override the test with a path.
41541   ;;
41542   *)
41543   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
41544 for as_dir in $PATH
41545 do
41546   IFS=$as_save_IFS
41547   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
41548     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
41549   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
41550     ac_cv_path_JTREGEXE="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
41551     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
41552     break 2
41553   fi
41554 done
41555   done
41556 IFS=$as_save_IFS
41557 
41558   ;;
41559 esac
41560 fi
41561 JTREGEXE=$ac_cv_path_JTREGEXE
41562 if test -n "$JTREGEXE"; then
41563   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $JTREGEXE" >&5
41564 $as_echo "$JTREGEXE" >&6; }
41565 else
41566   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
41567 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
41568 fi
41569 
41570 
41571         if test "x$JTREGEXE" = x; then
41572           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
41573         fi
41574       else
41575         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
41576         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool JTREGEXE=$tool_specified" >&5
41577 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool JTREGEXE=$tool_specified" >&6;}
41578         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for JTREGEXE" >&5
41579 $as_echo_n "checking for JTREGEXE... " >&6; }
41580         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
41581           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
41582 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
41583           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool JTREGEXE=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
41584         fi
41585         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
41586 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
41587       fi
41588     fi
41589   fi
41590 
41591 
41592 
41593   if test "x$JTREGEXE" = x; then
41594     as_fn_error $? "Could not find required tool for JTREGEXE" "$LINENO" 5
41595   fi
41596 
41597 
41598       JT_HOME="`$DIRNAME $JTREGEXE`"
41599     fi
41600   fi
41601 
41602 
41603 
41604 
41605 
41606 
41607   # Option used to tell the compiler whether to create 32- or 64-bit executables
41608   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xxlc; then
41609     COMPILER_TARGET_BITS_FLAG="-q"
41610   else
41611     COMPILER_TARGET_BITS_FLAG="-m"
41612   fi
41613 
41614 
41615   # FIXME: figure out if we should select AR flags depending on OS or toolchain.
41616   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xmacosx; then
41617     ARFLAGS="-r"
41618   elif test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xaix; then
41619     ARFLAGS="-X64"
41620   elif test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xwindows; then
41621     # lib.exe is used as AR to create static libraries.
41622     ARFLAGS="-nologo -NODEFAULTLIB:MSVCRT"
41623   else
41624     ARFLAGS=""
41625   fi
41626 
41627 
41628   ## Setup strip.
41629   # FIXME: should this really be per platform, or should it be per toolchain type?
41630   # strip is not provided by clang or solstudio; so guessing platform makes most sense.
41631   # FIXME: we should really only export STRIPFLAGS from here, not POST_STRIP_CMD.
41632   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xlinux; then
41633     STRIPFLAGS="-g"
41634   elif test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xsolaris; then
41635     STRIPFLAGS="-x"
41636   elif test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xmacosx; then
41637     STRIPFLAGS="-S"
41638   elif test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xaix; then
41639     STRIPFLAGS="-X32_64"
41640   fi
41641 
41642   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" != xwindows; then
41643     POST_STRIP_CMD="$STRIP $STRIPFLAGS"
41644   fi
41645 
41646 
41647   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xsolaris; then
41648     # FIXME: break out into MCSFLAGS
41649     POST_MCS_CMD="$MCS -d -a \"JDK $FULL_VERSION\""
41650   fi
41651 
41652 
41653   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xmicrosoft; then
41654     CC_OUT_OPTION=-Fo
41655     EXE_OUT_OPTION=-out:
41656     LD_OUT_OPTION=-out:
41657     AR_OUT_OPTION=-out:
41658   else
41659     # The option used to specify the target .o,.a or .so file.
41660     # When compiling, how to specify the to be created object file.
41661     CC_OUT_OPTION='-o$(SPACE)'
41662     # When linking, how to specify the to be created executable.
41663     EXE_OUT_OPTION='-o$(SPACE)'
41664     # When linking, how to specify the to be created dynamically linkable library.
41665     LD_OUT_OPTION='-o$(SPACE)'
41666     # When archiving, how to specify the to be create static archive for object files.
41667     AR_OUT_OPTION='rcs$(SPACE)'
41668   fi
41669 
41670 
41671 
41672 
41673 
41674   # On Windows, we need to set RC flags.
41675   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xmicrosoft; then
41676     RC_FLAGS="-nologo -l0x409"
41677     if test "x$VARIANT" = xOPT; then
41678       RC_FLAGS="$RC_FLAGS -DNDEBUG"
41679     fi
41680 
41681     # The version variables used to create RC_FLAGS may be overridden
41682     # in a custom configure script, or possibly the command line.
41683     # Let those variables be expanded at make time in spec.gmk.
41684     # The \$ are escaped to the shell, and the $(...) variables
41685     # are evaluated by make.
41686     RC_FLAGS="$RC_FLAGS \
41687         -D\"JDK_BUILD_ID=\$(FULL_VERSION)\" \
41688         -D\"JDK_COMPANY=\$(COMPANY_NAME)\" \
41689         -D\"JDK_COMPONENT=\$(PRODUCT_NAME) \$(JDK_RC_PLATFORM_NAME) binary\" \
41690         -D\"JDK_VER=\$(JDK_MINOR_VERSION).\$(JDK_MICRO_VERSION).\$(if \$(JDK_UPDATE_VERSION),\$(JDK_UPDATE_VERSION),0).\$(COOKED_BUILD_NUMBER)\" \
41691         -D\"JDK_COPYRIGHT=Copyright \xA9 $COPYRIGHT_YEAR\" \
41692         -D\"JDK_NAME=\$(PRODUCT_NAME) \$(JDK_RC_PLATFORM_NAME) \$(JDK_MINOR_VERSION) \$(JDK_UPDATE_META_TAG)\" \
41693         -D\"JDK_FVER=\$(JDK_MINOR_VERSION),\$(JDK_MICRO_VERSION),\$(if \$(JDK_UPDATE_VERSION),\$(JDK_UPDATE_VERSION),0),\$(COOKED_BUILD_NUMBER)\""
41694   fi
41695 
41696 
41697   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xmicrosoft; then
41698     # silence copyright notice and other headers.
41699     COMMON_CCXXFLAGS="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS -nologo"
41700   fi
41701 
41702   if test "x$SYSROOT" != "x"; then
41703     if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xsolstudio; then
41704       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xsolaris; then
41705         # Solaris Studio does not have a concept of sysroot. Instead we must
41706         # make sure the default include and lib dirs are appended to each
41707         # compile and link command line.
41708         SYSROOT_CFLAGS="-I$SYSROOT/usr/include"
41709         SYSROOT_LDFLAGS="-L$SYSROOT/usr/lib$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ISADIR \
41710             -L$SYSROOT/lib$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ISADIR \
41711             -L$SYSROOT/usr/ccs/lib$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ISADIR"
41712       fi
41713     elif test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xmacosx; then
41714       # Apple only wants -isysroot <path>, but we also need -iframework<path>/System/Library/Frameworks
41715       SYSROOT_CFLAGS="-isysroot \"$SYSROOT\" -iframework\"$SYSROOT/System/Library/Frameworks\""
41716       SYSROOT_LDFLAGS=$SYSROOT_CFLAGS
41717     elif test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xgcc; then
41718       SYSROOT_CFLAGS="--sysroot=$SYSROOT"
41719       SYSROOT_LDFLAGS="--sysroot=$SYSROOT"
41720     elif test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xclang; then
41721       SYSROOT_CFLAGS="-isysroot \"$SYSROOT\""
41722       SYSROOT_LDFLAGS="-isysroot \"$SYSROOT\""
41723     fi
41724     # Propagate the sysroot args to hotspot
41725     LEGACY_EXTRA_CFLAGS="$LEGACY_EXTRA_CFLAGS $SYSROOT_CFLAGS"
41726     LEGACY_EXTRA_CXXFLAGS="$LEGACY_EXTRA_CXXFLAGS $SYSROOT_CFLAGS"
41727     LEGACY_EXTRA_LDFLAGS="$LEGACY_EXTRA_LDFLAGS $SYSROOT_LDFLAGS"
41728   fi
41729 
41730   # These always need to be set, or we can't find the frameworks embedded in JavaVM.framework
41731   # set this here so it doesn't have to be peppered throughout the forest
41732   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xmacosx; then
41733     SYSROOT_CFLAGS="$SYSROOT_CFLAGS -F\"$SYSROOT/System/Library/Frameworks/JavaVM.framework/Frameworks\""
41734     SYSROOT_LDFLAGS="$SYSROOT_LDFLAGS -F\"$SYSROOT/System/Library/Frameworks/JavaVM.framework/Frameworks\""
41735   fi
41736 
41737 
41738 
41739 
41740 
41741 # FIXME: Currently we must test this after toolchain but before flags. Fix!
41742 
41743 # Now we can test some aspects on the target using configure macros.
41744 
41745 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for ANSI C header files" >&5
41746 $as_echo_n "checking for ANSI C header files... " >&6; }
41747 if ${ac_cv_header_stdc+:} false; then :
41748   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
41749 else
41750   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
41751 /* end confdefs.h.  */
41752 #include <stdlib.h>
41753 #include <stdarg.h>
41754 #include <string.h>
41755 #include <float.h>
41756 
41757 int
41758 main ()
41759 {
41760 
41761   ;
41762   return 0;
41763 }
41764 _ACEOF
41765 if ac_fn_cxx_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
41766   ac_cv_header_stdc=yes
41767 else
41768   ac_cv_header_stdc=no
41769 fi
41770 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
41771 
41772 if test $ac_cv_header_stdc = yes; then
41773   # SunOS 4.x string.h does not declare mem*, contrary to ANSI.
41774   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
41775 /* end confdefs.h.  */
41776 #include <string.h>
41777 
41778 _ACEOF
41779 if (eval "$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext") 2>&5 |
41780   $EGREP "memchr" >/dev/null 2>&1; then :
41781 
41782 else
41783   ac_cv_header_stdc=no
41784 fi
41785 rm -f conftest*
41786 
41787 fi
41788 
41789 if test $ac_cv_header_stdc = yes; then
41790   # ISC 2.0.2 stdlib.h does not declare free, contrary to ANSI.
41791   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
41792 /* end confdefs.h.  */
41793 #include <stdlib.h>
41794 
41795 _ACEOF
41796 if (eval "$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext") 2>&5 |
41797   $EGREP "free" >/dev/null 2>&1; then :
41798 
41799 else
41800   ac_cv_header_stdc=no
41801 fi
41802 rm -f conftest*
41803 
41804 fi
41805 
41806 if test $ac_cv_header_stdc = yes; then
41807   # /bin/cc in Irix-4.0.5 gets non-ANSI ctype macros unless using -ansi.
41808   if test "$cross_compiling" = yes; then :
41809   :
41810 else
41811   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
41812 /* end confdefs.h.  */
41813 #include <ctype.h>
41814 #include <stdlib.h>
41815 #if ((' ' & 0x0FF) == 0x020)
41816 # define ISLOWER(c) ('a' <= (c) && (c) <= 'z')
41817 # define TOUPPER(c) (ISLOWER(c) ? 'A' + ((c) - 'a') : (c))
41818 #else
41819 # define ISLOWER(c) \
41820                    (('a' <= (c) && (c) <= 'i') \
41821                      || ('j' <= (c) && (c) <= 'r') \
41822                      || ('s' <= (c) && (c) <= 'z'))
41823 # define TOUPPER(c) (ISLOWER(c) ? ((c) | 0x40) : (c))
41824 #endif
41825 
41826 #define XOR(e, f) (((e) && !(f)) || (!(e) && (f)))
41827 int
41828 main ()
41829 {
41830   int i;
41831   for (i = 0; i < 256; i++)
41832     if (XOR (islower (i), ISLOWER (i))
41833         || toupper (i) != TOUPPER (i))
41834       return 2;
41835   return 0;
41836 }
41837 _ACEOF
41838 if ac_fn_cxx_try_run "$LINENO"; then :
41839 
41840 else
41841   ac_cv_header_stdc=no
41842 fi
41843 rm -f core *.core core.conftest.* gmon.out bb.out conftest$ac_exeext \
41844   conftest.$ac_objext conftest.beam conftest.$ac_ext
41845 fi
41846 
41847 fi
41848 fi
41849 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_header_stdc" >&5
41850 $as_echo "$ac_cv_header_stdc" >&6; }
41851 if test $ac_cv_header_stdc = yes; then
41852 
41853 $as_echo "#define STDC_HEADERS 1" >>confdefs.h
41854 
41855 fi
41856 
41857 # On IRIX 5.3, sys/types and inttypes.h are conflicting.
41858 for ac_header in sys/types.h sys/stat.h stdlib.h string.h memory.h strings.h \
41859                   inttypes.h stdint.h unistd.h
41860 do :
41861   as_ac_Header=`$as_echo "ac_cv_header_$ac_header" | $as_tr_sh`
41862 ac_fn_cxx_check_header_compile "$LINENO" "$ac_header" "$as_ac_Header" "$ac_includes_default
41863 "
41864 if eval test \"x\$"$as_ac_Header"\" = x"yes"; then :
41865   cat >>confdefs.h <<_ACEOF
41866 #define `$as_echo "HAVE_$ac_header" | $as_tr_cpp` 1
41867 _ACEOF
41868 
41869 fi
41870 
41871 done
41872 
41873 
41874 
41875   ###############################################################################
41876   #
41877   # Now we check if libjvm.so will use 32 or 64 bit pointers for the C/C++ code.
41878   # (The JVM can use 32 or 64 bit Java pointers but that decision
41879   # is made at runtime.)
41880   #
41881 
41882   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xsolaris || test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xaix; then
41883     # Always specify -m flag on Solaris
41884     # And -q on AIX because otherwise the compiler produces 32-bit objects by default
41885 
41886   # When we add flags to the "official" CFLAGS etc, we need to
41887   # keep track of these additions in ADDED_CFLAGS etc. These
41888   # will later be checked to make sure only controlled additions
41889   # have been made to CFLAGS etc.
41890   ADDED_CFLAGS=" ${COMPILER_TARGET_BITS_FLAG}${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS}"
41891   ADDED_CXXFLAGS=" ${COMPILER_TARGET_BITS_FLAG}${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS}"
41892   ADDED_LDFLAGS=" ${COMPILER_TARGET_BITS_FLAG}${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS}"
41893 
41894   CFLAGS="${CFLAGS}${ADDED_CFLAGS}"
41895   CXXFLAGS="${CXXFLAGS}${ADDED_CXXFLAGS}"
41896   LDFLAGS="${LDFLAGS}${ADDED_LDFLAGS}"
41897 
41898   CFLAGS_JDK="${CFLAGS_JDK}${ADDED_CFLAGS}"
41899   CXXFLAGS_JDK="${CXXFLAGS_JDK}${ADDED_CXXFLAGS}"
41900   LDFLAGS_JDK="${LDFLAGS_JDK}${ADDED_LDFLAGS}"
41901 
41902   elif test "x$COMPILE_TYPE" = xreduced; then
41903     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS_TYPE" = xunix; then
41904       # Specify -m if running reduced on unix platforms
41905 
41906   # When we add flags to the "official" CFLAGS etc, we need to
41907   # keep track of these additions in ADDED_CFLAGS etc. These
41908   # will later be checked to make sure only controlled additions
41909   # have been made to CFLAGS etc.
41910   ADDED_CFLAGS=" ${COMPILER_TARGET_BITS_FLAG}${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS}"
41911   ADDED_CXXFLAGS=" ${COMPILER_TARGET_BITS_FLAG}${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS}"
41912   ADDED_LDFLAGS=" ${COMPILER_TARGET_BITS_FLAG}${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS}"
41913 
41914   CFLAGS="${CFLAGS}${ADDED_CFLAGS}"
41915   CXXFLAGS="${CXXFLAGS}${ADDED_CXXFLAGS}"
41916   LDFLAGS="${LDFLAGS}${ADDED_LDFLAGS}"
41917 
41918   CFLAGS_JDK="${CFLAGS_JDK}${ADDED_CFLAGS}"
41919   CXXFLAGS_JDK="${CXXFLAGS_JDK}${ADDED_CXXFLAGS}"
41920   LDFLAGS_JDK="${LDFLAGS_JDK}${ADDED_LDFLAGS}"
41921 
41922     fi
41923   fi
41924 
41925   # Make compilation sanity check
41926   for ac_header in stdio.h
41927 do :
41928   ac_fn_cxx_check_header_mongrel "$LINENO" "stdio.h" "ac_cv_header_stdio_h" "$ac_includes_default"
41929 if test "x$ac_cv_header_stdio_h" = xyes; then :
41930   cat >>confdefs.h <<_ACEOF
41931 #define HAVE_STDIO_H 1
41932 _ACEOF
41933 
41934 else
41935 
41936     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Failed to compile stdio.h. This likely implies missing compile dependencies." >&5
41937 $as_echo "$as_me: Failed to compile stdio.h. This likely implies missing compile dependencies." >&6;}
41938     if test "x$COMPILE_TYPE" = xreduced; then
41939       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You are doing a reduced build. Check that you have 32-bit libraries installed." >&5
41940 $as_echo "$as_me: You are doing a reduced build. Check that you have 32-bit libraries installed." >&6;}
41941     elif test "x$COMPILE_TYPE" = xcross; then
41942       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: You are doing a cross-compilation. Check that you have all target platform libraries installed." >&5
41943 $as_echo "$as_me: You are doing a cross-compilation. Check that you have all target platform libraries installed." >&6;}
41944     fi
41945     as_fn_error $? "Cannot continue." "$LINENO" 5
41946 
41947 fi
41948 
41949 done
41950 
41951 
41952   # The cast to long int works around a bug in the HP C Compiler
41953 # version HP92453-01 B.11.11.23709.GP, which incorrectly rejects
41954 # declarations like `int a3[[(sizeof (unsigned char)) >= 0]];'.
41955 # This bug is HP SR number 8606223364.
41956 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking size of int *" >&5
41957 $as_echo_n "checking size of int *... " >&6; }
41958 if ${ac_cv_sizeof_int_p+:} false; then :
41959   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
41960 else
41961   if ac_fn_cxx_compute_int "$LINENO" "(long int) (sizeof (int *))" "ac_cv_sizeof_int_p"        "$ac_includes_default"; then :
41962 
41963 else
41964   if test "$ac_cv_type_int_p" = yes; then
41965      { { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: error: in \`$ac_pwd':" >&5
41966 $as_echo "$as_me: error: in \`$ac_pwd':" >&2;}
41967 as_fn_error 77 "cannot compute sizeof (int *)
41968 See \`config.log' for more details" "$LINENO" 5; }
41969    else
41970      ac_cv_sizeof_int_p=0
41971    fi
41972 fi
41973 
41974 fi
41975 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_sizeof_int_p" >&5
41976 $as_echo "$ac_cv_sizeof_int_p" >&6; }
41977 
41978 
41979 
41980 cat >>confdefs.h <<_ACEOF
41981 #define SIZEOF_INT_P $ac_cv_sizeof_int_p
41982 _ACEOF
41983 
41984 
41985 
41986   # AC_CHECK_SIZEOF defines 'ac_cv_sizeof_int_p' to hold the number of bytes used by an 'int*'
41987   if test "x$ac_cv_sizeof_int_p" = x; then
41988     # The test failed, lets stick to the assumed value.
41989     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: The number of bits in the target could not be determined, using $OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS." >&5
41990 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: The number of bits in the target could not be determined, using $OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS." >&2;}
41991   else
41992     TESTED_TARGET_CPU_BITS=`expr 8 \* $ac_cv_sizeof_int_p`
41993 
41994     if test "x$TESTED_TARGET_CPU_BITS" != "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS"; then
41995       # This situation may happen on 64-bit platforms where the compiler by default only generates 32-bit objects
41996       # Let's try to implicitely set the compilers target architecture and retry the test
41997       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The tested number of bits in the target ($TESTED_TARGET_CPU_BITS) differs from the number of bits expected to be found in the target ($OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS)." >&5
41998 $as_echo "$as_me: The tested number of bits in the target ($TESTED_TARGET_CPU_BITS) differs from the number of bits expected to be found in the target ($OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS)." >&6;}
41999       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: I'll retry after setting the platforms compiler target bits flag to ${COMPILER_TARGET_BITS_FLAG}${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS}" >&5
42000 $as_echo "$as_me: I'll retry after setting the platforms compiler target bits flag to ${COMPILER_TARGET_BITS_FLAG}${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS}" >&6;}
42001 
42002   # When we add flags to the "official" CFLAGS etc, we need to
42003   # keep track of these additions in ADDED_CFLAGS etc. These
42004   # will later be checked to make sure only controlled additions
42005   # have been made to CFLAGS etc.
42006   ADDED_CFLAGS=" ${COMPILER_TARGET_BITS_FLAG}${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS}"
42007   ADDED_CXXFLAGS=" ${COMPILER_TARGET_BITS_FLAG}${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS}"
42008   ADDED_LDFLAGS=" ${COMPILER_TARGET_BITS_FLAG}${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS}"
42009 
42010   CFLAGS="${CFLAGS}${ADDED_CFLAGS}"
42011   CXXFLAGS="${CXXFLAGS}${ADDED_CXXFLAGS}"
42012   LDFLAGS="${LDFLAGS}${ADDED_LDFLAGS}"
42013 
42014   CFLAGS_JDK="${CFLAGS_JDK}${ADDED_CFLAGS}"
42015   CXXFLAGS_JDK="${CXXFLAGS_JDK}${ADDED_CXXFLAGS}"
42016   LDFLAGS_JDK="${LDFLAGS_JDK}${ADDED_LDFLAGS}"
42017 
42018 
42019       # We have to unset 'ac_cv_sizeof_int_p' first, otherwise AC_CHECK_SIZEOF will use the previously cached value!
42020       unset ac_cv_sizeof_int_p
42021       # And we have to undef the definition of SIZEOF_INT_P in confdefs.h by the previous invocation of AC_CHECK_SIZEOF
42022       cat >>confdefs.h <<_ACEOF
42023 #undef SIZEOF_INT_P
42024 _ACEOF
42025 
42026       # The cast to long int works around a bug in the HP C Compiler
42027 # version HP92453-01 B.11.11.23709.GP, which incorrectly rejects
42028 # declarations like `int a3[[(sizeof (unsigned char)) >= 0]];'.
42029 # This bug is HP SR number 8606223364.
42030 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking size of int *" >&5
42031 $as_echo_n "checking size of int *... " >&6; }
42032 if ${ac_cv_sizeof_int_p+:} false; then :
42033   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
42034 else
42035   if ac_fn_cxx_compute_int "$LINENO" "(long int) (sizeof (int *))" "ac_cv_sizeof_int_p"        "$ac_includes_default"; then :
42036 
42037 else
42038   if test "$ac_cv_type_int_p" = yes; then
42039      { { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: error: in \`$ac_pwd':" >&5
42040 $as_echo "$as_me: error: in \`$ac_pwd':" >&2;}
42041 as_fn_error 77 "cannot compute sizeof (int *)
42042 See \`config.log' for more details" "$LINENO" 5; }
42043    else
42044      ac_cv_sizeof_int_p=0
42045    fi
42046 fi
42047 
42048 fi
42049 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_sizeof_int_p" >&5
42050 $as_echo "$ac_cv_sizeof_int_p" >&6; }
42051 
42052 
42053 
42054 cat >>confdefs.h <<_ACEOF
42055 #define SIZEOF_INT_P $ac_cv_sizeof_int_p
42056 _ACEOF
42057 
42058 
42059 
42060       TESTED_TARGET_CPU_BITS=`expr 8 \* $ac_cv_sizeof_int_p`
42061 
42062       if test "x$TESTED_TARGET_CPU_BITS" != "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS"; then
42063         as_fn_error $? "The tested number of bits in the target ($TESTED_TARGET_CPU_BITS) differs from the number of bits expected to be found in the target ($OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS)" "$LINENO" 5
42064       fi
42065     fi
42066   fi
42067 
42068   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for target address size" >&5
42069 $as_echo_n "checking for target address size... " >&6; }
42070   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS bits" >&5
42071 $as_echo "$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS bits" >&6; }
42072 
42073 
42074   ###############################################################################
42075   #
42076   # Is the target little of big endian?
42077   #
42078    { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking whether byte ordering is bigendian" >&5
42079 $as_echo_n "checking whether byte ordering is bigendian... " >&6; }
42080 if ${ac_cv_c_bigendian+:} false; then :
42081   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
42082 else
42083   ac_cv_c_bigendian=unknown
42084     # See if we're dealing with a universal compiler.
42085     cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
42086 /* end confdefs.h.  */
42087 #ifndef __APPLE_CC__
42088                not a universal capable compiler
42089              #endif
42090              typedef int dummy;
42091 
42092 _ACEOF
42093 if ac_fn_cxx_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
42094 
42095         # Check for potential -arch flags.  It is not universal unless
42096         # there are at least two -arch flags with different values.
42097         ac_arch=
42098         ac_prev=
42099         for ac_word in $CC $CFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS; do
42100          if test -n "$ac_prev"; then
42101            case $ac_word in
42102              i?86 | x86_64 | ppc | ppc64)
42103                if test -z "$ac_arch" || test "$ac_arch" = "$ac_word"; then
42104                  ac_arch=$ac_word
42105                else
42106                  ac_cv_c_bigendian=universal
42107                  break
42108                fi
42109                ;;
42110            esac
42111            ac_prev=
42112          elif test "x$ac_word" = "x-arch"; then
42113            ac_prev=arch
42114          fi
42115        done
42116 fi
42117 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
42118     if test $ac_cv_c_bigendian = unknown; then
42119       # See if sys/param.h defines the BYTE_ORDER macro.
42120       cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
42121 /* end confdefs.h.  */
42122 #include <sys/types.h>
42123              #include <sys/param.h>
42124 
42125 int
42126 main ()
42127 {
42128 #if ! (defined BYTE_ORDER && defined BIG_ENDIAN \
42129                      && defined LITTLE_ENDIAN && BYTE_ORDER && BIG_ENDIAN \
42130                      && LITTLE_ENDIAN)
42131               bogus endian macros
42132              #endif
42133 
42134   ;
42135   return 0;
42136 }
42137 _ACEOF
42138 if ac_fn_cxx_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
42139   # It does; now see whether it defined to BIG_ENDIAN or not.
42140          cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
42141 /* end confdefs.h.  */
42142 #include <sys/types.h>
42143                 #include <sys/param.h>
42144 
42145 int
42146 main ()
42147 {
42148 #if BYTE_ORDER != BIG_ENDIAN
42149                  not big endian
42150                 #endif
42151 
42152   ;
42153   return 0;
42154 }
42155 _ACEOF
42156 if ac_fn_cxx_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
42157   ac_cv_c_bigendian=yes
42158 else
42159   ac_cv_c_bigendian=no
42160 fi
42161 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
42162 fi
42163 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
42164     fi
42165     if test $ac_cv_c_bigendian = unknown; then
42166       # See if <limits.h> defines _LITTLE_ENDIAN or _BIG_ENDIAN (e.g., Solaris).
42167       cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
42168 /* end confdefs.h.  */
42169 #include <limits.h>
42170 
42171 int
42172 main ()
42173 {
42174 #if ! (defined _LITTLE_ENDIAN || defined _BIG_ENDIAN)
42175               bogus endian macros
42176              #endif
42177 
42178   ;
42179   return 0;
42180 }
42181 _ACEOF
42182 if ac_fn_cxx_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
42183   # It does; now see whether it defined to _BIG_ENDIAN or not.
42184          cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
42185 /* end confdefs.h.  */
42186 #include <limits.h>
42187 
42188 int
42189 main ()
42190 {
42191 #ifndef _BIG_ENDIAN
42192                  not big endian
42193                 #endif
42194 
42195   ;
42196   return 0;
42197 }
42198 _ACEOF
42199 if ac_fn_cxx_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
42200   ac_cv_c_bigendian=yes
42201 else
42202   ac_cv_c_bigendian=no
42203 fi
42204 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
42205 fi
42206 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
42207     fi
42208     if test $ac_cv_c_bigendian = unknown; then
42209       # Compile a test program.
42210       if test "$cross_compiling" = yes; then :
42211   # Try to guess by grepping values from an object file.
42212          cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
42213 /* end confdefs.h.  */
42214 short int ascii_mm[] =
42215                   { 0x4249, 0x4765, 0x6E44, 0x6961, 0x6E53, 0x7953, 0 };
42216                 short int ascii_ii[] =
42217                   { 0x694C, 0x5454, 0x656C, 0x6E45, 0x6944, 0x6E61, 0 };
42218                 int use_ascii (int i) {
42219                   return ascii_mm[i] + ascii_ii[i];
42220                 }
42221                 short int ebcdic_ii[] =
42222                   { 0x89D3, 0xE3E3, 0x8593, 0x95C5, 0x89C4, 0x9581, 0 };
42223                 short int ebcdic_mm[] =
42224                   { 0xC2C9, 0xC785, 0x95C4, 0x8981, 0x95E2, 0xA8E2, 0 };
42225                 int use_ebcdic (int i) {
42226                   return ebcdic_mm[i] + ebcdic_ii[i];
42227                 }
42228                 extern int foo;
42229 
42230 int
42231 main ()
42232 {
42233 return use_ascii (foo) == use_ebcdic (foo);
42234   ;
42235   return 0;
42236 }
42237 _ACEOF
42238 if ac_fn_cxx_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
42239   if grep BIGenDianSyS conftest.$ac_objext >/dev/null; then
42240               ac_cv_c_bigendian=yes
42241             fi
42242             if grep LiTTleEnDian conftest.$ac_objext >/dev/null ; then
42243               if test "$ac_cv_c_bigendian" = unknown; then
42244                 ac_cv_c_bigendian=no
42245               else
42246                 # finding both strings is unlikely to happen, but who knows?
42247                 ac_cv_c_bigendian=unknown
42248               fi
42249             fi
42250 fi
42251 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
42252 else
42253   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
42254 /* end confdefs.h.  */
42255 $ac_includes_default
42256 int
42257 main ()
42258 {
42259 
42260              /* Are we little or big endian?  From Harbison&Steele.  */
42261              union
42262              {
42263                long int l;
42264                char c[sizeof (long int)];
42265              } u;
42266              u.l = 1;
42267              return u.c[sizeof (long int) - 1] == 1;
42268 
42269   ;
42270   return 0;
42271 }
42272 _ACEOF
42273 if ac_fn_cxx_try_run "$LINENO"; then :
42274   ac_cv_c_bigendian=no
42275 else
42276   ac_cv_c_bigendian=yes
42277 fi
42278 rm -f core *.core core.conftest.* gmon.out bb.out conftest$ac_exeext \
42279   conftest.$ac_objext conftest.beam conftest.$ac_ext
42280 fi
42281 
42282     fi
42283 fi
42284 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_c_bigendian" >&5
42285 $as_echo "$ac_cv_c_bigendian" >&6; }
42286  case $ac_cv_c_bigendian in #(
42287    yes)
42288      ENDIAN="big";; #(
42289    no)
42290      ENDIAN="little" ;; #(
42291    universal)
42292      ENDIAN="universal_endianness"
42293      ;; #(
42294    *)
42295      ENDIAN="unknown" ;;
42296  esac
42297 
42298 
42299   if test "x$ENDIAN" = xuniversal_endianness; then
42300     as_fn_error $? "Building with both big and little endianness is not supported" "$LINENO" 5
42301   fi
42302   if test "x$ENDIAN" != "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ENDIAN"; then
42303     as_fn_error $? "The tested endian in the target ($ENDIAN) differs from the endian expected to be found in the target ($OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ENDIAN)" "$LINENO" 5
42304   fi
42305 
42306 
42307 # Configure flags for the tools
42308 
42309   ###############################################################################
42310   #
42311   # How to compile shared libraries.
42312   #
42313 
42314   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xgcc; then
42315     PICFLAG="-fPIC"
42316     C_FLAG_REORDER=''
42317     CXX_FLAG_REORDER=''
42318 
42319     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xmacosx; then
42320       # Linking is different on MacOSX
42321       SHARED_LIBRARY_FLAGS="-dynamiclib -compatibility_version 1.0.0 -current_version 1.0.0 $PICFLAG"
42322       SET_EXECUTABLE_ORIGIN='-Xlinker -rpath -Xlinker @loader_path/.'
42323       SET_SHARED_LIBRARY_ORIGIN="$SET_EXECUTABLE_ORIGIN"
42324       SET_SHARED_LIBRARY_NAME='-Xlinker -install_name -Xlinker @rpath/$1'
42325       SET_SHARED_LIBRARY_MAPFILE=''
42326     else
42327       # Default works for linux, might work on other platforms as well.
42328       SHARED_LIBRARY_FLAGS='-shared'
42329       SET_EXECUTABLE_ORIGIN='-Xlinker -rpath -Xlinker \$$$$ORIGIN$1'
42330       SET_SHARED_LIBRARY_ORIGIN="-Xlinker -z -Xlinker origin $SET_EXECUTABLE_ORIGIN"
42331       SET_SHARED_LIBRARY_NAME='-Xlinker -soname=$1'
42332       SET_SHARED_LIBRARY_MAPFILE='-Xlinker -version-script=$1'
42333     fi
42334   elif test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xclang; then
42335     PICFLAG=''
42336     C_FLAG_REORDER=''
42337     CXX_FLAG_REORDER=''
42338 
42339     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xmacosx; then
42340       # Linking is different on MacOSX
42341       SHARED_LIBRARY_FLAGS="-dynamiclib -compatibility_version 1.0.0 -current_version 1.0.0 $PICFLAG"
42342       SET_EXECUTABLE_ORIGIN='-Xlinker -rpath -Xlinker @loader_path/.'
42343       SET_SHARED_LIBRARY_ORIGIN="$SET_EXECUTABLE_ORIGIN"
42344       SET_SHARED_LIBRARY_NAME='-Xlinker -install_name -Xlinker @rpath/$1'
42345       SET_SHARED_LIBRARY_MAPFILE=''
42346     else
42347       # Default works for linux, might work on other platforms as well.
42348       SHARED_LIBRARY_FLAGS='-shared'
42349       SET_EXECUTABLE_ORIGIN='-Xlinker -rpath -Xlinker \$$$$ORIGIN$1'
42350       SET_SHARED_LIBRARY_ORIGIN="-Xlinker -z -Xlinker origin $SET_EXECUTABLE_ORIGIN"
42351       SET_SHARED_LIBRARY_NAME='-Xlinker -soname=$1'
42352       SET_SHARED_LIBRARY_MAPFILE='-Xlinker -version-script=$1'
42353     fi
42354   elif test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xsolstudio; then
42355     PICFLAG="-KPIC"
42356     C_FLAG_REORDER='-xF'
42357     CXX_FLAG_REORDER='-xF'
42358     SHARED_LIBRARY_FLAGS="-G"
42359     SET_EXECUTABLE_ORIGIN='-R\$$$$ORIGIN$1'
42360     SET_SHARED_LIBRARY_ORIGIN="$SET_EXECUTABLE_ORIGIN"
42361     SET_SHARED_LIBRARY_NAME=''
42362     SET_SHARED_LIBRARY_MAPFILE='-M$1'
42363   elif test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xxlc; then
42364     PICFLAG="-qpic=large"
42365     C_FLAG_REORDER=''
42366     CXX_FLAG_REORDER=''
42367     SHARED_LIBRARY_FLAGS="-qmkshrobj"
42368     SET_EXECUTABLE_ORIGIN=""
42369     SET_SHARED_LIBRARY_ORIGIN=''
42370     SET_SHARED_LIBRARY_NAME=''
42371     SET_SHARED_LIBRARY_MAPFILE=''
42372   elif test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xmicrosoft; then
42373     PICFLAG=""
42374     C_FLAG_REORDER=''
42375     CXX_FLAG_REORDER=''
42376     SHARED_LIBRARY_FLAGS="-LD"
42377     SET_EXECUTABLE_ORIGIN=''
42378     SET_SHARED_LIBRARY_ORIGIN=''
42379     SET_SHARED_LIBRARY_NAME=''
42380     SET_SHARED_LIBRARY_MAPFILE=''
42381   fi
42382 
42383 
42384 
42385 
42386 
42387 
42388 
42389 
42390 
42391   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xsolaris; then
42392     CFLAGS_JDK="${CFLAGS_JDK} -D__solaris__"
42393     CXXFLAGS_JDK="${CXXFLAGS_JDK} -D__solaris__"
42394     CFLAGS_JDKLIB_EXTRA='-xstrconst'
42395   fi
42396   # The (cross) compiler is now configured, we can now test capabilities
42397   # of the target platform.
42398 
42399 
42400 
42401   ###############################################################################
42402   #
42403   # Setup the opt flags for different compilers
42404   # and different operating systems.
42405   #
42406 
42407   # FIXME: this was indirectly the old default, but just inherited.
42408   # if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xmicrosoft; then
42409   #   C_FLAG_DEPS="-MMD -MF"
42410   # fi
42411 
42412   # Generate make dependency files
42413   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xgcc; then
42414     C_FLAG_DEPS="-MMD -MF"
42415   elif test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xclang; then
42416     C_FLAG_DEPS="-MMD -MF"
42417   elif test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xsolstudio; then
42418     C_FLAG_DEPS="-xMMD -xMF"
42419   elif test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xxlc; then
42420     C_FLAG_DEPS="-qmakedep=gcc -MF"
42421   fi
42422   CXX_FLAG_DEPS="$C_FLAG_DEPS"
42423 
42424 
42425 
42426   # Debug symbols
42427   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xgcc; then
42428     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = "x64" && test "x$DEBUG_LEVEL" = "xfastdebug"; then
42429       # reduce from default "-g2" option to save space
42430       CFLAGS_DEBUG_SYMBOLS="-g1"
42431       CXXFLAGS_DEBUG_SYMBOLS="-g1"
42432     else
42433       CFLAGS_DEBUG_SYMBOLS="-g"
42434       CXXFLAGS_DEBUG_SYMBOLS="-g"
42435     fi
42436   elif test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xclang; then
42437     CFLAGS_DEBUG_SYMBOLS="-g"
42438     CXXFLAGS_DEBUG_SYMBOLS="-g"
42439   elif test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xsolstudio; then
42440     CFLAGS_DEBUG_SYMBOLS="-g -xs"
42441     # FIXME: likely a bug, this disables debug symbols rather than enables them
42442     CXXFLAGS_DEBUG_SYMBOLS="-g0 -xs"
42443   elif test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xxlc; then
42444     CFLAGS_DEBUG_SYMBOLS="-g"
42445     CXXFLAGS_DEBUG_SYMBOLS="-g"
42446   fi
42447 
42448 
42449 
42450   # bounds, memory and behavior checking options
42451   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xgcc; then
42452     case $DEBUG_LEVEL in
42453     release )
42454       # no adjustment
42455       ;;
42456     fastdebug )
42457       # no adjustment
42458       ;;
42459     slowdebug )
42460       # Add runtime stack smashing and undefined behavior checks
42461       CFLAGS_DEBUG_OPTIONS="-fstack-protector-all --param ssp-buffer-size=1"
42462       CXXFLAGS_DEBUG_OPTIONS="-fstack-protector-all --param ssp-buffer-size=1"
42463       ;;
42464     esac
42465   fi
42466 
42467 
42468 
42469   # Optimization levels
42470   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xsolstudio; then
42471     CC_HIGHEST="$CC_HIGHEST -fns -fsimple -fsingle -xbuiltin=%all -xdepend -xrestrict -xlibmil"
42472 
42473     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ARCH" = "xx86"; then
42474       # FIXME: seems we always set -xregs=no%frameptr; put it elsewhere more global?
42475       C_O_FLAG_HIGHEST="-xO4 -Wu,-O4~yz $CC_HIGHEST -xalias_level=basic -xregs=no%frameptr"
42476       C_O_FLAG_HI="-xO4 -Wu,-O4~yz -xregs=no%frameptr"
42477       C_O_FLAG_NORM="-xO2 -Wu,-O2~yz -xregs=no%frameptr"
42478       C_O_FLAG_DEBUG="-xregs=no%frameptr"
42479       C_O_FLAG_NONE="-xregs=no%frameptr"
42480       CXX_O_FLAG_HIGHEST="-xO4 -Qoption ube -O4~yz $CC_HIGHEST -xregs=no%frameptr"
42481       CXX_O_FLAG_HI="-xO4 -Qoption ube -O4~yz -xregs=no%frameptr"
42482       CXX_O_FLAG_NORM="-xO2 -Qoption ube -O2~yz -xregs=no%frameptr"
42483       CXX_O_FLAG_DEBUG="-xregs=no%frameptr"
42484       CXX_O_FLAG_NONE="-xregs=no%frameptr"
42485       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = "x32"; then
42486         C_O_FLAG_HIGHEST="$C_O_FLAG_HIGHEST -xchip=pentium"
42487         CXX_O_FLAG_HIGHEST="$CXX_O_FLAG_HIGHEST -xchip=pentium"
42488       fi
42489     elif test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ARCH" = "xsparc"; then
42490       C_O_FLAG_HIGHEST="-xO4 -Wc,-Qrm-s -Wc,-Qiselect-T0 $CC_HIGHEST -xalias_level=basic -xprefetch=auto,explicit -xchip=ultra"
42491       C_O_FLAG_HI="-xO4 -Wc,-Qrm-s -Wc,-Qiselect-T0"
42492       C_O_FLAG_NORM="-xO2 -Wc,-Qrm-s -Wc,-Qiselect-T0"
42493       C_O_FLAG_DEBUG=""
42494       C_O_FLAG_NONE=""
42495       CXX_O_FLAG_HIGHEST="-xO4 -Qoption cg -Qrm-s -Qoption cg -Qiselect-T0 $CC_HIGHEST -xprefetch=auto,explicit -xchip=ultra"
42496       CXX_O_FLAG_HI="-xO4 -Qoption cg -Qrm-s -Qoption cg -Qiselect-T0"
42497       CXX_O_FLAG_NORM="-xO2 -Qoption cg -Qrm-s -Qoption cg -Qiselect-T0"
42498       C_O_FLAG_DEBUG=""
42499       CXX_O_FLAG_NONE=""
42500     fi
42501   else
42502     # The remaining toolchains share opt flags between CC and CXX;
42503     # setup for C and duplicate afterwards.
42504     if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xgcc; then
42505       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xmacosx; then
42506         # On MacOSX we optimize for size, something
42507         # we should do for all platforms?
42508         C_O_FLAG_HIGHEST="-Os"
42509         C_O_FLAG_HI="-Os"
42510         C_O_FLAG_NORM="-Os"
42511       else
42512         C_O_FLAG_HIGHEST="-O3"
42513         C_O_FLAG_HI="-O3"
42514         C_O_FLAG_NORM="-O2"
42515       fi
42516       C_O_FLAG_DEBUG="-O0"
42517       C_O_FLAG_NONE="-O0"
42518     elif test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xclang; then
42519       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xmacosx; then
42520         # On MacOSX we optimize for size, something
42521         # we should do for all platforms?
42522         C_O_FLAG_HIGHEST="-Os"
42523         C_O_FLAG_HI="-Os"
42524         C_O_FLAG_NORM="-Os"
42525       else
42526         C_O_FLAG_HIGHEST="-O3"
42527         C_O_FLAG_HI="-O3"
42528         C_O_FLAG_NORM="-O2"
42529       fi
42530       C_O_FLAG_DEBUG="-O0"
42531       C_O_FLAG_NONE="-O0"
42532     elif test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xxlc; then
42533       C_O_FLAG_HIGHEST="-O3"
42534       C_O_FLAG_HI="-O3 -qstrict"
42535       C_O_FLAG_NORM="-O2"
42536       C_O_FLAG_DEBUG="-qnoopt"
42537       C_O_FLAG_NONE="-qnoop"
42538     elif test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xmicrosoft; then
42539       C_O_FLAG_HIGHEST="-O2"
42540       C_O_FLAG_HI="-O1"
42541       C_O_FLAG_NORM="-O1"
42542       C_O_FLAG_DEBUG="-Od"
42543       C_O_FLAG_NONE="-Od"
42544     fi
42545     CXX_O_FLAG_HIGHEST="$C_O_FLAG_HIGHEST"
42546     CXX_O_FLAG_HI="$C_O_FLAG_HI"
42547     CXX_O_FLAG_NORM="$C_O_FLAG_NORM"
42548     CXX_O_FLAG_DEBUG="$C_O_FLAG_DEBUG"
42549     CXX_O_FLAG_NONE="$C_O_FLAG_NONE"
42550   fi
42551 
42552   # Adjust optimization flags according to debug level.
42553   case $DEBUG_LEVEL in
42554     release )
42555       # no adjustment
42556       ;;
42557     fastdebug )
42558       # Not quite so much optimization
42559       C_O_FLAG_HI="$C_O_FLAG_NORM"
42560       CXX_O_FLAG_HI="$CXX_O_FLAG_NORM"
42561       ;;
42562     slowdebug )
42563       # Disable optimization
42564       C_O_FLAG_HIGHEST="$C_O_FLAG_DEBUG"
42565       C_O_FLAG_HI="$C_O_FLAG_DEBUG"
42566       C_O_FLAG_NORM="$C_O_FLAG_DEBUG"
42567       CXX_O_FLAG_HIGHEST="$CXX_O_FLAG_DEBUG"
42568       CXX_O_FLAG_HI="$CXX_O_FLAG_DEBUG"
42569       CXX_O_FLAG_NORM="$CXX_O_FLAG_DEBUG"
42570       ;;
42571   esac
42572 
42573 
42574 
42575 
42576 
42577 
42578 
42579 
42580 
42581 
42582 
42583 
42584 
42585   # Special extras...
42586   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xsolstudio; then
42587     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ARCH" = "xsparc"; then
42588       CFLAGS_JDKLIB_EXTRA="${CFLAGS_JDKLIB_EXTRA} -xregs=no%appl"
42589       CXXFLAGS_JDKLIB_EXTRA="${CXXFLAGS_JDKLIB_EXTRA} -xregs=no%appl"
42590     fi
42591   elif test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xxlc; then
42592     LDFLAGS_JDK="${LDFLAGS_JDK} -q64 -brtl -bnolibpath -liconv -bexpall"
42593     CFLAGS_JDK="${CFLAGS_JDK} -qchars=signed -q64 -qfullpath -qsaveopt"
42594     CXXFLAGS_JDK="${CXXFLAGS_JDK} -qchars=signed -q64 -qfullpath -qsaveopt"
42595   fi
42596 
42597   if test "x$CFLAGS" != "x${ADDED_CFLAGS}"; then
42598     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring CFLAGS($CFLAGS) found in environment. Use --with-extra-cflags" >&5
42599 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring CFLAGS($CFLAGS) found in environment. Use --with-extra-cflags" >&2;}
42600   fi
42601 
42602   if test "x$CXXFLAGS" != "x${ADDED_CXXFLAGS}"; then
42603     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring CXXFLAGS($CXXFLAGS) found in environment. Use --with-extra-cxxflags" >&5
42604 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring CXXFLAGS($CXXFLAGS) found in environment. Use --with-extra-cxxflags" >&2;}
42605   fi
42606 
42607   if test "x$LDFLAGS" != "x${ADDED_LDFLAGS}"; then
42608     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring LDFLAGS($LDFLAGS) found in environment. Use --with-extra-ldflags" >&5
42609 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring LDFLAGS($LDFLAGS) found in environment. Use --with-extra-ldflags" >&2;}
42610   fi
42611 
42612 
42613 # Check whether --with-extra-cflags was given.
42614 if test "${with_extra_cflags+set}" = set; then :
42615   withval=$with_extra_cflags;
42616 fi
42617 
42618 
42619 
42620 # Check whether --with-extra-cxxflags was given.
42621 if test "${with_extra_cxxflags+set}" = set; then :
42622   withval=$with_extra_cxxflags;
42623 fi
42624 
42625 
42626 
42627 # Check whether --with-extra-ldflags was given.
42628 if test "${with_extra_ldflags+set}" = set; then :
42629   withval=$with_extra_ldflags;
42630 fi
42631 
42632 
42633   CFLAGS_JDK="${CFLAGS_JDK} $with_extra_cflags"
42634   CXXFLAGS_JDK="${CXXFLAGS_JDK} $with_extra_cxxflags"
42635   LDFLAGS_JDK="${LDFLAGS_JDK} $with_extra_ldflags"
42636 
42637   # Hotspot needs these set in their legacy form
42638   LEGACY_EXTRA_CFLAGS="$LEGACY_EXTRA_CFLAGS $with_extra_cflags"
42639   LEGACY_EXTRA_CXXFLAGS="$LEGACY_EXTRA_CXXFLAGS $with_extra_cxxflags"
42640   LEGACY_EXTRA_LDFLAGS="$LEGACY_EXTRA_LDFLAGS $with_extra_ldflags"
42641 
42642 
42643 
42644 
42645 
42646   ###############################################################################
42647   #
42648   # Now setup the CFLAGS and LDFLAGS for the JDK build.
42649   # Later we will also have CFLAGS and LDFLAGS for the hotspot subrepo build.
42650   #
42651 
42652   # Setup compiler/platform specific flags into
42653   #    CFLAGS_JDK    - C Compiler flags
42654   #    CXXFLAGS_JDK  - C++ Compiler flags
42655   #    COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK - common to C and C++
42656   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xgcc; then
42657     COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS $COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK -Wall -Wno-parentheses -Wextra -Wno-unused -Wno-unused-parameter -Wformat=2 \
42658         -pipe -D_GNU_SOURCE -D_REENTRANT -D_LARGEFILE64_SOURCE"
42659     case $OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ARCH in
42660       arm )
42661         # on arm we don't prevent gcc to omit frame pointer but do prevent strict aliasing
42662         CFLAGS_JDK="${CFLAGS_JDK} -fno-strict-aliasing"
42663         ;;
42664       ppc )
42665         # on ppc we don't prevent gcc to omit frame pointer but do prevent strict aliasing
42666         CFLAGS_JDK="${CFLAGS_JDK} -fno-strict-aliasing"
42667         ;;
42668       * )
42669         COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK -fno-omit-frame-pointer"
42670         CFLAGS_JDK="${CFLAGS_JDK} -fno-strict-aliasing"
42671         ;;
42672     esac
42673   elif test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xsolstudio; then
42674     COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS $COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK -DTRACING -DMACRO_MEMSYS_OPS -DBREAKPTS"
42675     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ARCH" = xx86; then
42676       COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK -DcpuIntel -Di586 -D$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_LEGACY_LIB"
42677       CFLAGS_JDK="$CFLAGS_JDK -erroff=E_BAD_PRAGMA_PACK_VALUE"
42678     fi
42679 
42680     CFLAGS_JDK="$CFLAGS_JDK -xc99=%none -xCC -errshort=tags -Xa -v -mt -W0,-noglobal"
42681     CXXFLAGS_JDK="$CXXFLAGS_JDK -errtags=yes +w -mt -features=no%except -DCC_NOEX -norunpath -xnolib"
42682   elif test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xxlc; then
42683     CFLAGS_JDK="$CFLAGS_JDK -D_GNU_SOURCE -D_REENTRANT -D_LARGEFILE64_SOURCE -DSTDC"
42684     CXXFLAGS_JDK="$CXXFLAGS_JDK -D_GNU_SOURCE -D_REENTRANT -D_LARGEFILE64_SOURCE -DSTDC"
42685   elif test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xmicrosoft; then
42686     COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS $COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK -Zi -MD -Zc:wchar_t- -W3 -wd4800 \
42687     -D_STATIC_CPPLIB -D_DISABLE_DEPRECATE_STATIC_CPPLIB -DWIN32_LEAN_AND_MEAN \
42688     -D_CRT_SECURE_NO_DEPRECATE -D_CRT_NONSTDC_NO_DEPRECATE \
42689     -DWIN32 -DIAL"
42690     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU" = xx86_64; then
42691       COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK -D_AMD64_ -Damd64"
42692     else
42693       COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK -D_X86_ -Dx86"
42694     fi
42695   fi
42696 
42697   ###############################################################################
42698 
42699   # Adjust flags according to debug level.
42700   case $DEBUG_LEVEL in
42701     fastdebug | slowdebug )
42702       CFLAGS_JDK="$CFLAGS_JDK $CFLAGS_DEBUG_SYMBOLS $CFLAGS_DEBUG_OPTIONS"
42703       CXXFLAGS_JDK="$CXXFLAGS_JDK $CXXFLAGS_DEBUG_SYMBOLS $CXXFLAGS_DEBUG_OPTIONS"
42704       JAVAC_FLAGS="$JAVAC_FLAGS -g"
42705       ;;
42706     release )
42707       ;;
42708     * )
42709       as_fn_error $? "Unrecognized \$DEBUG_LEVEL: $DEBUG_LEVEL" "$LINENO" 5
42710       ;;
42711   esac
42712 
42713   # Setup LP64
42714   COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK $ADD_LP64"
42715 
42716   # Set some common defines. These works for all compilers, but assume
42717   # -D is universally accepted.
42718 
42719   # Setup endianness
42720   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ENDIAN" = xlittle; then
42721     # The macro _LITTLE_ENDIAN needs to be defined the same to avoid the
42722     #   Sun C compiler warning message: warning: macro redefined: _LITTLE_ENDIAN
42723     #   (The Solaris X86 system defines this in file /usr/include/sys/isa_defs.h).
42724     #   Note: -Dmacro         is the same as    #define macro 1
42725     #         -Dmacro=        is the same as    #define macro
42726     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xsolaris; then
42727       COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK -D_LITTLE_ENDIAN="
42728     else
42729       COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK -D_LITTLE_ENDIAN"
42730     fi
42731   else
42732     # Same goes for _BIG_ENDIAN. Do we really need to set *ENDIAN on Solaris if they
42733     # are defined in the system?
42734     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xsolaris; then
42735       COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK -D_BIG_ENDIAN="
42736     else
42737       COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK -D_BIG_ENDIAN"
42738     fi
42739   fi
42740 
42741   # Setup target OS define. Use OS target name but in upper case.
42742   OPENJDK_TARGET_OS_UPPERCASE=`$ECHO $OPENJDK_TARGET_OS | $TR 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz' 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ'`
42743   COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK -D$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS_UPPERCASE"
42744 
42745   # Setup target CPU
42746   COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK -DARCH='\"$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_LEGACY\"' -D$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_LEGACY"
42747 
42748   # Setup debug/release defines
42749   if test "x$DEBUG_LEVEL" = xrelease; then
42750     COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK -DNDEBUG"
42751     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xsolaris; then
42752       COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK -DTRIMMED"
42753     fi
42754   else
42755     COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK -DDEBUG"
42756   fi
42757 
42758   # Setup release name
42759   COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK -DRELEASE='\"\$(RELEASE)\"'"
42760 
42761 
42762   # Set some additional per-OS defines.
42763   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xmacosx; then
42764     COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK -D_ALLBSD_SOURCE -D_DARWIN_UNLIMITED_SELECT"
42765   elif test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xaix; then
42766     # FIXME: PPC64 should not be here.
42767     COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK -DPPC64"
42768   elif test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xbsd; then
42769     COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK -D_ALLBSD_SOURCE"
42770   fi
42771 
42772   # Additional macosx handling
42773   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xmacosx; then
42774     # Setting these parameters makes it an error to link to macosx APIs that are
42775     # newer than the given OS version and makes the linked binaries compatible
42776     # even if built on a newer version of the OS.
42777     # The expected format is X.Y.Z
42778     MACOSX_VERSION_MIN=10.7.0
42779 
42780 
42781     # The macro takes the version with no dots, ex: 1070
42782     # Let the flags variables get resolved in make for easier override on make
42783     # command line.
42784     COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK -DMAC_OS_X_VERSION_MAX_ALLOWED=\$(subst .,,\$(MACOSX_VERSION_MIN)) -mmacosx-version-min=\$(MACOSX_VERSION_MIN)"
42785     LDFLAGS_JDK="$LDFLAGS_JDK -mmacosx-version-min=\$(MACOSX_VERSION_MIN)"
42786   fi
42787 
42788   # Setup some hard coded includes
42789   COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK \
42790       -I${JDK_TOPDIR}/src/java.base/share/native/include \
42791       -I${JDK_TOPDIR}/src/java.base/$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS/native/include \
42792       -I${JDK_TOPDIR}/src/java.base/$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS_TYPE/native/include"
42793 
42794   # The shared libraries are compiled using the picflag.
42795   CFLAGS_JDKLIB="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK $CFLAGS_JDK $PICFLAG $CFLAGS_JDKLIB_EXTRA"
42796   CXXFLAGS_JDKLIB="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK $CXXFLAGS_JDK $PICFLAG $CXXFLAGS_JDKLIB_EXTRA "
42797 
42798   # Executable flags
42799   CFLAGS_JDKEXE="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK $CFLAGS_JDK"
42800   CXXFLAGS_JDKEXE="$COMMON_CCXXFLAGS_JDK $CXXFLAGS_JDK"
42801 
42802 
42803 
42804 
42805 
42806 
42807   # Setup LDFLAGS et al.
42808   #
42809 
42810   # Now this is odd. The JDK native libraries have to link against libjvm.so
42811   # On 32-bit machines there is normally two distinct libjvm.so:s, client and server.
42812   # Which should we link to? Are we lucky enough that the binary api to the libjvm.so library
42813   # is identical for client and server? Yes. Which is picked at runtime (client or server)?
42814   # Neither, since the chosen libjvm.so has already been loaded by the launcher, all the following
42815   # libraries will link to whatever is in memory. Yuck.
42816   #
42817   # Thus we offer the compiler to find libjvm.so first in server then in client. It works. Ugh.
42818   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xmicrosoft; then
42819     LDFLAGS_JDK="$LDFLAGS_JDK -nologo -opt:ref -incremental:no"
42820     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = "x32"; then
42821       LDFLAGS_JDK="$LDFLAGS_JDK -safeseh"
42822     fi
42823     # TODO: make -debug optional "--disable-full-debug-symbols"
42824     LDFLAGS_JDK="$LDFLAGS_JDK -debug"
42825   elif test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xgcc; then
42826     # If this is a --hash-style=gnu system, use --hash-style=both, why?
42827     # We have previously set HAS_GNU_HASH if this is the case
42828     if test -n "$HAS_GNU_HASH"; then
42829       LDFLAGS_JDK="${LDFLAGS_JDK} -Xlinker --hash-style=both"
42830     fi
42831     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xlinux; then
42832       # And since we now know that the linker is gnu, then add -z defs, to forbid
42833       # undefined symbols in object files.
42834       LDFLAGS_JDK="${LDFLAGS_JDK} -Xlinker -z -Xlinker defs"
42835       case $DEBUG_LEVEL in
42836         release )
42837           # tell linker to optimize libraries.
42838           # Should this be supplied to the OSS linker as well?
42839           LDFLAGS_JDK="${LDFLAGS_JDK} -Xlinker -O1"
42840           ;;
42841         slowdebug )
42842           if test "x$HAS_LINKER_NOW" = "xtrue"; then
42843             # do relocations at load
42844             LDFLAGS_JDK="$LDFLAGS_JDK $LINKER_NOW_FLAG"
42845             LDFLAGS_CXX_JDK="$LDFLAGS_CXX_JDK $LINKER_NOW_FLAG"
42846           fi
42847           if test "x$HAS_LINKER_RELRO" = "xtrue"; then
42848             # mark relocations read only
42849             LDFLAGS_JDK="$LDFLAGS_JDK $LINKER_RELRO_FLAG"
42850             LDFLAGS_CXX_JDK="$LDFLAGS_CXX_JDK $LINKER_RELRO_FLAG"
42851           fi
42852           ;;
42853         fastdebug )
42854           if test "x$HAS_LINKER_RELRO" = "xtrue"; then
42855             # mark relocations read only
42856             LDFLAGS_JDK="$LDFLAGS_JDK $LINKER_RELRO_FLAG"
42857             LDFLAGS_CXX_JDK="$LDFLAGS_CXX_JDK $LINKER_RELRO_FLAG"
42858           fi
42859           ;;
42860         * )
42861           as_fn_error $? "Unrecognized \$DEBUG_LEVEL: $DEBUG_LEVEL" "$LINENO" 5
42862           ;;
42863         esac
42864     fi
42865   elif test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xsolstudio; then
42866     LDFLAGS_JDK="$LDFLAGS_JDK -z defs -xildoff -ztext"
42867     LDFLAGS_CXX_JDK="$LDFLAGS_CXX_JDK -norunpath -xnolib"
42868   fi
42869 
42870   # Customize LDFLAGS for executables
42871 
42872   LDFLAGS_JDKEXE="${LDFLAGS_JDK}"
42873 
42874   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xmicrosoft; then
42875     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = "x64"; then
42876       LDFLAGS_STACK_SIZE=1048576
42877     else
42878       LDFLAGS_STACK_SIZE=327680
42879     fi
42880     LDFLAGS_JDKEXE="${LDFLAGS_JDKEXE} /STACK:$LDFLAGS_STACK_SIZE"
42881   elif test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xlinux; then
42882     LDFLAGS_JDKEXE="$LDFLAGS_JDKEXE -Xlinker --allow-shlib-undefined"
42883   fi
42884 
42885   # Customize LDFLAGS for libs
42886   LDFLAGS_JDKLIB="${LDFLAGS_JDK}"
42887 
42888   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xmicrosoft; then
42889     LDFLAGS_JDKLIB="${LDFLAGS_JDKLIB} -dll -libpath:${OUTPUT_ROOT}/support/modules_libs/java.base"
42890     LDFLAGS_JDKLIB_SUFFIX=""
42891   else
42892     LDFLAGS_JDKLIB="${LDFLAGS_JDKLIB}  ${SHARED_LIBRARY_FLAGS} \
42893         -L${OUTPUT_ROOT}/support/modules_libs/java.base${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_LIBDIR}"
42894 
42895     # On some platforms (mac) the linker warns about non existing -L dirs.
42896     # Add server first if available. Linking aginst client does not always produce the same results.
42897     # Only add client dir if client is being built. Add minimal (note not minimal1) if only building minimal1.
42898     # Default to server for other variants.
42899     if test "x$JVM_VARIANT_SERVER" = xtrue; then
42900       LDFLAGS_JDKLIB="${LDFLAGS_JDKLIB} -L${OUTPUT_ROOT}/support/modules_libs/java.base${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_LIBDIR}/server"
42901     elif test "x$JVM_VARIANT_CLIENT" = xtrue; then
42902       LDFLAGS_JDKLIB="${LDFLAGS_JDKLIB} -L${OUTPUT_ROOT}/support/modules_libs/java.base${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_LIBDIR}/client"
42903     elif test "x$JVM_VARIANT_MINIMAL1" = xtrue; then
42904       LDFLAGS_JDKLIB="${LDFLAGS_JDKLIB} -L${OUTPUT_ROOT}/support/modules_libs/java.base${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_LIBDIR}/minimal"
42905     else
42906       LDFLAGS_JDKLIB="${LDFLAGS_JDKLIB} -L${OUTPUT_ROOT}/support/modules_libs/java.base${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_LIBDIR}/server"
42907     fi
42908 
42909     LDFLAGS_JDKLIB_SUFFIX="-ljava -ljvm"
42910     if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xsolstudio; then
42911       LDFLAGS_JDKLIB_SUFFIX="$LDFLAGS_JDKLIB_SUFFIX -lc"
42912     fi
42913   fi
42914 
42915 
42916 
42917 
42918 
42919 
42920 
42921 
42922   # Some Zero and Shark settings.
42923   # ZERO_ARCHFLAG tells the compiler which mode to build for
42924   case "${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU}" in
42925     s390)
42926       ZERO_ARCHFLAG="${COMPILER_TARGET_BITS_FLAG}31"
42927       ;;
42928     *)
42929       ZERO_ARCHFLAG="${COMPILER_TARGET_BITS_FLAG}${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS}"
42930   esac
42931 
42932   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if compiler supports \"$ZERO_ARCHFLAG\"" >&5
42933 $as_echo_n "checking if compiler supports \"$ZERO_ARCHFLAG\"... " >&6; }
42934   supports=yes
42935 
42936   saved_cflags="$CFLAGS"
42937   CFLAGS="$CFLAGS $ZERO_ARCHFLAG"
42938   ac_ext=c
42939 ac_cpp='$CPP $CPPFLAGS'
42940 ac_compile='$CC -c $CFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
42941 ac_link='$CC -o conftest$ac_exeext $CFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
42942 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_c_compiler_gnu
42943 
42944   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
42945 /* end confdefs.h.  */
42946 int i;
42947 _ACEOF
42948 if ac_fn_c_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
42949 
42950 else
