42951   supports=no
42952 fi
42953 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
42954   ac_ext=cpp
42955 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
42956 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
42957 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
42958 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
42959 
42960   CFLAGS="$saved_cflags"
42961 
42962   saved_cxxflags="$CXXFLAGS"
42963   CXXFLAGS="$CXXFLAG $ZERO_ARCHFLAG"
42964   ac_ext=cpp
42965 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
42966 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
42967 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
42968 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
42969 
42970   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
42971 /* end confdefs.h.  */
42972 int i;
42973 _ACEOF
42974 if ac_fn_cxx_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
42975 
42976 else
42977   supports=no
42978 fi
42979 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
42980   ac_ext=cpp
42981 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
42982 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
42983 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
42984 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
42985 
42986   CXXFLAGS="$saved_cxxflags"
42987 
42988   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $supports" >&5
42989 $as_echo "$supports" >&6; }
42990   if test "x$supports" = "xyes" ; then
42991     :
42992   else
42993     ZERO_ARCHFLAG=""
42994   fi
42995 
42996 
42997 
42998   # Check that the compiler supports -mX (or -qX on AIX) flags
42999   # Set COMPILER_SUPPORTS_TARGET_BITS_FLAG to 'true' if it does
43000 
43001   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if compiler supports \"${COMPILER_TARGET_BITS_FLAG}${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS}\"" >&5
43002 $as_echo_n "checking if compiler supports \"${COMPILER_TARGET_BITS_FLAG}${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS}\"... " >&6; }
43003   supports=yes
43004 
43005   saved_cflags="$CFLAGS"
43006   CFLAGS="$CFLAGS ${COMPILER_TARGET_BITS_FLAG}${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS}"
43007   ac_ext=c
43008 ac_cpp='$CPP $CPPFLAGS'
43009 ac_compile='$CC -c $CFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
43010 ac_link='$CC -o conftest$ac_exeext $CFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
43011 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_c_compiler_gnu
43012 
43013   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
43014 /* end confdefs.h.  */
43015 int i;
43016 _ACEOF
43017 if ac_fn_c_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
43018 
43019 else
43020   supports=no
43021 fi
43022 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
43023   ac_ext=cpp
43024 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
43025 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
43026 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
43027 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
43028 
43029   CFLAGS="$saved_cflags"
43030 
43031   saved_cxxflags="$CXXFLAGS"
43032   CXXFLAGS="$CXXFLAG ${COMPILER_TARGET_BITS_FLAG}${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS}"
43033   ac_ext=cpp
43034 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
43035 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
43036 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
43037 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
43038 
43039   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
43040 /* end confdefs.h.  */
43041 int i;
43042 _ACEOF
43043 if ac_fn_cxx_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
43044 
43045 else
43046   supports=no
43047 fi
43048 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
43049   ac_ext=cpp
43050 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
43051 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
43052 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
43053 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
43054 
43055   CXXFLAGS="$saved_cxxflags"
43056 
43057   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $supports" >&5
43058 $as_echo "$supports" >&6; }
43059   if test "x$supports" = "xyes" ; then
43060     COMPILER_SUPPORTS_TARGET_BITS_FLAG=true
43061   else
43062     COMPILER_SUPPORTS_TARGET_BITS_FLAG=false
43063   fi
43064 
43065 
43066 
43067   case "${TOOLCHAIN_TYPE}" in
43068     microsoft)
43069       CFLAGS_WARNINGS_ARE_ERRORS="-WX"
43070       ;;
43071     solstudio)
43072       CFLAGS_WARNINGS_ARE_ERRORS="-errtags -errwarn=%all"
43073       ;;
43074     gcc)
43075       CFLAGS_WARNINGS_ARE_ERRORS="-Werror"
43076       ;;
43077     clang)
43078       CFLAGS_WARNINGS_ARE_ERRORS="-Werror"
43079       ;;
43080   esac
43081 
43082 
43083 
43084 # Setup debug symbols (need objcopy from the toolchain for that)
43085 
43086   #
43087   # ENABLE_DEBUG_SYMBOLS
43088   # This must be done after the toolchain is setup, since we're looking at objcopy.
43089   #
43090   # Check whether --enable-debug-symbols was given.
43091 if test "${enable_debug_symbols+set}" = set; then :
43092   enableval=$enable_debug_symbols;
43093 fi
43094 
43095 
43096   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if we should generate debug symbols" >&5
43097 $as_echo_n "checking if we should generate debug symbols... " >&6; }
43098 
43099   if test "x$enable_debug_symbols" = "xyes" && test "x$OBJCOPY" = x; then
43100     # explicit enabling of enable-debug-symbols and can't find objcopy
43101     #   this is an error
43102     as_fn_error $? "Unable to find objcopy, cannot enable debug-symbols" "$LINENO" 5
43103   fi
43104 
43105   if test "x$enable_debug_symbols" = "xyes"; then
43106     ENABLE_DEBUG_SYMBOLS=true
43107   elif test "x$enable_debug_symbols" = "xno"; then
43108     ENABLE_DEBUG_SYMBOLS=false
43109   else
43110     # Default is on if objcopy is found
43111     if test "x$OBJCOPY" != x; then
43112       ENABLE_DEBUG_SYMBOLS=true
43113     # MacOS X and Windows don't use objcopy but default is on for those OSes
43114     elif test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xmacosx || test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xwindows; then
43115       ENABLE_DEBUG_SYMBOLS=true
43116     else
43117       ENABLE_DEBUG_SYMBOLS=false
43118     fi
43119   fi
43120 
43121   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ENABLE_DEBUG_SYMBOLS" >&5
43122 $as_echo "$ENABLE_DEBUG_SYMBOLS" >&6; }
43123 
43124   #
43125   # ZIP_DEBUGINFO_FILES
43126   #
43127   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if we should zip debug-info files" >&5
43128 $as_echo_n "checking if we should zip debug-info files... " >&6; }
43129   # Check whether --enable-zip-debug-info was given.
43130 if test "${enable_zip_debug_info+set}" = set; then :
43131   enableval=$enable_zip_debug_info; enable_zip_debug_info="${enableval}"
43132 else
43133   enable_zip_debug_info="yes"
43134 fi
43135 
43136   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: ${enable_zip_debug_info}" >&5
43137 $as_echo "${enable_zip_debug_info}" >&6; }
43138 
43139   if test "x${enable_zip_debug_info}" = "xno"; then
43140     ZIP_DEBUGINFO_FILES=false
43141   else
43142     ZIP_DEBUGINFO_FILES=true
43143   fi
43144 
43145 
43146 
43147 
43148 
43149 ###############################################################################
43150 #
43151 # Check dependencies for external and internal libraries.
43152 #
43153 ###############################################################################
43154 
43155 # After we have toolchain, we can compile fixpath. It's needed by the lib checks.
43156 
43157   # When using cygwin or msys, we need a wrapper binary that renames
43158   # /cygdrive/c/ arguments into c:/ arguments and peeks into
43159   # @files and rewrites these too! This wrapper binary is
43160   # called fixpath.
43161   FIXPATH=
43162   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS" = xwindows; then
43163     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if fixpath can be created" >&5
43164 $as_echo_n "checking if fixpath can be created... " >&6; }
43165     FIXPATH_SRC="$SRC_ROOT/common/src/fixpath.c"
43166     FIXPATH_BIN="$OUTPUT_ROOT/fixpath.exe"
43167     if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = xwindows.cygwin; then
43168       FIXPATH_SRC=`$CYGPATH -m $FIXPATH_SRC`
43169       FIXPATH_BIN=`$CYGPATH -m $FIXPATH_BIN`
43170       # Important to keep the .exe suffix on Cygwin for Hotspot makefiles
43171       FIXPATH="$OUTPUT_ROOT/fixpath.exe -c"
43172     elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = xwindows.msys; then
43173       FIXPATH_SRC=`cmd //c echo $FIXPATH_SRC`
43174       FIXPATH_BIN=`cmd //c echo $FIXPATH_BIN`
43175 
43176       # Take all collected prefixes and turn them into a -m/c/foo@/c/bar@... command line
43177       # @ was chosen as separator to minimize risk of other tools messing around with it
43178       all_unique_prefixes=`echo "${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" | tr ' ' '\n' | grep '^/./' | sort | uniq`
43179       fixpath_argument_list=`echo $all_unique_prefixes  | tr ' ' '@'`
43180 
43181       FIXPATH="$OUTPUT_ROOT/fixpath -m$fixpath_argument_list"
43182     fi
43183     rm -f $OUTPUT_ROOT/fixpath*
43184     cd $OUTPUT_ROOT
43185     $CC $FIXPATH_SRC -Fe$FIXPATH_BIN > $OUTPUT_ROOT/fixpath1.log 2>&1
43186     cd $CURDIR
43187 
43188     if test ! -x $OUTPUT_ROOT/fixpath.exe; then
43189       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
43190 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
43191       cat $OUTPUT_ROOT/fixpath1.log
43192       as_fn_error $? "Could not create $OUTPUT_ROOT/fixpath.exe" "$LINENO" 5
43193     fi
43194     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes" >&5
43195 $as_echo "yes" >&6; }
43196     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if fixpath.exe works" >&5
43197 $as_echo_n "checking if fixpath.exe works... " >&6; }
43198     cd $OUTPUT_ROOT
43199     $FIXPATH $CC $SRC_ROOT/common/src/fixpath.c -Fe$OUTPUT_ROOT/fixpath2.exe > $OUTPUT_ROOT/fixpath2.log 2>&1
43200     cd $CURDIR
43201     if test ! -x $OUTPUT_ROOT/fixpath2.exe; then
43202       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
43203 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
43204       cat $OUTPUT_ROOT/fixpath2.log
43205       as_fn_error $? "fixpath did not work!" "$LINENO" 5
43206     fi
43207     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes" >&5
43208 $as_echo "yes" >&6; }
43209     rm -f $OUTPUT_ROOT/fixpath?.??? $OUTPUT_ROOT/fixpath.obj
43210   fi
43211 
43212 
43213 
43214 
43215 
43216 
43217   ###############################################################################
43218   #
43219   # OS specific settings that we never will need to probe.
43220   #
43221   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xlinux; then
43222     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking what is not needed on Linux?" >&5
43223 $as_echo_n "checking what is not needed on Linux?... " >&6; }
43224     PULSE_NOT_NEEDED=yes
43225     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: pulse" >&5
43226 $as_echo "pulse" >&6; }
43227   fi
43228 
43229   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xsolaris; then
43230     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking what is not needed on Solaris?" >&5
43231 $as_echo_n "checking what is not needed on Solaris?... " >&6; }
43232     ALSA_NOT_NEEDED=yes
43233     PULSE_NOT_NEEDED=yes
43234     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: alsa pulse" >&5
43235 $as_echo "alsa pulse" >&6; }
43236   fi
43237 
43238   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xaix; then
43239     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking what is not needed on AIX?" >&5
43240 $as_echo_n "checking what is not needed on AIX?... " >&6; }
43241     ALSA_NOT_NEEDED=yes
43242     PULSE_NOT_NEEDED=yes
43243     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: alsa pulse" >&5
43244 $as_echo "alsa pulse" >&6; }
43245   fi
43246 
43247 
43248   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xwindows; then
43249     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking what is not needed on Windows?" >&5
43250 $as_echo_n "checking what is not needed on Windows?... " >&6; }
43251     CUPS_NOT_NEEDED=yes
43252     ALSA_NOT_NEEDED=yes
43253     PULSE_NOT_NEEDED=yes
43254     X11_NOT_NEEDED=yes
43255     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: alsa cups pulse x11" >&5
43256 $as_echo "alsa cups pulse x11" >&6; }
43257   fi
43258 
43259   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xmacosx; then
43260     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking what is not needed on MacOSX?" >&5
43261 $as_echo_n "checking what is not needed on MacOSX?... " >&6; }
43262     ALSA_NOT_NEEDED=yes
43263     PULSE_NOT_NEEDED=yes
43264     X11_NOT_NEEDED=yes
43265     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: alsa pulse x11" >&5
43266 $as_echo "alsa pulse x11" >&6; }
43267   fi
43268 
43269   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xbsd; then
43270     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking what is not needed on bsd?" >&5
43271 $as_echo_n "checking what is not needed on bsd?... " >&6; }
43272     ALSA_NOT_NEEDED=yes
43273     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: alsa" >&5
43274 $as_echo "alsa" >&6; }
43275   fi
43276 
43277   if test "x$OPENJDK" = "xfalse"; then
43278     FREETYPE_NOT_NEEDED=yes
43279   fi
43280 
43281   if test "x$SUPPORT_HEADFUL" = xno; then
43282     X11_NOT_NEEDED=yes
43283   fi
43284 
43285 
43286 
43287   ###############################################################################
43288   #
43289   # Check for X Windows
43290   #
43291 
43292   if test "x$X11_NOT_NEEDED" = xyes; then
43293     if test "x${with_x}" != x; then
43294       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: X11 is not used, so --with-x is ignored" >&5
43295 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: X11 is not used, so --with-x is ignored" >&2;}
43296     fi
43297     X_CFLAGS=
43298     X_LIBS=
43299   else
43300     # Check if the user has specified sysroot, but not --x-includes or --x-libraries.
43301     # Make a simple check for the libraries at the sysroot, and setup --x-includes and
43302     # --x-libraries for the sysroot, if that seems to be correct.
43303     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = "xlinux"; then
43304       if test "x$SYSROOT" != "x"; then
43305         if test "x$x_includes" = xNONE; then
43306           if test -f "$SYSROOT/usr/X11R6/include/X11/Xlib.h"; then
43307             x_includes="$SYSROOT/usr/X11R6/include"
43308           elif test -f "$SYSROOT/usr/include/X11/Xlib.h"; then
43309             x_includes="$SYSROOT/usr/include"
43310           fi
43311         fi
43312         if test "x$x_libraries" = xNONE; then
43313           if test -f "$SYSROOT/usr/X11R6/lib/libX11.so"; then
43314             x_libraries="$SYSROOT/usr/X11R6/lib"
43315           elif test "$SYSROOT/usr/lib64/libX11.so" && test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = x64; then
43316             x_libraries="$SYSROOT/usr/lib64"
43317           elif test -f "$SYSROOT/usr/lib/libX11.so"; then
43318             x_libraries="$SYSROOT/usr/lib"
43319           fi
43320         fi
43321       fi
43322     fi
43323 
43324     # Now let autoconf do it's magic
43325     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for X" >&5
43326 $as_echo_n "checking for X... " >&6; }
43327 
43328 
43329 # Check whether --with-x was given.
43330 if test "${with_x+set}" = set; then :
43331   withval=$with_x;
43332 fi
43333 
43334 # $have_x is `yes', `no', `disabled', or empty when we do not yet know.
43335 if test "x$with_x" = xno; then
43336   # The user explicitly disabled X.
43337   have_x=disabled
43338 else
43339   case $x_includes,$x_libraries in #(
43340     *\'*) as_fn_error $? "cannot use X directory names containing '" "$LINENO" 5;; #(
43341     *,NONE | NONE,*) if ${ac_cv_have_x+:} false; then :
43342   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
43343 else
43344   # One or both of the vars are not set, and there is no cached value.
43345 ac_x_includes=no ac_x_libraries=no
43346 rm -f -r conftest.dir
43347 if mkdir conftest.dir; then
43348   cd conftest.dir
43349   cat >Imakefile <<'_ACEOF'
43350 incroot:
43351         @echo incroot='${INCROOT}'
43352 usrlibdir:
43353         @echo usrlibdir='${USRLIBDIR}'
43354 libdir:
43355         @echo libdir='${LIBDIR}'
43356 _ACEOF
43357   if (export CC; ${XMKMF-xmkmf}) >/dev/null 2>/dev/null && test -f Makefile; then
43358     # GNU make sometimes prints "make[1]: Entering ...", which would confuse us.
43359     for ac_var in incroot usrlibdir libdir; do
43360       eval "ac_im_$ac_var=\`\${MAKE-make} $ac_var 2>/dev/null | sed -n 's/^$ac_var=//p'\`"
43361     done
43362     # Open Windows xmkmf reportedly sets LIBDIR instead of USRLIBDIR.
43363     for ac_extension in a so sl dylib la dll; do
43364       if test ! -f "$ac_im_usrlibdir/libX11.$ac_extension" &&
43365          test -f "$ac_im_libdir/libX11.$ac_extension"; then
43366         ac_im_usrlibdir=$ac_im_libdir; break
43367       fi
43368     done
43369     # Screen out bogus values from the imake configuration.  They are
43370     # bogus both because they are the default anyway, and because
43371     # using them would break gcc on systems where it needs fixed includes.
43372     case $ac_im_incroot in
43373         /usr/include) ac_x_includes= ;;
43374         *) test -f "$ac_im_incroot/X11/Xos.h" && ac_x_includes=$ac_im_incroot;;
43375     esac
43376     case $ac_im_usrlibdir in
43377         /usr/lib | /usr/lib64 | /lib | /lib64) ;;
43378         *) test -d "$ac_im_usrlibdir" && ac_x_libraries=$ac_im_usrlibdir ;;
43379     esac
43380   fi
43381   cd ..
43382   rm -f -r conftest.dir
43383 fi
43384 
43385 # Standard set of common directories for X headers.
43386 # Check X11 before X11Rn because it is often a symlink to the current release.
43387 ac_x_header_dirs='
43388 /usr/X11/include
43389 /usr/X11R7/include
43390 /usr/X11R6/include
43391 /usr/X11R5/include
43392 /usr/X11R4/include
43393 
43394 /usr/include/X11
43395 /usr/include/X11R7
43396 /usr/include/X11R6
43397 /usr/include/X11R5
43398 /usr/include/X11R4
43399 
43400 /usr/local/X11/include
43401 /usr/local/X11R7/include
43402 /usr/local/X11R6/include
43403 /usr/local/X11R5/include
43404 /usr/local/X11R4/include
43405 
43406 /usr/local/include/X11
43407 /usr/local/include/X11R7
43408 /usr/local/include/X11R6
43409 /usr/local/include/X11R5
43410 /usr/local/include/X11R4
43411 
43412 /usr/X386/include
43413 /usr/x386/include
43414 /usr/XFree86/include/X11
43415 
43416 /usr/include
43417 /usr/local/include
43418 /usr/unsupported/include
43419 /usr/athena/include
43420 /usr/local/x11r5/include
43421 /usr/lpp/Xamples/include
43422 
43423 /usr/openwin/include
43424 /usr/openwin/share/include'
43425 
43426 if test "$ac_x_includes" = no; then
43427   # Guess where to find include files, by looking for Xlib.h.
43428   # First, try using that file with no special directory specified.
43429   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
43430 /* end confdefs.h.  */
43431 #include <X11/Xlib.h>
43432 _ACEOF
43433 if ac_fn_cxx_try_cpp "$LINENO"; then :
43434   # We can compile using X headers with no special include directory.
43435 ac_x_includes=
43436 else
43437   for ac_dir in $ac_x_header_dirs; do
43438   if test -r "$ac_dir/X11/Xlib.h"; then
43439     ac_x_includes=$ac_dir
43440     break
43441   fi
43442 done
43443 fi
43444 rm -f conftest.err conftest.i conftest.$ac_ext
43445 fi # $ac_x_includes = no
43446 
43447 if test "$ac_x_libraries" = no; then
43448   # Check for the libraries.
43449   # See if we find them without any special options.
43450   # Don't add to $LIBS permanently.
43451   ac_save_LIBS=$LIBS
43452   LIBS="-lX11 $LIBS"
43453   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
43454 /* end confdefs.h.  */
43455 #include <X11/Xlib.h>
43456 int
43457 main ()
43458 {
43459 XrmInitialize ()
43460   ;
43461   return 0;
43462 }
43463 _ACEOF
43464 if ac_fn_cxx_try_link "$LINENO"; then :
43465   LIBS=$ac_save_LIBS
43466 # We can link X programs with no special library path.
43467 ac_x_libraries=
43468 else
43469   LIBS=$ac_save_LIBS
43470 for ac_dir in `$as_echo "$ac_x_includes $ac_x_header_dirs" | sed s/include/lib/g`
43471 do
43472   # Don't even attempt the hair of trying to link an X program!
43473   for ac_extension in a so sl dylib la dll; do
43474     if test -r "$ac_dir/libX11.$ac_extension"; then
43475       ac_x_libraries=$ac_dir
43476       break 2
43477     fi
43478   done
43479 done
43480 fi
43481 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext \
43482     conftest$ac_exeext conftest.$ac_ext
43483 fi # $ac_x_libraries = no
43484 
43485 case $ac_x_includes,$ac_x_libraries in #(
43486   no,* | *,no | *\'*)
43487     # Didn't find X, or a directory has "'" in its name.
43488     ac_cv_have_x="have_x=no";; #(
43489   *)
43490     # Record where we found X for the cache.
43491     ac_cv_have_x="have_x=yes\
43492         ac_x_includes='$ac_x_includes'\
43493         ac_x_libraries='$ac_x_libraries'"
43494 esac
43495 fi
43496 ;; #(
43497     *) have_x=yes;;
43498   esac
43499   eval "$ac_cv_have_x"
43500 fi # $with_x != no
43501 
43502 if test "$have_x" != yes; then
43503   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $have_x" >&5
43504 $as_echo "$have_x" >&6; }
43505   no_x=yes
43506 else
43507   # If each of the values was on the command line, it overrides each guess.
43508   test "x$x_includes" = xNONE && x_includes=$ac_x_includes
43509   test "x$x_libraries" = xNONE && x_libraries=$ac_x_libraries
43510   # Update the cache value to reflect the command line values.
43511   ac_cv_have_x="have_x=yes\
43512         ac_x_includes='$x_includes'\
43513         ac_x_libraries='$x_libraries'"
43514   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: libraries $x_libraries, headers $x_includes" >&5
43515 $as_echo "libraries $x_libraries, headers $x_includes" >&6; }
43516 fi
43517 
43518     if test "$no_x" = yes; then
43519   # Not all programs may use this symbol, but it does not hurt to define it.
43520 
43521 $as_echo "#define X_DISPLAY_MISSING 1" >>confdefs.h
43522 
43523   X_CFLAGS= X_PRE_LIBS= X_LIBS= X_EXTRA_LIBS=
43524 else
43525   if test -n "$x_includes"; then
43526     X_CFLAGS="$X_CFLAGS -I$x_includes"
43527   fi
43528 
43529   # It would also be nice to do this for all -L options, not just this one.
43530   if test -n "$x_libraries"; then
43531     X_LIBS="$X_LIBS -L$x_libraries"
43532     # For Solaris; some versions of Sun CC require a space after -R and
43533     # others require no space.  Words are not sufficient . . . .
43534     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking whether -R must be followed by a space" >&5
43535 $as_echo_n "checking whether -R must be followed by a space... " >&6; }
43536     ac_xsave_LIBS=$LIBS; LIBS="$LIBS -R$x_libraries"
43537     ac_xsave_cxx_werror_flag=$ac_cxx_werror_flag
43538     ac_cxx_werror_flag=yes
43539     cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
43540 /* end confdefs.h.  */
43541 
43542 int
43543 main ()
43544 {
43545 
43546   ;
43547   return 0;
43548 }
43549 _ACEOF
43550 if ac_fn_cxx_try_link "$LINENO"; then :
43551   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
43552 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
43553        X_LIBS="$X_LIBS -R$x_libraries"
43554 else
43555   LIBS="$ac_xsave_LIBS -R $x_libraries"
43556        cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
43557 /* end confdefs.h.  */
43558 
43559 int
43560 main ()
43561 {
43562 
43563   ;
43564   return 0;
43565 }
43566 _ACEOF
43567 if ac_fn_cxx_try_link "$LINENO"; then :
43568   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes" >&5
43569 $as_echo "yes" >&6; }
43570           X_LIBS="$X_LIBS -R $x_libraries"
43571 else
43572   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: neither works" >&5
43573 $as_echo "neither works" >&6; }
43574 fi
43575 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext \
43576     conftest$ac_exeext conftest.$ac_ext
43577 fi
43578 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext \
43579     conftest$ac_exeext conftest.$ac_ext
43580     ac_cxx_werror_flag=$ac_xsave_cxx_werror_flag
43581     LIBS=$ac_xsave_LIBS
43582   fi
43583 
43584   # Check for system-dependent libraries X programs must link with.
43585   # Do this before checking for the system-independent R6 libraries
43586   # (-lICE), since we may need -lsocket or whatever for X linking.
43587 
43588   if test "$ISC" = yes; then
43589     X_EXTRA_LIBS="$X_EXTRA_LIBS -lnsl_s -linet"
43590   else
43591     # Martyn Johnson says this is needed for Ultrix, if the X
43592     # libraries were built with DECnet support.  And Karl Berry says
43593     # the Alpha needs dnet_stub (dnet does not exist).
43594     ac_xsave_LIBS="$LIBS"; LIBS="$LIBS $X_LIBS -lX11"
43595     cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
43596 /* end confdefs.h.  */
43597 
43598 /* Override any GCC internal prototype to avoid an error.
43599    Use char because int might match the return type of a GCC
43600    builtin and then its argument prototype would still apply.  */
43601 #ifdef __cplusplus
43602 extern "C"
43603 #endif
43604 char XOpenDisplay ();
43605 int
43606 main ()
43607 {
43608 return XOpenDisplay ();
43609   ;
43610   return 0;
43611 }
43612 _ACEOF
43613 if ac_fn_cxx_try_link "$LINENO"; then :
43614 
43615 else
43616   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for dnet_ntoa in -ldnet" >&5
43617 $as_echo_n "checking for dnet_ntoa in -ldnet... " >&6; }
43618 if ${ac_cv_lib_dnet_dnet_ntoa+:} false; then :
43619   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
43620 else
43621   ac_check_lib_save_LIBS=$LIBS
43622 LIBS="-ldnet  $LIBS"
43623 cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
43624 /* end confdefs.h.  */
43625 
43626 /* Override any GCC internal prototype to avoid an error.
43627    Use char because int might match the return type of a GCC
43628    builtin and then its argument prototype would still apply.  */
43629 #ifdef __cplusplus
43630 extern "C"
43631 #endif
43632 char dnet_ntoa ();
43633 int
43634 main ()
43635 {
43636 return dnet_ntoa ();
43637   ;
43638   return 0;
43639 }
43640 _ACEOF
43641 if ac_fn_cxx_try_link "$LINENO"; then :
43642   ac_cv_lib_dnet_dnet_ntoa=yes
43643 else
43644   ac_cv_lib_dnet_dnet_ntoa=no
43645 fi
43646 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext \
43647     conftest$ac_exeext conftest.$ac_ext
43648 LIBS=$ac_check_lib_save_LIBS
43649 fi
43650 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_lib_dnet_dnet_ntoa" >&5
43651 $as_echo "$ac_cv_lib_dnet_dnet_ntoa" >&6; }
43652 if test "x$ac_cv_lib_dnet_dnet_ntoa" = xyes; then :
43653   X_EXTRA_LIBS="$X_EXTRA_LIBS -ldnet"
43654 fi
43655 
43656     if test $ac_cv_lib_dnet_dnet_ntoa = no; then
43657       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for dnet_ntoa in -ldnet_stub" >&5
43658 $as_echo_n "checking for dnet_ntoa in -ldnet_stub... " >&6; }
43659 if ${ac_cv_lib_dnet_stub_dnet_ntoa+:} false; then :
43660   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
43661 else
43662   ac_check_lib_save_LIBS=$LIBS
43663 LIBS="-ldnet_stub  $LIBS"
43664 cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
43665 /* end confdefs.h.  */
43666 
43667 /* Override any GCC internal prototype to avoid an error.
43668    Use char because int might match the return type of a GCC
43669    builtin and then its argument prototype would still apply.  */
43670 #ifdef __cplusplus
43671 extern "C"
43672 #endif
43673 char dnet_ntoa ();
43674 int
43675 main ()
43676 {
43677 return dnet_ntoa ();
43678   ;
43679   return 0;
43680 }
43681 _ACEOF
43682 if ac_fn_cxx_try_link "$LINENO"; then :
43683   ac_cv_lib_dnet_stub_dnet_ntoa=yes
43684 else
43685   ac_cv_lib_dnet_stub_dnet_ntoa=no
43686 fi
43687 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext \
43688     conftest$ac_exeext conftest.$ac_ext
43689 LIBS=$ac_check_lib_save_LIBS
43690 fi
43691 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_lib_dnet_stub_dnet_ntoa" >&5
43692 $as_echo "$ac_cv_lib_dnet_stub_dnet_ntoa" >&6; }
43693 if test "x$ac_cv_lib_dnet_stub_dnet_ntoa" = xyes; then :
43694   X_EXTRA_LIBS="$X_EXTRA_LIBS -ldnet_stub"
43695 fi
43696 
43697     fi
43698 fi
43699 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext \
43700     conftest$ac_exeext conftest.$ac_ext
43701     LIBS="$ac_xsave_LIBS"
43702 
43703     # msh@cis.ufl.edu says -lnsl (and -lsocket) are needed for his 386/AT,
43704     # to get the SysV transport functions.
43705     # Chad R. Larson says the Pyramis MIS-ES running DC/OSx (SVR4)
43706     # needs -lnsl.
43707     # The nsl library prevents programs from opening the X display
43708     # on Irix 5.2, according to T.E. Dickey.
43709     # The functions gethostbyname, getservbyname, and inet_addr are
43710     # in -lbsd on LynxOS 3.0.1/i386, according to Lars Hecking.
43711     ac_fn_cxx_check_func "$LINENO" "gethostbyname" "ac_cv_func_gethostbyname"
43712 if test "x$ac_cv_func_gethostbyname" = xyes; then :
43713 
43714 fi
43715 
43716     if test $ac_cv_func_gethostbyname = no; then
43717       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for gethostbyname in -lnsl" >&5
43718 $as_echo_n "checking for gethostbyname in -lnsl... " >&6; }
43719 if ${ac_cv_lib_nsl_gethostbyname+:} false; then :
43720   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
43721 else
43722   ac_check_lib_save_LIBS=$LIBS
43723 LIBS="-lnsl  $LIBS"
43724 cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
43725 /* end confdefs.h.  */
43726 
43727 /* Override any GCC internal prototype to avoid an error.
43728    Use char because int might match the return type of a GCC
43729    builtin and then its argument prototype would still apply.  */
43730 #ifdef __cplusplus
43731 extern "C"
43732 #endif
43733 char gethostbyname ();
43734 int
43735 main ()
43736 {
43737 return gethostbyname ();
43738   ;
43739   return 0;
43740 }
43741 _ACEOF
43742 if ac_fn_cxx_try_link "$LINENO"; then :
43743   ac_cv_lib_nsl_gethostbyname=yes
43744 else
43745   ac_cv_lib_nsl_gethostbyname=no
43746 fi
43747 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext \
43748     conftest$ac_exeext conftest.$ac_ext
43749 LIBS=$ac_check_lib_save_LIBS
43750 fi
43751 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_lib_nsl_gethostbyname" >&5
43752 $as_echo "$ac_cv_lib_nsl_gethostbyname" >&6; }
43753 if test "x$ac_cv_lib_nsl_gethostbyname" = xyes; then :
43754   X_EXTRA_LIBS="$X_EXTRA_LIBS -lnsl"
43755 fi
43756 
43757       if test $ac_cv_lib_nsl_gethostbyname = no; then
43758         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for gethostbyname in -lbsd" >&5
43759 $as_echo_n "checking for gethostbyname in -lbsd... " >&6; }
43760 if ${ac_cv_lib_bsd_gethostbyname+:} false; then :
43761   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
43762 else
43763   ac_check_lib_save_LIBS=$LIBS
43764 LIBS="-lbsd  $LIBS"
43765 cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
43766 /* end confdefs.h.  */
43767 
43768 /* Override any GCC internal prototype to avoid an error.
43769    Use char because int might match the return type of a GCC
43770    builtin and then its argument prototype would still apply.  */
43771 #ifdef __cplusplus
43772 extern "C"
43773 #endif
43774 char gethostbyname ();
43775 int
43776 main ()
43777 {
43778 return gethostbyname ();
43779   ;
43780   return 0;
43781 }
43782 _ACEOF

43796 fi
43797 
43798       fi
43799     fi
43800 
43801     # lieder@skyler.mavd.honeywell.com says without -lsocket,
43802     # socket/setsockopt and other routines are undefined under SCO ODT
43803     # 2.0.  But -lsocket is broken on IRIX 5.2 (and is not necessary
43804     # on later versions), says Simon Leinen: it contains gethostby*
43805     # variants that don't use the name server (or something).  -lsocket
43806     # must be given before -lnsl if both are needed.  We assume that
43807     # if connect needs -lnsl, so does gethostbyname.
43808     ac_fn_cxx_check_func "$LINENO" "connect" "ac_cv_func_connect"
43809 if test "x$ac_cv_func_connect" = xyes; then :
43810 
43811 fi
43812 
43813     if test $ac_cv_func_connect = no; then
43814       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for connect in -lsocket" >&5
43815 $as_echo_n "checking for connect in -lsocket... " >&6; }
43816 if ${ac_cv_lib_socket_connect+:} false; then :
43817   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
43818 else
43819   ac_check_lib_save_LIBS=$LIBS
43820 LIBS="-lsocket $X_EXTRA_LIBS $LIBS"
43821 cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
43822 /* end confdefs.h.  */
43823 
43824 /* Override any GCC internal prototype to avoid an error.
43825    Use char because int might match the return type of a GCC
43826    builtin and then its argument prototype would still apply.  */
43827 #ifdef __cplusplus
43828 extern "C"
43829 #endif
43830 char connect ();
43831 int
43832 main ()
43833 {
43834 return connect ();
43835   ;
43836   return 0;
43837 }
43838 _ACEOF
43839 if ac_fn_cxx_try_link "$LINENO"; then :

43841 else

43845     conftest$ac_exeext conftest.$ac_ext

43955   # Check for libraries that X11R6 Xt/Xaw programs need.
43956   ac_save_LDFLAGS=$LDFLAGS
43957   test -n "$x_libraries" && LDFLAGS="$LDFLAGS -L$x_libraries"
43958   # SM needs ICE to (dynamically) link under SunOS 4.x (so we have to
43959   # check for ICE first), but we must link in the order -lSM -lICE or
43960   # we get undefined symbols.  So assume we have SM if we have ICE.
43961   # These have to be linked with before -lX11, unlike the other
43962   # libraries we check for below, so use a different variable.
43963   # John Interrante, Karl Berry
43964   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for IceConnectionNumber in -lICE" >&5
43965 $as_echo_n "checking for IceConnectionNumber in -lICE... " >&6; }
43966 if ${ac_cv_lib_ICE_IceConnectionNumber+:} false; then :
43967   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
43968 else
43969   ac_check_lib_save_LIBS=$LIBS
43970 LIBS="-lICE $X_EXTRA_LIBS $LIBS"
43971 cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
43972 /* end confdefs.h.  */
43973 
43974 /* Override any GCC internal prototype to avoid an error.
43975    Use char because int might match the return type of a GCC
43976    builtin and then its argument prototype would still apply.  */
43977 #ifdef __cplusplus
43978 extern "C"
43979 #endif
43980 char IceConnectionNumber ();
43981 int
43982 main ()
43983 {
43984 return IceConnectionNumber ();
43985   ;
43986   return 0;
43987 }
43988 _ACEOF
43989 if ac_fn_cxx_try_link "$LINENO"; then :
43990   ac_cv_lib_ICE_IceConnectionNumber=yes
43991 else
43992   ac_cv_lib_ICE_IceConnectionNumber=no
43993 fi

43995     conftest$ac_exeext conftest.$ac_ext
43996 LIBS=$ac_check_lib_save_LIBS
43997 fi
43998 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_lib_ICE_IceConnectionNumber" >&5
43999 $as_echo "$ac_cv_lib_ICE_IceConnectionNumber" >&6; }
44000 if test "x$ac_cv_lib_ICE_IceConnectionNumber" = xyes; then :
44001   X_PRE_LIBS="$X_PRE_LIBS -lSM -lICE"
44002 fi

44004   LDFLAGS=$ac_save_LDFLAGS
44005 
44006 fi

44008 
44009     # AC_PATH_XTRA creates X_LIBS and sometimes adds -R flags. When cross compiling
44010     # this doesn't make sense so we remove it.
44011     if test "x$COMPILE_TYPE" = xcross; then
44012       X_LIBS=`$ECHO $X_LIBS | $SED 's/-R \{0,1\}[^ ]*//g'`
44013     fi
44014 
44015     if test "x$no_x" = xyes; then
44016 
44017   # Print a helpful message on how to acquire the necessary build dependency.
44018   # x11 is the help tag: freetype, cups, pulse, alsa etc
44019   MISSING_DEPENDENCY=x11
44020 
44021   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
44022     cygwin_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY
44023   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
44024     msys_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY
44025   else
44026     PKGHANDLER_COMMAND=
44027 
44028     case $PKGHANDLER in
44029       apt-get)
44030         apt_help     $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
44031       yum)
44032         yum_help     $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
44033       port)
44034         port_help    $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
44035       pkgutil)
44036         pkgutil_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
44037       pkgadd)
44038         pkgadd_help  $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
44039     esac
44040 
44041     if test "x$PKGHANDLER_COMMAND" != x; then
44042       HELP_MSG="You might be able to fix this by running '$PKGHANDLER_COMMAND'."
44043     fi
44044   fi
44045 
44046       as_fn_error $? "Could not find X11 libraries. $HELP_MSG" "$LINENO" 5
44047     fi
44048 
44049     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xsolaris; then
44050       OPENWIN_HOME="/usr/openwin"
44051       X_CFLAGS="-I$SYSROOT$OPENWIN_HOME/include -I$SYSROOT$OPENWIN_HOME/include/X11/extensions"
44052       X_LIBS="-L$SYSROOT$OPENWIN_HOME/sfw/lib$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ISADIR \
44053           -L$SYSROOT$OPENWIN_HOME/lib$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ISADIR \
44054           -R$OPENWIN_HOME/sfw/lib$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ISADIR \
44055           -R$OPENWIN_HOME/lib$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ISADIR"
44056     fi
44057 
44058     ac_ext=c
44059 ac_cpp='$CPP $CPPFLAGS'
44060 ac_compile='$CC -c $CFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
44061 ac_link='$CC -o conftest$ac_exeext $CFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
44062 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_c_compiler_gnu
44063 
44064     OLD_CFLAGS="$CFLAGS"
44065     CFLAGS="$CFLAGS $SYSROOT_CFLAGS $X_CFLAGS"
44066 
44067     # Need to include Xlib.h and Xutil.h to avoid "present but cannot be compiled" warnings on Solaris 10
44068     for ac_header in X11/extensions/shape.h X11/extensions/Xrender.h X11/extensions/XTest.h X11/Intrinsic.h
44069 do :
44070   as_ac_Header=`$as_echo "ac_cv_header_$ac_header" | $as_tr_sh`
44071 ac_fn_c_check_header_compile "$LINENO" "$ac_header" "$as_ac_Header" "
44072           # include <X11/Xlib.h>
44073           # include <X11/Xutil.h>
44074 
44075 
44076 "
44077 if eval test \"x\$"$as_ac_Header"\" = x"yes"; then :
44078   cat >>confdefs.h <<_ACEOF
44079 #define `$as_echo "HAVE_$ac_header" | $as_tr_cpp` 1
44080 _ACEOF
44081  X11_HEADERS_OK=yes
44082 else
44083   X11_HEADERS_OK=no; break
44084 fi
44085 
44086 done
44087 
44088 
44089     if test "x$X11_HEADERS_OK" = xno; then
44090 
44091   # Print a helpful message on how to acquire the necessary build dependency.
44092   # x11 is the help tag: freetype, cups, pulse, alsa etc
44093   MISSING_DEPENDENCY=x11
44094 
44095   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
44096     cygwin_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY
44097   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
44098     msys_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY
44099   else
44100     PKGHANDLER_COMMAND=
44101 
44102     case $PKGHANDLER in
44103       apt-get)
44104         apt_help     $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
44105       yum)
44106         yum_help     $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
44107       port)
44108         port_help    $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
44109       pkgutil)
44110         pkgutil_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
44111       pkgadd)
44112         pkgadd_help  $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
44113     esac
44114 
44115     if test "x$PKGHANDLER_COMMAND" != x; then
44116       HELP_MSG="You might be able to fix this by running '$PKGHANDLER_COMMAND'."
44117     fi
44118   fi
44119 
44120       as_fn_error $? "Could not find all X11 headers (shape.h Xrender.h XTest.h Intrinsic.h). $HELP_MSG" "$LINENO" 5
44121     fi
44122 
44123     # If XLinearGradient isn't available in Xrender.h, signal that it needs to be
44124     # defined in libawt_xawt.
44125     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if XlinearGradient is defined in Xrender.h" >&5
44126 $as_echo_n "checking if XlinearGradient is defined in Xrender.h... " >&6; }
44127     cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
44128 /* end confdefs.h.  */
44129 #include <X11/extensions/Xrender.h>
44130 int
44131 main ()
44132 {
44133 XLinearGradient x;
44134   ;
44135   return 0;
44136 }
44137 _ACEOF
44138 if ac_fn_c_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
44139   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes" >&5
44140 $as_echo "yes" >&6; }
44141 else
44142   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
44143 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
44144          X_CFLAGS="$X_CFLAGS -DSOLARIS10_NO_XRENDER_STRUCTS"
44145 fi
44146 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
44147 
44148     CFLAGS="$OLD_CFLAGS"
44149     ac_ext=cpp
44150 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
44151 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
44152 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
44153 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
44154 
44155   fi # X11_NOT_NEEDED
44156 
44157 
44158 
44159 
44160 
44161 
44162   ###############################################################################
44163   #
44164   # The common unix printing system cups is used to print from java.
44165   #
44166 
44167 # Check whether --with-cups was given.
44168 if test "${with_cups+set}" = set; then :
44169   withval=$with_cups;
44170 fi
44171 
44172 
44173 # Check whether --with-cups-include was given.
44174 if test "${with_cups_include+set}" = set; then :
44175   withval=$with_cups_include;
44176 fi
44177 
44178 
44179   if test "x$CUPS_NOT_NEEDED" = xyes; then
44180     if test "x${with_cups}" != x || test "x${with_cups_include}" != x; then
44181       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: cups not used, so --with-cups is ignored" >&5
44182 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: cups not used, so --with-cups is ignored" >&2;}
44183     fi
44184     CUPS_CFLAGS=
44185   else
44186     CUPS_FOUND=no
44187 
44188     if test "x${with_cups}" = xno || test "x${with_cups_include}" = xno; then
44189       as_fn_error $? "It is not possible to disable the use of cups. Remove the --without-cups option." "$LINENO" 5
44190     fi
44191 
44192     if test "x${with_cups}" != x; then
44193       CUPS_CFLAGS="-I${with_cups}/include"
44194       CUPS_FOUND=yes
44195     fi
44196     if test "x${with_cups_include}" != x; then
44197       CUPS_CFLAGS="-I${with_cups_include}"
44198       CUPS_FOUND=yes
44199     fi
44200     if test "x$CUPS_FOUND" = xno; then
44201 
44202 
44203   if test "x$with_builddeps_server" != x || test "x$with_builddeps_conf" != x; then
44204     # Source the builddeps file again, to make sure it uses the latest variables!
44205     . $builddepsfile
44206     # Look for a target and build machine specific resource!
44207     eval resource=\${builddep_cups_BUILD_${rewritten_build_var}_TARGET_${rewritten_target_var}}
44208     if test "x$resource" = x; then
44209       # Ok, lets instead look for a target specific resource
44210       eval resource=\${builddep_cups_TARGET_${rewritten_target_var}}
44211     fi
44212     if test "x$resource" = x; then
44213       # Ok, lets instead look for a build specific resource
44214       eval resource=\${builddep_cups_BUILD_${rewritten_build_var}}
44215     fi
44216     if test "x$resource" = x; then
44217       # Ok, lets instead look for a generic resource
44218       # (The cups comes from M4 and not the shell, thus no need for eval here.)
44219       resource=${builddep_cups}
44220     fi
44221     if test "x$resource" != x; then
44222       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Using builddeps $resource for cups" >&5
44223 $as_echo "$as_me: Using builddeps $resource for cups" >&6;}
44224       # If the resource in the builddeps.conf file is an existing directory,
44225       # for example /java/linux/cups
44226       if test -d ${resource}; then
44227         depdir=${resource}
44228       else
44229 
44230   # cups is for example mymodule
44231   # $resource is for example libs/general/libmymod_1_2_3.zip
44232   # $with_builddeps_server is for example ftp://mybuilddeps.myserver.com/builddeps
44233   # $with_builddeps_dir is for example /localhome/builddeps
44234   # depdir is the name of the variable into which we store the depdir, eg MYMOD
44235   # Will download ftp://mybuilddeps.myserver.com/builddeps/libs/general/libmymod_1_2_3.zip and
44236   # unzip into the directory: /localhome/builddeps/libmymod_1_2_3
44237   filename=`basename $resource`
44238   filebase=`echo $filename | sed 's/\.[^\.]*$//'`
44239   filebase=${filename%%.*}
44240   extension=${filename#*.}
44241   installdir=$with_builddeps_dir/$filebase
44242   if test ! -f $installdir/$filename.unpacked; then
44243     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Downloading build dependency cups from $with_builddeps_server/$resource and installing into $installdir" >&5
44244 $as_echo "$as_me: Downloading build dependency cups from $with_builddeps_server/$resource and installing into $installdir" >&6;}
44245     if test ! -d $installdir; then
44246       mkdir -p $installdir
44247     fi
44248     if test ! -d $installdir; then
44249       as_fn_error $? "Could not create directory $installdir" "$LINENO" 5
44250     fi
44251     tmpfile=`mktemp $installdir/cups.XXXXXXXXX`
44252     touch $tmpfile
44253     if test ! -f $tmpfile; then
44254       as_fn_error $? "Could not create files in directory $installdir" "$LINENO" 5
44255     fi
44256 
44257   # $with_builddeps_server/$resource  is the ftp://abuilddeps.server.com/libs/cups.zip
44258   # $tmpfile is the local file name for the downloaded file.
44259   VALID_TOOL=no
44260   if test "x$BDEPS_FTP" = xwget; then
44261     VALID_TOOL=yes
44262     wget -O $tmpfile $with_builddeps_server/$resource
44263   fi
44264   if test "x$BDEPS_FTP" = xlftp; then
44265     VALID_TOOL=yes
44266     lftp -c "get $with_builddeps_server/$resource  -o $tmpfile"
44267   fi
44268   if test "x$BDEPS_FTP" = xftp; then
44269     VALID_TOOL=yes
44270     FTPSERVER=`echo $with_builddeps_server/$resource  | cut -f 3 -d '/'`
44271     FTPPATH=`echo $with_builddeps_server/$resource  | cut -f 4- -d '/'`
44272     FTPUSERPWD=${FTPSERVER%%@*}
44273     if test "x$FTPSERVER" != "x$FTPUSERPWD"; then
44274       FTPUSER=${userpwd%%:*}
44275       FTPPWD=${userpwd#*@}
44276       FTPSERVER=${FTPSERVER#*@}
44277     else
44278       FTPUSER=ftp
44279       FTPPWD=ftp
44280     fi
44281     # the "pass" command does not work on some
44282     # ftp clients (read ftp.exe) but if it works,
44283     # passive mode is better!
44284     ( \
44285         echo "user $FTPUSER $FTPPWD"        ; \
44286         echo "pass"                         ; \
44287         echo "bin"                          ; \
44288         echo "get $FTPPATH $tmpfile"              ; \
44289     ) | ftp -in $FTPSERVER
44290   fi
44291   if test "x$VALID_TOOL" != xyes; then
44292     as_fn_error $? "I do not know how to use the tool: $BDEPS_FTP" "$LINENO" 5
44293   fi
44294 
44295     mv $tmpfile $installdir/$filename
44296     if test ! -s $installdir/$filename; then
44297       as_fn_error $? "Could not download $with_builddeps_server/$resource" "$LINENO" 5
44298     fi
44299     case "$extension" in
44300       zip)  echo "Unzipping $installdir/$filename..."
44301         (cd $installdir ; rm -f $installdir/$filename.unpacked ; $BDEPS_UNZIP $installdir/$filename > /dev/null && touch $installdir/$filename.unpacked)
44302         ;;
44303       tar.gz) echo "Untaring $installdir/$filename..."
44304         (cd $installdir ; rm -f $installdir/$filename.unpacked ; tar xzf $installdir/$filename && touch $installdir/$filename.unpacked)
44305         ;;
44306       tgz) echo "Untaring $installdir/$filename..."
44307         (cd $installdir ; rm -f $installdir/$filename.unpacked ; tar xzf $installdir/$filename && touch $installdir/$filename.unpacked)
44308         ;;
44309       *) as_fn_error $? "Cannot handle build depency archive with extension $extension" "$LINENO" 5
44310         ;;
44311     esac
44312   fi
44313   if test -f $installdir/$filename.unpacked; then
44314     depdir=$installdir
44315   fi
44316 
44317       fi
44318       # Source the builddeps file again, because in the previous command, the depdir
44319       # was updated to point at the current build dependency install directory.
44320       . $builddepsfile
44321       # Now extract variables from the builddeps.conf files.
44322       theroot=${builddep_cups_ROOT}
44323       thecflags=${builddep_cups_CFLAGS}
44324       thelibs=${builddep_cups_LIBS}
44325       if test "x$depdir" = x; then
44326         as_fn_error $? "Could not download build dependency cups" "$LINENO" 5
44327       fi
44328       CUPS=$depdir
44329       if test "x$theroot" != x; then
44330         CUPS="$theroot"
44331       fi
44332       if test "x$thecflags" != x; then
44333         CUPS_CFLAGS="$thecflags"
44334       fi
44335       if test "x$thelibs" != x; then
44336         CUPS_LIBS="$thelibs"
44337       fi
44338       CUPS_FOUND=yes
44339 
44340     fi
44341 
44342   fi
44343 
44344     fi
44345     if test "x$CUPS_FOUND" = xno; then
44346       # Are the cups headers installed in the default /usr/include location?
44347       for ac_header in cups/cups.h cups/ppd.h
44348 do :
44349   as_ac_Header=`$as_echo "ac_cv_header_$ac_header" | $as_tr_sh`
44350 ac_fn_cxx_check_header_mongrel "$LINENO" "$ac_header" "$as_ac_Header" "$ac_includes_default"
44351 if eval test \"x\$"$as_ac_Header"\" = x"yes"; then :
44352   cat >>confdefs.h <<_ACEOF
44353 #define `$as_echo "HAVE_$ac_header" | $as_tr_cpp` 1
44354 _ACEOF
44355 
44356             CUPS_FOUND=yes
44357             CUPS_CFLAGS=
44358             DEFAULT_CUPS=yes
44359 
44360 
44361 fi
44362 
44363 done
44364 
44365     fi
44366     if test "x$CUPS_FOUND" = xno; then
44367       # Getting nervous now? Lets poke around for standard Solaris third-party
44368       # package installation locations.
44369       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for cups headers" >&5
44370 $as_echo_n "checking for cups headers... " >&6; }
44371       if test -s $SYSROOT/opt/sfw/cups/include/cups/cups.h; then
44372         # An SFW package seems to be installed!
44373         CUPS_FOUND=yes
44374         CUPS_CFLAGS="-I$SYSROOT/opt/sfw/cups/include"
44375       elif test -s $SYSROOT/opt/csw/include/cups/cups.h; then
44376         # A CSW package seems to be installed!
44377         CUPS_FOUND=yes
44378         CUPS_CFLAGS="-I$SYSROOT/opt/csw/include"
44379       fi
44380       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $CUPS_FOUND" >&5
44381 $as_echo "$CUPS_FOUND" >&6; }
44382     fi
44383     if test "x$CUPS_FOUND" = xno; then
44384 
44385   # Print a helpful message on how to acquire the necessary build dependency.
44386   # cups is the help tag: freetype, cups, pulse, alsa etc
44387   MISSING_DEPENDENCY=cups
44388 
44389   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
44390     cygwin_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY
44391   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
44392     msys_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY
44393   else
44394     PKGHANDLER_COMMAND=
44395 
44396     case $PKGHANDLER in
44397       apt-get)
44398         apt_help     $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
44399       yum)
44400         yum_help     $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
44401       port)
44402         port_help    $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
44403       pkgutil)
44404         pkgutil_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
44405       pkgadd)
44406         pkgadd_help  $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
44407     esac
44408 
44409     if test "x$PKGHANDLER_COMMAND" != x; then
44410       HELP_MSG="You might be able to fix this by running '$PKGHANDLER_COMMAND'."
44411     fi
44412   fi
44413 
44414       as_fn_error $? "Could not find cups! $HELP_MSG " "$LINENO" 5
44415     fi
44416   fi
44417 
44418 
44419 
44420 
44421 
44422 
44423   ###############################################################################
44424   #
44425   # The ubiquitous freetype library is used to render fonts.
44426   #
44427 
44428 # Check whether --with-freetype was given.
44429 if test "${with_freetype+set}" = set; then :
44430   withval=$with_freetype;
44431 fi
44432 
44433 
44434 # Check whether --with-freetype-include was given.
44435 if test "${with_freetype_include+set}" = set; then :
44436   withval=$with_freetype_include;
44437 fi
44438 
44439 
44440 # Check whether --with-freetype-lib was given.
44441 if test "${with_freetype_lib+set}" = set; then :
44442   withval=$with_freetype_lib;
44443 fi
44444 
44445 
44446 # Check whether --with-freetype-src was given.
44447 if test "${with_freetype_src+set}" = set; then :
44448   withval=$with_freetype_src;
44449 fi
44450 
44451   # Check whether --enable-freetype-bundling was given.
44452 if test "${enable_freetype_bundling+set}" = set; then :
44453   enableval=$enable_freetype_bundling;
44454 fi
44455 
44456 
44457   # Need to specify explicitly since it needs to be overridden on some versions of macosx
44458   FREETYPE_BASE_NAME=freetype
44459   FREETYPE_CFLAGS=
44460   FREETYPE_LIBS=
44461   FREETYPE_BUNDLE_LIB_PATH=
44462 
44463   if test "x$FREETYPE_NOT_NEEDED" = xyes; then
44464     if test "x$with_freetype" != x || test "x$with_freetype_include" != x || test "x$with_freetype_lib" != x || test "x$with_freetype_src" != x; then
44465       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: freetype not used, so --with-freetype is ignored" >&5
44466 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: freetype not used, so --with-freetype is ignored" >&2;}
44467     fi
44468     if test "x$enable_freetype_bundling" != x; then
44469       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: freetype not used, so --enable-freetype-bundling is ignored" >&5
44470 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: freetype not used, so --enable-freetype-bundling is ignored" >&2;}
44471     fi
44472   else
44473     # freetype is needed to build; go get it!
44474 
44475     BUNDLE_FREETYPE="$enable_freetype_bundling"
44476 
44477     if  test "x$with_freetype_src" != x; then
44478       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xwindows; then
44479         # Try to build freetype if --with-freetype-src was given on Windows
44480 
44481   FREETYPE_SRC_PATH="$with_freetype_src"
44482   BUILD_FREETYPE=yes
44483 
44484   # Check if the freetype sources are acessible..
44485   if ! test -d $FREETYPE_SRC_PATH; then
44486     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: --with-freetype-src specified, but can't find path \"$FREETYPE_SRC_PATH\" - ignoring --with-freetype-src" >&5
44487 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: --with-freetype-src specified, but can't find path \"$FREETYPE_SRC_PATH\" - ignoring --with-freetype-src" >&2;}
44488     BUILD_FREETYPE=no
44489   fi
44490   # ..and contain a vc2010 project file
44491   vcxproj_path="$FREETYPE_SRC_PATH/builds/windows/vc2010/freetype.vcxproj"
44492   if test "x$BUILD_FREETYPE" = xyes && ! test -s $vcxproj_path; then
44493     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Can't find project file $vcxproj_path (you may try a newer freetype version) - ignoring --with-freetype-src" >&5
44494 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Can't find project file $vcxproj_path (you may try a newer freetype version) - ignoring --with-freetype-src" >&2;}
44495     BUILD_FREETYPE=no
44496   fi
44497   # Now check if configure found a version of 'msbuild.exe'
44498   if test "x$BUILD_FREETYPE" = xyes && test "x$MSBUILD" == x ; then
44499     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Can not find an msbuild.exe executable (you may try to install .NET 4.0) - ignoring --with-freetype-src" >&5
44500 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Can not find an msbuild.exe executable (you may try to install .NET 4.0) - ignoring --with-freetype-src" >&2;}
44501     BUILD_FREETYPE=no
44502   fi
44503 
44504   # Ready to go..
44505   if test "x$BUILD_FREETYPE" = xyes; then
44506 
44507     # msbuild requires trailing slashes for output directories
44508     freetype_lib_path="$FREETYPE_SRC_PATH/lib$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS/"
44509     freetype_lib_path_unix="$freetype_lib_path"
44510     freetype_obj_path="$FREETYPE_SRC_PATH/obj$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS/"
44511 
44512   unix_path="$vcxproj_path"
44513   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
44514     windows_path=`$CYGPATH -m "$unix_path"`
44515     vcxproj_path="$windows_path"
44516   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
44517     windows_path=`cmd //c echo $unix_path`
44518     vcxproj_path="$windows_path"
44519   fi
44520 
44521 
44522   unix_path="$freetype_lib_path"
44523   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
44524     windows_path=`$CYGPATH -m "$unix_path"`
44525     freetype_lib_path="$windows_path"
44526   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
44527     windows_path=`cmd //c echo $unix_path`
44528     freetype_lib_path="$windows_path"
44529   fi
44530 
44531 
44532   unix_path="$freetype_obj_path"
44533   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
44534     windows_path=`$CYGPATH -m "$unix_path"`
44535     freetype_obj_path="$windows_path"
44536   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
44537     windows_path=`cmd //c echo $unix_path`
44538     freetype_obj_path="$windows_path"
44539   fi
44540 
44541     if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = x64; then
44542       freetype_platform=x64
44543     else
44544       freetype_platform=win32
44545     fi
44546 
44547     # The original freetype project file is for VS 2010 (i.e. 'v100'),
44548     # so we have to adapt the toolset if building with any other toolsed (i.e. SDK).
44549     # Currently 'PLATFORM_TOOLSET' is set in 'TOOLCHAIN_CHECK_POSSIBLE_VISUAL_STUDIO_ROOT'/
44550     # 'TOOLCHAIN_CHECK_POSSIBLE_WIN_SDK_ROOT' in toolchain_windows.m4
44551     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Trying to compile freetype sources with PlatformToolset=$PLATFORM_TOOLSET to $freetype_lib_path_unix ..." >&5
44552 $as_echo "$as_me: Trying to compile freetype sources with PlatformToolset=$PLATFORM_TOOLSET to $freetype_lib_path_unix ..." >&6;}
44553 
44554     # First we try to build the freetype.dll
44555     $ECHO -e "@echo off\n"\
44556              "$MSBUILD $vcxproj_path "\
44557                        "/p:PlatformToolset=$PLATFORM_TOOLSET "\
44558                        "/p:Configuration=\"Release Multithreaded\" "\
44559                        "/p:Platform=$freetype_platform "\
44560                        "/p:ConfigurationType=DynamicLibrary "\
44561                        "/p:TargetName=freetype "\
44562                        "/p:OutDir=\"$freetype_lib_path\" "\
44563                        "/p:IntDir=\"$freetype_obj_path\" > freetype.log" > freetype.bat
44564     cmd /c freetype.bat
44565 
44566     if test -s "$freetype_lib_path_unix/freetype.dll"; then
44567       # If that succeeds we also build freetype.lib
44568       $ECHO -e "@echo off\n"\
44569                "$MSBUILD $vcxproj_path "\
44570                          "/p:PlatformToolset=$PLATFORM_TOOLSET "\
44571                          "/p:Configuration=\"Release Multithreaded\" "\
44572                          "/p:Platform=$freetype_platform "\
44573                          "/p:ConfigurationType=StaticLibrary "\
44574                          "/p:TargetName=freetype "\
44575                          "/p:OutDir=\"$freetype_lib_path\" "\
44576                          "/p:IntDir=\"$freetype_obj_path\" >> freetype.log" > freetype.bat
44577       cmd /c freetype.bat
44578 
44579       if test -s "$freetype_lib_path_unix/freetype.lib"; then
44580         # Once we build both, lib and dll, set freetype lib and include path appropriately
44581         POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$FREETYPE_SRC_PATH/include"
44582         POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$freetype_lib_path_unix"
44583         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Compiling freetype sources succeeded! (see freetype.log for build results)" >&5
44584 $as_echo "$as_me: Compiling freetype sources succeeded! (see freetype.log for build results)" >&6;}
44585       else
44586         BUILD_FREETYPE=no
44587       fi
44588     else
44589       BUILD_FREETYPE=no
44590     fi
44591   fi
44592 
44593         if test "x$BUILD_FREETYPE" = xyes; then
44594           # Okay, we built it. Check that it works.
44595 
44596   POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH"
44597   POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH"
44598   METHOD="--with-freetype-src"
44599 
44600   # Let's start with an optimistic view of the world :-)
44601   FOUND_FREETYPE=yes
44602 
44603   # First look for the canonical freetype main include file ft2build.h.
44604   if ! test -s "$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH/ft2build.h"; then
44605     # Oh no! Let's try in the freetype2 directory. This is needed at least at Mac OS X Yosemite.
44606     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH/freetype2"
44607     if ! test -s "$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH/ft2build.h"; then
44608       # Fail.
44609       FOUND_FREETYPE=no
44610     fi
44611   fi
44612 
44613   if test "x$FOUND_FREETYPE" = xyes; then
44614     # Include file found, let's continue the sanity check.
44615     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found freetype include files at $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH using $METHOD" >&5
44616 $as_echo "$as_me: Found freetype include files at $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH using $METHOD" >&6;}
44617 
44618     # Reset to default value
44619     FREETYPE_BASE_NAME=freetype
44620     FREETYPE_LIB_NAME="${LIBRARY_PREFIX}${FREETYPE_BASE_NAME}${SHARED_LIBRARY_SUFFIX}"
44621     if ! test -s "$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/$FREETYPE_LIB_NAME"; then
44622       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xmacosx \
44623           && test -s "$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/${LIBRARY_PREFIX}freetype.6${SHARED_LIBRARY_SUFFIX}"; then
44624         # On Mac OS X Yosemite, the symlink from libfreetype.dylib to libfreetype.6.dylib disappeared. Check
44625         # for the .6 version explicitly.
44626         FREETYPE_BASE_NAME=freetype.6
44627         FREETYPE_LIB_NAME="${LIBRARY_PREFIX}${FREETYPE_BASE_NAME}${SHARED_LIBRARY_SUFFIX}"
44628         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Compensating for missing symlink by using version 6 explicitly" >&5
44629 $as_echo "$as_me: Compensating for missing symlink by using version 6 explicitly" >&6;}
44630       else
44631         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Could not find $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/$FREETYPE_LIB_NAME. Ignoring location." >&5
44632 $as_echo "$as_me: Could not find $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/$FREETYPE_LIB_NAME. Ignoring location." >&6;}
44633         FOUND_FREETYPE=no
44634       fi
44635     else
44636       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xwindows; then
44637         # On Windows, we will need both .lib and .dll file.
44638         if ! test -s "$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/${FREETYPE_BASE_NAME}.lib"; then
44639           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Could not find $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/${FREETYPE_BASE_NAME}.lib. Ignoring location." >&5
44640 $as_echo "$as_me: Could not find $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/${FREETYPE_BASE_NAME}.lib. Ignoring location." >&6;}
44641           FOUND_FREETYPE=no
44642         fi
44643       elif test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xsolaris \
44644           && test -s "$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ISADIR/$FREETYPE_LIB_NAME"; then
44645         # Found lib in isa dir, use that instead.
44646         POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ISADIR"
44647         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting to use $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH instead" >&5
44648 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting to use $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH instead" >&6;}
44649       fi
44650     fi
44651   fi
44652 
44653   if test "x$FOUND_FREETYPE" = xyes; then
44654 
44655   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
44656 
44657   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
44658   # unix format.
44659   path="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH"
44660   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
44661 
44662   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
44663   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
44664   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
44665   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
44666   #
44667   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file precense.
44668   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
44669   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
44670   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
44671     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
44672 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
44673     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH" "$LINENO" 5
44674   fi
44675 
44676   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
44677   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
44678 
44679   input_path="$new_path"
44680   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
44681   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
44682   # take no chances and rewrite it.
44683   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
44684   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
44685   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
44686     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
44687     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
44688     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
44689     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
44690       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
44691       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
44692       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
44693       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
44694       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
44695       new_path="$input_path"
44696     fi
44697   fi
44698 
44699   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
44700   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
44701     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
44702     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
44703       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
44704       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
44705       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
44706     fi
44707   fi
44708 
44709 
44710   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
44711     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$new_path"
44712     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&5
44713 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
44714   fi
44715 
44716   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
44717 
44718   path="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH"
44719   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
44720   new_path="$path"
44721   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
44722     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
44723     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
44724   fi
44725 
44726 
44727   input_path="$new_path"
44728   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
44729   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
44730   # take no chances and rewrite it.
44731   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
44732   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
44733   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
44734     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
44735     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
44736   fi
44737 
44738 
44739   windows_path="$new_path"
44740   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
44741     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
44742     new_path="$unix_path"
44743   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
44744     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
44745     new_path="$unix_path"
44746   fi
44747 
44748   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
44749     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$new_path"
44750     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&5
44751 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
44752   fi
44753 
44754   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
44755   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
44756 
44757   else
44758     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
44759     path="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH"
44760     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
44761     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
44762       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
44763 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
44764       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
44765     fi
44766 
44767     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
44768     eval path="$path"
44769     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
44770       as_fn_error $? "The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
44771     fi
44772 
44773     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="`cd "$path"; $THEPWDCMD -L`"
44774   fi
44775 
44776 
44777   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
44778 
44779   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
44780   # unix format.
44781   path="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH"
44782   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
44783 
44784   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
44785   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
44786   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
44787   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
44788   #
44789   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file precense.
44790   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
44791   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
44792   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
44793     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
44794 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
44795     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH" "$LINENO" 5
44796   fi
44797 
44798   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
44799   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
44800 
44801   input_path="$new_path"
44802   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
44803   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
44804   # take no chances and rewrite it.
44805   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
44806   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
44807   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
44808     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
44809     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
44810     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
44811     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
44812       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
44813       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
44814       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
44815       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
44816       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
44817       new_path="$input_path"
44818     fi
44819   fi
44820 
44821   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
44822   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
44823     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
44824     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
44825       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
44826       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
44827       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
44828     fi
44829   fi
44830 
44831 
44832   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
44833     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$new_path"
44834     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&5
44835 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
44836   fi
44837 
44838   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
44839 
44840   path="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH"
44841   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
44842   new_path="$path"
44843   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
44844     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
44845     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
44846   fi
44847 
44848 
44849   input_path="$new_path"
44850   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
44851   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
44852   # take no chances and rewrite it.
44853   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
44854   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
44855   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
44856     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
44857     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
44858   fi
44859 
44860 
44861   windows_path="$new_path"
44862   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
44863     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
44864     new_path="$unix_path"
44865   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
44866     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
44867     new_path="$unix_path"
44868   fi
44869 
44870   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
44871     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$new_path"
44872     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&5
44873 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
44874   fi
44875 
44876   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
44877   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
44878 
44879   else
44880     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
44881     path="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH"
44882     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
44883     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
44884       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
44885 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
44886       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
44887     fi
44888 
44889     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
44890     eval path="$path"
44891     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
44892       as_fn_error $? "The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
44893     fi
44894 
44895     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="`cd "$path"; $THEPWDCMD -L`"
44896   fi
44897 
44898 
44899     FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH"
44900     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for freetype includes" >&5
44901 $as_echo_n "checking for freetype includes... " >&6; }
44902     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH" >&5
44903 $as_echo "$FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH" >&6; }
44904     FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH"
44905     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for freetype libraries" >&5
44906 $as_echo_n "checking for freetype libraries... " >&6; }
44907     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $FREETYPE_LIB_PATH" >&5
44908 $as_echo "$FREETYPE_LIB_PATH" >&6; }
44909   fi
44910 
44911           if test "x$FOUND_FREETYPE" != xyes; then
44912             as_fn_error $? "Can not use the built freetype at location given by --with-freetype-src" "$LINENO" 5
44913           fi
44914         else
44915           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: User specified --with-freetype-src but building freetype failed. (see freetype.log for build results)" >&5
44916 $as_echo "$as_me: User specified --with-freetype-src but building freetype failed. (see freetype.log for build results)" >&6;}
44917           as_fn_error $? "Consider building freetype manually and using --with-freetype instead." "$LINENO" 5
44918         fi
44919       else
44920         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: --with-freetype-src is currently only supported on Windows - ignoring" >&5
44921 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: --with-freetype-src is currently only supported on Windows - ignoring" >&2;}
44922       fi
44923     fi
44924 
44925     if test "x$with_freetype" != x || test "x$with_freetype_include" != x || test "x$with_freetype_lib" != x; then
44926       # User has specified settings
44927 
44928       if test "x$BUNDLE_FREETYPE" = x; then
44929         # If not specified, default is to bundle freetype
44930         BUNDLE_FREETYPE=yes
44931       fi
44932 
44933       if test "x$with_freetype" != x; then
44934         POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$with_freetype/include"
44935         POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$with_freetype/lib"
44936       fi
44937 
44938       # Allow --with-freetype-lib and --with-freetype-include to override
44939       if test "x$with_freetype_include" != x; then
44940         POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$with_freetype_include"
44941       fi
44942       if test "x$with_freetype_lib" != x; then
44943         POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$with_freetype_lib"
44944       fi
44945 
44946       if test "x$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH" != x && test "x$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH" != x; then
44947         # Okay, we got it. Check that it works.
44948 
44949   POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH"
44950   POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH"
44951   METHOD="--with-freetype"
44952 
44953   # Let's start with an optimistic view of the world :-)
44954   FOUND_FREETYPE=yes
44955 
44956   # First look for the canonical freetype main include file ft2build.h.
44957   if ! test -s "$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH/ft2build.h"; then
44958     # Oh no! Let's try in the freetype2 directory. This is needed at least at Mac OS X Yosemite.
44959     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH/freetype2"
44960     if ! test -s "$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH/ft2build.h"; then
44961       # Fail.
44962       FOUND_FREETYPE=no
44963     fi
44964   fi
44965 
44966   if test "x$FOUND_FREETYPE" = xyes; then
44967     # Include file found, let's continue the sanity check.
44968     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found freetype include files at $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH using $METHOD" >&5
44969 $as_echo "$as_me: Found freetype include files at $POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH using $METHOD" >&6;}
44970 
44971     # Reset to default value
44972     FREETYPE_BASE_NAME=freetype
44973     FREETYPE_LIB_NAME="${LIBRARY_PREFIX}${FREETYPE_BASE_NAME}${SHARED_LIBRARY_SUFFIX}"
44974     if ! test -s "$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/$FREETYPE_LIB_NAME"; then
44975       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xmacosx \
44976           && test -s "$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/${LIBRARY_PREFIX}freetype.6${SHARED_LIBRARY_SUFFIX}"; then
44977         # On Mac OS X Yosemite, the symlink from libfreetype.dylib to libfreetype.6.dylib disappeared. Check
