47999   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
48000   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
48001     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
48002 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
48003     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH" "$LINENO" 5
48004   fi
48005 
48006   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
48007   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
48008 
48009   input_path="$new_path"
48010   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
48011   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
48012   # take no chances and rewrite it.
48013   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
48014   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
48015   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
48016     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
48017     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
48018     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
48019     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
48020       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
48021       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
48022       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
48023       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
48024       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
48025       new_path="$input_path"
48026     fi
48027   fi
48028 
48029   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
48030   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
48031     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
48032     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
48033       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
48034       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
48035       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
48036     fi
48037   fi
48038 
48039 
48040   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
48041     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$new_path"
48042     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&5
48043 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
48044   fi
48045 
48046   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
48047 
48048   path="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH"
48049   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
48050   new_path="$path"
48051   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
48052     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
48053     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
48054   fi
48055 
48056 
48057   input_path="$new_path"
48058   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
48059   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
48060   # take no chances and rewrite it.
48061   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
48062   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
48063   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
48064     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
48065     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
48066   fi
48067 
48068 
48069   windows_path="$new_path"
48070   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
48071     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
48072     new_path="$unix_path"
48073   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
48074     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
48075     new_path="$unix_path"
48076   fi
48077 
48078   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
48079     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$new_path"
48080     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&5
48081 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
48082   fi
48083 
48084   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
48085   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
48086 
48087   else
48088     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
48089     path="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH"
48090     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
48091     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
48092       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
48093 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
48094       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
48095     fi
48096 
48097     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
48098     eval path="$path"
48099     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
48100       as_fn_error $? "The path of POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
48101     fi
48102 
48103     POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="`cd "$path"; $THEPWDCMD -L`"
48104   fi
48105 
48106 
48107     FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH"
48108     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for freetype includes" >&5
48109 $as_echo_n "checking for freetype includes... " >&6; }
48110     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH" >&5
48111 $as_echo "$FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH" >&6; }
48112     FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$POTENTIAL_FREETYPE_LIB_PATH"
48113     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for freetype libraries" >&5
48114 $as_echo_n "checking for freetype libraries... " >&6; }
48115     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $FREETYPE_LIB_PATH" >&5
48116 $as_echo "$FREETYPE_LIB_PATH" >&6; }
48117   fi
48118 
48119               fi
48120             fi
48121           fi
48122         fi
48123       fi # end check in well-known locations
48124 
48125       if test "x$FOUND_FREETYPE" != xyes; then
48126 
48127   # Print a helpful message on how to acquire the necessary build dependency.
48128   # freetype is the help tag: freetype, cups, pulse, alsa etc
48129   MISSING_DEPENDENCY=freetype
48130 
48131   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
48132     cygwin_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY
48133   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
48134     msys_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY
48135   else
48136     PKGHANDLER_COMMAND=
48137 
48138     case $PKGHANDLER in
48139       apt-get)
48140         apt_help     $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
48141       yum)
48142         yum_help     $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
48143       port)
48144         port_help    $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
48145       pkgutil)
48146         pkgutil_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
48147       pkgadd)
48148         pkgadd_help  $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
48149     esac
48150 
48151     if test "x$PKGHANDLER_COMMAND" != x; then
48152       HELP_MSG="You might be able to fix this by running '$PKGHANDLER_COMMAND'."
48153     fi
48154   fi
48155 
48156         as_fn_error $? "Could not find freetype! $HELP_MSG " "$LINENO" 5
48157       fi
48158     fi # end user specified settings
48159 
48160     # Set FREETYPE_CFLAGS, _LIBS and _LIB_PATH from include and lib dir.
48161     if test "x$FREETYPE_CFLAGS" = x; then
48162 
48163   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
48164 
48165   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
48166   # unix format.
48167   path="$FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH"
48168   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
48169 
48170   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
48171   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
48172   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
48173   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
48174   #
48175   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file precense.
48176   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
48177   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
48178   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
48179     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
48180 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
48181     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH" "$LINENO" 5
48182   fi
48183 
48184   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
48185   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
48186 
48187   input_path="$new_path"
48188   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
48189   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
48190   # take no chances and rewrite it.
48191   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
48192   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
48193   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
48194     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
48195     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
48196     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
48197     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
48198       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
48199       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
48200       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
48201       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
48202       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
48203       new_path="$input_path"
48204     fi
48205   fi
48206 
48207   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
48208   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
48209     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
48210     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
48211       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
48212       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
48213       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
48214     fi
48215   fi
48216 
48217 
48218   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
48219     FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$new_path"
48220     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&5
48221 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
48222   fi
48223 
48224   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
48225 
48226   path="$FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH"
48227   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
48228   new_path="$path"
48229   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
48230     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
48231     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
48232   fi
48233 
48234 
48235   input_path="$new_path"
48236   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
48237   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
48238   # take no chances and rewrite it.
48239   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
48240   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
48241   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
48242     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
48243     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
48244   fi
48245 
48246 
48247   windows_path="$new_path"
48248   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
48249     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
48250     new_path="$unix_path"
48251   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
48252     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
48253     new_path="$unix_path"
48254   fi
48255 
48256   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
48257     FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="$new_path"
48258     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&5
48259 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
48260   fi
48261 
48262   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
48263   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
48264 
48265   else
48266     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
48267     path="$FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH"
48268     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
48269     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
48270       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
48271 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
48272       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
48273     fi
48274 
48275     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
48276     eval path="$path"
48277     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
48278       as_fn_error $? "The path of FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
48279     fi
48280 
48281     FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH="`cd "$path"; $THEPWDCMD -L`"
48282   fi
48283 
48284       if test -d $FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH/freetype2/freetype; then
48285         FREETYPE_CFLAGS="-I$FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH/freetype2 -I$FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH"
48286       else
48287         FREETYPE_CFLAGS="-I$FREETYPE_INCLUDE_PATH"
48288       fi
48289     fi
48290 
48291     if test "x$FREETYPE_LIBS" = x; then
48292 
48293   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
48294 
48295   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
48296   # unix format.
48297   path="$FREETYPE_LIB_PATH"
48298   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
48299 
48300   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
48301   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
48302   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
48303   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
48304   #
48305   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file precense.
48306   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
48307   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
48308   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
48309     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
48310 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
48311     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of FREETYPE_LIB_PATH" "$LINENO" 5
48312   fi
48313 
48314   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
48315   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
48316 
48317   input_path="$new_path"
48318   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
48319   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
48320   # take no chances and rewrite it.
48321   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
48322   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
48323   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
48324     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
48325     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
48326     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
48327     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
48328       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
48329       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
48330       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
48331       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
48332       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
48333       new_path="$input_path"
48334     fi
48335   fi
48336 
48337   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
48338   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
48339     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
48340     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
48341       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
48342       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
48343       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
48344     fi
48345   fi
48346 
48347 
48348   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
48349     FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$new_path"
48350     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting FREETYPE_LIB_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&5
48351 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting FREETYPE_LIB_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
48352   fi
48353 
48354   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
48355 
48356   path="$FREETYPE_LIB_PATH"
48357   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
48358   new_path="$path"
48359   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
48360     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
48361     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
48362   fi
48363 
48364 
48365   input_path="$new_path"
48366   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
48367   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
48368   # take no chances and rewrite it.
48369   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
48370   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
48371   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
48372     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
48373     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
48374   fi
48375 
48376 
48377   windows_path="$new_path"
48378   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
48379     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
48380     new_path="$unix_path"
48381   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
48382     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
48383     new_path="$unix_path"
48384   fi
48385 
48386   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
48387     FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="$new_path"
48388     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting FREETYPE_LIB_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&5
48389 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting FREETYPE_LIB_PATH to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
48390   fi
48391 
48392   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
48393   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
48394 
48395   else
48396     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
48397     path="$FREETYPE_LIB_PATH"
48398     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
48399     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
48400       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
48401 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
48402       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
48403     fi
48404 
48405     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
48406     eval path="$path"
48407     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
48408       as_fn_error $? "The path of FREETYPE_LIB_PATH, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
48409     fi
48410 
48411     FREETYPE_LIB_PATH="`cd "$path"; $THEPWDCMD -L`"
48412   fi
48413 
48414       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xwindows; then
48415         FREETYPE_LIBS="$FREETYPE_LIB_PATH/$FREETYPE_BASE_NAME.lib"
48416       else
48417         FREETYPE_LIBS="-L$FREETYPE_LIB_PATH -l$FREETYPE_BASE_NAME"
48418       fi
48419     fi
48420 
48421     # Try to compile it
48422     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if we can compile and link with freetype" >&5
48423 $as_echo_n "checking if we can compile and link with freetype... " >&6; }
48424     ac_ext=cpp
48425 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
48426 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
48427 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
48428 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
48429 
48430     PREV_CXXCFLAGS="$CXXFLAGS"
48431     PREV_LIBS="$LIBS"
48432     PREV_CXX="$CXX"
48433     CXXFLAGS="$CXXFLAGS $FREETYPE_CFLAGS"
48434     LIBS="$LIBS $FREETYPE_LIBS"
48435     CXX="$FIXPATH $CXX"
48436     cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
48437 /* end confdefs.h.  */
48438 
48439           #include<ft2build.h>
48440           #include FT_FREETYPE_H
48441           int main () {
48442             FT_Init_FreeType(NULL);
48443             return 0;
48444           }
48445 
48446 _ACEOF
48447 if ac_fn_cxx_try_link "$LINENO"; then :
48448 
48449           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes" >&5
48450 $as_echo "yes" >&6; }
48451 
48452 else
48453 
48454           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
48455 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
48456           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Could not compile and link with freetype. This might be a 32/64-bit mismatch." >&5
48457 $as_echo "$as_me: Could not compile and link with freetype. This might be a 32/64-bit mismatch." >&6;}
48458           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Using FREETYPE_CFLAGS=$FREETYPE_CFLAGS and FREETYPE_LIBS=$FREETYPE_LIBS" >&5
48459 $as_echo "$as_me: Using FREETYPE_CFLAGS=$FREETYPE_CFLAGS and FREETYPE_LIBS=$FREETYPE_LIBS" >&6;}
48460 
48461 
48462   # Print a helpful message on how to acquire the necessary build dependency.
48463   # freetype is the help tag: freetype, cups, pulse, alsa etc
48464   MISSING_DEPENDENCY=freetype
48465 
48466   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
48467     cygwin_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY
48468   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
48469     msys_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY
48470   else
48471     PKGHANDLER_COMMAND=
48472 
48473     case $PKGHANDLER in
48474       apt-get)
48475         apt_help     $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
48476       yum)
48477         yum_help     $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
48478       port)
48479         port_help    $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
48480       pkgutil)
48481         pkgutil_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
48482       pkgadd)
48483         pkgadd_help  $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
48484     esac
48485 
48486     if test "x$PKGHANDLER_COMMAND" != x; then
48487       HELP_MSG="You might be able to fix this by running '$PKGHANDLER_COMMAND'."
48488     fi
48489   fi
48490 
48491 
48492           as_fn_error $? "Can not continue without freetype. $HELP_MSG" "$LINENO" 5
48493 
48494 
48495 fi
48496 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext \
48497     conftest$ac_exeext conftest.$ac_ext
48498     CXXCFLAGS="$PREV_CXXFLAGS"
48499     LIBS="$PREV_LIBS"
48500     CXX="$PREV_CXX"
48501     ac_ext=cpp
48502 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
48503 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
48504 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
48505 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
48506 
48507 
48508     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if we should bundle freetype" >&5
48509 $as_echo_n "checking if we should bundle freetype... " >&6; }
48510     if test "x$BUNDLE_FREETYPE" = xyes; then
48511       FREETYPE_BUNDLE_LIB_PATH="$FREETYPE_LIB_PATH"
48512     fi
48513     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $BUNDLE_FREETYPE" >&5
48514 $as_echo "$BUNDLE_FREETYPE" >&6; }
48515 
48516   fi # end freetype needed
48517 
48518 
48519 
48520 
48521 
48522 
48523 
48524   ###############################################################################
48525   #
48526   # Check for alsa headers and libraries. Used on Linux/GNU systems.
48527   #
48528 
48529 # Check whether --with-alsa was given.
48530 if test "${with_alsa+set}" = set; then :
48531   withval=$with_alsa;
48532 fi
48533 
48534 
48535 # Check whether --with-alsa-include was given.
48536 if test "${with_alsa_include+set}" = set; then :
48537   withval=$with_alsa_include;
48538 fi
48539 
48540 
48541 # Check whether --with-alsa-lib was given.
48542 if test "${with_alsa_lib+set}" = set; then :
48543   withval=$with_alsa_lib;
48544 fi
48545 
48546 
48547   if test "x$ALSA_NOT_NEEDED" = xyes; then
48548     if test "x${with_alsa}" != x || test "x${with_alsa_include}" != x || test "x${with_alsa_lib}" != x; then
48549       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: alsa not used, so --with-alsa is ignored" >&5
48550 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: alsa not used, so --with-alsa is ignored" >&2;}
48551     fi
48552     ALSA_CFLAGS=
48553     ALSA_LIBS=
48554   else
48555     ALSA_FOUND=no
48556 
48557     if test "x${with_alsa}" = xno || test "x${with_alsa_include}" = xno || test "x${with_alsa_lib}" = xno; then
48558       as_fn_error $? "It is not possible to disable the use of alsa. Remove the --without-alsa option." "$LINENO" 5
48559     fi
48560 
48561     if test "x${with_alsa}" != x; then
48562       ALSA_LIBS="-L${with_alsa}/lib -lasound"
48563       ALSA_CFLAGS="-I${with_alsa}/include"
48564       ALSA_FOUND=yes
48565     fi
48566     if test "x${with_alsa_include}" != x; then
48567       ALSA_CFLAGS="-I${with_alsa_include}"
48568       ALSA_FOUND=yes
48569     fi
48570     if test "x${with_alsa_lib}" != x; then
48571       ALSA_LIBS="-L${with_alsa_lib} -lasound"
48572       ALSA_FOUND=yes
48573     fi
48574     if test "x$ALSA_FOUND" = xno; then
48575 
48576 
48577   if test "x$with_builddeps_server" != x || test "x$with_builddeps_conf" != x; then
48578     # Source the builddeps file again, to make sure it uses the latest variables!
48579     . $builddepsfile
48580     # Look for a target and build machine specific resource!
48581     eval resource=\${builddep_alsa_BUILD_${rewritten_build_var}_TARGET_${rewritten_target_var}}
48582     if test "x$resource" = x; then
48583       # Ok, lets instead look for a target specific resource
48584       eval resource=\${builddep_alsa_TARGET_${rewritten_target_var}}
48585     fi
48586     if test "x$resource" = x; then
48587       # Ok, lets instead look for a build specific resource
48588       eval resource=\${builddep_alsa_BUILD_${rewritten_build_var}}
48589     fi
48590     if test "x$resource" = x; then
48591       # Ok, lets instead look for a generic resource
48592       # (The alsa comes from M4 and not the shell, thus no need for eval here.)
48593       resource=${builddep_alsa}
48594     fi
48595     if test "x$resource" != x; then
48596       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Using builddeps $resource for alsa" >&5
48597 $as_echo "$as_me: Using builddeps $resource for alsa" >&6;}
48598       # If the resource in the builddeps.conf file is an existing directory,
48599       # for example /java/linux/cups
48600       if test -d ${resource}; then
48601         depdir=${resource}
48602       else
48603 
48604   # alsa is for example mymodule
48605   # $resource is for example libs/general/libmymod_1_2_3.zip
48606   # $with_builddeps_server is for example ftp://mybuilddeps.myserver.com/builddeps
48607   # $with_builddeps_dir is for example /localhome/builddeps
48608   # depdir is the name of the variable into which we store the depdir, eg MYMOD
48609   # Will download ftp://mybuilddeps.myserver.com/builddeps/libs/general/libmymod_1_2_3.zip and
48610   # unzip into the directory: /localhome/builddeps/libmymod_1_2_3
48611   filename=`basename $resource`
48612   filebase=`echo $filename | sed 's/\.[^\.]*$//'`
48613   filebase=${filename%%.*}
48614   extension=${filename#*.}
48615   installdir=$with_builddeps_dir/$filebase
48616   if test ! -f $installdir/$filename.unpacked; then
48617     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Downloading build dependency alsa from $with_builddeps_server/$resource and installing into $installdir" >&5
48618 $as_echo "$as_me: Downloading build dependency alsa from $with_builddeps_server/$resource and installing into $installdir" >&6;}
48619     if test ! -d $installdir; then
48620       mkdir -p $installdir
48621     fi
48622     if test ! -d $installdir; then
48623       as_fn_error $? "Could not create directory $installdir" "$LINENO" 5
48624     fi
48625     tmpfile=`mktemp $installdir/alsa.XXXXXXXXX`
48626     touch $tmpfile
48627     if test ! -f $tmpfile; then
48628       as_fn_error $? "Could not create files in directory $installdir" "$LINENO" 5
48629     fi
48630 
48631   # $with_builddeps_server/$resource  is the ftp://abuilddeps.server.com/libs/cups.zip
48632   # $tmpfile is the local file name for the downloaded file.
48633   VALID_TOOL=no
48634   if test "x$BDEPS_FTP" = xwget; then
48635     VALID_TOOL=yes
48636     wget -O $tmpfile $with_builddeps_server/$resource
48637   fi
48638   if test "x$BDEPS_FTP" = xlftp; then
48639     VALID_TOOL=yes
48640     lftp -c "get $with_builddeps_server/$resource  -o $tmpfile"
48641   fi
48642   if test "x$BDEPS_FTP" = xftp; then
48643     VALID_TOOL=yes
48644     FTPSERVER=`echo $with_builddeps_server/$resource  | cut -f 3 -d '/'`
48645     FTPPATH=`echo $with_builddeps_server/$resource  | cut -f 4- -d '/'`
48646     FTPUSERPWD=${FTPSERVER%%@*}
48647     if test "x$FTPSERVER" != "x$FTPUSERPWD"; then
48648       FTPUSER=${userpwd%%:*}
48649       FTPPWD=${userpwd#*@}
48650       FTPSERVER=${FTPSERVER#*@}
48651     else
48652       FTPUSER=ftp
48653       FTPPWD=ftp
48654     fi
48655     # the "pass" command does not work on some
48656     # ftp clients (read ftp.exe) but if it works,
48657     # passive mode is better!
48658     ( \
48659         echo "user $FTPUSER $FTPPWD"        ; \
48660         echo "pass"                         ; \
48661         echo "bin"                          ; \
48662         echo "get $FTPPATH $tmpfile"              ; \
48663     ) | ftp -in $FTPSERVER
48664   fi
48665   if test "x$VALID_TOOL" != xyes; then
48666     as_fn_error $? "I do not know how to use the tool: $BDEPS_FTP" "$LINENO" 5
48667   fi
48668 
48669     mv $tmpfile $installdir/$filename
48670     if test ! -s $installdir/$filename; then
48671       as_fn_error $? "Could not download $with_builddeps_server/$resource" "$LINENO" 5
48672     fi
48673     case "$extension" in
48674       zip)  echo "Unzipping $installdir/$filename..."
48675         (cd $installdir ; rm -f $installdir/$filename.unpacked ; $BDEPS_UNZIP $installdir/$filename > /dev/null && touch $installdir/$filename.unpacked)
48676         ;;
48677       tar.gz) echo "Untaring $installdir/$filename..."
48678         (cd $installdir ; rm -f $installdir/$filename.unpacked ; tar xzf $installdir/$filename && touch $installdir/$filename.unpacked)
48679         ;;
48680       tgz) echo "Untaring $installdir/$filename..."
48681         (cd $installdir ; rm -f $installdir/$filename.unpacked ; tar xzf $installdir/$filename && touch $installdir/$filename.unpacked)
48682         ;;
48683       *) as_fn_error $? "Cannot handle build depency archive with extension $extension" "$LINENO" 5
48684         ;;
48685     esac
48686   fi
48687   if test -f $installdir/$filename.unpacked; then
48688     depdir=$installdir
48689   fi
48690 
48691       fi
48692       # Source the builddeps file again, because in the previous command, the depdir
48693       # was updated to point at the current build dependency install directory.
48694       . $builddepsfile
48695       # Now extract variables from the builddeps.conf files.
48696       theroot=${builddep_alsa_ROOT}
48697       thecflags=${builddep_alsa_CFLAGS}
48698       thelibs=${builddep_alsa_LIBS}
48699       if test "x$depdir" = x; then
48700         as_fn_error $? "Could not download build dependency alsa" "$LINENO" 5
48701       fi
48702       ALSA=$depdir
48703       if test "x$theroot" != x; then
48704         ALSA="$theroot"
48705       fi
48706       if test "x$thecflags" != x; then
48707         ALSA_CFLAGS="$thecflags"
48708       fi
48709       if test "x$thelibs" != x; then
48710         ALSA_LIBS="$thelibs"
48711       fi
48712       ALSA_FOUND=yes
48713       else ALSA_FOUND=no
48714 
48715     fi
48716     else ALSA_FOUND=no
48717 
48718   fi
48719 
48720     fi
48721     # Do not try pkg-config if we have a sysroot set.
48722     if test "x$SYSROOT" = x; then
48723       if test "x$ALSA_FOUND" = xno; then
48724 
48725 pkg_failed=no
48726 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for ALSA" >&5
48727 $as_echo_n "checking for ALSA... " >&6; }
48728 
48729 if test -n "$ALSA_CFLAGS"; then
48730     pkg_cv_ALSA_CFLAGS="$ALSA_CFLAGS"
48731  elif test -n "$PKG_CONFIG"; then
48732     if test -n "$PKG_CONFIG" && \
48733     { { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$PKG_CONFIG --exists --print-errors \"alsa\""; } >&5
48734   ($PKG_CONFIG --exists --print-errors "alsa") 2>&5
48735   ac_status=$?
48736   $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$? = $ac_status" >&5
48737   test $ac_status = 0; }; then
48738   pkg_cv_ALSA_CFLAGS=`$PKG_CONFIG --cflags "alsa" 2>/dev/null`
48739 else
48740   pkg_failed=yes
48741 fi
48742  else
48743     pkg_failed=untried
48744 fi
48745 if test -n "$ALSA_LIBS"; then
48746     pkg_cv_ALSA_LIBS="$ALSA_LIBS"
48747  elif test -n "$PKG_CONFIG"; then
48748     if test -n "$PKG_CONFIG" && \
48749     { { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$PKG_CONFIG --exists --print-errors \"alsa\""; } >&5
48750   ($PKG_CONFIG --exists --print-errors "alsa") 2>&5
48751   ac_status=$?
48752   $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$? = $ac_status" >&5
48753   test $ac_status = 0; }; then
48754   pkg_cv_ALSA_LIBS=`$PKG_CONFIG --libs "alsa" 2>/dev/null`
48755 else
48756   pkg_failed=yes
48757 fi
48758  else
48759     pkg_failed=untried
48760 fi
48761 
48762 
48763 
48764 if test $pkg_failed = yes; then
48765 
48766 if $PKG_CONFIG --atleast-pkgconfig-version 0.20; then
48767         _pkg_short_errors_supported=yes
48768 else
48769         _pkg_short_errors_supported=no
48770 fi
48771         if test $_pkg_short_errors_supported = yes; then
48772                 ALSA_PKG_ERRORS=`$PKG_CONFIG --short-errors --print-errors "alsa" 2>&1`
48773         else
48774                 ALSA_PKG_ERRORS=`$PKG_CONFIG --print-errors "alsa" 2>&1`
48775         fi
48776         # Put the nasty error message in config.log where it belongs
48777         echo "$ALSA_PKG_ERRORS" >&5
48778 
48779         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
48780 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
48781                 ALSA_FOUND=no
48782 elif test $pkg_failed = untried; then
48783         ALSA_FOUND=no
48784 else
48785         ALSA_CFLAGS=$pkg_cv_ALSA_CFLAGS
48786         ALSA_LIBS=$pkg_cv_ALSA_LIBS
48787         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes" >&5
48788 $as_echo "yes" >&6; }
48789         ALSA_FOUND=yes
48790 fi
48791       fi
48792     fi
48793     if test "x$ALSA_FOUND" = xno; then
48794       for ac_header in alsa/asoundlib.h
48795 do :
48796   ac_fn_cxx_check_header_mongrel "$LINENO" "alsa/asoundlib.h" "ac_cv_header_alsa_asoundlib_h" "$ac_includes_default"
48797 if test "x$ac_cv_header_alsa_asoundlib_h" = xyes; then :
48798   cat >>confdefs.h <<_ACEOF
48799 #define HAVE_ALSA_ASOUNDLIB_H 1
48800 _ACEOF
48801 
48802             ALSA_FOUND=yes
48803             ALSA_CFLAGS=-Iignoreme
48804             ALSA_LIBS=-lasound
48805             DEFAULT_ALSA=yes
48806 
48807 else
48808   ALSA_FOUND=no
48809 fi
48810 
48811 done
48812 
48813     fi
48814     if test "x$ALSA_FOUND" = xno; then
48815 
48816   # Print a helpful message on how to acquire the necessary build dependency.
48817   # alsa is the help tag: freetype, cups, pulse, alsa etc
48818   MISSING_DEPENDENCY=alsa
48819 
48820   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
48821     cygwin_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY
48822   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
48823     msys_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY
48824   else
48825     PKGHANDLER_COMMAND=
48826 
48827     case $PKGHANDLER in
48828       apt-get)
48829         apt_help     $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
48830       yum)
48831         yum_help     $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
48832       port)
48833         port_help    $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
48834       pkgutil)
48835         pkgutil_help $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
48836       pkgadd)
48837         pkgadd_help  $MISSING_DEPENDENCY ;;
48838     esac
48839 
48840     if test "x$PKGHANDLER_COMMAND" != x; then
48841       HELP_MSG="You might be able to fix this by running '$PKGHANDLER_COMMAND'."
48842     fi
48843   fi
48844 
48845       as_fn_error $? "Could not find alsa! $HELP_MSG " "$LINENO" 5
48846     fi
48847   fi
48848 
48849 
48850 
48851 
48852 
48853 
48854   ###############################################################################
48855   #
48856   # Check for the jpeg library
48857   #
48858 
48859 
48860 # Check whether --with-libjpeg was given.
48861 if test "${with_libjpeg+set}" = set; then :
48862   withval=$with_libjpeg;
48863 fi
48864 
48865 
48866   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for which libjpeg to use" >&5
48867 $as_echo_n "checking for which libjpeg to use... " >&6; }
48868 
48869   # default is bundled
48870   DEFAULT_LIBJPEG=bundled
48871 
48872   #
48873   # if user didn't specify, use DEFAULT_LIBJPEG
48874   #
48875   if test "x${with_libjpeg}" = "x"; then
48876     with_libjpeg=${DEFAULT_LIBJPEG}
48877   fi
48878 
48879   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: ${with_libjpeg}" >&5
48880 $as_echo "${with_libjpeg}" >&6; }
48881 
48882   if test "x${with_libjpeg}" = "xbundled"; then
48883     USE_EXTERNAL_LIBJPEG=false
48884   elif test "x${with_libjpeg}" = "xsystem"; then
48885     ac_fn_cxx_check_header_mongrel "$LINENO" "jpeglib.h" "ac_cv_header_jpeglib_h" "$ac_includes_default"
48886 if test "x$ac_cv_header_jpeglib_h" = xyes; then :
48887 
48888 else
48889    as_fn_error $? "--with-libjpeg=system specified, but jpeglib.h not found!" "$LINENO" 5
48890 fi
48891 
48892 
48893     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for jpeg_CreateDecompress in -ljpeg" >&5
48894 $as_echo_n "checking for jpeg_CreateDecompress in -ljpeg... " >&6; }
48895 if ${ac_cv_lib_jpeg_jpeg_CreateDecompress+:} false; then :
48896   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
48897 else
48898   ac_check_lib_save_LIBS=$LIBS
48899 LIBS="-ljpeg  $LIBS"
48900 cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
48901 /* end confdefs.h.  */
48902 
48903 /* Override any GCC internal prototype to avoid an error.
48904    Use char because int might match the return type of a GCC
48905    builtin and then its argument prototype would still apply.  */
48906 #ifdef __cplusplus
48907 extern "C"
48908 #endif
48909 char jpeg_CreateDecompress ();
48910 int
48911 main ()
48912 {
48913 return jpeg_CreateDecompress ();
48914   ;
48915   return 0;
48916 }
48917 _ACEOF
48918 if ac_fn_cxx_try_link "$LINENO"; then :
48919   ac_cv_lib_jpeg_jpeg_CreateDecompress=yes
48920 else
48921   ac_cv_lib_jpeg_jpeg_CreateDecompress=no
48922 fi
48923 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext \
48924     conftest$ac_exeext conftest.$ac_ext
48925 LIBS=$ac_check_lib_save_LIBS
48926 fi
48927 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_lib_jpeg_jpeg_CreateDecompress" >&5
48928 $as_echo "$ac_cv_lib_jpeg_jpeg_CreateDecompress" >&6; }
48929 if test "x$ac_cv_lib_jpeg_jpeg_CreateDecompress" = xyes; then :
48930   cat >>confdefs.h <<_ACEOF
48931 #define HAVE_LIBJPEG 1
48932 _ACEOF
48933 
48934   LIBS="-ljpeg $LIBS"
48935 
48936 else
48937    as_fn_error $? "--with-libjpeg=system specified, but no libjpeg found" "$LINENO" 5
48938 fi
48939 
48940 
48941     USE_EXTERNAL_LIBJPEG=true
48942   else
48943     as_fn_error $? "Invalid use of --with-libjpeg: ${with_libjpeg}, use 'system' or 'bundled'" "$LINENO" 5
48944   fi
48945 
48946 
48947 
48948   ###############################################################################
48949   #
48950   # Check for the gif library
48951   #
48952 
48953 
48954 # Check whether --with-giflib was given.
48955 if test "${with_giflib+set}" = set; then :
48956   withval=$with_giflib;
48957 fi
48958 
48959 
48960 
48961   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for which giflib to use" >&5
48962 $as_echo_n "checking for which giflib to use... " >&6; }
48963 
48964   # default is bundled
48965   DEFAULT_GIFLIB=bundled
48966 
48967   #
48968   # if user didn't specify, use DEFAULT_GIFLIB
48969   #
48970   if test "x${with_giflib}" = "x"; then
48971     with_giflib=${DEFAULT_GIFLIB}
48972   fi
48973 
48974   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: ${with_giflib}" >&5
48975 $as_echo "${with_giflib}" >&6; }
48976 
48977   if test "x${with_giflib}" = "xbundled"; then
48978     USE_EXTERNAL_LIBGIF=false
48979   elif test "x${with_giflib}" = "xsystem"; then
48980     ac_fn_cxx_check_header_mongrel "$LINENO" "gif_lib.h" "ac_cv_header_gif_lib_h" "$ac_includes_default"
48981 if test "x$ac_cv_header_gif_lib_h" = xyes; then :
48982 
48983 else
48984    as_fn_error $? "--with-giflib=system specified, but gif_lib.h not found!" "$LINENO" 5
48985 fi
48986 
48987 
48988     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for DGifGetCode in -lgif" >&5
48989 $as_echo_n "checking for DGifGetCode in -lgif... " >&6; }
48990 if ${ac_cv_lib_gif_DGifGetCode+:} false; then :
48991   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
48992 else
48993   ac_check_lib_save_LIBS=$LIBS
48994 LIBS="-lgif  $LIBS"
48995 cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
48996 /* end confdefs.h.  */
48997 
48998 /* Override any GCC internal prototype to avoid an error.
48999    Use char because int might match the return type of a GCC
49000    builtin and then its argument prototype would still apply.  */
49001 #ifdef __cplusplus
49002 extern "C"
49003 #endif
49004 char DGifGetCode ();
49005 int
49006 main ()
49007 {
49008 return DGifGetCode ();
49009   ;
49010   return 0;
49011 }
49012 _ACEOF
49013 if ac_fn_cxx_try_link "$LINENO"; then :
49014   ac_cv_lib_gif_DGifGetCode=yes
49015 else
49016   ac_cv_lib_gif_DGifGetCode=no
49017 fi
49018 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext \
49019     conftest$ac_exeext conftest.$ac_ext
49020 LIBS=$ac_check_lib_save_LIBS
49021 fi
49022 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_lib_gif_DGifGetCode" >&5
49023 $as_echo "$ac_cv_lib_gif_DGifGetCode" >&6; }
49024 if test "x$ac_cv_lib_gif_DGifGetCode" = xyes; then :
49025   cat >>confdefs.h <<_ACEOF
49026 #define HAVE_LIBGIF 1
49027 _ACEOF
49028 
49029   LIBS="-lgif $LIBS"
49030 
49031 else
49032    as_fn_error $? "--with-giflib=system specified, but no giflib found!" "$LINENO" 5
49033 fi
49034 
49035 
49036     USE_EXTERNAL_LIBGIF=true
49037   else
49038     as_fn_error $? "Invalid value of --with-giflib: ${with_giflib}, use 'system' or 'bundled'" "$LINENO" 5
49039   fi
49040 
49041 
49042   ###############################################################################
49043   #
49044   # Check for the lcms2 library
49045   #
49046 
49047 
49048 # Check whether --with-lcms was given.
49049 if test "${with_lcms+set}" = set; then :
49050   withval=$with_lcms;
49051 fi
49052 
49053 
49054   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for which lcms to use" >&5
49055 $as_echo_n "checking for which lcms to use... " >&6; }
49056 
49057   DEFAULT_LCMS=bundled
49058 
49059   #
49060   # If user didn't specify, use DEFAULT_LCMS
49061   #
49062   if test "x${with_lcms}" = "x"; then
49063       with_lcms=${DEFAULT_LCMS}
49064   fi
49065 
49066   if test "x${with_lcms}" = "xbundled"; then
49067     USE_EXTERNAL_LCMS=false
49068     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: bundled" >&5
49069 $as_echo "bundled" >&6; }
49070   elif test "x${with_lcms}" = "xsystem"; then
49071     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: system" >&5
49072 $as_echo "system" >&6; }
49073 
49074 pkg_failed=no
49075 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for LCMS" >&5
49076 $as_echo_n "checking for LCMS... " >&6; }
49077 
49078 if test -n "$LCMS_CFLAGS"; then
49079     pkg_cv_LCMS_CFLAGS="$LCMS_CFLAGS"
49080  elif test -n "$PKG_CONFIG"; then
49081     if test -n "$PKG_CONFIG" && \
49082     { { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$PKG_CONFIG --exists --print-errors \"lcms2\""; } >&5
49083   ($PKG_CONFIG --exists --print-errors "lcms2") 2>&5
49084   ac_status=$?
49085   $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$? = $ac_status" >&5
49086   test $ac_status = 0; }; then
49087   pkg_cv_LCMS_CFLAGS=`$PKG_CONFIG --cflags "lcms2" 2>/dev/null`
49088 else
49089   pkg_failed=yes
49090 fi
49091  else
49092     pkg_failed=untried
49093 fi
49094 if test -n "$LCMS_LIBS"; then
49095     pkg_cv_LCMS_LIBS="$LCMS_LIBS"
49096  elif test -n "$PKG_CONFIG"; then
49097     if test -n "$PKG_CONFIG" && \
49098     { { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$PKG_CONFIG --exists --print-errors \"lcms2\""; } >&5
49099   ($PKG_CONFIG --exists --print-errors "lcms2") 2>&5
49100   ac_status=$?
49101   $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$? = $ac_status" >&5
49102   test $ac_status = 0; }; then
49103   pkg_cv_LCMS_LIBS=`$PKG_CONFIG --libs "lcms2" 2>/dev/null`
49104 else
49105   pkg_failed=yes
49106 fi
49107  else
49108     pkg_failed=untried
49109 fi
49110 
49111 
49112 
49113 if test $pkg_failed = yes; then
49114 
49115 if $PKG_CONFIG --atleast-pkgconfig-version 0.20; then
49116         _pkg_short_errors_supported=yes
49117 else
49118         _pkg_short_errors_supported=no
49119 fi
49120         if test $_pkg_short_errors_supported = yes; then
49121                 LCMS_PKG_ERRORS=`$PKG_CONFIG --short-errors --print-errors "lcms2" 2>&1`
49122         else
49123                 LCMS_PKG_ERRORS=`$PKG_CONFIG --print-errors "lcms2" 2>&1`
49124         fi
49125         # Put the nasty error message in config.log where it belongs
49126         echo "$LCMS_PKG_ERRORS" >&5
49127 
49128         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
49129 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
49130                 LCMS_FOUND=no
49131 elif test $pkg_failed = untried; then
49132         LCMS_FOUND=no
49133 else
49134         LCMS_CFLAGS=$pkg_cv_LCMS_CFLAGS
49135         LCMS_LIBS=$pkg_cv_LCMS_LIBS
49136         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes" >&5
49137 $as_echo "yes" >&6; }
49138         LCMS_FOUND=yes
49139 fi
49140     if test "x${LCMS_FOUND}" = "xyes"; then
49141       USE_EXTERNAL_LCMS=true
49142     else
49143       as_fn_error $? "--with-lcms=system specified, but no lcms found!" "$LINENO" 5
49144     fi
49145   else
49146     as_fn_error $? "Invalid value for --with-lcms: ${with_lcms}, use 'system' or 'bundled'" "$LINENO" 5
49147   fi
49148 
49149 
49150 
49151   ###############################################################################
49152   #
49153   # Check for the png library
49154   #
49155 
49156 
49157 # Check whether --with-libpng was given.
49158 if test "${with_libpng+set}" = set; then :
49159   withval=$with_libpng;
49160 fi
49161 
49162 
49163 
49164   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for which libpng to use" >&5
49165 $as_echo_n "checking for which libpng to use... " >&6; }
49166 
49167   # default is bundled
49168   DEFAULT_LIBPNG=bundled
49169 
49170   #
49171   # if user didn't specify, use DEFAULT_LIBPNG
49172   #
49173   if test "x${with_libpng}" = "x"; then
49174       with_libpng=${DEFAULT_LIBPNG}
49175   fi
49176 
49177   if test "x${with_libpng}" = "xbundled"; then
49178       USE_EXTERNAL_LIBPNG=false
49179       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: bundled" >&5
49180 $as_echo "bundled" >&6; }
49181   elif test "x${with_libpng}" = "xsystem"; then
49182 
49183 pkg_failed=no
49184 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for PNG" >&5
49185 $as_echo_n "checking for PNG... " >&6; }
49186 
49187 if test -n "$PNG_CFLAGS"; then
49188     pkg_cv_PNG_CFLAGS="$PNG_CFLAGS"
49189  elif test -n "$PKG_CONFIG"; then
49190     if test -n "$PKG_CONFIG" && \
49191     { { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$PKG_CONFIG --exists --print-errors \"libpng\""; } >&5
49192   ($PKG_CONFIG --exists --print-errors "libpng") 2>&5
49193   ac_status=$?
49194   $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$? = $ac_status" >&5
49195   test $ac_status = 0; }; then
49196   pkg_cv_PNG_CFLAGS=`$PKG_CONFIG --cflags "libpng" 2>/dev/null`
49197 else
49198   pkg_failed=yes
49199 fi
49200  else
49201     pkg_failed=untried
49202 fi
49203 if test -n "$PNG_LIBS"; then
49204     pkg_cv_PNG_LIBS="$PNG_LIBS"
49205  elif test -n "$PKG_CONFIG"; then
49206     if test -n "$PKG_CONFIG" && \
49207     { { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$PKG_CONFIG --exists --print-errors \"libpng\""; } >&5
49208   ($PKG_CONFIG --exists --print-errors "libpng") 2>&5
49209   ac_status=$?
49210   $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$? = $ac_status" >&5
49211   test $ac_status = 0; }; then
49212   pkg_cv_PNG_LIBS=`$PKG_CONFIG --libs "libpng" 2>/dev/null`
49213 else
49214   pkg_failed=yes
49215 fi
49216  else
49217     pkg_failed=untried
49218 fi
49219 
49220 
49221 
49222 if test $pkg_failed = yes; then
49223 
49224 if $PKG_CONFIG --atleast-pkgconfig-version 0.20; then
49225         _pkg_short_errors_supported=yes
49226 else
49227         _pkg_short_errors_supported=no
49228 fi
49229         if test $_pkg_short_errors_supported = yes; then
49230                 PNG_PKG_ERRORS=`$PKG_CONFIG --short-errors --print-errors "libpng" 2>&1`
49231         else
49232                 PNG_PKG_ERRORS=`$PKG_CONFIG --print-errors "libpng" 2>&1`
49233         fi
49234         # Put the nasty error message in config.log where it belongs
49235         echo "$PNG_PKG_ERRORS" >&5
49236 
49237         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
49238 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
49239                  LIBPNG_FOUND=no
49240 elif test $pkg_failed = untried; then
49241          LIBPNG_FOUND=no
49242 else
49243         PNG_CFLAGS=$pkg_cv_PNG_CFLAGS
49244         PNG_LIBS=$pkg_cv_PNG_LIBS
49245         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes" >&5
49246 $as_echo "yes" >&6; }
49247          LIBPNG_FOUND=yes
49248 fi
49249       if test "x${LIBPNG_FOUND}" = "xyes"; then
49250           USE_EXTERNAL_LIBPNG=true
49251           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: system" >&5
49252 $as_echo "system" >&6; }
49253       else
49254           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: system not found" >&5
49255 $as_echo "system not found" >&6; }
49256           as_fn_error $? "--with-libpng=system specified, but no libpng found!" "$LINENO" 5
49257       fi
49258   else
49259       as_fn_error $? "Invalid value of --with-libpng: ${with_libpng}, use 'system' or 'bundled'" "$LINENO" 5
49260   fi
49261 
49262 
49263   ###############################################################################
49264   #
49265   # Check for the zlib library
49266   #
49267 
49268 
49269 # Check whether --with-zlib was given.
49270 if test "${with_zlib+set}" = set; then :
49271   withval=$with_zlib;
49272 fi
49273 
49274 
49275   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for compress in -lz" >&5
49276 $as_echo_n "checking for compress in -lz... " >&6; }
49277 if ${ac_cv_lib_z_compress+:} false; then :
49278   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
49279 else
49280   ac_check_lib_save_LIBS=$LIBS
49281 LIBS="-lz  $LIBS"
49282 cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
49283 /* end confdefs.h.  */
49284 
49285 /* Override any GCC internal prototype to avoid an error.
49286    Use char because int might match the return type of a GCC
49287    builtin and then its argument prototype would still apply.  */
49288 #ifdef __cplusplus
49289 extern "C"
49290 #endif
49291 char compress ();
49292 int
49293 main ()
49294 {
49295 return compress ();
49296   ;
49297   return 0;
49298 }
49299 _ACEOF
49300 if ac_fn_cxx_try_link "$LINENO"; then :
49301   ac_cv_lib_z_compress=yes
49302 else
49303   ac_cv_lib_z_compress=no
49304 fi
49305 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext \
49306     conftest$ac_exeext conftest.$ac_ext
49307 LIBS=$ac_check_lib_save_LIBS
49308 fi
49309 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_lib_z_compress" >&5
49310 $as_echo "$ac_cv_lib_z_compress" >&6; }
49311 if test "x$ac_cv_lib_z_compress" = xyes; then :
49312    ZLIB_FOUND=yes
49313 else
49314    ZLIB_FOUND=no
49315 fi
49316 
49317 
49318   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for which zlib to use" >&5
49319 $as_echo_n "checking for which zlib to use... " >&6; }
49320 
49321   DEFAULT_ZLIB=bundled
49322   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xmacosx; then
49323     #
49324     # On macosx default is system...on others default is
49325     #
49326     DEFAULT_ZLIB=system
49327   fi
49328 
49329   if test "x${ZLIB_FOUND}" != "xyes"; then
49330     #
49331     # If we don't find any system...set default to bundled
49332     #
49333     DEFAULT_ZLIB=bundled
49334   fi
49335 
49336   #
49337   # If user didn't specify, use DEFAULT_ZLIB
49338   #
49339   if test "x${with_zlib}" = "x"; then
49340     with_zlib=${DEFAULT_ZLIB}
49341   fi
49342 
49343   if test "x${with_zlib}" = "xbundled"; then
49344     USE_EXTERNAL_LIBZ=false
49345     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: bundled" >&5
49346 $as_echo "bundled" >&6; }
49347   elif test "x${with_zlib}" = "xsystem"; then
49348     if test "x${ZLIB_FOUND}" = "xyes"; then
49349       USE_EXTERNAL_LIBZ=true
49350       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: system" >&5
49351 $as_echo "system" >&6; }
49352     else
49353       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: system not found" >&5
49354 $as_echo "system not found" >&6; }
49355       as_fn_error $? "--with-zlib=system specified, but no zlib found!" "$LINENO" 5
49356     fi
49357   else
49358     as_fn_error $? "Invalid value for --with-zlib: ${with_zlib}, use 'system' or 'bundled'" "$LINENO" 5
49359   fi
49360 
49361 
49362 
49363   ###############################################################################
49364   LIBZIP_CAN_USE_MMAP=true
49365 
49366 
49367 
49368   ###############################################################################
49369   #
49370   # Check if altzone exists in time.h
49371   #
49372 
49373   cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
49374 /* end confdefs.h.  */
49375 #include <time.h>
49376 int
49377 main ()
49378 {
49379 return (int)altzone;
49380   ;
49381   return 0;
49382 }
49383 _ACEOF
49384 if ac_fn_cxx_try_link "$LINENO"; then :
49385   has_altzone=yes
49386 else
49387   has_altzone=no
49388 fi
49389 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext \
49390     conftest$ac_exeext conftest.$ac_ext
49391   if test "x$has_altzone" = xyes; then
49392 
49393 $as_echo "#define HAVE_ALTZONE 1" >>confdefs.h
49394 
49395   fi
49396 
49397   ###############################################################################
49398   #
49399   # Check the maths library
49400   #
49401 
49402   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for cos in -lm" >&5
49403 $as_echo_n "checking for cos in -lm... " >&6; }
49404 if ${ac_cv_lib_m_cos+:} false; then :
49405   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
49406 else
49407   ac_check_lib_save_LIBS=$LIBS
49408 LIBS="-lm  $LIBS"
49409 cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
49410 /* end confdefs.h.  */
49411 
49412 /* Override any GCC internal prototype to avoid an error.
49413    Use char because int might match the return type of a GCC
49414    builtin and then its argument prototype would still apply.  */
49415 #ifdef __cplusplus
49416 extern "C"
49417 #endif
49418 char cos ();
49419 int
49420 main ()
49421 {
49422 return cos ();
49423   ;
49424   return 0;
49425 }
49426 _ACEOF
49427 if ac_fn_cxx_try_link "$LINENO"; then :
49428   ac_cv_lib_m_cos=yes
49429 else
49430   ac_cv_lib_m_cos=no
49431 fi
49432 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext \
49433     conftest$ac_exeext conftest.$ac_ext
49434 LIBS=$ac_check_lib_save_LIBS
49435 fi
49436 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_lib_m_cos" >&5
49437 $as_echo "$ac_cv_lib_m_cos" >&6; }
49438 if test "x$ac_cv_lib_m_cos" = xyes; then :
49439   cat >>confdefs.h <<_ACEOF
49440 #define HAVE_LIBM 1
49441 _ACEOF
49442 
49443   LIBS="-lm $LIBS"
49444 
49445 else
49446 
49447         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Maths library was not found" >&5
49448 $as_echo "$as_me: Maths library was not found" >&6;}
49449 
49450 
49451 fi
49452 
49453 
49454 
49455   ###############################################################################
49456   #
49457   # Check for libdl.so
49458 
49459   save_LIBS="$LIBS"
49460   LIBS=""
49461   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for dlopen in -ldl" >&5
49462 $as_echo_n "checking for dlopen in -ldl... " >&6; }
49463 if ${ac_cv_lib_dl_dlopen+:} false; then :
49464   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
49465 else
49466   ac_check_lib_save_LIBS=$LIBS
49467 LIBS="-ldl  $LIBS"
49468 cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
49469 /* end confdefs.h.  */
49470 
49471 /* Override any GCC internal prototype to avoid an error.
49472    Use char because int might match the return type of a GCC
49473    builtin and then its argument prototype would still apply.  */
49474 #ifdef __cplusplus
49475 extern "C"
49476 #endif
49477 char dlopen ();
49478 int
49479 main ()
49480 {
49481 return dlopen ();
49482   ;
49483   return 0;
49484 }
49485 _ACEOF
49486 if ac_fn_cxx_try_link "$LINENO"; then :
49487   ac_cv_lib_dl_dlopen=yes
49488 else
49489   ac_cv_lib_dl_dlopen=no
49490 fi
49491 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext \
49492     conftest$ac_exeext conftest.$ac_ext
49493 LIBS=$ac_check_lib_save_LIBS
49494 fi
49495 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ac_cv_lib_dl_dlopen" >&5
49496 $as_echo "$ac_cv_lib_dl_dlopen" >&6; }
49497 if test "x$ac_cv_lib_dl_dlopen" = xyes; then :
49498   cat >>confdefs.h <<_ACEOF
49499 #define HAVE_LIBDL 1
49500 _ACEOF
49501 
49502   LIBS="-ldl $LIBS"
49503 
49504 fi
49505 
49506   LIBDL="$LIBS"
49507 
49508   LIBS="$save_LIBS"
49509 
49510 
49511   ###############################################################################
49512   #
49513   # statically link libstdc++ before C++ ABI is stablized on Linux unless
49514   # dynamic build is configured on command line.
49515   #
49516 
49517 # Check whether --with-stdc++lib was given.
49518 if test "${with_stdc__lib+set}" = set; then :
49519   withval=$with_stdc__lib;
49520         if test "x$with_stdc__lib" != xdynamic && test "x$with_stdc__lib" != xstatic \
49521                 && test "x$with_stdc__lib" != xdefault; then
49522           as_fn_error $? "Bad parameter value --with-stdc++lib=$with_stdc__lib!" "$LINENO" 5
49523         fi
49524 
49525 else
49526   with_stdc__lib=default
49527 
49528 fi
49529 
49530 
49531   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xlinux; then
49532     # Test if -lstdc++ works.
49533     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if dynamic link of stdc++ is possible" >&5
49534 $as_echo_n "checking if dynamic link of stdc++ is possible... " >&6; }
49535     ac_ext=cpp
49536 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
49537 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
49538 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
49539 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
49540 
49541     OLD_CXXFLAGS="$CXXFLAGS"
49542     CXXFLAGS="$CXXFLAGS -lstdc++"
49543     cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
49544 /* end confdefs.h.  */
49545 
49546 int
49547 main ()
49548 {
49549 return 0;
49550   ;
49551   return 0;
49552 }
49553 _ACEOF
49554 if ac_fn_cxx_try_link "$LINENO"; then :
49555   has_dynamic_libstdcxx=yes
49556 else
49557   has_dynamic_libstdcxx=no
49558 fi
49559 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext \
49560     conftest$ac_exeext conftest.$ac_ext
49561     CXXFLAGS="$OLD_CXXFLAGS"
49562     ac_ext=cpp
49563 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
49564 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
49565 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
49566 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
49567 
49568     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $has_dynamic_libstdcxx" >&5
49569 $as_echo "$has_dynamic_libstdcxx" >&6; }
49570 
49571     # Test if stdc++ can be linked statically.
49572     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if static link of stdc++ is possible" >&5
49573 $as_echo_n "checking if static link of stdc++ is possible... " >&6; }
49574     STATIC_STDCXX_FLAGS="-Wl,-Bstatic -lstdc++ -lgcc -Wl,-Bdynamic"
49575     ac_ext=cpp
49576 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
49577 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
49578 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
49579 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
49580 
49581     OLD_LIBS="$LIBS"
49582     OLD_CXX="$CXX"
49583     LIBS="$STATIC_STDCXX_FLAGS"
49584     CXX="$CC"
49585     cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
49586 /* end confdefs.h.  */
49587 
49588 int
49589 main ()
49590 {
49591 return 0;
49592   ;
49593   return 0;
49594 }
49595 _ACEOF
49596 if ac_fn_cxx_try_link "$LINENO"; then :
49597   has_static_libstdcxx=yes
49598 else
49599   has_static_libstdcxx=no
49600 fi
49601 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext \
49602     conftest$ac_exeext conftest.$ac_ext
49603     LIBS="$OLD_LIBS"
49604     CXX="$OLD_CXX"
49605     ac_ext=cpp
49606 ac_cpp='$CXXCPP $CPPFLAGS'
49607 ac_compile='$CXX -c $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext >&5'
49608 ac_link='$CXX -o conftest$ac_exeext $CXXFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS >&5'
49609 ac_compiler_gnu=$ac_cv_cxx_compiler_gnu
49610 
49611     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $has_static_libstdcxx" >&5
49612 $as_echo "$has_static_libstdcxx" >&6; }
49613 
49614     if test "x$has_static_libstdcxx" = xno && test "x$has_dynamic_libstdcxx" = xno; then
49615       as_fn_error $? "Cannot link to stdc++, neither dynamically nor statically!" "$LINENO" 5
49616     fi
49617 
49618     if test "x$with_stdc__lib" = xstatic && test "x$has_static_libstdcxx" = xno; then
49619       as_fn_error $? "Static linking of libstdc++ was not possible!" "$LINENO" 5
49620     fi
49621 
49622     if test "x$with_stdc__lib" = xdynamic && test "x$has_dynamic_libstdcxx" = xno; then
49623       as_fn_error $? "Dynamic linking of libstdc++ was not possible!" "$LINENO" 5
49624     fi
49625 
49626     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking how to link with libstdc++" >&5
49627 $as_echo_n "checking how to link with libstdc++... " >&6; }
49628     # If dynamic was requested, it's available since it would fail above otherwise.
49629     # If dynamic wasn't requested, go with static unless it isn't available.
49630     if test "x$with_stdc__lib" = xdynamic || test "x$has_static_libstdcxx" = xno || test "x$JVM_VARIANT_ZEROSHARK" = xtrue; then
49631       LIBCXX="$LIBCXX -lstdc++"
49632       LDCXX="$CXX"
49633       STATIC_CXX_SETTING="STATIC_CXX=false"
49634       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: dynamic" >&5
49635 $as_echo "dynamic" >&6; }
49636     else
49637       LIBCXX="$LIBCXX $STATIC_STDCXX_FLAGS"
49638       LDCXX="$CC"
49639       STATIC_CXX_SETTING="STATIC_CXX=true"
49640       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: static" >&5
49641 $as_echo "static" >&6; }
49642     fi
49643   fi
49644 
49645 
49646   if test "x$JVM_VARIANT_ZERO" = xtrue || test "x$JVM_VARIANT_ZEROSHARK" = xtrue; then
49647     # Figure out LIBFFI_CFLAGS and LIBFFI_LIBS
49648 
49649 pkg_failed=no
49650 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for LIBFFI" >&5
49651 $as_echo_n "checking for LIBFFI... " >&6; }
49652 
49653 if test -n "$LIBFFI_CFLAGS"; then
49654     pkg_cv_LIBFFI_CFLAGS="$LIBFFI_CFLAGS"
49655  elif test -n "$PKG_CONFIG"; then
49656     if test -n "$PKG_CONFIG" && \
49657     { { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$PKG_CONFIG --exists --print-errors \"libffi\""; } >&5
49658   ($PKG_CONFIG --exists --print-errors "libffi") 2>&5
49659   ac_status=$?
49660   $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$? = $ac_status" >&5
49661   test $ac_status = 0; }; then
49662   pkg_cv_LIBFFI_CFLAGS=`$PKG_CONFIG --cflags "libffi" 2>/dev/null`
49663 else
49664   pkg_failed=yes
49665 fi
49666  else
49667     pkg_failed=untried
49668 fi
49669 if test -n "$LIBFFI_LIBS"; then
49670     pkg_cv_LIBFFI_LIBS="$LIBFFI_LIBS"
49671  elif test -n "$PKG_CONFIG"; then
49672     if test -n "$PKG_CONFIG" && \
49673     { { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$PKG_CONFIG --exists --print-errors \"libffi\""; } >&5
49674   ($PKG_CONFIG --exists --print-errors "libffi") 2>&5
49675   ac_status=$?
49676   $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: \$? = $ac_status" >&5
49677   test $ac_status = 0; }; then
49678   pkg_cv_LIBFFI_LIBS=`$PKG_CONFIG --libs "libffi" 2>/dev/null`
49679 else
49680   pkg_failed=yes
49681 fi
49682  else
49683     pkg_failed=untried
49684 fi
49685 
49686 
49687 
49688 if test $pkg_failed = yes; then
49689 
49690 if $PKG_CONFIG --atleast-pkgconfig-version 0.20; then
49691         _pkg_short_errors_supported=yes
49692 else
49693         _pkg_short_errors_supported=no
49694 fi
49695         if test $_pkg_short_errors_supported = yes; then
49696                 LIBFFI_PKG_ERRORS=`$PKG_CONFIG --short-errors --print-errors "libffi" 2>&1`
49697         else
49698                 LIBFFI_PKG_ERRORS=`$PKG_CONFIG --print-errors "libffi" 2>&1`
49699         fi
49700         # Put the nasty error message in config.log where it belongs
49701         echo "$LIBFFI_PKG_ERRORS" >&5
49702 
49703         as_fn_error $? "Package requirements (libffi) were not met:
49704 
49705 $LIBFFI_PKG_ERRORS
49706 
49707 Consider adjusting the PKG_CONFIG_PATH environment variable if you
49708 installed software in a non-standard prefix.
49709 
49710 Alternatively, you may set the environment variables LIBFFI_CFLAGS
49711 and LIBFFI_LIBS to avoid the need to call pkg-config.
49712 See the pkg-config man page for more details.
49713 " "$LINENO" 5
49714 elif test $pkg_failed = untried; then
49715         { { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: error: in \`$ac_pwd':" >&5
49716 $as_echo "$as_me: error: in \`$ac_pwd':" >&2;}
49717 as_fn_error $? "The pkg-config script could not be found or is too old.  Make sure it
49718 is in your PATH or set the PKG_CONFIG environment variable to the full
49719 path to pkg-config.
49720 
49721 Alternatively, you may set the environment variables LIBFFI_CFLAGS
49722 and LIBFFI_LIBS to avoid the need to call pkg-config.
49723 See the pkg-config man page for more details.
49724 
49725 To get pkg-config, see <http://pkg-config.freedesktop.org/>.
49726 See \`config.log' for more details" "$LINENO" 5; }
49727 else
49728         LIBFFI_CFLAGS=$pkg_cv_LIBFFI_CFLAGS
49729         LIBFFI_LIBS=$pkg_cv_LIBFFI_LIBS
49730         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes" >&5
49731 $as_echo "yes" >&6; }
49732         :
49733 fi
49734 
49735   fi
49736 
49737   if test "x$JVM_VARIANT_ZEROSHARK" = xtrue; then
49738     # Extract the first word of "llvm-config", so it can be a program name with args.
49739 set dummy llvm-config; ac_word=$2
49740 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
49741 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
49742 if ${ac_cv_prog_LLVM_CONFIG+:} false; then :
49743   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
49744 else
49745   if test -n "$LLVM_CONFIG"; then
49746   ac_cv_prog_LLVM_CONFIG="$LLVM_CONFIG" # Let the user override the test.
49747 else
49748 as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
49749 for as_dir in $PATH
49750 do
49751   IFS=$as_save_IFS
49752   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
49753     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
49754   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
49755     ac_cv_prog_LLVM_CONFIG="llvm-config"
49756     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
49757     break 2
49758   fi
49759 done
49760   done
49761 IFS=$as_save_IFS
49762 
49763 fi
49764 fi
49765 LLVM_CONFIG=$ac_cv_prog_LLVM_CONFIG
49766 if test -n "$LLVM_CONFIG"; then
49767   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $LLVM_CONFIG" >&5
49768 $as_echo "$LLVM_CONFIG" >&6; }
49769 else
49770   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
49771 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
49772 fi
49773 
49774 
49775 
49776     if test "x$LLVM_CONFIG" != xllvm-config; then
49777       as_fn_error $? "llvm-config not found in $PATH." "$LINENO" 5
49778     fi
49779 
49780     llvm_components="jit mcjit engine nativecodegen native"
49781     unset LLVM_CFLAGS
49782     for flag in $("$LLVM_CONFIG" --cxxflags); do
49783       if echo "${flag}" | grep -q '^-[ID]'; then
49784         if test "${flag}" != "-D_DEBUG" ; then
49785           if test "${LLVM_CFLAGS}" != "" ; then
49786             LLVM_CFLAGS="${LLVM_CFLAGS} "
49787           fi
49788           LLVM_CFLAGS="${LLVM_CFLAGS}${flag}"
49789         fi
49790       fi
49791     done
49792     llvm_version=$("${LLVM_CONFIG}" --version | sed 's/\.//; s/svn.*//')
49793     LLVM_CFLAGS="${LLVM_CFLAGS} -DSHARK_LLVM_VERSION=${llvm_version}"
49794 
49795     unset LLVM_LDFLAGS
49796     for flag in $("${LLVM_CONFIG}" --ldflags); do
49797       if echo "${flag}" | grep -q '^-L'; then
49798         if test "${LLVM_LDFLAGS}" != ""; then
49799           LLVM_LDFLAGS="${LLVM_LDFLAGS} "
49800         fi
49801         LLVM_LDFLAGS="${LLVM_LDFLAGS}${flag}"
49802       fi
49803     done
49804 
49805     unset LLVM_LIBS
49806     for flag in $("${LLVM_CONFIG}" --libs ${llvm_components}); do
49807       if echo "${flag}" | grep -q '^-l'; then
49808         if test "${LLVM_LIBS}" != ""; then
49809           LLVM_LIBS="${LLVM_LIBS} "
49810         fi
49811         LLVM_LIBS="${LLVM_LIBS}${flag}"
49812       fi
49813     done
49814 
49815 
49816 
49817 
49818   fi
49819 
49820   # libCrun is the c++ runtime-library with SunStudio (roughly the equivalent of gcc's libstdc++.so)
49821   if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xsolstudio && test "x$LIBCXX" = x; then
49822     LIBCXX="${SYSROOT}/usr/lib${OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ISADIR}/libCrun.so.1"
49823   fi
49824 
49825   # TODO better (platform agnostic) test
49826   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = xmacosx && test "x$LIBCXX" = x && test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xgcc; then
49827     LIBCXX="-lstdc++"
49828   fi
49829 
49830 
49831 
49832 
49833   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = "xwindows"; then
49834 
49835 
49836 # Check whether --with-msvcr-dll was given.
49837 if test "${with_msvcr_dll+set}" = set; then :
49838   withval=$with_msvcr_dll;
49839 fi
49840 
49841 
49842   if test "x$with_msvcr_dll" != x; then
49843     # If given explicitely by user, do not probe. If not present, fail directly.
49844 
49845   POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL="$with_msvcr_dll"
49846   METHOD="--with-msvcr-dll"
49847   if test -e "$POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL"; then
49848     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found msvcr100.dll at $POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL using $METHOD" >&5
49849 $as_echo "$as_me: Found msvcr100.dll at $POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL using $METHOD" >&6;}
49850 
49851     # Need to check if the found msvcr is correct architecture
49852     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking found msvcr100.dll architecture" >&5
49853 $as_echo_n "checking found msvcr100.dll architecture... " >&6; }
49854     MSVCR_DLL_FILETYPE=`$FILE -b "$POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL"`
49855     if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
49856       # The MSYS 'file' command returns "PE32 executable for MS Windows (DLL) (GUI) Intel 80386 32-bit"
49857       # on x32 and "PE32+ executable for MS Windows (DLL) (GUI) Mono/.Net assembly" on x64 systems.
49858       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = x32; then
49859         CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH="PE32 executable"
49860       else
49861         CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH="PE32+ executable"
49862       fi
49863     else
49864       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = x32; then
49865         CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH=386
49866       else
49867         CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH=x86-64
49868       fi
49869     fi
49870     if $ECHO "$MSVCR_DLL_FILETYPE" | $GREP "$CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH" 2>&1 > /dev/null; then
49871       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: ok" >&5
49872 $as_echo "ok" >&6; }
49873       MSVCR_DLL="$POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL"
49874       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for msvcr100.dll" >&5
49875 $as_echo_n "checking for msvcr100.dll... " >&6; }
49876       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $MSVCR_DLL" >&5
49877 $as_echo "$MSVCR_DLL" >&6; }
49878     else
49879       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: incorrect, ignoring" >&5
49880 $as_echo "incorrect, ignoring" >&6; }
49881       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The file type of the located msvcr100.dll is $MSVCR_DLL_FILETYPE" >&5
49882 $as_echo "$as_me: The file type of the located msvcr100.dll is $MSVCR_DLL_FILETYPE" >&6;}
49883     fi
49884   fi
49885 
49886     if test "x$MSVCR_DLL" = x; then
49887       as_fn_error $? "Could not find a proper msvcr100.dll as specified by --with-msvcr-dll" "$LINENO" 5
49888     fi
49889   fi
49890 
49891   if test "x$MSVCR_DLL" = x; then
49892     # Probe: Using well-known location from Visual Studio 10.0
49893     if test "x$VCINSTALLDIR" != x; then
49894       CYGWIN_VC_INSTALL_DIR="$VCINSTALLDIR"
49895 
49896   windows_path="$CYGWIN_VC_INSTALL_DIR"
49897   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
49898     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
49899     CYGWIN_VC_INSTALL_DIR="$unix_path"
49900   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
49901     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
49902     CYGWIN_VC_INSTALL_DIR="$unix_path"
49903   fi
49904 
49905       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = x64; then
49906         POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL="$CYGWIN_VC_INSTALL_DIR/redist/x64/Microsoft.VC100.CRT/msvcr100.dll"
49907       else
49908         POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL="$CYGWIN_VC_INSTALL_DIR/redist/x86/Microsoft.VC100.CRT/msvcr100.dll"
49909       fi
49910 
49911   POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL="$POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL"
49912   METHOD="well-known location in VCINSTALLDIR"
49913   if test -e "$POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL"; then
49914     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found msvcr100.dll at $POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL using $METHOD" >&5
49915 $as_echo "$as_me: Found msvcr100.dll at $POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL using $METHOD" >&6;}
49916 
49917     # Need to check if the found msvcr is correct architecture
49918     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking found msvcr100.dll architecture" >&5
49919 $as_echo_n "checking found msvcr100.dll architecture... " >&6; }
49920     MSVCR_DLL_FILETYPE=`$FILE -b "$POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL"`
49921     if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
49922       # The MSYS 'file' command returns "PE32 executable for MS Windows (DLL) (GUI) Intel 80386 32-bit"
49923       # on x32 and "PE32+ executable for MS Windows (DLL) (GUI) Mono/.Net assembly" on x64 systems.
49924       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = x32; then
49925         CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH="PE32 executable"
49926       else
49927         CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH="PE32+ executable"
49928       fi
49929     else
49930       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = x32; then
49931         CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH=386
49932       else
49933         CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH=x86-64
49934       fi
49935     fi
49936     if $ECHO "$MSVCR_DLL_FILETYPE" | $GREP "$CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH" 2>&1 > /dev/null; then
49937       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: ok" >&5
49938 $as_echo "ok" >&6; }
49939       MSVCR_DLL="$POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL"
49940       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for msvcr100.dll" >&5
49941 $as_echo_n "checking for msvcr100.dll... " >&6; }
49942       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $MSVCR_DLL" >&5
49943 $as_echo "$MSVCR_DLL" >&6; }
49944     else
49945       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: incorrect, ignoring" >&5
49946 $as_echo "incorrect, ignoring" >&6; }
49947       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The file type of the located msvcr100.dll is $MSVCR_DLL_FILETYPE" >&5
49948 $as_echo "$as_me: The file type of the located msvcr100.dll is $MSVCR_DLL_FILETYPE" >&6;}
49949     fi
49950   fi
49951 
49952     fi
49953   fi

49969     if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
49970       # The MSYS 'file' command returns "PE32 executable for MS Windows (DLL) (GUI) Intel 80386 32-bit"
49971       # on x32 and "PE32+ executable for MS Windows (DLL) (GUI) Mono/.Net assembly" on x64 systems.

49980       else
49981         CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH=x86-64
49982       fi
49983     fi

49988       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for msvcr100.dll" >&5
49989 $as_echo_n "checking for msvcr100.dll... " >&6; }
49990       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $MSVCR_DLL" >&5
49991 $as_echo "$MSVCR_DLL" >&6; }
49992     else
49993       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: incorrect, ignoring" >&5
49994 $as_echo "incorrect, ignoring" >&6; }
49995       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The file type of the located msvcr100.dll is $MSVCR_DLL_FILETYPE" >&5
49996 $as_echo "$as_me: The file type of the located msvcr100.dll is $MSVCR_DLL_FILETYPE" >&6;}
49997     fi
49998   fi

50000   fi

50064

50068     CYGWIN_VS_TOOLS_DIR="$unix_path"

50071     CYGWIN_VS_TOOLS_DIR="$unix_path"
50072   fi

50074       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = x64; then
50075         POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL=`$FIND "$CYGWIN_VS_TOOLS_DIR" -name msvcr100.dll | $GREP -i /x64/ | $HEAD --lines 1`
50076       else
50077         POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL=`$FIND "$CYGWIN_VS_TOOLS_DIR" -name msvcr100.dll | $GREP -i /x86/ | $HEAD --lines 1`
50078       fi

50083     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found msvcr100.dll at $POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL using $METHOD" >&5
50084 $as_echo "$as_me: Found msvcr100.dll at $POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL using $METHOD" >&6;}
