50090     if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
50091       # The MSYS 'file' command returns "PE32 executable for MS Windows (DLL) (GUI) Intel 80386 32-bit"
50092       # on x32 and "PE32+ executable for MS Windows (DLL) (GUI) Mono/.Net assembly" on x64 systems.
50093       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = x32; then
50094         CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH="PE32 executable"
50095       else
50096         CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH="PE32+ executable"
50097       fi
50098     else
50099       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = x32; then
50100         CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH=386
50101       else
50102         CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH=x86-64
50103       fi
50104     fi
50105     if $ECHO "$MSVCR_DLL_FILETYPE" | $GREP "$CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH" 2>&1 > /dev/null; then
50106       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: ok" >&5
50107 $as_echo "ok" >&6; }
50108       MSVCR_DLL="$POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL"
50109       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for msvcr100.dll" >&5
50110 $as_echo_n "checking for msvcr100.dll... " >&6; }
50111       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $MSVCR_DLL" >&5
50112 $as_echo "$MSVCR_DLL" >&6; }
50113     else
50114       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: incorrect, ignoring" >&5
50115 $as_echo "incorrect, ignoring" >&6; }
50116       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The file type of the located msvcr100.dll is $MSVCR_DLL_FILETYPE" >&5
50117 $as_echo "$as_me: The file type of the located msvcr100.dll is $MSVCR_DLL_FILETYPE" >&6;}
50118     fi
50119   fi
50120 
50121     fi
50122   fi

50124   if test "x$MSVCR_DLL" = x; then
50125     # Probe: Search wildly in the VCINSTALLDIR. We've probably lost by now.
50126     # (This was the original behaviour; kept since it might turn up something)
50127     if test "x$CYGWIN_VC_INSTALL_DIR" != x; then
50128       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = x64; then
50129         POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL=`$FIND "$CYGWIN_VC_INSTALL_DIR" -name msvcr100.dll | $GREP x64 | $HEAD --lines 1`
50130       else
50131         POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL=`$FIND "$CYGWIN_VC_INSTALL_DIR" -name msvcr100.dll | $GREP x86 | $GREP -v ia64 | $GREP -v x64 | $HEAD --lines 1`
50132         if test "x$POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL" = x; then
50133           # We're grasping at straws now...
50134           POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL=`$FIND "$CYGWIN_VC_INSTALL_DIR" -name msvcr100.dll | $HEAD --lines 1`
50135         fi
50136       fi
50137

50139   POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL="$POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL"
50140   METHOD="search of VCINSTALLDIR"
50141   if test -e "$POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL"; then
50142     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Found msvcr100.dll at $POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL using $METHOD" >&5
50143 $as_echo "$as_me: Found msvcr100.dll at $POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL using $METHOD" >&6;}
50144 
50145     # Need to check if the found msvcr is correct architecture
50146     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking found msvcr100.dll architecture" >&5
50147 $as_echo_n "checking found msvcr100.dll architecture... " >&6; }
50148     MSVCR_DLL_FILETYPE=`$FILE -b "$POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL"`
50149     if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
50150       # The MSYS 'file' command returns "PE32 executable for MS Windows (DLL) (GUI) Intel 80386 32-bit"
50151       # on x32 and "PE32+ executable for MS Windows (DLL) (GUI) Mono/.Net assembly" on x64 systems.
50152       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = x32; then
50153         CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH="PE32 executable"
50154       else
50155         CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH="PE32+ executable"
50156       fi
50157     else
50158       if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS" = x32; then
50159         CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH=386
50160       else
50161         CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH=x86-64
50162       fi
50163     fi
50164     if $ECHO "$MSVCR_DLL_FILETYPE" | $GREP "$CORRECT_MSVCR_ARCH" 2>&1 > /dev/null; then
50165       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: ok" >&5
50166 $as_echo "ok" >&6; }
50167       MSVCR_DLL="$POSSIBLE_MSVCR_DLL"
50168       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for msvcr100.dll" >&5
50169 $as_echo_n "checking for msvcr100.dll... " >&6; }
50170       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $MSVCR_DLL" >&5
50171 $as_echo "$MSVCR_DLL" >&6; }
50172     else
50173       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: incorrect, ignoring" >&5
50174 $as_echo "incorrect, ignoring" >&6; }
50175       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The file type of the located msvcr100.dll is $MSVCR_DLL_FILETYPE" >&5
50176 $as_echo "$as_me: The file type of the located msvcr100.dll is $MSVCR_DLL_FILETYPE" >&6;}
50177     fi
50178   fi

50180     fi

50182 
50183   if test "x$MSVCR_DLL" = x; then
50184     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for msvcr100.dll" >&5
50185 $as_echo_n "checking for msvcr100.dll... " >&6; }
50186     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
50187 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
50188     as_fn_error $? "Could not find msvcr100.dll. Please specify using --with-msvcr-dll." "$LINENO" 5
50189   fi
50190 
50191 
50192   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
50193 
50194   # Input might be given as Windows format, start by converting to
50195   # unix format.
50196   path="$MSVCR_DLL"
50197   new_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$path"`
50198 
50199   # Cygwin tries to hide some aspects of the Windows file system, such that binaries are
50200   # named .exe but called without that suffix. Therefore, "foo" and "foo.exe" are considered
50201   # the same file, most of the time (as in "test -f"). But not when running cygpath -s, then
50202   # "foo.exe" is OK but "foo" is an error.
50203   #
50204   # This test is therefore slightly more accurate than "test -f" to check for file precense.
50205   # It is also a way to make sure we got the proper file name for the real test later on.
50206   test_shortpath=`$CYGPATH -s -m "$new_path" 2> /dev/null`
50207   if test "x$test_shortpath" = x; then
50208     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of MSVCR_DLL, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
50209 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of MSVCR_DLL, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
50210     as_fn_error $? "Cannot locate the the path of MSVCR_DLL" "$LINENO" 5
50211   fi
50212 
50213   # Call helper function which possibly converts this using DOS-style short mode.
50214   # If so, the updated path is stored in $new_path.
50215 
50216   input_path="$new_path"
50217   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
50218   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
50219   # take no chances and rewrite it.
50220   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
50221   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-._/a-zA-Z0-9]`
50222   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
50223     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
50224     shortmode_path=`$CYGPATH -s -m -a "$input_path"`
50225     path_after_shortmode=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
50226     if test "x$path_after_shortmode" != "x$input_to_shortpath"; then
50227       # Going to short mode and back again did indeed matter. Since short mode is
50228       # case insensitive, let's make it lowercase to improve readability.
50229       shortmode_path=`$ECHO "$shortmode_path" | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
50230       # Now convert it back to Unix-stile (cygpath)
50231       input_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$shortmode_path"`
50232       new_path="$input_path"
50233     fi
50234   fi
50235 
50236   test_cygdrive_prefix=`$ECHO $input_path | $GREP ^/cygdrive/`
50237   if test "x$test_cygdrive_prefix" = x; then
50238     # As a simple fix, exclude /usr/bin since it's not a real path.
50239     if test "x`$ECHO $new_path | $GREP ^/usr/bin/`" = x; then
50240       # The path is in a Cygwin special directory (e.g. /home). We need this converted to
50241       # a path prefixed by /cygdrive for fixpath to work.
50242       new_path="$CYGWIN_ROOT_PATH$input_path"
50243     fi
50244   fi
50245 
50246 
50247   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
50248     MSVCR_DLL="$new_path"
50249     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting MSVCR_DLL to \"$new_path\"" >&5
50250 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting MSVCR_DLL to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
50251   fi
50252 
50253   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
50254 
50255   path="$MSVCR_DLL"
50256   has_colon=`$ECHO $path | $GREP ^.:`
50257   new_path="$path"
50258   if test "x$has_colon" = x; then
50259     # Not in mixed or Windows style, start by that.
50260     new_path=`cmd //c echo $path`
50261   fi
50262 
50263 
50264   input_path="$new_path"
50265   # Check if we need to convert this using DOS-style short mode. If the path
50266   # contains just simple characters, use it. Otherwise (spaces, weird characters),
50267   # take no chances and rewrite it.
50268   # Note: m4 eats our [], so we need to use [ and ] instead.
50269   has_forbidden_chars=`$ECHO "$input_path" | $GREP [^-_/:a-zA-Z0-9]`
50270   if test "x$has_forbidden_chars" != x; then
50271     # Now convert it to mixed DOS-style, short mode (no spaces, and / instead of \)
50272     new_path=`cmd /c "for %A in (\"$input_path\") do @echo %~sA"|$TR \\\\\\\\ / | $TR 'ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ' 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'`
50273   fi
50274 
50275 
50276   windows_path="$new_path"
50277   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
50278     unix_path=`$CYGPATH -u "$windows_path"`
50279     new_path="$unix_path"
50280   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
50281     unix_path=`$ECHO "$windows_path" | $SED -e 's,^\\(.\\):,/\\1,g' -e 's,\\\\,/,g'`
50282     new_path="$unix_path"
50283   fi
50284 
50285   if test "x$path" != "x$new_path"; then
50286     MSVCR_DLL="$new_path"
50287     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Rewriting MSVCR_DLL to \"$new_path\"" >&5
50288 $as_echo "$as_me: Rewriting MSVCR_DLL to \"$new_path\"" >&6;}
50289   fi
50290 
50291   # Save the first 10 bytes of this path to the storage, so fixpath can work.
50292   all_fixpath_prefixes=("${all_fixpath_prefixes[@]}" "${new_path:0:10}")
50293 
50294   else
50295     # We're on a unix platform. Hooray! :)
50296     path="$MSVCR_DLL"
50297     has_space=`$ECHO "$path" | $GREP " "`
50298     if test "x$has_space" != x; then
50299       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: The path of MSVCR_DLL, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&5
50300 $as_echo "$as_me: The path of MSVCR_DLL, which resolves as \"$path\", is invalid." >&6;}
50301       as_fn_error $? "Spaces are not allowed in this path." "$LINENO" 5
50302     fi
50303 
50304     # Use eval to expand a potential ~
50305     eval path="$path"
50306     if test ! -f "$path" && test ! -d "$path"; then
50307       as_fn_error $? "The path of MSVCR_DLL, which resolves as \"$path\", is not found." "$LINENO" 5
50308     fi
50309 
50310     MSVCR_DLL="`cd "$path"; $THEPWDCMD -L`"
50311   fi
50312 
50313 
50314 
50315 
50316 # Check whether --with-dxsdk was given.
50317 if test "${with_dxsdk+set}" = set; then :
50318   withval=$with_dxsdk; { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Option --with-dxsdk is deprecated and will be ignored." >&5
50319 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Option --with-dxsdk is deprecated and will be ignored." >&2;}
50320 fi
50321 
50322 
50323 
50324 
50325 # Check whether --with-dxsdk-lib was given.
50326 if test "${with_dxsdk_lib+set}" = set; then :
50327   withval=$with_dxsdk_lib; { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Option --with-dxsdk-lib is deprecated and will be ignored." >&5
50328 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Option --with-dxsdk-lib is deprecated and will be ignored." >&2;}
50329 fi
50330 
50331 
50332 
50333 
50334 # Check whether --with-dxsdk-include was given.
50335 if test "${with_dxsdk_include+set}" = set; then :
50336   withval=$with_dxsdk_include; { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Option --with-dxsdk-include is deprecated and will be ignored." >&5
50337 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Option --with-dxsdk-include is deprecated and will be ignored." >&2;}
50338 fi
50339 
50340 
50341   fi
50342 
50343 
50344 
50345 ###############################################################################
50346 #
50347 # We need to do some final tweaking, when everything else is done.
50348 #
50349 ###############################################################################
50350 
50351 
50352   HOTSPOT_MAKE_ARGS="$HOTSPOT_TARGET"
50353 
50354 
50355   # The name of the Service Agent jar.
50356   SALIB_NAME="${LIBRARY_PREFIX}saproc${SHARED_LIBRARY_SUFFIX}"
50357   if test "x$OPENJDK_TARGET_OS" = "xwindows"; then
50358     SALIB_NAME="${LIBRARY_PREFIX}sawindbg${SHARED_LIBRARY_SUFFIX}"
50359   fi
50360 
50361 
50362 
50363     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if elliptic curve crypto implementation is present" >&5
50364 $as_echo_n "checking if elliptic curve crypto implementation is present... " >&6; }
50365 
50366     if test -d "${SRC_ROOT}/jdk/src/jdk.crypto.ec/share/native/libsunec/impl"; then
50367       ENABLE_INTREE_EC=yes
50368       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes" >&5
50369 $as_echo "yes" >&6; }
50370     else
50371       ENABLE_INTREE_EC=no
50372       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
50373 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
50374     fi
50375 
50376 
50377 
50378 
50379 ###############################################################################
50380 #
50381 # Configure parts of the build that only affect the build performance,
50382 # not the result.
50383 #
50384 ###############################################################################
50385 
50386 
50387   # How many cores do we have on this build system?
50388 
50389 # Check whether --with-num-cores was given.
50390 if test "${with_num_cores+set}" = set; then :
50391   withval=$with_num_cores;
50392 fi
50393 
50394   if test "x$with_num_cores" = x; then
50395     # The number of cores were not specified, try to probe them.
50396 
50397   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for number of cores" >&5
50398 $as_echo_n "checking for number of cores... " >&6; }
50399   NUM_CORES=1
50400   FOUND_CORES=no
50401 
50402   if test -f /proc/cpuinfo; then
50403     # Looks like a Linux (or cygwin) system
50404     NUM_CORES=`cat /proc/cpuinfo  | grep -c processor`
50405     FOUND_CORES=yes
50406   elif test -x /usr/sbin/psrinfo; then
50407     # Looks like a Solaris system
50408     NUM_CORES=`LC_MESSAGES=C /usr/sbin/psrinfo -v | grep -c on-line`
50409     FOUND_CORES=yes
50410   elif test -x /usr/sbin/system_profiler; then
50411     # Looks like a MacOSX system
50412     NUM_CORES=`/usr/sbin/system_profiler -detailLevel full SPHardwareDataType | grep 'Cores' | awk  '{print $5}'`
50413     FOUND_CORES=yes
50414   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS" = xaix ; then
50415     NUM_CORES=`/usr/sbin/prtconf | grep "^Number Of Processors" | awk '{ print $4 }'`
50416     FOUND_CORES=yes
50417   elif test -n "$NUMBER_OF_PROCESSORS"; then
50418     # On windows, look in the env
50419     NUM_CORES=$NUMBER_OF_PROCESSORS
50420     FOUND_CORES=yes
50421   fi
50422 
50423   if test "x$FOUND_CORES" = xyes; then
50424     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $NUM_CORES" >&5
50425 $as_echo "$NUM_CORES" >&6; }
50426   else
50427     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: could not detect number of cores, defaulting to 1" >&5
50428 $as_echo "could not detect number of cores, defaulting to 1" >&6; }
50429     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: This will disable all parallelism from build!" >&5
50430 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: This will disable all parallelism from build!" >&2;}
50431   fi
50432 
50433   else
50434     NUM_CORES=$with_num_cores
50435   fi
50436 
50437 
50438 
50439   # How much memory do we have on this build system?
50440 
50441 # Check whether --with-memory-size was given.
50442 if test "${with_memory_size+set}" = set; then :
50443   withval=$with_memory_size;
50444 fi
50445 
50446   if test "x$with_memory_size" = x; then
50447     # The memory size was not specified, try to probe it.
50448 
50449   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for memory size" >&5
50450 $as_echo_n "checking for memory size... " >&6; }
50451   # Default to 1024 MB
50452   MEMORY_SIZE=1024
50453   FOUND_MEM=no
50454 
50455   if test -f /proc/meminfo; then
50456     # Looks like a Linux (or cygwin) system
50457     MEMORY_SIZE=`cat /proc/meminfo | grep MemTotal | awk '{print $2}'`
50458     MEMORY_SIZE=`expr $MEMORY_SIZE / 1024`
50459     FOUND_MEM=yes
50460   elif test -x /usr/sbin/prtconf; then
50461     # Looks like a Solaris or AIX system
50462     MEMORY_SIZE=`/usr/sbin/prtconf | grep "^Memory [Ss]ize" | awk '{ print $3 }'`
50463     FOUND_MEM=yes
50464   elif test -x /usr/sbin/system_profiler; then
50465     # Looks like a MacOSX system
50466     MEMORY_SIZE=`/usr/sbin/system_profiler -detailLevel full SPHardwareDataType | grep 'Memory' | awk  '{print $2}'`
50467     MEMORY_SIZE=`expr $MEMORY_SIZE \* 1024`
50468     FOUND_MEM=yes
50469   elif test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS" = xwindows; then
50470     # Windows, but without cygwin
50471     MEMORY_SIZE=`wmic computersystem get totalphysicalmemory -value | grep = | cut -d "=" -f 2-`
50472     MEMORY_SIZE=`expr $MEMORY_SIZE / 1024 / 1024`
50473     FOUND_MEM=yes
50474   fi
50475 
50476   if test "x$FOUND_MEM" = xyes; then
50477     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $MEMORY_SIZE MB" >&5
50478 $as_echo "$MEMORY_SIZE MB" >&6; }
50479   else
50480     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: could not detect memory size, defaulting to $MEMORY_SIZE MB" >&5
50481 $as_echo "could not detect memory size, defaulting to $MEMORY_SIZE MB" >&6; }
50482     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: This might seriously impact build performance!" >&5
50483 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: This might seriously impact build performance!" >&2;}
50484   fi
50485 
50486   else
50487     MEMORY_SIZE=$with_memory_size
50488   fi
50489 
50490 
50491 
50492   # Provide a decent default number of parallel jobs for make depending on
50493   # number of cores, amount of memory and machine architecture.
50494 
50495 # Check whether --with-jobs was given.
50496 if test "${with_jobs+set}" = set; then :
50497   withval=$with_jobs;
50498 fi
50499 
50500   if test "x$with_jobs" = x; then
50501     # Number of jobs was not specified, calculate.
50502     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for appropriate number of jobs to run in parallel" >&5
50503 $as_echo_n "checking for appropriate number of jobs to run in parallel... " >&6; }
50504     # Approximate memory in GB.
50505     memory_gb=`expr $MEMORY_SIZE / 1024`
50506     # Pick the lowest of memory in gb and number of cores.
50507     if test "$memory_gb" -lt "$NUM_CORES"; then
50508       JOBS="$memory_gb"
50509     else
50510       JOBS="$NUM_CORES"
50511       # On bigger machines, leave some room for other processes to run
50512       if test "$JOBS" -gt "4"; then
50513         JOBS=`expr $JOBS '*' 90 / 100`
50514       fi
50515     fi
50516     # Cap number of jobs to 16
50517     if test "$JOBS" -gt "16"; then
50518       JOBS=16
50519     fi
50520     if test "$JOBS" -eq "0"; then
50521       JOBS=1
50522     fi
50523     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $JOBS" >&5
50524 $as_echo "$JOBS" >&6; }
50525   else
50526     JOBS=$with_jobs
50527   fi
50528 
50529 
50530 
50531 # Setup arguments for the boot jdk (after cores and memory have been setup)
50532 
50533   ##############################################################################
50534   #
50535   # Specify jvm options for anything that is run with the Boot JDK.
50536   # Not all JVM:s accept the same arguments on the command line.
50537   #
50538 
50539 # Check whether --with-boot-jdk-jvmargs was given.
50540 if test "${with_boot_jdk_jvmargs+set}" = set; then :
50541   withval=$with_boot_jdk_jvmargs;
50542 fi
50543 
50544 
50545   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking flags for boot jdk java command " >&5
50546 $as_echo_n "checking flags for boot jdk java command ... " >&6; }
50547 
50548   # Disable special log output when a debug build is used as Boot JDK...
50549 
50550   $ECHO "Check if jvm arg is ok: -XX:-PrintVMOptions -XX:-UnlockDiagnosticVMOptions -XX:-LogVMOutput" >&5
50551   $ECHO "Command: $JAVA -XX:-PrintVMOptions -XX:-UnlockDiagnosticVMOptions -XX:-LogVMOutput -version" >&5
50552   OUTPUT=`$JAVA -XX:-PrintVMOptions -XX:-UnlockDiagnosticVMOptions -XX:-LogVMOutput -version 2>&1`
50553   FOUND_WARN=`$ECHO "$OUTPUT" | grep -i warn`
50554   FOUND_VERSION=`$ECHO $OUTPUT | grep " version \""`
50555   if test "x$FOUND_VERSION" != x && test "x$FOUND_WARN" = x; then
50556     boot_jdk_jvmargs="$boot_jdk_jvmargs -XX:-PrintVMOptions -XX:-UnlockDiagnosticVMOptions -XX:-LogVMOutput"
50557     JVM_ARG_OK=true
50558   else
50559     $ECHO "Arg failed:" >&5
50560     $ECHO "$OUTPUT" >&5
50561     JVM_ARG_OK=false
50562   fi
50563 
50564 
50565   # Apply user provided options.
50566 
50567   $ECHO "Check if jvm arg is ok: $with_boot_jdk_jvmargs" >&5
50568   $ECHO "Command: $JAVA $with_boot_jdk_jvmargs -version" >&5
50569   OUTPUT=`$JAVA $with_boot_jdk_jvmargs -version 2>&1`
50570   FOUND_WARN=`$ECHO "$OUTPUT" | grep -i warn`
50571   FOUND_VERSION=`$ECHO $OUTPUT | grep " version \""`
50572   if test "x$FOUND_VERSION" != x && test "x$FOUND_WARN" = x; then
50573     boot_jdk_jvmargs="$boot_jdk_jvmargs $with_boot_jdk_jvmargs"
50574     JVM_ARG_OK=true
50575   else
50576     $ECHO "Arg failed:" >&5
50577     $ECHO "$OUTPUT" >&5
50578     JVM_ARG_OK=false
50579   fi
50580 
50581 
50582   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $boot_jdk_jvmargs" >&5
50583 $as_echo "$boot_jdk_jvmargs" >&6; }
50584 
50585   # For now, general JAVA_FLAGS are the same as the boot jdk jvmargs
50586   JAVA_FLAGS=$boot_jdk_jvmargs
50587 
50588 
50589 
50590   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking flags for boot jdk java command for big workloads" >&5
50591 $as_echo_n "checking flags for boot jdk java command for big workloads... " >&6; }
50592 
50593   # Starting amount of heap memory.
50594 
50595   $ECHO "Check if jvm arg is ok: -Xms64M" >&5
50596   $ECHO "Command: $JAVA -Xms64M -version" >&5
50597   OUTPUT=`$JAVA -Xms64M -version 2>&1`
50598   FOUND_WARN=`$ECHO "$OUTPUT" | grep -i warn`
50599   FOUND_VERSION=`$ECHO $OUTPUT | grep " version \""`
50600   if test "x$FOUND_VERSION" != x && test "x$FOUND_WARN" = x; then
50601     boot_jdk_jvmargs_big="$boot_jdk_jvmargs_big -Xms64M"
50602     JVM_ARG_OK=true
50603   else
50604     $ECHO "Arg failed:" >&5
50605     $ECHO "$OUTPUT" >&5
50606     JVM_ARG_OK=false
50607   fi
50608 
50609 
50610   # Maximum amount of heap memory.
50611   # Maximum stack size.
50612   JVM_MAX_HEAP=`expr $MEMORY_SIZE / 2`
50613   if test "x$BUILD_NUM_BITS" = x32; then
50614     if test "$JVM_MAX_HEAP" -gt "1100"; then
50615       JVM_MAX_HEAP=1100
50616     elif test "$JVM_MAX_HEAP" -lt "512"; then
50617       JVM_MAX_HEAP=512
50618     fi
50619     STACK_SIZE=768
50620   else
50621     # Running Javac on a JVM on a 64-bit machine, takes more space since 64-bit
50622     # pointers are used. Apparently, we need to increase the heap and stack
50623     # space for the jvm. More specifically, when running javac to build huge
50624     # jdk batch
50625     if test "$JVM_MAX_HEAP" -gt "1600"; then
50626       JVM_MAX_HEAP=1600
50627     elif test "$JVM_MAX_HEAP" -lt "512"; then
50628       JVM_MAX_HEAP=512
50629     fi
50630     STACK_SIZE=1536
50631   fi
50632 
50633   $ECHO "Check if jvm arg is ok: -Xmx${JVM_MAX_HEAP}M" >&5
50634   $ECHO "Command: $JAVA -Xmx${JVM_MAX_HEAP}M -version" >&5
50635   OUTPUT=`$JAVA -Xmx${JVM_MAX_HEAP}M -version 2>&1`
50636   FOUND_WARN=`$ECHO "$OUTPUT" | grep -i warn`
50637   FOUND_VERSION=`$ECHO $OUTPUT | grep " version \""`
50638   if test "x$FOUND_VERSION" != x && test "x$FOUND_WARN" = x; then
50639     boot_jdk_jvmargs_big="$boot_jdk_jvmargs_big -Xmx${JVM_MAX_HEAP}M"
50640     JVM_ARG_OK=true
50641   else
50642     $ECHO "Arg failed:" >&5
50643     $ECHO "$OUTPUT" >&5
50644     JVM_ARG_OK=false
50645   fi
50646 
50647 
50648   $ECHO "Check if jvm arg is ok: -XX:ThreadStackSize=$STACK_SIZE" >&5
50649   $ECHO "Command: $JAVA -XX:ThreadStackSize=$STACK_SIZE -version" >&5
50650   OUTPUT=`$JAVA -XX:ThreadStackSize=$STACK_SIZE -version 2>&1`
50651   FOUND_WARN=`$ECHO "$OUTPUT" | grep -i warn`
50652   FOUND_VERSION=`$ECHO $OUTPUT | grep " version \""`
50653   if test "x$FOUND_VERSION" != x && test "x$FOUND_WARN" = x; then
50654     boot_jdk_jvmargs_big="$boot_jdk_jvmargs_big -XX:ThreadStackSize=$STACK_SIZE"
50655     JVM_ARG_OK=true
50656   else
50657     $ECHO "Arg failed:" >&5
50658     $ECHO "$OUTPUT" >&5
50659     JVM_ARG_OK=false
50660   fi
50661 
50662 
50663   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $boot_jdk_jvmargs_big" >&5
50664 $as_echo "$boot_jdk_jvmargs_big" >&6; }
50665 
50666   JAVA_FLAGS_BIG=$boot_jdk_jvmargs_big
50667 
50668 
50669 
50670   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking flags for boot jdk java command for small workloads" >&5
50671 $as_echo_n "checking flags for boot jdk java command for small workloads... " >&6; }
50672 
50673   # Use serial gc for small short lived tools if possible
50674 
50675   $ECHO "Check if jvm arg is ok: -XX:+UseSerialGC" >&5
50676   $ECHO "Command: $JAVA -XX:+UseSerialGC -version" >&5
50677   OUTPUT=`$JAVA -XX:+UseSerialGC -version 2>&1`
50678   FOUND_WARN=`$ECHO "$OUTPUT" | grep -i warn`
50679   FOUND_VERSION=`$ECHO $OUTPUT | grep " version \""`
50680   if test "x$FOUND_VERSION" != x && test "x$FOUND_WARN" = x; then
50681     boot_jdk_jvmargs_small="$boot_jdk_jvmargs_small -XX:+UseSerialGC"
50682     JVM_ARG_OK=true
50683   else
50684     $ECHO "Arg failed:" >&5
50685     $ECHO "$OUTPUT" >&5
50686     JVM_ARG_OK=false
50687   fi
50688 
50689 
50690   $ECHO "Check if jvm arg is ok: -Xms32M" >&5
50691   $ECHO "Command: $JAVA -Xms32M -version" >&5
50692   OUTPUT=`$JAVA -Xms32M -version 2>&1`
50693   FOUND_WARN=`$ECHO "$OUTPUT" | grep -i warn`
50694   FOUND_VERSION=`$ECHO $OUTPUT | grep " version \""`
50695   if test "x$FOUND_VERSION" != x && test "x$FOUND_WARN" = x; then
50696     boot_jdk_jvmargs_small="$boot_jdk_jvmargs_small -Xms32M"
50697     JVM_ARG_OK=true
50698   else
50699     $ECHO "Arg failed:" >&5
50700     $ECHO "$OUTPUT" >&5
50701     JVM_ARG_OK=false
50702   fi
50703 
50704 
50705   $ECHO "Check if jvm arg is ok: -Xmx512M" >&5
50706   $ECHO "Command: $JAVA -Xmx512M -version" >&5
50707   OUTPUT=`$JAVA -Xmx512M -version 2>&1`
50708   FOUND_WARN=`$ECHO "$OUTPUT" | grep -i warn`
50709   FOUND_VERSION=`$ECHO $OUTPUT | grep " version \""`
50710   if test "x$FOUND_VERSION" != x && test "x$FOUND_WARN" = x; then
50711     boot_jdk_jvmargs_small="$boot_jdk_jvmargs_small -Xmx512M"
50712     JVM_ARG_OK=true
50713   else
50714     $ECHO "Arg failed:" >&5
50715     $ECHO "$OUTPUT" >&5
50716     JVM_ARG_OK=false
50717   fi
50718 
50719 
50720   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $boot_jdk_jvmargs_small" >&5
50721 $as_echo "$boot_jdk_jvmargs_small" >&6; }
50722 
50723   JAVA_FLAGS_SMALL=$boot_jdk_jvmargs_small
50724 
50725 
50726   JAVA_TOOL_FLAGS_SMALL=""
50727   for f in $JAVA_FLAGS_SMALL; do
50728     JAVA_TOOL_FLAGS_SMALL="$JAVA_TOOL_FLAGS_SMALL -J$f"
50729   done
50730 
50731 
50732 
50733 # Setup smart javac (after cores and memory have been setup)
50734 
50735 
50736 # Check whether --with-sjavac-server-java was given.
50737 if test "${with_sjavac_server_java+set}" = set; then :
50738   withval=$with_sjavac_server_java;
50739 fi
50740 
50741 
50742   if test "x$with_sjavac_server_java" != x; then
50743     SJAVAC_SERVER_JAVA="$with_sjavac_server_java"
50744     FOUND_VERSION=`$SJAVAC_SERVER_JAVA -version 2>&1 | grep " version \""`
50745     if test "x$FOUND_VERSION" = x; then
50746       as_fn_error $? "Could not execute server java: $SJAVAC_SERVER_JAVA" "$LINENO" 5
50747     fi
50748   else
50749     SJAVAC_SERVER_JAVA="$JAVA"
50750   fi
50751 
50752 
50753   if test "$MEMORY_SIZE" -gt "3000"; then
50754 
50755   $ECHO "Check if jvm arg is ok: -d64" >&5
50756   $ECHO "Command: $SJAVAC_SERVER_JAVA -d64 -version" >&5
50757   OUTPUT=`$SJAVAC_SERVER_JAVA -d64 -version 2>&1`
50758   FOUND_WARN=`$ECHO "$OUTPUT" | grep -i warn`
50759   FOUND_VERSION=`$ECHO $OUTPUT | grep " version \""`
50760   if test "x$FOUND_VERSION" != x && test "x$FOUND_WARN" = x; then
50761     SJAVAC_SERVER_JAVA_FLAGS="$SJAVAC_SERVER_JAVA_FLAGS -d64"
50762     JVM_ARG_OK=true
50763   else
50764     $ECHO "Arg failed:" >&5
50765     $ECHO "$OUTPUT" >&5
50766     JVM_ARG_OK=false
50767   fi
50768 
50769     if test "$JVM_ARG_OK" = true; then
50770       JVM_64BIT=true
50771       JVM_ARG_OK=false
50772     fi
50773   fi
50774 
50775   MX_VALUE=`expr $MEMORY_SIZE / 2`
50776   if test "$JVM_64BIT" = true; then
50777     # Set ms lower than mx since more than one instance of the server might
50778     # get launched at the same time before they figure out which instance won.
50779     MS_VALUE=512
50780     if test "$MX_VALUE" -gt "2048"; then
50781       MX_VALUE=2048
50782     fi
50783   else
50784     MS_VALUE=256
50785     if test "$MX_VALUE" -gt "1500"; then
50786       MX_VALUE=1500
50787     fi
50788   fi
50789   if test "$MX_VALUE" -lt "512"; then
50790     MX_VALUE=512
50791   fi
50792 
50793   $ECHO "Check if jvm arg is ok: -Xms${MS_VALUE}M -Xmx${MX_VALUE}M" >&5
50794   $ECHO "Command: $SJAVAC_SERVER_JAVA -Xms${MS_VALUE}M -Xmx${MX_VALUE}M -version" >&5
50795   OUTPUT=`$SJAVAC_SERVER_JAVA -Xms${MS_VALUE}M -Xmx${MX_VALUE}M -version 2>&1`
50796   FOUND_WARN=`$ECHO "$OUTPUT" | grep -i warn`
50797   FOUND_VERSION=`$ECHO $OUTPUT | grep " version \""`
50798   if test "x$FOUND_VERSION" != x && test "x$FOUND_WARN" = x; then
50799     SJAVAC_SERVER_JAVA_FLAGS="$SJAVAC_SERVER_JAVA_FLAGS -Xms${MS_VALUE}M -Xmx${MX_VALUE}M"
50800     JVM_ARG_OK=true
50801   else
50802     $ECHO "Arg failed:" >&5
50803     $ECHO "$OUTPUT" >&5
50804     JVM_ARG_OK=false
50805   fi
50806 
50807 
50808 
50809   # Check whether --enable-sjavac was given.
50810 if test "${enable_sjavac+set}" = set; then :
50811   enableval=$enable_sjavac; ENABLE_SJAVAC="${enableval}"
50812 else
50813   ENABLE_SJAVAC='no'
50814 fi
50815 
50816   if test "x$JVM_ARG_OK" = "xfalse"; then
50817     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Could not set -Xms${MS_VALUE}M -Xmx${MX_VALUE}M, disabling sjavac" >&5
50818 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Could not set -Xms${MS_VALUE}M -Xmx${MX_VALUE}M, disabling sjavac" >&2;}
50819     ENABLE_SJAVAC=no;
50820   fi
50821   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking whether to use sjavac" >&5
50822 $as_echo_n "checking whether to use sjavac... " >&6; }
50823   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $ENABLE_SJAVAC" >&5
50824 $as_echo "$ENABLE_SJAVAC" >&6; }
50825 
50826 
50827   if test "x$ENABLE_SJAVAC" = xyes; then
50828     SJAVAC_SERVER_DIR="$OUTPUT_ROOT/javacservers"
50829   else
50830     SJAVAC_SERVER_DIR=
50831   fi
50832 
50833 
50834 
50835 # Can the C/C++ compiler use precompiled headers?
50836 
50837 
50838   ###############################################################################
50839   #
50840   # Can the C/C++ compiler use precompiled headers?
50841   #
50842   # Check whether --enable-precompiled-headers was given.
50843 if test "${enable_precompiled_headers+set}" = set; then :
50844   enableval=$enable_precompiled_headers; ENABLE_PRECOMPH=${enable_precompiled_headers}
50845 else
50846   ENABLE_PRECOMPH=yes
50847 fi
50848 
50849 
50850   USE_PRECOMPILED_HEADER=1
50851   if test "x$ENABLE_PRECOMPH" = xno; then
50852     USE_PRECOMPILED_HEADER=0
50853   fi
50854 
50855   if test "x$ENABLE_PRECOMPH" = xyes; then
50856     # Check that the compiler actually supports precomp headers.
50857     if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = xgcc; then
50858       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking that precompiled headers work" >&5
50859 $as_echo_n "checking that precompiled headers work... " >&6; }
50860       echo "int alfa();" > conftest.h
50861       $CXX -x c++-header conftest.h -o conftest.hpp.gch 2>&5 >&5
50862       if test ! -f conftest.hpp.gch; then
50863         USE_PRECOMPILED_HEADER=0
50864         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
50865 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
50866       else
50867         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes" >&5
50868 $as_echo "yes" >&6; }
50869       fi
50870       rm -f conftest.h conftest.hpp.gch
50871     fi
50872   fi
50873 
50874 
50875 
50876 
50877 # Setup use of ccache, if available
50878 
50879   # Check whether --enable-ccache was given.
50880 if test "${enable_ccache+set}" = set; then :
50881   enableval=$enable_ccache;
50882 fi
50883 
50884 
50885   CCACHE=
50886   CCACHE_STATUS=
50887   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking is ccache enabled" >&5
50888 $as_echo_n "checking is ccache enabled... " >&6; }
50889   if test "x$enable_ccache" = xyes; then
50890     if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = "xgcc" -o "x$TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" = "xclang"; then
50891       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes" >&5
50892 $as_echo "yes" >&6; }
50893       OLD_PATH="$PATH"
50894       if test "x$TOOLCHAIN_PATH" != x; then
50895         PATH=$TOOLCHAIN_PATH:$PATH
50896       fi
50897 
50898 
50899 
50900   # Publish this variable in the help.
50901 
50902 
50903   if test "x$CCACHE" = x; then
50904     # The variable is not set by user, try to locate tool using the code snippet
50905     for ac_prog in ccache
50906 do
50907   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
50908 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
50909 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
50910 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
50911 if ${ac_cv_path_CCACHE+:} false; then :
50912   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
50913 else
50914   case $CCACHE in
50915   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
50916   ac_cv_path_CCACHE="$CCACHE" # Let the user override the test with a path.
50917   ;;
50918   *)
50919   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
50920 for as_dir in $PATH
50921 do
50922   IFS=$as_save_IFS
50923   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
50924     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
50925   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
50926     ac_cv_path_CCACHE="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
50927     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
50928     break 2
50929   fi
50930 done
50931   done
50932 IFS=$as_save_IFS
50933 
50934   ;;
50935 esac
50936 fi
50937 CCACHE=$ac_cv_path_CCACHE
50938 if test -n "$CCACHE"; then
50939   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $CCACHE" >&5
50940 $as_echo "$CCACHE" >&6; }
50941 else
50942   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
50943 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
50944 fi
50945 
50946 
50947   test -n "$CCACHE" && break
50948 done
50949 
50950   else
50951     # The variable is set, but is it from the command line or the environment?
50952 
50953     # Try to remove the string !CCACHE! from our list.
50954     try_remove_var=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!CCACHE!/}
50955     if test "x$try_remove_var" = "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES"; then
50956       # If it failed, the variable was not from the command line. Ignore it,
50957       # but warn the user (except for BASH, which is always set by the calling BASH).
50958       if test "xCCACHE" != xBASH; then
50959         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: Ignoring value of CCACHE from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&5
50960 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: Ignoring value of CCACHE from the environment. Use command line variables instead." >&2;}
50961       fi
50962       # Try to locate tool using the code snippet
50963       for ac_prog in ccache
50964 do
50965   # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
50966 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
50967 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
50968 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
50969 if ${ac_cv_path_CCACHE+:} false; then :
50970   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
50971 else
50972   case $CCACHE in
50973   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
50974   ac_cv_path_CCACHE="$CCACHE" # Let the user override the test with a path.
50975   ;;
50976   *)
50977   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
50978 for as_dir in $PATH
50979 do
50980   IFS=$as_save_IFS
50981   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
50982     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
50983   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
50984     ac_cv_path_CCACHE="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
50985     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
50986     break 2
50987   fi
50988 done
50989   done
50990 IFS=$as_save_IFS
50991 
50992   ;;
50993 esac
50994 fi
50995 CCACHE=$ac_cv_path_CCACHE
50996 if test -n "$CCACHE"; then
50997   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $CCACHE" >&5
50998 $as_echo "$CCACHE" >&6; }
50999 else
51000   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
51001 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
51002 fi
51003 
51004 
51005   test -n "$CCACHE" && break
51006 done
51007 
51008     else
51009       # If it succeeded, then it was overridden by the user. We will use it
51010       # for the tool.
51011 
51012       # First remove it from the list of overridden variables, so we can test
51013       # for unknown variables in the end.
51014       CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES="$try_remove_var"
51015 
51016       # Check if the provided tool contains a complete path.
51017       tool_specified="$CCACHE"
51018       tool_basename="${tool_specified##*/}"
51019       if test "x$tool_basename" = "x$tool_specified"; then
51020         # A command without a complete path is provided, search $PATH.
51021         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will search for user supplied tool CCACHE=$tool_basename" >&5
51022 $as_echo "$as_me: Will search for user supplied tool CCACHE=$tool_basename" >&6;}
51023         # Extract the first word of "$tool_basename", so it can be a program name with args.
51024 set dummy $tool_basename; ac_word=$2
51025 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for $ac_word" >&5
51026 $as_echo_n "checking for $ac_word... " >&6; }
51027 if ${ac_cv_path_CCACHE+:} false; then :
51028   $as_echo_n "(cached) " >&6
51029 else
51030   case $CCACHE in
51031   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]*)
51032   ac_cv_path_CCACHE="$CCACHE" # Let the user override the test with a path.
51033   ;;
51034   *)
51035   as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
51036 for as_dir in $PATH
51037 do
51038   IFS=$as_save_IFS
51039   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
51040     for ac_exec_ext in '' $ac_executable_extensions; do
51041   if as_fn_executable_p "$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"; then
51042     ac_cv_path_CCACHE="$as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext"
51043     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: found $as_dir/$ac_word$ac_exec_ext" >&5
51044     break 2
51045   fi
51046 done
51047   done
51048 IFS=$as_save_IFS
51049 
51050   ;;
51051 esac
51052 fi
51053 CCACHE=$ac_cv_path_CCACHE
51054 if test -n "$CCACHE"; then
51055   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $CCACHE" >&5
51056 $as_echo "$CCACHE" >&6; }
51057 else
51058   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
51059 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
51060 fi
51061 
51062 
51063         if test "x$CCACHE" = x; then
51064           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool $tool_basename could not be found" "$LINENO" 5
51065         fi
51066       else
51067         # Otherwise we believe it is a complete path. Use it as it is.
51068         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: Will use user supplied tool CCACHE=$tool_specified" >&5
51069 $as_echo "$as_me: Will use user supplied tool CCACHE=$tool_specified" >&6;}
51070         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking for CCACHE" >&5
51071 $as_echo_n "checking for CCACHE... " >&6; }
51072         if test ! -x "$tool_specified"; then
51073           { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: not found" >&5
51074 $as_echo "not found" >&6; }
51075           as_fn_error $? "User supplied tool CCACHE=$tool_specified does not exist or is not executable" "$LINENO" 5
51076         fi
51077         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $tool_specified" >&5
51078 $as_echo "$tool_specified" >&6; }
51079       fi
51080     fi
51081   fi
51082 
51083 
51084 
51085   if test "x$CCACHE" = x; then
51086     as_fn_error $? "Could not find required tool for CCACHE" "$LINENO" 5
51087   fi
51088 
51089 
51090       PATH="$OLD_PATH"
51091       CCACHE_VERSION=`$CCACHE --version | head -n1 | $SED 's/[A-Za-z ]*//'`
51092       CCACHE_STATUS="Active ($CCACHE_VERSION)"
51093     else
51094       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
51095 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
51096       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: ccache is not supported with toolchain type $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" >&5
51097 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: ccache is not supported with toolchain type $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE" >&2;}
51098     fi
51099   elif test "x$enable_ccache" = xno; then
51100     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no, explicitly disabled" >&5
51101 $as_echo "no, explicitly disabled" >&6; }
51102     CCACHE_STATUS="Disabled"
51103   elif test "x$enable_ccache" = x; then
51104     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
51105 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
51106   else
51107     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: unknown" >&5
51108 $as_echo "unknown" >&6; }
51109     as_fn_error $? "--enable-ccache does not accept any parameters" "$LINENO" 5
51110   fi
51111 
51112 
51113 
51114 # Check whether --with-ccache-dir was given.
51115 if test "${with_ccache_dir+set}" = set; then :
51116   withval=$with_ccache_dir;
51117 fi
51118 
51119 
51120   if test "x$with_ccache_dir" != x; then
51121     # When using a non home ccache directory, assume the use is to share ccache files
51122     # with other users. Thus change the umask.
51123     SET_CCACHE_DIR="CCACHE_DIR=$with_ccache_dir CCACHE_UMASK=002"
51124     if test "x$CCACHE" = x; then
51125       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: --with-ccache-dir has no meaning when ccache is not enabled" >&5
51126 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: --with-ccache-dir has no meaning when ccache is not enabled" >&2;}
51127     fi
51128   fi
51129 
51130   if test "x$CCACHE" != x; then
51131 
51132   if test "x$CCACHE" != x; then
51133     if test "x$USE_PRECOMPILED_HEADER" = "x1"; then
51134       HAS_BAD_CCACHE=`$ECHO $CCACHE_VERSION | \
51135           $GREP -e '^1.*' -e '^2.*' -e '^3\.0.*' -e '^3\.1\.[0123]'`
51136       if test "x$HAS_BAD_CCACHE" != "x"; then
51137         as_fn_error $? "Precompiled headers requires ccache 3.1.4 or later, found $CCACHE_VERSION" "$LINENO" 5
51138       fi
51139       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if C-compiler supports ccache precompiled headers" >&5
51140 $as_echo_n "checking if C-compiler supports ccache precompiled headers... " >&6; }
51141       CCACHE_PRECOMP_FLAG="-fpch-preprocess"
51142       PUSHED_FLAGS="$CXXFLAGS"
51143       CXXFLAGS="$CCACHE_PRECOMP_FLAG $CXXFLAGS"
51144       cat confdefs.h - <<_ACEOF >conftest.$ac_ext
51145 /* end confdefs.h.  */
51146 
51147 int
51148 main ()
51149 {
51150 
51151   ;
51152   return 0;
51153 }
51154 _ACEOF
51155 if ac_fn_cxx_try_compile "$LINENO"; then :
51156   CC_KNOWS_CCACHE_TRICK=yes
51157 else
51158   CC_KNOWS_CCACHE_TRICK=no
51159 fi
51160 rm -f core conftest.err conftest.$ac_objext conftest.$ac_ext
51161       CXXFLAGS="$PUSHED_FLAGS"
51162       if test "x$CC_KNOWS_CCACHE_TRICK" = xyes; then
51163         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: yes" >&5
51164 $as_echo "yes" >&6; }
51165         CFLAGS_CCACHE="$CCACHE_PRECOMP_FLAG"
51166 
51167         CCACHE_SLOPPINESS=pch_defines,time_macros
51168       else
51169         { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: no" >&5
51170 $as_echo "no" >&6; }
51171         as_fn_error $? "Cannot use ccache with precompiled headers without compiler support for $CCACHE_PRECOMP_FLAG" "$LINENO" 5
51172       fi
51173     fi
51174 
51175     CCACHE="CCACHE_COMPRESS=1 $SET_CCACHE_DIR \
51176         CCACHE_SLOPPINESS=$CCACHE_SLOPPINESS CCACHE_BASEDIR=$TOPDIR $CCACHE"
51177 
51178     if test "x$SET_CCACHE_DIR" != x; then
51179       mkdir -p $CCACHE_DIR > /dev/null 2>&1
51180       chmod a+rwxs $CCACHE_DIR > /dev/null 2>&1
51181     fi
51182   fi
51183 
51184   fi
51185 
51186 
51187 ###############################################################################
51188 #
51189 # And now the finish...
51190 #
51191 ###############################################################################
51192 
51193 # Check for some common pitfalls
51194 
51195   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.cygwin"; then
51196     file_to_test="$SRC_ROOT/LICENSE"
51197     if test `$STAT -c '%a' "$file_to_test"` -lt 400; then
51198       as_fn_error $? "Bad file permissions on src files. This is usually caused by cloning the repositories with a non cygwin hg in a directory not created in cygwin." "$LINENO" 5
51199     fi
51200   fi
51201 
51202 
51203   # Did user specify any unknown variables?
51204 
51205   if test "x$CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES" != x; then
51206     # Replace the separating ! with spaces before presenting for end user.
51207     unknown_variables=${CONFIGURE_OVERRIDDEN_VARIABLES//!/ }
51208     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: The following variables might be unknown to configure: $unknown_variables" >&5
51209 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: The following variables might be unknown to configure: $unknown_variables" >&2;}
51210   fi
51211 
51212 
51213   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: checking if build directory is on local disk" >&5
51214 $as_echo_n "checking if build directory is on local disk... " >&6; }
51215 
51216   # df -l lists only local disks; if the given directory is not found then
51217   # a non-zero exit code is given
51218   if test "x$DF" = x; then
51219     if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS_ENV" = "xwindows.msys"; then
51220       # msys does not have df; use Windows "net use" instead.
51221       IS_NETWORK_DISK=`net use | grep \`pwd -W | cut -d ":" -f 1 | tr a-z A-Z\`:`
51222       if test "x$IS_NETWORK_DISK" = x; then
51223         OUTPUT_DIR_IS_LOCAL="yes"
51224       else
51225         OUTPUT_DIR_IS_LOCAL="no"
51226       fi
51227     else
51228       # No df here, say it's local
51229       OUTPUT_DIR_IS_LOCAL="yes"
51230     fi
51231   else
51232     if $DF -l $OUTPUT_ROOT > /dev/null 2>&1; then
51233       OUTPUT_DIR_IS_LOCAL="yes"
51234     else
51235       OUTPUT_DIR_IS_LOCAL="no"
51236     fi
51237   fi
51238 
51239   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: result: $OUTPUT_DIR_IS_LOCAL" >&5
51240 $as_echo "$OUTPUT_DIR_IS_LOCAL" >&6; }
51241 
51242 
51243 
51244   # Check if the user has any old-style ALT_ variables set.
51245   FOUND_ALT_VARIABLES=`env | grep ^ALT_`
51246 
51247   # Before generating output files, test if they exist. If they do, this is a reconfigure.
51248   # Since we can't properly handle the dependencies for this, warn the user about the situation
51249   if test -e $OUTPUT_ROOT/spec.gmk; then
51250     IS_RECONFIGURE=yes
51251   else
51252     IS_RECONFIGURE=no
51253   fi
51254 
51255 
51256 # At the end, call the custom hook. (Dummy macro if no custom sources available)
51257 
51258 
51259 # We're messing a bit with internal autoconf variables to put the config.status
51260 # in the output directory instead of the current directory.
51261 CONFIG_STATUS="$OUTPUT_ROOT/config.status"
51262 
51263 # Create the actual output files. Now the main work of configure is done.
51264 cat >confcache <<\_ACEOF
51265 # This file is a shell script that caches the results of configure
51266 # tests run on this system so they can be shared between configure
51267 # scripts and configure runs, see configure's option --config-cache.
51268 # It is not useful on other systems.  If it contains results you don't
51269 # want to keep, you may remove or edit it.
51270 #
51271 # config.status only pays attention to the cache file if you give it
51272 # the --recheck option to rerun configure.
51273 #
51274 # `ac_cv_env_foo' variables (set or unset) will be overridden when
51275 # loading this file, other *unset* `ac_cv_foo' will be assigned the
51276 # following values.
51277 
51278 _ACEOF
51279 
51280 # The following way of writing the cache mishandles newlines in values,
51281 # but we know of no workaround that is simple, portable, and efficient.
51282 # So, we kill variables containing newlines.
51283 # Ultrix sh set writes to stderr and can't be redirected directly,
51284 # and sets the high bit in the cache file unless we assign to the vars.
51285 (
51286   for ac_var in `(set) 2>&1 | sed -n 's/^\([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*\)=.*/\1/p'`; do
51287     eval ac_val=\$$ac_var
51288     case $ac_val in #(
51289     *${as_nl}*)
51290       case $ac_var in #(
51291       *_cv_*) { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: cache variable $ac_var contains a newline" >&5
51292 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: cache variable $ac_var contains a newline" >&2;} ;;
51293       esac
51294       case $ac_var in #(
51295       _ | IFS | as_nl) ;; #(
51296       BASH_ARGV | BASH_SOURCE) eval $ac_var= ;; #(
51297       *) { eval $ac_var=; unset $ac_var;} ;;
51298       esac ;;
51299     esac
51300   done
51301 
51302   (set) 2>&1 |
51303     case $as_nl`(ac_space=' '; set) 2>&1` in #(
51304     *${as_nl}ac_space=\ *)
51305       # `set' does not quote correctly, so add quotes: double-quote
51306       # substitution turns \\\\ into \\, and sed turns \\ into \.
51307       sed -n \
51308         "s/'/'\\\\''/g;
51309           s/^\\([_$as_cr_alnum]*_cv_[_$as_cr_alnum]*\\)=\\(.*\\)/\\1='\\2'/p"
51310       ;; #(
51311     *)
51312       # `set' quotes correctly as required by POSIX, so do not add quotes.
51313       sed -n "/^[_$as_cr_alnum]*_cv_[_$as_cr_alnum]*=/p"
51314       ;;
51315     esac |
51316     sort
51317 ) |
51318   sed '
51319      /^ac_cv_env_/b end
51320      t clear
51321      :clear
51322      s/^\([^=]*\)=\(.*[{}].*\)$/test "${\1+set}" = set || &/
51323      t end
51324      s/^\([^=]*\)=\(.*\)$/\1=${\1=\2}/
51325      :end' >>confcache
51326 if diff "$cache_file" confcache >/dev/null 2>&1; then :; else
51327   if test -w "$cache_file"; then
51328     if test "x$cache_file" != "x/dev/null"; then
51329       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: updating cache $cache_file" >&5
51330 $as_echo "$as_me: updating cache $cache_file" >&6;}
51331       if test ! -f "$cache_file" || test -h "$cache_file"; then
51332         cat confcache >"$cache_file"
51333       else
51334         case $cache_file in #(
51335         */* | ?:*)
51336           mv -f confcache "$cache_file"$$ &&
51337           mv -f "$cache_file"$$ "$cache_file" ;; #(
51338         *)
51339           mv -f confcache "$cache_file" ;;
51340         esac
51341       fi
51342     fi
51343   else
51344     { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: not updating unwritable cache $cache_file" >&5
51345 $as_echo "$as_me: not updating unwritable cache $cache_file" >&6;}
51346   fi
51347 fi
51348 rm -f confcache
51349 
51350 test "x$prefix" = xNONE && prefix=$ac_default_prefix
51351 # Let make expand exec_prefix.
51352 test "x$exec_prefix" = xNONE && exec_prefix='${prefix}'
51353 
51354 # Transform confdefs.h into DEFS.
51355 # Protect against shell expansion while executing Makefile rules.
51356 # Protect against Makefile macro expansion.
51357 #
51358 # If the first sed substitution is executed (which looks for macros that
51359 # take arguments), then branch to the quote section.  Otherwise,
51360 # look for a macro that doesn't take arguments.
51361 ac_script='
51362 :mline
51363 /\\$/{
51364  N
51365  s,\\\n,,
51366  b mline
51367 }
51368 t clear
51369 :clear
51370 s/^[     ]*#[    ]*define[       ][      ]*\([^  (][^    (]*([^)]*)\)[   ]*\(.*\)/-D\1=\2/g
51371 t quote
51372 s/^[     ]*#[    ]*define[       ][      ]*\([^  ][^     ]*\)[   ]*\(.*\)/-D\1=\2/g
51373 t quote
51374 b any
51375 :quote
51376 s/[      `~#$^&*(){}\\|;'\''"<>?]/\\&/g
51377 s/\[/\\&/g
51378 s/\]/\\&/g
51379 s/\$/$$/g
51380 H
51381 :any
51382 ${
51383         g
51384         s/^\n//
51385         s/\n/ /g
51386         p
51387 }
51388 '
51389 DEFS=`sed -n "$ac_script" confdefs.h`
51390 
51391 
51392 ac_libobjs=
51393 ac_ltlibobjs=
51394 U=
51395 for ac_i in : $LIBOBJS; do test "x$ac_i" = x: && continue
51396   # 1. Remove the extension, and $U if already installed.
51397   ac_script='s/\$U\././;s/\.o$//;s/\.obj$//'
51398   ac_i=`$as_echo "$ac_i" | sed "$ac_script"`
51399   # 2. Prepend LIBOBJDIR.  When used with automake>=1.10 LIBOBJDIR
51400   #    will be set to the directory where LIBOBJS objects are built.
51401   as_fn_append ac_libobjs " \${LIBOBJDIR}$ac_i\$U.$ac_objext"
51402   as_fn_append ac_ltlibobjs " \${LIBOBJDIR}$ac_i"'$U.lo'
51403 done
51404 LIBOBJS=$ac_libobjs
51405 
51406 LTLIBOBJS=$ac_ltlibobjs
51407 
51408 
51409 
51410 : "${CONFIG_STATUS=./config.status}"
51411 ac_write_fail=0
51412 ac_clean_files_save=$ac_clean_files
51413 ac_clean_files="$ac_clean_files $CONFIG_STATUS"
51414 { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: creating $CONFIG_STATUS" >&5
51415 $as_echo "$as_me: creating $CONFIG_STATUS" >&6;}
51416 as_write_fail=0
51417 cat >$CONFIG_STATUS <<_ASEOF || as_write_fail=1
51418 #! $SHELL
51419 # Generated by $as_me.
51420 # Run this file to recreate the current configuration.
51421 # Compiler output produced by configure, useful for debugging
51422 # configure, is in config.log if it exists.
51423 
51424 debug=false
51425 ac_cs_recheck=false
51426 ac_cs_silent=false
51427 
51428 SHELL=\${CONFIG_SHELL-$SHELL}
51429 export SHELL
51430 _ASEOF
51431 cat >>$CONFIG_STATUS <<\_ASEOF || as_write_fail=1
51432 ## -------------------- ##
51433 ## M4sh Initialization. ##
51434 ## -------------------- ##
51435 
51436 # Be more Bourne compatible
51437 DUALCASE=1; export DUALCASE # for MKS sh
51438 if test -n "${ZSH_VERSION+set}" && (emulate sh) >/dev/null 2>&1; then :
51439   emulate sh
51440   NULLCMD=:
51441   # Pre-4.2 versions of Zsh do word splitting on ${1+"$@"}, which
51442   # is contrary to our usage.  Disable this feature.
51443   alias -g '${1+"$@"}'='"$@"'
51444   setopt NO_GLOB_SUBST
51445 else
51446   case `(set -o) 2>/dev/null` in #(
51447   *posix*) :
51448     set -o posix ;; #(
51449   *) :
51450      ;;
51451 esac
51452 fi
51453 
51454 
51455 as_nl='
51456 '
51457 export as_nl
51458 # Printing a long string crashes Solaris 7 /usr/bin/printf.
51459 as_echo='\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\'
51460 as_echo=$as_echo$as_echo$as_echo$as_echo$as_echo
51461 as_echo=$as_echo$as_echo$as_echo$as_echo$as_echo$as_echo
51462 # Prefer a ksh shell builtin over an external printf program on Solaris,
51463 # but without wasting forks for bash or zsh.
51464 if test -z "$BASH_VERSION$ZSH_VERSION" \
51465     && (test "X`print -r -- $as_echo`" = "X$as_echo") 2>/dev/null; then
51466   as_echo='print -r --'
51467   as_echo_n='print -rn --'
51468 elif (test "X`printf %s $as_echo`" = "X$as_echo") 2>/dev/null; then
51469   as_echo='printf %s\n'
51470   as_echo_n='printf %s'
51471 else
51472   if test "X`(/usr/ucb/echo -n -n $as_echo) 2>/dev/null`" = "X-n $as_echo"; then
51473     as_echo_body='eval /usr/ucb/echo -n "$1$as_nl"'
51474     as_echo_n='/usr/ucb/echo -n'
51475   else
51476     as_echo_body='eval expr "X$1" : "X\\(.*\\)"'
51477     as_echo_n_body='eval
51478       arg=$1;
51479       case $arg in #(
51480       *"$as_nl"*)
51481         expr "X$arg" : "X\\(.*\\)$as_nl";
51482         arg=`expr "X$arg" : ".*$as_nl\\(.*\\)"`;;
51483       esac;
51484       expr "X$arg" : "X\\(.*\\)" | tr -d "$as_nl"
51485     '
51486     export as_echo_n_body
51487     as_echo_n='sh -c $as_echo_n_body as_echo'
51488   fi
51489   export as_echo_body
51490   as_echo='sh -c $as_echo_body as_echo'
51491 fi
51492 
51493 # The user is always right.
51494 if test "${PATH_SEPARATOR+set}" != set; then
51495   PATH_SEPARATOR=:
51496   (PATH='/bin;/bin'; FPATH=$PATH; sh -c :) >/dev/null 2>&1 && {
51497     (PATH='/bin:/bin'; FPATH=$PATH; sh -c :) >/dev/null 2>&1 ||
51498       PATH_SEPARATOR=';'
51499   }
51500 fi
51501 
51502 
51503 # IFS
51504 # We need space, tab and new line, in precisely that order.  Quoting is
51505 # there to prevent editors from complaining about space-tab.
51506 # (If _AS_PATH_WALK were called with IFS unset, it would disable word
51507 # splitting by setting IFS to empty value.)
51508 IFS=" ""        $as_nl"
51509 
51510 # Find who we are.  Look in the path if we contain no directory separator.
51511 as_myself=
51512 case $0 in #((
51513   *[\\/]* ) as_myself=$0 ;;
51514   *) as_save_IFS=$IFS; IFS=$PATH_SEPARATOR
51515 for as_dir in $PATH
51516 do
51517   IFS=$as_save_IFS
51518   test -z "$as_dir" && as_dir=.
51519     test -r "$as_dir/$0" && as_myself=$as_dir/$0 && break
51520   done
51521 IFS=$as_save_IFS
51522 
51523      ;;
51524 esac
51525 # We did not find ourselves, most probably we were run as `sh COMMAND'
51526 # in which case we are not to be found in the path.
51527 if test "x$as_myself" = x; then
51528   as_myself=$0
51529 fi
51530 if test ! -f "$as_myself"; then
51531   $as_echo "$as_myself: error: cannot find myself; rerun with an absolute file name" >&2
51532   exit 1
51533 fi
51534 
51535 # Unset variables that we do not need and which cause bugs (e.g. in
51536 # pre-3.0 UWIN ksh).  But do not cause bugs in bash 2.01; the "|| exit 1"
51537 # suppresses any "Segmentation fault" message there.  '((' could
51538 # trigger a bug in pdksh 5.2.14.
51539 for as_var in BASH_ENV ENV MAIL MAILPATH
51540 do eval test x\${$as_var+set} = xset \
51541   && ( (unset $as_var) || exit 1) >/dev/null 2>&1 && unset $as_var || :
51542 done
51543 PS1='$ '
51544 PS2='> '
51545 PS4='+ '
51546 
51547 # NLS nuisances.
51548 LC_ALL=C
51549 export LC_ALL
51550 LANGUAGE=C
51551 export LANGUAGE
51552 
51553 # CDPATH.
51554 (unset CDPATH) >/dev/null 2>&1 && unset CDPATH
51555 
51556 
51557 # as_fn_error STATUS ERROR [LINENO LOG_FD]
51558 # ----------------------------------------
51559 # Output "`basename $0`: error: ERROR" to stderr. If LINENO and LOG_FD are
51560 # provided, also output the error to LOG_FD, referencing LINENO. Then exit the
51561 # script with STATUS, using 1 if that was 0.
51562 as_fn_error ()
51563 {
51564   as_status=$1; test $as_status -eq 0 && as_status=1
51565   if test "$4"; then
51566     as_lineno=${as_lineno-"$3"} as_lineno_stack=as_lineno_stack=$as_lineno_stack
51567     $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: error: $2" >&$4
51568   fi
51569   $as_echo "$as_me: error: $2" >&2
51570   as_fn_exit $as_status
51571 } # as_fn_error
51572 
51573 
51574 # as_fn_set_status STATUS
51575 # -----------------------
51576 # Set $? to STATUS, without forking.
51577 as_fn_set_status ()
51578 {
51579   return $1
51580 } # as_fn_set_status
51581 
51582 # as_fn_exit STATUS
51583 # -----------------
51584 # Exit the shell with STATUS, even in a "trap 0" or "set -e" context.
51585 as_fn_exit ()
51586 {
51587   set +e
51588   as_fn_set_status $1
51589   exit $1
51590 } # as_fn_exit
51591 
51592 # as_fn_unset VAR
51593 # ---------------
51594 # Portably unset VAR.
51595 as_fn_unset ()
51596 {
51597   { eval $1=; unset $1;}
51598 }
51599 as_unset=as_fn_unset
51600 # as_fn_append VAR VALUE
51601 # ----------------------
51602 # Append the text in VALUE to the end of the definition contained in VAR. Take
51603 # advantage of any shell optimizations that allow amortized linear growth over
51604 # repeated appends, instead of the typical quadratic growth present in naive
51605 # implementations.
51606 if (eval "as_var=1; as_var+=2; test x\$as_var = x12") 2>/dev/null; then :
51607   eval 'as_fn_append ()
51608   {
51609     eval $1+=\$2
51610   }'
51611 else
51612   as_fn_append ()
51613   {
51614     eval $1=\$$1\$2
51615   }
51616 fi # as_fn_append
51617 
51618 # as_fn_arith ARG...
51619 # ------------------
51620 # Perform arithmetic evaluation on the ARGs, and store the result in the
51621 # global $as_val. Take advantage of shells that can avoid forks. The arguments
51622 # must be portable across $(()) and expr.
51623 if (eval "test \$(( 1 + 1 )) = 2") 2>/dev/null; then :
51624   eval 'as_fn_arith ()
51625   {
51626     as_val=$(( $* ))
51627   }'
51628 else
51629   as_fn_arith ()
51630   {
51631     as_val=`expr "$@" || test $? -eq 1`
51632   }
51633 fi # as_fn_arith
51634 
51635 
51636 if expr a : '\(a\)' >/dev/null 2>&1 &&
51637    test "X`expr 00001 : '.*\(...\)'`" = X001; then
51638   as_expr=expr
51639 else
51640   as_expr=false
51641 fi
51642 
51643 if (basename -- /) >/dev/null 2>&1 && test "X`basename -- / 2>&1`" = "X/"; then
51644   as_basename=basename
51645 else
51646   as_basename=false
51647 fi
51648 
51649 if (as_dir=`dirname -- /` && test "X$as_dir" = X/) >/dev/null 2>&1; then
51650   as_dirname=dirname
51651 else
51652   as_dirname=false
51653 fi
51654 
51655 as_me=`$as_basename -- "$0" ||
51656 $as_expr X/"$0" : '.*/\([^/][^/]*\)/*$' \| \
51657          X"$0" : 'X\(//\)$' \| \
51658          X"$0" : 'X\(/\)' \| . 2>/dev/null ||
51659 $as_echo X/"$0" |
51660     sed '/^.*\/\([^/][^/]*\)\/*$/{
51661             s//\1/
51662             q
51663           }
51664           /^X\/\(\/\/\)$/{
51665             s//\1/
51666             q
51667           }
51668           /^X\/\(\/\).*/{
51669             s//\1/
51670             q
51671           }
51672           s/.*/./; q'`
51673 
51674 # Avoid depending upon Character Ranges.
51675 as_cr_letters='abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'
51676 as_cr_LETTERS='ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ'
51677 as_cr_Letters=$as_cr_letters$as_cr_LETTERS
51678 as_cr_digits='0123456789'
51679 as_cr_alnum=$as_cr_Letters$as_cr_digits
51680 
51681 ECHO_C= ECHO_N= ECHO_T=
51682 case `echo -n x` in #(((((
51683 -n*)
51684   case `echo 'xy\c'` in
51685   *c*) ECHO_T=' ';;     # ECHO_T is single tab character.
51686   xy)  ECHO_C='\c';;
51687   *)   echo `echo ksh88 bug on AIX 6.1` > /dev/null
51688        ECHO_T=' ';;
51689   esac;;
51690 *)
51691   ECHO_N='-n';;
51692 esac
51693 
51694 rm -f conf$$ conf$$.exe conf$$.file
51695 if test -d conf$$.dir; then
51696   rm -f conf$$.dir/conf$$.file
51697 else
51698   rm -f conf$$.dir
51699   mkdir conf$$.dir 2>/dev/null
51700 fi
51701 if (echo >conf$$.file) 2>/dev/null; then
51702   if ln -s conf$$.file conf$$ 2>/dev/null; then
51703     as_ln_s='ln -s'
51704     # ... but there are two gotchas:
51705     # 1) On MSYS, both `ln -s file dir' and `ln file dir' fail.
51706     # 2) DJGPP < 2.04 has no symlinks; `ln -s' creates a wrapper executable.
51707     # In both cases, we have to default to `cp -pR'.
51708     ln -s conf$$.file conf$$.dir 2>/dev/null && test ! -f conf$$.exe ||
51709       as_ln_s='cp -pR'
51710   elif ln conf$$.file conf$$ 2>/dev/null; then
51711     as_ln_s=ln
51712   else
51713     as_ln_s='cp -pR'
51714   fi
51715 else
51716   as_ln_s='cp -pR'
51717 fi
51718 rm -f conf$$ conf$$.exe conf$$.dir/conf$$.file conf$$.file
51719 rmdir conf$$.dir 2>/dev/null
51720 
51721 
51722 # as_fn_mkdir_p
51723 # -------------
51724 # Create "$as_dir" as a directory, including parents if necessary.
51725 as_fn_mkdir_p ()
51726 {
51727 
51728   case $as_dir in #(
51729   -*) as_dir=./$as_dir;;
51730   esac
51731   test -d "$as_dir" || eval $as_mkdir_p || {
51732     as_dirs=
51733     while :; do
51734       case $as_dir in #(
51735       *\'*) as_qdir=`$as_echo "$as_dir" | sed "s/'/'\\\\\\\\''/g"`;; #'(
51736       *) as_qdir=$as_dir;;
51737       esac
51738       as_dirs="'$as_qdir' $as_dirs"
51739       as_dir=`$as_dirname -- "$as_dir" ||
51740 $as_expr X"$as_dir" : 'X\(.*[^/]\)//*[^/][^/]*/*$' \| \
51741          X"$as_dir" : 'X\(//\)[^/]' \| \
51742          X"$as_dir" : 'X\(//\)$' \| \
51743          X"$as_dir" : 'X\(/\)' \| . 2>/dev/null ||
51744 $as_echo X"$as_dir" |
51745     sed '/^X\(.*[^/]\)\/\/*[^/][^/]*\/*$/{
51746             s//\1/
51747             q
51748           }
51749           /^X\(\/\/\)[^/].*/{
51750             s//\1/
51751             q
51752           }
51753           /^X\(\/\/\)$/{
51754             s//\1/
51755             q
51756           }
51757           /^X\(\/\).*/{
51758             s//\1/
51759             q
51760           }
51761           s/.*/./; q'`
51762       test -d "$as_dir" && break
51763     done
51764     test -z "$as_dirs" || eval "mkdir $as_dirs"
51765   } || test -d "$as_dir" || as_fn_error $? "cannot create directory $as_dir"
51766 
51767 
51768 } # as_fn_mkdir_p
51769 if mkdir -p . 2>/dev/null; then
51770   as_mkdir_p='mkdir -p "$as_dir"'
51771 else
51772   test -d ./-p && rmdir ./-p
51773   as_mkdir_p=false
51774 fi
51775 
51776 
51777 # as_fn_executable_p FILE
51778 # -----------------------
51779 # Test if FILE is an executable regular file.
51780 as_fn_executable_p ()
51781 {
51782   test -f "$1" && test -x "$1"
51783 } # as_fn_executable_p
51784 as_test_x='test -x'
51785 as_executable_p=as_fn_executable_p
51786 
51787 # Sed expression to map a string onto a valid CPP name.
51788 as_tr_cpp="eval sed 'y%*$as_cr_letters%P$as_cr_LETTERS%;s%[^_$as_cr_alnum]%_%g'"
51789 
51790 # Sed expression to map a string onto a valid variable name.
51791 as_tr_sh="eval sed 'y%*+%pp%;s%[^_$as_cr_alnum]%_%g'"
51792 
51793 
51794 exec 6>&1
51795 ## ----------------------------------- ##
51796 ## Main body of $CONFIG_STATUS script. ##
51797 ## ----------------------------------- ##
51798 _ASEOF
51799 test $as_write_fail = 0 && chmod +x $CONFIG_STATUS || ac_write_fail=1
51800 
51801 cat >>$CONFIG_STATUS <<\_ACEOF || ac_write_fail=1
51802 # Save the log message, to keep $0 and so on meaningful, and to
51803 # report actual input values of CONFIG_FILES etc. instead of their
51804 # values after options handling.
51805 ac_log="
51806 This file was extended by OpenJDK $as_me jdk9, which was
51807 generated by GNU Autoconf 2.69.  Invocation command line was
51808 
51809   CONFIG_FILES    = $CONFIG_FILES
51810   CONFIG_HEADERS  = $CONFIG_HEADERS
51811   CONFIG_LINKS    = $CONFIG_LINKS
51812   CONFIG_COMMANDS = $CONFIG_COMMANDS
51813   $ $0 $@
51814 
51815 on `(hostname || uname -n) 2>/dev/null | sed 1q`
51816 "
51817 
51818 _ACEOF
51819 
51820 case $ac_config_files in *"
51821 "*) set x $ac_config_files; shift; ac_config_files=$*;;
51822 esac
51823 
51824 
51825 
51826 cat >>$CONFIG_STATUS <<_ACEOF || ac_write_fail=1
51827 # Files that config.status was made for.
51828 config_files="$ac_config_files"
51829 
51830 _ACEOF
51831 
51832 cat >>$CONFIG_STATUS <<\_ACEOF || ac_write_fail=1
51833 ac_cs_usage="\
51834 \`$as_me' instantiates files and other configuration actions
51835 from templates according to the current configuration.  Unless the files
51836 and actions are specified as TAGs, all are instantiated by default.
51837 
51838 Usage: $0 [OPTION]... [TAG]...
51839 
51840   -h, --help       print this help, then exit
51841   -V, --version    print version number and configuration settings, then exit
51842       --config     print configuration, then exit
51843   -q, --quiet, --silent
51844                    do not print progress messages
51845   -d, --debug      don't remove temporary files
51846       --recheck    update $as_me by reconfiguring in the same conditions
51847       --file=FILE[:TEMPLATE]
51848                    instantiate the configuration file FILE
51849 
51850 Configuration files:
51851 $config_files
51852 
51853 Report bugs to <build-dev@openjdk.java.net>.
51854 OpenJDK home page: <http://openjdk.java.net>."
51855 
51856 _ACEOF
51857 cat >>$CONFIG_STATUS <<_ACEOF || ac_write_fail=1
51858 ac_cs_config="`$as_echo "$ac_configure_args" | sed 's/^ //; s/[\\""\`\$]/\\\\&/g'`"
51859 ac_cs_version="\\
51860 OpenJDK config.status jdk9
51861 configured by $0, generated by GNU Autoconf 2.69,
51862   with options \\"\$ac_cs_config\\"
51863 
51864 Copyright (C) 2012 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
51865 This config.status script is free software; the Free Software Foundation
51866 gives unlimited permission to copy, distribute and modify it."
51867 
51868 ac_pwd='$ac_pwd'
51869 srcdir='$srcdir'
51870 AWK='$AWK'
51871 test -n "\$AWK" || AWK=awk
51872 _ACEOF
51873 
51874 cat >>$CONFIG_STATUS <<\_ACEOF || ac_write_fail=1
51875 # The default lists apply if the user does not specify any file.
51876 ac_need_defaults=:
51877 while test $# != 0
51878 do
51879   case $1 in
51880   --*=?*)
51881     ac_option=`expr "X$1" : 'X\([^=]*\)='`
51882     ac_optarg=`expr "X$1" : 'X[^=]*=\(.*\)'`
51883     ac_shift=:
51884     ;;
51885   --*=)
51886     ac_option=`expr "X$1" : 'X\([^=]*\)='`
51887     ac_optarg=
51888     ac_shift=:
51889     ;;
51890   *)
51891     ac_option=$1
51892     ac_optarg=$2
51893     ac_shift=shift
51894     ;;
51895   esac
51896 
51897   case $ac_option in
51898   # Handling of the options.
51899   -recheck | --recheck | --rechec | --reche | --rech | --rec | --re | --r)
51900     ac_cs_recheck=: ;;
51901   --version | --versio | --versi | --vers | --ver | --ve | --v | -V )
51902     $as_echo "$ac_cs_version"; exit ;;
51903   --config | --confi | --conf | --con | --co | --c )
51904     $as_echo "$ac_cs_config"; exit ;;
51905   --debug | --debu | --deb | --de | --d | -d )
51906     debug=: ;;
51907   --file | --fil | --fi | --f )
51908     $ac_shift
51909     case $ac_optarg in
51910     *\'*) ac_optarg=`$as_echo "$ac_optarg" | sed "s/'/'\\\\\\\\''/g"` ;;
51911     '') as_fn_error $? "missing file argument" ;;
51912     esac
51913     as_fn_append CONFIG_FILES " '$ac_optarg'"
51914     ac_need_defaults=false;;
51915   --he | --h |  --help | --hel | -h )
51916     $as_echo "$ac_cs_usage"; exit ;;
51917   -q | -quiet | --quiet | --quie | --qui | --qu | --q \
51918   | -silent | --silent | --silen | --sile | --sil | --si | --s)
51919     ac_cs_silent=: ;;
51920 
51921   # This is an error.
51922   -*) as_fn_error $? "unrecognized option: \`$1'
51923 Try \`$0 --help' for more information." ;;
51924 
51925   *) as_fn_append ac_config_targets " $1"
51926      ac_need_defaults=false ;;
51927 
51928   esac
51929   shift
51930 done
51931 
51932 ac_configure_extra_args=
51933 
51934 if $ac_cs_silent; then
51935   exec 6>/dev/null
51936   ac_configure_extra_args="$ac_configure_extra_args --silent"
51937 fi
51938 
51939 _ACEOF
51940 cat >>$CONFIG_STATUS <<_ACEOF || ac_write_fail=1
51941 if \$ac_cs_recheck; then
51942   set X $SHELL '$0' $ac_configure_args \$ac_configure_extra_args --no-create --no-recursion
51943   shift
51944   \$as_echo "running CONFIG_SHELL=$SHELL \$*" >&6
51945   CONFIG_SHELL='$SHELL'
51946   export CONFIG_SHELL
51947   exec "\$@"
51948 fi
51949 
51950 _ACEOF
51951 cat >>$CONFIG_STATUS <<\_ACEOF || ac_write_fail=1
51952 exec 5>>config.log
51953 {
51954   echo
51955   sed 'h;s/./-/g;s/^.../## /;s/...$/ ##/;p;x;p;x' <<_ASBOX
51956 ## Running $as_me. ##
51957 _ASBOX
51958   $as_echo "$ac_log"
51959 } >&5
51960 
51961 _ACEOF
51962 cat >>$CONFIG_STATUS <<_ACEOF || ac_write_fail=1
51963 _ACEOF
51964 
51965 cat >>$CONFIG_STATUS <<\_ACEOF || ac_write_fail=1
51966 
51967 # Handling of arguments.
51968 for ac_config_target in $ac_config_targets
51969 do
51970   case $ac_config_target in
51971     "$OUTPUT_ROOT/spec.gmk") CONFIG_FILES="$CONFIG_FILES $OUTPUT_ROOT/spec.gmk:$AUTOCONF_DIR/spec.gmk.in" ;;
51972     "$OUTPUT_ROOT/hotspot-spec.gmk") CONFIG_FILES="$CONFIG_FILES $OUTPUT_ROOT/hotspot-spec.gmk:$AUTOCONF_DIR/hotspot-spec.gmk.in" ;;
51973     "$OUTPUT_ROOT/bootcycle-spec.gmk") CONFIG_FILES="$CONFIG_FILES $OUTPUT_ROOT/bootcycle-spec.gmk:$AUTOCONF_DIR/bootcycle-spec.gmk.in" ;;
51974     "$OUTPUT_ROOT/compare.sh") CONFIG_FILES="$CONFIG_FILES $OUTPUT_ROOT/compare.sh:$AUTOCONF_DIR/compare.sh.in" ;;
51975     "$OUTPUT_ROOT/Makefile") CONFIG_FILES="$CONFIG_FILES $OUTPUT_ROOT/Makefile:$AUTOCONF_DIR/Makefile.in" ;;
51976 
51977   *) as_fn_error $? "invalid argument: \`$ac_config_target'" "$LINENO" 5;;
51978   esac
51979 done
51980 
51981 
51982 # If the user did not use the arguments to specify the items to instantiate,
51983 # then the envvar interface is used.  Set only those that are not.
51984 # We use the long form for the default assignment because of an extremely
51985 # bizarre bug on SunOS 4.1.3.
51986 if $ac_need_defaults; then
51987   test "${CONFIG_FILES+set}" = set || CONFIG_FILES=$config_files
51988 fi
51989 
51990 # Have a temporary directory for convenience.  Make it in the build tree
51991 # simply because there is no reason against having it here, and in addition,
51992 # creating and moving files from /tmp can sometimes cause problems.
51993 # Hook for its removal unless debugging.
51994 # Note that there is a small window in which the directory will not be cleaned:
51995 # after its creation but before its name has been assigned to `$tmp'.
51996 $debug ||
51997 {
51998   tmp= ac_tmp=
51999   trap 'exit_status=$?
52000   : "${ac_tmp:=$tmp}"
52001   { test ! -d "$ac_tmp" || rm -fr "$ac_tmp"; } && exit $exit_status
52002 ' 0
52003   trap 'as_fn_exit 1' 1 2 13 15
52004 }
52005 # Create a (secure) tmp directory for tmp files.
52006 
52007 {
52008   tmp=`(umask 077 && mktemp -d "./confXXXXXX") 2>/dev/null` &&
52009   test -d "$tmp"
52010 }  ||
52011 {
52012   tmp=./conf$$-$RANDOM
52013   (umask 077 && mkdir "$tmp")
52014 } || as_fn_error $? "cannot create a temporary directory in ." "$LINENO" 5
52015 ac_tmp=$tmp
52016 
52017 # Set up the scripts for CONFIG_FILES section.
52018 # No need to generate them if there are no CONFIG_FILES.
52019 # This happens for instance with `./config.status config.h'.
52020 if test -n "$CONFIG_FILES"; then
52021 
52022 
52023 ac_cr=`echo X | tr X '\015'`
52024 # On cygwin, bash can eat \r inside `` if the user requested igncr.
52025 # But we know of no other shell where ac_cr would be empty at this
52026 # point, so we can use a bashism as a fallback.
52027 if test "x$ac_cr" = x; then
52028   eval ac_cr=\$\'\\r\'
52029 fi
52030 ac_cs_awk_cr=`$AWK 'BEGIN { print "a\rb" }' </dev/null 2>/dev/null`
52031 if test "$ac_cs_awk_cr" = "a${ac_cr}b"; then
52032   ac_cs_awk_cr='\\r'
52033 else
52034   ac_cs_awk_cr=$ac_cr
52035 fi
52036 
52037 echo 'BEGIN {' >"$ac_tmp/subs1.awk" &&
52038 _ACEOF
52039 
52040 
52041 {
52042   echo "cat >conf$$subs.awk <<_ACEOF" &&
52043   echo "$ac_subst_vars" | sed 's/.*/&!$&$ac_delim/' &&
52044   echo "_ACEOF"
52045 } >conf$$subs.sh ||
52046   as_fn_error $? "could not make $CONFIG_STATUS" "$LINENO" 5
52047 ac_delim_num=`echo "$ac_subst_vars" | grep -c '^'`
52048 ac_delim='%!_!# '
52049 for ac_last_try in false false false false false :; do
52050   . ./conf$$subs.sh ||
52051     as_fn_error $? "could not make $CONFIG_STATUS" "$LINENO" 5
52052 
52053   ac_delim_n=`sed -n "s/.*$ac_delim\$/X/p" conf$$subs.awk | grep -c X`
52054   if test $ac_delim_n = $ac_delim_num; then
52055     break
52056   elif $ac_last_try; then
52057     as_fn_error $? "could not make $CONFIG_STATUS" "$LINENO" 5
52058   else
52059     ac_delim="$ac_delim!$ac_delim _$ac_delim!! "
52060   fi
52061 done
52062 rm -f conf$$subs.sh
52063 
52064 cat >>$CONFIG_STATUS <<_ACEOF || ac_write_fail=1
52065 cat >>"\$ac_tmp/subs1.awk" <<\\_ACAWK &&
52066 _ACEOF
52067 sed -n '
52068 h
52069 s/^/S["/; s/!.*/"]=/
52070 p
52071 g
52072 s/^[^!]*!//
52073 :repl
52074 t repl
52075 s/'"$ac_delim"'$//
52076 t delim
52077 :nl
52078 h
52079 s/\(.\{148\}\)..*/\1/
52080 t more1
52081 s/["\\]/\\&/g; s/^/"/; s/$/\\n"\\/
52082 p
52083 n
52084 b repl
52085 :more1
52086 s/["\\]/\\&/g; s/^/"/; s/$/"\\/
52087 p
52088 g
52089 s/.\{148\}//
52090 t nl
52091 :delim
52092 h
52093 s/\(.\{148\}\)..*/\1/
52094 t more2
52095 s/["\\]/\\&/g; s/^/"/; s/$/"/
52096 p
52097 b
52098 :more2
52099 s/["\\]/\\&/g; s/^/"/; s/$/"\\/
52100 p
52101 g
52102 s/.\{148\}//
52103 t delim
52104 ' <conf$$subs.awk | sed '
52105 /^[^""]/{
52106   N
52107   s/\n//
52108 }
52109 ' >>$CONFIG_STATUS || ac_write_fail=1
52110 rm -f conf$$subs.awk
52111 cat >>$CONFIG_STATUS <<_ACEOF || ac_write_fail=1
52112 _ACAWK
52113 cat >>"\$ac_tmp/subs1.awk" <<_ACAWK &&
52114   for (key in S) S_is_set[key] = 1
52115   FS = ""
52116 
52117 }
52118 {
52119   line = $ 0
52120   nfields = split(line, field, "@")
52121   substed = 0
52122   len = length(field[1])
52123   for (i = 2; i < nfields; i++) {
52124     key = field[i]
52125     keylen = length(key)
52126     if (S_is_set[key]) {
52127       value = S[key]
52128       line = substr(line, 1, len) "" value "" substr(line, len + keylen + 3)
52129       len += length(value) + length(field[++i])
52130       substed = 1
52131     } else
52132       len += 1 + keylen
52133   }
52134 
52135   print line
52136 }
52137 
52138 _ACAWK
52139 _ACEOF
52140 cat >>$CONFIG_STATUS <<\_ACEOF || ac_write_fail=1
52141 if sed "s/$ac_cr//" < /dev/null > /dev/null 2>&1; then
52142   sed "s/$ac_cr\$//; s/$ac_cr/$ac_cs_awk_cr/g"
52143 else
52144   cat
52145 fi < "$ac_tmp/subs1.awk" > "$ac_tmp/subs.awk" \
52146   || as_fn_error $? "could not setup config files machinery" "$LINENO" 5
52147 _ACEOF
52148 
52149 # VPATH may cause trouble with some makes, so we remove sole $(srcdir),
52150 # ${srcdir} and @srcdir@ entries from VPATH if srcdir is ".", strip leading and
52151 # trailing colons and then remove the whole line if VPATH becomes empty
52152 # (actually we leave an empty line to preserve line numbers).
52153 if test "x$srcdir" = x.; then
52154   ac_vpsub='/^[  ]*VPATH[        ]*=[    ]*/{
52155 h
52156 s///
52157 s/^/:/
52158 s/[      ]*$/:/
52159 s/:\$(srcdir):/:/g
52160 s/:\${srcdir}:/:/g
52161 s/:@srcdir@:/:/g
52162 s/^:*//
52163 s/:*$//
52164 x
52165 s/\(=[   ]*\).*/\1/
52166 G
52167 s/\n//
52168 s/^[^=]*=[       ]*$//
52169 }'
52170 fi
52171 
52172 cat >>$CONFIG_STATUS <<\_ACEOF || ac_write_fail=1
52173 fi # test -n "$CONFIG_FILES"
52174 
52175 
52176 eval set X "  :F $CONFIG_FILES      "
52177 shift
52178 for ac_tag
52179 do
52180   case $ac_tag in
52181   :[FHLC]) ac_mode=$ac_tag; continue;;
52182   esac
52183   case $ac_mode$ac_tag in
52184   :[FHL]*:*);;
52185   :L* | :C*:*) as_fn_error $? "invalid tag \`$ac_tag'" "$LINENO" 5;;
52186   :[FH]-) ac_tag=-:-;;
52187   :[FH]*) ac_tag=$ac_tag:$ac_tag.in;;
52188   esac
52189   ac_save_IFS=$IFS
52190   IFS=:
52191   set x $ac_tag
52192   IFS=$ac_save_IFS
52193   shift
52194   ac_file=$1
52195   shift
52196 
52197   case $ac_mode in
52198   :L) ac_source=$1;;
52199   :[FH])
52200     ac_file_inputs=
52201     for ac_f
52202     do
52203       case $ac_f in
52204       -) ac_f="$ac_tmp/stdin";;
52205       *) # Look for the file first in the build tree, then in the source tree
52206          # (if the path is not absolute).  The absolute path cannot be DOS-style,
52207          # because $ac_f cannot contain `:'.
52208          test -f "$ac_f" ||
52209            case $ac_f in
52210            [\\/$]*) false;;
52211            *) test -f "$srcdir/$ac_f" && ac_f="$srcdir/$ac_f";;
52212            esac ||
52213            as_fn_error 1 "cannot find input file: \`$ac_f'" "$LINENO" 5;;
52214       esac
52215       case $ac_f in *\'*) ac_f=`$as_echo "$ac_f" | sed "s/'/'\\\\\\\\''/g"`;; esac
52216       as_fn_append ac_file_inputs " '$ac_f'"
52217     done
52218 
52219     # Let's still pretend it is `configure' which instantiates (i.e., don't
52220     # use $as_me), people would be surprised to read:
52221     #    /* config.h.  Generated by config.status.  */
52222     configure_input='Generated from '`
52223           $as_echo "$*" | sed 's|^[^:]*/||;s|:[^:]*/|, |g'
52224         `' by configure.'
