52225     if test x"$ac_file" != x-; then
52226       configure_input="$ac_file.  $configure_input"
52227       { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: creating $ac_file" >&5
52228 $as_echo "$as_me: creating $ac_file" >&6;}
52229     fi
52230     # Neutralize special characters interpreted by sed in replacement strings.
52231     case $configure_input in #(
52232     *\&* | *\|* | *\\* )
52233        ac_sed_conf_input=`$as_echo "$configure_input" |
52234        sed 's/[\\\\&|]/\\\\&/g'`;; #(
52235     *) ac_sed_conf_input=$configure_input;;
52236     esac
52237 
52238     case $ac_tag in
52239     *:-:* | *:-) cat >"$ac_tmp/stdin" \
52240       || as_fn_error $? "could not create $ac_file" "$LINENO" 5 ;;
52241     esac
52242     ;;
52243   esac
52244 
52245   ac_dir=`$as_dirname -- "$ac_file" ||
52246 $as_expr X"$ac_file" : 'X\(.*[^/]\)//*[^/][^/]*/*$' \| \
52247          X"$ac_file" : 'X\(//\)[^/]' \| \
52248          X"$ac_file" : 'X\(//\)$' \| \
52249          X"$ac_file" : 'X\(/\)' \| . 2>/dev/null ||
52250 $as_echo X"$ac_file" |
52251     sed '/^X\(.*[^/]\)\/\/*[^/][^/]*\/*$/{
52252             s//\1/
52253             q
52254           }
52255           /^X\(\/\/\)[^/].*/{
52256             s//\1/
52257             q
52258           }
52259           /^X\(\/\/\)$/{
52260             s//\1/
52261             q
52262           }
52263           /^X\(\/\).*/{
52264             s//\1/
52265             q
52266           }
52267           s/.*/./; q'`
52268   as_dir="$ac_dir"; as_fn_mkdir_p
52269   ac_builddir=.
52270 
52271 case "$ac_dir" in
52272 .) ac_dir_suffix= ac_top_builddir_sub=. ac_top_build_prefix= ;;
52273 *)
52274   ac_dir_suffix=/`$as_echo "$ac_dir" | sed 's|^\.[\\/]||'`
52275   # A ".." for each directory in $ac_dir_suffix.
52276   ac_top_builddir_sub=`$as_echo "$ac_dir_suffix" | sed 's|/[^\\/]*|/..|g;s|/||'`
52277   case $ac_top_builddir_sub in
52278   "") ac_top_builddir_sub=. ac_top_build_prefix= ;;
52279   *)  ac_top_build_prefix=$ac_top_builddir_sub/ ;;
52280   esac ;;
52281 esac
52282 ac_abs_top_builddir=$ac_pwd
52283 ac_abs_builddir=$ac_pwd$ac_dir_suffix
52284 # for backward compatibility:
52285 ac_top_builddir=$ac_top_build_prefix
52286 
52287 case $srcdir in
52288   .)  # We are building in place.
52289     ac_srcdir=.
52290     ac_top_srcdir=$ac_top_builddir_sub
52291     ac_abs_top_srcdir=$ac_pwd ;;
52292   [\\/]* | ?:[\\/]* )  # Absolute name.
52293     ac_srcdir=$srcdir$ac_dir_suffix;
52294     ac_top_srcdir=$srcdir
52295     ac_abs_top_srcdir=$srcdir ;;
52296   *) # Relative name.
52297     ac_srcdir=$ac_top_build_prefix$srcdir$ac_dir_suffix
52298     ac_top_srcdir=$ac_top_build_prefix$srcdir
52299     ac_abs_top_srcdir=$ac_pwd/$srcdir ;;
52300 esac
52301 ac_abs_srcdir=$ac_abs_top_srcdir$ac_dir_suffix
52302 
52303 
52304   case $ac_mode in
52305   :F)
52306   #
52307   # CONFIG_FILE
52308   #
52309 
52310 _ACEOF
52311 
52312 cat >>$CONFIG_STATUS <<\_ACEOF || ac_write_fail=1
52313 # If the template does not know about datarootdir, expand it.
52314 # FIXME: This hack should be removed a few years after 2.60.
52315 ac_datarootdir_hack=; ac_datarootdir_seen=
52316 ac_sed_dataroot='
52317 /datarootdir/ {
52318   p
52319   q
52320 }
52321 /@datadir@/p
52322 /@docdir@/p
52323 /@infodir@/p
52324 /@localedir@/p
52325 /@mandir@/p'
52326 case `eval "sed -n \"\$ac_sed_dataroot\" $ac_file_inputs"` in
52327 *datarootdir*) ac_datarootdir_seen=yes;;
52328 *@datadir@*|*@docdir@*|*@infodir@*|*@localedir@*|*@mandir@*)
52329   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: $ac_file_inputs seems to ignore the --datarootdir setting" >&5
52330 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: $ac_file_inputs seems to ignore the --datarootdir setting" >&2;}
52331 _ACEOF
52332 cat >>$CONFIG_STATUS <<_ACEOF || ac_write_fail=1
52333   ac_datarootdir_hack='
52334   s&@datadir@&$datadir&g
52335   s&@docdir@&$docdir&g
52336   s&@infodir@&$infodir&g
52337   s&@localedir@&$localedir&g
52338   s&@mandir@&$mandir&g
52339   s&\\\${datarootdir}&$datarootdir&g' ;;
52340 esac
52341 _ACEOF
52342 
52343 # Neutralize VPATH when `$srcdir' = `.'.
52344 # Shell code in configure.ac might set extrasub.
52345 # FIXME: do we really want to maintain this feature?
52346 cat >>$CONFIG_STATUS <<_ACEOF || ac_write_fail=1
52347 ac_sed_extra="$ac_vpsub
52348 $extrasub
52349 _ACEOF
52350 cat >>$CONFIG_STATUS <<\_ACEOF || ac_write_fail=1
52351 :t
52352 /@[a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z_0-9]*@/!b
52353 s|@configure_input@|$ac_sed_conf_input|;t t
52354 s&@top_builddir@&$ac_top_builddir_sub&;t t
52355 s&@top_build_prefix@&$ac_top_build_prefix&;t t
52356 s&@srcdir@&$ac_srcdir&;t t
52357 s&@abs_srcdir@&$ac_abs_srcdir&;t t
52358 s&@top_srcdir@&$ac_top_srcdir&;t t
52359 s&@abs_top_srcdir@&$ac_abs_top_srcdir&;t t
52360 s&@builddir@&$ac_builddir&;t t
52361 s&@abs_builddir@&$ac_abs_builddir&;t t
52362 s&@abs_top_builddir@&$ac_abs_top_builddir&;t t
52363 $ac_datarootdir_hack
52364 "
52365 eval sed \"\$ac_sed_extra\" "$ac_file_inputs" | $AWK -f "$ac_tmp/subs.awk" \
52366   >$ac_tmp/out || as_fn_error $? "could not create $ac_file" "$LINENO" 5
52367 
52368 test -z "$ac_datarootdir_hack$ac_datarootdir_seen" &&
52369   { ac_out=`sed -n '/\${datarootdir}/p' "$ac_tmp/out"`; test -n "$ac_out"; } &&
52370   { ac_out=`sed -n '/^[  ]*datarootdir[  ]*:*=/p' \
52371       "$ac_tmp/out"`; test -z "$ac_out"; } &&
52372   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: $ac_file contains a reference to the variable \`datarootdir'
52373 which seems to be undefined.  Please make sure it is defined" >&5
52374 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: $ac_file contains a reference to the variable \`datarootdir'
52375 which seems to be undefined.  Please make sure it is defined" >&2;}
52376 
52377   rm -f "$ac_tmp/stdin"
52378   case $ac_file in
52379   -) cat "$ac_tmp/out" && rm -f "$ac_tmp/out";;
52380   *) rm -f "$ac_file" && mv "$ac_tmp/out" "$ac_file";;
52381   esac \
52382   || as_fn_error $? "could not create $ac_file" "$LINENO" 5
52383  ;;
52384 
52385 
52386 
52387   esac
52388 
52389 done # for ac_tag
52390 
52391 
52392 as_fn_exit 0
52393 _ACEOF
52394 ac_clean_files=$ac_clean_files_save
52395 
52396 test $ac_write_fail = 0 ||
52397   as_fn_error $? "write failure creating $CONFIG_STATUS" "$LINENO" 5
52398 
52399 
52400 # configure is writing to config.log, and then calls config.status.
52401 # config.status does its own redirection, appending to config.log.
52402 # Unfortunately, on DOS this fails, as config.log is still kept open
52403 # by configure, so config.status won't be able to write to it; its
52404 # output is simply discarded.  So we exec the FD to /dev/null,
52405 # effectively closing config.log, so it can be properly (re)opened and
52406 # appended to by config.status.  When coming back to configure, we
52407 # need to make the FD available again.
52408 if test "$no_create" != yes; then
52409   ac_cs_success=:
52410   ac_config_status_args=
52411   test "$silent" = yes &&
52412     ac_config_status_args="$ac_config_status_args --quiet"
52413   exec 5>/dev/null
52414   $SHELL $CONFIG_STATUS $ac_config_status_args || ac_cs_success=false
52415   exec 5>>config.log
52416   # Use ||, not &&, to avoid exiting from the if with $? = 1, which
52417   # would make configure fail if this is the last instruction.
52418   $ac_cs_success || as_fn_exit 1
52419 fi
52420 if test -n "$ac_unrecognized_opts" && test "$enable_option_checking" != no; then
52421   { $as_echo "$as_me:${as_lineno-$LINENO}: WARNING: unrecognized options: $ac_unrecognized_opts" >&5
52422 $as_echo "$as_me: WARNING: unrecognized options: $ac_unrecognized_opts" >&2;}
52423 fi
52424 
52425 
52426 # Try to move the config.log file to the output directory.
52427 if test -e ./config.log; then
52428   $MV -f ./config.log "$OUTPUT_ROOT/config.log" 2> /dev/null
52429 fi
52430 
52431 # Make the compare script executable
52432 $CHMOD +x $OUTPUT_ROOT/compare.sh
52433 
52434 # Finally output some useful information to the user
52435 
52436   # Finally output some useful information to the user
52437 
52438   printf "\n"
52439   printf "====================================================\n"
52440   if test "x$no_create" != "xyes"; then
52441     if test "x$IS_RECONFIGURE" != "xyes"; then
52442       printf "A new configuration has been successfully created in\n%s\n" "$OUTPUT_ROOT"
52443     else
52444       printf "The existing configuration has been successfully updated in\n%s\n" "$OUTPUT_ROOT"
52445     fi
52446   else
52447     if test "x$IS_RECONFIGURE" != "xyes"; then
52448       printf "A configuration has been successfully checked but not created\n"
52449     else
52450       printf "The existing configuration has been successfully checked in\n%s\n" "$OUTPUT_ROOT"
52451     fi
52452   fi
52453   if test "x$CONFIGURE_COMMAND_LINE" != x; then
52454     printf "using configure arguments '$CONFIGURE_COMMAND_LINE'.\n"
52455   else
52456     printf "using default settings.\n"
52457   fi
52458 
52459   printf "\n"
52460   printf "Configuration summary:\n"
52461   printf "* Debug level:    $DEBUG_LEVEL\n"
52462   printf "* HS debug level: $HOTSPOT_DEBUG_LEVEL\n"
52463   printf "* JDK variant:    $JDK_VARIANT\n"
52464   printf "* JVM variants:   $with_jvm_variants\n"
52465   printf "* OpenJDK target: OS: $OPENJDK_TARGET_OS, CPU architecture: $OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_ARCH, address length: $OPENJDK_TARGET_CPU_BITS\n"
52466 
52467   printf "\n"
52468   printf "Tools summary:\n"
52469   if test "x$OPENJDK_BUILD_OS" = "xwindows"; then
52470     printf "* Environment:    $WINDOWS_ENV_VENDOR version $WINDOWS_ENV_VERSION (root at $WINDOWS_ENV_ROOT_PATH)\n"
52471   fi
52472   printf "* Boot JDK:       $BOOT_JDK_VERSION (at $BOOT_JDK)\n"
52473   printf "* Toolchain:      $TOOLCHAIN_TYPE ($TOOLCHAIN_DESCRIPTION)\n"
52474   printf "* C Compiler:     Version $CC_VERSION_NUMBER (at $CC)\n"
52475   printf "* C++ Compiler:   Version $CXX_VERSION_NUMBER (at $CXX)\n"
52476 
52477   printf "\n"
52478   printf "Build performance summary:\n"
52479   printf "* Cores to use:   $JOBS\n"
52480   printf "* Memory limit:   $MEMORY_SIZE MB\n"
52481   if test "x$CCACHE_STATUS" != "x"; then
52482     printf "* ccache status:  $CCACHE_STATUS\n"
52483   fi
52484   printf "\n"
52485 
52486   if test "x$BUILDING_MULTIPLE_JVM_VARIANTS" = "xyes"; then
52487     printf "NOTE: You have requested to build more than one version of the JVM, which\n"
52488     printf "will result in longer build times.\n"
52489     printf "\n"
52490   fi
52491 
52492   if test "x$FOUND_ALT_VARIABLES" != "x"; then
52493     printf "WARNING: You have old-style ALT_ environment variables set.\n"
52494     printf "These are not respected, and will be ignored. It is recommended\n"
52495     printf "that you clean your environment. The following variables are set:\n"
52496     printf "$FOUND_ALT_VARIABLES\n"
52497     printf "\n"
52498   fi
52499 
52500   if test "x$OUTPUT_DIR_IS_LOCAL" != "xyes"; then
52501     printf "WARNING: Your build output directory is not on a local disk.\n"
52502     printf "This will severely degrade build performance!\n"
52503     printf "It is recommended that you create an output directory on a local disk,\n"
52504     printf "and run the configure script again from that directory.\n"
52505     printf "\n"
52506   fi
52507 
52508   if test "x$IS_RECONFIGURE" = "xyes" && test "x$no_create" != "xyes"; then
52509     printf "WARNING: The result of this configuration has overridden an older\n"
52510     printf "configuration. You *should* run 'make clean' to make sure you get a\n"
52511     printf "proper build. Failure to do so might result in strange build problems.\n"
52512     printf "\n"
52513   fi
52514 
52515   if test "x$IS_RECONFIGURE" != "xyes" && test "x$no_create" = "xyes"; then
52516     printf "WARNING: The result of this configuration was not saved.\n"
52517     printf "You should run without '--no-create | -n' to create the configuration.\n"
52518     printf "\n"
52519   fi
52520 
52521 
52522 
52523 if test -e "$OUTPUT_ROOT/config.log"; then
52524   $GREP '^configure:.*: WARNING:' "$OUTPUT_ROOT/config.log" > /dev/null 2>&1
52525   if test $? -eq 0; then
52526     printf "The following warnings were produced. Repeated here for convenience:\n"
52527     # We must quote sed expression (using []) to stop m4 from eating the [].
52528     $GREP '^configure:.*: WARNING:' "$OUTPUT_ROOT/config.log" | $SED -e  's/^configure:[0-9]*: //'
52529     printf "\n"
52530   fi
52531 fi
52532 
52533 
--- EOF ---
